A

COLLECTION

OF THE

LOCAL AND PERSONAL ACTS,

DECLARED PUBLIC,

AND TO BE JUDICIALLY NOTICED,

PASSED IN THE

Twelfth and Thirteenth Year

OF THE REIGN OF HER MAJESTY

QUEEN VICTORIA:

Being the SECOND SESSION of the FIFTEENTH PARLIAMENT of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty.

1849.

LOCAL AND PERSONAL ACTS,

DECLARED PUBLIC,

AND TO BE JUDICIALLY NOTICED.

i. An Act to enable the Blackburn Waterworks Company to raise a farther Sum of Money; and to amend the Act relating thereto. 3

ii. An Act for enabling the Sunderland Water Company to raise a further Sum of Money, and for amending and enlarging the Provisions of the Act relating to such Company. 9

iii. An Act for supplying the District of Brierley Hill in the Parish of Kingswinford in the County of Stafford with Gas. 17

iv. An Act for more effectually repairing and maintaining certain Roads in the Counties of Roxburgh and Berwick. 21

v. An Act to authorize the Warrington Waterworks Company to raise a further Sum of Money. 33

vi. An Act for better establishing and maintaining the Market Place and Markets at Longton, heretofore called Lane End, in the Parish of Stoke-upon-Trent in the County of Stafford. 37

vii. An Act for improving the Drainage of Feltwell Second District in the County of Norfolk, and for amending the Acts relating to the same. 49

viii. An Act for lighting with Gas and supplying with Water the Town and Borough of Darlington and the Suburbs thereof in the County of Durham. 61

ix. An Act for enabling the Nottingham Gaslight and Coke Company to raise a further Sum of Money, and for amending some of the Provisions of the Act relating to such Company. 73

x. An Act for more effectually assessing and collecting the Poor Rate and all other Rates and Assessments in the Parish of Epsom in the County of Surrey, and for the better Management of the Business and Affairs of the said Parish; and for other Purposes relating thereto. 81

xi. An Act for making and maintaining Docks near to Wareham in the County of Dorset, with an Entrance thereto from Wareham Channel. 89

xii. An Act for better assessing the Poor Rates on small Tenements in certain Parishes and Places within the Union of Kidderminster. 113

xiii. An Act for the Dissolution of the Argyll Canal Company, and for the Abandonment of their Undertaking. 121

xiv. An Act to amend an Act for the better regulating and improving the Port and Harbour of New Ross in the Counties of Wexford and Kilkenny.

xv. An Act to enable the Edinburgh and Northern Railway Company to raise a further Sum of Money. 133

xvi. An Act for the Management and Disposal of the Freemen’s Pastures in the Parish of Great Grimsby in the Parts of Lindsey in the County of Lincoln; and for other Purposes. 141

xvii. An Act for better supplying the Town, Port, and Harbour of Whitehaven and other Places with Water. 165

xviii. An Act for altering the Mode of assessing the Drainage Rates authorized by the Act for draining and improving Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen in the Country of Marshland in the County of Norfolk, and to provide for the Repair of Roads within the Limits of the said Act. 177

xix. An Act for enabling the North-western Railway Company to make an Extension of the Lancaster Branch of their Railway, and a new Road to Settle Station, and to abandon the William Lands Branch; and for other Purposes. 197

xx. An Act for authorizing the Bradford Waterworks Company to raise a further Sum of Money. 253

xxi. An Act for incorporating the Bury Saint Edmund's Gas Company, and for better supplying the Town and Borough of Bury Saint Edmunds in the County of Suffolk with Gas. 257

xxii. An Act to incorporate the Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society; to enable the said Society to sue and be sued, and to take and hold Property; and for other Purposes relating to the said Society. 265

xxiii. An Act to amend and equalize the Rates and Duties leviable at the Port and Harbour of Perth, to authorize the borrowing of an additional Sum of Money, and for other Purposes in relation thereto. 277

xxiv. An Act to amend an Act of the Twelfth Year of the Reign of King George the Third, for embanking, draining, and preserving certain Fen Lands and Low Grounds in the Parish of Ramsey in the County of Huntingdon, and in the Parishes of Doddington, March, Benwick, Wimblington, and Chatteris, within the Isle of Ely and County of Cambridge, so far as relates to the Lower or Fifth District, and to annex other Lands thereto. 297

xxv. An Act for amending an Act passed in the Tenth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, for lighting with Gas and supplying with Water the Town of Hartlepool and the Neighbourhood thereof in the County of Durham. 309

xxvi. An Act for better supplying with Water the Borough of Macclesfield in the County of Chester, and for other Purposes connected with the said Borough. 325

xxvii. An Act for enabling the Leeds and Thirsk Railway Company to raise a further Sum of Money for the Completion of their Railways, to guarantee Interest on certain Shares, and for other Purposes. 349

xxviii. An Act for making a short Railway to connect the Line of the Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway with the Line of the London and South-western Railway; and for other Purposes. 357

xxix. An Act to vest the Stainforth and Keadby Canal in the Company of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River Dun. 365

xxx. An Act for enlarging, improving, and maintaining the Harbour of Kirkcaldy in the County of Fife, for regulating the Petty Customs of the Burgh of Kirkcaldy, and for other Purposes relating to the said Harbour and Burgh. 381

xxxi. An Act to amend "The Sunderland Dock Act, 1846," and for other Purposes. 413

xxxii. An Act for defining the Boundaries of the Parishes of Whittlesey Saint Mary and Whittlesey Saint Andrew in the Isle of Ely in the County of Cambridge for Ecclesiastical Purposes, for the Union of the said Parishes for other Purposes, and for better paving, lighting, watching, cleansing, and otherwise regulating and improving the Town of Whittlesey. 441

xxxiii. An Act for extending the Powers of the London and South-western Railway Company for purchasing Lands for and completing the Works of the Railways from Basingstoke to Salisbury and from Farnham to Alton; and for other Purposes. 461

xxxiv. An Act for enabling the Windsor, Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway Company to make an Extension of their Railway to the Town of New Windsor; and for other Purposes. 473

xxxv. An Act for the further Improvement of the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne. 485

xxxvi. An Act to extend the Provisions and enlarge the Powers of the Staffordshire Potteries Waterworks Act, 1847. 505

xxxvii. An Act for granting further Powers to the London Gaslight Company. 513

xxxviii. An Act to enable the Cockermouth and Workington Railway Company to make a Branch Railway to Bridgefoot; and for amending the Act relating to their Railway. 517

xxxix. An Act for vesting the Edinburgh and Glasgow Union Canal in the Edinburgh and Glasgow Railway Company. 525

xl. An Act to confer certain Powers on the Railway Passengers Assurance Company. 549

xli. An Act to enable the Chester and Holyhead Railway Company to raise a further Sum of Money; and for other Purposes. 561

xlii. An Act for making the Parish of Richmond in the County of Surrey a District Vicarage, by dividing the Vicarage of Kingston-upon-Thames and Sheen otherwise Richmond into Two separate Vicarages, and for providing a Stipend and Residence for the Vicar of Richmond aforesaid, and for extinguishing the Vicarial Tithes in the Parish of Richmond, and for other Purposes relating to such Vicarages. 569

xliii. An Act to authorize the Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Railway Company to alter the Alston Branch of their Railway, to make a Branch Railway therefrom, and for other Purposes. 589

xliv. An Act for consolidating the Trusts of the Truro Turnpike Roads and the Penryn and Redruth Turnpike Roads in the County of Cornwall, and for making a new Turnpike Road from Bosvigo Bridge to the Turnpike Road from Truro to Redruth, and for making the Road or Highway from Ferris Town to Bosvigo Bridge a Turnpike Road, and tor maintaining all such Roads; and for other Purposes. 597

xlv. An Act for amending an Act passed in the Thirty-fifth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Third, for dividing and leasing or letting certain Commons or Waste Grounds within the Borough and Township of Congleton in the County of Chester, and for applying the Profits of Part of the same in aid of the Poor’s Rate or other Taxes or public Expenses within the said Township. 609

xlvi. An Act to facilitate the Prosecution of Criminal Offences before Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace in the County of Renfrew, and to simplify the Proceedings therein and lessen the Costs thereof. 617

xlvii. An Act to alter and amend an Act passed in the Ninth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act for more effectually amending the Road leading from the Stones End in Blackman Street in the Borough of Southwark in the County of Surrey to Highgate in the County of Sussex, and several other Roads therein mentioned, and for other Purposes relating thereto. 625

xlviii. An Act for the Improvement of the Haven, Bridge, and Navigation of Great Yarmouth in the County of Norfolk. 633

xlix. An Act for rendering valid certain Letters Patent granted to Joshua Procter Westhead of Manchester, Manufacturer. 645

l. An Act to alter, amend, extend, and enlarge some of the Provisions of the several Acts relating to the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway, and for making Extensions of some of the Branches of the said Railway, and for making other Provisions in relation to the said Railway and to the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company. 653

li. An Act for improving the Approaches to the Charing Cross Bridge on the Surrey Side thereof, and for amending the Acts relating thereto; for authorizing the raising of a further Sum of Money; and for other Purposes. 681

lii. An Act for extending the Time and Powers for making the Ely and Huntingdon Railway, and for amending the Act relating to the East Anglian Railways. 693

liii. An Act for the Dissolution of the East Lothian Central Railway Company, and for the Abandonment of the Railway. 701

liv. An Act to consolidate the several Acts relating to the Stockton and Darlington Railway Company, to enable the Company to alter their Line of Railway in the Parishes of Egglescliffe and Stockton-on-Tees, and to increase their Capital, and to vest in them the Middlesbrough Dock. 709

lv. An Act to authorize the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company to make certain Branches to the River Dee, with Wharfs and other Conveniences connected therewith, to enter into Agreements for a joint Station at Shrewsbury, and to subscribe towards the Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway. 733

lvi. An Act regulating and maintaining Markets in the Town of Torquay in the County of Devon, and for constructing convenient Market Places therein. 769

lvii. An Act for repairing the Road leading from Chatteris Ferry to Wisbech, and from thence to Tid Gote in the Isle of Ely and to Downham Bridge in the County of Norfolk, and to authorize the Conversion of the Wisbech and March Low Road into Turnpike. 781

lviii. An Act for enabling the York, Newcastle, and Berwick Railway Company to make certain Branches in the Counties of Northumberland and Newcastle-upon-Tyne; and for other Purposes. 797

lix. An Act to alter and amend the Provisions of the several Acts relating to the Black Sluice Drainage, to extend the Time by "The Black Sluice Drainage Act, 1846," limited for the Completion of the Works, to authorize the levying and raising of further Rates and Monies, to alter existing Rates and Tolls, and for other Purposes. 821

lx. An Act for enabling the York and North Midland Railway Company to divert their Railways between Market Weighton and Beverley and Copmanthorpe and Tadcaster, all in the County of York; and for other Purposes. 849

lxi. An Act for making a Branch from the Taff Vale Railway to Dowlais, and for other Purposes. 865

lxii. An Act to amend the Acts relating to the Irish South-eastern Railway. 881

lxiii. An Act for maintaining, improving, and keeping in repair certain Roads in the County of Lanark to be called "The East and West Lanarkshire Turnpike Roads." 885

lxiv. An Act to extend the present Tinsley and Doncaster Turnpike Road from Tinsley to Sheffield, and for other Purposes. 897

lxv. An Act for more effectually managing and repairing the Road leading from Flimwell Vent in the County of Sussex to the Town and Port of Hastings in the said County. 913

lxvi. An Act for continuing the Term of an Act passed in the Third Year of the Reign of His Majesty King William the Fourth, intituled An Act for continuing certain Powers to the Trustees of the New North Road, leading from the South End of Highbury Place, Islington, to Haberdashers Walk in the Parish of Saint Leonard Shoreditch in the County of Middlesex, and for vesting the Management of the said Road in the Metropolis Roads Commissioners, for the Purpose of paying off the Debt due thereon. 929

lxvii. An Act to effect the Sale of the Wishaw and Coltness Railway to the Caledonian Railway Company. 941

lxviii. An Act to continue and amend the Powers of an Act for repairing and improving the Roads from Dublin, by Ashbourne, to Slane and Drogheda. 953

lxix. An Act for enabling the Dock Company at Kingston-upon-Hull to raise a further Sum of Money; and for amending some of the Provisions of the Acts relating to such Company. 981

lxx. An Act for better enabling the Rock Life Assurance Company to sue and be sued, and to alter certain Provisions of their Deed of Settlement, and to give further Powers to the Company. 989

lxxi. An Act to amend the Acts relating to the East Lancashire Railway Company, and to enable the same Company to make certain Branches at Preston. 1009

lxxii. An Act to authorize the Transfer of the Wilsontown, Morningside, and Coltness Railway to, and to vest the same in, the Edinburgh and Glasgow Railway Company. 1021

lxxiii. An Act to extend the Time for the Purchase of Lands required for the widening of the London and Blackwall Railway, and to amend the Acts relating to such Railway. 1037

lxxiv. An Act for vesting in the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company and the London and North-western Railway Company the Preston and Wyre Railway, Harbour, and Dock, and all the Works, Property, and Effects belonging thereto. 1045

lxxv. An Act to transfer the Sheffield Canal to the Company of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River Dun. 1073

lxxvi. An Act for more effectually repairing the Commercial Road, and other Roads connected therewith, in the Counties of Middlesex and Essex. 1081

lxxvii. An Act for confirming and carrying into effect an Arrangement made by the Court of Chancery concerning the Proprietors of the Rowling Iron Company, and for granting certain Powers to the said Company. 1097

lxxviii. An Act for regulating and improving the Markets and Fairs in the Borough of Louth in the County of Lincoln. 1121

lxxix. An Act to enable the Edinburgh and Northern Railway Company to construct a Low-water Pier and other Works at Granton; and for other Purposes. 1137

lxxx. An Act to incorporate the Governors of the Hospital for Consumption and Diseases of the Chest, and to authorize the Establishment of a Chapel in connexion with the said Hospital, and to enable the said Governors the better to carry on their charitable Designs. 1149

lxxxi. An Act to consolidate into One Act and to amend the Provisions of the several Railway and Dock Acts relating to the Manchester, Sheffield, and Lincolnshire Railway Company, and to amend their Canal Acts. 1165

lxxxii. An Act to amend and extend the Provisions of certain Acts for inclosing Lands in the Parishes of Binbrooke Saint Mary and Binbrooke Saint Gabriel in the County of Lincoln, and to vary the Awards made thereunder, and to unite the said Parishes. 1325

lxxxiii. An Act to incorporate the Great Indian Peninsula Railway Company, and for other Purposes connected therewith. 1333

lxxxiv. An Act to amend the Acts relating to the Great Northern Railway, and to make a Diversion of such Railway at Bentley-with-Arksey in the West Riding of Yorkshire, and to enlarge the Boston, Lincoln, and London Stations of such Railway. 1345

lxxxv. An Act to alter and amend some of the Powers and Provisions of the Shrewsbury and Birmingham Railway Acts, and to authorize the Formation of certain Branch Railways, a navigable Canal, and other Works connected with the same respectively; and for other Purposes. 1361

lxxxvi. An Act to authorize a Deviation of the Branch Line of the Stirling and Dunfermline Railway to Alloa Harbour, and the Diversion of certain Works; to extend the Time for the compulsory Purchase of certain Lands; and for other Purposes. 1385

lxxxvii. An Act to amend the several Acts relating to the Lancaster and Preston Junction Railway Company, and to transfer the Management of the Railway to the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway Company. 1397

lxxxviii. An Act to amend and enlarge the Powers and Provisions of the Acts relating to the Ardrossan Harbour and to the Glasgow, Kilmarnock, and Ardrossan Railway. 1421

lxxxix. An Act to amend and extend and partly repeal the Provisions of an Act of Parliament for erecting the Town of Airdrie into a Burgh; to provide for the Municipal and Police Government of said Burgh, and for the better paving, watching, lighting, and cleansing, and for regulating the Police, and managing the Statute Labour of the said Burgh; for consolidating the Provisions of other Acts; and for other Purposes relating thereto. 1429

xc. An Act to effectuate a Lease of the Glasgow, Barrhead, and Neilston Direct Railway to the Caledonian Railway Company. 1469

xci. An Act for the Incorporation of the General Land Drainage and Improvement Company, and for facilitating the Execution of Land Drainage and other Improvements. 1481

xcii. An Act to amend the Acts relating to the Eastern Union Railway Company. 1513

xciii. An Act for incorporating the East Indian Railway Company, and for other Purposes connected therewith. 1521

xciv. An Act to amend an Act passed in the Eleventh Year of the Reign of King George the First, for regulating Elections within the City of London, and for preserving the Peace, good Order, and Government of the said City. 1533

xcv. An Act to amend the "Norfolk Estuary Act, 1846," and to enable the Eau Brink Commissioners and the Corporation of King's Lynn to contribute towards the Undertaking, and for other Purposes connected therewith. 1541

PRIVATE ACTS,

PRINTED BY THE QUEEN’S PRINTER,

AND WHEREOF THE PRINTED COPIES MAY BE GIVEN IN EVIDENCE.

1. AN Act to enable the Trustees of a Society called or known by the Name of "The Society for the Prosecution of Felons and Receivers of Stolen Goods" to distribute the Monies and Funds of the said Society amongst certain charitable Institutions. 3

2. An Act for authorizing the Sale and Exchange of certain Freehold and Copyhold Lands and Hereditaments forming Part of the Estate of the late Charles Hayes Esquire, and for authorizing certain Leases to be granted thereof; and for authorizing the Sale and Exchange of certain Freehold and Copyhold Lands and Hereditaments forming Part of the Estate of the late John Rutherforth Abdy Esquire, and for enabling the Trustees of this Act to shift the Charges affecting the Inheritance of the last-mentioned Lands and Hereditaments; and for other Purposes. 9

3. An Act to authorize the granting of Building Leases of the Estates devised by the Will of Richard Morris Griffith Gentleman, deceased, called Caemaeslodig, situate in the Parish of Bangor in the County of Carnarvon. 33

4. An Act for confirming Two several Indentures of Lease, dated respectively the Twenty-sixth Day of June One thousand seven hundred and eighty-six, respectively granted by the Dean and Chapter of the Cathedral and Metropolitical Church of Christ Canterbury and Henry Penton to Thomas Clutton, of Hereditaments situate at Walworth in the Parish of Saint Mary Newington in the County of Surrey, and for settling the Boundaries of the Hereditaments thereby intended to be demised. 45

5. An Act for settling all Questions of disputed Ownership between the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the Borough of Louth and the Warden and Six Assistants of the Town of Louth and Free School of King Edward the Sixth in Louth, with reference to the Lands, Tenements, Fairs, Markets, Rents, Tolls, Powers, Rights, Privileges, and Property claimed by them respectively; and for vesting the Fairs and Markets within the said Borough in the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses thereof; and for other Purposes. 57

6. An Act to authorize the Sale of Part of the Estates devised by William Lee Antonie Esquire, deceased, and for applying the Proceeds in Payment of certain Incumbrances, and in Purchase of Hereditaments to be limited to the Uses declared of certain Estates substituted and settled by an Act of the Second and Third Years of the Reign of King William the Fourth, intituled An Act for vesting the Fee Simple of Part of the Freehold Estates devised by the Will of William Lee Antonie Esquire, deceased, in strict Settlement, in his Nephew John Lee Esquire, Doctor of Laws, (subject to a Term of Five hundred Years, as an Indemnification against a Sum of Ten thousand Pounds and Interest,) and for substituting Part of the Fee Simple Estates of the said John Lee in lieu thereof, and also for appointing new Trustees of the said settled Estates; and to amend the said Act. 133

7. An Act to enable Leases for Mining Purposes to be granted to Anthony Hill Esquire of Parts of the Estate situate in the Parish of Merthyr Tydvil in the County of Glamorgan, devised by the Will of the Right Honourable Other Archer Earl of Plymouth, deceased; and for other Purposes. 161

8. An Act to incorporate, by the Name of "The Trustees of the Hospital in Aberdeen for Orphan and Destitute Female Children," "The Trustees of the Aberdeen Destitute Female Orphan Asylum" acting under a Deed of Constitution granted by the Trustees of John Gordon of Murtle, Esquire, deceased, and to alter and extend the Powers and Provisions of the said Deed, and to vest the Residue of the Estate and Effects of John Carnegie Esquire, deceased, in the Trustees so incorporated. 193

9. An Act to enable the Trustees of the Settlement made in pursuance of the Will of George Granville late Duke of Sutherland to grant or demise for a long Term of Years to the Staffordshire Potteries Waterworks Company certain Springs and Reservoirs of Water in Lands in the Parishes of Caverswall and Stone in the County of Stafford comprised in the said Settlement, and certain Waterworks, Rights, and Privileges for supplying with Water the Towns of Longton and Lane End in the said County, and several Townships or Places near thereto; and to enable the said Trustees to take Shares in the said Company, and to advance Money to the said Company on Mortgage; and for other Purposes. 221

10. An Act to enable Marianne Sarah Robertson of Ladykirk to disentail certain detached Portions of the entailed Estate of Ladykirk, to be conveyed to David Robertson her Husband in lieu of the Lands of Simprim, to be added by him to the said entailed Estate; to grant Security upon the said Estate for a certain Sum of Money expended in Improvements; and for other Purposes relating thereto. 253

11. An Act for enabling the Trustees of the Settlement made under Orders of the High Court of Chancery, after the Marriage of Chaloner Ogle Esquire and Eliza Sophia Frances Ogle his Wife, to grant Building, Improving, and other Leases of certain Estates and Hereditaments situate at Patcham in the County of Sussex, comprised in the said Settlement. 273

12. An Act for vesting the Cole and Reynolds Estates, situate at Doddington, Leverington, Guyhurn, Broughton and Buckden, in the Isle of Ely and Counties of Cambridge and Huntingdon, in Trustees for Sale. 313

13. An Act to authorize the Trustees of the Will of the late Anthony Harman Esquire to grant Building, Improving, and other Leases of certain Freehold Estates devised by the said Will. 357

14. An Act for authorizing the Trustees of the late Thomas Gordon to sell his Estates of Cairness and others in the County of Aberdeen, and to apply the Price thereof in Payment of the Debts and Burdens affecting the same; and for laying out the Residue of the Price in the Purchase of other Lands, to be entailed in Terms of the Trust Deed of Settlement by the said Thomas Gordon; and for other Purposes. 381

15. An Act to confirm the Title of the Trustees of the Will of Philip Hurd Esquire, deceased, to a Copyhold Estate at Kentish Town in the County of Middlesex; and to extend the Power to grant Building Leases contained in the said Will; and to empower the Trustees of the said Will to raise Money for the Improvement of the said Estate; and for other Purposes. 409

16. An Act to enable the Trustees of the Will of the late Duke of Cleveland to raise certain Monies on the Trust Estates in the County of Durham by the said Will devised, and for the Management of the said Estates. 437

17. An Act for enabling the Trustees of the Will of William Trenchard Esquire, deceased, to pull down the Mansion or Dwelling House at Lytchet Matravers in the County of Dorset, and the Stables, Offices, and Outbuildings belonging thereto, Part of the Estates devised by the said Will, and to rebuild a smaller Mansion, Stabling, and Outbuildings suitable to the same; and to pull down Farm Buildings on the said Estates, and to rebuild the same; and to convert Shrubberies and Pleasure Grounds into Arable and Pasture Lands; and to raise Money for these Purposes by the Sale of Part of the Capital of the Personal Estate of the said William Trenchard deceased; and for other Purposes. 419

18. An Act for vesting the Real Estates devised by the Will of the late Sir Hugh Bateman of Hartington Hall in the County of Derby, Baronet, in Trustees, upon trust to sell a Part thereof, and to lay out the Monies arising from such Sale in Payment of the Mortgage Debts and other Charges and Incumbrances affecting the said Estates, and in Repairs and substantial Improvements upon the said Estates; and for other Purposes. 485

19. An Act for the better Administration of the Real and Personal Estates of the Right Honourable James Lord Glastonbury deceased. 517

20. An Act to remove Doubts relative to the Appointment of Mr. George Bishton as a Commissioner under the Pattingham and Patshull Inclosure Act. 549

21. An Act for removing Doubts relative to the Powers of granting Building Leases contained in the Will of the Right Honourable George Augustus Henry Earl of Burlington deceased; and for other Purposes. 569

22. An Act for supplying the Omission in the Will of the Right Honourable George Augustus Henry Earl of Burlington deceased of Powers of granting Farming and Building Leases of the Estates in the Counties of York and Derby devised by the same Will; of Powers of selling and exchanging the same Estates; and for other Purposes. 597

23. An Act to enable Sir Thomas Maryon Wilson Baronet to grant the Site of a Church for "The District of Saint Thomas, Woolwich," in the County of Kent; and for other Purposes. 625

24. An Act for authorizing the Sale of certain Parts of the Estates in the County of Middlesex devised by the Will of Sir George Osborn Baronet, deceased, for the Purpose of discharging the Incumbrances thereon. 641

25. An Act to authorize the granting of Building Leases of Parts of the Estates devised by the Will of the late Henry Blundell Esquire, situate in the Townships of Heaton and Rumworth in the County of Lancaster, and to lease Coal and other Mines, and to grant Farming Leases for Twenty-one Years of Lands within the said Townships; and for other Purposes. 713

26. An Act for the Sale of certain Hereditaments in the Parish of Barkham in the County of Berks affected by the Settlement made on the Marriage of Theophilus Clive Esquire. 757

PRIVATE ACTS,

NOT PRINTED.

27. An Act to dissolve the Marriage of Thomas William Waldy Esquire with Ellen his now Wife, and to enable him to marry again; and for other Purposes.

28. An Act to dissolve the Marriage of John James with his now Wife and to enable him to marry again; and for other Purposes.

29. An Act to dissolve the Marriage of Henry Hoghton Esquire with Louisa Josephine Hoghton his now Wife, and to enable him to marry again; and for other Purposes.

30. An Act to dissolve the Marriage of Francis Hudson Merchant with Louisa his now Wife, and to enable him to marry again; and for other Purposes therein mentioned.

31. An Act for naturalizing Richard Tufton and Henry Tufton his infant Son.

32. An Act to dissolve the Marriage of Edward Cripps Esquire with Augusta Sarah his now Wife, and to enable him to marry again; and for other Purposes.

33. An Act to dissolve the Marriage of the Reverend Bryan Faussett with Helena Caroline his Wife, and to enable him to marry again; and for other Purposes.

34. An Act to dissolve the Marriage of Edward Eustace Hill Esquire with the Honourable Georgiana Charlotte, commonly called Lady Georgiana Charlotte, his now Wife, and to enable him to marry again; and for other Purposes.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO REGNI

VICTORIAE,

Britanniarum Reginae,

DUODECIMO.

At the Parliament begun and holden at Westminster, the Eighteenth Day of November, Anno Domini 1847, in the Eleventh Year of the Reign of our Sovereign Lady VICTORIA, by the Grace of God Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland, Defender of the Faith:

And from thence continued, by several Prorogations, to the First Day of February 1849; being the SECOND SESSION of the FIFTEENTH PARLIAMENT of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty.

1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIAE REGINAE.

Cap. i.

An Act to enable the Blackburn Waterworks Company to raise a further Sum of Money; and to amend the Act relating thereto.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Eighth and Ninth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty Queen Victoria,

[8 & 9 Vict. c. 138.]

---

intituled An Act for better supplying with Water the Town and Township of Blackburn in the County Palatine of Lancaster, whereby the Company incorporated by the said Act were empowered to raise the Sum of Forty thousand Pounds by Shares, and Thirteen thousand Pounds by Mortgage : And whereas the said Company have accordingly raised the Sum of Thirty-eight thousand five hundred Pounds by Shares, and the whole Sum of Thirteen thousand Pounds by Mortgage, and the whole of such Amount has been expended upon the Purposes authorized by the said Act: And whereas a further Sum of Money is required to enable the said Company completely to carry into effect the Purposes thereof, and it is expedient that Power should be granted to the said Company to raise such further Sum of Money:

And whereas it is also expedient that some of the Powers and Provisions of the said recited Act should be amended and enlarged; but

4 12° VICTORIA, Cap. i.

the Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by Powers of the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions, Matters, and reciicd Act Things contained in the said recited Act, and now remaining in force, -if- ex°- (except such of them as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise cept as hereby provided for, or are inconsistent with the Provisions of this Act,) shall altered. extend to this Act, and shall be in force in respect to the Objects and Purposes of this Act, as fully and effectually, to all Intents and Purposes, as if such Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act with express Reference to the Objects and Purposes thereof; and the said recited Act and this Act shall as to all Matters and Things whatsoever (except as aforesaid) be read and construed together as One Act.

Power to

II. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, raise addi- from Time to Time, by an Order of any Meeting thereof^ to raise, by by Creation oT ^)e Creation of new Shares, in addition to any Sums which they have mw Shares, raised and are entitled to raise under and by virtue of the said recited Act, any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the further Sum of Twenty thousand Pounds.

New Shares

III. And be it enacted, That the Capital so to be raised by the

to be consi- Creation of new Shares shall be considered as Part of the general dered same Capital of the Company, and such new Capital and new Shares shall Share^'."a be subject to the same Provisions in all respects, whether with reference to the Payment of Calls, or the Forfeiture of Shares on Nonpayment of Calls, or otherwise, as if such Capital had been Part of the original Capital, except as to the Times of making Calls for such additional Capital, and the Amount of such Calls, which respectively it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time to fix as they shall think fit, and except as herein otherwise provided.

And be it enacted, That if at the Time of any Augmentation ataPremium, of Capital taking place by the Creation of new Shares the then exist-"o b^oiTered ,<'^iares °* the Capital of the Company shall be at a Premium, or to original6 greater actual Value than the nominal Value thereof, then the Shareholders. VII. And be it enacted, That if at the Time of any such Aug- If existing mentation of Capital taking place the existing Shares of the Capital St)ares "v1 of the Company shall not be at a Premium, then such new Shares ^ne""’ may be of such Amount, and may bear such annual Sums for Interest mavbe issued or Dividends on the same, for such Period, and may be issued in as Company such Manner, and may be sold and disposed of at such Price, pay- l,1*nfc fi,< able at such Times and by such Instalments, as the Company shall think fit.

VIII. And be it enacted, That every Person who shall become Rights of entitled to any new Share to be created under this Act shall in new Share-respect of the same Share be a Shareholder in the Undertaking, and hol<,ers.U11)e shall, unless the Rate of Interest or Dividend payable in respect of ab°e to^h'e such Share shall be stated thereon, be entitled to a Share of the Value of Dividends of the Company in the Proportion which the Amount new Shares, paid up on such new Shares shall bear to the aggregate Amount of the paid-up Capital of the Company for the Time being in respect whereof such Dividends shall be payable, and such new Shares shall also confer on the respective Holders or Proprietors thereof Rights of voting and Qualifications in proportion to the aggregate nominal Value of such Shares, and not in proportion to the Number thereof; and for such Purposes every entire Sum of Ten Pounds of such nominal Value shall be considered as equivalent to One Share of Ten Pounds created under the said recited Act; and no Shareholder shall vote in respect of any Number of such new Shares which shall constitute a less Interest in the Capital of the Company than Ten Pounds.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. i.

rized to be raised shall have been taken, and One Half of such Capital shall have been paid up, it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond such Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be authorized to be borrowed by Order of a General Meeting of the Company, not exceeding in the whole, in addition to the Sum authorized to be borrowed by the said recited Act, the Sum of Six thousand six hundred and sixty-six Pounds, and to secure the Repayment of the Sum so to be borrowed, with Interest, by Mortgage of the Undertaking, as by "The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," provided, and subject to the several Provisions therein contained with respect to the borrowing of Money on Mortgage.

X. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages or Bonds granted under the Authority of the said recited Act, and which shall be in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall during the Continuance thereof have Priority over any Mortgages or Bonds to be created by virtue of this Act.

XI. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the said Company from the Provisions of " The Public Health Act, 1848," or of any general Act relating thereto or to the Subject Matter thereof, which may pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament.

XII. And be it enacted, That every Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, and every Transfer of any Share, Stock, Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, to be granted or made by virtue of the said recited Act or this Act, shall be by Deed duly stamped, wherein the Consideration for the same shall be truly stated, anything herein or in the said recited Act contained to the contrary notwithstanding.

XIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company and they are hereby empowered from Time to Time to contract and agree with any Person or Persons for the Purchase of any Messuages, Buildings, Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments within the Township of Blackburn, for the Purpose of using the same as an Office or Offices for the Transaction of the Affairs and for the general Purposes of the Company, and to defray the Expense thereof out of any Monies in their Hands, or to be received by them under the Authority of the said recited Act or this Act.

XIV. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of and attending the passing of this Act or incidental thereto shall be paid by the said Company out of the first Monies that shall come to their Hands, and in preference to any other Payment whatsoever.

XV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments and other Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to refer to and describe it by the Title of " The Blackburn Waterworks Act, 1849."

12° VICTORIA, Cap a.

[Public Act.]

XVI. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIAE REGINA.

Cap. ii.

An Act for enabling the Sunderland Water Company to raise a further Sum of Money, and for amending and enlarging the Provisions of the Act relating to such Company.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for better supplying with Water the Town and Borough of Sunderland and the Neighbourhood thereof in the County of Durham, whereby certain Persons were incorporated by the Name of the " Sunderland Water Company," and were empowered to supply with Water the District included within the Limits of the said Act: And whereas by the said Act the said Company were authorized to raise the Sum of Thirty-five thousand Pounds by Subscription, and the Sum of Eleven thousand Pounds by Mortgage of the Undertaking : And whereas the said Company have proceeded to carry the Powers of the said Act into execution, and [Eocn/.] C have

9 & 10 Vict, c, 36.

10

Powers of recited Act extended to this Act, except as

hereby

altered.

So much of recited Act as relates to Qualification of a Director repealed.

Qualification of Directors.

Power to raise Money by Creation of new Shares.

Additional Capital to be divided into 51. Shares.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. il

have raised and expended nearly the whole of the Money authorized to be raised as aforesaid: And whereas the said Capital which the Company are so authorized to raise under the Powers of the said Act is insufficient for effectually supplying with Water the whole of the District within the Limits of the said Act, and for completing the Waterworks : And whereas it is expedient that the said Company should be enabled to raise an additional Sum of Money, and that some of the Provisions of the said recited Act should be altered, amended, and enlarged; but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in the said recited Act, and in the Acts incorporated therewith, and now remaining in force, (except such of them as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, or are inconsistent with the Provisions of this Act,) shall extend to this Act, and shall be in force in respect of the Objects and Purposes of this Act, as fully and effectually to all Intents and Purposes as if such Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act with express Reference to the Objects and Purposes thereof; and the said recited Act and this Act shall, as to all Matters and Things whatsoever, except as aforesaid, be read and construed together as One Act.

II. And be it enacted, That so much of the recited Act as enacts that the Qualification of a Director shall be the Possession in his own Right of Five Shares in the Undertaking shall be and the same is hereby repealed.

III. And be it enacted, That the Qualification of a Director of the said Company shall be the Possession in his own Right of Ten Shares in the Undertaking.

IV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time, by an Order of any Meeting thereof, to raise by the Creation of new Shares, in addition to any Sums which they have raised and are entitled to raise under and by virtue of the said recited Act, any Sum and Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the further Sum of Nineteen thousand five hundred Pounds.

V. And be it enacted, That the said additional Sum of Nineteen thousand five hundred Pounds shall be divided into Three thousand nine hundred Shares of Five Pounds each.

11

12° VICTORIA, Cap. ii.

VI. And be it enacted, That Three thousand five hundred of such Certain^ b new Shares shall be offered and disposed of in manner herein-after registerej as mentioned, and shall be distinguished and registered as " Preference Preference Shares," and shall be marked as such, together with the Rate of the Shares-preferential Dividend payable thereon, upon the Certificates issued by the Company to the respective Holders thereof.

VII. And be it enacted, That the Capital so to be raised by the New Shares

Creation of new Shares shall be considered as Part of the general to be consi-, , , , , n uered same

Capital of the Company, and such new Capital and new Shares shall as original

be subject to the same Provisions in all respects, whether with Shares, reference to the Payment of Calls, or the Forfeiture of Shares on the Nonpayment of Calls, or otherwise, as if such Capital had been Part of the original Capital, except as to the Times of making Calls for such additional Capital, and the Amount of such Calls, which respectively it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time to fix as they shall think fit, and except as herein otherwise provided.

VIII. And be it enacted, That the said Preference Shares shall be Preference offered to the then Shareholders in the Company in such Proportions ^Jj’arej be as the Directors may from Time to Time determine; and such Offers original10 shall be made by Letter, under the Hand of the Secretary of the Share-Company, given to or sent by Post, addressed to each Shareholder, llollIers' according to his Address as entered in the Shareholders Address

Book, or left at his usual or last known Place of Abode in England; and every such Offer made by Letter sent by Post shall be considered as made on the Day on which such Letter in the due Course of Delivery ought to reach the Place to which it shall be addressed.

IX. And be it enacted, That such Preference Shares so to be Shares to created shall vest in and belong to the Shareholders who shall accept \est in Par-the same, and pay the Amount thereof to the Company at the Time other-" or Times and by the Instalments which shall be fixed by the Com- wise to be pany; and if any Shareholder shall fail for One Month after such byP°ubhcof Offer of new Shares to accept the same, or pay the Instalments called Auction, for in respect thereof within One Month after the same shall respectively become due, it shall be lawful for the Company to dispose of such Shares by public Auction to any Party willing to become the Purchaser thereof for such Sum as the Company can obtain for the same.

X. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall be lawful Shareholders for the Directors in case they shall think proper so to do, but not ™ft^ejet*>er" otherwise, to permit any Shareholder who from Absence abroad, or take new any other Cause satisfactory to the Directors, may have omitted or Shares aft?r neglected (within the Time limited by this Act) to signify his fiedUn cer!"

12

After Preference Shares disposed of, Directors to sell new Shares by public Auction.

Rights of new Shareholders to be the same as original Shareholders.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. ii.

Acceptance of the new Share or Shares which may have been offered to him, or to which he may be entitled by virtue of this Act, to accept such Share or Shares, and to pay for each such Share the Sum at which the same shall have been allotted to him, notwithstanding the Time limited for such Acceptance or for the Payment of such Sum may have expired.

XI. And be it enacted, That after the said Preference Shares shall have been disposed of, and the Amount thereof been called for, the Directors may from Time to Time, and when and as often as Occasion shall require, sell and dispose of by public Auction such and so many of the remaining new Shares, and at such Prices, and payable at such Times and by such Instalments, as the Directors shall think fit.

XII. And be it enacted, That every Person who shall become entitled to any new Share to be created under this Act shall in respect of the same Share be a Shareholder in the Undertaking, and shall, unless the same shall be a Preference Share, be entitled to the same Amount of Dividends as the Shares created by the said recited Act, and such new Shares shall also confer on the respective Holders or Proprietors thereof Rights of voting and Qualifications as the original Shares.

XIII. And be it enacted, That no Shareholder of the Company shall be entitled to transfer any Share after any Call shall have been made in respect thereof until he shall have paid such Call, nor until he shall have paid all Calls for the Time being due on every Share held by him.

XIV. And be it enacted, That after the whole Sum authorized by this and the said recited Act to be raised by Shares shall have been subscribed for, and One Half of the Sum by this and the said recited Act authorized to be raised by Shares shall have been paid up, it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond such Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be authorized to be borrowed by Order of an Ordinary or Extraordinary Meeting of the Company, not exceeding in the whole, in addition to the Sum authorized to be borrowed by the said recited Act, and in addition to the Sum authorized to be raised by Shares, the Sum of Six thousand five hundred Pounds, and to secure the Repayment of the Money so borrowed, with Interest, by Mortgage of the Undertaking or by Bond as by the said recited Act is provided, and subject to the several Provisions therein contained, or such of them as are applicable to the Monies thereby authorized to be raised on Mortgage or Bond, and the Securities thereby authorized to be granted in respect of the same.

13

12° VICTORIA, Cap. ii.

XV. And be it enacted, That if after having borrowed any Part As to of the Money by this Act authorized to be borrowed on Mortgage rel)0rr0WinS-or Bond the Company shall pay off the same, it shall be lawful for

them again to borrow the Amount so paid off, and so from Time to Time, but such Power of reborrowing shall not be exercised without the Authority of an Ordinary or Extraordinary Meeting of the Company, unless the Money be so reborrowed in order to pay off any existing Mortgage or Bond.

XVI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages or Mortgages Bonds granted by the Company before the passing of this Act, and ^"^"have^ which shall be in force at the Time of passing this Act, shall during prjorjty. the Continuance thereof have Priority over any Mortgages or Bonds

to be created by virtue of this Act.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Company shall provide a Supply of sufficient Supply of Water for any public Pumps, Baths, or Wash- ^p^for* ^ houses that may have been or may be established within the Limits Baths and of the recited Act for the free Use of the Inhabitants, or paid for

out of any Poor Rates or Borough Rates levied within the said Limits; and such Supply shall be provided at such Rates, in such Quantities, and upon such Terms and Conditions as may be agreed upon by the Council of the Borough of Sunderland and the Company, or in case of Disagreement as shall be settled by Two Justices until an Inspector shall have been appointed, and after the Appointment of such Inspector by the Inspector so appointed.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts Short Title, ot Parliament, or in legal Instruments or Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Sunderland Waterworks Amendment Act, 1849."

XIX. And be it enacted, That the Monies to be raised by Application virtue of this Act shall be applied, in the first place, and in pre- of Monies, ference to any other Payment, in paying and discharging all Costs

and Expenses incurred in obtaining this Act, and all Expenses incident thereto; and, secondly, in carrying the Purposes of the said recited Act and of this Act into execution in such Manner as the Directors of the Company shall think fit.

XX. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be Nothing to

deemed or construed to exempt the said Company from the Pro- exempt visions of " The Public Health Act, 1848," or of any general Act fVomPPro-relating thereto, or to the Subject Matter thereof, which may pass visions of during the present or any future Session of Parliament. H^12,Vict-

14 12° VICTORIA, Cap. ii.

[Public Act.]

XXI. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be deemed a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIAE REGIK/E.

Cap. iii.

An Act for supplying the District of Brierley Hill in the Parish of Kingswinf&rd in the County of Stafford with Gas.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS the District of Brierley Hill in the Parish of Kingsivinford in the County of Stafford is now ill supplied with Gas, and it would be a great Advantage to the Inhabitants of the said District and to the Public if they were better supplied therewith : And whereas the Parties herein-after mentioned are willing to supply the said District with Gas; but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this 8 & y Vict. present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That t

the several Acts of Parliament following, that is to say, " The Com- c 1S;nc01..‘ panies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," and " The Gasworks Clauses porated with Act, 1847," shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act. this Act.

II. And be it enacted, That the Expression " Quarter Sessions " in Quarter the said incorporated Acts shall be construed to mean the Quarter Sesslons-Sessions of the Peace for the County of Stafford holden at Stafford.

[Short Title.]

III. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Brierley Hill Gas Act, 1849."

18

8 & 9 Vict. c. 18. incorporated with this Act.

Nothing to authorize Company to take Land without^on-sent, &c.

Limits of Act.

Company incorporated.

Quantity of Land to be held by Company limited.

Capital.

Shares.

12° VICTORIA, Cap.Yii.

IV. And be it enacted, That the " Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act; and the Provisions of the said Lands Clauses Consolidation Act shall be applicable to the Undertaking hereby authorized, except as hereinafter mentioned.

V. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing in the said Lands Clauses Consolidation Act contained shall authorize the Company hereby constituted to take or use any Land, unless with the Consent of and by Agreement with the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers thereof.

VI. And be it enacted, That the Limits of this Act shall extend to and include the District of Brierley Hill in the County of Stafford, and the Liberties and Precincts thereof and Places adjacent thereto, comprising the several Places herein-after named; that is to say, Brierley Hill, Badger’s Bank, Brettell Lane, Moor Lane, Leys, Brockrnoor, Bromley, Gosty Bank, Common Side, Pensnett, Round Oak, Crawley Plain, Level, Mill Lane, Delph, Rocks Hill, dyer’s Plain, Mount Pleasant, and Quarry Bank, all in the Parish of Kingswinford in the County of Stafford, and also that Part of Hartshill which lies in the Parish and County aforesaid.

VII. And be it enacted, That George Collison Tuting, Reuben Plant, Francis Tandy, John Fraser Watkins, William Henzey Bond, Thomas Southall, William Cooke, Benjamin Stinson, John Price, Abraham Whitehouse, Joseph Kell, Thomas Grove, John Parkes, John Compson Wright, Joseph Moore, Henry Weaver, Samuel Hudson, George Ford, William Meller, John Harper, Benjamin Green, and all other Persons and Corporations who have already subscribed or shall hereafter subscribe to the Undertaking, and their Executors, Administrators, Successors, and Assigns, shall be united into a Company for the Purpose of making and supplying Gas within the Limits of this Act, and for making Gasworks for that Purpose, with proper Works and Conveniences connected therewith, according to the Provisions in this and the said incorporated Acts contained; and for the Purposes aforesaid such Company shall be incorporated by the Name of the " Brierley Hill District Gaslight Company," and by that Name shall be a Body Corporate, with perpetual Succession, and shall have Power to purchase and hold Lands for the Purposes of the said Undertaking.

VIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the Company to purchase or hold for the Purposes of the Undertaking more than Five Acres of Land.

IX. And be it enacted, That the Capital of the said Company shall be Six thousand Pounds.

X. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shares into which the said Capital shall be divided shall be Twelve hundred, and the Amount of each Share shall be Five Pounds.

19

12° VICTORIA, Cap.\ii.

XI. And be it enacted, That One Pound per Share shall be the greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make upon the Shareholders, and that Three Fifths of the Amount of a Share shall be the utmost aggregate Amount of the Calls to be made in any One Year upon any Share, and that Two Months at the least shall intervene between successive Calls.

XII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond any Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Two thousand Pounds; but no Part of such Sum shall be raised until the whole of the said Capital or Sum of Six thousand Pounds shall have been subscribed for, and One Half thereof shall actually have been paid up.

XIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mortgagees of the Company to enforce the Payment of the Arrears of the Principal and Interest due on any such Mortgages by the Appointment of a Receiver; and in order to authorize the Appointment of such Receiver, in the event of the Principal Monies not being duly paid, the Amount owing to the Mortgagees by whom Application for such Receiver shall be made shall not be less than Five hundred Pounds in the whole.

XIV. And be it enacted, That the first Ordinary Meeting of the Company shall be held within Two Months next after the passing of this Act, and the subsequent Ordinary Meetings of the Company shall be held on the Second Wednesday in the Months of February and August; and the first of such Ordinary Meetings shall be held at the Star Inn at Brierley Hill aforesaid; and such Meetings, whether ordinary or extraordinary, shall be held at Brierley Hill.

XV. And be it enacted, That the Quorum for any General Meeting of the Company shall be Seven Shareholders holding in the aggregate not less than Five hundred Pounds in the Capital of the Company.

XVI. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shareholders on whose Requisition an Extraordinary Meeting may be required to be convened shall be Twenty Shareholders holding in the aggregate not less than One thousand Pounds in the Capital of the Company.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Scale according to which Shareholders may vote in respect of their Shares shall be as follows; (that is to say,)

For One Share or more, but not exceeding Twenty, One Vote:

For more than Twenty Shares, but not exceeding Forty, Two Votes.

For more than Forty Shares, Three Votes.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That (subject to the Provisions herein contained for increasing or reducing the Number of Directors) the Number of Directors shall be Nine, and the Qualification of a Director shall be the Possession in his own Right of Twenty Shares in the U ndertaking.

Calls.

Power to borrow Money on Mortgage.

Arrears may be enforced by Appointment of Receiver.

First and other Meetings.

Quorum of

General

Meetings.

Number of Shareholders requisite to convene Extraordinary

Meeting.

Scale of voting.

Number and Qualification of Directors.

20

Power to vary the Number of the Directors.

First

Directors.

Committees of Directors.

The Amount of reserved Fund.

Power to Undertakers to construct Gasworks, &c.

Maximum Price or Charge.

Power to Undertakers to lay Pipes for lighting Buildings.

[Public Act.]

12° VICTORIAE, Cap. iii.

XIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time to increase or reduce the Number of Directors of the Company, but the whole Number of Directors, after such an Increase or Reduction as aforesaid, shall not be greater than Nine nor less than Five.

XX. And be it enacted, That Reuben Plant, George Collison Tuting, Thomas Southall, John Price, Joseph Moore, Benjamin Green, John Harper, John Fraser Watkins, and Benjamin Stinson, shall be the first Directors of the Company.

XXI. And be it enacted, That the Number of Directors of which Committees appointed by the Directors shall consist shall not be less than Three nor more than Five, and the Quorum of such Committees shall be Three.

XXII. And be it enacted, That the Amount of the reserved or contingent Fund shall be One thousand Pounds.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this and the said incorporated Acts contained, it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time to construct and maintain such Gasworks and Apparatus, and such Buildings, with Approaches thereto, upon the Lands belonging to the Company, or hereby authorized to be purchased by them, and to do all such other Acts as they shall think necessary for supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Gas, and to supply such Gas upon such Terms as shall be agreed upon between the Company and the Persons supplied therewith, and to sell and dispose of the Coke and other Residuum arising from the Materials used in the Manufacture of Gas, in such Manner as the Company may think proper.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That the Price or Charge for the supplying of Gas to any Persons or Person for or in respect of any public or private Lights or Light shall in no Case exceed the Price or Charge of Eight Shillings and Sixpence for every Thousand Cubic Feet of Gas.

XXV. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this and the said incorporated Acts contained, it shall be lawful for the Company to lay any Pipe, Branch, or other Apparatus from any Main or Branch Pipes into, through, or against any Building, for the Purpose of lighting the same, and to provide and set up any Apparatus necessary for securing to any Buildings a proper and complete Supply of Gas, and for measuring and ascertaining the Extent of such Supply.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIA REGIKE.

Cap. iv.

An Act for more effectually repairing and maintaining certain Roads in the Counties of Roxburgh and Berwick.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Forty-sixth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Third, intituled An Act for the more effectually repairing and amending certain Roads in the Counties of Roxburgh and Berwick, and for better regulating the Statute Labour and making and repairing the High Roads and Bridges in the said County of Roxburgh : And whereas another Act was passed in the Ninth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act for more effectually making, amending, widening, repairing, and maintaining certain Roads in the Counties of Roxburgh and Berwick, by which the said first-recited Act was, in so far as regards the Turnpike Roads therein mentioned, repealed, and certain Persons were appointed Trustees for making, amending, and repairing the Roads mentioned in the said last-recited Act, and various Powers and Authorities were granted to them for that Purpose: And whereas a Third Act was passed in the Third Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for further and more effectually repairing and maintaining several Turnpike Roads in the County of Roxburgh, whereby \Local.~\ F certain

46 G. 3.C. 48.

90.4. c. 104.

3 &• 4 Vict. c. 66.

22

Recited Acts repealed, and this Act to take effect.

[Short Title.]

12° VICTORIA, ascertain other Persons were appointed Trustees for repairing, improving, and maintaining the other Roads therein mentioned, and various Powers and Authorities were granted to them for that Purpose : And whereas the Trustees by the said second-recited Act appointed have proceeded to put the same into execution, and various Sums of Money to the Amount in the whole of Twenty-one thousand two hundred and ninety-five Pounds Eleven Shillings and Sixpence have been borrowed, subscribed, or are owing upon the Credit of the Tolls and Duties thereby granted; but as the said Act, so far as respects the Roads therein contained, is about to expire, the said Sums cannot be repaid, or the said Roads repaired and maintained, unless Provision be made for these Purposes : And whereas the Trustees appointed by and under the Powers of the said third-recited Act have also proceeded to put the same into execution, and have borrowed and expended considerable Sums of Money in repairing, improving, and maintaining certain of the Roads therein described, and carrying into effect the other Purposes mentioned in the said third-recited Act: And whereas it would be advantageous to the Public, and beneficial and convenient to the Inhabitants of the Districts through which the Roads comprehended under the said recited Acts pass, that the Roads comprehended under the said second-recited Act, and a certain Line of Road comprehended under the said third-recited Act, should be placed under the same Trust Management in Time to come, and that certain of the Roads maintained by Conversion Money in lieu of Statute Labour under the Acts first and third before recited, or one or other of them, should be rendered Turnpike Roads, and be managed and maintained as such along with the said other Roads; but as these Purposes cannot be effected without the Aid and Authority of Parliament, May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the said second-recited Act shall be and the same is hereby repealed, excepting in so far as the said Act in part repeals the said first-recited Act, and that the said first and second recited Acts, in so far as regards the Roads heretofore maintained under the Authority of the same, and now comprehended under this Act, shall also be and the same are hereby repealed; and this Act shall, from and after the passing of the same, commence and be put in execution for and during the Term and for the Purposes herein-after mentioned: Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall extend or be construed to extend to, or in any Manner to affect, prejudice, or interfere with, any Prosecution or Cause pending in any Court of Law or before any other Tribunal, against or at the Instance of the Trustees under the said recited Acts, or their respective Clerks, but the same shall be prosecuted, carried on, adjudged, and concluded in such and the same Manner as if this Act had not been passed.

II. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in any other Act of Parliament, or in any legal Instrument or Proceeding, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " Roxburghshire and Berwickshire Roads Act, 1849."

12° VICTORIA, Cap. iv.

III. And be it enacted, That the Act of the First and Second Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King William the Fourth, intituled An Act for amending and making more effectual the Laws concerning Turnpike Roads in Scotland, and all and sundry the Powers, Provisions, Exemptions, Penalties, Forfeitures, Payments, Remedies, Matters, and Things therein contained, (save and except such Parts thereof as are hereby expressly varied, altered, or repealed,) shall be applied to this Act, and shall be as good, valid, and effectual for carrying this Act into execution as if the same had been repeated and re-enacted in this Act.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. iv.

Thomas Macmillan Scott younger of Wauchope, Thomas Scott of Peel, John Scott of Riccalton, John Scott of Teviot Bank, Captain George Scott of Wooden, Royal Navy, James Scott of Whitehaugh, John Scott of Samieston, John Scott younger of Samieston, John Scott of Sinton, John Scott of Wool, Robert Selby of Samieston, Ephraim Selby younger of Samieston, Thomas Simson of Blainslie, Mar/c Sprot of Riddell, John Stavert of Hosecoat, James Stedman younger of Broornhill, John Govan Stewart of Hermiston, the Honourable John Clietwynd Talbot of Bonjedward, Thomas Tod of Drygrange, Robert Henry Tulloch of Ellieston, John Waldie of Henderside, William Watsoti of Burn Grove, Alexander White of Fens, James Wilson of Otterburn, the Provost of the Burgh of Jedburgh for the Time being, the Bailie of the Lordship of Melrose for the Time being, the eldest Bailie of Lauder for the Time being, the eldest Bailie of Hawick for the Time being, the Sheriff Depute of the County of Roxburgh for the Time being, and the Chamberlains or Factors of the Duke of Buccleuch and Queensberry, the Duke of Roxburghe, the Marquis of Tiveeddale, the Marquis of Lothian, the Earl of Buchan, the Earl of Lauderdale, the Earl of Minto, Lord Somerville, Lord Polwarth, Lord Douglas, and Lord Campbell respectively, upon their Estates in the County of Roxburgh, shall be and are hereby nominated and appointed Trustees for carrying into execution the Purposes of this Act.

V. And be it enacted, That when and so often as it shall appear to be necessary and expedient to the Trustees hereby appointed it shall be lawful for them, or any Five or more of them, from Time to Time to elect and appoint One or more other fit Person or Persons to be a Trustee or Trustees for the Purposes of this Act; provided that public Notice of the Time and Place of Meeting of the said Trustees for every such Election be given by Two several Advertisements in any One Newspaper to be published in the County of Roxburgh, and if there shall be no such Newspaper published in the said County then in any Newspaper published in Edinburgh, the first of such Advertisements being at least Fourteen Days before the Day of Meeting for such Election; and every Person who shall be elected and appointed a Trustee pursuant to the Directions of this Act shall and may act in the Execution of this Act to all Intents and Purposes as if he had been named and appointed a Trustee in and by this Act.

VI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That no Person, other than and except the Provost of Jedburgh, the Bailie of the Lordship of Melrose, the eldest Bailie of Lauder, the eldest Bailie of Hawick, and the Sheriff Depute of the said County of Roxburgh, all for the Time being, shall be capable of acting as a Trustee in the Execution of this Act, unless he shall be in the actual Possession and Enjoyment, in his own Right or in right of his Wife, as Fiar or Liferenter, of the Rents and Profits of Lands lying in the said County of Roxburgh, or in those Parishes of the County of Berwick through which the Direction of any of the said Roads shall or may pass, valued in the Cess Books of the said Counties respectively at Two hundred Pounds Scots, or the Heir Apparent of a Person so qualified as aforesaid,

or

25

12" VICTORIA, iv.

or a Guardian of a Minor enjoying and possessing Lands of the Valuation aforesaid: Provided always, that any Chamberlain or Factor hereby appointed shall be capable of acting if possessed of Ileal or Personal Estate of the Value of Five hundred Pounds Sterling; but no Chamberlain or Factor, unless when otherwise duly qualified, shall be entitled to vote at any Meeting where his Constituent is present as a Trustee: Provided also, that no Person claiming as a Trustee under this Act shall have more than One Vote on any Pretence whatever, excepting he be the Preses of any Meeting, who shall, in case of an Equality of Votes, in addition to his deliberative Vote, have a casting Vote.

VII. And be it enacted, That the said Trustees shall hold their General First stated or General Meeting by virtue of this Act at Jedburgh 1 eetinSs-upon the Third Tuesday after the passing of this Act, or as soon

after as conveniently may be, and their next stated or General Meeting on the Second Wednesday of September then next ensuing, and thereafter a stated or General Meeting shall be held on the Second Wednesday of September annually during the Continuance of this Act, at such Place or Places as the said Trustees assembled at their First stated or General Meeting at Jedburgh shall fix and determine.

VIII. And be it enacted, That the Quorum of Trustees at general Quorum of or adjourned Meetings shall be Five; but if any Number less than Trustees. Five shall be present at any of the said Meetings, such Trustees or Trustee shall have Power to adjourn the Meeting.

IX. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be put in execution, Roads to be for and during the Term herein-after mentioned, for the Purposes of maintamed-surveying, amending, improving, widening, altering, straightening, repairing, and keeping in repair the Hoads made and maintained by the Trustees under the said second-recited Act; videlicet, the Road leading from the Red Swyre upon the Mid Border between England and Scotland, through the Burgh of Jedburgh, to the Confines of the County of Mid Lothian at or near the Farm of Caitha, by Ancrum Bridge, Saint Boswell’s Green, and Melrose; the Road leading from or near from the West of the present Toll Bar situated at the East End of Hawick to Denholm, and from thence till it join the Road above described at or near Ancrum Bridge aforesaid; the Road leading from the Road first above described at the Carter, by Southdean Kirk and Bonchester Bridge, till it join the Road last above described at the Guide Post at or near Haugh Heads; the Road leading from the Road last above described at or near Chester’s Smithy, by Abbotrule and Swinnie, till it join the Road first above described at or near Linthaugh; the Road leading from the High Road from Kelso to the East Border at or near Maxwellheugh, by Heiton and Crailing, to the Bridge over the Jed at Jedfoot, and from thence till it join the Road first above described at the Village of Bonjedward by Two Branches, the one towards Jedburgh, and the other towards Hawick; the Road leading from the Road first above described at or near the Village of Eildon to the Bridge over the Tweed at Drygrange, and from thence till it join the Road leading from Kelso to Lauder near

Nether Blainslies, with an Alteration thereof crossing the River Lender at or near Earlston Bridge, and from thence through tire Lands of Earlston, Carolside, and Birkliillside, till it again join the present Turnpike Road to Lauder at or near Nether Blainslies or Bridge Ilaugh;
