and the following Lines of Road, heretofore maintained byconversion Money in lieu of Statute Labour, but hereby rendered and declared to be Turnpike Roads, when and so soon as the Trustees hereby appointed shall assume them as such, which they are hereby empowered to do, videlicet, that Part of the Road from the said Royal Burgh of Selkirk situated in the County of Roxburgh, from the said Confines of the County of Selkirk, by Toflsbarns, to the Jedburgh Turnpike Road at or near Ancrum Side Bar in the County of Roxburgh, or such Part or Parts thereof as the Trustees herein appointed shall think proper; a Road leading from the Edinburgh and Jedburgh Turnpike Road at or near the Townfoot Bridge of Jedburgh, by the Back of the Boundaries, to the Junction with the Road first above described at or near Kenmuir Lodge; for building, repairing, and maintaining the Bridges, Fences, and other Works and Buildings made or to be made on the said several Roads or any of them, and for putting in execution all and every the Powers and Authorities, and for carrying into effect the several other Purposes, in and by this Act given and granted, according to the true Intent and Meaning of this Act.

X. And be it enacted, That all Bonds, Covenants, Agreements, and Securities made or entered into by any Person or Persons to or with the Trustees for executing the said recited Acts shall remain in full Force and Effect, and be and continue available in all Courts of Law and Equity, until the same are fully satisfied and performed; and all Contracts, Agreements, Bonds, Assignments, and Securities duly made and entered into by the Trustees for executing the said Acts, to or with any Person or Persons, shall remain in full Force and Effect, and shall, as far as regards the Roads herein comprised, be binding on the Trustees for executing this Act, and be observed and kept by them, according to the Terms, Stipulations, and Tenor thereof respectively.

XI. And be it enacted, That, after providing for the Maintenance, Repairs, and Improvement of the said Roads as aforesaid, the Tolls and Duties hereby authorized to be levied from the Roads contained in the said second-recited Act shall be liable for that Part of the Debt presently existing against the Trust created by the said second-

recited

12° VICTORIA, 27

recited Act only, but for no other existing Debt; and the Tolls and on thes? Duties hereby authorized to be levied from the Road contained in the JP^tlve said third-recited Act, now included under this Act, shall be liable for the Debts presently existing against the Trust created by the said third-recited Act, so far as applicable to the said Road only, or for such Proportion of the said Debts as shall be agreed on by the Trustees under the said third-recited Act and this Act, and the Creditors therein, but for no other existing Debt: Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall be held to prevent the Trustees under this Act, borrowing Money under the Authority of the same, from burdening the Tolls and Duties leviable upon the whole Roads herein comprised, or such Part of the same as they shall think proper.

XII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Clerks, Sur- Clerks, &c. veyors, Collectors, and all other Officers who have been appointed "ntler. under and employed in the Execution of the said second-recited Act, ^ited Act to hereby repealed, shall respectively be the Officers under this Act, and continue shall continue to hold their Offices until they shall respectively be dis- under this placed or removed by the said Trustees, or be incapable of executing Act*

the same.

XIII. And be it enacted, That, notwithstanding the Repeal of the Present Tolls said recited Acts to the Extent before mentioned, the several Tolls continued thereby respectively granted and made payable shall continue to be Letdn*"™ °* paid at the Toll Gates or Toll Bars on or on the Sides of the Roads B comprised in this Act, till the Expiry of the respective existing Lettings of the said Tolls, and that the Roads heretofore maintained

by Statute Labour Money shall be so maintained until assumed as Turnpike under this Act.

XIV. And be it enacted, That the said Trustees, or any Person or Power to Persons duly authorized by them, shall be and they are hereby take thf fol-authorized and empowered to demand and take, or cause to be Io'vin8 Tolls-demanded and taken, at each of the Gates or Turnpikes which shall be continued or erected by virtue of this Act, before any Passage be permitted, (save and except as herein-after mentioned,) the Tolls and Duties following, or such other Sum or Sums as the said Trustees shall from Time to Time determine, not exceeding the Rates after specified;

(that is to say,)

For every Horse or other Beast of Draught drawing any Coach,

Berlin, Landau, Barouche, Chariot,Chaise, DogCart, Car, Hearse,

Calache, Chair, or other such Carriage, the Sum of Sixpence Sterling:

For every Horse or other Beast of Draught drawing any Waggon,

Cart, or other such Carriage, when drawn by Four or more Horses or other Beasts of Draught, the Sum of Sixpence Sterling; and when drawn by One, Two, or Three Horses or other Beasts of Draught, the Sum of Three-pence Sterling:

For every Horse or Beast of Burden, with or without a Rider, laden or unladen, and not drawing, the Sum of Three-pence Sterling:

For

28

Additional Tolls for Overweight.

Regulations as to additional Weights.

12° VICTORIAE, Cap. iv.

For every Drove of Oxen, Neat Cattle, Asses, Horses, or Fillies unshod, the Sum of One Shilling and Eight-pence Sterling per Score, and so in proportion for any greater or less Number:

For every Drove of Calves, Swine, Sheep, Lambs, or Goats, the Sum of Five-pence Sterling per Score, and so in proportion for any greater or less Number.

XV. And be it enacted, That for every Hundred Weight which any Waggon, Cart, or Carriage, together with the Loading thereof, shall weigh at any Weighing Machine erected or to be erected upon any Parts of the said Hoads, over and above the Weight which such Waggon, Cart, or Carriage is allowed to weigh without paying any additional Toll, as herein-after regulated, there shall be received and taken the following additional Tolls, or such other Sum or Sums as the said Trustees shall from Time to Time determine as additional Tolls, not exceeding the Rates after mentioned; (that is to say,)

For the First and Second Hundred Weight of such Overweight, the Sum of Three-pence Sterling for each Hundred Weight;

For every Hundred Weight of such Overweight above Two Hundred and not exceeding Five Hundred, the Sum of Sixpence Sterling;

For every Hundred Weight of such Overweight exceeding Five Hundred and not exceeding Ten Hundred, the Sum of Two Shillings and Sixpence Sterling;

For every Hundred Weight of such Overweight above Ten Hundred and not exceeding Fifteen Hundred, the Sum of Ten Shillings Sterling;

For every Hundred Weight of such Overweight above Fifteen Hundred, the Sum of Twenty Shillings Sterling:

Before such Waggon, Cart, or Carriage shall be permitted to pass through any of the said Gates or Turnpikes.

XVI. And be it enacted, That every Waggon, Cart, or Carriage shall be allowed to pass without paying any additional Toll, provided such Waggon, Cart, or Carriage, with its Loading, do not weigh more than the Weights following; videlicet, every Waggon or Four-wheeled Carriage having the Sole or Bottom of the Fellies of the Wheels of the Breadth of Sixteen Inches, Eight Tons in Summer and Seven Tons in Winter; every Waggon or Four-wheeled Carriage having the Sole or Bottom of the Fellies of the Breadth of Nine Inches, Six Tons in Summer and Five Tons Ten Hundred Weight in Winter; every Cart having the Sole or Bottom of the Fellies of the Breadth of Nine Inches, Three Tons in Summer and Two Tons Fifteen Hundred Weight in Winter; every Waggon having the Sole or Bottom of the Fellies of the Breadth of Six Inches, Four Tons Five Hundred Weight in Summer and Three Tons Fifteen Hundred Weight in Winter; every Cart having the Sole or Bottom of the Fellies of the Breadth of Six Inches, Two Tons Twelve Hundred Weight in Summer and Two Tons Seven Hundred Weight in Winter; every Waggon having the Sole or Bottom of the Fellies of less Breadth than Six Inches, Three Tons Ten Hundred Weight in Summer and Three Tons in Winter

29

12° VICTORIA, Cap. iv.

every Cart having the Sole or Bottom of the Fellies of less Breadth than Six Inches, and drawn by Two or more Horses or other Beasts of Draught, One Ton Ten Hundred Weight in Summer and One Ton Seven Hundred Weight in Winter; and every such Cart drawn by One Horse or other Beast of Draught, One Ton both in Summer and Winter; and for the aforesaid Purposes it shall be deemed Summer from the First Day of May to the Thirty-first Day of October, and Winter from the First Day of November to the Thirtieth Day of April in every Year, both inclusive.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Tolls hereby authorized to be Tolls to be taken having been paid at any of the said Turnpike Gates or Bars, no onceaEtay further Toll shall on the same Day (to be computed from Twelve of wjti, in tf,e y the Clock at Night to Twelve of the Clock of the succeeding Night) Distance of be again exigible, either at the same Turnpike Gate or Bar, or at any Six Miles, other Turnpike Gate or Bar within Six Miles (measured on the Line

of the said Roads) of the Gate or Bar at which such Tolls shall have been paid, for the same Horse or other Beast, or for the same Coach,

AVaggon, or other Carriage, for which such Toll shall have been previously paid on the same Day.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That if any of the Keepers of the Penalty on Turnpike Gates continued or erected by virtue of this Act shall fail Keepers of in due Performance of his Duty, or shall neglect to give constant f^tfnSnes~ Attendance at all Hours, and a free and ready Passage to all Persons their Duties, and Carriages on Payment offered of the Toll or Tolls exigible, every such Keeper so offending shall forfeit and pay any Sum not exceeding Five Pounds Sterling for each Offence.

XIX. And be it enacted, That the Produce of the said Tolls and Application Duties so to be raised, levied, and collected as aforesaid shall, after of T°"s-Payment of the Expenses of preparing, applying for, procuring, and

passing this Act, as herein-after provided, be applied towards making, maintaining, and improving the Roads comprehended under this Act, and paying the Interest of the Money borrowed, subscribed, advanced, or owing at the Time, and the Surplus shall be appropriated annually to extinguish the Principal of the said Debt, and to no other Purpose whatsoever.

XX. And be it enacted, That, besides the Exemptions from the Pay- Local Ex-ment of Toll Duties specified in the said recited Act of the First emptions and Second Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King William the lom ° s‘ Fourth, no Toll whatsoever shall be demanded or taken for any Carriage, Horse, or Cattle loaded with Corn of any Kind going to Mills

or Kilns for the Purpose of being manufactured, or returning therefrom, for the Use of Farmers, their Families and Cottagers, residing within One Mile of any Toll Bar which may be passed through.

XXI. And be it enacted, That all the Tolls and Duties hereby Tolls, &c. granted and made payable, together with the Right of Property of

and in every Gate or Turnpike, Toll House, Building, Garden, rus ees Bridge, Milestone, Post, Rail, and all Road Materials, and every other Matter or Thing belonging to the said Roads comprehended under

30

Expenses of Act.

Roads not exempt from Provisions of any future general Act.

Term of Act.

[Public Act.]

12° VICTORIAE, Cap. iv.

this Act, or which shall be acquired by virtue hereof, are and shall be vested in the Trustees appointed in or by virtue of this Act.

XXII. And be it enacted, That the Expenses of preparing, applying for, procuring, and passing this Act shall be paid out of the first and readiest of the Tolls and Duties received and levied under this Act, or by or out of the first Monies that shall come to the Hands of the said Trustees under and by virtue of the said second and third recited Acts.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed to exempt the Roads comprised in this Act from the Provisions of any general Act relating to the Consolidation or other improved Arrangement of Turnpike Roads which may pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall continue from and after the Commencement thereof during the Term of Thirty-one Years, and from thence to the End of the then next ensuing Session of Parliament.

XXV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be deemed to be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIAE REGINE.

Cap. v.

An Act to authorize the Warrington Waterworks Company to raise a further Sum of Money.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for the better supplying with Water the Town 9 & to Vict. and Borough of Warrington, or Parts thereof in the Counties of c. 112. Lancaster and Chester, and the Townships of Latchford and Appleton in the last-mentioned County, whereby a Company was incorporated called "The Warrington Waterworks Company," whereby the Sum of Sixteen thousand Pound was authorized to be raised by the Creation of Shares for the Purposes mentioned therein, and whereby also the Sum of Six thousand Pounds was authorized to be borrowed on Mortgage or Bond for the Purposes aforesaid : And whereas the whole of the said Sums of Sixteen thousand Pounds and Six thousand Pounds have been accordingly raised and expended upon the Purposes aforesaid: And whereas, in exercise of the Powers contained in the said Act, the Warrington Waterworks Company have constructed extensive Works for the Purposes in the said Act mentioned, but the Capital which the said Company is authorized to raise under the Powers of the said Act is insufficient to complete the same, and it is expedient that the said Capital should be increased: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted [Local.j I by

34

Powers of recited Act &c. extended to this Act.

[Short Title.]

Power to raise Money by the Creation of new Shares.

New Shares to be considered same as original Shares.

New Shares to be offered to original Shareholders.

Company may remunerate Directors.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. v.

by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in the said recited Act, and the several Acts incorporated therewith, shall extend to and be incorporated with this Act, so far as the same are applicable to the Purposes and Objects thereof.

II. And be it enacted, That in reciting this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments and Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Warrington Waterworks Amendment Act, 1849."

III. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Directors of the said Company from Time to Time, by an Order of any Meeting thereof, to raise by creating and disposing of new Shares, in addition to any Sums which they are already authorized to raise under and by virtue of the said recited Act, any further Sum not exceeding Eight thousand Pounds.

IV. And be it enacted, That the Capital so to be raised by the Creation of new Shares shall be considered as Part of the general Capital, and such new Shares shall be of the same Amount respectively, and subject to the same Provisions in all respects, whether with reference to the Payment of Calls, or the Forfeiture of Shares on the Nonpayment of Calls, or otherwise, as if such new Shares had been Part of the original Capital of the Company.

V. And be it enacted, That when any Augmentation of Capital shall take place by the Creation of new Shares, such new Shares shall be apportioned among the then Shareholders in proportion to the existing Shares held by them respectively; and an Offer of such new Shares shall be made by Letter under the Hand of the Clerk of the Company given or sent by Post to each Shareholder, or left at his usual or last Place of Abode; and such new Shares shall vest in and belong to the Shareholders who shall accept the same, and pay the Deposit or Call thereon to the Company at the Time which shall be fixed by the Directors thereof; and if any Shareholder fail for One Month after such Offer of new Shares to accept the same, and pay the Deposit or Call to be paid in respect thereof, it shall be lawful for the Directors of the said Company to dispose of such Shares to any Person or Persons willing to become the Purchaser or Purchasers thereof, upon such Terms and for such Sum as they can or may obtain for the same; and every such Offer made by Letter sent by Post shall be considered as made on the Day when such Letter shall be committed to the Post Office.

VI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company at any General Meeting to order that Remuneration shall be made to the Directors for the Time being of the said Company for their Time and Trouble in conducting the Affairs of the said Company, not exceeding Two hundred Pounds per Annum, unless the current Year’s Profits shall yield a Dividend of Seven and a Half

per

35

12° VICTORIA, Cap. x.

per Centum to the Shareholders in the Company, and not exceeding in any Case Three hundred Pounds per Annum; and any Amount of Remuneration so ordered shall be paid to such Directors out of the current Year’s Profits of the said Company.

VII. And be it enacted, That after One Half of the Capital by this and the said recited Act authorized to be raised shall have been actually paid up it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond such Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be authorized to be borrowed by Order of a General Meeting of the Company, not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Two thousand six hundred and sixty-six Pounds Thirteen Shillings and Four-pence, in addition to the Sum authorized to be borrowed by the said recited Act.

VIII. And be it enacted, That all Monies so raised, and all Mortgages and Bonds to be made by virtue of this Act, shall be subject to the same Provisions as by the said recited Act and the Acts incorporated therewith are made applicable to the Monies authorized by the said recited Act to be raised on Mortgage or Bond, and to the Mortgages or Bonds thereby authorized to be granted; and the respective Mortgagees and Bondholders shall be entitled to the like Benefits, Rights, and Privileges in respect of the Mortgages or Bonds granted by virtue of this Act as they would have been entitled to in respect of like Mortgages or Bonds granted under the said recited Act.

IX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages and Bonds made or entered into by the said Company before the passing of this Act, and which shall be in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall during the Continuance thereof have Priority over all Mortgages and Bonds made or entered into by virtue of this Act.

X. And be it enacted, That the Monies to be raised by virtue of this Act shall be laid out and applied, in the first place, and in preference to any other Payment, in paying and discharging all Costs and Expenses incurred in passing this Act, and the Residue in carrying out the Purposes and Objects of the said recited Act and of this Act, in such Manner as the Directors of the Company shall think fit.

XI. And whereas the said recited Act was intended to apply to the said Townships of Latchford and Appleton in all respects as fully and effectually as to the said Town of H arrington, and the said Company are now supplying Water under their said Act to the Inhabitants of the said first-mentioned Townships, but the Provisions of the said recited Act are defective, and do not clearly include the same within its Limits: Be it therefore enacted, That all the Powers, Authorities, Provisions, Regulations, Directions, Privileges, Penalties, Forfeitures, and all other Matters and Things whatsoever contained in the said recited Act and the Acts incorporated therewith, save and except so far as they are altered and varied by this Act, shall throughout be taken to extend to and and they hereby declared to

be

Power to borrow Money on Mortgage.

New Mortgages and Bonds to be subject to the Provisions of recited Act.

Former Mortgages, &c. to have Priority.

Application of Monies.

Confirming Provisions of recited Act to the Townships of Latchford and Apple-ton.

36

Company not exempted from Provisions of 11 & 12 Vict, c. 63.

[Public Act.]

12° VICTORIAS, Cap. v.

be in as full Force and Effect within the said Townships of Latchford and Appleton as to and within the said Town of Warrington.

XII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the said Company from the Provisions of "The Public Health Act, 1848," or of any general Act relating thereto or to the Subject Matter thereof which may pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament.

XIII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be deemed a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849-

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. vi.

An Act for better establishing and maintaining the Market Place and Markets at Longtoji, heretofore called Lane End, in the Parish of Stoke-upo?i- Trent in the County of Stafford.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS for many Years past a Market has been held and continues to be holden at Longton, heretofore called Lane End, in the Parish of Stoke-upon- Trent in the County of Stafford, in a Place there called the Market Place, and a Market House or Hall, with Stalls and Standings, have been provided for the Use of Persons frequenting the said Market: And whereas the said Market and Market Place is inadequate for the Demands and Convenience of the Inhabitants of the said Town and the Neighbourhood, and it is expedient that the said Market should be enlarged, and more permanently established and regulated : And whereas the Persons herein-after named are willing, at their own Costs and Charges, to carry such Undertaking into execution; but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, [Locfl/.] K That

38

8 & 9 Vict, ce. 16. & 18. and 10 & 11 Vict. c. 14. incorporated with this Act.

Nothing to authorize Company to take Lands without Consent.

Quarter

Sessions.

[Short Title.]

Corporation.

Limits of Act.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. vi.

That the following Acts of Parliament, (that is to say,) " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 184-5," " The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," and " The Markets and Fairs Clauses Act, 1847," so far as the same respectively are not varied by the Provisions of this Act, shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act.

II. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing in this Act or the said Lands Clauses Consolidation Act shall authorize the Company herein-after incorporated to purchase, take, or use any Lands for the Purposes of this Act, unless with the Consent of and by Agreement with the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers thereof.

III. And be it enacted, That the Expression " Quarter Sessions" in this and the said incorporated Acts shall be construed to mean the Quarter Sessions of the Peace for the County of Stafford holden at Stafford.

IV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Longton Market Act, 1849."

V. And be it enacted, That Charles Harvey the elder, Charles Harvey the younger, John Harvey, William Kenwright Harvey, Sampson Bridgwood, John Lockett, Janies Glover, Benjamin Singleton Brough, Ralph Steele, John Ashwell, Thomas Barlow, Jesse Ridge, Joseph Ridge, Thomas Hulse the younger, James Meakin, John Palmer, Joseph Salt, Henry Brassington, Samuel Bridgwood, William Clarke, and all other Persons and Corporations who have already subscribed or shall hereafter subscribe to the Undertaking, and their Executors, Administrators, Successors, and Assigns respectively, shall be united into a Company for carrying on and continuing, maintaining, altering, improving, and enlarging the said Market and Market Place, and the Approaches thereto, together with all proper Works and Conveniences connected therewith and belonging thereto, within the Limits of this Act prescribed, upon the Lands described in Schedule (A.) to this Act annexed, according to the Provisions of this Act and of the said incorporated Acts, and for other the Purposes herein and in the same Acts contained; and for the Purposes aforesaid such Company shall be and are hereby incorporated by the Name of " The Longton Market Company," and by that Name shall be a Body Corporate with perpetual Succession, and shall and may sue and be sued, and shall have Power to purchase and hold Lands for the Purposes of the said Undertaking, within the Restrictions herein and in the said Acts herewith incorporated contained; and that the Lands, Buildings, and Hereditaments described in Schedule (A.) to this Act annexed shall be vested in the said Longton Market Company.

VI. And be it enacted, That the Limits within which this and the incorporated Acts shall be put in force shall be as follows; (that is to say,) the Liberty, Township, Hamlet, or Vill of Lane End and Longton (now commonly called Longton) in the Parish of Sloke-upon-Trent in the County of Stafford.

12° VICTORIAE, 3!)

VII. And be it enacted, That the Capital of the said Company shall Capital, he Sixteen thousand Pounds.

VIII. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shares into which Number ami the Capital of the said Company shall he divided shall be Two hun- Amount oi dred, and that the Amount of each Share shall be Eighty Pounds, of are!" which Forty Pounds have been paid up.

IX. And be it enacted, That Two Pounds per Share shall be the Calls, greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make on the Shareholders in respect of the unpaid up Capital, and Three Months at least shall be the Interval between the successive Calls.

X. And be it enacted, That no Shareholder shall be entitled to Limitation hold more than Ten Shares in the said Company, unless more than Number Ten such Shares shall be derived by Marriage, or shall descend upon £e he"jes 10 or be given or bequeathed by Will to him or her respectively, or

unless such a Number of Shares shall be derived by Marriage or shall descend upon or be given or bequeathed to him or her respectively as with the Number of Shares then already held by him or her shall exceed Ten in Number.

XI. And be it enacted, That if any Shareholder shall by Purchase, or any other Means than those herein-before mentioned, become possessed of or entitled to more titan Ten Shares in the said Undertaking, every such Shareholder shall and he or she is hereby required, upon Notice in Writing under the Hands of Two Directors or of the Clerk to the Company, to sell and dispose of all such Shares as may be held by him or her over and above the said limited Number of Ten.

XII. And be it enacted, That if for the Space of Three Months after Surplus Notice in Writing to any Shareholder holding more than Ten Shares ®,lai'?s to. j>e (except as herein is provided for), requiring such Shareholder to sell no/X^oscci and dispose of so many of his said Shares as will reduce the Number of. Cl of Shares then held by him to Ten only, such Shareholder shall neglect or refuse so to sell and dispose of the surplus Shares, and to comply with the said Notice, such Number of Shares as he shall hold over and above the said limited Number of Ten shall become forfeited, and may, without any further or other Notice, be disposed of by the Directors as they may think proper, and the Proceeds of such Sale shall be applied in and towards and form Part of the Sinking Fund herein-after mentioned.

XIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Power to or Directors from Time to Time to borrow for the Purposes of this borro'v Act, upon Mortgage of all or any of the Property and Premises M°"teya°n belonging to them, or of the Rents or Sums of Money accruing from r §agt the said Market, and from the Tolls and Rents herein-after set forth,

or upon their Bond or otherwise, any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Five thousand three hundred and thirty Pounds; but that no Part of such Sum shall be raised until the whole of the said Capital or Sum of Sixteen thousand Pounds shall have

12° VICTORIA, Cap. vi.

have been subscribed for, and One Half thereof shall have actually been paid up.

XIV. And whereas Provision is made in this or the said incorporated Acts for the Repayment of the Sums so to be raised by Mortgage or Bond as aforesaid : And whereas the several Persons named in the Schedule (G.) to this Act annexed have already advanced the several Sums affixed to their Names respectively, and the same are still owing: Be it enacted, That the said several Sums so owing shall during the Continuance thereof have Priority over any Mortgages or Bonds to be created by virtue of this Act: Provided always, that, except as is herein-before excepted, no Mortgage or Bond created by virtue of this Act shall have Priority over any other Mortgages or Bonds similarly created.

XV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mortgagees of the Company to enforce the Payment of Principal and Arrears of Interest due on any such Mortgages by the Appointment of a Receiver; and in order to authorize the Appointment of such Receiver, in the event of the Principal Monies not being duly paid, the Amount owing to the Mortgagees by whom Application for such Receiver shall be made shall not be less than One thousand Pounds in the whole.

XVI. And be it enacted, That the First Ordinary Meeting of the Company shall be held at Longton within Three Months after the passing of this Act, and an Ordinary or Quarterly Meeting shall be held on the First Thursday after Lady Day, Midsummer Day, Michaelmas Day, and Christmas Day in each Year, or at such other stated Periods as shall be appointed for that Purpose by an Order of a General Meeting; and all Meetings, whether ordinary or extraordinary, shall be held at such Places within the Limits of this Act as the Directors of the Company for the Time being shall appoint; and all Questions shall be decided by the Majority of Shareholders present at such Meetings qualified to vote; and that the Presence of Seven Shareholders shall be sufficient to constitute a Meeting.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shareholders on whose Requisition an extra General Meeting may be required to be convened shall be not less than Three, holding Two Shares each at the least in the Capital.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That no Shareholders shall be entitled to vote at any Meeting unless he be a Holder of Two Shares at least, neither shall any Shareholder be entitled to more than One Vote.

XIX. And be it enacted, That no Shareholder shall be entitled to hold more than Three Proxies, such Proxies to be in Writing, and signed by the Party giving the same.

XX. And be it enacted, That the Number of Directors shall never be more than Seven nor less than Five, Three of whom shall form a Quorum; and the Qualification of a Director shall be the Possession, in his own Right, of not less than Four Shares in the Undertaking

12' VICTORIA, 41

XXI. And be it enacted, That Charles Harvey the elder, John Firsl Direc" Harvey, John Lockett, Sampson Bridgwood, Benjamin Singleton tors‘ Brough, Ralph Steele, and Henry Brassington, shall be the first Directors of the Company.

XXII. And be it enacted, That Three of the Directors shall retire Retirement annually by Rotation, and fresh Directors shall be appointed in the of Directors. Place of the Directors so retiring, such Directors to go out of Office

on the First Thursday after Midsummer Day in every Year, at which Time, and at the Meeting to be then held, the fresh Directors shall be nominated and appointed.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That the Directors retiring from Office Retiring

by Rotation shall be qualified to serve again in the then next Year, Directors and may be re-elected. Elected/6

XXIV. And be it enacted, That the Advertisements relating to Newspaper the Affairs of the Company shall be inserted in the Newspaper called for Insertion the Staffordshire Advertiser, but in case that shall cease to be pub- "|c^t(svertlse" fished, then in some other Newspaper published in the County of Stafford.

XXV. And be it enacted, That all Notices (except Notices relating Notices to the Forfeiture of Shares where more than Ten are held) to be '° Sim reserved by the Company on Shareholders shall be so served as to allow 10 ttrs‘ the Party served at least Three clear Days to observe and perform the

Act, Matter, or Thing therein required or mentioned.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That all Meetings of the Directors, or Notices of of the Shareholders, to be held under the Authority of this or the Meeting, incorporated Acts, shall be convened or called by a Circular Letter or Notice in Writing, signed by the Clerk or Secretary, and delivered

or left at the usual Place of Abode or Business of such Directors or Shareholders, or sent by Post addressed to each of the said Directors or Shareholders at such Place of Abode or Business; and every Notice or Circular shall specify the Time and Place of Meeting, and in case of special or extra Meetings shall specify the Object thereof, and no Business shall be transacted at any special or extra Meeting except such as is stated in the Notice or Circular convening the same.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Power to Company from Time to Time and at all Times after the passing of ComPan.v this Act, when and so often and at such Days, Hours, or Times as Market they may think fit, to hold a Market or Fair, or Markets or Fairs, for the Sale of Cattle, and also to hold or continue to hold a Market or Markets for the Sale of Meat, Fruit, Vegetables, and all other marketable Commodities, in the Place where the same has heretofore been holden, or in any other Part or Parts of the Land and Premises belonging to the said Company mentioned in the said Schedule (A.), or on Additions thereto or to the said Market Place, or on any other Land belonging to the said Company, or on any Land hereafter to be purchased or acquired for the Purposes this Act; and to alter, vary, and to alter, or reconstruct the present Market, and the Buildings and Conve- Market

[Zoca/.]

42

Buildings

attached

thereto.

Application of Monies.

Power to form a Sinking Fund.

Power to take Tolls for Stands, &c. in Markets.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. vi.

niences thereto attached; or to make, erect, construct, provide, and put up on all or any Part of the said Premises mentioned in the said Schedule (A.), or on any Lands to be hereafter purchased or acquired by the said Company, any Slaughter-house or Slaughter-houses, or other Buildings for the slaughtering of Cattle, and any new, additional, or other Building or Buildings, Stalls, Standings, Bulks, Blocks, Sheds, Shops, or other Conveniences, for the Purposes or Objects of the said Market, as to the said Company shall appear necessary or convenient, or by means whereof the Purposes of this Act may be carried into execution.

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That the Monies arising from the said Market or Markets, and the Rates and Tolls herein-after provided, and the Rents and Profits of the Property now or hereafter belonging to the said Company as aforesaid, and all other Monies arising under this Act, shall be applied by the said Company, in the first place, in or for the Payment of the Expenses of obtaining and passing this Act or incident thereto, and of such Sum or Sums as shall have been borrowed for that Purpose, with lawful Interest thereon; and afterwards, as the said Company or Directors shall think proper, in the Payment of the Expenses and Disbursements of and attending the Continuance, Maintenance, Improvement, and keeping up of the said Market and Market Place, and the regulating, ordering, and Management thereof, and in the Payment of the annual Dividend herein-after mentioned, and of such Sum or Sums as have been or may be hereafter raised by Mortgage, Bond, or otherwise, upon the Security or Credit of the said Property, or of the Rates aforesaid, and the Interest thereof, and all Taxes, Salaries, and Allowances to Officers, and other incidental Expenses: Provided nevertheless, that the Dividend to be declared by the said Company or Directors shall not exceed Five Pounds per Centum per Annum on the Capital hereby expressed or declared to be paid up and on all future Calls.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company or Directors from Time to Time to set apart and appropriate any surplus Funds which may remain after the Applications aforesaid, and Payment of a Dividend not exceeding Five Pounds per Centum per Annum as aforesaid upon each Share of the Capital of the said Company expressed or declared to be paid up, and future Calls, to the Formation of a Sinking Fund; and that it shall be lawful for the said Company or Directors to apply the Amount of such Sinking Fund so formed as aforesaid, or any Part thereof, from Time to Time in or to the Improvement of the said Township of Longton, or in such other Manner as they may think fit.

XXX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company or the Directors thereof from Time to Time to demand from any Person or Persons occupying or using any Stand, Stall, Shed, Pen or Place m the said Market Place or Building, or Ground connected therewith, or on Land or Building hereafter to be used for the Purposes of the said Market, or bringing within the Limits of this Act or into the said Market Place, Buildings, or Ground, any marketable Commodities, Provisions, Articles, or Things specified in Schedule (B )

43

12° VICTORIA, Cup.vi.

to this Act annexed, such Stallage, Rents, and Tolls as the said Company or Directors shall from Time to Time appoint, not exceeding the several Stallages, Rents, and Tolls specified in the said Schedule (B.) : Provided always, that in the event of any such Article being of a perishable Nature, then and in such Case, and so often as it shall so happen, it shall be lawful for the Collector, Farmer, Lessee, or other Person so authorized to receive the same, either by himself or his Assistants, to levy the same by Distress and Sale of all or any of such perishable Articles and Things so offered or exposed to Sale, and the Distress and Distresses so taken to sell immediately, or at any Time in the Day of levying the same, or within a reasonable Time thereafter, rendering the Overplus, if any there be, after deducting the Expenses of such Distress and Sale, to the Person or Persons whose Property such perishable Articles or Things were at the Time of levying every such Distress.

XXXI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company or Directors from Time to Time to demand in the Cattle Market or Fair, from any Person bringing therein or within the Limits of this Act any Cattle or other live Stock, as specified in the Schedule (C.) to this Act annexed, such Stallages, Rents, and Tolls as the said Company or Directors shall from Time to Time appoint, not exceeding the several Stallages, Rents, and Tolls specified in the said Schedule (C.)

XXXII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company or Directors to demand from any Person slaughtering Cattle in any Slaughter-house belonging to the said Company such Tolls as are specified in Schedule (D.) to this Act annexed.

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Person for the Time being appointed to attend to the Weighing-houses, or Places for weighing or measuring any Article sold in the said Market

j Place by Weight or Measure, from Time to Time to demand such

Tolls as the said Company or Directors shall appoint, not exceeding s in any Case the Amount set forth in the Schedule (E.) to this Act

s annexed.

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Person for the Time being appointed to attend the Machines for weighing Carts or other Vehicles, Commodities or Things, within the Limits of this Act, to demand from the Person requiring the same to be weighed such Tolls as the said Company or Directors may appoint, not exceeding in any Case the Amount set forth in the Schedule (F.) to this Act annexed; and such Tolls shall be paid before any Waggon, Cart, or Carriage in respect of which the same are payable shall be weighed.

XXXV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company or Directors from Time to Time to demise and let the said Market or Market Place, or any Part thereof, or any Building or Shop belonging to the said Company, and the said Slaughter-houses, Weighing-houses, or Places, and Machines, or any of them, or the said

Stallages,

Power to take Tolls for Cattle Market;

for Slauglr-ter-houses;

for weighing and measuring;

and for

weighing

Carts.

Power to lease the Market for Seven Years.

44

Power to lease Standings in the Market.

Power to assign Lease of Standings.

Saving Rights of Richard £. Heathcote as Lord of the Manor.

Application of Penalties.

[Public Act.]

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xu

Stallages, Rents, or Tolls, or any of them, or any other Buildings, Shops, and Premises now or at any Time hereafter belonging to the said Company, for any Period not exceeding Seven Years, upon such Terms as shall be agreed upon between the said Company or Directors and the Person to whom such Lease shall be made.

XXXVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company or Directors to let any of the said Slaughter-houses, Shops, Stalls, Standings, Benches, Places, or other Conveniences in the said Market or Market Place for any Term not exceeding Seven Years.

XXXVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Lessee of the said Market Place, or of any such Slaughter-house, Shop, Stall, or Standing, or other Convenience as aforesaid, his Executors, Administrators, or Assigns, with the Consent in Writing of the said Company, but not otherwise, to assign the same for the Residue of his Term.

XXXVIII. And whereas Richard Edensor Heathcote is or claims to be Lord of the Manor of Longton, and as such claims to be entitled to certain Franchises within the said Manor: Be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend to limit, abridge, or otherwise take away any Franchises, Rights, or Properties to which the said Richard Edensor Heathcote is entitled.

XXXIX. And be it enacted, That with respect to the Application of any Penalties or Forfeitures recovered by virtue of this Act or of the Acts incorporated herewith, or any or either of them, other than such Penalties or Forfeitures as may be recovered from the said Company, or any Person or Persons acting on their Behalf, the Justice by whom any such Penalty or Forfeiture shall be imposed may award any Part thereof not exceeding One Half to the Informer, and the Remainder, or the whole in case no Part shall be awarded to the Informer, to the said Company or their Treasurer, to be applied for and towards and to form Part of the Sinking Fund herein-before authorized by this Act to be formed.

XL. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

SCHEDULE (B.)

Schedule of Tolls or Stallage referred to and authorized to be in the Market by the foregoing Act.

For every covered or uncovered Shed, Stall, Bulk, Block, Tressel, Standing Place, or Station used by any Person for exposing to Sale Flesh Meat, Cheese, Bacon, Pickled Pork, Fish, or any other live or dead Victuals, Fruit, Vegetables, China, Glass, Earthenware, or other Goods, Articles, Commodities, or Things whatsoever, according to the Size or Dimensions of the same; videlicet, for each superficial Square Foot thereof—

If such Stall, Bulk, Block, Tressel, or Station be within or on the Ground or Basement Floor of the Market Hall, or the Butchery or Butter Market behind the same, or in any covered Building now or hereafter to be erected—

If taken for the Year, the Sum of -

By the Half Year, the Sum of -

By the Quarter, the Sum of

If otherwise taken, for each Market Day or other Day the Sum of -

If drawn by One Horse or other Animal, provided the Article or Commodity contained in such Cart do not exceed One Ton Weight, the Sum of -

If drawn by Two or more Horses or other Animals, or if the Article or Commodity contained in such Cart exceeds One Ton Weight, the Sum of For each Compartment or Space on the Surface of the Ground used by any Person for the like Purpose, according to the Size or Dimensions

The Stallage and the several Tolls and Rents before mentioned and specified to be payable and paid for or in respect of the Occupation or Use of any Stall, Standing Place, Bench, Compartment, or Space of Ground shall be paid as well by the original Taker or Occupier thereof for a Part or Portion of the Day, in case he shall not occupy the same the whole Day, as also by any subsequent Taker or Occupier of the same for the Residue of any Part or Portion of the same Day.

SCHEDULE (C.)

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. vii.

An Act for improving the Drainage of Feltwell Second District in the County of Norfolk, and for amending the Acts relating to the same.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Thirteenth Year of the Reign of King George the Third, intituled An Act for 13G. 3. C. 45. draining and preserving certain Fen Lands and Low Grounds lying in the South Level, Part of the Great Level of the Fens commonly called Bedford Level, between certain old Rivers or Drains called Stoke River and Brandon River and a certain Level or District called Feltwell New District, and the Hard Lands of Woodhall in Helgay and Helgay in the Counties of Norfolk and Suffolk, whereby certain Fen Lands and Low Grounds therein described were made One general District, for the Purpose of scouring, deepening, maintaining, and supporting the old Sewer or Drain called Sam's Cut otherwise Sam's Cut Drain, and a certain Sluice called Hunt's Sluice, at the End thereof next the River Ouse, and were also thereby made Two separate Districts or Divisions, for the Purpose of embanking and draining the same, and such Part and so much of the said Fen Lands and Low Grounds bounded and described as follows; (that is to say,) from Wilton Load along the North Side of Brandon River to the new Bank at Feltwell New District, and along the said Bank to Sam’s Cut or Drain on the South Side thereof, and [Local.] N from

50

12° VICTORIA, Cup.vii.

from thence along the same Drain to Stake Load, and on the South Side of Stake Load aforesaid to the Hard Lands of Feltwell, and along the Hard Lands of Feltwell Saint Mary, Feltwell Saint Nicholas, and Hockwold-with- Wilton, to Wilton Load aforesaid, containing about Six thousand Acres, were thereby called and taken to be the Second District or Division: And whereas an Act was passed in the Forty-second Year of the Reign of King George the Third, 4‘iG. 3. c. 24. intituled An Act for amending and rendering more effectual so much of an Act passed in the Thirteenth Year of the Reign of His present Majesty, intituled 4 An Act for draining and preserving certain Fen 4 Lands and Low Grounds lying in the South Level, Part of the 4 Great Level of the Fens commonly called Bedford Level, between 4 certain old Rivers or Drains called Stoke River and Brandon River 4 and a certain Level or District called Feltwell New District and the Hard Lands of Woodhall in Helgay and Helgay in the Counties of Norfolk and Suffolk,’ as relates to the Fen and Low Grounds lying within the Second District or Division described in the said Act: And whereas it is expedient that some of the Powers and Provisions of the said firstly-recited Act, so far as the same relate to the said Second District or Division, and also that some of the Powers and Provisions of the said secondly-recited Act, should be altered, amended, and enlarged, and that further Powers should be granted for raising an additional Sum of Money for more effectually draining and improving the Lands and Grounds comprised in the said Second District or Division, and for the proper Maintenance of the Works within the same; but the Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliaments May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, Certain and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions, Matters, Provisions of and Things contained in the said firstly-recited Act, so far as the recited Acts same relate to the said Second District or Division, and all the Pro-t his* Act. l° visions. Matters, and Things contained in the said secondly-recited Act, so far as the same are now in force, (and except such of them as are by this Act altered or otherwise provided for,) shall extend to this Act, as fully and effectually as if the same Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act.

So much of

" her, or their Action or Suit, after the Defendant or Defendants " should have appeared, or if a Verdict should pass against the " Plaintiff or Plaintiffs, or if upon Demurrer or otherwise Judgment " should be given against the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs, the Defendant or " Defendants should have Double Costs, and should have such

[Short Title.]

Interpretation of Terms used in this Act.

■Provisions in secondly-recited Act as to Meeting of Commissioners repealed.

Construction of Term " Feltwell Second District Commissioners."

Two General Meetings to be held annually.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xii.

" Remedy for recovering the same as any Defendant had for Costs " of Suit in other Cases by Law shall be and the same is hereby repealed.

III. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act for any Purposes whatsoever it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Feltwell Second District Drainage Act, 1849-"

IV. And be it enacted, That in this Act the following Words and Expressions shall have the several Meanings hereby assigned to them, unless there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Construction; (that is to say,)

Words importing the Singular Number shall include the Plural Number, and Words importing the Plural Number shall include the Singular Number:

Words importing the Masculine Gender shall include Females:

The Word " Person " shall include any Body Politic, Corporate, or Collegiate, Civil or Ecclesiastical, Aggregate or Sole:

The Word " Lands " shall extend to Messuages, Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments of any Tenure:

The Word " County " shall include any Division of a County.

V. And be it enacted, That so much of the said secondly-recited Act as enacts, " that the said Commissioners, or any Five or more of " them, should meet twice in every Year at the Cock Inn in Feltwell " aforesaid, or at such other Place within or near to the said Second " District as the said Commissioners should from Time to Time " appoint, on the Second Monday in the Month of April and the " Second Monday in the Month of October in each and every Year," shall be and the same is hereby repealed.

VI. And be it enacted, That the Words " Feltwell Second District Commissioners " shall for all Purposes of the said recited Acts and this Act, be taken to mean the Commissioners acting in Execution of and under the Powers and Provisions of the said recited Acts and this Act.

VII. And be it enacted, That the said Feltwell Second District Commissioners shall hold Two General Meetings in every Year on the Third Mondays in the Months of April and October, and that such Meetings shall be holden at some Inn or convenient Place in Feltwell in the County of Norfolk; and in case Five Commissioners shall not be present at such Meetings the same shall be adjourned by the Commissioners present, or the Clerk to the said Commissioners, to any Time, and to any Inn or convenient Place in Feltwell aforesaid, that may be thought expedient; and all other Meetings shall be holden by the said Feltwell Second District Commissioners, and Notices thereof, and of the said General Meetings and adjourned Meetings, shall be given in manner provided by the said secondly-recited Act.

VIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Feltwell Second District Commissioners at any Meeting to appoint One or more Committee or Committees, consisting of not less than Five of the Commissioners, for carrying into effect any of the Provisions

53

12° VICTORIA, Cap• vii.

visions of this Act and the said recited Acts, or either of them, and at any Meeting to continue, alter, or discontinue any such Committee, but no such Committee shall be appointed to act for a longer Term than until the General Meeting of the Commissioners next following its Appointment; and the said Commissioners may make such Allowance for any reasonable Expenses incurred by such Committees as they may think expedient.

IX. And be it enacted, That no Business shall be transacted at Quorum of any Meeting of any Committee unless Three Members of the Com- Committees, mittee be present.

X. And be it enacted, That the said Feltwell Second District Power to Commissioners shall annually tax, charge, and assess all the Fen

Lands and Low Grounds, Commons, Commonable and Waste Lands, a purti,er within the aforesaid Boundary of the said Second District, with an Tax on Acre Tax not exceeding in any Year Five Shillings nor less than Lands.

Four Shillings, and in such Proportions for less than an Acre, in addition to the Acre Taxes imposed upon the said Lands and Grounds, or any of them, under the Authorities of the said recited Acts; and the said Tax to be imposed under the Authority of this Act shall be called " The Further Taxand such Tax shall be payable at the same Times and Places respectively, and to the same Persons respectively, and in the same Manner in all respects as the several Taxes authorized to be imposed, charged, and assessed upon the said Lands and Low Grounds, or any of them, by the said recited Acts, are thereby taxed, charged, and assessed, and directed to be paid.

XI. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Commission-Feltwell Second District Commissioners at any Time to tax, charge, t°ctax or assess any Part or Parts of the Lands or Grounds in Feltwell afore- CaIlfid’"The said called " The Poors Commons," containing Three hundred and Poor's Com-Sixty Acres or thereabouts, and bounded by a Ditch called Mott's mons-" Dyke towards the North and North-west, by a Drain called the

New Drain or the Cross Drain towards the South-east, and by the Ditch called Stake Load towards the South-west, or the Common situate in Hockwold aforesaid called the " Poor’s Common," and containing about Thirty Acres, which shall be dug for Fuel for the Use of the Poor, with any Taxes directed or authorized to be imposed by the said first-recited Act and this Act, or either of them, so long and as often as such Part or Parts of the said Lands or Grounds and the said last-mentioned Common shall be so dug up for Fuel for the Use of the Poor: Provided always, that the Trustees or Feoffees of the said Lands, Grounds, or Commons, when the said Land shall be so dug up, shall make and maintain a proper and sufficient Bank or other Works to prevent any Water from flowing or passing from the same into the said Second District during the Time the said Lands, Grounds, or Commons shall be dug up as aforesaid : Provided also, that the total Quantity of Land in Feltwell aforesaid so to be exempted from Taxation shall not at any Time exceed Sixty Acres, unless the Trustees of the said Land called the Poor’s Commons shall at any Time claim to have any greater Quantity of Land exempted, in which Case it shall be lawful for the said Trustees and the said Feltwell Second [Loccr/.] 0 District

54 12° VICTORIA, Cap. vii.

District Commissioners from Time to Time to agree upon and determine the Quantity of Land to be exempted from such Taxes, and to vary such Quantity as they may think fit; and in case any Difference of Opinion shall at any Time arise between the said Trustees and the Commissioners thereon, the Matter in difference shall be referred to the Determination of some Person to be appointed by the Parties so differing, or in case they shall not agree upon such Appointment, then by the Chairman for the Time being of the Board of Guardians of the Poor Law Union comprising the Parishes of Feltwell; and the Award or Decision of such Referee in Writing shall be final and conclusive.

XII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Feltwell assess an Ad- Second District Commissioners from Time to Time, as often as they welf1 stU s*ia" annually to tax, charge, and assess upon all the Lands

Power to

XIII. 12° VICTORIA, Cap. vii.

directed or authorized to be imposed, or any Part thereof, with all proper Powers or Remedies for recovering and enforcing Payment thereof, to the Person who shall lend such Money, or some Person appointed by him, in like Manner as is herein or in the said recited Acts or either of them provided with respect to any Monies borrowed under the Provisions thereof, or of either of them.

XV. And be it enacted, That if the said Feltwell Second District Commissioners shall be able to borrow any Sum of Money at a lower Rate of Interest than any subsisting Securities given or made by them shall bear, it shall be lawful for them from Time to Time to borrow the same, as they shall think proper, on the Credit of all or any of the Taxes by the said recited Acts or this Act directed or authorized to be imposed on which such subsisting Securities shall be charged, but so that there shall not be more Money so borrowed than was at the Time owing on such Securities; and it is hereby declared, that the Money to be borrowed under the present Provision, and the Interest for the same, may be secured by an Assignment by the said Commissioners, or any Five of them, of the said Taxes, charged with such subsisting Securities or any Part or Parts thereof respectively, with all Powers and Remedies whatsoever for recovering and enforcing Payment thereof, in like Manner in all respects as is herein-before provided as to the said Sum of Eight thousand Pounds and the Interest thereof.

XVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Feltwell Second District Commissioners from Time to Time to borrow, at Interest, on the Credit of the Taxes hereby or by the said recited Acts or either of them directed or authorized to be levied by them, or of either of the said Taxes, or any Part or Parts thereof respectively, any Sum or Sums which they may think necessary to be raised for the Purpose of paying off any Sum or Sums which may have been previously borrowed under any of the Powers herein or in the said recited Acts or either of them contained (and all the Powers and Provisions herein-before or in the said recited Acts or either of them given and contained with respect to any Monies authorized to be borrowed shall apply to the Monies borrowed under this present Provision) : Provided always, that the Taxes hereby authorized to be imposed shall not be charged with any existing Mortgage Debt of the said Commissioners, nor shall the Taxes authorized to be imposed by the said recited Acts or either of them be charged with any future Mortgage Debt of the said Commissioners.

XVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners, if they shall think lit so to do, at any Time or Times to receive from any Person who may be desirous of advancing the same, the Amount of the Taxes, or any of them, to which any Land belonging to him may be liable to be assessed under the said recited Acts or this Act, for any Year or Number of Years, and to allow Discount for the same at such Rate, not exceeding Five Pounds per Centum per Annum, as may be agreed upon by the said Commissioners and the Person making such Payment, from the Time the same shall be made to the Time when the Taxes so paid in advance would be payable

XX. And be it enacted, That when and so soon as all the Mortgage Taxesautho- Debts of the said Commissioners now existing, and any Monies which raised'b ^ may be borrowed for discharging the same, shall be fully paid and recited Acts satisfied, the Power and Authority given by the said recited Acts or are to cease, either of them for charging and assessing the said Taxes thereby authorized to be imposed shall cease and determine.

What Maps,

XXI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Feltwell Surreys, &c. geconcj District Commissioners to adopt and make use of any existing ^carrying Surveys, Maps, and Plans, parochial or otherwise, of all or any Part into effect of the Lands or Grounds by this Act made liable to the Payment of Provisions of any Tax or Assessment; and the said Commissioners may, in their this Act. Discretion, from Time to Time order and direct all or any Part of such Lands or Grounds to be surveyed and mapped; and it shall be lawful for any Person employed on such Survey, Map, or Plan to enter on any taxable Lands or Grounds for that Purpose; and a Copy of or Extract from any Survey, Map, or Plan, so adopted or made use of, and also the said last-mentioned Survey or Map, when authenticated to the Satisfaction of the said Commissioners, and signed by any Five or more of them, shall be binding on the several Persons charged with the Payment of such Taxes and Assessments for their several Lands and Grounds, and shall be admitted in Evidence in all Courts whatsoever, in all Cases, Suits, and Actions touching anythin'’- done in pursuance of the said recited Acts and this Act, or either of them.

Power to

XXII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said reduce com- Feltwood Second District Commissioners, at any of their Meetings waywmd' to from Time to Time to order the common Droveways belonging'"to sell surplus the Commissioners within the said District, or any Parts thereof, to be Lands. reduced in Width to such an Extent as that no Part of such Drove-ways shall be less than Forty Feet wide, and thereupon to order all such Parts of the said Droveways as shall not be situate within the reduced Boundary thereof to be sold and absolutely disposed of, in

12° VICTORIA, Cap. vii.

such Portions and Parcels and in such Manner as to them, in their Discretion, shall appear most advantageous and expedient, and either by public Auction or private Contract; and it shall be lawful for any Five or more of the said Commissioners, from Time to Time, pursuant to an Order in that Behalf made at some Meeting of the said Commissioners, to sign, seal, and execute all necessary Agreements, Conveyances, and Assurances for conveying the Right, Title, and Interest of the said Commissioners in the said Portions of the said Droveways so sold to the respective Purchasers thereof; and all such Conveyances, Agreements, and Assurances shall be good, valid, and effectual to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever: Prtmded nevertheless, that no Order for Sale of any Part of the said Droveways shall at any Time be made by the said Commissioners unless Notice of the Intention of proposing the Sale thereof shall be stated in the Notices convening the Meeting at which such Proposal is intended to be taken into consideration; provided further, that previously to any such Sale the said Commissioners shall offer to the respective Owners of the Land adjoining the same such Portions of the Droveways so to be sold as may adjoin their respective Properties, at such Prices as the said Commissioners may think fit; and that it shall not be lawful for the said Commissioners to sell the same, either by private Contract or by public Auction, to any Person or Persons, at less Prices than the respective Proprietors of the adjoining Lands shall offer to give for the same, and for which they shall complete the Purchases thereof within a reasonable Time, to be fixed by the said Commissioners.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That the Chairman of the Court of Auditortobe Quarter Sessions for the Time being for the said County of Norfolk appointed, shall and he is hereby required from Time to Time to nominate some

fit and proper Person to be Auditor of the Accounts of the said Felt-well Second District Commissioners; and the Person so to be nominated shall on his Appointment make and sign, before One of Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace, a solemn Declaration that he will faithfully and impartially, according to the best of his Skill and Judgment, execute the Powers and Authorities reposed in him as Auditor by virtue of this Act; and the Auditor so appointed shall receive from the said Feltwell Second District Commissioners a reasonable Remuneration for his Time and Trouble, not exceeding Two Guineas for every Day he shall be fully employed on such Audit, and all such Expenses as he shall be put unto attending the auditing of such Accounts.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That the Auditor so nominated shall Auditor to attend, as soon as conveniently may be after the General Meetings of 'nsPect Ac-the Feltwell Second District Commissioners, at their Office, or at some inJed’isap-’ other convenient Place to be appointed by them, and from Time to proves of any Time shall, in the Presence of their Clerk, if he desire to be present, Part, may proceed to audit the Accounts of the Commissioners for the Half appeal Year preceding the said General Meeting; and the Commissioners to Quarter^ shall by their Clerk produce and lay before such Auditor the Accounts Sessions, allowed and passed at such General Meeting, together with proper Vouchers in support of the same, and all Books, Papers, and Writings

in their Custody or Power relating thereto; and any Person inte-[LocaF] P rested

5S 12° VICTORIA, Cap. vn.

rested in the said Account, either as a Creditor of the Commissioners or as a Tax-payer, may be present at the Audit of the said Accounts, by himself or his Agent, and may make any Objection to any Part of such Account; and if the said Accounts be found correct, such Auditor shall sign the same, in token of his Allowance thereof; but if such Auditor think there is just Cause to disapprove of any Part of the said Accounts, he, or any other Person interested in the said Accounts as aforesaid, may appeal against any such Parts of the said Accounts as shall be so disapproved of to One of the Two next Quarter Sessions for the County of Norfolk, Notice in Writing of sifth Appeal being given to the Clerk of the Commissioners Fourteen Days at the least before the Hearing of such Appeal.

Penalty on Omission.

Portion of Land described in 46G.3. c. 95. in Two Districts taken out of One District.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That the Feltwell Second District Commissioners shall every Year cause an annual Account in abstract to be prepared, showing the total Receipt and Expenditure of all Funds levied by them by virtue of this and the said recited Acts for some Year ending on a Day down to which their Accounts shall have been made up, under the several distinct Heads of Receipt and Expenditure, with a Statement of the Balance of such Account, duly audited and certified by the Chairman of the Commissioners and by the said Auditor, and shall send a Copy of the said Account, free of Charge, to the Clerk of the Peace for the County of Norfolk, on or before the Thirtieth Day of January in each Year, which Account shall be open to the Inspection of the Public at all reasonable Hours, on Payment of the Sum of One Shilling for every such Inspection; and if the Commissioners shall omit to prepare and transmit such Account as aforesaid they shall be liable for every such Omission to a Penalty of Twenty Pounds.

XXVII. And whereas by an Act passed in the Forty-sixth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Third, intituled An Act for more effectually draining and preserving certain Fen Lands lying in the South Level, Part of the Great Level of the Fens called Bedford Level, between Brandon River and Sam’s Cut Drain, it was enacted, that the said Act should be put in execution for more effectually draining and preserving the Fen Lands in that Part of the Great Level of the lens called the South Level lying and being in the several Parishes of Feltwell Saint Mary, Feltwell Saint Nicholas, Hock-wold-curn-Wilton, Metliwold, Helgay, and Southery, in the County of Norfolk, containing Seven thousand Acres or thereabouts, which Fen Lands were bounded as follows; that is to say, from the North Bank of Brandon River, about Iwo Furlongs below Redmoor House alone a certain Drain or Ditch called the Twelve Foot Drain to a decayed Sewer called S ake Load, and by the said Load to the Drain called Sam s Cut, and along the South Side of the said Drain to the East

5 Bank

59

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xii.

Bank of the River Ouse, and then along the said Bank to Brandon Creek's End, and from thence along the North Bank of Brandon River to the Twelve Foot Drain aforesaid: And whereas a certain triangular Portion of the last-mentioned Fen Lands, containing about Five hundred and fifty Acres, and bounded in part on the West by the said Twelve Foot Drain, and on the other Part by the Bank of the New Fen, or First District, on the North-east by Sam’s Cut, and on the South and South-west by Stake Load, also forms Part of the Fen Lands within the said Second District or Division which are authorized to be embanked and drained under the Provisions of the said recited Acts and this Act, and it is expedient that the said Portion of Land should be taken out of the Jurisdiction of the Commissioners for executing the said Act of the Forty-sixth Year of the Reign of His said Majesty : Be it therefore enacted, That the Portion of the said Fen Lands so described as aforesaid as being within such Two Boundaries or Jurisdictions shall from henceforth cease to be within or in any way subject to the Provisions of the said last-mentioned Act, or of the Commissioners for executing the same.

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses uf Expenses of and incidental to the obtaining and passing of this Act Act-

shall be paid by the said Feltwell Second District Commissioners out of any Money in their Hands, or out of the first Money they may receive, in preference to all other Payments whatsoever.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That all the Estates and Interests, Saving the Rights, Powers, Privileges, and Authorities whatsoever, which by virtue of any Act of Parliament or otherwise are now vested in the &c, of nej. Governor, Bailiffs, and Commonalty of the Company of Conservators ford Level, of the Great Level of the Fens called Bedford Level, shall be in the said Governor, Bailiffs, and Commonalty, and the Governor, Bailiffs, and Conservators, as fully as if this Act had not been passed.

XXX. Saving always to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, Her General Heirs and Successors, and all and every other Persons, Bodies Politic, ®aving‘ Collegiate, and Corporate, and their Heirs, Successors, Administrators,

or Assigns, all such Estates, Rights, and Interests not prejudicial to the said Drainage as they had and enjoyed of, in, to, or out of or in respect of the Lands, Grounds, and Premises hereby intended to be drained and improved before the passing of this Act, or could or might have had or enjoyed in case the same had not been passed.

[Public Act.]

XXXI. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.
