ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. viii.

An Act for lighting with Gas and supplying with Water the Town and Borough of Darlington and the Suburbs thereof in the County of Durham.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS certain Persons in the Year One thousand eight hundred and forty-six formed themselves into an Association or Company, under the Title of "The Darlington Gas Company," for the Purpose of manufacturing or making Gas, and therewith lighting the Streets, Houses, and other Places of the Parish of Darlington in the County of Durham, and the Parishes and Places adjoining or near thereto, and for other Purposes incident to such Manufacture: And whereas the Persons so associated have been since the Formation of such Company and now are engaged in the Manufacture or making of Gas, and in such lighting as aforesaid, so far as respects the Town and Borough of Darlington and the Suburbs thereof in the said Parish of Darlington; and it would be of great public Advantage if more effectual Powers were granted for such lighting, and for extending the Supply of Gas to other Parts of the said Suburbs : And whereas the said Town and Borough of Darlington and the Suburbs thereof are not at present sufficiently supplied with Water, and the making of Waterworks for effectually supplying the same would be [Loca/.] Q of

62

8 & 9 Vict, cc. 16. & 18. and 10 & 11 Vict. cc. 15. & 17. incorporated with this Act.

Interpretation of Act.

Town Commissioners.

[Short Title.]

l-imits of the Act.

Subscribers

incorporated.

12° VICTORIAE, Cap. xiii.

of great public Advantage: And whereas the several Persons hereinafter named, with others, are willing at their own Expense to carry into execution the Purposes aforesaid; but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the several Acts of Parliament following, that is to say, "The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," "The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," "The Gasworks Clauses Act, 1847," and "The Waterworks Clauses Act, 1847," shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act, except so far as the same several Acts or any of them, or any Part or Parts thereof respectively, are inconsistent with the Provisions of this Act or any of them, or are expressly varied or altered by this Act: Provided always, that nothing in " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," or this Act, contained, shall confer on the Company hereby incorporated Power to take Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments by Compulsion for the Purposes of supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Gas, or, for the Purpose of supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Water, to take any Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments except such as are mentioned in the Book of Reference deposited as herein-after mentioned.

II. And be it enacted, That in construing this Act and the several Acts incorporated herewith the Expression "the Undertaking" shall mean as well the Gasworks and Waterworks, and Works connected therewith respectively, by this Act authorized to be constructed, and each of them, as also the Gasworks and Works vested in the Undertakers by this Act; and the Expression "the Undertakers" shall mean the Company incorporated by this Act.

III. And be it enacted, That the Expression "Town Commissioners" shall mean the several Persons or Parties for the Time being having the Charge, Control, or Management of the Streets and Roads of the several Parishes and Places respectively within the Limits of this Act.

IV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression "The Darlington Gas and Waterworks Act, 1849."

V. And be it enacted, That the Limits of this Act shall be deemed and taken to extend to and shall comprise and include the whole of the Town and Borough of Darlington, and the several Places in the Suburbs thereof and adjacent" thereto, such Town, Borough, and Places comprising the several Parishes, Townships, and extra-parochial or other Places of Darlington, Darlington Bond gate otherwise Bondgate in Darlington, Darlington Borough Prebend Bow Pnestgate, Blackwell, Cockerton, Haughton, and I laughton-le- bkerne, all in the said County of Durham.

\ I. And be it enacted, That William Backhouse, John Church Backhouse, John Hardcastle Bowman, John Buckton, Joseph Forster,

John

63

12° VICTORIA, Cap.yiii

John Castell Hopkins, Francis Kipling, Alfred, Kitching, Michael Middleton, James Overend, John Sheilds Peacock, Edward Pease, John Pease, Joseph Pease, Henry Pease, Nathaniel Plews, William Robinson, Robert Thompson, William Thompson, and Christopher Wat kin, and all other Persons and Corporations who have already subscribed or shall hereafter subscribe to the Undertaking by this Act authorized, and their Executors, Administrators, Successors, and Assigns respectively, shall be and they are hereby united and incorporated into a Company for the Purpose of supplying with Gas and Water the Inhabitants, Buildings, and Lands within the Limits of this Act, and for other the Purposes herein and in the said recited Acts contained, under the Name of " The Darlington Gas and Water Company," and by that Name shall be a Body Corporate, with perpetual Succession, and shall and may sue and be sued, and shall have Power to purchase and hold Lands for the Purposes of the Undertaking, within the Restrictions and Provisions herein and in the said incorporated Acts contained.

VII. And be it enacted, That the Capital of the Company shall be Twenty-five thousand Pounds.

VIII. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shares into which the said Capital shall be divided shall be Two thousand, and the Amount of each Share shall be Twelve Pounds Ten Shillings.

IX. And be it enacted, That no Person shall at any Time hereafter hold more than One hundred Shares in the said Undertaking, otherwise than by Bequest, Marriage, or by virtue of the Statute of Distribution of Intestates Effects, or by original Allotment or Subscription : Provided always, that it shall not be lawful for any Person who may, by Bequest, Marriage, or by virtue of the Statute of Distribution of Intestates Effects, acquire or become possessed of a greater Number of Shares than One hundred, to continue to hold such greater Number of Shares for a Period exceeding Two Years from the Date of the Registration of such Shares in the Name of such Person; and if any Person shall continue to hold such greater Number of Shares beyond Two Years the Company may, if they think fit, sell such greater Number held by such Person by public Auction, and shall pay the Proceeds, deducting the Expense of such Sale, to such Person whose Shares shall be so sold, upon Demand; or if such Shares shall belong to an Infant, Lunatic, or Person under any legal Disability, the Proceeds of such Sale, after deducting the Expenses of Sale, shall be paid to the Guardian, Committee, or Trustees of such Person, as the Case may be, on Demand, or shall, in case the same shall exceed Two hundred Pounds, be paid into the Court of Chancery, for the Benefit of such Infant, Lunatic, or Person under legal Disability, and may be invested, disposed of, or applied for the Benefit of such Infant, Lunatic, or Person under Disability in such Manner as the said Court of Chancery shall think fit.

X. And be it enacted, That One Pound per Share shall be the greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make

upon

Shares.

Limiting Number of Shares to be held.

upon the Shareholders, and that Two Months at the least shall intervene between the making of any Two successive Calls.

XI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond any Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Eight thousand three hundred and thirty-three Pounds; but no Part of such Sum shall be raised until the whole of the said Capital or Sum of Twenty-five thousand Pounds shall have been subscribed for, and One Half thereof shall have been actually paid up.

Number and

XII. And be it enacted, That (subject to the Provisions herein Qualification contained for increasing or reducing the Number of Directors) the of Directors. Number of Directors shall be Nine, and the Qualification of a Director shall be the Possession in his own Right of Ten Shares in the Undertaking.

Power to vary the Number of Directors.

XIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time to increase the Number of Directors, and from Time to Time to reduce such Number; but the whole Number of Directors after such an Increase or Reduction as aforesaid shall not be greater than Twelve nor less than Nine.

First Di-

XIV. And be it enacted, That the said John Hardcastle Bowman, rectors. John Buckton, John Castell Hopkins, Francis Kipling, Michael Middleton, James Overend, John Pease, Henry Pease, and Robert Thompson, shall be the first Directors of the Company.

Quorum of Directors.

XV. And be it enacted, That a Quorum of a Meeting of Directors shall be Five.

Committees

XVI. And be it enacted, That the Number of Directors of which of Directors. Qommjttees appointed by the Directors shall consist shall not be less than Three nor more than Five, and the Quorum of such Committee shall be Two.

Quorum of Meetings.

Scale of voting.

Appointment of Auditors.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Quorum for every Meeting of the Company shall be Ten Shareholders holding in the aggregate not less than Two thousand Pounds in the Capital of the Company.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That the Scale according to which the Shareholders may vote in respect to their Shares shall be as follows; (that is to say,) for One Share or more, but not exceeding Twenty, One Vote in respect of each Share, and for more than Twenty Shares an additional Vote for every Three Shares.

XIX. And be it enacted, That the Number of Auditors shall be Two, and that the said William Thompson and William Robinson shall be the first Auditors of the Company.

Qualification

XX. And be it enacted, That no Person shall be capable of being of Auditors. an Auditor unless he be a Shareholder possessed in his own Rmht of not less than Ten Shares in the Undertaking.

XXI. And be it enacted, That the Secretary of the Company Appoint-shall from Time to Time be appointed by the Directors, and the ™e"t ofr Amount of his Salary or Remuneration shall be fixed and deter- ‘ '' mined by them.

XXII. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Restrictions and Declaration Limitations in the said Gasworks Clauses Act, 1847, and the said Dividends. Waterworks Clauses Act, 1847, contained as to the maximum Amount of Profits to be divided among the Undertakers by way

of Dividend in any Year, the Amount of Dividend to be from Time to Time declared and divided shall be fixed and determined by the Directors.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That the Newspaper or Newspapers Newspaper in which Advertisements relating to the Affairs of the Company are for Insertion to be inserted shall be some Newspaper or Newspapers printed within °isemev®,r* the said Town of Darlington, and if no Newspaper shall be printed

within the said Town, then in some Newspaper or Newspapers usually circulated within the same Town.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Com- Power to pany to agree with the Owners of any Lands or Buildings which purchase they may think requisite or proper for the Purpose of making or supplying Gas within the Limits of this Act for the absolute Purchase for a Consideration in Money, or for a Lease on such Terms as may be agreed on, of any such Lands or Buildings, or such Part thereof as they shall think proper; and that it shall be lawful for all or any of the Parties who by the said " Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," are empowered to sell and convey or release, to agree for and execute any such Lease as aforesaid : Provided always, that the Consideration for any Lease which shall be granted of any such Lands in which any Person under Disability shall be interested shall be the best yearly Rent, payable half-yearly or oftener, that can be reasonably obtained, without taking any Money by way of Fine or Premium : Provided also, that where any Lands or Buildings shall be taken on Lease by virtue of this Act the Company shall afterwards have Power to purchase the Reversion of such Lands, or the Discharge thereof from the Rents and Covenants reserved and payable in and by such Lease.

XXV. And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act all Main Pipes and other Pipes and Works laid down or placed in the several Streets, Roads, Ways, Lanes, and other public Passages and Places within the Limits of this Act, and belonging to the said Company called " The Darlington Gas Company," and all Retorts, Purifiers, Gasholders, Receivers, Cisterns, Engines, Machines, Pipes, Posts, Lamp Irons, Lamps, Lands, Tenements, Erections, Buildings, Matters, and Things, Monies, Stocks, Funds, and Securities, the Property of or belonging or due to or vested in the said Company called "The Darlington Gas Company," or any Trustee or Trustees on their Behalf, and all Leases vested in the same Company, or such Trustee or Trustees as aforesaid, at the Time of the passing of this Act, and all the Rights, Privileges, Powers, and [Local.] R Authorities

Vesting present Gas Works and other Property in the Company hereby incorporated.

(56 12° VICTORIA, Cap. xHi.

Authorities relating to the said Darlington Gas Company, or any of them, given to or vested in the said Darlington Gas Company, shall (subject to the existing Debts, Liabilities, Engagements, Contracts, Obligations, and Incumbrances respectively affecting the same,) be and be held to be and the same are hereby vested in the said Darlington Gas and Water Company hereby incorporated, and may be lawfully held, used, exercised, and enjoyed, by and in the Name of the Darlington Gas and Water Company, in the same Manner and to the same Extent as the said Darlington Gas Company could have held, used, exercised, and enjoyed the same in the Name of the said Darlington Gas Company, or in the Name or Names of any Person or Persons in trust for such Company or for their Benefit, if this Act had not been passed, (save only so far as the Use, Exercise, and Enjoyment of such Rights, Powers, Authorities, and Privileges may be inconsistent with the Provisions and Purposes of this Act, or the said Acts hereby incorporated therewith, or any of them); and from and after the passing of this Act the said Darlington Gas Company shall be and the same is hereby dissolved.

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That all and every Purchase, Sale,

Ca 'cfm" Conveyance, Surrender, Grant, Lease, Agreement, Security, Right, pany binding Liability, Privilege, Act, Matter, or Thing whatsoever, already made, on Company done, acknowledged, executed, granted, incurred, obtained, transacted, hereby in- commenced, or instituted by, to, for, or on behalf of, against, or in < orporated. respect of the said Darlington Gas Company shall (subject to the Provisions in this Act contained) be and the same are hereby declared to be as good, valid, and effectual, and of the same Condition and Quality, to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever, by, to, for, on behalf of, against, 01 in lespect of the Company hereby incorporated, as they respectively 5 were

12° VICTORIA, Cap. viii.

were immediately before the passing of this Act with reference to the said Darlington Gas Company, and shall and may (subject as aforesaid) be executed, done, performed, continued, completed, and terminated by, to, for, on behalf of, against, or with respect to the Company hereby incorporated, as fully and effectually as the same could or might have been by and in the Name of the Darlington Gas Company, or by or in the Name or Names of any Person or Persons in trust for or for the Benefit of the Darlington Gas Company, if this Act had not passed.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That every Person or Corporation who immediately before the passing of this Act was the Proprietor of One or more Shares in the said Darlington Gas Company upon which the Sum of Eight Pounds had been paid shall be entitled to a like Number of Shares of the nominal Value of Twelve Pounds Ten Shillings each in the Capital or Joint Stock of the Company hereby incorporated, which Shares shall be deemed to have been subscribed for, and upon which the whole Amount or Value thereof shall for all Purposes whatsoever be deemed to have been fully paid up, and every such Person or Corporation shall stand and be possessed of every such Share upon the same Trusts and for the same Purposes, and under and subject to the same Powers and Provisions respectively, subject nevertheless to the Provisions of this Act, as the Shares in the said Darlington Gas Company in lieu of which the Shares in the Capital or Joint Stock of the Company hereby incorporated are given as aforesaid were immediately before the passing of this Act held upon and subject or liable to, and so as to give Effect to and not to revoke any Will or other testamentary Disposition made previous to the passing of this Act: Provided always, that every such Person or Corporation who shall at the Time of the passing of this Act have paid up a larger Sum than Eight Pounds per Share in respect of his Share or Shares in the Darlington Gas Company shall be deemed a Creditor of the Company hereby incorporated for the extra Amount so paid.

XXX. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this and the said incorporated Acts contained, it shall be lawful for the Company to continue the existing Gasworks, and from Time to Time to construct and maintain such other Gasworks and Apparatus, and such Buildings, with Approaches thereto, upon the Lands belonging to the Company, or hereby authorized to be purchased by them by Agreement, and to do all such other Acts as they shall think necessary for supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Gas, and to supply such Gas upon such Terms as shall be agreed upon between the Company and the Persons supplied therewith, and to sell and dispose of the Coke and other Residuum arising from the Materials used in the Manufacture of Gas, and also to manufacture Coke from Coal not used in the Manufacture of Gas, and to sell the same.

XXXI. And be it enacted, That the maximum Charge for Gas to be supplied by the Company within the Limits of this Act shall not exceed the Sum of Six Shillings per Thousand Cubic Feet.

Penalties imposed by this Act not cumulative.

XXXIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That no Penalty or Forfeiture imposed by the said incorporated Acts, or any of them, for or in respect of the same Act or Default of the Company shall be cumulative on any Penalty or Forfeiture imposed for or in respect of the same Act or Default by any other Act of Parliament, but it shall be lawful for the Company, or for any Person entitled to proceed for any such Penalty or Forfeiture, to elect to proceed under such last-mentioned Act or any of the said incorporated Acts.

XXXVI. And be it enacted, That the Persons empowered by the grant Leases, said Lands Clauses Consolidation Act to convey Lands shall have full Power to grant Leases of any Lands for the Purposes of this Act, or any Easement, Power, or Authority in or over such Lands.

XXXVII. And be it enacted, That all Leases of Land to be taken on Lease by virtue of the Powers or Provisions of this or the

Form of Lease.

69

12° VICTORIAE, Cap. viii.

the incorporated Acts may be according to the Form in Schedule (A.) to this Act annexed, or as near thereto as the Circumstances of the Case will admit.

XXXVIII. And be it enacted, That the Waterworks shall be completed within Five Years from the passing of this Act, and on the Expiration of such Period the Powers by this or the said incorporated Acts granted to the Company for executing such Works, or otherwise in relation thereto, shall cease to be exercised, except as to so much of the said Waterworks as shall then be completed : Provided always, that nothing in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend so as to restrain the Company from extending their Mains and Pipes from Time to Time whenever it shall be necessary for the Purpose of supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Water.

XXXIX. And be it enacted, That the Company shall, at the Request of the Owner or Occupier of any House or Part of a House in any Street in which any Pipe of the Company shall be laid, or of any Person who, under the Provisions of this Act or any Act incorporated herewith, shall be entitled to demand a Supply of Water for domestic Purposes, furnish to such Owner or Occupier or other Person a sufficient Supply of Water for then-domestic Uses at the Rates herein-after specified"; (that is to say,)

If there be no Watercloset or Bath in the Dwelling House to be supplied with Water, then at the following Rates:

Where the annual Value of such House shall not amount to Ten Pounds, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Seven Pounds Ten Shillings:

Where the annual Aralue of such Dwelling House shall be Ten Pounds and under Twenty Pounds, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Seven Pounds:

Where the annual Value of such Dwelling House shall be Twenty Pounds and under Forty Pounds, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Six Pounds Ten Shillings: Where the annual Value of such Dwelling House shall be Forty Pounds and upwards, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Six Pounds:

If there be a Watercloset or Waterclosets, or a private Bath or Baths, in such Dwelling House, then, in addition to the Rates above specified, the following Rates shall be payable; (that is to say,)

Where the annual Value of such Dwelling House shall not amount to Ten Pounds per Annum, the Sum of Four Shillings for each such Watercloset and Four Shillings for each such Bath:

Where the annual Value of such Dwelling House shall be Ten Pounds and under Twenty Pounds, the Sum of Six Shillings for each such Watercloset and Six Shillings for each such Bath:

Where the annual Value of such Dwelling House shall be Twenty Pounds and under Forty Pounds, the Sum of Eight [Local] S Shillings

Period within which Waterworks are to be completed

Rate at which Water is to be supplied for domestic Purposes.

Where no Watercloset.

If there be a Water-closet.

70 12° VICTORIAE, Cap. Vm.

Shillings for each such Watercloset and Eight Shillings for each such Bath:

Where the annual Value of such Dwelling House shall be Forty Pounds and upwards, the Sum of Ten Shillings for each such Watercloset and Ten Shillings for each such Bath:

Provided always, that the Company shall not be compelled to supply any Watercloset or Bath, or the Apparatus or Pipes connected therewith, unless the same shall be so constructed and used as to prevent the Waste or undue Consumption of the Water of the Company, and the Return of foul Air and other noisome or impure Matter into the Mains or other Pipes belonging to or connected with the Mains or Pipes of the Company.

What shall

XL. And be it enacted, That a Supply of Water for domestic be domestic Purposes shall not include a Supply of Water for Horses or Cattle, Purposes. or washing Carriages, or for any Trade, Manufacture, or Business whatsoever, or for watering Gardens, or for Fountains, or for any ornamental Purposes whatsoever.

Power to

XLI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Corn-lease the Gas pany to lease the whole or any of the Gas Rates or Rents and Water Rates or Rents payable to the Company by virtue of this Act or otherwise, to any Person or Persons, for any Term not exceeding Three Years, and upon such Rents, Covenants, and Conditions as the Company shall think fit: Provided always, that no such Lease shall defeat or abridge the Power by the said Waterworks Clauses Act given to the Court of Quarter Sessions of directing the Reduction of the Rates, and the Company shall reduce the Rates in the same Manner as they would have done in case no Lease had been granted.

XLII. And with respect to the Supply of Water in pursuance of the Thirty-fifth Section of the Waterworks Clauses Act, 1847, be it enacted, That the Water so to be supplied need not be constantly laid on under a Pressure greater than that to be afforded from the Service Reservoir by this Act authorized to be constructed.

XLIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to supply any Person with Water for other than domestic Purposes for iU1 sucl» Remuneration and upon such Terms and Conditions as shall be

he supplied agreed upon between the Company and the Persons desirous of having by Agree- such Supply of Water, ment.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. ix.

An Act for enabling the Nottingham Gaslight and Coke Company to raise a further Sum of Money, and for amending some of the Provisions of the Act relating to such Company.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Fiftli and Sixth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for granting more ef- 5 fectual Poivers for lighting with Gas the Town of Nottingham, and c several Parishes and Places adjacent thereto, whereby certain Persons were incorporated by the Name of " The Nottingham Gaslight and Coke Company," and were empowered to light with Gas the District included within the Limits of the said Act, and were empowered to raise the Sum of Forty thousand Pounds by Shares, and the Sum of Thirteen thousand Pounds by Mortgage, or by the Creation of new Shares : And whereas the said Company have proceeded to carry the Powers of the said Act into execution, and have raised the said Capital of Forty thousand Pounds, and nearly the whole of the said Sunt of Thirteen thousand Pounds, and have expended the same, and large Sums of Money in addition thereto, for the Purposes of the recited Act: And whereas, by virtue of an Act passed in the Session [Local.] T of

& 6 Vict. . 13.

74

8 & 9 Vict, c. 7. (Priv.)

Powers of recited Act extended to this Act, except as hereby altered.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. ix.

of Parliament held in the Eighth and Ninth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for inclosing Lands in the Parish of Saint Mary in the Town and County of the Town of Nottingham, various Streets and Roads are being laid out, and additional Works, Mains, Pipes, and other Works will be required for the Purpose of lighting such Streets and Roads, and the Buildings which may be erected therein, and otherwise in satisfying the increasing Demands and Requirements of the Inhabitants within the Limits of the said firstly-recited Act: And whereas the Capital which the Company are authorized to raise under the Powers of the said firstly-recited Act is insufficient for the Purposes aforesaid : And whereas some of the Provisions of the firstly-recited Act are defective and inconvenient, and it is expedient that the same should be altered, amended, and enlarged; but the Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in the said firstly-recited Act and now remaining in force, (except such of them as are repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, or are inconsistent with the Provisions of this Act,) shall extend to this Act, and shall be in force in respect to the Objects and Purposes of this Act as fully and effectually to all Intents and Purposes as if such Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act with express Reference to the Objects and Purposes thereof; and the said firstly-recited Act and this Act shall, as to all Matters and Things whatsoever, (except as aforesaid,) be read and construed together as One Act.

Augments-

II. And whereas the present Share Capital of the Company is tion of Capi- Porty-two thousand five hundred Pounds, consisting of the Sum of Forty thousand Pounds authorized to be raised by the said firstly-recited Act, and of the further Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds arising from the Conversion of Loans into Capital, under or by virtue of the Provisions in such Act contained: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time, by an Order of any Ordinary or Extraordinary Meeting thereof, to raise by the Creation of new Shares, in addition to the said Sums which they have raised by Shares, and also in addition to any Sum which they have raised or may hereafter raise upon Mortgage or Loan under and by virtue of the said firstly-recited Act or this Act, any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the further Sum of Forty-two thousand five hundred Pounds.

New Shares to be considered same as original Shares.

III. And be it enacted, That the Capital so to be raised by the Creation of new Shares shall be considered as Part of the general Capital of the Company, and shall be divided into Shares of such nominal Value as the Committee of the Company shall determine, and such new Capital and new Shares shall be subject to the same Provisions in all respects, whether with reference to the Payment of Calls, or the Forfeiture of Shares on Nonpayment of Calls, (in case the whole Amount of such Shares shall not be payable at one Time,) or to

the

75

12° VICTORIA, Cap. ix.

the Limitation of Dividends, or otherwise, as if such Capital had been Part of the original Capital, except as to the Times of mating Calls for such additional Capital, and the Amount of such Calls, which respectively it shall be lawful for the Committee of the Company from Time to Time to fix as they shall think fit.

IV. And be it enacted, That the Committee of the Company shall cause such new Shares, when and as the same shall from Time to Time be issued, to be sold by public Auction, in such Manner and at such Times, and subject to such Conditions, as the said Committee may from Time to Time determine.

V. And be it enacted, That the Intention to sell the said Shares by Auction shall be duly advertised, for Two successive Weeks, in Two or more Newspapers published in the Town of Nottingham; and any Sum of Money which shall arise upon such Sales by way of Premium shall form Part of the said Sum of Forty-two thousand five hundred Pounds hereby authorized to be raised, and shall be expended in paying the Expenses of this Act, or in extending or improving the Works of the Company, or in paying off’ Money borrowed by the Company, under the Powers of this Act, or the firstly-recited Act, and shall not be considered as Part of the Capital of the Company entitled to Dividend.

VI. And be it enacted, That every Person who shall become entitled to any new Share to be created under this Act shall in respect of the same Share he a Shareholder in the Undertaking, and shall be entitled to a Share of the Dividends of the Company in the Proportion which the Amount paid up on such new Shares shall, exclusive of any Premium, bear to the aggregate Amount of the paid-up Capital of the Company for the Time being in respect whereof such Dividends shall be payable; and such new Shares shall also confer on the respective Shareholders or Proprietors thereof Rights of voting and Qualifications in proportion to the Amount paid up on such new Shares, exclusive of any Premium, and not in proportion to the Number thereof; and for such Purposes every entire Sum of Twenty-five Pounds of such Amount so paid up shall be considered as equivalent to One Share of Twenty-five Pounds under the said firstly-recited Act, and no Shareholder shall vote in respect of any Number of such new Shares which shall constitute a less Interest in the Capital of the Company than Twenty-five Pounds.

VII. And be it enacted, That so much of the firstly-recited Act as provides that no Person should at any Time thereafter hold more in the said Undertaking than such Number of original Shares as should be equal in nominal Value to Ten original Shares of Fifty Pounds each, and such Number of new additional Shares as should be equal in nominal Value to Ten Shares of Fifty Pounds each, otherwise than by Devise or by virtue of the Statute of Distribution of Intestates Effects, shall be and the same is hereby repealed.

VIII. And whereas the Company were authorized by the firstly-recited Act to raise or continue certain Sum or Sums of Money,

amounting

New Shares to be sold by Auction.

Sales by Auction to be advertised.

Rights of new Shareholders to be in proportion to the Value of new Shares.

So much of firstly-recited Act as to Limit of Shares repealed.

Power to borrow additional Money

on Mortgage-

ing-

Mortgages and Bonds.

Rights of Mortgagees.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. ix.

amounting together to the Sum of Thirteen thousand Pounds, on Mortgage or Bond, or by the Creation of new Shares, and the Company have raised a Portion of such Sum by the Sale of Shares, in pursuance of the Provisions contained in the firstly-recited Act, and it is expedient to enable the Company to raise a further Sum of Money by Mortgage or Bond: Be it enacted, That when and so soon as One Half of the entire Capital of the Company shall have been paid up, it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond (in addition to such Sum or Sums of Money so authorized to he raised by Mortgage or Bond by virtue of the firstly-recited Act, and also in addition to the Capital raised or authorized to be raised by Shares by die said firstly-recited Act, and by this Act,) such further Sum or Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be authorized to be borrowed by an Order of an Ordinary or Extraordinary Meeting of the Company, not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Twelve thousand Pounds; and for securing the Repayment of the Money so borrowed, with Interest, to mortgage the Rents and Profits of the Undertaking, or the future Calls on the Shareholders of the Company, or to give Bonds, in manner herein-after mentioned : Provided always, that the Amount due and owing upon Mortgage or Bond at any one Time shall not exceed One Third of the Share Capital for the Time being actually subscribed for and issued.

IX. And be it enacted, That if after having borrowed any Part of the Money authorized to be borrowed on Mortgage or Bond by virtue of the firstly-recited Act and this Act, or either of them, the Company pay off the same, it shall be lawful for them again to borrow the Amount so paid off, and so from Time to Time; but such Power of re-borrowing shall not be exercised without the Authority of an Ordinary or Extraordinary Meeting of the Company, unless the Money be so re-borrowed in order to pay off any existing Mortgage or Bond.

X. And be it enacted, That every Mortgage and Bond for securing Money borrowed by the Company shall be by Deed, under the Common Seal of the Company, duly stamped, and wherein the Consideration shall be truly stated; and every such Mortgage, Deed, or Bond may be according to the Forms set forth in the Schedule (C.) or (D.) annexed to the said firstly-recited Act, or with such Variation in such Forms as the Circumstances of the Case may require.

XI. And be it enacted, That all Mortgages and Bonds already granted or continued under or by virtue of the Powers of the said firstly-recited Act shall have Priority over the Mortgages and Bonds by this Act authorized to be given.

XII. And be it enacted, That (subject as aforesaid to the Rights of existing Mortgagees and Bondholders) the respective Mort<ui"ees shall be entitled one with another to their respective Proportion's of the Rents, Sums, and I remises comprised in such Mortgages according to the respective Sums in such Mortgages mentioned to be advanced by such Mortgagees respectively, and to be repaid the Sums so advanced, with Interest, without any Preference one above another, or above the Bond Creditors of the Company, by reason of the

Priority

12° VICTORIA, Cap. ix.

Priority of the Date of any such Mortgage, or of the Meeting at which the same was authorized, or on any other Account whatsoever.

XIII. And be it enacted, That (subject as aforesaid to the Rights of existing Mortgagees and Bondholders) the respective Obligees in the Bonds granted by virtue of this Act shall proportionably, according to the Amount of the Monies secured thereby, be entitled to be paid, out of the said Rents, Sums, and Premises, the respective Sums in such Bonds mentioned, and thereby intended to be secured, without any Preference one above another, or above the said Mortgagees under this Act, by reason of Priority of Date of any such Bond, or of the Meeting at which the same was authorized, or otherwise howsoever.

XIV. And be it enacted, That every Transfer of any Mortgage or Bond shall be by Deed duly stamped, wherein the Consideration shall be truly stated.

XV. And be it enacted, That the Provisions contained in the said firstly-recited Act relating to the Registry of Mortgages and Bonds, the Transfer of Mortgages and Bonds, and the Registry of such Transfers, the Payment of the Interest, and the Repayment of Principal, the Appointment of a Receiver, and the Power to convert Loan into Capital, shall extend and be applicable to the Mortgages and Bonds by this Act authorized to be granted: Provided always, that the Provisions of this Act with reference to Sales of Shares by Auction, and the Application of Premiums, shall also be applicable to any Shares to be created for the Conversion of Loan into Capital by virtue of this Act.

XVI. And whereas it was by the recited Act enacted, that if the clear Profits of the said Undertaking, after Payment of all Costs, Charges, and Expenses, should in any Year amount to a larger Sum than should be sufficient to make Distribution amongst the Proprietors of the Company of the Dividends thereby authorized to be paid in respect of each Share in the said Undertaking, the Excess beyond the Sum which might be necessary for the Purposes aforesaid should accumulate until the Fund so formed should amount to the Sum of Four thousand Pounds, which Sum should form a contingent or reserved Fund to answer any Deficiency which might at any Time happen in the Amount of divisible Profits of the Company, or to meet any extraordinary Claim or Demand which might at any Time arise against the Company, or for the further Improvement of their Works; and it was also enacted, that when and so soon as such Fund should, by Accumulation or otherwise, amount to the Sum of Four thousand Pounds, an Account of the said contingent Fund, and of the Receipts, Expenditure, and Profits of the Company, should be laid before the Justices assembled at the Quarter Sessions of the Peace for the Town and County of the Town of Nottingham, and be filed with the Clerk of the Peace of the said Town and County, and if it should thereupon appear to such Justices that the Profits of the Company for the preceding Year should have exceeded the Sum therein-1 efore authorized to be divided amongst the several Proprietors

Rights of Obligees.

Transfers to be stamped.

Provisions in recited Act as to Mortgages and Bond extended to this Act.

So much of recited Act as relates to contingent Fund repealed.

Certain Clauses in Gas Clauses Act incorporated with this Act.

Regulating Supply of Gas, and Price for public Lamps.

So much of firstly-recited Act as to Hire of Meters repealed.

Power to Company to let Meters and Fittings.

So much of firstly-recited Act

12° VICTORIA, Cap. ix.

of Shares in the said Undertaking the Company should make such a rateable Reduction in the Rents and Prices of Gas to be furnished by the Company for the then current Year as the Company might deem prudent, or as in the Judgment of the Justices should be proper, until by the Expenditure and Payments of the Company the contingent Fund should be reduced below the said Sum of Four thousand Pounds, when the Price of the Gas might, if necessary, be again raised, and so from Time to Time as often as such Event should happen : And whereas it is expedient that the said Enactments should be repealed, and other Provisions made in lieu thereof: Re it enacted, That on and after the First Day of July One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine the said Enactments shall be and the same are hereby repealed.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Clauses contained in the Gas Works Clauses Act, 1847, with respect to the Amount of Profit to be received by the Undertakers when the Gas Works are carried on for their Benefit, shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act, and shall take effect on and after the said First Day of July One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That from and after the Expiration of any existing Contract for the Supply of Gas to any public Lamps within the Limits of this Act, the Company shall afford such Supply from any Main situate within Twenty-five Yards of any such Lamp, at a Price equal to the lowest Price charged for the Time being by the Company to any private Consumer.

XIX. And be it enacted, That so much of the said firstly-recited Act as enacts that it should be lawful for the Company to lend any Meter for ascertaining the Quantity of Gas consumed or supplied for such Remuneration in Money as should be agreed upon, and such Remuneration should be recoverable in the same Manner as Rents due to the Company, and such Meter or Meters should not be subject to the Rights of Distress of the Landlords of the Premises where such might be used for Rent, nor for any Lien or Pledge known in the Law of England, any Law or Practice to the contrary notwithstanding, shall be and the same is hereby repealed.

XX. And be it enacted, That the Company may let for Hire any Meter for ascertaining the Quantity of Gas consumed or supplied, and any Fittings for the Gas, for such Remuneration in Money as shall be agreed upon between the Company and any Person to whom the same may be so let; and such Remuneration shall be recoverable in the same Manner as the Rents or Sums due to the Company for Gas; and such Meters and Fittings shall not be subject to Distress tor Rent of the Premises where the same may be used, nor to be taken in^ execution under any Process of a Court of Law or Equity, or any Fiat in Bankruptcy against the Person in whose Possession the same may be.

XXI. And be it enacted, That so much of the firstly-recited Act as enacts that it should be lawful for the Officer duly appointed" for

6 the

the Purpose by the Company to inspect every Building and Place as to Penalty lighted with Gas supplied by the Company, and if in any such Building or Place any Meter for ascertaining the Quantity of Gas repealed, consumed or supplied should be fraudulently altered the Person making use of such Meter which should be so altered should for every such Offence forfeit and pay to the Company a Penalty not exceeding Ten Pounds, shall be and the same is hereby repealed.

XXII. XXIV. And be it enacted, That the Recorder of the Borough of Inspection Nottingham shall appoint an Inspector of Meters, which he is hereby of Meters, authorized to do; and such Inspector shall have at all Times, on the Application and at the Expense of any Consumer of Gas supplied by the Company, a Right to inspect the Meters erected by the said Company in the Premises of the Person making such Request, after giving Forty-eight Hours Notice of such intended Inspection to the said Company or their Clerk.

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of applying for, obtaining, and passing this Act, and preparatory thereto, shall be paid out of the Funds of the Company in preference to all other Payments whatsoever.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. x.

An Act for more effectually assessing and collecting the Poor Rate and all other Rates and Assessments in the Parish of Epsom in the County of Surrey, and for the better Management of the Business and Affairs of the said Parish; and for other Purposes relating thereto.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS the Parish of Epsom in the County of Surrey is large and populous, and the Poor belonging thereto are numerous, and supported at a great Expense, and the Laws now in force for assessing, collecting, and levying Monies for the Relief of the Poor and other Purposes in the said Parish are found to be inconvenient and ineffectual, and the several Rates and Assessments made in the said Parish are in many Cases evaded and rendered unproductive; and there are within the said Parish divers small Tenements which are either let to occasional Occupiers or in separate Apartments, or to Persons who quit their Residences, or become insolvent, and the Rates imposed thereon for the Relief of the Poor and for other Purposes cannot be collected, by means whereof the Owners and Occupiers of other Property in the said [Zoca/.] X Parish

82

Owners of Property not exceeding annual Value of 10/., ascertained according to 6 & 7 W. 4. c. 96., to be rated instead of Occupiers.

Owners may compound for Rates.

Meetings to be held for compounding, and Notice to be given.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. x.

Parish are made to bear more than their fair Proportion of the parochial Burdens; and it is therefore expedient that better Provisions should be granted for managing the Affairs of the said Parish, for rating of such Tenements, and for the Collection of such Rates; but the Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That after the passing of this Act the Owner of every Tenement within the said Parish of Epsom, the rateable annual Value whereof shall not exceed Ten Pounds, from Time to Time to be ascertained according to the Provisions of an Act passed in the Sixth and Seventh Years of the Reign of His late Majesty King William the Fourth, intituled An Act to regulate Parochial Assessments, or which shall be let to weekly or monthly Tenants, or shall be let furnished or in lodgings or in separate Apartments, or at Rents payable or collected at any shorter Period than Three Months, shall be hereafter rated and assessed to the Rates for the Relief of the Poor, for the Repairs and Services of the Church, for the Repairs of the Highways, for lighting, watching, and cleansing, and every other parochial, local, district, and other Rate within the said Parish, in respect of such Tenement, instead of the actual Occupier thereof.

II. And be it enacted, That in all Cases where any Owner shall have been or shall be liable to be rated in pursuance of this Act in respect of any such Tenement as aforesaid, it shall be lawful for such Owner to give Notice to the Officers authorized to make or collect any such Rate, of his Intention to compound for the same by Payment of a reduced Rate, whether such Tenement be occupied or not, and that in every such Case every such Owner shall thenceforth, until he shall give like Notice for determining such Composition, be liable to pay Two Thirds of such Rate only, and all such Compositions shall be entered in the Rate Books of such Officers, and such Owners shall be thenceforth rated accordingly.

III. And be it enacted, That the said Officers respectively shall, once at least in every Year, hold, at some convenient Time anil Place within the said Parish, a Meeting for the Purpose of entering into such Compositions with such Owners as aforesaid, and of the Time and Place of every such Meeting shall respectively give or cause to be given Seven clear Days Notice, in the same Manner as Notices of Vestry Meetings are now by Law required to be given, and that the first yearly Meeting for entering into Compositions for the said Rates respectively shall be held within Fourteen Days after the Publication of the first of such Rates respectively made after the passing of this Act, and that every such Meeting in all future Years shall be held within Fourteen Days after the Publication of the first of such Rates respectively which shall be so made next after the Twenty-fifth Day of March in every Year, and that every Notice of such Meeting'respectively shall be signed by the Officers or a Majority of the Officers convening the same.

12" VICTORIA, x. 83

IV. And be it enacted, That upon Nonpayment of any Rate, or Recovery of any Compositions for any Rate, by such Owner as shall be liable of Rates or to the Payment thereof, the same, together with the Costs and Charges of recovering and levying the same, shall and may be levied Action.1 upon and recovered from him, and his Goods and Chattels, wherever

the same may be found, in like Manner as Rates within the said Parish may by Law be levied and recovered upon and from the Occupier, or the same may be recovered from such Owner by Action of Debt, at the Suit of the Party authorized to make or recover such Rate, with Costs, in any Court of Law having competent Jurisdiction.

V. And be it enacted, That in any such Action or other Proceed- How Action ing it shall be sufficient to sue by the Name of the Officer respectively Jnay be authorized to make or collect the Rate, and whether the same shall brou6lt-have become due during his own Tenure of Office or that of any of his Predecessors, and without specifying the Name of such respective Officer for the Time being, and no such Action or other Proceeding shall abate or be discontinued by the Death, Removal, or Retirement of such Plaintiff in such Action or Proceeding.

VI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That before any such Notice of Action shall be commenced a Notice signed by the Person or Persons Action to be intending to bring such Action, or by his or their Attorney, shall be 81ven' sent by Post to, or left at the Dwelling House or last known Place of Abode of, the Person so made liable to the said Rates or Compositions, or if his Dwelling House or last known Place of Abode cannot be discovered, then such Notice shall be left at or upon the Premises in respect of which he shall be assessed to the Rate, which said Notice shall state that certain Rates or certain Compositions for Rates (describing them) are due from such Person, and that, at the Expiration of Fourteen Days from the posting or delivery of the said Notice an Action at Law will be commenced for the Recovery of such Rates or for such Compositions (as the Case may be), unless the same shall in the meantime be discharged : Provided also, that no such Action shall be commenced under the Authority of this Act after the Expiration of Eighteen Calendar Months from the Time when such Rate or Compositions (as the Case may be) shall have become due.

VII. And in order to prevent Disputes touching the Designation Personsre-of the Parties intended to be made liable by this Act to the Payment reiving

of Rates as Owners, be it enacted, That the Person actually receiving ^e"ts to the Rent of any Tenement from the Tenant or Occupier thereof, the Owner-. whether for his own Benefit as the Owner, or as Trustee, Agent, or Receiver for any other Person or Purpose, as well the actual Owner as the Landlord, Lessee, or Mortgagee in receipt of such Rents, or other Person in any other Capacity or Character claiming to be entitled, shall be deemed and taken to be the Owner of the same for the Purposes of this Act, and shall be liable to the Payment of all such Rates, although such Person shall have ceased to be the Owner of such Tenement, after having been rated or made liable to the Payment of such Rate, until some other Person shall be rated in respect

84

Penalty on Occupier refusing to give Name of Owner when requested so to do.

The Word " Owner " deemed a sufficient Description.

Tenants under existing Leases or Agreements to repay the Owner.

Occupiers liable to be distrained upon for Arrrears of Rates, and to recover Expenses from Owners.

12" VICTORIES, Cap. x.

respect of such Tenement, or shall have compounded for such Rate> but subject to Appeal as herein-after provided for in case such Owner shall become liable to pay only a Portion of such Rate in consequence of having ceased to be such Owner, or otherwise howsoevei.

VIII. And be it enacted, That if on the Request of the Person authorized to make the said Rates, or of the Collector thereof, the Occupier of the said Property shall refuse or wilfully omit to disclose, or shall wilfully misstate the Name of the Owner of such Property or of the Person receiving or authorized to receive the Rents of the same, any Justice of the Peace, on Oath made before him of such Request, and of such Refusal or wilful Omission or Mis-statement, may summon the Person who shall have so refused, or wilfully omitted, or misstated as aforesaid, to appear, at a Time and Place to be mentioned in such Summons, before any Two or more Justices; and if the Persons so summoned shall neglect or refuse to attend at the Time and Place mentioned in the Summons, or if he shall attend, and not show good Cause to the Justices then present for such his Refusal, or wilful Omission or Mis-statement, such Justices, upon Proof (in case of the Neglect or Refusal to attend as aforesaid) of the due Service of the said Summons, or on such Attendance, may impose a Penalty upon such Person who shall have so refused, or wilfully omitted, or have made such wilful Misstatement, not exceeding the Sum of Five Pounds, to be recovered, with Costs, as the Rates or Compositions under this Act may be recovered.

IX. And be it enacted, That whenever the Name of any such Owner shall not be known to the Officers making any such Rate, it shall be sufficient to rate such Owner as the Owner of the Property to be rated, by the Description of " Owner," without stating his Name.

X. Provided always, and be it enacted, That when any Owner shall be rated in respect of any Tenement which shall be in the Occupation of any Tenant under any Lease or Agreement made prior to the passing of this Act, such Tenant shall repay to the Owner all Sums which shall be paid by the Owner on account of any Rates under this Act during the Continuance of such Lease payable by the Occupier, unless it shall have been agreed that the Owner shall pay all Rates in respect of such Property; and every such Sum of Money payable by the Tenant to the Owner under the Provisions herein contained may be recovered, if the same be not paid upon Demand, as Arrears of Rent could be recovered from the Occupier by the said Owner.

XL. And be it enacted, That in all Cases where the Owner is absent and cannot be found, or refuses or neglects to pay the Rate or Composition to which he is by this Act liable, such Rate or Composition may be paid by the Occupier of the Premises in respect of which such Rate or Composition shall be due, and the Goods and Chattels of every such Occupier shall be liable at all Times to be distrained and sold for Payment of so much of the same Rate, or of any Composition for the same, and all Arrears thereof, as shall y become

12" VICTORIA, 85

become due in respect of the same Premises during the Time of his Occupation, only in such and the same Manner as Rates for the Relief of the Poor may by Law be levied and recovered, but no such Occupier shall at any Time be required to pay any greater Sum for or towards discharging of any such Rate or Composition or Arrears than the Amount of the Rent actually due by such Occupier to the Owner of the Premises so occupied by him at the Time when the said Rate shall be demanded, or which shall thereafter become due before such Rate shall be levied by Distress; provided also, that every such Occupier who shall pay any such Rate or Composition or Arrears, or any Part thereof, or upon whose Goods and Chattels the same shall be levied, may from Time to Time deduct the Amount of such Rate which shall be so paid or levied, and the Costs and Charges of recovering and levying the same, from the Rent then due or at any Time thereafter to become due from him to the Owner of the Premises, and the Receipt for such Payment shall be a good and sufficient Discharge to such Occupier against the Owner for so much Money as he shall have paid in the Manner directed by this Act, or shall have sustained the Loss of by reason of any Distress made under this Act.

XII. And be it enacted, That in all Cases where any Person shall Persons recease to be the Owner of any Tenement in respect whereof he shall be rated or be liable to be rated by virtue of this Act, such Person entering jpto shall be liable to pay so much of such Rate as shall be in proportion Premises to to the Time he shall have possessed the same; and in all Cases where pay Propor-any Person shall come into the Possession of any such Tenement of ^°ns of which any other Person shall have ceased to be the Owner, the 1 ates' Person so coming into possession shall be liable to pay such Rate (although his Name may not be inserted in such Rate) in proportion to the Time that he shall have been the Owner thereof, and which said Proportion, in case of Dispute, shall be settled by the Officers for the Time being, or the major Part of them, duly authorized to make or collect such Rate.

XIII. And be it enacted, That every Person so rated as an Persons Owner shall, on Payment by him of such Rates, be entitled to be rated as present and vote in Vestry in like Manner as if he were an Occupier ^'t"ea[to of and rated as such in respect of the same Tenement. Vestry

XIV. And be it enacted, That the respective Rate Books of the Rate Books Officers authorized to make or collect any of the said Rates shall to be °Pen be open for the Inspection of such Owners as aforesaid without Fee Por Ia‘ or Reward, in the same Way and Manner to all Intents and Purposes SpeC °n whatsoever as such Rate Books are now by Law required to be open to the Inspection of other Rate-payers.

XV. And be it enacted, That all Rates to the Payment of which Appeal, the several Owners of Tenements are hereby made liable may be appealed against by such Owners, in the same Manner as other similar Rates within the said Parish might have been appealed against by the Occupiers or Parties aggrieved before the passing of this Act.

86

Summonses or Warrants may include several Persons.

Liability to Rates not to disqualify Justices.

Power to appoint Vestry Clerk, and award Salary to him.

Power to appoint Collector and award Salary, &c.

On Removal of Collectors their Books to be produced or delivered.

Collector to account and pay over Balances.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. x.

XVI. And be it enacted, That every Summons or Warrant of Distress for Nonpayment of any Rate or Composition payable by virtue of this Act may include several Persons as well as one Person, and several Sums in respect of Tenements of which the same Person may be Owner, or the same Person may be Occupier.

XVII. And be it enacted, That no Person, although liable to the Payment of Money towards the Rates authorized to be raised under this Act, shall by reason thereof be disabled to act as a Justice in the Execution of the same.

XVIII. And whereas a Vestry Clerk has from Time to Time been appointed for managing the Affairs of the said Parish, and Doubts have arisen as to the Legality of the Payments made to him for his Services out of the parochial Rates of the said Parish : It is hereby enacted (to remove such Doubts), That it shall be lawful for the Rate-payers of the said Parish, in Vestry assembled for that Purpose, from Time to Time to appoint and to remove a Vestry Clerk, and to order and direct him to be paid, out of any of the Rates to be made and levied in the said Parish by the Officers making or collecting such Rates, such Salary or Remuneration for his Services as to such Vestry shall seem fit.

XIX. And in order more effectually to collect and levy the Rates to be made in the said Parish by virtue of this Act, or any other Act, be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Rate-payers of the said Parish from Time to Time, at a public Vestry to be duly convened and held for that Purpose, to nominate and elect, with the Consent of the Poor Law Commissioners for England and ll'ales, a Collector of such Rates, and to make such Allowances, by way of Salary or Poundage, to such Collector, out of such Rates (not exceeding One Shilling in the Pound on the Monies actually collected), and to dismiss such Officer, and to revoke, alter, and vary such Allowance, when and as to such llate-pavers shall seem proper.

XX. And be it enacted, That every such Collector shall, upon being so dismissed, or otherwise when required by them so to do, produce and deliver up to the said Churchwardens and Overseers, or the major Part of them, all the Money, Rate Rooks, Papers, Writings, Documents, Property, Matters, and Things in his Custody or Possession, belonging or relating to the said Parish, or relating to his said Office, for the Purpose of Inspection and safe Custody.

XXI. And be it enacted, That every such Collector shall at all Times keep, and when required by the said Churchwardens and Overseers or the major Part of them, or such other Officers as shall or may be by Law authorized to make, collect, or expend any Rate in the said Parish, or such other Person as shall be authorized to require the same, deliver for Examination and Audit, true and perfect Accounts in Writing under his Hand of all Matters and Things committed to his Charge by virtue of this Act, and also of all Monies from Time to Time received by him on account of any such Rate, and of all Disbursements made thereout or on account thereof and the Times when and to whom made, together with proper Vouchers

8 for

87

12° VICTORIA, Cap. x.

for such Payments, and shall pay to the said Churchwardens and Overseers or other Officer as aforesaid, or to such Person as they shall respectively appoint to receive the same, all such Monies as shall remain due from him.

XXII. And be it enacted, That the said Churchwardens and Overseers shall take Security for the due and faithful Execution of the Office of such Collector, and such Security shall be by Bond with sufficient Sureties, and in such Penalty as the said Churchwardens and Overseers shall think fit; and every such Bond shall be made to the said Churchwardens and Overseers, and may, on any Breach ol' the Conditions thereof, be put in suit by and in the Names of the Churchwardens and Overseers for the lime being for the Benefit of the said Parish, and no Action or other Proceedings on the said Bond shall cease, abate, or be discontinued, defeated, or impeded, by the Death, Removal, or Expiration of Office of all or either of the Churchwardens and Overseers named in such Action or Proceeding.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That in all Cases it shall be deemed sufficient Service of a Summons or Demand of a Rate if a Copy of such Summons, or a Notice of the Amount so demanded, shall be left at the usual or last known Place of Abode of the Person to be summoned or rated, and in case such Person shall reside above Five Miles from the said Parish, then if a Copy of such Summons or such Demand be left or affixed on the Premises rated, and another Copy put into the Post Office directed to such Person at his usual or last known Place of Abode.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of obtaining and passing this Act, and all other Charges incident or in relation thereto, shall be borne, paid, and defrayed out of the first Monies which shall be collected out of any Rate for the Relief of the Poor of the said Parish of Epsom: Provided always nevertheless, that if it shall appear expedient to the Churchwardens and Overseers for the Time being, or the major Part of them, to borrow or take up at Interest the whole or any Part of the Money required for the Purposes aforesaid on the Credit of the said Rates to be from Time to Time made, it shall and may be lawful tor them so to do, but not exceeding the Sum of Seven hundred Pounds, and by Writing under their Hands or of the major Part of them, such Writing being duly stamped for denoting the Payment of the Stamp Duty on a Mortgage for the like Amount, to charge the said Rates as a Security for Repayment thereof with legal Interest for the same; and the Costs and Expenses of such Charge shall be from Time to Time defrayed by the said Officers out of the said Rates; and every such Security shall be good, valid, and effectual, and shall entitle the Person to whom the same shall have been made, his Executors, Administrators, and Assigns, to the Repayment of the Money thereby secured with Interest as aforesaid, and to all Profit and Advantage thereon, according to the true Intent and Meaning of this Act; so, nevertheless, that the Sum so borrowed shall be repaid by equal annual Instalments of not exceeding Seven.

Power to take Security from Collector.

Mariner of serving Summons, kc.

Interpretation of Act.

[Short Title.]

[Public Act.]

12° VICTORIA, Cap. x.

XXV. And be it enacted, That whenever in this Act any Word is used importing the Plural Number the same shall be understood to include the Singular Number, and Words importing the Singular Number only the same shall be understood to include the Plural Number, and several Matters as well as one Matter, and several Persons as well as one Person, and shall extend to Corporations, whether aggregate or sole; and any Word importing the Masculine Gender only shall be understood to include Females as well as Males; the Word Tenement shall include all Property of every Description rateable to any parochial or other Rate in the said Parish of Epsom, or in any Hamlet, District, Liberty, or Part of the said Parish, as the Case may require; and that the Words "Officer" and "Officers" shall mean and include, as the Case may be or the Subject require, Churchwardens, Assistant Churchwardens, Overseers, Assistant Overseers, Collectors of Rates, Surveyors, Assistant Surveyors, Board of Surveyors, Commissioners, and all other Persons whose Duty it may be to make or collect any of the several Rates which form the Subject of this Act; the W7ord " Parish " shall include the said Parish of Epsom, and every Hamlet, District, Liberty, and Part thereof; the Word " Mortgagee" shall be held to include, if in receipt of the Rents, every other Description of Incumbrancer in possession as well as a Mortgagee; the Word " Oath " shall include Affirmation or other Declaration or Solemnity lawfully substituted for an Oath in the Case of Persons exempted by Law from the Necessity of taking an Oath; and the Words " Two or more Justices," as to all Jurisdiction within any Police Court Division assigned or to be hereafter assigned to a Police Court within the Metropolitan Police District, shall, except where otherwise herein provided, mean a Magistrate of such Police Court present at such Court, and in his Absence any Two or more Justices of the Peace acting at such Court, under the Authority of the Metropolitan Police Act, and as to all Jurisdiction not within such Police Court Division shall mean any Two or more Justices of the Peace acting for the County in which such Jurisdiction is to be exercised; unless in any of the Cases aforesaid there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Construction.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in any Act of Parliament, legal Instrument, or other Document, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Epsom Rates Act, 184<J."

XXVII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be deemed and taken to be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.
