Cap. xi.

An Act for making and maintaining Docks near to Wareham in the County of Dorset, with an Entrance thereto from Wareham Channel.

[11th May 1849.]

WHEREAS the making of Docks near to Wareham, with an Entrance thereto from Wareham Channel, would be of public Advantage : And whereas the Persons herein-after named are willing to carry such Undertaking into execution; but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the several Acts of Parliament following, (that is to say,) " The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," and " The Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act, 1847," except where the same shall be inconsistent with or repugnant to any of the Provisions of this Act, shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act. II.

II. And be it enacted, That the Expression "Quarter Sessions" in this Act and all Acts incorporated therewith shall mean the Quarter Sessions for the County of Dorset holden at Dorchester.

8 dr 9 Vict, cc. 16. & 18. and 10 & 11 Vict. c. 27. incorporated with this Act.

" Quarter Sessions.’-

90

[Short Title.]

Subscribers

incorporated.

Capital.

Shares.

Calls.

Power to borrow Money on Mortgage or Bond.

Arrears may be enforced by Appointment of a Receiver.

First and other Meetings.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xi.

III. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression "The Wareham Dock Act, 1849-"

IV. And be it enacted, That the Right Honourable John Earl of Eldon, James William Farrer, John Venn Prior, James Farrer, Samuel Jay, and all other Persons and Corporations who have already subscribed or shall hereafter subscribe to the Undertaking, and their Executors, Administrators, Successors, and Assigns respectively, shall be united into a Company for the Purpose of making and maintaining the Docks and Works hereby authorized, with all proper Works and Conveniences connected therewith, subject to the Provisions contained in this Act and the Acts incorporated herewith; and for the Purposes aforesaid such Company shall be incorporated by the Name of " The Wareham Dock Company," and by that Name shall be a Body Corporate, with perpetual Succession, and shall have Power to purchase and hold Lands for the Purposes of the said Undertaking, subject to the Restrictions and Provisions herein and in the said incorporated Acts contained.

V. And be it enacted, That the Capital of the Company shall be Forty-five thousand Pounds.

VI. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shares into which the said Capital shall be divided shall be One thousand eight hundred, and the Amount of each Share shall be Twenty-five Pounds.

VII. And be it enacted, That Five Pounds per Share shall be the greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make upon the Shareholders, and that Three Fifths of the Amount of a Share shall be the utmost aggregate Amount of the Calls to be made in any One Year upon any Share, and that Three Months at the least shall intervene between successive Calls.

VIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole at any One Time One Third of the Capital of the Company in Shares or Stock for the Time being, but no Part of such Sum or Sums shall be raised until the whole of the said Capital or Sum of Forty-five thousand Pounds shall have been subscribed for, or Shares taken for the same, and One Half thereof shall have been actually paid up.

IX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mortgagees of the Company to enforce the Payment of the Arrears of Principal and Interest due on any such Mortgages by the Appointment of a Receiver; and in order to authorize the Appointment of such Receiver, in the event of the Principal Monies not being duly paid the Amount owing to the Mortgagees by whom Application for such Receiver shall be made shall not be less than Two thousand Pounds in the whole.

X. And be it enacted, That the first Ordinary Meeting of the Company shall be belli within Six Calendar Months next after the passing

91

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xi.

passing of this Act, and the subsequent Ordinary Meetings of the Company shall be held yearly in the Month of May or in the Month of June, or at such other stated Periods as shall be appointed for that Purpose by an Order of a General Meeting.

XI. And be it enacted, That the Quorum for any General Meeting Quorum of of the Company shall be any Number of Shareholders holding in

the aggregate not less than Five thousand Pounds in the Capital of ee 1Mgs' the Company.

XII. And be it enacted, That (subject to the Provisions herein Number contained for increasing or reducing the Number of Directors) the of Directors. Number of Directors shall be Three.

XIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Power to from Time to Time to increase or reduce the Number of Directors dumber of of the Company; but the whole Number of Directors, after such an Directors. Increase or Reduction as aforesaid, shall not be greater than Nine nor

less than Three.

XIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Directors, Directors

without the Direction or Sanction of a General Meeting, from Time m?y declare to Time to declare and pay in the Interval between any Two Ordi- en Is nary Annual Meetings a Half Year’s Dividend out of the Profits of ■’

the Company to the Shareholders, but the Directors shall not make any Dividend whereby the Capital of the Company will be reduced.

XV. And be it enacted, That James Farrer, James William Far- First Direc-rer, and Samuel Jay shall be the first Directors of the Company. tors-

XVI. And be it enacted, That the Directors hereby appointed Election and shall continue in Office until the first General Meeting to be held next Notation of after the passing of this Act; and at such Meeting the Shareholders L,lrectors-present, personally or by Proxy, may either continue in Office the Directors hereby appointed, or any Number of them, or may elect a

new Body of Directors, or Directors to supply the Places of those not continued in Office, the Directors hereby appointed being eligible as Members of such new Body; and at the first Ordinary Meeting to be held every Year after the Year in which such first General Meeting shall have been holden, the Shareholders present, personally or by Proxy, shall elect Persons to supply the Places of the Directors then retiring from Office, agreeably to the Provisions for that Purpose contained in the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845; and the several Persons elected at any such Meeting, being neither re. moved nor disqualified nor having resigned, shall continue to be Directors until others are elected in their Stead, as in the said Companies Clauses Consolidation Act mentioned.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Number of Auditors shall be Number of

One. Auditors

XVIII. And be it enacted, That the Newspaper in which Adver- Newspaper tisements relating to the Affairs of the Company are to be inserted for Insertion

shall

92

of Advertisements.

Company empowered to construct Docks and Works ac-according to deposited Plans and Sections.

Company may deviate to the Extent marked on the Plan.

Local Survey to be made, if required by the Admiralty.

If Works abandoned, Admiralty may, remove same at the Costs of the Company.

Lands for extraordinary Purposes.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xi.

shall be some Newspaper or Newspapers published or circulated in the County of Dorset.

XIX. And whereas a Plan and Section of the said Docks and Works, showing the Situation and Levels thereof respectively, and the Limits within which the same are to be constructed, and also a Book of Reference containing the Names of the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers of the Lands upon or through which the same are intended to be made, have been deposited with the Clerk of the Peace for the County of Dorset: Be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this and the said incorporated Acts contained, it shall be lawful for the said Company to make and maintain the said Docks and Works in the Situation and upon the Lands delineated upon the said Plan and described in the said Book of Reference, and within the Limits aforesaid to make and maintain all such Works and Conveniences as they may think necessary for the Purposes of the said Docks and Works, and to enter upon, take, and use such of the said Lands as they shall deem necessary for the Purposes aforesaid, and to cause the Water from Wareham Bay to supply the said Docks and Works.

XX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, in constructing the said Docks and Works, where Limits of Deviation are marked on the said Plan, to deviate to the Extent of the Limits of Deviation marked on the said Plan.

XXI. And be it enacted, That if after working Drawings of the Works hereby authorized shall have been submitted to the Lord High Admiral of the United Kingdom, or to the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, it shall be deemed expedient by him or them to order a local Survey and Examination of such Works, or of the intended Site thereof, the Company shall defray the Costs of such local Survey and Examination, and the Amount thereof shall be a Debt due to Pier Majesty from the Company, and if not paid, upon Demand, may be recovered, as a Debt due to the Crown, with the Costs of Suit, or may be recovered, with Costs, as a Penalty is or may be recoverable from the Company.

XXII. And be it enacted, That if any Work to be constructed by the Company, or any Portion of such Work, shall be abandoned or suffered to fall into Disuse or Decay by the Company, it shall be lawful for the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, to abate and remove the same, or such Part or Parts thereof as he or they may at any Time or Times deem fit and proper, and to restore the Site thereof to its former Condition, at the Cost and Charge of the Company, and the Amount thereof shall be a Debt due from the Company to the Crown, and be recoverable accordingly, with Costs of Suit.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That the Lands to be taken by the Company for extraordinary Purposes shall not exceed Twenty Acres.

12" VICTORIA, i. 93

XXIV. And be it enacted, That the Docks and Works shall be Period for completed within Seven Years after the passing of this Act; and on the Expiration of such Period the Powers by this Act and the Acts incorporated herewith given to the Company for constructing the Docks and Works shall cease to be exercised, except as to so much of the Docks and Works as shall be then completed.

XXV. And be it enacted, That the Undertakers need not provide Life Boats a Lifeboat or Lifeboats. ^roTk-d.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Com- Power pany to demand, for every Vessel using or entering the said Docks or j^™e®non Works, any Sum, for every Ton Measurement of such Vessel, not ships as in exceeding the Rates mentioned in Schedule (A.) hereunto annexed; Schedule and every such Rate shall be payable by the Master of such Vessel. (A-)

XXVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Com- Power to pany to demand, for all Goods mentioned in the Schedule (B.) here-unto annexed, which shall be shipped or unshipped, received or G"ojSs°^ j delivered, within the Limits of the Docks and Works, any Sums not Schedule exceeding the several Rates in the said Schedule (B.) specified with (B.) respect to such Goods respectively; and as to all such Goods as shall not be specified in the said Schedule the Company may demand a Rate equal to the Rate for the Time being payable in respect of Goods of a similar Nature, Package, and Quality; and every such Rate shall be payable by the Owner of the Goods.

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That if any Vessel using the Docks Further or Works, whether the same shall previously have paid or been liable Tonnage to pay Tonnage Rates or not, shall remain in the Docks or Works vessels*" for any longer Space of Time than Ten Days, the Company may remaining in demand for every such Vessel a further Rate of One Penny per Ton Dock longer for every Week, and so in proportion for any Period less than a Week, l!'an Ten during which any such Vessel shall remain in the Docks or Works Cays‘ beyond the said Period of Ten Days, in addition to the Tonnage Rates payable by virtue of this Act: Provided always, that such additional Rates shall not be payable for any Vessel which shall have been prevented from leaving the Docks or Works by an Embargo or Stress of Weather.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Com- Power to pany and they are hereby authorized to levy, receive, and take, for charge Rates the Use of any Cranes, Weighing Machines, Slips, or Ways, and for Jlie use Engines or Sheers, erected by the Company, and for and in respect of warehousing and safe Custody of any Goods, Wares, Merchandize, Machines, or other Commodities which shall be warehoused, deposited, or kept &c. within the Warehouse or Warehouses of the Company, and for and in respect of building, repairing, coopering, sampling, painting, marking, and other Work to be performed and Materials to be supplied in respect of any Ships, Vessels, Goods, Wares, and Merchandize, such Rates and Sums of Money as may be from Time to Time agreed upon between the Masters or Owners of any Ships, Vessels, Goods,

91

Limits within which Dock Master may exercise his Authority.

Power to appoint Weighers and Measurers. Saving the Rights of the Corporation of Poole.

29G.2.C. 10.

[Public Act.]

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xi.

Wares, Merchandize, and other Commodities, and the said Company, or as may be usual and reasonable.

XXX. And be it enacted, That the Limits within which the Powers of the Dockmaster for the Regulation of the Docks shall be exercised shall be the whole of the Docks, Works, and Premises of the Company, and a Distance of One hundred Yards in an easterly Direction from the Entrance thereto from Wareham Bay.

XXXI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to appoint and license a sufficient Number of Persons to be Meters and Weighers within the Docks and Works.

XXXII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall abate, alter, or prejudicially affect the Rates, Duties, and Customs which are of right leviable by the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the Town and County and Borough of Poole, in respect of any Ships or Vessels, by virtue of a certain Act passed in the Twenty-ninth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King Oeorge the Second, intituled An Act for the better ascertaining, recovering, and collecting certain Duties payable upon the Importation and Exportation of Goods and Merchandizes into or out of the Harbour of the Town and County of Poole, and also of Ballast and Boomage Duties payable in respect of Ships and Vessels coming into and going out of the said Harbour; and for the enlarging, better repairing, and keeping in repair the said Harbour, and the Quays and Wharfs; and for providing a proper Place for keeping Gunpowder in or near the said Town; and for establishing and regulating the nightly Watch, and enlightening the Streets in the said Town.

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

For every Ship clearing for any Port in the United Kingdom or the Isle of Man, per Ton For every Ship clearing for any Port in Europe, or for any Port in the British Possessions and United States in North America, per Ton For every Ship clearing for any other Port or Place than above specified, per Ton -

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIA REGIN. E,

Cap. xii.

An Act for better assessing the Poor Rates on small Tenements in certain Parishes and Places within the Union of Kidderminster.

[24th May 1849.]

WHEREAS the following Parishes and Places situate within the Union of Kidderminster, (that is to say,) Kidderminster Foreign, Lower Mitton, Bewdley, Woloerley, Chaddesley Corbett, Ribbesford, Churchill, Stone, Rushock, and Broome, all in the County of Worcester, Upper Arley in the County of Stafford, and Dowles in the County of Salop, contain a great Number of small Tenements, which are let at small annual Rents, and the Poor belonging thereto are numerous, and supported at a great Expense, and in consequence of the Inability of the Occupiers of such Tenements to pay the Poor Rates thereupon imposed the same are in a great measure rendered unproductive, and it is expedient therefore that better Provision should be made for the rating of such small Tenements to such Rates, and for the collecting of such Rates; but tire same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in [Local.] Ff legal

114

[Short Title.]

Construction of certain Terms in this Act.

Owners of Tenements rated to the Poor Rates at any Sum not exceeding 11. to be rated instead of Occupiers.

How Actions may be brought.

Notice of Action.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xii.

leo-al and other Instruments and Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to° use the Expression " The Kidderminster Union Small Tenements Rating Act, 181-9."

II. And be it enacted, That in construing this Act Words importing the Singular Number shall include the Plural Number, and Words importing the Plural Number shall include the Singular Number; and the Word " Person " shall include Corporation; and the Words importing the Masculine Gender shall include Females as well as Males; the Word " Rate" shall include Assessments; the Word " Parish" shall include any Borough, Hamlet, or other Place; the Word " Overseers" shall include Churchwardens, Assistant Churchwardens, and Assistant Overseers and Collectors; and the Word " Tenement" shall include Lands and Hereditaments and all Property whatsoever rateable to the Poor Rates, unless in any of the Cases aforesaid there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Construction.

III. And be it enacted, That after the passing of this Act the Owner of every Tenement within the following Parishes in the Union of Kidderminster, (that is to say,) Kidderminster Foreign, Lower Mitton, Bewdley, Woloerley, Cliaddesley Corbett, Ribbesford, Churchill, Stone, Rushock, and Broome, all in the County of Worcester, Upper Arley in the County of Stafford, and Dowles in the County of Salop, or any or either of them, which shall be assessed to the Poor Rate at any annual Sum not exceeding Seven Pounds rateable Value, ascertained according to Law, shall hereafter be rated to and pay such Poor Rates instead of the actual Occupier of the same Tenement; and upon Nonpayment of any such Rate, or of the Sum for which the same may be compounded, as in this Act mentioned, such Rate or Sum may be levied and recovered by Distress and Sale of the Goods and Chattels of such Owner wheresoever the same may be found, in like Manner as Poor Rates within the said Parishes respectively may by Law now be levied and recovered from Occupiers, or the same may be recovered from such Owner by Action of Debt at the Suit of the Party authorized to make or recover such Rate, with Costs, in any Court of Law having competent Jurisdiction.

IV. And it enacted, That in any Action or other Proceeding it shall be sufficient to sue by the Name or Description of " The Overseers of the Poor" of the Parish in which the Tenement in respect of the Rate whereon such Action or other Proceeding shall have arisen shall be situate, without specifying the individual Names of such Overseers, and whether the Cause of such Action or Proceeding shall have arisen whilst the Overseers for the Time being shall have been in Office, or in the Time of any of their Predecessors in Office; and no such Action or Proceeding shall abate or be discontinued by reason of the Death, Removal, or Retirement of all or any of the Persons who may have been such Overseers when the same was commenced, or during the Continuance of the same.

V. And be it enacted, That before any Action for the Recovery of any Rate or Composition shall be commenced, a Notice, signed by

6 ° the

115

12° VICTORIA, Cap.sW.

the Person or Persons intending to bring such Action, or their or his Attorney, shall be sent by Post to or left at the existing or last known Place of Abode of the Person liable to pay such Rate or Composition, or if the existing and last Place of Abode of such Person cannot be discovered, then left at or upon the Tenement in respect of which he shall be liable to such Rate or Composition, which said Notice shall state that a certain Rate or Composition for a Rate, as the Case may be, (describing the same,) is due from such Person, and that at the Expiration of Fourteen Days from the posting or leaving of the said Notice an Action at Law will be commenced for the Recovery of such Rate or Composition (as the Case may be), unless the same shall in the meantime be discharged : Provided also, that no such Action shall be commenced under the Authority of this Act after the Expiration of Twelve Calendar Months from the Time when such Rate or Composition (as the Case may be) shall have become due.

VI. And in order to prevent Disputes touching the Meaning of Designation the Word "Owner" in this Act, be it enacted, That as well the of Owner, actual Owner as the Landlord, Lessor, or other Person or Persons receiving or claiming to be entitled to the Rent of any Tenement immediately payable by the Tenant or Occupier thereof, either on his

own Account or as Agent of any other Person, or the Mortgagee in receipt of such Rent, shall be deemed and taken to be the Owner of the same for the Purposes of this Act.

VII. And be it enacted, That if on the Request of the Officer autho- Penalty on rized to make or collect any such Rate as aforesaid within any of the Occupiers said Parishes the Tenant or Occupier of any such Tenement as afore- r*USvj®nJ° said within such Parish shall refuse or wilfully omit to disclose, or of Owner'' shall wilfully mis-state to such Officer, the Name of the Landlord, when re-Owner, or Lessor of such Tenement, or of the Person receiving or quested, authorized to receive the Rent of the same, it shall be lawful for any Justice of the Peace for the County within which such Parish or Hamlet may be, on Oath made before him of such Request, and of such Refusal or wilful Omission or Mis-statement, to summon, by Writing under his Hand, the Person who shall have so refused or wilfully omitted or mis-stated as aforesaid to appear at the Time and Place to be mentioned in such Summons before any Two Justices for the same County, and such Summons may be served by delivering a Copy thereof to the Person summoned, or by leaving the same at his Dwelling House or last known Place of Abode; and if the Person so summoned shall neglect or refuse to attend at the Time and Place mentioned in such Summons, or if he shall attend and shall not show good Cause to the Justices then present for such his Refusal or wilful Omission or Mis-statement, it shall be lawful for such Justices forthwith, or (in case of the Neglect or Refusal of such Person to attend as aforesaid) upon Proof of the due Service of the said Summons, to convict the Person who shall have so refused or wilfully omitted or have made such wilful Mis-statement, and upon such Conviction to order and adjudge that such Person shall forfeit and pay for every such Offence any Sum not exceeding Five Pounds, with Costs, to be recovered by Warrant of Distress under the Hands of such Justices; and such

Penalty,

116

The Word " Owner" a sufficient Description, if Name unknown.

Person rated as Owner to rote.

Hate Books to be open to Inspection of Owners.

Owner may compound for Hates.

Occupier liable to be distrained upon for Arrears of Rates.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xn.

Penalty, when levied, shall be applied to the Purposes for which the said Rates are to be applied.

VIII. And be it enacted, That whenever the Name of any Owner of any such Tenement as aforesaid shall not be known, it shall be sufficient to rate such Owner in the Rate Book of the Parish in which such Tenement shall be situate as the Owner thereof by the Description of " Owner " only, without stating his Name.

IX. And be it enacted, That every Person so rated as an Owner, and who shall have paid all Rates due, shall be entitled to be present and vote in Vestry in like Manner as if he was the Occupier of the Tenement in respect of which he shall be rated and was rated as such Occupier.

X. And be it enacted, That the respective Rate Books of the Officers authorized to make or collect any of the said Rates in either of the said Parishes shall be open for the Inspection of the Owner of any such Tenement as aforesaid, without Tee or Reward, in the same Manner, to all Intents and Purposes, as such Rate Books are now by Law required to be open to the Inspection of other Rate-payers.

XI. And be it enacted, That in all Cases where any Owner shall have been rated or shall have been liable to be rated in pursuance of this Act in respect of any such Tenement as aforesaid, it shall be lawful for such Owner to give Notice in Writing to the Officer authorized to make or collect any such Rate of his Intention to compound for the same, by Payment of a reduced Rate, whether such Tenement be occupied or not, and that in every such Case every such Owner shall thenceforth, until he shall give Notice in Writing for determining such Composition, be liable to pay Two Thirds only of the Amount of any such Rate; and all such Compositions shall be entered in the Rate Book of such Officers, and such Owners shall be thenceforth rated accordingly.

XII. And be it enacted, That the Goods and Chattels of any Person renting or occupying any Tenement the Owner whereof is by this Act made liable to pay the said Rates shall be liable at all Time’s to be distrained and sold for Payment of any Rate or Composition, or of such Part of any Rate or Composition, and all Arrears thereof, as shall become due in respect of the same Tenement during the Time of his Occupancy only, but no such Occupier shall at any Time be required to pay any greater Sum for or towards the Discharge of any such Rate or Composition or Arrears than the Amount of the Rent actually due by such Occupier to the Owner of the Tenement so occupied by him at the Time when the said Rate shall be made and demanded : 1 rovided also, that each and every such Occupier who shall pay any such Rate or Composition, or Arrears, or any Part thereof, or upon whose Goods and Chattels the same shall be levied, may from lime to lime deduct the Amount of such Rate or Composition or Money which shall be so paid or levied from the Rent then due or at any Time thereafter to become due from him to the

Owner

117

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xii.

Owner of such Tenement, and the Receipt for such Payment shall be a good and sufficient Discharge to such Occupier against the Owner for so much Money as he shall have paid in the Manner directed by this Act, or shall have sustained the Loss of by reason of any Distress made under this Act.

XIII. And be it enacted, That every Summons or Warrant of Distress for Nonpayment of any Rate or Composition payable by virtue of this Act may include several Persons as well one Person, and several Sums in respect of several Tenements of which the same Person may be Owner.

XIV. And be it enacted, That all Rates to the Payment of which the Owner of any Tenement is hereby made liable shall and may be appealed against by such Owner in the same Manner as the Poor Rate within the Parish in which such Tenement shall be situate may now or at any Time hereafter be appealed against: Provided also, that in case any Owner shall be rated in respect of any Tenement, and shall appeal against such Rate, and thereby seek to increase the Assessment of the same Tenement so as to throw the Burden thereof on the Person renting or occupying the same, or if the Person so renting or occupying the same shall be rated in respect of such Tenement, and shall appeal against such Rate, and thereby seek to diminish the Assessment of such Tenement, so as to throw the Burthen thereof on the Owner of the said Tenement, then and in either of the said Cases the Justices of the Peace before whom such Appeal shall be brought shall Hot hear such Appeal until sufficient Proof shall be given before them that the Person so renting or occupying as aforesaid, or the Owner as aforesaid, (as the Case may be,) shall have had Ten Days Notice of such Appeal, by Writing under the Hand of the Party intending to appeal, either by Service thereof upon him, or by Delivery thereof at his usual or last known Place of Abode, stating in such Notice the Grounds of such Appeal.

XV. And be it enacted, That in all Cases whenever the Tenant or Occupier of any Tenement within either of the said Parishes (in respect of which Tenement the Owner thereof shall be rated under the Provisions of this Act) shall be desirous of being rated instead of such Owner to the Rates herein-before mentioned, the Officers authorized to make or collect the same Rates are hereby authorized and required, upon the Application of such Tenant or Occupier, to rate such Tenant or Occupier, and insert his Name in their Rate Books in respect of such Tenement, instead of the Owner thereof; and in case such Officer shall neglect or refuse so to do such Tenant or Occupier shall nevertheless be deemed to have been rated in respect of such Tenement from the Period at which the Rate shall have been made in respect of which he shall have so claimed to be rated as aforesaid, and upon Payment or Tender by him of such Rate shall be entitled to the same Powers and Privileges in all respects as other Persons would be entitled to who had been included in and had paid the same Rate in respect of any other Tenement in the same Parish, anything hereinbefore contained to the contrary notwithstanding.

Summons or Warrant may include several Persons.

Appeal.

Occupier may berated, on his own Application.

118

Omissions in Rates may be supplied.

Justices may order Rates to be remitted in certain Cases.

Rates to be apportioned on Holder quitting.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xii.

XVI. And be it enacted, That if the Name of any Person liable to be rated shall be omitted from any such Rate as aforesaid, or if any Error shall be made in any Name, or if any Person, after the making of any such Rate, shall become the Owner or Occupier of any Tenement within either of the said Parishes, or shall become liable to be rated in respect of any Tenement by virtue of this Act, it shall be lawful for the Overseers of the Poor of the Parish to which such Rate refers, at any Time after the Discovery of any such Omission or Error, or new Ownership, Occupancy, or Liability as aforesaid, to cause the Name of every such Person to be corrected or added to or substituted in any such Rate, and every such Person shall thereupon be deemed to all Intents and Purposes to be properly rated, although such Rate shall have been previously allowed and published : Provided always, that any such Person whose Name shall be so inserted in such Rate as last aforesaid may appeal against the same in manner aforesaid at the General Quarter Sessions of the Peace for the County in which the Parish or Hamlet to which such Rate refers shall be situate, to be holden next after such Insertion of his Name as aforesaid.

XVII. And be it enacted, That in case the Owner of any Tenement who, under the Provisions herein-before contained, shall be rated for such Tenement, (and who shall not have compounded with the said Overseers as aforesaid,) shall make it appear to the Satisfaction of any Two or more of Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace for the County within which the same Tenement shall be situate, that he has been unable, either by reason of there being no sufficient Distress upon the Premises, or by the absconding of any Tenant or Occupier of such Tenement, or by reason of such Tenant or Occupier having become bankrupt or insolvent, or by reason of such Tenement having remained void and unoccupied for the whole or any Part of the Year for which he shall have been rated in respect thereof, to obtain Payment of any Part of the Rent which would otherwise have been paid for the same, it shall be lawful for such Justices, having first duly summoned the Overseers or the Collector of the Parish in which the Premises so rated shall be situated, and having in the Presence of such Overseers or Collector, or in his or their Absence, if he or they shall neglect or refuse to attend at the Time and Place mentioned in such Summons, duly inquired into and investigated on Oath the Cause or Occasion of such Loss, and whether by due Diligence such Loss might not have been prevented, to remit to such Owner such Portion of the Rate charged upon the said Premises as shall have accrued due for the Period during which such Owner shall by any or either of the Causes aforesaid have been unable to obtain Payment of Rent, and make such Order therein as such Justices may deem expedient.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That when any Rate shall have been made for a particular Period, and the Owner who shall be rated to such Rate shall cease to be the Owner of the 1 enement in respect whereof he shall be rated before the End of such Period, such Owner shall be liable to pay a Portion only of the Rate payable for the whole of such Period proportionate to the Time during which he continued to be Owner; and if any Person shall become the Owner of any Tenement so rated as aforesaid during any Part of any Period for

which

119

12° VICTORIA Cap. xn.

which any Rate shall have been made, such Person shall pay a Portion of such Rate proportioned to the Time during which he shall have held the Tenement so rated.

XIX. And be it enacted, That if any Tenement rateable under this Act shall have been unoccupied at the Time of making any Rate, and in respect of which no Composition shall have been made as aforesaid, and any Person shall afterwards occupy such Tenement during any Part of the Period for which such Rate shall have been made, it shall be lawful for the Overseers to rate the Owner of such Tenement, who shall pay a Portion of the said Rate proportioned to the Time during which such Tenement shall be so occupied as aforesaid.

XX. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall extend to alter, affect, or make void any Covenant, Contract, or Agreement between any Landlord and any Lessee or Tenant relating to the Payment of any Poor Rates within the said Parishes, or any or either of them.

XXI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That when any Owner shall be rated in respect of any such Tenement as aforesaid which shall be in the Occupation of any Tenant under any Lease or Agreement made prior to the passing of this Act, such Tenant shall repay to the Owner all Sums paid by him during the Continuance of such Lease or Agreement on account of any Rates by this Act made payable by the Owner, unless it shall have been agreed that the Owner should pay all such Rates in respect of such Tenement; and every Sum so payable by the Tenant to the Owner may be recovered, if not paid upon Demand, in the same Manner as Arrears of Rent due under an actual existing Demise are recoverable.

XXII. And whereas it may happen that after the passing of this Act some Tenements to which this Act extends may be converted into One or more Dwelling House or Dwelling Houses, and may be let in Lodgings or separate Apartments : Be it enacted, That in all Cases in which any Tenements within the said Parishes, or any or either of them, now severally assessed or hereafter to be severally assessed to the Poor Rate at any annual Sum not exceeding Seven Pounds rateable Value, ascertained according to Law, shall after the passing of this Act be converted into One or more Dwelling House or Dwelling Houses, and be let in Lodgings or separate Apartments, the Owner of such Dwelling House or Dwelling Houses, whatever the annual rateable Value thereof may be, shall be rated to the before-mentioned Rates in respect of such Dwelling House or Dwelling Houses, in the same Manner, and subject to the same Provisions for the Recovery and enforcing Payment of such Rates, as is and are herein directed and contained with respect to such Tenements as aforesaid, and shall be entitled to the same Right of compounding and other Rights, and be subject to the same Liabilities, as the Owners of such Tenements as aforesaid are by this Act entitled and subject unto.

Persons entering upon unoccupied Property to pay a Portion of the Hate.

Not to affect Agreements between Landlords and Tenants.

Tenants under existing Leases to defray Owner’s Amount of Rates paid by them.

Owners of small Tenements converted into Dwelling Houses, and let in Lodgings or sepa rate Apartments, to be rated.

120

Expenses of Act.

[Public Act.]

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xii.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of preparing and passing this Act, and all preliminary and other Charges and Expenses incident to or attending the obtaining thereof, or in any Manner relating thereto, shall be borne, paid, and defrayed out of the first Monies to be received by the Overseers of the Poor of the said Parishes respectively on account of Poor Rates, in the same Proportions in which the said Parishes respectively now contribute or are liable to contribute to the Common or Establishment Charges of the said Kidderminster Union.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 184-9. o

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. xiii.

An Act for the Dissolution of the Argyll Canal Company, and for the Abandonment of their Undertaking.

[24th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty Queen Victoria, intituled " The Argyll Canal Act, 18-i6:" And whereas none of the Powers by the said Act conferred for the Purchase of Lands, and for the Execution of the Works thereby authorized, have been exercised : And whereas it has become expedient that the Company established by the said Act should be dissolved, and the Undertaking abandoned; but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That from and after the passing of this Act the Undertaking of the Argyll Canal, authorized to be made by the said Argyll Canal Act, 184-6, shall be abandoned, and all the Powers granted to the said Company by the said Act or otherwise [Local.'} H h touching

9& 10 Vict, c. 362.

Undertaking to be abandoned.

122

Company released from any further Liability to make, maintain, &c. the Argyll Canal.

Compensation to be made where Contracts have been entered into or Notices given.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xiii.

touching the Construction, Maintenance, or Management of the said Undertaking shall cease, and the said Company shall exist only for the Purpose of discharging their Debts, Contracts, and other Liabilities, collecting their Assets, distributing their Funds, and winding up their Affairs, and when and so soon as the same shall have been accomplished the said Company shall be dissolved.

II. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions herein-after contained, the Company shall be and they are hereby absolutely and entirely released, exonerated, and discharged of and from all Obligation or Liability to make, maintain, and support the said Canal, or any of the Works which they are by the said Act or otherwise authorized or empowered to make and maintain, or to pay any Sums of Money which would have been by them payable in the event of the said Canal having been completed and opened to the Public under the Powers of the said Act, or to purchase or take any of the Lands which they are by the said Act or otherwise authorized to purchase or take, whether any Notice of the Intention of the Company to take or use the same shall or shall not have been given to the Owner or Occupiers thereof, or to complete the Purchase of any Land which may have been agreed to be purchased or taken for the Purpose of making the said Canal or any of the Works connected therewith.

III. Provided always, and be it enacted, That in any Case where before the passing of this Act any Contract hath been entered into or Notice given by the Company for purchasing any Lands which the Company were by the said recited Act empowered to purchase for the Purpose of the Formation of the said Canal hereby authorized to be abandoned as aforesaid, the Company shall make to the Owners or Occupiers of and other Parties interested in such Lands full Compensation for all Injury or Damage sustained by such Owners, Occupiers, and other Parties by reason of such Purchase not being completed pursuant to such Contract or Notice; and the Amount and Application of such Compensation shall be determined in the Manner provided by the Lands Clauses Consolidation (,Scotland) Act, 1845, for determining the Amount and Application of the Compensation to be paid for Lands taken under the Provisions thereof: Provided also, that the Authority hereby given for abandoning the Formation of the said Canal shall not prejudice or affect the Right of the Owner or Occupier of any Lands which the Company were so empowered to purchase as aforesaid to receive from the Company Compensation for any Damage that may have been occasioned by the Entry of the Company upon such Lands for the Purpose of surveying and taking Levels, and of probing or boring to ascertain the Nature of the Soil, or of setting out the Line of the Canal, pursuant to the Provisions for that Purpose in the said Lands Clauses Consolidation (Scotland) Act contained.

IV. And be it enacted, That so much of the said recited Act which of

provides that from and after the passing thereof the whole Powers Queen Anne and Authorities conferred or granted by an Act passed in the Sixth retrans-Year of the Reign of Her late Majesty Queen Anne upon Archibald p^e‘liett°0J.,u M‘Allister Esquire, then Proprietor of the Soil of East Tarbert, his 0fstonefield. Heirs and Assignees, should he vested in the said Company, who

should thenceforth take on themselves the whole Obligations thereby imposed, and that it should be lawful for the said Company to levy, collect, and recover the Rates and Duties specified in the said Act, and to exercise and enjoy the whole Powers and Authority in the said Act contained, in the same Manner of Way and as fully and freely as the same Powers and Authorities might have been exercised and enjoyed by the said Archibald Ml Allis ter, his Heirs or Assignees, except in so far as the same Powers and Authorities were altered or varied by the said Act, and that the said Archibald M'Allister and his Heirs and Assignees should be freed and relieved from all Obligations imposed on them by the foresaid Act of Her late Majesty Queen Anne-, shall be and the same is hereby repealed, and the said Company shall be and they are hereby absolutely and entirely released, exonerated, and discharged of and from the Obligations imposed as aforesaid; and the said Powers and Authorities shall be exercised and enjoyed by John Campbell Esquire, of Stonefield, now Proprietor of East Tarbert aforesaid, his Heirs and Assignees, as the Successors of the said Archibald M'Allister, his Heirs and Assignees, in the same Manner and Way, to the like Extent, and subject to the same Provisions as if the said Argyll Canal Act had not been passed; and the said John Campbell, his Heirs and Assignees, shall not be bound to account to the said Company for any Dues, Duties, or Sums of Money at any Time received by the said John Campbell at or in respect of the said Harbour, or to pay over the same, or any Sum as Compensation therefor, to the said Company.

V. And be it enacted, That Notice of the Abandonment of the Notice of Undertaking shall be given by Advertisement published Once in 1:>lssolution-the Edinburgh Gazette, and for Three successive Weeks in a Newspaper which shall be published in Edinburgh at least Three

Days in the Week, and in a Newspaper published in the City of Glasgow.

VI. And be it enacted, That within Six Months after the last of Persons such Publications all Persons having any Claim or Demand upon the to said Company in respect of any Contract or Agreement which shall make the have been legally entered into by the Company, and which will be same in six determined by reason of the Abandonment of the said Undertaking, Montl,s'

1 shall give Notice in Writing to the Company of such Claim or Demand, and shall state the Particulars thereof, and the Amount claimed in respect thereof.

124

Disputes as to Debts and Compensation.

Actions, &c. not to abate

As to Distribution of the Funds of the

Company.

Provisions as to Shares and Debts belonging to unknown or incapacitated Persons.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xiii.

VII. And be it enacted, That any Person with whom any such Contract or Agreement shall have been entered into by the Company shall be entitled to Compensation for any Loss or Damage that he may have sustained by reason of the Nonfulfilment thereof; and if any Dispute shall arise as to the Amount of any Debt due by the Company, or as to whether any and what Compensation shall be made by the Company for the Breach of any Contract or Agreement determined by the abandoning of the said Undertaking, the same shall be settled in the Manner provided by the Lands Clauses Consolidation (Scotland) Act, 1845, and for such Purposes the Clauses in the said Lands Clauses Consolidation (Scotland) Act, 1845, with respect to the Purchase and taking of Land otherwise than by Agreement, shall, in so far as the same are applicable, be incorporated with this Act.

VIII. And be it enacted, That no Debt due to or from the Company shall be discharged, and no Action, Suit, or Proceeding whatsoever, commenced either by or against the said Company, shall abate or be discontinued or be prejudicially affected, by virtue or in consequence of the Provisions of this Act, but the same shall continue and take effect as well in favour of as against the said Company in the same Manner in all respects as if this Act had not been passed.

IX. And be it enacted, That the Funds and Property of the said Company shall be from Time to Time applied, under the Control and Superintendence of the Directors of the said Company, in the first place, in the Payment of the Costs and Expenses of applying for and obtaining and passing this Act, or which shall be incurred by such Company or the Directors thereof in carrying into effect the Provisions of this Act, and then in or towards Payment of the Debts and Liabilities of the Company, or any Composition thereupon; and, subject to such Payments, the Monies and Funds of the Company shall be paid and distributed, under the like Control and Superintendance, amongst the Proprietors for the Time being of Shares in the same Company.

X. And be it enacted, That as concerning any Shares in the Capital of the said Company the Owner or Owners or the Person or Persons entitled to which shall not be known or cannot be found, or in respect of which there shall be no Person competent to receive and give an effectual Discharge for the Monies payable in respect thereof, on the Distribution of the Funds of the said Company, it shall be lawful for the same Company to deposit, invest, and pay into any One of the Banks in Scotland incorporated by Act of Parliament or Royal Charter (any of which Banks is hereby authorized and required to receive the same) such Proportion or distinct Proportions of the Monies to arise from the Property of the same Company as shall correspond with or represent or be payable in respect of the same Shares respectively, in the Manner and subject to the Conditions contained

125

12° VICTORIA, Cajj.xiii.

in " The Lands Clauses Consolidation (Scotland) Act, 1845," with respect to the Purchase Money or Compensation exceeding Two hundred Pounds coming to Parties having limited Interests, or prevented from treating, or not making Title; and the Monies so to be deposited, invested, and paid shall be applied in pursuance of the Provisions of the same Act in that respect.

XI. And be it enacted, That after the Abandonment of the said Power of

Undertaking, and until all the Debts and Monies due or thereafter to c '°

become due to the said Company shall have been received and reco- until the vered by the Directors for the Time being thereof, or shall have been released, extinguished, or finally abandoned by the same Directors (as t|iem ar(: they are hereby empowered in their Discretion to do), and until all received and Debts, Monies, and Compensation claimed, or which may become Paid

due or be claimed, as herein-before provided, shall have been fully paid, settled, and discharged by the said Directors, as they in their Discretion shall have full Power to do, the said Company shall continue, with the like Powers to use a Common Seal, and to sue and be sued, as they now have, and the said Directors for the Time being shall after the said Abandonment have full Power to use such Common Seal, and to do and perform all other Acts and Things necessary or expedient to be done and performed for recovering and compelling Payment of the said several Monies respectively, and for otherwise winding up the Affairs of the Company: Provided always, that it shall not be lawful for the Directors of the Company to enter into any new Contract or incur any fresh Liability, excepting so far as the same may facilitate the winding up of the Affairs of the Company.

XII. And be it enacted, That in this Act the following Words and Interpreta-Expressions shall have the several Meanings hereby assigned to them, tion Clause-unless there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant to

such Construction; that is to say,

Words importing the Singular Number shall include the Plural Number, and Words importing the Plural Number shall include the Singular Number:

Words importing the Masculine Gender shall include Females:

The Word " Person" shall include Corporation:

The Word "Lands" shall extend to Houses, Lands, Tenements, and Heritages of any Description or Tenure:

The Expression " the Undertaking" shall mean the " Argyll Canal, and Works authorized by the Argyll Canal Act, 1846:"

The Expression " the Company " shall mean the " Argyll Canal Company incorporated by the Argyll Canal Act, 1846," their Successors and Assigns.

[Short Title.]

XIII. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in any legal Instruments and Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Argyll Canal Company Dissolution Act, 1849."

126

Expenses of Act.

[Public Act.]

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xiii.

XIV. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses connected with the passing of this Act, or of carrying the same into effect, shall be paid by the Company or the Directors thereof out of the Funds of the Company, in preference to all other Payments whatsoever.

XV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen's most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIAE REGINAE.

Cap. xiv.

An Act to amend an Act for the better regulating and improving the Port and Harbour of New Ross in the Counties of Wexford and Kilkenny.

[24th May 1849.]

WHEREAS by an Act passed in the last Session of Parliament,

intituled An Act for the better regulating and improving n& 12 Vict. the Port and Harbour of New ltoss in the Counties of c. 139. Wexford and Kilkenny, it is (amongst other things) enacted, that it shall be lawful for the Commissioners acting in execution of said Act to demand for every Vessel (except such as should carry Limestone or Manure as the sole Cargo) using or entering the said Port and Harbour within the Limits of said Port and Harbour any Sum for every Ton Measurement of such Vessel not exceeding the Rates mentioned in Schedule (B.) thereunto annexed:

And whereas by the Schedule (B.) to said recited Act annexed it is provided, that a Rate not exceeding Two-pence per Ton shall be charged upon and paid for and upon every Ton of the Admeasurement of every Vessel (not exceeding One hundred Tons Burthen) for each and every Voyage made to and from the said Port and Harbour of New Ross, and a Rate not exceeding Three-pence per Ton for and upon every Ton of the Admeasurement of every Vessel (Vessels exceeding One hundred Tons Burthen and Foreign Vessels [Z/Oca/.] K h excepted)

130

Rates upon Vessels exceeding 100 Tons Burthen.

Costs of Act.

[Public Act.]

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xiv.

excepted) for each and every Voyage made to and from the said Port and Harbour of New Ross : And whereas the said Schedule (B.) is manifestly incorrect, inasmuch as thereunder Vessels exceeding One hundred Tons Burden using said Port and Harbour of New Ross would escape paying any Rates to said Commissioners, contrary to the Intent of said Act; and it is expedient that the said Schedule should be amended, but same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners acting in execution of the said recited Act to demand a Rate not exceeding Three-pence per Ton for and upon every Ton of the Admeasurement of every Vessel exceeding One hundred Tons Burthen (Foreign Vessels excepted), for each and every Voyage made to and from the said Port and Harbour of New Ross, the same to be payable and recoverable as any other Rate is by the said recited Act made payable and recoverable: Provided always, that no greater Rate than Two-pence per Ton upon Vessels not exceeding One hundred Tons Burthen shall be levied under the said recited Act.

II. And be it enacted, That the Expenses of this Act shall be paid by the Commissioners acting in execution of the said recited Act, out of the Monies that now are in or may come to their Hands as such Commissioners.

III. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be deemed and taken to be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such, and be incorporated with and form Part of the said recited Act.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIA REGINA.

Cap. xv.

An Act to enable the Edinburgh and Northern Railway Company to raise a further Sum of Money. ' [24th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament holden in the Tenth and Eleventh Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled " The Edinburgh and Northern Railway Company and Edinburgh, Leith, and Granton Railway Company Amalgamation Act," under the Provisions of which the said Two Companies have been dissolved, and a new Company has been incorporated, under the Name and Style of "The Edinburgh and Northern Railway Company:" And whereas the whole Undertakings of the said Two dissolved Companies in the Counties of Edinburgh, Fife, Perth, and Forfar, authorized by the several Acts of Parliament passed with respective Reference thereto in the Sixth and Seventh Years of the Reign of His late Majesty King William the Fourth and in the Second and Third, Seventh and Eighth, Eighth and Ninth, Ninth and Tenth, and Tenth and Eleventh Years of the Reign of Her said present Majesty, have become vested in the same Company : And whereas Two Acts were passed in the last Session of Parliament, by which [Zoca/.] L I Powers

10 &• 11 Vict, c. 239.

134

Increase of Capital.

Existing Guarantees not to be prejudiced.

12° VICTORIA, Cap.zv.

Power? were conferred on the same Company to improve the Harbour of Burntisland in the County of Fife, and to make certain other Branch Railways and Works in the same County : And whereas the Monies authorized to be raised by the several Acts passed with reference to the said Undertakings have been found insufficient for completing the same, and for the other Purposes thereof, and it is expedient that the Company should be enabled to raise a further Sum of Money therefor: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That for the Purpose of completing the Undertakings of the Company, and for the several other Objects of the said Acts, and for Payment of all Liabilities which may have been incurred or Advances which may have been made by or on the Credit of the Directors of the said Companies, on account of the said Undertakings, and which have been applied to the Objects and Purposes by the said Acts authorized, it shall be lawful for the Company to raise, by creating new Shares, in addition to the Sums of Money which they are already authorized to raise by virtue of the said several Acts, any further Sum of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Five hundred and fifty thousand Pounds, in such Manner, and with the like Powers, and subject to the same Provisions under which, by the "Companies Clauses Consolidation (Scotland) Act, 1845," they are authorized to raise additional Capital, by the Creation of new Shares, in lieu of borrowing the Sum by their said Acts authorized to be borrowed, or for the Conversion of such Sums, or any Part thereof, if borrowed, into Capital: Provided always, that the nominal Amount of each such new Share so to be created shall be of such Amount, not exceeding Twenty-five Pounds, and shall be entitled to such guaranteed Interest, not exceeding Ten Pounds per Centum per Annum, as the Company may determine; provided also, that all and every Part of such Sum of Money so to be raised by the Creation of new Shares shall be applicable only to the Objects and Purposes by this Act authorized. II.

II. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the Company, under the Authority of this Act, to give or confer any Guarantee of Interest or Dividend on any Capital to be raised under the Authority thereof which shall be preferable to any other Guarantee of Interest or Dividend theretofore granted by the said Two dissolved Companies or any of them, or by the Company, in pursuance of the Authorities in the before-recited Acts contained, or any of them; and no Guarantee which may be given or conferred pursuant to this Act shall prejudice or affect or be deemed to prejudice or affect any existing Rights conferred upon or with respect to any Stock of the Company which under the Acts creating the same, and under the said first-recited Act, is entitled to any preferential Interest or Dividend, but the same Rights shall continue attached to such last-mentioned Stock, and the same preferential Interest or Dividend shall continue to be paid thereon, before any Dividend or Interest shall be paid upon any Capital or Portion of Capital created under the Authority of this

135

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xv.

Act, anything in this Act to the contrary contained notwithstanding : Provided always, that as respects any Guarantee of Interest or Dividend on any Capital created by the Authority of this Act, the Company may determine and fix the Order of Preference thereof, and Interest or Dividend shall, subject to existing Guarantees, be paid in the Order of Preference so determined or fixed upon by the Company.

III. And be it enacted, That the Capital so be raised by the Creation of new Shares shall be considered as Part of the general Capital of the Company, and shall, except where otherwise provided for by this Act, be subject to the same Provisions in all respects, whether with reference to the Payment of Calls, or the Forfeiture of Shares or Nonpayment of Calls, or otherwise, as if it had been Part of the Capital of the Company authorized to be raised by the " Edinburgh and Northern Railway Act, 1845," and all the Powers and Provisions of the said last-mentioned xAct, and of the other Acts incorporated therewith, applicable to the Capital or other Monies by such Act authorized to be created or borrowed, shall apply to and be in force with respect to the Capital or other Monies authorized to be raised or borrowed by this Act: Provided always, that One Fourth Part of a Share shall be the greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make on such new Shares, and that there shall be an Interval of Two Calendar Months at least between the Time fixed for the Payment of One Call and the Time fixed for the Payment of the next succeeding Call; and provided also, that so much of the said " Edinburgh and Northern Railway Act, 1845," which provides that Two Fifths of the Amount of a Share shall be the utmost aggregate Amount of Calls that may be made in any One Year upon any Share, shall not be applicable to any Shares which may be created under the Powers by this Act conferred on the Company.

IV. And be it enacted, That the Proprietors of any new Shares created under the Powers of this Act shall be entitled to such Number of Votes in respect thereof as the nominal Amount represented by such Shares would have entitled them to if they had been possessed of original Shares in the Undertaking authorized by the " Edinburgh and Northern Railway Act, 1845Provided always, that no Proprietor shall be entitled to vote unless he shall be possessed of Shares in the Capital of the Company which shall be of the nominal Amount of Fifty Pounds at the least.

\. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage such Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be authorized to be borrowed by Order of a General Meeting of the Company, not exceeding in the whole, in addition to the Sums already authorized to be borrowed by the said Company, One Third of the additional Capital which at the Time of exercising such borrowing Powers shall have been created under the Authority of this Act, and to secure the Payment of the Sums so to be borrowed, with Interest, by Mortgages of the Undertaking, subject to the same Provisions

New Shares to be considered same as original Shares.

As to Votes of Proprietors of new Shares.

Power to borrow Money on Mortgage.

Reborrow-

ing.

Former Mortgages to have Priority.

Mortgages and Transfers, &c. to be stamped.

Interest not to be paid on Calls paid up.

Deposits lor future Bills not to be paid out of the Company’s Capital.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xv.

visions as by the said "Companies Clauses Consolidation (Scotland) Act, 1845," were made applicable to the Monies authorized to be raised on Mortgage, and to the Securities thereby authorized to be granted in respect of the same; but no Part of such Sums shall be borrowed until the whole of the Capital of the Company authorized by the said recited Acts, and of the said additional Capital in respect of which such Powers are exercised, shall have been subscribed or taken, and One Half thereof actually paid up : Provided always, that all and every Part of such Sum of Money so to be borrowed shall when raised be applicable only to the Objects and Purposes by this Act authorized.

VI. And be it enacted, That if, after having borrowed any Part of the Money by this Act authorized to be borrowed, the Company shall pay off the same, it shall be lawful for them again to borrow the Sum so paid off, or any Part thereof, and so from Time to Time.

VII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages granted by the Company before the passing of this Act, and also all other Mortgages affecting the said Undertaking, and made pursuant to the several Acts of Parliament in relation thereto, and which shall be in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall during the Continuance thereof have Priority over any Mortgages to be created by virtue of this Act.

VIII. And be it enacted, That every Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, and every Transfer of any Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, to be granted or made by virtue of this Act, shall be by Deed duly stamped, wherein the Consideration for the same shall be duly stated, anything herein to the contrary notwithstanding.

IX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Company, out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the said Company authorized to be raised by Calls in respect of Shares, or by the Exercise of any Power of borrowing, to pay Interest or Dividend to any Shareholder on the Amount of the Calls made in respect of the Shares held by him in the Capital by this Act authorized: Provided always, that nothing hereinbefore contained shall be deemed to prevent the said Company from paying to any Shareholder such Interest on Money advanced by him beyond the Amount of the Calls actually made as shall be in conformity with the Provisions in the " Companies Clauses Consolidation ( Scotland) Act, 1845," in that Behalf contained.

X. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Company, out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the said Company authorized to be raised for the Purposes of such Act or Acts, to pay or deposit any Sum of Money which by any Standing Order of either House of Parliament, now in force or hereafter to be in force, may be required to be deposited in respect of any

Application

137

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xv.

Application to Parliament for the Purpose of obtaining an Act authorizing the said Company to construct any other Railway or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

XI. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses Expenses of of and attending the passing of this Act or incidental thereto shall Act.

be paid by the Company out of the first Monies which shall come to or be in their Hands, and in preference to any Payment whatsoever.

XII. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of the Railway Reign of Iler present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide for the {^"ubjecuo Conveyance of the Mails by Railway; and another Act was passed provjsjolls ot-in the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An i & 2 Vict. Act for regulating Railways; and another was passed in the Sixth c- 98.,

said Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Conditions to the 7 & 8 Vict. Construction of future Railways authorized or to be authorized by any g Soviet Act of the present or succeeding Sessions of Parliament, and for other cc.S7.&l05. Purposes in relation to Railways; and other Two Acts were passed in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled respectively An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways, and An Act for constituting the Commissioners of Railways: Be it enacted,

That nothing in this Act contained shall be held to exempt the Railways by the said several Acts authorized, or the said Company, from the Provisions of the said several Acts respectively, but such Provisions shall be in force in respect of the said Railways and Company so far as the same shall be applicable thereto.

XIII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be Railways deemed or construed to exempt the Railways by the said recited to be subject Acts authorized to be made, or the Company, from the Provisions of

any general Act relating to such Acts, or of any general Act relating general^Acu to Railways, or to the better and more impartial Audit of the Accounts of Railway Companies, now in force, or which may hereafter pass during this or any future Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision and Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament, of the maximum Rates of Fares and Charges authorized by the said recited Acts.

[Short Title.]

XIV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, Parliamentary Notices, or other Documents or Pleadings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression "Edinburgh and Northern Railway (Additional Capital) Act, 1849."

XV. And be it enacted, That in this Act the Words " the Com- Interpret*-pany" shall mean the Edinburgh and Northern Railway Company tion of incorporated by " The Edinburgh and Northern Railway Company Ierms'
