12° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii.

the Interests therein of and from all Persons whose beneficial Use thereof shall be affected thereby.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Powers of the said Trustees for the compulsory Purchase of Lands for the Purposes of this Act, or for the compulsory Acquisition of any Right, Easement, or Privilege therein, shall not be exercised after the Expiration of Four \ears from the passing of this Act.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That the Waterworks shall be completed within Four Years from the passing of this Act, and on the Expiration of such Period the Powers by this or the said incorporated Acts granted to the Trustees for executing such Works, or otherwise in relation thereto, shall cease to be exercised, except as to so much of the said Waterworks as shall then be completed : Provided always, that nothing in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend so far as to restrain the Trustees from extending their Mains and Pipes from Time to Time, whenever it shall be necessary, for the Purpose of supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Water.

XIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Trustees to purchase, take, and hold all Lands, Easements, or Privileges necessary for carrying into execution the Powers of this Act in the Name of the Lord of the Manor of Saint Bees for the Time being, in trust for the Purposes of this Act; and in giving any Notice or Notices under the Lands Clauses Consolidation Act or under this Act, for the Acquisition of Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments, or of any Right, Easement, or Privilege therein, it shall be sufficient if such Notice or Notices be signed by the Clerk or Clerks for the Time being of the said Trustees, or by the Chairman of the Board of Trustees at a Meeting duly convened and held in pursuance of the said recited Acts.

XX. And in order to raise a Sum of Money sufficient to defray the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of supplying the Places within the Limits of this Act with Water, and otherwise incident and in relation thereto, be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Trustees once in every Year to cause a public Rate, to be called the " Water Rate," to be made and levied, in respect of the Supply of Water for domestic Purposes, upon the Occupiers of all Dwelling Houses, Inns, Hotels, Taverns, and other similar Premises, and upon the Occupiers of all Buildings used as Dwelling Houses, situate within the Limits of this Act, according to the full net annual Value thereof, and at a Rate per Centum not exceeding Six Pounds upon such full net annual Value of such Dwelling Houses and other Buildings and Premises respectively as aforesaid; and the said Water Rate shall from Time to Time be collected and paid by yearly, half-yearly, or quarterly Payments, as the Trustees shall from Time to Time think proper: Provided always, that the Trustees shall not be obliged to furnish a Supply of Water for domestic Purposes to any Person for a less Sum than Five Shillings in any One Year; and provided also, that no Person shall be liable to pay any Rate made for the Purposes of this Act unless he shall occupy a Dwelling House or other Building or Premises respectively

as

171

12° VICTORIA, Cap*xvii.

as aforesaid the outer Wall of which shall be situate within a Distance of Fifty Yards of any Main or Service Pipe of the Works authorized by this Act, or shall obtain a Supply of Water therefrom.

XXI. And be it enacted, That a Supply of Water for domestic Purposes aforesaid shall not include a Supply of Water for Railway Purposes, or for Baths, Wash-houses, Water-closets, or public Purposes, or for Horses or Cattle, or for washing Carriages, or for any ornamental Purpose, or for any Steam Engine, or for any Brewery, Warehouse, Counting-house, Office, Shop used solely as a Shop, and not communicating with any Dwelling House or other Building liable to be rated under the Authority of this Act, Coach-house, Stable, Store, Cellar, Vault, Workshop, Mill, or Manufactory, or for Shipping, or for any Trade, Manufacture, or Business whatsoever.

XXII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Trustees to supply any Person with Water for other than domestic Purposes, and private Water-closets and private Baths, at such Rent and upon such Terms and Conditions as shall be agreed upon between the Trustees and Persons desirous of having such Supply of Water.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That the said Trustees shall furnish a Supply of Water for Baths and Water-closets in any private Dwelling House at or for Rates or Remunerations not exceeding the Rates or Remunerations following; that is to say,

When the full net annual Value of such Dwelling House does not exceed Eight Pounds, the Sum of Four Shillings per Annum for each such Bath or Water-closet:

When the full net annual Value of such Dwelling House exceeds Eight Pounds and does not exceed Fifteen Pounds, the Sum of Six Shillings per Annum for each such Bath or Water-closet:

When the full net annual Value of such Dwelling House exceeds Fifteen Pounds but does not exceed Twenty-five Pounds, the Sum of Eight Shillings per Annum for each such Bath or Water-closet:

When the full net annual Value of such Dwelling House exceeds Twenty-five Pounds, the Sum of Ten Shillings per Annum for each such Bath or Water-closet.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Trustees to supply with Water Ships or Vessels resorting to the Port and Harbour of Whitehaven, by Agreement with the Owners or Masters of such Ships or Vessels, and to charge such Remuneration or Rate of Payment for the Water supplied to any such Ships or Vessels as to the .trustees from Time to Time may seem to be reasonable, not exceeding the Rates herein-after mentioned; that is to say.

For One hundred Gallons or any less Quantity supplied at any One lime to any such Ship or Vessel, One Shilling; and for every additional One hundred Gallons or Part of One hundred Gallons, Sixpence:

And it shall be lawful for the Trustees from Time to Time to make and establish such Rules and Regulations for supplying Ships or Vessels with Water as to them shall seem proper.

Supply ot' Water not to include Supply for Trade, &c.

Water for other than domestic and Shipping Purposes to be supplied by Agreement.

Charges for private Baths and Water-closets to be limited-

Charges for supplying the Shipping limited.

172

Constant Pressure to be that afforded from Reservoir.

Certain Clauses of 11 & 12 Vict, c. 3t. relating to Rates applied to this Act.

New Rate may be made, though previous Rate not fully paid up.

Power to rate the Owners instead of Occupiers in certain Cases.

Liability to Rates not to disqualify Justices, and Trustees may be competent Witnesses.

Application of Rates.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xvii.

XXV. And with respect to the Supply of Water in pursuance of the Thirty-fifth Section of the " Waterworks Clauses Act, 1847, ’ be it enacted, That the Water so to be supplied need not be constantly laid on under a Pressure greater than that to be afforded from the Service Reservoir delineated on the said Plans.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That the following Clauses in " I he Towns Improvement Clauses Act, 1847," shall, so far as the same are applicable to the said recited Acts and this Act, and not inconsistent therewith, apply to the Trustees acting in virtue of this Act, and be and the same are hereby incorporated therewith; (that is to say,)

The Clauses with respect to the Manner of making Rates;

The Clauses with respect to the Appeal to be made against any Rate; and

The Clauses with respect to the Recovery of Rates.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Trustees in any One Year to make and levy the Water Rate by this Act authorized, although and notwithstanding that by reason of Poverty the annual Water Rate for the Year immediately preceding, or any Year prior to the making of such new Rate, shall not have been fully and completely levied and paid.

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That in all Cases in which any Property liable to be rated under the Authority of this Act, the full net annual Value of which shall not exceed Six Pounds, it shall be lawful for the Trustees, in or by any Rate or Assessment to be made by virtue of this Act, at their Discretion, to rate and assess the Owner of every or any such Property instead of the actual Occupier thereof; and upon Nonpayment of the Sum so to be assessed the same may and shall be levied, and the Payment thereof be enforced, against the Owner so to be assessed, upon his Goods and Chattels, in like Manner as any Rate made for the Purposes of this Act may be recovered and levied, and Payment thereof enforced, under the Authority of this Act, upon and against any actual Occupier to whom the same is charged.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That no Person, though liable to the Payment of Money towards the Rates authorized to be raised under this Act, shall by reason thereof be disabled to act as a Justice of the Peace or otherwise in any Manner relating to the carrying of this Act into execution \ nor shall any Trustee be deemed an incompetent W itness in any Action, Suit, or other Proceeding under this Act, by reason of his being a Party in or to any such Action, Suit, or Proceeding.

XXX. And be it enacted, That all Monies to be raised by Mortgage or levied by the Trustees under the Authority of this Act shall be applied, first, in paying the Expenses of obtaining and passing this Act as herein-after provided, and, secondly, in carrying the several Provisions of this Act into execution, and to no other Purpose whatsoever.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xvii.

XXXI. And be it enacted, That the Trustees shall keep a separate and distinct Account, to be called " The Whitehaven Water Account," of all Monies received or paid under the Provisions of this Act, and such Account shall be audited in such and the like Manner as other Accounts kept by the said Trustees under the Provisions of this Act.

XXXII. And be it enacted, That all Sums of Money received by virtue of the Water Rate to be levied under the Authority of this Act, and all other Monies to be received under the Provisions of this Act, shall be carried to the Credit of the said Account called " The Whitehaven Water Account."

XXXIII. And in order to raise Money for defraying the Expenses incurred or to be incurred in carrying into effect the Powers and Provisions of this Act: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Trustees and they are hereby authorized from Time to Time to borrow and take up at Interest on the Credit of the " Whitehaven Water Account," of and from any Person who shall be willing to advance the same, any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sutn of Twenty-six thousand six hundred and sixty-six Pounds; and for securing the Repayment of such Sum or Sums of Money, with Interest at a Rate not exceeding Five Pounds per Centum per Annum, the Trustees may mortgage and assign over the said " Whitehaven Water Account," or any Part thereof, or any Monies accruing and by this Act authorized or directed to be paid thereto, or any Part thereof, to any Person who shall advance such Money, or his Trustee, and, in the event of all or any Part of such Monies being repaid by the Trustees, to reborrow the same upon the like Security, and so toties quoties, but so nevertheless that there shall not be owing on the Security aforesaid, under the Authority of this Act, any more than the said Sum of Twenty-six thousand six hundred and sixty-six Pounds.

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Trustees and they are hereby required annually to set apart from and out of any surplus Monies appearing upon the then yearly Balance of the said " Whitehaven Water Account " a Sum not exceeding Two Pounds and Ten Shillings per Centum per Annum nor less than One Pound per Centum per Annum upon the Amount raised and borrowed for the Purposes of this Act, together with the Amount of any Surplus then remaining, and the Sum or Sums so set apart shall be carried to an Account to be called " The Sinking Fund and such Sinking Fund shall be from Time to Time applicable to the Redemption of Mortgages, and the Restoration and Improvement of the Works by this Act authorized, and to no other Purpose whatsoever.

XXXV. And be it enacted, That the Trustees shall from Time to Time so regulate the Rates and Charges to be made for the Supply of Water under the Provisions of this Act that the Amount of such Rates and Charges shall be as near as may be sufficient to pay the Interest upon any Monies borrowed on the Credit of " The Whitehaven Water Account," together with the Costs of managing, conducting, and extending the Works by this Act authorized to be

[Loc«/.] X x made,

Separate Accounts to be kept.

Certain Clauses in 11 & 12 Vict, c. 16. applied to this Act.

Prior Mortgages not to affected.

Nothing herein to exempt Trustees from Provisions of 11 & 12 Vict, c. 63.

Saving of Rights under recited Acts.

Expenses of Act.

12" VICTORIA, Cap. xvii.

made, and such further Sum as may be proper to be set apart as and for a Sinking Fund under the Provisions herein-before contained.

XXXVI. And be it enacted, That the following Clauses in " The Commissioners Clauses Act, 1847," shall, so far as the same are applicable to this and the said recited Acts, and not inconsistent therewith, apply to the Trustees acting in virtue of this Act, and be and the same are hereby incorporated therewith; (that is to say,)

The Clauses with respect to the Contracts to be entered into and the Deeds to be executed by the Trustees;

The Clauses with respect to the Liabilities of the 1 rustees, and to legal Proceedings by or against the Trustees;

The Clauses with respect to the Appointment and Accountability of the Officers of the Trustees;

The Clauses with respect to the Mortgages to be executed by the Trustees; and

The Clauses with respect to the Accounts to be kept by the Trustees.

XXXVII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be held in any way to prejudice or affect the Priority or Validity of any Mortgages, Bonds, or other Securities executed by the said Trustees, or Debts or other Liabilities which they may have incurred or be subject to in carrying into effect the other Purposes by the said recited Acts authorized, and which may be subsisting and in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, but all such Mortgages, Bonds, or other Securities, Debts or Liabilities, shall during the Continuance thereof have the same Priority, Validity, and Effect as if this Act had not been passed.

XXXVIII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the said Trustees from the Provisions of " The Public Health Act, 1848," or of any general Act relating thereto or to the Subject Matter thereof which may pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament.

XXXIX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend to abridge, alter, prejudice, or take away any of the Rights or Privileges, Franchises, Powers, or Authorities, of or belonging to or vested in the Lord or Lords of the Manor of Saint Bees for the Time being, and the said other Trustees, or any other Person or Persons, under or by virtue of the said recited Acts or any them, but the said Acts, and all the Powers and Provisions and Matters and Things therein contained, so far as the same are now in force, or are not modified by or inconsistent with this Act, shall continue in full Force and Effect in like Manner as if this Act had not been passed.

XL. And be it enacted, That the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of applying for, obtaining, and passing this Act, and incidental and preparatory thereto, shall be paid by the Trustees out of the first Monies to be received by them in pursuance of this Act, in preference to all other Payments whatever.

12° VICTORIA, Ctfjo.xvii.

XLI. And be it enacted, That in this Act the following Words and Expressions shall have the several Meanings hereby assigned to them, unless there is something in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Construction; that is to say,

The Words " the Trustees, or the said Trustees," shall mean the Trustees of the Port, Harbour, and Town of Whitehaven:

The Expression " Clerk or Clerks " shall mean the Clerk or Clerks of the said Trustees.

XLII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIAE REGINE.

Cap. xviii.

An Act for altering the Mode of assessing the Drainage Rates authorized by the Act for draining and improving Marshland Smeeth and Marsh-land Fen in the Country of Marshland in the County of Norfolk, and to provide for the Repair of Roads within the Limits of the said Act.

[24th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Thirty-sixth Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Third, intituled An Act for draining and improving, and for inclosing, dividing, and allotting, certain Tracts of Common and Waste Lands called Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen, lying within the Country of Marshland in the County of Norfo\k, and for stinting and regulating the stocking, feeding, and depasturing of the said Smeeth and Fen until the Inclosure, Division, and Allotment thereof, whereby Powers were conferred upon the Commissioners constituted by the said Act for draining, dividing, and allotting the Tracts of Common and Waste Lands called Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen, and also (upon the Application of the Proprietors thereof, and which Application has been made,) to include certain other Lands [Loca/.] Y y called

36 G. 3. c. too.

178

12° VICTORIAE, Cap. xviii.

called Well Moor, Broad Fen, and Short Fen, in the said Drainage, and Powers were conferred upon the Commissioners for Drainage constituted by the said Act to tax and charge the Owners and Occupiers of the said Common and Waste Lands with such equal and proportionate Rates and Assessments upon each and every Allotment to be made by virtue of the said Act as they should judge necessary for the Purposes of such Drainage, and to tax and charge the Owners and Occupiers of the said Lands called Well Moor, Broad Fen, and Short Fen with such proportionate Rates and Taxes for the Purposes aforesaid as should be equal to the Rates and Taxes to be raised and payable out of the said Common or Waste Lands : And whereas it was by the said Act enacted, that the Commissioners for Inclosure therein mentioned should set out such public Carriage Roads and such private Roads and Ways as should be necessary and convenient, and that all such private Roads and Ways should be repaired at the Expense of the Persons entitled to the said Tracts of Common and Waste Lands in such Manner as the said Commissioners for Inclosure should direct: And whereas the said Commissioners for Inclosure, pursuant to the Directions of the said recited Act, set out, allotted, and awarded several private Roads, but no public Roads, over the said Common and Waste Lands, and declared in what Parishes the said private Roads should lie, and directed that the said Roads should at all Times thereafter be repaired at the Expense of the Persons who for the Time being should be entitled to the Parcels of Land therein-after awarded within the several Parishes wherein the said Roads were therein declared to be, so that the Roads within each Parish should be repaired at the Expense of the Persons entitled to Lands in such Parish, and that the Expense of repairing the said Roads should be borne by the Persons entitled to the said respective Lands in the same Proportions as the Occupiers of the said Lands should respectively contribute to the Rates for the Relief of the Poor, or other Rates or Assessments within the said Parishes: And whereas by the Mode of Assessment prescribed by the said recited Act for the Purposes of Drainage the Lands in the said Marshland Smeeth are unfairly assessed, and made to contribute an undue Proportion of the Expenses of the several Works for the Drainage and Preservation of the Lands in the said District, in comparison with the Lands in the said Marshland Fen, and it is considered just and reasonable that all the Lands in the said Smeeth and Fen (together with the Lands in Well Moor, Broad Fen, and Short Fen,) should be rated equally by the Acre throughout the whole of the said District for all Purposes of Drainage : And whereas it is expedient that certain of the said Roads so set out as aforesaid as private Roads should be declared to be and should be made public Roads, and that the said Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen, together with the said Broad Fen and Short Fen, should be formed into a separate District for the Repair of the said Roads, and that further Provision should be made for the Repair of the said Roads, and that the Owners and Occupiers of the Lands within the Limits of the said District should in respect of such Lands be exempted from all Highway and othei Rates, and from all other Liability, pecuniary or otherwise, for repairing any Road or Highway not being within the Limits of the said District: And whereas the Objects aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please

Your

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xviii. 179

Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the Recited Act said recited Act, and all the Enactments and Provisions therein con- £°r"teinue tained, so far as they respectively stood in force before the passing of aS this Act, shall henceforth continue in force as if the same had been altered, repeated and re-enacted in this Act, except only so far as the same are by this Act repealed, varied, or altered, or are inconsistent therewith.

II. And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act Proprietors every Owner of Thirty Acres of Land liable to be taxed, charged, or ’"^eiUloor assessed under the said recited Act or this Act shall be and he is

hereby appointed a Commissioner for the Purposes of the said recited Fens to be Act and this Act; and that the several Works, Lands, and other Pro- Commission-perty vested in, and Powers, Authorities, Emoluments, and Duties ers-given to, exercisable by, and imposed upon the Commissioners of Drainage, under or by virtue of the said recited Act, shall be and the same are hereby declared to be respectively vested in, given to, exercisable by, and imposed upon the said Commissioners under this Act, to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever, save and except so far as the same are altered, varied, or repealed by this Act; and that the Proprietors of Lands in Well Moor, Broad Fen, and Short Fen shall have the like Power of appointing Deputy Commissioners to act for them in their Absence, and all such other Powers, as by the said recited Act are given to the Proprietors of Lands in the said Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen, save and except only so far as such Powers are hereby repealed or altered; provided that no Commissioner appointed in respect of his being Owner of Land within Well Moor aforesaid shall be authorized to act or vote upon any Question or Matter relating to any of the Roads by this Act authorized to be made, maintained, or repaired.

III. And for the Purpose of regulating the Conduct of any Business As to Votes to be transacted by the said Commissioners at any Meeting or Meet- of Commis-ings to be held by them pursuant to the said recited Act or this Act, sloners‘

be it enacted, That every Commissioner and Deputy Commissioner, being the Proprietor of or appointed for or in respect of less than One hundred Acres of Land liable to be taxed, charged, or assessed under this Act, shall be entitled to and have One Vote only; and being the Proprietor of or appointed for or in respect of One hundred Acres and less than Two hundred Acres of such Land, shall be entitled to and have Two Votes; and being the Proprietor of or appointed for or in respect of Two hundred Acres and less than Three hundred Acres of such Land, Three Votes; and of, for, or in respect of Three hundred Acres of such Land (or upwards), Four Votes.

IV. And be it enacted, That, notwithstanding anything in the said Extension of recited Act contained to the contrary, it shall be lawful for the Power for said Commissioners from Time to Time to hold their general, special, Commission-and adjourned Meetings in the Towns of King's Lynn and Wisbech Meetings. Saint Peter’s, or either of them, or at any intermediate or other Place,

as the said Commissioners or any Five or more of them shall from Time to Time appoint; and if at any of their Meetings the said Commissioners

180 12° VICTORIA, Cap. xyul

missioners present shall omit to adjourn their Meeting to any other Day, or if there shall not he Five of the said Commissioners present to adjourn the same, then it shall be lawful for the Clerk to the said Commissioners to adjourn such Meeting for such Time, either less or exceeding Fourteen Days from the Time of such Adjournment, and either to the same or any other Place, as the said Clerk in his Discretion shall think proper, giving public Notice of the Time and Place of such adjourned Meeting in One or more of the Norfolk and One or more of the Cambridge County Newspapers: Provided nevertheless, that the General Annual Meeting of the said Commissioners shall be held alternately in the Towns of King's Lynn and Wisbech Saint Peter's aforesaid on the Second Wednesday in the Month of May yearly, as directed by the said recited Act.

Power of V. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Corn-Commission- missioners and they are hereby authorized and empowered, at their Commufee"1 respect've Meetings, from Time to Time to appoint any Number of mi L s- themselves, not being more than Ten nor less than Five, to be a Committee for any Purposes for which the said Commissioners, in the Execution of the said recited Act or this Act, may think proper so to appoint them; and it shall be lawful for such Committee to meet from Time to Time, and to adjourn from Place to Place, as they may think proper, for carrying into effect the Purposes of their Appointment; but such Committee shall not exercise any of the Powers intrusted to them, except at a Meeting at which Five Members of such Committee shall be present; and at all Meetings of such Committee One of the Members present shall be appointed Chairman, and all Questions at any such Meeting shall be determined by a Majority of Votes of the Members present, and every Member of such Committee shall for the Purposes thereof be entitled to One Vote only, except the Chairman, who shall in the Case of an Equality of Votes be entitled to an additional or casting Vote; and the several Acts and Resolutions of the said Committee, or the major Part of them present at any Meeting, in the Execution of the several Powers intrusted to them by the said Commissioners, being confirmed or adopted by the said Commissioners at any of their Meetings, shall be good, effectual, and binding to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever.

The Com-

VI. And be it enacted, That the Commissioners for the Time missioners to being acting in execution of the said recited Act and this Act may «ue and be an(j shall, in all Cases arising out of or under any of the Provisions of the said recited Act or this Act, sue and be sued in the Name of any One of the said Commissioners or of their Clerk for the Time being; and no Action, Suit, Information, or Indictment which shall be brought, commenced, filed, preferred, or prosecuted by or against the said Commissioners or any of them respectively by virtue of the said recited Act or this Act, in the Name of any Commissioner or of their Clerk, shall abate or be discontinued by the Death, Suspension, or Removal of any such Commissioner or Clerk, or by the Act of any such Commissioner or Clerk without the Consent of the said Commissioners, but the said Commissioner or the Clerk for the Time being shall always be and be deemed to be the Plaintiff, Prosecutor, or Defendant, as the Case may be, in any such Action, Suit, Information, or Indictment: Provided nevertheless, that every such Commissioner

sued in the Name of a Commissioner or their Clerk.

181

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiii.

missioner and Clerk shall be reimbursed and paid out of the Funds to arise by virtue of this Act all such Damages, Losses, Costs, Charges, and Expenses as he shall be put to or become chargeable with by reason of his being made Plaintiff', Prosecutor, or Defendant as aforesaid.

VII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners acting under the Authority of this Act, and they are hereby authorized and required, as soon as conveniently may be after the passing of this Act, to remove the Wind Engines now erected and used for the Drainage of the Lands in the said Marshland Smeeth and Fen, and in Well Moor, Broad Fen, and Short Fen, or any of them, and to erect, make, and use such Steam Engines and other Works as the said Commissioners shall think expedient for the better and more effectual Drainage thereof.

VIII. And be it enacted, That so much of the said recited Act as directs and authorizes the said Commissioners for Drainage to assess, rate, tax, and charge all and every the Owners and Occupiers of the said Common and Waste Lands by and with such equal and proportionate Rates and Assessments upon each and every Allotment made by virtue of the said recited Act as they shall judge necessary for the Purposes therein mentioned, and as authorizes and directs such Commissioners to tax, charge, and assess the Owners and Occupiers of the said Lands called Well Moor, Broad Fen, and Short Fen with such proportionate Rates and Taxes, for the Purposes therein mentioned, as shall be equal to the Rates and Taxes to be raised and payable out of the said Common and Waste Lands, shall be and the same is hereby repealed; and in lieu and stead thereof the said Commissioners acting under the Authority of this Act shall and may from Time to Time, henceforth and at all Times, at their General Meeting in each and every succeeding Year, or at any Special Meeting of which public Notice shall be given in manner provided by the said recited Act, assess, tax, rate, and charge all and every the Owners and Occupiers of the said Lands in the said Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen, and in Well Moor, Broad Fen, and Short Fen, with such Rates and Assessments as they shall judge necessary, to be charged and assessed by the said Commissioners equally by the Acre upon each and every Acre of the said Lands in the said Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen, and in Well Moor, Broad Fen, and Short Fen, and so in proportion for any less Quantity than an Acre, for maintaining, repairing, and supporting the several Works by the said recited Act authorized to be made for the Drainage Purposes thereofj and for making and maintaining the several Works authorized by this Act for such Purposes, and for making any necessary Alterations and Enlargements therein or thereto respectively as Occasion shall require, and for paying the Interest of any Principal Money which may be secured on such Rates, Taxes, and Assessments under the Powers in that Behalf herein-after contained, and for providing a Fund for the Payment of such Principal Monies as hereinafter directed: Provided nevertheless, that such Acre Rates and laxes shall not exceed the Sum of Three Shillings and Sixpence an Acre in the whole in any One Year.

Power to Commissioners to drain by Steam.

The Drainage Rates to be assessed by the Acre.

Application of Drainage Rates.

Certain Roads to be public Highways.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xviii.

IX. And be it enacted, Tltat all the Taxes which shall be rated or assessed by virtue of this Act as last aforesaid shall be applied in making, maintaining, repairing, supporting, altering, and enlarging the several Works for the Drainage of the said Lands, and in paying the Interest of any Principal Monies which may be secured on such laxes, under the Powers in this Act herein-after contained, and in or towards Payment of such Principal Monies, in manner herein-after directed.

X. And be it enacted, That all Tenants and Occupiers of all and singular the Lands which shall be assessed or rated by virtue of this Act for the Purposes of Drainage shall and they are hereby authorized and required to pay such Sums of Money as shall be so assessed on the Lands in their respective Occupations, and to deduct and retain out of his, her, or their Rent all such Money as they shall respectively pay; and the several Owners are hereby required to allow such Deduction, and every such Tenant paying such Assessment shall be discharged of so much Money as the same shall amount to, as fully as if the same had been paid to his or her Landlord : Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall be construed to alter, change, determine, or make void any existing Contracts, Covenants, or Agreements whatsoever between Landlord and Tenant or any other Persons touching the Payment of Taxes and Assessments, and that as between Landlords and Tenants, and Persons having limited Interests in the Lands hereby directed to be taxed and assessed, the Rates, Taxes, and Assessments which shall be levied and made for the Purposes of Drainage under the Authority of this Act shall be considered as made under the Authority of the said recited Act.

XI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners for the Time being acting in execution of the said recited Act and of this Act, and they are hereby required, within Two Years after the passing of this Act, to amend and repair with hard Materials the several Roads herein-after mentioned which were set out as private Roads by the Award of the said Commissioners for Inclosure within the said Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen; that is to say.

The Smeeth Road from Emneth Gate to Saint John's Gate; the Road from the said Smeeth Road to Walsoken Gate; the Road from the said Smeeth Road to Bettinson's Bridge over the Rans Drain; the Road from the said Smeeth Road to Walpole Gate; the Road from Walton Gate to the Forty Foot Drain Bridge; the Road from the Forty Foot Drain Bridge to Howlett's Bridge, and thence to Fuller's Bridge; the Road from the Gravel Bank near the Mills to Howlett's Bridge; the Black Horse Drove from Howlett's Bridge to the Crown Estate; the Road from Saint John's Gate to Tilney Gate; and the Road from Emneth Hungate to Moyse’s Bridge over the Sixteen Foot Drain; and also the Gravel Bank from Tilney Bridge to Lords Bridge:

And from and after the passing of this Act such Roads shall be deemed and taken to be public Highways, and shall be maintained and kept in repair by the Owners and Occupiers for the Time being of the Lands within the said Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen, and in Broad Fen and Short Fen; and the said Commissioners for the

Time

183

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xviii.

Time being acting in execution of the said recited Act and of this Act shall be subject and liable to such legal Proceedings for not repairing such Roads as Inhabitants of Parishes are now by Law subject and liable to for the Nonrepair of public Highways.

XII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners for the Time being acting in execution of the said recited Act and this Act, and they are hereby authorized, from Time to Time to amend and repair, in such Order and Course and in such Manner as they shall think expedient, the several other Roads and Ways so set out as aforesaid in, upon, and over the said Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen, or any of them; and it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners from Time to Time to appoint One or more Surveyor or Surveyors of all the said several Roads aforesaid, whether public or private, and such other Officers, Agents, and Assistants, and with such Salary or Salaries as they shall think necessary, and to remove and displace every or any such Surveyor, Officer, Agent, or Assistant, and to appoint another or others in his Place; and every such Surveyor shall and may (subject to the Instructions of the said Commissioners) have, use, and exercise the same Powers and Authorities upon or in respect of the said several Roads, and demand, recover, and receive such and the like Penalties and Forfeitures from Offenders, as Surveyors of public Highways have or are authorized to use or exercise, demand, recover, and receive, upon or in respect of the public Highways in their respective Parishes.

XIII. And be it enacted, That it shall and may be lawful for the said Commissioners and they are hereby authorized and empowered, from Time to Time, at their yearly General Meeting, or at any Special Meeting of which public Notice shall be given in manner provided by the said recited Act, to levy and raise such Rates and Assessments as they shall judge necessary or proper for the Purpose of amending, repairing, and maintaining the several Roads by this Act required or authorized to be amended, repaired, and maintained as aforesaid, and for widening and improving the same respectively, and for paying the Interest of any Principal Monies to be borrowed on the Security of the said Rates and Assessments, and for providing a Fund for the Payment of such Principal Monies as herein-after mentioned, which Rates and Assessments shall be applied by the said Commissioners for the Purposes aforesaid, and in or towards the Payment of such Principal Monies in manner herein-after directed.

XIV. And be it enacted, That, notwithstanding anything contained in the said recited Act or this Act, or in the Award of the said Inclosure Commissioners, to the contrary, the Rates and Assessments so directed to be levied and raised as last aforesaid shall be made, levied, and assessed upon all the Lands in the said Marshland Smeeth and Marshland Fen, and in Broad Fen and Short Fen, equally by the Acre throughout, and shall be paid by the Owners or Occupiers for the Time being of such Lands respectively.

XV. And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act the several Allotments set out, allotted, and awarded by the said

Power to repair other Roads, and to appoint Surveyor.

Commissioners to levy Road Rates.

Road Rates to be assessed by Uie Acre.

exercise Control in the Smecth and Fen, nor Surveyors in Smeeth and Fen elsewhere.

said Commissioners for Inclosure for the Repair of Roads under or by virtue of the said recited Act, and thereby vested in the Surveyors for the Time being of the several Parishes therein mentioned, shall be and the same are hereby declared to be vested in the said Commissioners for the Time being under this Act, and that from and after the passing of this Act no Parish Surveyor, Surveyor of Highways, or other Officer (other than and except such Surveyors or Officers as shall be appointed by the said Commissioners under the Authority of this Act) shall at any Time have, use, or exercise any Control or Interference over the Lands, Roads, and Ways in the said Marshland, Smeeth and Marshland Fen, and in Broad Fen and Short Fen, or any of them, and that the several Lands in the said Smeeth and Fen, and the said several Roads and Ways, and the several Lands in Broad Fen and Short Fen, or any of them, or any of the Owners or Occupiers thereof, shall not in respect thereof be charged or chargeable with or contributory to the Amendment, Repair, or Maintenance of any public or private Roads or Ways not being within the said Smeeth or Fen, or in Broad Fen and Short Fen, or with or to any Highway Rate or other Charge or Assessment for the Amendment, Repair, or Maintenance of any of such last-mentioned Roads or Ways; and no Surveyor or other Officer appointed by the said Commissioners under the Authority of this Act shall at any Time, under or by virtue of such Appointment, have, use, or exercise any Control or Interference over any Highway or Road not being in the said Smeeth and Fen, or in Broad Fen and Short Fen, or either of them; and the several Lands not lying within the said Smeeth and Fen, and Broad Fen and Short Fen, or either of them, shall not, nor shall the Owners or Occupiers thereof or of any Part thereof, be charged or chargeable in respect of the same with or contributory to the Amendment, Repair, or Maintenance of any of the Roads or Ways within the said Smeeth and Fen, or in Broad Fen and Short Fen, or either of them, or with or to any Highway Rate or other Charge or Assessment for the Amendment, Repair, or Maintenance of any of such last-mentioned Roads or Way.

XVI. And, for aiding the several Purposes of this Act and the said recited Act, be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners and they are hereby empowered, at any of their Meetings, to borrow or take up any Principal Sum or Sums of Money, not exceeding the Sum of Three thousand five hundred Pounds in the whole for the Purposes of the Drainage, and Three thousand five hundred Pounds in the whole for the Purposes of the Roads, at Interest upon any Mortgage or Mortgages of all or any of the Rates, Taxes, and Assessments hereby authorized to be levied and raised as aforesaid, or any Part thereof, as the said Commissioners assembled at any of their said Meetings shall from Time to Time think proper or see Occasion, and by Writing under the Hands and Seals of any Five of the said Commissioners present at any of their said Meetings (the Chairman of the Meeting being One of them) to assign or charge the said Rates, Taxes, and Assessments, or any of them, or any Part thereof respectively, to or in fiivour of any Person or Persons who shall lend or advance any such Principal Sum or Sums, as a Security or Securities for the Repayment thereof, with Interest for the same at any Rate

XVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for all and every Securities Body and Bodies Politic and Corporate, and Person and Persons, to to be assign-whom any such Security shall be so made as aforesaid, or who shall able-be entitled to the same, or to the Principal Money and Interest thereby secured, or any Part or Proportion thereof, and he, she, and they is and are hereby respectively empowered, from Time to Time, by any Deed under his, her, or their Hand and Seal or Hands and Seals, duly stamped, in which the Consideration for such Assignment or Transfer shall be stated, and which Deed may, if thought expedient, be endorsed on his, her, or their Security, to assign or transfer such Security, or any Share thereof or Interest therein, and all or any Part of the Monies due or to become due thereon, to any Body or Bodies, Person or Persons whomsoever; and every such Assignment or Transfer shall be produced or notified to the Clerk of the said Commissioners, who shall cause a Memorial thereof, specifying the Date thereof, and the Names, Additions, and Places of Abode of the several Parties thereto, and the Sum or Sums of Money therein (Local.] 3 A mentioned

186 12° VICTORIA, Cap.wm.

mentioned to be transferred, to be entered in the Book or Books to be kept for entering the said original Securities, for the Entry of which said Memorial the said Clerk shall be paid the Sum of Five Shillings, and no more, by the Person or Persons producing or notifying such Assignment or Transfer as aforesaid; and after Entry made of such Memorial as aforesaid, and not otherwise, every such Assignment or Transfer shall be good and valid to all Intents and Purposes, both at Law and in Equity, and shall entitle the Assignee or Assignees therein named, and his, her, or their Successors, Executors, Administrators, and Assigns, to the full Benefit thereof, and of the original Security or Interest therein which shall have been thereby assigned or transferred; and every such Assignee shall and may in like Manner assign and transfer such respective Securities from Time to Time when and as often as he shall think fit.

Mortgagees to be Creditors in an equal Degree.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That the several Bodies or Persons to whom such respective Securities as aforesaid shall be made or granted, and their respective Successors, Executors, Administrators, and Assigns, shall be Creditors upon the said Rates, Taxes, and Assessments thereby respectively charged therewith, in an equal Degree one with another, according to the Amount of the respective Principal Sums of Money which shall be thereby respectively secured to them; and that any One or more of the said several Bodies or Persons, or his, her, or their respective Successors, Executors, Administrators, or Assigns, shall not have any Preference over any other or others of them, or his, her, or their respective Executors, Administrators, or Assigns, by reason of any Priority in the Date of such respective Securities or any of them, or in the Time of advancing the Monies for which the same shall have been respectively given.

The Trea-

XIX. And be it enacted, That the Treasurer or Treasurers for the surer or Col- Time being of the said Commissioners, or in case of his or their Commission- default or Neglect then any Collector or Collectors of the said Comers to pay missioners, shall, upon receiving Notice in that Behalf from any Mort-the Interest, gagee or Mortgagees for the Time being entitled to any Principal and to repay Monies under or by virtue of any Security to be so granted as afore-XuJ'mT sa'^>an<^ of which Default by such Treasurer or Treasurers the Notice

to be given to any such Collector or Collectors shall be sufficient Notice. Evidence, and he and they is and are hereby authorized and required, with and out of the said Rates, Taxes, and Assessments which shall be assessed, rated, or charged by virtue of or under this Act, and which shall be so mortgaged respectively, to pay and keep down the Interest of the said several Principal Monies which shall be secured thereon respectively as aforesaid, by equal half-yearly Payments, to the several Persons entitled thereto respectively, and also to repay the Principal Money due upon any Mortgage as aforesaid on the Day or respective Days and in the Manner expressed in such Mortgage, or in case no Day shall be appointed for that Purpose in such Mortgage, or in case the I ayment of the said Principal Money shall be postponed beyond the Day or Days which shall be so appointed therein by Consent of the Person or Persons entitled to receive such Principal Money, then upon Six Months previous Notice in Writing for the Payment of such Principal Money being given to or left at the Dwelling

ing House or Office for the Time being of the Treasurer or Clerk of the said Commissioners, by or on behalf of the Person or Persons for the Time being entitled to such Mortgage, or to the Principal Money and Interest thereby secured.

XX. And be it enacted, That in case Default shall be made in the Payment of the Principal Money or Interest due and payable upon or by virtue of any Mortgage or Mortgages which shall be granted as aforesaid, on the Day or Days and in the Manner herein-before directed for the Payment thereof respectively, then and in any such Case the said Rates, Taxes, and Assessments which shall have been made liable to and charged with the Payment thereof respectively shall thereupon vest in the Mortgagee or Mortgagees to whom such Mortgage or Mortgages shall have been respectively made as aforesaid, or his or their respective Successors, Executors, Administrators, or Assigns, according to the respective Amounts of the several Principal Sums of Money secured to them respectively, until the Principal Money and Interest due to him and them respectively upon such Security or Securities shall be fully paid and satisfied to the said Mortgagee or Mortgagees, together with the Costs and Charges which shall have been occasioned by the Nonpayment of the same Principal Monies and Interest; and such Mortgagee and Mortgagees respectively, and their respective Successors, or Executors, Administrators, and Assigns, or any Person or Persons to be from Time to Time in Writing appointed for that Purpose by such Mortgagee, or by the Majority in Value of such Mortgagees, if more than One, shall and may from Time to Time, when and as the same Rates, Taxes, and Assessments shall be so vested in such Mortgagee or Mortgagees as aforesaid, have and exercise all such and the same Powers, Rights, Privileges, and Remedies for recovering, collecting, and receiving the said Rates, Taxes, and Assessments, or such of them, or such Part or Parts thereof respectively, as shall be so mortgaged or charged to them respectively as aforesaid, as the said Commissioners, or their Treasurer or Collector, would or might have had or exercised in case no such Default had been made.

XXI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That no such Mortgagee or Mortgagees as aforesaid, nor any Person to be appointed by him, her, or them to collect and receive the said Rates, Taxes, and Assessments as aforesaid, shall be answerable or accountable for more Money than he, she, or they shall actually receive for or on account of such Rates, Taxes, or Assessments, nor shall such Mortgagee or Mortgagees be answerable or accountable for any Neglect or Default of any Person or Persons to be appointed by him, her, or them to collect or receive the said Rates, Taxes, and Assessments as aforesaid, so that such Neglect or Default be not wilfully occasioned by such Mortgagee or Mortgagees.

XXII. And be it enacted, That all such Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be raised, borrowed, or received by the said Commissioners upon any such Mortgage or Mortgages as aforesaid shall be applied and disposed of by the said Commissioners from Time to Time in the Payment of the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of and

incident

Sinking Fund to be formed.

Sinking Fund to be invested and applied.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xviii.

incident to the raising and borrowing of the same, and, subject thereto, in such and the same Manner as the several Rates, Taxes, and Assessments authorized to be levied and received by virtue of this Act, and on the Security whereof such Money shall be so borrowed, would or ought to have been applied and disposed of under the Provisions of the said recited Act or of this Act in case no such Mortgage had been granted.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners shall and they are hereby required, with and out of the Rates and Taxes to be received by them under the Authority of this Act, and on the Security whereof any Principal Monies shall be due and owing, subject nevertheless and without Prejudice to the Rights and Remedies of any Mortgagee or Mortgagees for recovering Payment of his or their Principal Monies and Interest, yearly and every Year to appropriate and set apart a Sum equal to One Twentieth Part of the Principal Monies for the Time being due and owing on the Security of the same Rates and Taxes, in order that the same may be accumulated and form a Sinking Fund, and be applied for the Purpose of paying off such Principal Monies in manner herein-after directed.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners shall and they are hereby required, at some or One of their Meetings to be held under the Authority of the said recited Act or of this Act, and as soon as conveniently may be after any such Mortgage shall be made as aforesaid, to elect and appoint Three fit and proper Persons to be Trustees on behalf of the said Commissioners of the Sums of Money so herein-before directed to be appropriated and set apart and accumulated as and by way of a Sinking Fund as aforesaid; and that from Time to Time when and so often as any of the said Trustees, or any succeeding Trustee or Trustees to be appointed as herein-after mentioned, shall die, or desire to be discharged from his Trust, or refuse, neglect, or become incapable or unfit to act as such Trustees, it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners, in manner herein-before mentioned in respect to the original Appointment of Trustees, or as near thereto as may be, to elect and appoint some other fit and proper Person to act as a Trustee in the Place or Stead of every Trustee so dying, desiring to be discharged, or refusing, neglecting, or becoming incapable or unfit to act as aforesaid.

XXV. And be it enacted, That the said yearly Sums herein-before directed to be appropriated and set apart as aforesaid, and the Income thereof, shall, from Time to Time as and when the same shall be so set apart and appropriated or become payable, be invested in the Names or Name of the Trustees or Trustee for the Time being acting in execution of the Provisions of this Act, subject nevertheless and without Prejudice to the Rights and Remedies of any Mortgagee or Mortgagees as aforesaid, as and by way of a Sinking Fund in such Government Securities as the said Commissioners shall from Time to Time at any of their Meetings direct, and be transferred or varied for or into other Securities of a like Nature, when and as often as the said Commissioners shall in like Manner direct; and the said Trustee or Trustees shall stand possessed of and interested in such Securities,

and

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xviii. 189

and the annual Income thereof, upon trust to accumulate the same by investing, from Time to Time as the same shall become due, the annual Income arising from such Securities in or upon other Securities of the like Nature, and shall (subject and without Prejudice as aforesaid), from Time to Time when and as the said Commissioners at any of their said Meetings shall so order and direct, and the Fund so to be accumulated shall be of sufficient Amount, apply the same Fund in or towards the Payment of all such Monies as shall for the Time being be due and owing on the Security of the Rates and Taxes from or out of which such Fund and Accumulations shall have respectively arisen or been derived, rateably in proportion to the Amount of the several Principal Monies due thereon, if more than One.

XXVI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall be lawful Power for for such Trustees or Trustee for the Time being as aforesaid, at any Time or Times, by the Direction of the said Commissioners, in the Commis-Writing signed by the Chairman of any Meeting held by them under sioners, to the Authority of the said recited Act or of this Act, to apply the apply Sink-whole or a competent Part or Parts of the said accumulated or Sinking Fund in or towards the Payment or Discharge of the whole or any chargeofany Part of the Monies for the Time being owing on any One or more Mortgages, Mortgage or Mortgages of any Rates, Taxes, or Assessments as but not with‘ aforesaid, towards the Payment or Discharge of which such accumulated °J! or Sinking Fund is hereby made applicable, yet so nevertheless that gagees. no Mortgage or Mortgages to be either wholly or in part paid off or discharged as aforesaid, under this present Proviso, shall be so paid off" or discharged without the Consent in Writing as well of the Mortgagee or Mortgagees entitled to the same, as also of the other Mortgagee or Mortgagees (if any) for the Time being.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That the Trustees or Trustee for the Indemnity Time being of the aforesaid Sinking Fund and Investment shall be to Trustees chargeable only for so much Money as they or he shali respectively pu^nkms actually receive under or by virtue of this Act, or the Trusts or Powers aforesaid, notwithstanding their joining in Receipts for Conformity, and that they shall be respectively answerable for their own respective Acts, Receipts, Neglects, and Defaults only, and that they

or any of them shall not be answerable for any Misfortune, Loss, or Damage which may happen in the Execution of any of the aforesaid Trusts, or in relation thereto, unless the same shall happen by or through their or his wilful Neglect or Default respectively; and also that the said Trustees respectively shall and may, by and out of the Monies which shall come to their or his Hands under the Trusts and Powers aforesaid, retain to and reimburse themselves and himself respectively, and allow to their or his Co-Trustee or Co-Trustees, all such Costs, Damages, and Expenses as they or he shall respectively suffer, sustain, or be put unto on account or in consequence of the Trusts hereby in them and him reposed, or in the Execution thereof, or otherwise howsoever relating thereto.

said Commissioners for Inclosure for the Repairs of the said Roads and Ways, or any of them respectively, and all other Lands, Allotments, Drains, Banks, Forelands, and other Property vested in the said Commissioners for the Time being acting under the Authority of this Act, which in their Judgment are not required for the several Purposes of this and the said recited Act; and upon every such Sale, and Payment of the Purchase Money as aforesaid, there shall be delivered to the Purchaser or Purchasers, together with such Receipt, a Certificate in Writing under the Hands of Three or more of the said last-mentioned Commissioners, certifying the Sale of the Premises therein mentioned to such Purchaser or Purchasers, and the Amount of the Purchase Money for the same j and such Certificate shall be duly stamped for denoting the Payment of the full and proper ad valorem Stamp Duty payable on a Deed of Conveyance on the Sale of Property for the like Amount of Purchase Money, and thereupon the several Premises so certified to be sold as aforesaid shall thenceforth by the Authority of this Act become, be, and remain fully and absolutely vested in such Purchaser or Purchasers who shall be named in such Certificate, and his or their Heirs and Assigns, or in some Person or Persons to be named in such Certificate, and his or their Heirs and Assigns, in trust for the Purchaser or Purchasers of the said Premises, and his or their Heirs and Assigns for ever; and all and singular the Monies to arise and be produced by any such Sale as aforesaid, after Payment of the Charges and Expenses attending such Sale, shall be applied by the said Commissioners in the Manner herein-before directed concerning the Rates and Taxes by this Act authorized to be levied for the Purposes of the said Roads.

XXXVII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That before any Premises to such Sale or Disposition of any such Premises as last mentioned shall be first be made to any other Person the said Commissioners shall offer to ^nerVot'*16 sell and dispose of the same to the Owner or reputed Owner of any ti,e adjoining of the Lands thereto adjoining (the Owner or reputed Owner of the Lands, greatest Quantity of Land adjoining thereto having the Preference or Pre-emption), and the Price or Purchase Money for the same shall be adjusted and settled by and between the said Commissioners and such Owner or reputed Owner in such Manner as they and he shall mutually agree; and if no such Owner or reputed Owner shall agree to purchase the same in manner aforesaid within the Space of Fourteen Days from the Time at which such Offer shall be made to him by the said Commissioners (of which Fact any Writing under the Hands of any Three of the said Commissioners shall be sufficient Evidence), then and in every such Case the Premises so offered for Sale as aforesaid shall and may be sold and disposed of by the said Commissioners to any Person or Persons whomsoever, and in manner herein-before mentioned.

Penalty for

XXXVIII. And be it enacted, That if the Occupier or Occupiers not cleansing of any of the Lands lying within the said Marshland Smeeth, and Ditches or Marshland Fen, or in Well Moor, Broad Fen and Short Fen, to making Tun- whjc|j any Droveway Ditch, Outring Ditch, or Division Ditch doth or shall belong, or which shall be bounded by any Soak or Fence Ditch, made or to be made at the Back ^ of any of the Banks or Works belonging to the said Commissioners, shall neglect or refuse sufficiently to rode, scour, cleanse, open, or repair such Ditch, or to make the same of a sufficient Depth, and of the Width of Eight Feet Three Inches at the Top and Three Feet Six Inches at least at the Bottom, or to make, keep, and repair a sufficient Tunnel for the Passage of Waters in or under any Gateway or Roadway, in, over, or across such Ditch, after Fourteen Days Notice in Writing given to him, her, or them, or left at his, her, or their usual or last Place of Abode, from Time to Time for that Purpose, by the Superintendent or any other Officer of the said Commissioners, or by any Person employed by the said Commissioners for that Purpose, such Occupier or Occupiers respectively shall for every such Neglect or Refusal forfeit and pay to the said Commissioners as a Penalty the Sum of Two Shillings for every Rod so neglected to be roded, scoured, cleansed, opened, deepened, and widened as aforesaid, and the Sum of Twenty Shillings for every Tunnel so neglected to be made, kept, or repaired as aforesaid; and it shall be lawful from Time to Time for such Superintendent or other Officer or Person employed as aforesaid to cause such Ditch, at the Expense and Charge of such Occupier or Occupiers respectively, to be roded, scoured, cleansed, opened, repaired, and deepened in a sufficient Manner, and made of the Width aforesaid, and such Tunnel to be made or repaired as aforesaid, and by Warrant or Precept under the Hands of Three or more of the said Commissioners to levy such Penalty, and also all such Charges and Expenses as shall be paid or incurred by the said Commissioners or any of their Officers in or about the Premises, upon such Occupier or Occupiers, by Distress and Sale of his, her, or their Goods and Chattels; and such Penalty and Charges, when so levied and recovered, shall be paid to and applied by the said Commissioners, for the Purposes of the said recited Act and this Act, in such Manner as they shall at any of their Meetings order and direct.

Power for

XXXIX. Provided also, and be it enacted, That in case the said Commission- Commissioners shall at any Time or Times be of opinion that it is Dimensions'6 unnccessar)’ i*1 the said Marshland Smeeth to make any Droveway in certain Ditches, Outring Ditches, or Division Ditches of the Dimensions Cases. herein-before specified, then and in such Case it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners to make such Order as they may think fit, directing the same to be made of smaller Dimensions in the said Marshland Smeeth, but not elsewhere; and every such Order shall be conclusive and binding, as fully, to all Intents and Purposes, as if the same were Part of this Act.

Appeal.

XL. Provided further, and be it enacted .That if any Person shall think himself aggrieved by any Rate made or by anything done in pursuance of the said recited Act or this Act, anti for which no particular Method of Relief hath been already appointed, such Person

may

195

12° VICTORIA, Cup.xviii.

may appeal to the Justices at the next General or Quarter Sessions of the Peace to be held for the County wherein the Cause of such Complaint shall arise, such Appellant first giving or causing to be given to the said Commissioners or their Clerk Notice in Writing of his Intention to bring such Appeal, together with a Statement in Writing of the Grounds of such Appeal, within Fourteen Days after Payment of such Rate shall have been demanded or Cause of Complaint shall have arisen, and within Four Days after such Notice entering into a Recognizance before some Justice, with Two sufficient Sureties, conditioned to try such Appeal at and abide the Order of and pay such Costs as shall be awarded by the Justices at such General or Quarter Sessions; and such Justices, upon hearing and finally determining the Matter of such Appeal, shall and may, accord-ding to their Discretion, award such Costs to the Party appealing or appealed against as they shall think proper, and their Determination in or concerning the Premises shall be conclusive and binding on all Parties to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever: Provided nevertheless, that in case there shall not be Time to give such Notice and enter into such Recognizance as aforesaid before the next Sessions to be holden after Payment of any Rate shall have been demanded or the Cause of Complaint shall have arisen, then and in every such Case such Appeal may be made to the next following Sessions, and shall be then heard and determined : Provided also, that it shall not be lawful for the Appellant to be heard in support of such Appeal unless such Notice and Statement shall have been given as aforesaid, nor on the Hearing of such Appeal to go into Evidence of any other Grounds of Appeal than those set forth in such Statement as aforesaid.

XLI. And be it enacted, That in all Cases of Appeal against any Rate or Assessment made in pursuance of this Act the several Provisions and Enactments contained in a certain Act made and passed in the Forty-first Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Third, intituled An Act for the better Collection of the Rates made for the Relief of the Poor, shall be applicable thereto, so far as the Circumstances will admit thereof, as if the same had been repeated and re-enacted in this Act with respect to such Appeal.

XLII. And be it enacted, That the Costs and Charges of obtaining and passing this Act, and all other Costs, Charges, and Expenses whatsoever preparatory or incidental to or concerning this Act, shall be paid and discharged by the said Commissioners, in preference to every other Payment whatsoever, by and out of the first Rates, Taxes, or other Monies which shall come into their Hands or be at their Disposal under the Authority of the said recited Act or this Act, or either of them.

XLIII. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, or in Pleadings, legal Instruments, or other Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Marshland Smeeth and Fen (Drainage Rate and Road District) Act, 1849."

XLIV. And be it enacted, That nothing contained in this Act, or in the Act herein recited or referred to, shall extend or be deemed

Provision of 41 G. 3. c. 23. applicable to this Act.

Expenses of Act.

[Short Title.]

Saving the Rights of the Crown.

Public

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xviii.

or construed to extend to prejudice, diminish, alter, or take away any of the Rights, Privileges, Powers, Prerogatives, or Authorities vested in or enjoyed by Her Majesty, Her Heirs or Successors.

Act.

XLV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be and shall be deemed and taken to be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. xix.

An Act for enabling the North-western Railway Company to make an Extension of the Lancaster Branch of their Railway, and a new Road to Settle Station, and to abandon the William Lands Branch; and for other Purposes.

[24th May 1849.]

9 & 10 Vict, c. 92.

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for making a Railway from the Leedsand Bradford Extension Railway to the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway, with a diverging Line therefrom to Lancaster, to he called " The North-western Railway," whereby a Company was incorporated called " The North-western Railway Company And whereas another Act was passed in the same Session, intituled An Act for making « 9 & iov-ct. Harbour and Docks at Heysham on Morecambe Bay in the County c. 18+. of Lancaster, and a Railway in connexion therewith, whereby a Company was incorporated called " The Morecambe Harbour and Railway " Company And whereas under or by virtue of the Powers and Provisions of the said last-recited Act the Undertaking of the said Morecambe Harbour and Railway Company has become vested in the [Local.] 3 D said

198

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xix.

said North-western Railway Company: And whereas another Act was ll & 12 Vict, passed in the last Session of Parliament, intituled An Act for enabling c. 22. the North-western Railway Company to make certain Alterations and Diversions in the Main Line of their Railway at Skipton, Caslerton, and Sedbergh, and in the Lancaster Branch of their Radway at Bulk: And whereas it is expedient that the said North-western Railway Company should be authorized to make the Extension of the Lancaster Branch of their Railway, and the new Road to the Settle Station of the said Railway, herein-after mentioned, and to abandon so much of the Branch Railway called " The William Lands Branch" as will become useless in consequence of the Construction of the said Extension Line : And whereas it is also expedient that the Time granted by the recited Acts for the compulsory Purchase of Lands and Houses, and for the Completion of the Works, should be extended, and that some of the Powers and Provisions of the said recited Acts should be amended and enlarged; but the Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, Extending and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions contained Provisions of;n yle sajfj recited Acts, so far as the same are or may be applicable to'his Act*8 anc* now 'n force> an(] except such of them as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, shall extend to this Act, and to the several Purposes thereof, and to the several Matters and Things hereby authorized to be done, as fully and effectually as if the said Provisions were re-enacted in this Act in reference to such Purposes, Matters, and Things, and the said recited Acts and this Act shall be construed and read together as forming One Act.

Power to make Railway and Road according to deposited Plans.

II. And whereas Plans and Sections of the proposed Extension and of the proposed new Road, together with a Book of Reference to the said Plans containing the Names of the reputed Owners and Lessees and of the Occupiers of the Lands which may be required to be taken for the Purposes thereof, have been deposited with the respective Clerks of the Peace for the County of Lancaster and the West Riding of the County of York : Be it enacted, That, subject to the Powers of Deviation contained in the Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, and to the Provisions herein-after contained, it shall be lawful for the Company to make and maintain the said Extension of the Lancaster Branch of the said Railway and the said new Road, with proper Works and Conveniences connected therewith, respectively in the Lines and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans and referred to in the said Books of Reference so deposited as aforesaid, and according to the Levels defined on the said Sections, and to enter upon, takefand use such of the said Lands as may be required for such Purposes.

III. And be it enacted, That the said Extension Line of Railway shall commence at or near the Lancaster Station of the said Northwestern Railway in the Township of Lancaster in the Parish of Lancaster, and shall terminate at or near the Castle Station of and on the East Side of the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway in the Township of Lancaster aforesaid, all in the said County of Lancaster.

199

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xix.

IV. And be it enacted, That the said Company shall and they are Power to hereby required to abandon the Formation of so much of the Branch pbJ‘"io°not-Line of Railway commencing from the Main Line of the Alorecambe L;ne of Rail-Harbour Railway at or near Poulton-le-Sands, and terminating by a way. Junction with the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway at or near William

Lands in the Township of Slyne-with- Hest, as authorized to be constructed by the said Morecmnbe Harbour and Railway Act, 1846, as will become useless and unnecessary in consequence of the Construction of the Extension Line of Railway herein-before mentioned.

V. Provided always, and be it enacted, That in any Case where Compensa-before the passing of this Act any Contract hath been entered into ^"jg°w|®re or Notice given by the Company for purchasing any Lands which Contract5 the Company were by the said " Morecambe Harbour and Railway have been

" Act, 1846," empowered to purchase, for the Purpose of constructing entered into the Portion of the said Railway so authorized to be abandoned as Notice* aforesaid, the Company shall make to the Owners or Occupiers ofB''cn’ and other Parties interested in such Lands full Compensation for all Injury or Damage sustained by such Owners, Occupiers, and other Parties, by reason of such Purchase not being completed pursuant to such Contract or Notice; and the Amount and Application of such Compensation shall be determined in the Manner provided by the Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, for determining the Amount and Application of the Compensation to be paid for Lands taken under the Provisions thereof: Provided also, that the Authority hereby given for abandoning the Formation of the aforesaid Portion of the said Railway shall not prejudice or affect the Right of the Owner or Occupier of any Lands which the Company were so empowered to purchase as aforesaid to receive from the Company Compensation for any Damage that may have been occasioned by the Entry of the Company upon such Lands for the Purpose of surveying and taking Levels, and of probing or boring to ascertain the Nature of the Soil, or of setting out the Line of the Railway, pursuant to the Provisions for that Purpose in the Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, contained.

VI. And be it enacted, That the said Road shall commence at or Line of near Beggarwaith Bridge otherwise Beggarwifc Bridge in the Parish Road-of Giggleswick in the West Riding of the County of York at or near

to the Point of Junction of a certain Road or Highway there which leads from or towards Paley Green in the Parish of Giggleswick aforesaid with a certain other Road or Highway in the said Parish of Giggleswick which leads from the Village of Rathmel in the said last-mentioned Parish to or towards the Village of Giggleswick in the said Parish of Giggleswick, and shall terminate at or in the Town of Settle in the Parish of Giggleswick aforesaid at or near to the Point of Junction of a certain Yard there called Clarkson’s Yard with the Main Street called Duke Street otherwise Duck Street in the Town of Settle aforesaid, all in the West Riding of the County of York.

VII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Lands for to purchase any Quantity of Land for extraordinary Purposes, not ex!ra‘

Limiting Period for Purchase of Lands.
