12° VICTORIA?, Cap.*ix.

exceeding Ten Acres, in addition to the Lands which the Company are authorized by the said recited Acts to take for such Purposes.

VIII. And be it enacted, That the Powers of the Company for the compulsory Purchase of Lands for the Purposes of this Act shall not be exercised after the Expiration of three Years from the passing of this Act.

IX. And be it enacted, That the said Railway, Road, and Works hereby authorized shall be completed within live Years from the pass jig of this Act, and on the Expiration of such Period the Powers by this or the said former Acts granted to the Company for executing the same shall cease to be exercised, except as to so much of the same as shall then be completed.

X. And be it enacted, That the said Company shall and they are hereby required to construct, complete, and open for public Traffic the whole of the said Extension Line of Railway (together with all necessary Works and Conveniences to be connected therewith) on or before the Sixteenth Day of July One thousand eight hundred and fifty-one, and shall and they are hereby required for ever after that Date to maintain and keep the same in perfect Order and Repair; and that such Extension Line of Railway (as regards Construction and Character of the Railway and Works) shall be and shall from Time to Time be maintained, altered, and continued (as the Case may be) at least equal in all respects from Time to Time to the other Portion of Railway between Lancaster and Skipton authorized by the said recited Acts, or One of them; and it shall not be lawful for the said North-western Railway Company, or the Directors thereof, to make or declare, or pay to any Proprietor of any Share in the North-western Railway, any Dividend or Interest (or any Money in lieu of or in the Nature of Dividend or Interest) after the Sixteenth Day of July One thousand eight hundred and fifty-one, unless and until the said Extension Line of Railway by this Act authorized shall have been constructed, completed, and opened in the Manner hereinbefore directed.

XI. And be it enacted, That all Communications between the said Extension Line of Railway and the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway shall be effected in a substantial and workmanlike Manner, by means of Connexion Rails, Switches, and Points, of the Construction and shall be laid and maintained in the Manner most approved from Time to Time, and to the entire Satisfaction of the Engineer for the Time being of the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway Company; and all the Switches or Points for effecting such Junction as aforesaid shall be laid down arid maintained so as to join the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway on the existing Level thereof, and within Sixty Feet of the Spot marked B. upon the said iJan as denoting the said Junction between the said Railways, and not on any other Level or at any greater Distance from that Spot, without "the Consent of the said Lancaster and Carlisle Railway Company, under their Common Seal.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xix. 201

XII. And be it enacted, That the said Company shall and they are Company to hereby required from Time to Time to provide, appoint, and pay provide pro-proper Persons to watch and superintend, by Day and by Night, the Peern

said Communications between the said Extension Line and the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway, so as always to keep the Points of Communication in the right Direction, and otherwise to prevent any Injury or Inconvenience therefrom to the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway Company, or any Impediment to the Traffic upon or along the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway.

XIII. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Companynot North-western Railway Company (except with the Consent of the |°t^'tp^ere Lancaster and Carlisle Railway Company under their Common Seal) |iertyof"

to take for the Purposes of this or of the said recited Acts, or of any Lancaster of them, any of the Land or Property of the said Lancaster and and Carlisle Carlisle Railway Company, or which they may under any Act of 1ji,luay Parliament have the Right to purchase, nor shall it be lawful for the ^bout^ said North-western Railway Company or any Person (except with Consent, such Consent as aforesaid) in any Manner to enter upon or use any such Land, or to alter, vary, or interfere, for the Purposes of this Act or of the said recited Acts, or any of them, with the said Lancaster and Carlisle Railway, or any of the Works appertaining thereto, save only for the Purpose of effecting the Junctions hereby authorized in the Manner aforesaid.

XIV. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act, or in the said Saving recited Acts, or any of them, contained, shall prejudice, diminish, or

take away any of the Rights, Privileges, Powers, Franchises, or a,j Carlisle Authorities of or vested in or belonging to the said Lancaster and Itailway Carlisle Railway Company under or by virtue of any Act of Par- Company, liament, but all their Rights, Powers, Franchises, and Authorities under their several Acts of Parliament are hereby expressly saved and reserved.

XV. And whereas the said proposed Railway will pass through As to Appli-Part of the Glebe Lands in the Township of Lancaster belonging to nation of the Vicarage of Lancaster, whereof George Marton of Capernwray jx^ne^aml Hall, Esquire, is now Patron, and the Reverend Joseph Turner Master Compeii-" of Arts is Vicar, and it is expedient to provide for the Application of sation in the Purchase Money and Compensation to be paid in respect of the respect of the said Lands: Be it therefore enacted, That in the Conveyance by the said Vicar or his Successors to' the said Company of any Lands the Vicarage belonging to the said Vicarage of Lancaster, or any Interest therein, of Lancaster. the Purchase and Compensation Money which shall be payable in respect of the same may be lawfully paid to Two Trustees, to be nominated by the said Vicar or his Successors, with the Consent of the Ordinary and Patron for the 'Lime being, such Nomination and Consent to be signed in Writing under the Hands of the said Vicar and Ordinary and Patron, and it is hereby declared that the said Trustees, or the Survivor of them, or the Executors or Administrators of such Survivor, shall, at the Request of the said Vicar or his Successors, with such Consents as aforesaid, pay and apply any Part, not exceeding One Half, of the said Purchase or Compensation Money, in \Local.~\ 3 E erecting

XVI. And be it enacted, That the respective Periods limited by the said recited Acts for the Purchase or taking of Lands for the Purposes of the Railways and Works thereby respectively authorized shall, as regards the Lands mentioned in the Schedule to this Act annexed, he and the same are hereby accordingly extended for a Period of Three Years from the passing of this Act.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the respective Periods limited by the said recited Acts for the Completion of the Railways and Works thereby authorized shall be and the same are hereby accordingly extended for a Period of Five Years from the passing of this Act.

XVIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Justices, Arbitrators, Umpires, or Juries respectively, as the Case may be, who, under the Provisions of the said recited Acts, shall award or assess the Compensation to be made by the Company to the Owners or Occupiers of or other Persons interested in any of the Lands mentioned in the Schedule to this Act annexed, which shall be taken or used for the Purposes of the Railways or Works by the said recited Acts authorized, or which may be injuriously affected by the Construction thereof, shall in estimating the Amount of such Compensation have regard to and make Compensation for the additional Damage (if any) sustained by such Owners, Occupiers, or other Persons by reason of the Extension hereby authorized of the respective Periods aforesaid.

XIX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Extension hereby authorized of the respective Periods aforesaid shall not in anywise prejudice or affect any Contract entered into or Notice given by the said Company betbre the passing of this Act for purchasing, taking, or using any Lands which under the said recited Acts such Company is entitled to purchase, take, or use, but every such Contract and Notice respectively shall be construed and shall take effect, and the same Proceedings shall be had thereunder, and all Parties thereto

203

12° VICTORIA, Cap.*ix.

shall be entitled to the same Rights and Remedies in respect thereof, both at Law and in Equity, as if such Extension of the said respective Periods had not been authorized as aforesaid.

XX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to enter into such Contracts and Agreements with the Leeds and Bradford, the Midland, and the Lancaster and Carlisle Railway Companies, or any or either of them, as shall be mutually deemed expedient for or in respect of the Working, Use, and Occupation of their respective Railways, and the several Stations and Conveniences connected therewith, and for and in respect of the Appropriation of any Part of any of such Stations to the exclusive or particular Use of any of the said Companies respectively, and for or in respect of the Interchange of Traffic upon the Railways belonging to the said Companies or any of them, and generally for and in respect of all such Matters and Things as may be necessary or desirable for the mutual Convenience and Accommodation of the said Companies respectively.

XXI. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Company, out of any Money by any existing Act relating to the said Railway Company authorized to be raised for the Purposes of such Act, to pay or deposit any Sum of Money which by any Standing Order of either House of Parliament, now in force or hereafter to be in force, may be required to be deposited in respect of any Application to Parliament for the Purpose of obtaining an Act authorizing the said Company to construct any other Railway or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

XXII. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of the Ileign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide for the Conveyance of the Mails by Railways; and another Act was passed in the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act

for regulating Railways; and another Act was passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for the better Regulation of Railways, and for the Conveyance of Troops; and another Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Conditions to the Construction of future Railways authorized or to be authorized by any Act of the present or succeeding Sessions of Parliament, and for other Purposes in relation to Railways; and another Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways; and another Act was passed in the same Session, intituled An Act for constituting Commissioners of Railways: Be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall be held to exempt the said Railway and Works or the said Company from the Provisions of the said several Acts respectively, but that such Provisions shall be in force in respect to the said Railway and Works and Company, so far as the same are applicable.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Railway by this or the said recited

Power to enter into Agreements with the Leeds and Bradford Railway Company, &c. for Use of Stations.

Deposits for future Bills not to be paid out of the Company’s Capital.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xix.

recited Acts authorized to be made, or the Company, from the Provisions of any general Act relating to such Acts, or of any general Act relating to Railways, or to the better and more impartial Audit of the Accounts of Railway Companies, now in force or which may hereafter pass during this or any future Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision or Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament, of the maximum Rates of Fares and Charges authorized by the said recited Acts or this Act.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of and attending the passing of this Act or incidental thereto shall be paid by the said Company out of the first Monies that shall come to their Hands, and in preference to any other Payment whatsoever.

XXV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments and other Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to refer to and describe it by the Title of " The Northwestern Railway (Extension of Lancaster Branch, &c.) Act, 1849."

XXVI. And be it enacted, That nothing contained in this Act or in the Acts herein recited or referred to shall extend to authorize the Company to purchase, take, or use any Land or Soil, or any Rights in respect thereof, belonging to Her Majesty in right of Her Crown, without the Consent in Writing of the Commissioners for the Time being of Her Majesty's Woods, Forests, Land Revenues, Works, and Buildings, or any Two of them, first had and obtained for that Purpose, and which such Commissioners, or any Two of them, are hereby authorized and empowered to give, or to prejudice, diminish, alter, or take away any of the Rights, Privileges, Powers, or Authorities vested in or enjoyed by Her Majesty, Her Heirs or Successors.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xix,

PART II.

No. on Plans and Books of Reference referred to in the " Morecambe Harbour and Railway Act, 1846." Present Description. Present Owner or reputed Owner. Present Lessee reputed Lessee. Present Occupier.

ANNO DUODECIMO

VICTORIAE REGINAE.

Cap. xx.

An Act for authorizing the Bradford Waterworks Company to raise a further Sum of Money.

[24th May 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Fifth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for better 5 & 6 Vict. supplying with Water the Town and Neighbourhood of c. 6. Bradford in the West Riding of the County of York, whereby a Company was incorporated called " The Bradford Waterworks Company And whereas under the Provisions of the said Act the said Company were authorized to raise by the Issue of Shares the Sum of Forty-four thousand Pounds, and to borrow the further Sum of Fourteen thousand five hundred Pounds upon Mortgage for the Purposes of the said Act, and which said Sums have been raised and applied accordingly : And whereas in exercise of the Powers contained in the said Act the Bradford Waterworks Company have constructed extensive Works for the Purposes in the said Act mentioned, but the Necessities of the Town and Neighbourhood of Bradford require that such Works should be extended and enlarged, and the Capital which the said Company is authorized to raise under the Powers of the said Act is greatly insufficient to meet the additional Outlay necessary for such Purpose, and it is expedient that the said Capital should be increased, but the same cannot be done without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it [Locn/.] 3 /S' enacted

254

Powers of recited Act to extend to this Act, except as hereby-altered.

Powers to raise additional Capital by the Creation of new Shares.

New Shares to be considered same as original Shares.

If old Shares at a Premium new Shares to be offered to original Shareholders.

12° VICTORIA, Cup.xx.

enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in the said recited Act, and now remaining in force, (except such as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for,) shall extend to this Act, and to the Objects, Purposes, and Things hereby authorized or required to be effected and done, in the same Manner as if such Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act with express Reference to the aforesaid Objects, Purposes, and Things.

II. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Bradford Waterworks Company from Time to Time, by an Order of any Meeting of the Proprietors thereof specially convened for the Purpose, to raise, by creating and disposing of new Shares, in addition to any Sums which they are already authorized to raise under and by virtue of the said recited Act, any further Sum not exceeding Twenty-seven thousand five hundred Pounds, and which said Sum is to be applicable to the Objects and Purposes of the said recited Act and this Act.

III. And be it enacted, That the Capital so to be raised by the Creation of new Shares shall be considered as Part of the General Capital of the said Company, and such new Capital and new Shares shall be subject to the same Provisions in all respects, whether with reference to the Payment of Calls, or the Forfeiture of Shares on Nonpayment of Calls, or otherwise, as if such Capital had been Part of the original Capital, except as to the Number and Amount of the Shares into which such new Capital shall be divided, which shall be subject to the Provisions herein-after contained, and except as to the Times of making Calls in respect of such new Shares, and the Amount of such Calls, which respectively it shall be lawful for the Directors of the said Company from Time to Time to fix as they shall think fit.

IV. And be it enacted, That if at the Time of any Augmentation of Capital taking place by the Creation of new Shares the then existing Shares of the Capital Stock of the Company be at a Premium, or of greater actual Value than the nominal Value thereof, then the Sum so to be raised shall, subject to the Provisions herein-after contained, be divided into Shares or Stock of such Amount as will conveniently allow the said Sum to be apportioned among the then Shareholders in proportion to the existing Shares held by them respectively, or as near thereto as may be; and an Offer of such new Shares or Stock shall be made by Letter under the Hand of the Clerk of the Company given or sent by Post to each Shareholder, or left at his usual or last Place of Abode; and such new Shares shall vest in and belong to the Shareholders who shall accept the same, and pay the Value thereof to the Company at the Times or Time and by the Instalments which shall be fixed by the Directors of the said Company; and if any Shareholder fail for One Month after such Offer of new Shares to accept the same, and pay the Instalments called for in respect thereof, it shall be lawful for the Directors of the said Company to dispose of such Shares to any Party willing to become the Purchaser thereof for such Sum as

the

25 5

12° VICTORIA, Cap. xx.

the Company can obtain for the same; and every such Offer made by Letter sent by the Post shall be considered as made on the Day when such Letter shall be committed to the Post Office.

V. And whereas the existing Capital of the Company consists of original Shares of the nominal Value of Twenty Pounds each, and new Quarter Shares of the nominal Value of Five Pounds each, and some of the Proprietors of the last-mentioned Shares hold an uneven Number thereof, and the Division of the Capital by this Act authorized to be raised into Shares of such a nominal Value as would admit of an equal Distribution of such Shares amongst all the Proprietors of the Company would be attended with considerable Inconvenience and Expense : Be it enacted, That so much of the Capital Stock by this Act authorized to be created as the Proprietors of less than Four new Quarter Shares, or of any Number of new Quarter Shares over and above Four, or (as the Case may be) over and above any Number equally divisible by Four, would, but for this Provision, be entitled to receive in respect thereof, shall be disposed of by the Directors of the said Company in such Manner as shall appear to them best adapted for securing to the said Proprietors their relative Proportion of the Value of such Stock.

VI. And be it enacted, That if at any Time of such Augmentation of Capital taking place the existing Shares of the Capital Stock of the Company be not at a Premium, then such new Shares may be of such Amount, and may be issued in such Manner, and may be sold and disposed of at such Price, and payable at such Times and by such Instalments, as the Directors of the said Company shall think fit.

VII. And be it enacted, That any Number of Shares in the Capital of the Company for the Time being, the aggregate nominal Amount whereof shall be equal to the nominal Amount of an original Share in the Capital of the said Company of the nominal Value of Twenty Pounds, shall entitle the Holder of such Shares to the same Powers, Rights, Privileges, and Qualifications in respect thereof as the Holder of an original Share in the said Capital is entitled to in respect of such original Share, and so in proportion for all the Shares held by the same Proprietor.

VIII. And be it enacted, That after the whole of the Capital by this Act authorized to be raised shall have been subscribed, and One Half of the Capital of the Company for the Time being shall have been paid up, it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage such Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be authorized to be borrowed by Order of a General Meeting of the Company specially convened for the Purpose, not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds, and to secure the Payment of the Sums so to be borrowed, with Interest, by Mortgage of the Undertaking of the said Company.

IX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages granted under the Provisions of the said recited Act, and which may be in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall have Priority over all Mortgages to be granted under the Powers of this Act.

Disposition of Shares in respect of old 5l. Shares.

If existing Shares not at a Premium new ones to be issued as the Company may think fit.

New Shares to confer same Privileges as original Shares in the Proportion to their nominal Value.

Power to borrow on Mortgage.

Former Mortgagees to have Priority.

256 12° VICTORIA, Cap. xx.

Application

X. And be it enacted, That the Monies to be raised by virtue of of Monies, this ^ct siian be ]ajj 0llt ancj applied, in the first jdace, and in preference to any other Payment, in paying and discharging all Costs and Expenses incurred in passing this Act, and the Residue in promoting the Purposes and Objects of the said recited Act and of this Act.

Nothing

XI. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be

herein to ex- jeeme(] or construed to exempt the said Company from the Provisions pany from of " The Public Health Act, 1848," or of any general Act relating Provisions of thereto, or to the Subject Matter thereof, which may pass during the l i & 12 Vict, present or any future Session of Parliament.

Interpreta-

XII. And be it enacted, That in construing this Act Words import-Xe" ing the Masculine Gender shall include Females, and Words importing

the Singular Number shall include the Plural Number, and Words importing the Plural Number shall include the Singular Number, unless there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Construction.

[Short Title.]

XIII. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in Parliamentary and legal Instruments and Proceedings it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Bradford Waterworks Amendment Act, 1849."

[Public Act.]

XIV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGIME.

An Act for incorporating the Bury Saint Edmund's Gas Company, and for better supplying the Town and Borough of Bury Saint Edmund's in the County of Suffolk with Gas.

WHEREAS certain Persons some Years since formed themselves into an Association or Company for the Purpose of supplying with Gas the Town and Borough of Bury Saint Edmund's in the County of Suffolk, and for that Purpose erected Gasworks and other Conveniences for the Manufacture of Gas, and laid down Mains and Pipes in the public Streets and Places of the said Town and Borough, at their own Costs: And whereas certain other Persons have lately agreed to form themselves into a Company under the Title of " The Bury Saint Edmund’s Gas Company," and are desirous of being incorporated for the Purpose of more effectually lighting the said Town and Borough with Gas, and of having certain Powers granted to them for carrying on their Undertaking, but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the

Cap. xxi.

[26th June 1849.]

[Loca/.]

3 T

Advice

r

258

8 & 9 Vict, c. 16. and

10 & 11 Vict, c. 15. incorporated with this Act.

Construction of Terms:

* the Undertaking :*

" Quarter Sessions."

[Short Title.]

8 & 9 Vict, c. 18. incorporated with this Act.

Nothing to authorize Company to take Lands without Consent.

Limits of Act.

Company incorporated.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxi.

Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the several Acts of Parliament following, (that is to say,) "The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," and " The Gasworks Clauses Act, 1847," shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act, except so far as the same are inconsistent with the Provisions of this Act, or are herein-after expressly varied or altered.

II. And be it enacted, That in construing this Act, and the several Acts incorporated herewith, the Expression " the Undertaking" shall mean as well the Gasworks and other Works connected therewith by this Act authorized to be purchased and constructed, as also the Gasworks, and other Works, Matters, and Things, vested in the said Company by this Act; and the Expression "the Undertakers" shall mean the Company incorporated by this Act.

III. And be it enacted, That the Expression "Quarter Sessions" in the said incorporated Acts shall be construed to mean and refer to the Quarter Sessions of the Peace for the Borough of Bury Saint Edmutid's.

IV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Bury Saint Edmund's Gas Act, 1849."

V. And be it enacted, That " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act; and the Provisions of the said Lands Clauses Consolidation Act shall be applicable to the Undertaking hereby authorized, except as hereinafter mentioned.

VI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing in the said Lands Clauses Consolidation Act contained shall authorize the Company hereby constituted to take or use any Land, unless with the Consent of and by Agreement with the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers thereof.

VII. And be it enacted, That the Limits of this Act shall extend to and include all Places within the Town and Borough of Bury Saint Edmund's in the County of Suffolk.

VIII. And be it enacted, That Robert Bevan, George Moor, Francis King Eagle, Charles Beard, David Goldsmith, Henry Newson, and all other Persons and Corporations who have already subscribed or shall hereafter subscribe to the said Undertaking, and their several and respective Executors, Administrators, Successors, and Assigns, shall be united into a Company for the Purpose of making and supplying Gas within the Limits of this Act, and for maintaining the existing Gasworks, or erecting new ones, with proper Works and Conveniences connected therewith, according to the Provisions in this and the said incorporated Acts contained; and for the Purposes aforesaid such Company shall be incorporated by the Name of " The Bury Saint Edmund's Gas Company," and by that Name shall be a Body Corporate,

259

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxi.

porate, with perpetual Succession, and shall and may sue and be sued, and shall have Power to purchase and hold Lands, for the Purposes of the said Undertaking.

IX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful Power to for the Company to purchase or hold for the Purposes of the Under- J"ftej*nds taking more than Ten Acres of Land.

X. And be it enacted, That the Capital of the Company shall be Amount of

Twelve thousand Pounds. Capital.

XI. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shares into which the Shares, said Capital shall be divided shall be Twelve hundred, and the Amount of each Share shall be Ten Pounds.

XII. And be it enacted, That Two Pounds per Share shall be the Calls, greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make upon the Shareholders, and that Three Fifths of the Amount of a Share shall be the utmost aggregate Amount of the Calls to be made in any One Year upon any Share, and that Two Months at the least shall intervene between successive Calls.

XIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Power to to borrow on Mortgage or Bond any Sums of Money not exceeding b°rro''r in the whole the Sum of Four thousand Pounds, including the Sum Mortgage of Two thousand five hundred Pounds herein-after mentioned, or so D much thereof as for the Time being shall have been borrowed and remain due, but no Part of such Sum of Four thousand Pounds shall be raised until the whole of the said Capital or Sum of Twelve thousand Pounds shall have been subscribed for, and One Half thereof shall have been actually paid up.

XIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mortgagees Arrears may of the Company to enforce the Payment of the Arrears of Principal be enforced and Interest due on any such Mortgages by the Appointment of a ^p0f°mt’ Receiver; and in order to authorize the Appointment of such Re- Receiver, ceiver in the event of the Principal Monies not being duly paid, the Amount owing to the Mortgagees by whom Application for such Receiver shall be made shall not be less than Two thousand Pounds

in the whole.

XV. And be it enacted, That the First Ordinary Meeting of the First and Company shall be held within Two Months next after the passing of other Meet-this Act, and the subsequent Ordinary Meetings of the Company inSs-shall be held on the Second Friday in the Months of February and August in every Year, and the First of such Ordinary Meetings shall be held at the Gasworks in the Town and Borough of Bury Saint Edmund's aforesaid, and all such Meetings (whether ordinary or extraordinary) shall be held in the said Town oi Bury Saint Edmund’s.

XVI. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shareholders on Number of

whose Requisition any Extraordinary Meeting may be required to be Shareholders convened shall be Five Shareholders holding in the aggregate not ExmmrdT less than Five hundred Pounds in the Capital of the Company. nar, Meet-

XVII. And ing.

260

Scale of Voting.

Number and Qualification of Directors.

Power to vary the Number of the Directors.

First Directors.

The Amount of reserved Fund.

On Payment of 8,500/., the present Gasworks and other Property of the former Company to vest in the new Company.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxi.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Scale according to which Shareholders may vote in respect of their Shares shall be as follows; that is to say,

For One Share or more, but not exceeding Five, One Vote;

For more than Five Shares, but not exceeding Ten, Two Votes;

For more than Ten Shares, an additional Vote for every Five Shares:

Provided always, that no Person shall have more than I wenty Votes, notwithstanding any Number of Shares that he may hold.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions herein contained for increasing or reducing the Number of Directors, the Number of Directors shall be Nine; and the Qualification of a Director shall be the Possession in his own Right of Ten Shares or more in the Undertaking.

XIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time to increase or reduce the Number of Directors of the Company, but the whole Number of Directors, after such an Increase or Reduction as aforesaid, shall not be greater than Nine nor less than Six.

XX. And be it enacted, That Robert Bevnn, George Moor, Francis King Eagle, Charles Beard, David Goldsmith, and Henry Newson, shall be the First Directors of the Company for general Purposes, and John Trevetlian, Henry Le Grice, and Johnson Gedge shall be the First Directors on behalf of the Commissioners herein-after mentioned.

XXI. And be it enacted, That the Amount of the reserved or contingent Fund shall be One thousand two hundred Pounds.

XXII. And whereas the said Company hereby incorporated have entered into a conditional Agreement with the said former Association or Company for the Purchase of the said present Gasworks, with the Apparatus, Mains, Service and other Pipes, Meters, Lamps, Posts, and other Articles and Things belonging thereto, for the Price or Sum of Eight thousand five hundred Pounds : Be it therefore enacted, That upon the Execution of a Deed of Conveyance, duly stamped for denoting the Payment of the full and proper Stamp Duty by Law payable in respect of the said Purchase or Consideration Money, and upon Payment by the Company hereby incorporated unto the Persons for the Time being constituting the said former Company or Association of the Sum of Eight thousand five hundred Pounds in the Manner already agreed upon for that Purpose, as well the said existing Gasworks, and all other Works, Buildings, and Conveniences thereto belonging, and all Lands and Grounds held or occupied therewith, as also all and singular the Apparatus, Mains, Service and other Pipes, Meters, Lamps, Lamp Irons, Posts, and all other Matters and Things heretofore the Property of or belonging to and vested in the said former Company or Association, or any Trustee or Trustees on their Behalf, at the Time of the passing of this Act, and all their Estate, Right, and Interest therein, shall be and the same are hereby vested in the Company hereby incorporated, and shall be applicable to

261

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxi.

to or for the Purposes of this Act: Provided always, that all Persons having any Interest, Charge, or Claim whatsoever in or upon the said Gasworks and Premises so agreed to be purchased as aforesaid shall have the same or the like Interest, Charge, and Claim in and upon the said Sum of Eight thousand five hundred Pounds, so agreed to be paid to the said former Association or Company as aforesaid, and that nothing herein contained shall defeat or prejudice the Claims of any Person or Persons upon or against the several Parties who were Members of the said former Association or Company.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this and the said incorporated Acts contained, it shall be lawful for the Company hereby incorporated to continue the said existing Gasworks, and from Time to Time to construct and maintain such new or other Gasworks and Apparatus, and such Buildings, with Approaches thereto, upon the Lands belonging to the Company, or hereby authorized to be purchased by them, and to do all such other Acts as they shall think necessary for supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Gas, and to supply such Gas upon such Terms as shall be agreed upon between the Company and the Persons supplied therewith, and to sell and dispose of the Coke and other Residuum arising from the Materials used in the Manufacture of Gas, in such Manner as the Company may think proper.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this and the said incorporated Acts contained, it shall be lawful for the Company to lay any Pipe, Branch, or other Apparatus from any Main or Branch Pipes into, through, or against any Building, for the Purpose of lighting the same, and to provide and set up any Apparatus necessary for securing to any Buildings a proper and complete Supply of Gas, and for measuring and ascertaining the Extent of such Supply.

XXV. And whereas the Commissioners acting under the Authority and in execution of an Act passed in the Fifty-first Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Third, intituled An Act for better paving, lighting, cleansing, watching, and otherwise improving the Town of Bury Saint Edmund’s in the County of Suffolk, and of another Act passed in the First Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act to amend, extend, and render more effectual an Act of His late Majesty for paving, lighting, cleansing, watching, and otherwise improving the Town of Bury Saint Edmund’s in the County of Suffolk, have consented to the Company hereby incorporated being authorized and empowered to light the said Town and Borough of Bury Saint Edmund’s with Gas in the Manner and upon the Terms herein-after expressed, and also to advance and lend to the said Company by way of Loan as herein-after mentioned the Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds, in order to increase their Capital, without requiring any Interest to be paid for or in respect of the same: Be it therefore enacted, That in consideration of the Commissioners acting under the Two several herein-before mentioned Acts consenting to the passing of this Act, and to the vesting in the said Company of the several

Power to Undertakers to construct Gasworks, &c.

Power to Undertakers to lay Pipes for lighting Buildings.

Company to supply Gas to the Commissioners at cost Price.

51 G. 3. c. 9.

1 G. 4. c. 61.

262

Company to provide Posts,Lamps, &c. for the public Lights without Charge.

Maximum Charge or Price.

One Third of the Directors to be appointed by the Commissioners.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxi.

Powers and Authorities hereby granted, and upon the said Commissioners advancing to the said Company the Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds without Interest, by way of Loan, and an Increase of their Capital as herein-before mentioned, the said Company hereby incorporated shall and may and they are hereby required, from Time to Time until the said Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds shall be repaid by them, to furnish and supply the said Commissioners acting under or in execution of the said herein-before mentioned Acts with such a Quantity or Amount of Gas as they may require for the Purpose of lighting the public Lamps and public Places within the said Town and Borough of Bury Saint Edmund's at the Price of Three Shillings per Thousand Cubic Feet of pure Gas, to be tested in the usual Manner, so far as the present Mains extend, with a fair and reasonable Addition thereto for any more Mains which may hereafter be specially laid down for public Lights, exclusive of the Expense of lighting, extinguishing, and cleansing the Lamps, which Expense is to be defrayed and borne by the said Commissioners : Provided always, that it shall be competent for the said Company and Commissioners at any Time to make any Alteration in the Price of the Gas supplied to the said Commissioners which may be rendered just and necessary by any Alteration in the Cost of Production, Bulk, illuminating Power, or other Matters connected therewith, as they shall mutually agree upon; and in case of any Difference or Dispute relating thereto, the same shall, with the Consent of both Parties, be referred to some experienced Gas Valuer or Engineer, whose Decision in the Matter shall be final and conclusive upon both Parties, and the Costs of the Reference shall be at the Discretion of the Referee or Arbitrator.

XXVI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the said Company shall provide all Posts, Lamps, and requisite Apparatus for the supplying of Gas to the public Lights without any Charge to the said Commissioners, except for the Cost of any Posts, Lamps, and Apparatus required for any additional Mains specially laid down or maintained for public Lights as herein-before provided.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That the maximum Charge or Price to be charged to any Person, Company, or Corporation in respect of the lighting of any Building, House, or Premises whatsoever, other than the said Commissioners in their public Capacity, shall in no Case exceed the Sum or Rate of Ten Shillings for every Thousand Cubic Feet of Gas.

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners from Time to Time to nominate and appoint any of the said Commissioners (not exceeding in Number One Third of the Diiectors of the Company) to be Directors of the Company hereby incorporated, who shall become and act as such accordingly, but they shall not be Holders of Shares in the said Company, nor shall they be at liberty to interfere with the Supply of Gas to any Person, Company, or Corporation other than the said Commissioners in their public Capacity.

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. xxi.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners acting in the Execution of the herein-before mentioned Acts, or either of them, and they are hereby empowered and required, with all convenient Speed after the passing of this Act, to levy and raise, or borrow and take up at Interest, in the Manner and by the Ways or Means in the same Acts, or either of them, mentioned or provided in respect to the raising or borrowing of Money, on such Conditions in respect to the Payment of Principal or Interest as shall be agreed upon with the Persons lending the same (and over and above the Monies thereby authorized to be raised or borrowed), the Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds Sterling for the Purposes of this Act, and to lend, pay, and advance such Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds, and every Part thereof, to the said Company hereby incorporated, on the Security of the Gasworks and other Property of the same Company, without requiring any Interest whatever for or in respect of the same, or any Part thereof, so long as the said Company shall furnish and supply the said Commissioners with Gas upon the Terms and in manner herein-before mentioned.

XXX. And be it enacted, That every Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, and every Transfer of any Share, Stock, Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, to be granted or made by virtue of this Act, shall be by Deed duly stamped, wherein the Consideration for the same shall be truly stated.

XXXI. And be it enacted, That the said Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds, when so raised and paid by the said Commissioners to the said Company as aforesaid, shall be the first Charge on the Gasworks and other Property of the said Company, and shall have and be entitled to Priority over all other Payments whatsoever; but the same shall not be called in, or be required to be paid off, so long as the said Company shall continue to supply the said Commissioners with Gas upon the Terms and in manner herein-before expressed, nor shall the same be paid in by the said Company without the Consent of the said Commissioners : Provided always, that in the event of the said Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds being called in or required to be paid off as aforesaid, and of the same being so paid off’, it shall be lawful for the said Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond any Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the said Sum of Four thousand Pounds, subject to such Restrictions and Conditions as are herein-before contained with reference thereto.

XXXII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That no Shareholder in the Company hereby incorporated shall, by reason only of his holding Shares in the said Company, be disabled from acting or voting as a Commissioner in the Execution of the herein-before mentioned Acts, or either of them, upon any Question or Matter except those relating to the public Gaslights, anything in the same several Acts, or either of them, contained to the contrary notwithstanding.

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall take away, control, suspend, prejudice, or interefere with any of the Rights, Privileges, Jurisdictions, Powers, and Authorities vested

in

263

Power lo Commissioners to raise the 2,500/, and to lend the same to the Company for the Purposes of this Act.

Mortgages and Transfers to be stamped.

in or belonging to the said Commissioners (save and except as herein and in the Gasworks Clauses Act, 184-7, is otherwise provided), and that all such Rights, Privileges, Jurisdictions, Powers, and Authorities shall in all other respects be as valid and effectual as if this Act had not been passed.

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That all Costs, Charges, and Expenses attending the applying for and obtaining this Act shall be paid out of the first Monies which shall come into the Possession of the Directors of the Company hereby incorporated after the passing of this Act.

XXXV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

VICTORIES REGIN R.

Cap. xxii.

An Act to incorporate the Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society; to enable the said Society to sue and be sued, and to take and hold Property; and for other Purposes relating; to the said Society. [V6‘th June 184.9.]

■W ~W TlIEREAS by Deed of Constitution and 'Articles and %/%/ Regulations of the Scottish Amicable Life Assurance T T Society, dated the Nineteenth and Twentieth Days of February in the Year One thousand eight hundred and thirty-four, and registered in the Books of Council and Session in Scotland the Twenty-first Day of February in the same Year, the Persons therein named and designed, and Subscribers to the said Deed, on behalf of themselves and of the whole other Persons therein referred to, formed and united themselves into a Contributorship and Mutual Assurance Society, under the Name of " The Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society," for the Purpose of effecting Insurances on Lives and Survivorships, and purchasing and granting Annuities: And whereas the said Society have very successfully, and to the Benefit of the Public, carried on and now carry on the said Business at Glasgow, and have in the Prosecution thereof appointed Agents in \_Focal.~\ 3 X other

266

Incorporation of the Society,

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii.

other Parts of Scotland, and in England, Ireland, and the Colonies: And whereas it would be advantageous to the said Society and beneficial to the Public if the said Society were incorporated for the Purposes aforesaid, with Power to sue and be sued, to invest Monies. and Funds, and to take, hold, and transfer Property and Securities, Real and Personal, and with such other Powers and Privileges as may be necessary for enabling the said Society more effectually to conduct and carry on Business; but these Objects cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the said Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society, now carrying on the Business of Life Assurance in its various Branches, and the present and all succeeding Members thereof, shall be and are hereby united and incorporated into One Body Politic and Corporate by the Name and Style of " The Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society," and by that Name shall have perpetual Succession and a Common Seal, with Power to change, break, and make new the same from Time to Time, and shall be entitled to carry on the Business of effecting Assurances on Lives and Survivorships, and purchasing and selling Annuities and Reversions, and in general to carry on all the Business connected with a Life Assurance Society in all the various Branches thereof in any Part of Her Majesty's Dominions of Great Britain and Ireland and the Colonies, or elsewhere, and with and under the Conditions and Declarations and Powers and Privileges herein-after set forth, and the Society shall continue incorporated until dissolved In Terms of the Regulations of the Society.

Liability of

II. And be it enacted, That neither the Incorporation of the Society Members of nor anything herein contained shall in anywise restrict the Liability ^continue an3’ *he Members of the Society under any Judgment, Decree, or Order for the Payment of Money which shall be obtained against the Society or any of the Members thereof in any Action or Suit prosecuted by or against the Society in any Court of Law or Equity, but every such Member shall in respect of such Monies be and continue liable as he would have been if the Society had not been incorporated: Provided always, that it shall be lawful for the Society, in all Policies, Contracts, and Agreements which they may enter into, to make such special Conditions and Provisions, and such Limitations oi the Liabilities of the Members thereof, as the Society may think fit.

III. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall relieve or discharge the Society, or any Member thereof, from any Contract, Responsibility, Debt, Engagement, or Obligation to which the said Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society, or any Member thereof, is now or shall be hereafter liable, but the same shall continue as if the said Society had not been incorporated under this Act; and nothing herein contained shall be held to invalidate or affect the Deed of Constitution and Articles and Regulations of the said Society, or any of the Powers therein contained, or any of the Bye Laws or other Alterations of the Deed of Constitution, made or to be made in

virtue

Contracts anil Obligations and Deed of Constitution and Laws of the Society to remain valid.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii. 267

virtue of the Powers given by the said Deed, excepting in so far as the same are expressly altered or varied by this Act, or are contrary to the true Intent and Meaning thereof; and the Society and the Directors thereof shall have the same Powers as they at present have, under the said Deed of Constitution and Articles and Regulations and Bye Laws, to make Bye Laws, or new Laws, Rules, and Regulations; and the said Deed of Constitution, Articles, and Regulations, Powers therein contained, and Bye Laws or other Alterations of the said Deed of Constitution, made or to be made, shall be as obligatory on the Members of the Society and all other Persons as if this Act had not been passed, provided the same be not inconsistent with the Provisions of this Act, nor contrary to the true Intent and Meaning thereof.

IV. And be it enacted, That the Business of the Society shall be Place of carried on in a Place of Business within the City of Glasgow or the fnUjp^j^rt0 Parliamentary Boundaries thereof, approved of by the Directors, and a|)p0int local which shall be the principal Office of the Society; and the Directors Directors shall have the Management and Superintendence of the Business and and Agents. Affairs of the Society, and full Power and Authority to purchase or

take on Lease other Places of Business, and to nominate and appoint local Directors and Agents at such Places within Great Britain and Ireland, and the Colonies, or elsewhere, as they shall judge expedient; and the Duties, Powers, and Remuneration of the local Directors and Agents shall be under the Control and Regulation of the Directors.

V. And be it enacted, That all Property, Heritable and Moveable, Property Real and Personal, wheresoever situated at the Time of the passing of v®st®d m this Act, and all Bonds, Bills, Promissory Notes, Dispositions, Mort,- ciety,°and gages, Bonds, and Grants of Annuity, Warrants of Attorney, Convey- existing ances, Assignments, Charters, Sasines, Agreements, and other Deeds Policies and and legal Instruments, and all Assurances, Judgments, Decrees, oth.cr 0bli* or Writings, of what Kind or Nature soever, with the Lands, Subjects, be'v^fd l° Property, Sums of Money, Stocks, and other .Matters and Tilings

therein contained, which have already been taken to or executed or conceived in favour of the said Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society, or of the Directors or any of them, or the Manager, or any Persons, as Trustees or otherwise‘for the Use or Behoof of the said Society, whether the same are held absolutely or in Security, and in general all Estate and Effects, and all Debts, Obligations, Rights, and Interests of every Description belonging to the said Society, or vested in any Person lor the Benefit of the said Society, at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall be and the same are hereby transferred to and vested in the Society hereby incorporated, as fully as if the same had been made, granted, and taken after the passing of this Act, and the same shall in future be held, managed, sold, granted, conveyed, assigned, leased, released, discharged, sued for, or otherwise used and disposed of by the Society, under the corporate Name of " The Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society," without the Necessity of any connecting or continuing Title or separate Investiture, or Writing or Procedure, other than this Act; and in like Manner all Policies,

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii.

or issued by the said Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society, or by the Directors and Officers thereof in Name and Behalf of the same, and generally all Debts and Liabilities existing against the said Society at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall be and the same are hereby declared to be valid and subsisting against the Society hereby incorporated, and the Funds and Property of the Society, in the same Manner and as effectually as it this Act had not been passed.

YI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Society, in all Matters and Proceedings whatsoever, to use the said Name of " The Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society," and the Society shall and may by that Name sue and be sued, plead and be impleaded, petition and be petitioned against, answer and be answered unto, defend and be defended, prosecute and be prosecuted, in all and every Courts and Court, and charge and be charged in any Part of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland and the Colonies, or elsewhere, and shall have Power to issue Policies of Assurance, enter into Contracts, Agreements, and all other Deeds or Writings in any way connected with or relating to the Business or Affairs of the Society, and generally to transact such Business and Affairs in every and any Part of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland and the Colonies, or elsewhere.

VII. And be it enacted, That the Ordinary Directors may when they think proper cause any of the Funds or Property at present laid out and invested to be disposed of, called in, or otherwise converted into Money; and the Money arising therefrom, and the other Funds or Property of the Society, so far as the same shall not be required to satisfy the immediate Claims upon and Expenses of the Society, may be from Time to Time laid out and invested in the Name of the Society, or in the Name of Two or more Trustees on behalf of the Society, in or upon such Securities, Funds, Stocks, Revenues, Property, Estate, or other Investments as are or may be authorized and allowed by the said Deed of Constitution, or by any Bye Laws, Rules, or Regulations made or to be made under and by virtue of the same; and the Ordinary Directors may, when they think proper, cause any of the Funds or Property so laid out and invested to be disposed of, called in, or otherwise converted into Money, and the Money arising therefrom to be again laid out and invested, and so from Time to Time as Occasion may require: Provided always, that it shall be in the Power of the Ordinary Directors to set apart such Sums as they may think proper for answering the current Business and Expenses of the Society, and which Sums shall be kept in such Banks or Banking Companies as the Directors shall appoint.

III. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Society from Time to Time to lend or advance any Monies, or Stock in the Public or Parliamentary Funds, or other Stock or Property, belonging to the Society, upon Mortgage or Security of any Lands, either inFee Simple absolute or in Security or under Reversion, or for any less or other Estate, or upon Mortgage or Security of any Canals, Railways, Rates, Tolls, or other Property arising or being within Her Majesty's Dominions, and to accept of and take from any Persons or Bodies

Politic

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii. 269

Politic or Corporate Mortgages, Heritable Bonds, Or Bonds and Dispositions in Security, or absolute Conveyances qualified by Back Bonds, or such other Securities as may be thought advisable, upon any such Lands, Canals, Railways, Rates, Tolls, or other Property, as Securities for the Repayment of the Money lent or advanced, and that the Lands, Canals, Railways, Rates, Tolls, or other Property to be comprised in any such Mortgage or Securities as aforesaid shall, according to the l’espective Tenures and Qualities thereof, be conveyed, surrendered, disponed, assigned, or otherwise assured to the Society, or to Trustees for the Society, their Heirs, Executors, Administrators, and Assigns, subject to a Proviso for Redemption or repaying or replacing at the Times to be appointed for that Purpose of the Money or of "the Stock so to be advanced, and with Interest upon or in respect of such Money, or an Equivalent for the intermediate Dividends upon or in respect of such Stock, and also with or without additional Provisions or Trusts for the Sale of the Lands, Canals, Railways, Rates, Tolls, or other Property so mortgaged or secured, to take effect in the event of Nonpayment of the Money and Interest, or of the nonreplacing of the Stock and Equivalent for the Dividends thereof, after or within a given Period after the Time respectively appointed for the repaying or replacing of the same in the Proviso for Redemption herein-before referred to, and with or without any other Powers and Provisions as the Society shall think proper or be advised.

IX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Society to Society may institute, bring, commence, and prosecute any Suit, Action, or other b.ring Ac-Proceeding in Her Majesty's High Courts of Chancery, or in any other closure^0/6' Court within the United Kingdom having Jurisdiction in the Matter, Mortgages, for foreclosing the Equity of Redemption of any Lands, Canals, Railways, Rates, Tolls, and other Property which have been or shall be mortgaged or conveyed, surrendered, assigned, or otherwise assured to or in trust as a Security for the Repayment of any Sum of Money, or for the Reinvestment of any Stock which has been or shall be advanced or lent by or owing to the Society, and to obtain and prosecute to the End any Decree obtained in any such Action, Suit, or other Proceeding, and also to purchase or acquire the Equity of Redemption of any Lands, Canals, Railways, Rates, Tolls, or other Property which have been or shall be so mortgaged, conveyed, surrendered, assigned, or otherwise assured as a Secui’ity as aforesaid:

Provided always, that as to any Mortgages or Securities which shall have become absolute or have been foreclosed previously to the passing of this Act, and also as to the Lands, Canals, Railways, Rates,

Tolls, or other Property the Reversion or the Right or Equity of Redemption of which shall be foreclosed, purchased, or acquired as aforesaid under this Act, such Lands, Canals, Railways, Rates, Tolls, or other Property shall nevertheless be sold by the Order or under the Authority of such Courts or of the Society, by public Sale or private Contract, and in such Manner in all respects as the Society shall think proper: Provided also, that the Society shall not be required to sell as aforesaid Property consisting of Money, Stocks, or Funds which are or shall be of the Nature of Personal or Moveable Estate only.

Limitation of Period within which Lands may be sold.

Society may hold Lands without Licence in Mortmain, subject to Provisions for Sale.

Tables of the Society may be altered by the Directors.
