12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii.

X. And be it enacted, That the Sale of the Lands, Canals, Railways, Rates, Tolls, or other Property of which the Equity of Redemption shall be or shall have been so foreclosed or purchased or acquired, and which the Society are hereby required to sell as aforesaid, shall not be delayed beyond the Space of Five Years from the Time of Foreclosure, Purchase, or Acquisition thereof as aforesaid being completed, if the same shall take place after the passing of this Act, or within Five Years from the passing of this Act, it the same shall have heretofore been completed, but shall from Time to Time be made and completed within the Space of the said Five Years, as the Case may be, unless, by reason of Objections to Titles, Breach of Contract, or any Action, Suit, or other Proceeding at Law or in Equity, or on any other Account, the Completion of such Sale shall be unavoidably delayed or impeded, in which Case such Sale shall take place within Twelve Calendar Months next after such Impediment shall be removed; and if such Sale shall not be made within such Space of Five Years, or within Twelve Calendar Months after such Impediment shall be removed, such Lands, Canals, Railways, Rates, Tolls, or other Property shall be and become forfeited to Her Majesty, Her Heirs and Successors: Provided always, that the Enactments herein-before contained respecting Sales being required to be made, and Forfeiture in the event of such Sales not being made within a limited Period, shall not apply to any Houses or Property which the Society shall have acquired or shall acquire for the Purposes of their Business.

XI. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions aforesaid, and for the Purpose of securing the Money advanced on the same according to such Provisions as aforesaid, the Society, or any Persons in trust for the Society, shall be able and capable in Law to hold, receive, possess, and enjoy any Lands, Canals, Railway's, Rates, Tolls, or other Property so acquired, either absolutely and irredeemably, or redeemably and under Reversion only, or by way of Security for Annuities, or by way of Mortgage, and shall continue to hold and enjoy the same for the Purposes of and under the Provisions contained in this Act, without Licence in Mortmain, and without being liable to the Penalties and Forfeitures of the Statutes of Mortmain, or any other Penalties, Forfeitures, or Disabilities, any Law or Practice to the contrary notwithstanding.

XII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Directors, if they shall think it expedient, to alter the Tables of the Society so as to make the same correspond with the Life Tables contained in the Reports of the Registrar General of Births, Deaths, and Marriages in England already issued, or with such amended Life Tables as may be contained in any future Reports to be issued by him, and to adopt such Life Tables or amended Life Tables in whole or in part for the future Assurances and Transactions of the Society.

XIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Ordinary Directors (Three Fourths of their Number agreeing and concurring) at any' Time, with the Sanction of the Directors, to undertake, on behalf of the Society, the Payment of the Sums and Annuities

respectively

271

12° & 13° VICTORIA'S, Cap. xxii.

respectively assured and granted by any Assurance Company or Society desirous of being dissolved, or of relinquishing the whole or any Part of their Business, and to make such Contracts and Arrangements with any such Company or Society for enabling the Ordinary Directors to complete such Undertaking, and to exonerate the Company or Society so dissolved or relinquishing Business from all further Liability in respect of the Sums and Annuities which the Ordinary Directors, on behalf of the Society, may have undertaken to pay, and to obtain from any such Company or Society a Transfer to the Society of so much of the Funds or Property of such Company or Society, as the Ordinary Directors shall think fit.

XIV. And be it enacted, That all Policies of Assurance, Bonds, Contracts, Agreements, Discharges, and other Deeds and Writings which require to be granted and executed by the Society, may be in Writing or printed, or partly in Writing and partly printed, and shall, after the same have been submitted to and approved of or sanctioned at a Meeting of the Ordinary Directors, be subscribed by any Two of the Ordinary Directors, and by the Manager or such other Officer as the Ordinary Directors shall appoint; and all Policies, Bonds, Contracts, Agreements, Discharges, and other Deeds and Writings so subscribed, shall be good, valid, and effectual, and binding and obligatory on the Society, although not under the Common Seal of the Society, and the Parties receiving the same shall not be bound or required to see that the same have been approved of or sanctioned by the Ordinary Directors as aforesaid; and in all Matters and Proceedings whatsoever, wherein it shall be requisite to make any Declaration or Affidavit by or on behalf of the Society, such Declaration or Affidavit may be made by any One of the Ordinary Directors, or by the Manager or such other Officer as the Ordinary Directors shall appoint, and the same when so made shall be sufficient.

XV. And be it enacted, That every Intimation or Notice of the Assignment of any Policy shall be made either by Exhibition of the principal Deed or Instrument of Assignment, or, if registered in Scotland, of an Extract thereof, and by Delivery of a Copy of such Deed or Instrument, or of an Excerpt of so much thereof as relates to the Policy assigned, or of a Memorandum specifying the Names and Descriptions of the Party assigning and of the Assignee respectively, the Cause of granting or Consideration of the Assignment, the Number of the Policy assigned, and the Date of the Assignment, at the Office of the Society in Glasgow, to the Manager or other Officer acting for him for the Time being, and by a Docquet to be then endorsed upon the principal Deed so exhibited by the Manager or other Officer; or otherwise such Intimation or Notice shall be in Writing, and shall be served by being left in the Presence of a Notary Public and Two Witnesses, with a Copy of the Deed or Instrument of Assignment, at the Office of the Society in Glasgow, or by being given personally to the Manager or other Officer acting for him for the Time being; and every Arrestment in the Hands of the Society shall be served by the Copy and Execution thereof being left at the Office of the Society in Glasgow, or by being given personally to the Manager in Glasgow for the Time being.

surance Companies relinquishing Business.

As to

the Execution of Deeds.

Intimation of Assignments of Policies and Service of Arrestments.

272

Policies to be liable for Claims of the Society against Members.

Execution of Assignments and Discharges of Policies.

Receipts of Persons appointed by the Society to be a sufficient Discharge.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii.

XVI. And be it enacted, That the Policies belonging to any Member of the Society for the Time being, with the whole Profits and Emoluments belonging to the same, and the Interest which he has in the Society, shall be subject to and charged with and the same are hereby declared to belong to the Society, in Security of any Debts that may be owing by him to the Society, and in Security of the Performance and Observance on his Part of the Obligations come under by him to the Society, and the Ordinary Directors are hereby authorized and empowered to sell and dispose of the same as and when they shall think fit, with the Profits and Emoluments belonging thereto; but whenever an Assignation in favour of a lhird Party has been intimated to the Society, no Debt subsequently contracted to the Society by the Member granting such Assignation shall compete with the same.

XVII. And whereas many Persons who reside out of Scotland are now and hereafter may be Members of the Society, and Holders of or interested in Policies, and it would be attended with Inconvenience if Assignments and Discharges of Policies were in all Cases required to be executed according to the Law of Scotland: Be it enacted, That all Assignments and Discharges of Policies shall be valid and effectual if the same be executed by Parties resident in Scotland according to the usual Mode of executing Deeds or Instruments of a like Nature in Scotland, and by Parties not in Scotland either according to the usual Mode of executing Deeds or Instruments of a like Nature in the Places where the said Parties may be residing at the Time, or according to the usual Mode of executing Deeds or Instruments of a like Nature in Scotland or in England.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That in every Case in which any Money shall become payable to the Society, and also in any Case in which any Stock or other Property shall become transferable to the Society, the Receipt of the Person who shall be authorized or appointed by the Society, by any Instrument in Writing subscribed by Two of the Ordinary Directors and by the Manager or other Officer as aforesaid, to receive or accept the same, shall effectually discharge the Person paying or transferring the same from being answerable or accountable for the Misapplication or Nonapplication of such Money or Stock, or from being obliged or concerned to see to the Application of the same; and on the Death of any Party entitled to receive from the Society any . Monies in respect of any Policy, such Monies may, on the Application of the Party legally entitled thereto, be paid by the Society (under Deduction of Discount) before the Time when the same would become payable in Terms of such Policy, and the Society shall be discharged by Payment of such Monies to any Person who shall be Executor or Administrator of the Deceased under any Probate or Letters of ^ Administration obtained in England or Ireland or any of the Colonies, or under any Testament Testamentary or Testament Dative obtained in Scotland: Provided always, that in the Case of any Policy forfeited by Nonpayment of the Premium the Ordinary Directors may, if they think fit, allow any Sum not exceeding the Surrender Value of such Policy.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii.

XIX. And be it enacted, That where any Policy has been granted or assigned to Trustees for or on behalf of any other Person, the Receipt of such Trustees or the Sui’vivor of them for the Sums payable in respect of such Policy shall (unless the Society have received Notice from the Parties beneficially interested in such Policy, or some of them, not to pay to such Trustees or Trustee,) be a sufficient Discharge to the Society, and the Society shall not be bound to see to the Application of the Sums so paid to such Trustees or Trustee.

XX. And be it enacted, That if any Person against whom the Society shall have any Claim or Demand become bankrupt, or apply for or take the Benefit of any Act for the Relief of Insolvent Debtors, it shall be lawful for the Manager or other Officer of the Society, authorized to that Effect by a Minute of the Ordinary Directors, to represent the Society in all Proceedings against the Estate of such Person, or under any Sequestration, Fiat, Process of Cessio bonorum, Trust, or Act of Insolvency against such Person, and to make Affidavit or Declaration and to vote and otherwise act on behalf of the Society in all respects as if such Claim or Demand had been the Claim or Demand of such Manager or other Officer; and an Extract of such Minute, certified under the Hand of any Three Ordinary Directors, shall be taken and received in all Courts whatsoever as sufficient Evidence of the Authority and Right of such Manager or other Officer so to act and represent the Society.

XXI. And be it enacted, That the Directors shall not be liable for Omissions, or for the Sufficiency either in Value or Title of the Property or Securities on which the Funds of the Society have been or may be invested, or for the Acts or Intromissions of the Manager, Agents, or other Officers of the Society, or for any other Person intrusted with the Money or Business of the Society, nor shall they be liable singuli in solidum, or for the Acts or Intromissions of each other, nor shall the Directors, by being Parties to or executing in their Capacity of Directors any Policy, Contract, or other Deed or Instrument on behalf of the Society, or otherwise lawfully executing any of the Powers given to the Directors, be subject to be sued or prosecuted, either individually or collectively, by any Person whomsoever, and the Bodies or Goods and Lands of the Directors shall not be liable to Execution of any legal Process by reason of any Policy, Contract, or other Deed or Instrument so entered into, signed, or executed by them, or by reason of any other lawful Act done by them in the Execution of any of their Powers as Directors; and the Directors, their Heirs, Executors, and Administrators, shall be indemnified by the Society for all Payments made or Liability incurred in respect of any Acts done by them, and for all Losses, Costs, and Damages which they may incur in the Execution of the Powers granted to them, and the Directors may apply the existing Funds of the Society for the Purpose of such Indemnity; and all Acts done by any Meeting of the Directors, or any Persons acting as Directors, shall, notwithstanding it may be afterwards discovered that there was some Defect in the Appointment of any such Directors or Persons acting as aforesaid, or that they or any of them were disqualified, be as valid as if every such Person had been duly appointed and was qualified to be a Director.

273

Society not to be bound by Trusts.

Representation of the Society in Matters of Bankruptcy.

Indemnity to Directors of the Society.

274

Society to be subject to Jurisdiction of Superior Courts in England and Ireland.

Service of Writs and Notices on the Society.

Disputes in reference to any Policy may be settled by Arbitration.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxi'i.

XXII. And be it enacted, That the Society shall be amenable to the Jurisdiction of the Superior Courts of Common Law and Equity

at Westminster in reference to any Policies or other Engagements entered into with Parties described therein as of any Place in England, and to the Jurisdiction of the Superior Courts of Common Law and Equity in Ireland in reference to any Policies or other Engagements entered into with Parties described therein as of any Place in Ireland, in the like Manner as if the Domicile of the Society were in England or in Ireland respectively; and that any Judgment or Rule of any of the Superior Courts of Common Law at Westminster, or any Decree or Order of the High Court of Chancery, or of any Court of Equity or Bankruptcy, recovered, made, or pronounced against the Society in such Cases, shall have the same Effect and Operation against the Society as if the same were domiciled in England or in Ireland respectively; and in such Case any Summons or Notice, or any Writ or other Proceeding at Law or in Equity, requiring to be served upon the Society, shall be served in the Manner herein-after provided: Provided always, that the Proceedings in any Action or Suit by or against the Society, or the Officers or any One of the Members of the Society, in which the Merits in respect of the Demand thereby sought to be enforced, or of the Cause of Action or Suit to be determined, shall have been tried and determined, may be pleaded in Bar of any other Action, or in Defence against any other Suit, for the same Cause, Matter, Thing, or Demand, against the Society or any Officers or Members thereof.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That any Summons or Notice, or any Writ or other Proceeding at Law or in Equity, requiring to be served upon the Society, may be served by being given personally to the Manager at Glasgow, or in case there be no Manager, to any One of the Ordinary Directors at Glasgow, or by being left at the principal Office of the Society at Glasgow.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That in the event of any Dispute arising between the Society and any Person assured therein, or the Heirs, Executors, Administrators, or Assigns of such Person, relative to any Assurance or Policy, it shall be lawful to such Person, by a Notice in Writing subscribed by him, and to be served on the Society in the Manner provided by this Act, to require that such Disputes be settled by Arbitration, and to nominate for that Purpose an Arbiter on his Part, and to require that unless the Society shall concur in the Appointment of the Arbiter so nominated by such Person the Society shall nominate and appoint an Arbiter on their Part; and thereupon and thereafter, if the Dispute be in regard to any Policy entered into with any Person who at the Date of such Policy was described to have been resident in Scotland, or in any Place other than England or Ireland, or if the Procedure in the Arbitration shall take place in Glasgow, as herein-after provided, the Nomination of an Arbiter on the Part of the Society, and the whole Procedure, shall be reo-ulated and carried on in the Manner observed in Arbitrations in Scotland, and the Arbiters, in case of Difference of Opinion, shall have Power to appoint an Oversman, and the final Award or Decree Arbitral shall be pronounced within Twelve Months from the last Date of the

Deed

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii. 275

Deed of Submission; but if the Dispute be in regard to any Policy entered into with any Person who at the Date thereof was described to have been resident in England or Ireland, and the Procedure in the Arbitration shall take place in London or Dublin, as herein-after provided, the Nomination of an Arbitrator on the Part of the Society and the whole Procedure shall be regulated and carried on in the Manner usual in Arbitrations in England or Ireland, as the Case may be, and the Arbiters, in case of Difference of Opinion, shall have Power to appoint an Umpire, and the final Award shall be pronounced within Twelve Months from the last Date of the Deed of Reference or Arbitration: Provided always, that the Person desiring such Arbitration shall give Notice to that Effect previous to any Action or Suit being instituted in any Court in respect of such Dispute, and it shall not be lawful to give such Notice after the Institution of such Action or Suit; and in all Cases of Arbitration the Society shall be bound to appoint an Arbiter or Arbitrator on their Part within Three Weeks after Requisition shall have been served on the Society: Provided also, that the Arbiters or Arbitrators, or Oversman or Umpire, as the Case may be, shall hold his or their Meetings in London or Glasgow, in the Option of the Person desiring such Arbitration regarding any Policy entered into with any Person described therein as resident in England, or in Dublin or Glasgow, in the Option of the Person desiring such Arbitration regarding any Policy entered into with any Person described therein as resident in Ireland, and in Glasgow in all other Arbitrations.

XXV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts Short Title, of Parliament, and in all legal Deeds, Instruments, and Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society’s Incorporation Act, 1849."

XXVI. And be it enacted, That in this Act the following Words Interpreta-and Expressions shall have the several Meanings hereby assigned to tion ot' them, unless there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant renns' to such Construction; that is to say,

Words importing the Singular shall include the Plural Number; and Words importing the Plural shall include the Singular Number:

Words importing the Masculine Gender shall include Females:

The Word " Lands" shall extend to and include Houses, Lands,

Feu Duties, Ground Annuals, Ground Rents, Patronages, Teinds,

Fishings, Waters, Mines, Minerals, Tenements, Messuages, and Hereditaments of every Description, Tenure, and Quality, and Freehold, Leasehold, Copyhold, or Customary Estates, whether *

in reversion, remainder, or otherwise, situated either in Great Britain and Ireland or in any Part of Her Majesty's Dominions:

The Expression "the Society" shall mean " The Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society " incorporated by this Act:

The Word " Directors" shall mean the Ordinary and Extraordinary Directors, including the Presidents and Vice Presidents of the Society:

The Expression "Ordinary Directors" shall mean the Ordinary Directors of the Society for the Time being:

The

2/6 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxii.

The Word " Manager " shall mean the Manager of the Society for the Time being:

The Words " Policy " or " Policies " shall mean and include all Policies of Assurance granted by the said Scottish Amicable Life Assurance Society prior to the passing of this Act, or by the Society hereby incorporated after the passing of this Act.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall

future ge- Act which may be passed during the present or any future Session of neral Acts. Parliament affecting Insurance Companies or Societies formed previous to the passing of such general Act.

[Public Act.]

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGINA.

Cap. xxiii.

An Act to amend and equalize the Rates and Duties leviable at the Port and Harbour of Perth, to authorize the borrowing’ of an additional Sum of Money, and for other Purposes in relation thereto.

[26th June 1849.]

"W ~W T WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Eleventh Year of %/%/ the Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth and ▼ T the First Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King William the Fourth, intituled An Act for enlarging, improving, and HG. 4. & maintaining the Port and Harbour of Perth, for improving the Navi- JM\4. c. 121. gation of the River Tay to the said City, and for other Purposes therewith connected: And whereas another Act was passed in the Fourth and Fifth Year of the Reign of His said late Majesty King William the Fourth, intituled An Act to alter and amend an Act passed in the 4 & 5 W. 4. Eleventh Year of the Reign of His late Majesty and First Year of the c- 67'

Reign of His present Majesty, intituled 1 An Act for enlarging, improving,

‘ and maintaining the Port and Harbour of Perth, for improving the 1 Navigation of the River Tay to the said City, and for other Purposes ‘ therewith, connectedAnd whereas a Third Act was passed in the Second Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act 2&3Vict.

\_Local.~\

4 A

c. 21.

278

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. xxiii.

to alter, amend, and enlarge the Powers and Provisions of Two several Acts of the Eleventh Year of the Reign of King George the Fourth and First Year of the Reign of King William the Fourth, and Fourth and Fifth Year of the Reign of King William the Fourth, for improving the Port and Harbour of Perth, and the Navigation of the River Tay to the said City: And whereas by the said first-recited Act the Commissioners thereby appointed were authorized to deepen the said River Tay from the Ford or Shallow called the Town’s Ford to Friarton in manner therein particularly specified, and to levy the several Rates and Duties for the Use of the said Port and Harbour of Perth contained in the Schedules thereunto annexed, and also to borrow, upon the Credit of the said Rates and Duties, any Sum or Sums of Money not excee'd-ing Sixteen thousand Pounds Sterling: And whereas by the said second-recited Act the Commissioners thereby appointed were specially authorized to carry into execution the several Works and Operations contemplated and authorized by the said first-recited Act, and in addition thereto to erect a Tide Harbour, a Dock or Docks, either a Dry or a Wet Dock or Docks, with a Canal or Canals, Cuts, Entrances, or other Accesses thereto, and all necessary Works and Conveniences, and also to levy the Rates and Duties contained in the Schedules thereunto annexed in lieu of the Rates and Duties authorized to be levied by the said first-recited Act, and to borrow any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding the additional Sum of Thirty-four thousand Pounds Sterling upon the Credit and Security of the said Rates and Duties; and it was enacted, that the Time and Period for the Execution of the Works by the said first and second recited Acts authorized to be executed should be extended to the Period of Five Years from and after the passing of the said second-recited Act for deepening and improving the Navigation of the River beyond the P>ounds to which the said first-recited Act applied, and Twenty Years from and after the passing of the said second-recited Act for the Execution of the other Works and Operations, such other Works and Operations being always to be executed upon Lands, Grounds, or Heritages which should be at the Time the Property of the Community of the City of Perth, or of the said Commissioners; and it was also thereby declared not to be competent to the said Commissioners to proceed further in the Execution of the Works and Operations thereby authorized than to deepen and improve the Navigation of the said River Tay, and to form and complete the Tide Harbour thereby authorized to be made, formed, and erected, nor for these Purposes to expend, borrow, or take up at Interest any Sum exceeding the Sum of Fifteen thousand Pounds Sterling, beyond the Debt then incurred under the Authority of the said first-recited Act, until Compensation should be made or provided for, in 1 erms of the Directions in the said second-recited Act contained for that Purpose, to the Proprietors of Fishings, for any Damage that might be sustained by them in consequence of the Operations and Works executed by the said Commissioners; and it was by the said second-recited Act further enacted, that the Proprietors or Owners of Salmon Fishings situated in that Part of the River Tay to which the Operations authorized by both the said recited Acts extended, and the Lessees, Tenants, or Occupiers of the same, should be entitled to Indemnification for any Loss or Damage which their said Fishings might suffer or sustain in consequence of any such Operations, the Amount of

12° & 13" VICTORIA,

of such Loss or Damage to be ascertained in the Manner by the said Act provided: And whereas by the said third-recited Act the said Commissioners were authorized to borrow, on the Credit of the Rates and Duties leviable at the said Port and Harbour, before Compensation should be made or provided to the Proprietors of Salmon Fishings in manner directed by the said second-recited Act, any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding Six thousand Pounds Sterling in the whole, over and above the foresaid Sum of Fifteen thousand Pounds, and in addition to the Debt authorized to be contracted under the Authority of the said first-recited Act: And whereas the said Commissioners have, in pursuance of the Powers committed to them by the several Acts before recited, executed and carried on a Variety of Operations and Works for the Improvement of the Navigation of the said River and the Enlargement and Improvement of the Port and Harbour of Perth, and have also made Compensation to the Proprietors, Lessees, and Occupiers of Salmon Fishings, so far as demanded, for the Loss and Damage sustained by them during the Continuance of the said Operations for improving the Navigation of the River, and also during Five Years or Fishing Seasons immediately succeeding the Termination of such Operations, as directed by the said recited Acts, but no sufficient Provision has been made by the said recited Acts for the Payment of the Compensation to be made to the said Proprietors : And whereas the Tables of Rates and Duties authorized by the said second-recited Act have in some Instances been found defective, unequal in their Operation, and disproportioned to the relative Values of the Goods and other Commodities upon which the same are leviable, as well as to the Lengths of the Voyages made by Vessels charged with Tonnage Dues:

And whereas it would be attended with Advantage to the Public if the Time allowed for the Completion of certain of the Works and Operations authorized by the said recited Acts were extended beyond the Period therein specified, and if the said Commissioners were authorized to borrow and take up at Interest such additional Sum or Sums of Money as may be found necessary for satisfying and paying the Amount of Compensation due to the Proprietors of Salmon Fishings as aforesaid, and if the said Rates and Duties were regulated, adjusted, and equalized as is herein-after provided; but as these Purposes cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament,

May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the Time allowed by the said recited Time for Acts for the Execution of the Works and Operations thereby au- executing thorized to be made, done, and performed shall, excepting as to certain of so much thereof as relates to the Operations for deepening and im- autholiml proving the Navigation of the said River 'lay, be extended, and the by former same is hereby extended, to the Period of Twenty Years from and Acts ex-after the passing of this Act; provided always, that such Works and tcnded-Operations shall only be executed in or upon Lands, Grounds, or Heritages which shall be at the Time the Property of the Community of the City ol Perth or of the said Commissioners.

280

Power to borrow additional Money for Purposes of this Act.

Rights of Proprietors of Fishings reserved.

All Sums to be borrowed on the Security of the Rates and Duties.

New Rates and Duties to be levied.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiii.

II. And be it enacted, That, in addition to the Sums of Sixteen thousand Pounds and Thirty-four thousand Pounds authorized to be borrowed and taken up by the said Commissioners by the said first and second recited Acts, the said Commissioners shall be and they are hereby authorized and empowered to borrow and take up at Interest in the Way and Manner provided for in the said recited Acts any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding Thirty thousand Pounds Sterling, which in so far as necessary the said Commissioners shall be bound to expend and apply for the Purpose of making Compensation to the Proprietors of Salmon Fishings in Terms of the Provisions of the said recited Acts, with the Expenses of ascertaining the same, and the Expenses of obtaining this Act, and to no other Purpose whatever: Provided always, that all Bonds and Assignations in Security granted by the said Commissioners under and by virtue of the said recited Acts, and which shall be in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall have Priority over any Bonds and Assignations in Security to be granted hereafter for the Purposes of this Act.

III. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be held or construed to impair or diminish the Rights of the Proprietors of Salmon Fishings to receive Compensation from the said Commissioners in the Way and Manner provided for in the said recited Acts, or to restrict the Liability of the Commissioners for Payment of the same.

IV. And be it enacted, That all Sums of Money which the said Commissioners may hereafter borrow and take up at Interest, under the Powers in the said recited Acts and this Act contained, shall be so borrowed upon the Credit of the Rates and Duties hereby imposed, and set forth in the Schedules hereunto annexed; and the said Commissioners are hereby authorized and empowered to grant, assign, and set over the said Rates and Duties for the Security of the Party or Parties lending the Money or any Portion thereof; and when any Portion of the Sums of Money already borrowed for the Purposes of the said recited Acts, or which may hereafter be borrowed, shall be repaid, the said Commissioners shall be and they are hereby authorized and empowered, upon the Credit of the Rates and Duties hereby imposed, again to borrow and grant Assignments or other Securities for such Sum or Sums as may be necessary; and the Lord Provost, Magistrates, and Council of the City of Pei'th are hereby authorized and empowered to interpose the Security of the City and Common Funds thereof in guarantee of the Repayment of all Sums of Money to be hereafter from Time to Time borrowed by the said Commissioners in the Manner and to the Extent provided in the said recited Acts.

\ . And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act it shall be lawful to the said Commissioners and their Servants, and all such Persons as are, shall, or may be commissioned or employed by them, and they are hereby authorized and empowered, in lieu and instead of the Rates and Duties leviable under the said recited Acts or any of them, to demand and take upon every Ship, Vessel, Boat, Bark, or Lighter coming to or being within that Part and Portion of the

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. win. 281

the Precincts of the said Port and Harbour of Perth which is situated to the Westward, or further up the River Tay than a Line drawn from a Point on the South Side of the said River immediately above the Junction of the River Earn with the said River Tay to the West End of the Dyke or Embankment on the North Side of the said River Tay, forming the Land March between the Estates of Pitfour and Tnchyra, to receive or discharge a Cargo or Part of a Cargo, or sailing in Ballast within the said Precincts, the several Rates and Duties contained in the Schedule (A.) hereunto annexed, and also to demand and take from all and every the Owners and Proprietors of all Goods, Wares, Merchandise, and Commodities whatsoever which shall be imported or exported in any Ship,

Vessel, Boat, Barque, or Lighter coming to and within or leaving the said Port and Harbour of Perth, or any Part or Place within the Precincts or Boundaries thereof last before mentioned, or which shall be brought, floated, or conveyed by Water within the said Precincts or Boundaries, or from the Agents, Factors, or Managers of such Owners and Proprietors, the several Rates and Duties which are specified and contained in the Schedule (B.) hereunto annexed, which Rates and Duties hereby authorized and granted shall, after paying the Expenses attendant on the procuring of this Act as after provided, and the Charge of collecting and Management of the Funds thence arising, be applied to and for the Purposes by the said recited Acts and this Act authorized, and all Persons from whom the said Commissioners have borrowed and taken up any Sum or Sums of Money shall have such and the like Security for Repayment over the Rates and Duties hereby authorized as they held over the Rates and Duties authorized by the said second-recited Act.

VI. And be it enacted, That the Provisions contained in the " Har- Provisions hours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act, 1847," with respect to the Rates of 10 & ll to be taken by the said Commissioners, and with respect to the Col- ,Vict c-27-lection and Recovery of Rates, shall be incorporated with and form with This ^ Part of this Act: Provided always, that it shall be lawful to the Com- Act. missioners to demand and take the Rates and Duties hereby authorized from and after the passing of this Act, anything in the said

" Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act" notwithstanding, with such Exemptions nevertheless as in the same Act mentioned.

VII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That any Duties, Rates, Rates on

or Charges chargeable by this Act upon Vessels not entitled to the Foreign Ves-Privileges of a British Ship, or upon Goods imported or exported in reduced to such Vessels, shall not be applicable to Vessels belonging to Countries theURates°on with which Treaties of Reciprocity have been concluded or may here- British Ships, after be concluded, so long as such Treaties shall continue in force, nor where Re-to the Goods imported or exported therein; but the same Duties, Rates, ~procity or Charges shall be levied upon the Vessels of such Countries during shalU^en-such Period as aforesaid, and upon the Goods imported or exported tered into therein, as may be from Time to Time payable by this Act upon Ves- with Foreign sels entitled to the Privileges of British Ships, or upon Goods imported Countries-or exported in such Vessels.

\ HI. And be it enacted, That nothing in the said recited Acts Reserving or in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend to Rights of [Local.] 4 B take

the Earl of Kinnoull.

Expenses of the Act.

Provision in first-recited Act as to Limitation of Actions repealed.

Powers of recited Acts extended to this Act.

[Public Act.]

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiii.

take away, impeach, diminish, limit, change, or affect the Right of Free Port and Harbour claimed by the Right Honourable the Earl of Kinnoull at Bridgend of Perth as a Part and Pertinent of the Barony of Balhousie, in so far as his Rights and Titles shall legally support or establish the same; but nothing herein contained shall be deemed, construed, or taken to exempt Ships, Vessels, Barks, Boats, or Lighters frequenting the said Port of Bridgend of Perth, or Goods imported or exported thereat, from Payment of the Rates and Duties by this Act imposed and authorized to be levied.

IX. And be it enacted, That the Expenses of preparing, applying for, and obtaining this Act shall be chargeable upon and defrayed out of the first and readiest of the Rates and Duties levied by the said Commissioners under the Authority of the said second-recited Act or this Act.

X. And whereas by the first-recited Act it is enacted, that no Suit or Action shall be commenced against the Commissioners thereby appointed, or any Person or Persons employed by or under them in the Execution of the said Act, for anything done in pursuance thereof, after the Lapse of Six Calendar Months alter the Fact committed or Cause of Action accrued for which the said Suit or Action shall be brought, and the Defender or Defenders in such Suit or Action may produce and plead the said Act in justification, and if it shall appear that he, she, or they have acted agreeably thereto they shall be assoilzied or acquitted, and treble Costs shall be awarded to be paid to them by the Prosecutor or Prosecutors of such Suit or Action: Be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act the said Provisions shall be and the same are hereby repealed.

XI. And be it enacted, That all and every the Powers, Provisions, Obligations, Authorities, Penalties, Forfeitures, Payments, Remedies, Matters, and Things in the said recited Acts or any of them contained (save and except such Parts thereof as are varied, altered, or repealed) shall be as good, valid, and effectual as if the same had been repeated and re-enacted in this Act.

XII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be deemed and taken to be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiii

283

SCHEDULE (A.) to which this Act refers.

Hates and Duties leviable on Vessels at the Port and Harbour of Perth.

Rates and Duties.

1. For all Vessels navigating to the Southward of the Tropic of Capricorn - - - £ s. d. 0 1 6 Per Register Ton.

2. Between the Equator and the Tropic of Capricorn 0 1 3 Per Ditto.

3. Between the Tropic of Cancer and the Equator ... 0 1 0 Per Ditto.

4. To and from any Port in North America, and all within the Straits of Gibraltar ... 0 0 8 Per Ditto.

5. To or from any Port to the North of Drontheim in Norway, or to or from Azores, Madeira, or Tene-riffe Islands ... 0 0 7 Per Ditto.

6. To or from any Port between Gibraltar and Dunkirk, including Dunkirk, and from any Port in the Baltic ... 0 0 5 Per Ditto.

7. To or from any Port in Great Britain or Ireland, including the Islands of Guernsey, Jersey, Alderney, Sark, Man, the Shetland Islands and Orkneys 0 0 4 Per Ditto.

8. All Vessels employed in the River Tay carrying Goods, and entering the Precincts of the Port or Harbour of Perth 0 0 2 Per Ditto.

9. All Steam Vessels from any Port in Great Britain, or Places enumerated in Number 7., carrying Passengers and their Luggage exclusively ... 0 0 2 Per Ditto.

10. All Steam Vessels employed in the River Tay only, and carrying Passengers and their Luggage exclusively - 0 0 0J Per Ditto.

11. All Steam Vessels carrying Goods and Passengers 0 0 1£ Per Register Ton.

12. All Steam Vessels employed in tugging Ships, Vessels, Boats, Barques, or Lighters - 0 0 1 Per Ditto.

284

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cnjj. xxiii.

13. All Boats entirely open landing or

taking on board Sand, Bricks, Tiles, Stones, Manure, or other Goods or Commodities within the Precincts of the Harbour : If not capable of carrying more than Five Tons Weight If capable of carrying more than Five and less than Ten Tons If capable ofcarrying Ten Tons or upwards ...

14. All Boats entirely open, landing or

taking on board Fish:

If not capable of carrying more than Five Tons Weight Ifcapable ofcarrying more than Five and less than Ten Tons -Ifcapable ofcarrying Ten Tons or upwards -

Rates and Duties. —

£ s. d.

0 0 4 Each.

0 0 6 Each.

0 1 0 Each.

0 1 0 Each.

0 1 6 Each.

0 2 0 Each.

15.

16. 17.

18.

19.

20.

All Foreign Vessels from any of the above-mentioned Ports or Places to pay One Half more than the above Rates.

All Vessels remaining at the Harbour or Quays of Perth more than Two Months to pay One Penny per Register Ton per Month in advance.

All Vessels launched at the Harbour of Perth, or within the Precincts thereof set forth in the Act, to pay One Penny Halfpenny per Register Ton on the Voyage Outwards, if sailing in Ballast, but if loaded in whole or in part, or carrying Passengers, to pay full Dues.

Boats employed solely in conveying Salmon and Grilses from the Fishings in the Tay to Perth to be exempted.

It shall be in the Option of the Commissioners to charge either the Tonnage Dues on the Voyage Inwards or on the Voyage Outwards at the Rates specified in this Schedule; and if the Charge be made on the Voyage Outwards, there shall be deducted from it the Amount of the D ues that may have been previously paid on the Voyage Inwards, but if such Vessels sail in Ballast they shall be charged with the Dues on the Inward Voyage only.

All Vessels not carrying Passengers arriving in the Harbour in Ballast, and departing again in Ballast, shall be liable only in half Dues; but if such Vessels, after arriving in Ballast, shall take in Cargoes or Parts of Cargoes before their Departure, they shall be liable in full Dues.

Wood, Home, viz.:

Fir - 0 0 6 Per Load of 50 Cubic Feei.

Hardwood - 0 0 9 Per Ditto.

Fir, Planks and Deals - - 0 0 6 Per Ditto.

Hardwood, Planks and Deals . 0 0 9 Per Ditto.

Cartwheel Spokes - 0 0 H Per 60 Pieces.

Hogshead Staves - 0 2 0 Per 1,000. Per Ditto.

Barrel Staves - - 0 1 0

Pit Props - 0 0 1 Per Dozen.

Wool (other than Cotton Wool) . 0 0 3 Per Cwt.

Worsted Yarn. (See Yarn.)

Whitening - - 0 0 8 Per Ton.

Yarn, viz.:

Lint - 0 2 0 Per Ditto.

Cotton - 0 1 6 Per Ditto.

Tow - 0 1 3 Per Ditto.

Hemp - 0 1 3 Per Ditto.

Worsted - • 0 0 3 Per Cwt.

Yeast ... 0 0 9 Per Puncheon.

All Goods not specified in the above Schedule to be chargeable in proportion to other Goods of similar Hulk and Value above enumerated.

The Rates and Duties allowed for any general Description of Goods in the above Table shall not apply to such Articles falling under the general Description as are therein specially mentioned, and for which separate Rates and Duties are granted.

All

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cajj.xxiii.

All Passengers Luggage accompanying the Owners in Steam Vessels employed in the River Tay are exempted from Dues.

AH Linen and Cotton Cloth imported solely for the Purpose of being bleached and exported to be chargeable only with Three-pence per Barrel Bulk at Import, and the like Rate at Export.

All Goods having paid Dues Outward are exempted from Dues when brought Inwards, if they be returned Goods to the original Shipper, and in the original State.

All returned empty Boxes, Barrels, Bags, Sacks, Packages, and Pack Sheets are exempted from Dues.

Five Cubic Feet, not exceeding Two and One Half Hundred Weight, to be rated a Barrel Bulk; but when the Weight of Five Cubic Feet is greater than Two and One Half Hundred Weight, then Two and One Half Hundred Weight to be rated a Barrel Bulk.

In weighing or measuring Goods, the Weight or Measurement of the Packages is to be included.

All Goods shipped overside to pay Half Dues only.

Salmon imported from Fishings in the Tay to be exempted from Payment of any Dues on Import, provided the same be reshipped at the Port.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. xxiv.

An Act to amend an Act of the Twelfth Year of the Reign of King George the Third, for embanking, draining, and preserving certain Fen Lands and Low Grounds in the Parish of Ramsey in the County of Huntingdon, and in the Parishes of Doddington, March, Bemvick, Wimblington, and Chatteris, within the Isle of Ely and County of Cambridge, so far as relates to the Lower or Fifth District, and to annex other Lands thereto.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Twelfth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Third, intituled An 12G.3. c. 26. Act for embanking, draining, and preserving certain Fen Lands and Low Grounds in the Parish of Ramsey in the County of Huntingdon, and in the Parishes of Doddington, March, Benwick, Wimblington, and Chatteris, within the Isle of Ely in the County of Cambridge, and for amending the Road from a certain Bridge in the Parish of Chatteris aforesaid, called Carter’s Bridge, by a Drain called Vermuyden’s or the Forty Feet Drain, to a Bridge called the Forty Feet Bridge, in the said Parish of Ramsey; and by the said Act the 4 F said

298

Certain Parts of recited Act repealed.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiv.

said Fen Lands and Low Grounds are divided into Two separate Districts for embanking the River Nene, called respectively the " Upper District or Division " and the " Lower District or Divisionand by the said Act the said Fen Lands and Low Grounds are further divided into Five Districts for draining, called respectively the First, Second, Third, Fourth, and Fifth Districts or Divisions; and by the said Act separate Commissioners are appointed, so far as relates to embanking the said Upper District or Division, and also separate Commissioners for each of the said First, Second, Third, and Fourth Districts or Divisions, so far as relates to the draining of the same Districts or Divisions respectively, and also separate Commissioners so far as regards as well the embanking as the draining of the said Lower District or Division and the said Fifth District or Division, which are in fact one and the same District: And whereas the Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District or Division are by the said Act empowered to assess, rate, tax, and charge the several Owners and Occupiers of all and singular the Fen Lands and Low Grounds within the said District or Division by and with an equal and proportional Tax or Assessment not exceeding One Shilling per Acre for embanking, and also by and with an equal and proportional Tax or Assessment not exceeding Two Shillings per Acre for draining the same District or Division: And whereas the Funds and Monies authorized to be levied by the said recited Act by the Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District or Division for draining the same are insufficient to provide for the erecting and upholding of Engines and other Works of Drainage proper and sufficient for that Purpose, and for the due Execution of the said Act, so far as the same relates to the draining of the same District or Division j and it is expedient that the Commissioners should be empowered to levy and raise further Funds for that Purpose, and that the Fen Lands and Low Grounds mentioned and described in the Schedule to this Act annexed, which adjoin and abut immediately upon the said District or Division, or some Part or Parts thereof, and which are not otherwise drained than as the Waters therefrom run or soak away into the said District or Division, should be included in the same District or Division, and the Owners and Occupiers thereof made liable to be taxed and charged by the Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District or Division, and that some of the Provisions of the said Act, so far as the same relate to the said District or Division, should be altered, amended, and enlarged; but the Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of same, That so much of the said recited Act as enacts that certain Parts of the Lands and Grounds therein described shall be called " The Lower District or Division," and also so much thereof as enacts that certain Parts of the Lands and Grounds therein described shall be called " The Fifth District or Division and also so much of the said recited Act as empowers the Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District or Division, or any Five or more of them assembled at any of their Meetings, to divide the same District or Division into Three or more Subdivisions for draining the same, and for that Purpose to make

299

12° & 13° VICTORIA, CV.xxiv.

and erect Dams, Banks, Engines, and other Works for the Benefit of such Subdivisions; and also so much of the said Act as authorizes the Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District or Division to levy and assess a Tax not exceeding One Shilling per Acre on the several Owners and Occupiers of the Fen Lands and Low Grounds within the same District or Division, for embanking the said lliver Nene against the said Lower or Fifth District or Division; and also so much of the said Act as authorizes the Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District or Division, or any Seven or more of them, to borrow, take up, and receive any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding the Sum of Four thousand Pounds on the Credit of the said Tax of One Shilling per Acre; and also so much and such Parts of the said Act as relate to Meetings of the Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District or Division, or to the Time and Place of holding the same, or to the Mode of calling or convening the same; and also so much and such Parts of the said Act as require Notices of the Days of Payment of the Rates, Taxes, and Assessments to be rated, taxed, or assessed upon the several Owners and Occupiers of the Fen Lands and Low Grounds within the said Lower or Fifth District or Division to be affixed on the Church Door of Ramsey; and also so much of the said Act as imposes a Penalty of Two-pence for every Shilling of the Taxes authorized to be assessed and levied by the said recited Act in case of Default in Payment thereof within Two Calendar Months after a personal Demand made thereof by the Collector; and also such Parts of the said Act as provide that the Plaintiff, in any Action for any Irregularity, shall not recover if Tender of Amends shall have been made as therein mentioned, and which renders the Plaintiff in case of a Nonsuit liable to Double Costs; and also so much of the said Act as exempts Mortgages, Assignments, or other Securities for borrowing Money, and Contracts and Agreements under the Hands or under the Hands and Seals of the said Commissioners, and Transfers of Mortgages, Assignments, or other Securities and Bonds taken from any Officer or his Sureties in pursuance of the said recited Act for the due Execution of his Office, and any other Writing whatever concerning the Execution of the said recited Act, (except the Nomination or Appointment of Commissioners or Deputy Commissioners,) from Stamp Duty; and also so much of the said Act as directs that the Clerk, Treasurer, Collector, Receiver, or other Officers should account upon Oath; and also so much of the said recited Act as enacts that if any Person or Persons should wilfully and maliciously burn, cut, break down, destroy, or advise with, counsel, or employ any Person to burn, cut, break down, or otherwise destroy, any Bank, Mill, Engine, Floodgate, or Sluice, made or to be made for the Purpose of draining and preserving the said Fen Lands and Low Grounds, and being thereof convicted, should be guilty of Felony, and be transported for Seven Years; and also all such Part and Parts of the said recited Act as relate to the Recovery of any Penalty or Penalties by the said Act imposed, and to which any Person or Persons were thereby made liable; and also such Part of the said recited Act as limits the Time within which any Action, Suit, or Information may be commenced or prosecuted for anything done or to be done in pursuance of the said Act, and as concerns the Pleadings and Costs in any such Action, Suit, or Information, shall be and the same several

Parts

300 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiv.

Parts of the said recited Act, so far as the same relate to or concern the said Lower or Fifth District or Division, are hereby repealed.

Provisions of

II. And be it enacted, That the said recited Act, and all and recited Act every the Clauses, Enactments, Powers, Authorities, Provisions, to remain in penaities. Matters, and Tilings therein contained, so far as they respec-as'altered^y tively 'elate to tl,e said Lower or Fifth District or Division, or the this Act. Qualification or Appointment of Commissioners or Deputy Commissioners thereof, and so far as the same respectively stood in force at or immediately before the passing of this Act, shall henceforth remain and continue in force, and shall be as good, valid, and effectual for carrying this Act and the said recited Act into execution, as if the same had been repeated and re-enacted in this Act, except only such Provisions of the said recited Act as are by this Act repealed, varied, or altered, or are inconsistent therewith.

New Titles

III. And be it enacted, That the said Lower or Fifth District or of District Division shall henceforth, as well for the Purposes of this Act as for and Commis- aq otjiei. purp0ses whatsoever, be called the " Ransonmoor Drainage District," and the Commissioners thereof, to be qualified, authorized, and appointed as by the said recited Act is provided and required with respect to Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District or Division, shall be called the " Ransonmoor Drainage Commissioners;" and when and so often as in this Act the Word District is herein-after mentioned or used, the same shall be held to mean the said Ransonmoor Drainage District, and when and so often as in this Act the Word Commissioners is herein-after mentioned or used, the same shall be held to mean the Ransonmoor Drainage Commissioners, unless there be something either in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Meaning or Construction.

Regulations

IV. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners shall hold for Meetings a General Meeting for the Purpose of carrying this Act and the said sione°is'm S" rec'te^ Act, as hereby altered and amended, so far as the same relates to the said District, into execution, at some convenient Time and Place in Doddington aforesaid, on the Fourth Tuesday next after the passing of this Act, and shall hold a General Meeting in every Year on the Third Wednesday in the Month of May, at some convenient Place in Doddington aforesaid; and that Notice of the First and every subsequent General Meeting shall be given by Advertisement thereof inserted twice in some Newspaper of general Circulation in the Isle of Ely; and the said Commissioners assembled at the said First Meeting, and also at any General or Special Meeting, shall and may then and from Time to Time afterwards adjourn themselves to meet at such other Time and Times as they or any Five or more of them respectively shall think fit; and the said Commissioners shall and may hold such Special Meetings at Doddington aforesaid as Five or more of the said Commissioners shall by Notice in Writing under their Hands appoint; and every such Notice shall state the Purpose and Object of the Meeting thereby convened, and such Notices shall be affixed on the Church Doors of Doddington and March aforesaid, and on the Church or Chapel Door of Benwick, Ten Days before the holding of the

Meeting

301

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiv.

Meeting thereby convened, and also be advertised once at least in some Newspaper of general Circulation in the Isle of Ely.

V. And be it enacted, That all the Clauses, Powers, and Provisions of " The Commissioners Clauses Act, 1847," (except the Clause which disqualifies every Commissioner who for the Space of Six Months after his Appointment neglects to make and subscribe the Declaration therein-before required, or who for Six Months in succession is absent from all Meetings of the said Commissioners, and also except the Clauses relating to the Election and Rotation of the Commissioners, and also the Clauses and Parts of the Clauses which require and relate to monthly Meetings to be held by the Commissioners, and all Clauses relating to the Mode of convening and Notices to be given of Meetings, and also the Clause which requires the Clerk of the Commissioners to attend at their Office daily, and also so much of any Clause as requires a yearly Sum to be set apart in or towards the Discharge of any Principal Monies to be borrowed on Security of the Taxes, and also the Clause with respect to Mortgages to be executed by the Commissioners which prescribes the Form of Mortgage,) shall be and the same are hereby incorporated with and declared to be and form Part of this Act.

VI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners of the said District or any Five or more of them, at their first or any other General Meeting to be held after the passing of this Act, yearly and every Year, over and above the Tax or Assessment of Two Shillings per Acre charged upon the Lands and Grounds lying within the said District by the said recited Act, to assess, rate, tax, and charge all and every the respective Owner or Owners, Occupier or Occupiers of all and singular the Fen Lands and Low Grounds lying within the same District, by and with an equal and proportionable Tax or Assessment, in any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Four Shillings per Acre in any One Year for every Acre of Fen Lands and Low Grounds lying within the said District, which said additional Tax or Assessment shall, in case of Nonpayment thereof within the Time or Times appointed by the said recited Act as to the said Tax of Two Shillings per Acre thereby authorized to be levied, be liable to the same Penalty, and shall be assessed, levied, collected, paid, and recovered in the same Manner and by the same

"Ways and Means as in and by the said recited Act, as altered and amended by this Act, are in that Behalf contained or provided.

VII. And be it enacted, That if any Occupier of any Part of the Fen Lands or Low Grounds within the said District shall refuse or neglect to pay to the Collector thereof the Taxes or Assessments with which the same Land shall be respectively taxed or charged by virtue of the said recited Act or this Act, and which shall become due and payable during his Occupation thereof, for the Space of Two Calendar Months after the same shall have so become due and payable, every such Occupier shall forfeit and pay to such Collector the further Sum of Three Shillings and Four-pence for every Twenty Shillings which shall he so in arrear and unpaid, and so in proportion for any less Sum, to be levied by Distress and Sale of his or her Goods and Chattels in

Certain Clauses of 10 & 11 Vict, c. 16. incorporated with this Act.

Power to Commissioners to assess a further Tax, not exceeding 4s. per Acre per Annum.

Penalty on Nonpayment of Taxes.

302

Further Power for Recovery of Taxes and Penalties.

For Recovery of Arrears.

Power to borrow Money on the Credit of the Taxes.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiv.

such Manner as the Taxes and Assessments granted by the said recited Act or this Act are directed to be levied.

VIII. And be it enacted, That in case no sufficient Distress can be found on any Fen Lands or Low Grounds within the said District whereon to levy and raise any Taxes then due to the said Commissioners, and in arrear for the same Lands, or from the Occupier thereof, or the Penalties which may have accrued due by reason of the Nonpayment thereof within the Time herein-before in that Behalf provided, then and in every such Case it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners, or any Five or more of them, to levy and raise the said Taxes so in arrear, and the Penalties (if any) then due in respect thereof, by Distress and Sale of any Goods and Chattels of the Person or Persons who was or were the Occupier or Occupiers of the said Fen Lands and Low Grounds at the Time or respective Times when such Tax or Assessment, or Taxes or Assessments, became due and payable, whensoever and wheresoever the same Goods and Chattels shall be found, together with all the Charges of levying the same.

IX. And be it enacted, That in case no sufficient Distress can be found whereon to levy the said Taxes or Assessments so in arrear, and the Penalties (if any) then due in respect thereof, then such Parts of the said Fen Lands and Low Grounds in respect of which such Taxes or Assessments shall have been made or assessed shall always remain a Security for Payment thereof; and all Corn, Hay, Cattle, and other Goods and Chattels, which shall at any Time thereafter be found thereon, shall and may be distrained, kept, appraised, and sold, in manner aforesaid, until all Arrears of Taxes or Assessments, and the Charges of such Distress, and detaining, keeping, and selling the same, shall be fully paid and satisfied : Provided always, that Six Days at least before any such last-mentioned Distress shall be made the Amount of such Arrears and Penalties (if any) shall be demanded of the Occupier for the Time being of the said Fen Lands and Low Grounds in respect of which such Taxes or Assessments so in arrear shall have been made or assessed, by leaving at his usual Place of Abode a Notice in Writing specifying the Amount thereof, and signed by the Clerk to the Commissioners; and any such last-mentioned Occupier, being a Tenant, and having paid the Amount of such Demand, shall be and is hereby empowered and authorized to deduct the same from the Rent then due or accruing due from him for the -Premises, or the same shall otherwise, after a Demand and Refusal by the Landlord to pay or allow the Amount thereof, be recoverable from such Landlord by Action at Law.

X. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners from Time to Time to borrow at Interest on the Credit of the said Paxes by the said recited Act or this Act directed or authorized to be imposed, or either of the same Taxes, or any Part or Parts thereof respectively', any Sum or Sums of Money which they may think necessary for the Purposes of the said recited Act or this Act, not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Four thousand Pounds; and for securing the Repayment of the Sum or Sums so borrowed, with Interest, the said Commissioners, or any Five of them, may assign the several

303

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cup.xxiv.

several Taxes hereby or by the said recited Act directed or authorized to be imposed by them, or any Part or Parts thereof respectively, with all Powers or Remedies whatsoever for recovering and enforcing Payment thereof, to the Person who shall lend such Money, or some Person appointed by him; and any such Mortgage may contain any Provisions for continuing the Loan, and for the Payment of the Sum thereby secured by Instalments, and for reducing the Rate of Interest reserved on Payment thereof within such Period after the Time appointed for Payment thereof as shall be in that Behalf agreed upon, and may also contain any Power of Sale of the mortgaged Premises, and any Powers and Provisions in connexion therewith, and any such special Provisions as shall be in that Behalf agreed upon; and upon any such Loan any Receivers and Collectors may be appointed, and Provision may be made for the future Appointment of such Receivers and Collectors; and such Receivers and Collectors shall act under such Circumstances, and have such Powers, and be remunerated in such Manner, as shall be in that Behalf agreed upon; and it is hereby declared that the Receipts of the said Commissioners or any Five of them shall be sufficient Discharges for the Money borrowed under this Act, and that the Person advancing any such Money shall not be bound or concerned to see to the Application of the Money advanced by him, or be liable for the Misapplication or Nonapplication thereof, or be concerned to inquire whether the Sum advanced by him ought to be raised; and it is hereby further declared, that any Purchaser under any such Power of Sale as aforesaid shall be seised of the Taxes purchased by him for an absolute Estate, free from any Equity or Power of Redemption whatsoever, and he and his Heirs and Assigns may recover the same by Distress and Sale, in like Manner as the said Commissioners might have done : Provided always, that every Mortgage shall contain a Covenant on the Part of the Mortgagee not to exercise such Power of Sale as aforesaid unless Default shall have been made in Payment of the Interest or some Part thereof for Six Calendar Months next after the Advertisements herein-after mentioned shall have been first inserted, and in Payment of the Principal Money for Twelve Calendar Months next after the Advertisements herein-after mentioned shall have been first inserted, nor until such Mortgagee shall, by Advertisement in the London Gazette, and twice in the same Month in some Newspaper of general Circulation in the Isle of Ely, have given Notice of his Intention to exercise such Power of Sale if such Interest shall not be paid within Six Calendar Months, and such Principal Monies shall not be paid within Twelve Calendar Months, as the Case may be, nor unless such Advertisement shall have been repeated Four Times during such Six Calendar Months or Twelve Calendar Months respectively.

XL. And for the Purpose of enabling the said Commissioners to secure the Benefit of a moderate Rate of Interest, be it enacted, That if the said Commissioners can borrow any Sum of Money at a lower Rate of Interest than any subsisting Securities given or made by them shall bear, it shall be lawful for them from Time to Time to borrow such Money as they shall think proper, on the Credit of all or any of the Taxes by the said recited Act or this Act authorized to be levied, at any lower Rate of Interest; and it is hereby declared that the Money to be borrowed for that Purpose, and the Interest for the same,

may
