304

Power to borrow Money to pay off Sums previously borrowed.

Repayment of MonieSj borrowed.

Commissioners empowered to sell Mills

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cctp.xxiv.

may be secured by an Assignment by the said Commissioners or any Five of them of the said Taxes hereby or by the said recited Act directed or authorized to be levied by them, or either of such Taxes, or any Part or Parts thereof respectively, with all Powers and Remedies whatsoever for recovering and enforcing Payment thereof, in like Manner and subject to the like Restrictions in all respects as is herein-before provided as to the said Sum of Four thousand Pounds, and the Interest thereof; and any such Mortgage may contain any such Provisions or Powers as herein-before mentioned, or as shall be in that Behalf agreed upon, and any such Receivers or Collectors as aforesaid may be appointed or provided for; and it is hereby declared that the Receipts of the said Commissioners or any Five of them, making such Assignment as aforesaid, shall be sufficient Discharges for the Money borrowed under this Act, and that the Person advancing any such Money shall not be bound or concerned to inquire whether there shall be any subsisting Securities bearing a higher Rate of Interest than the Sum advanced by him shall be made to bear, or whether the Sum advanced by him is a Sum properly raiseable, or to see to the Application of the Money advanced by him, or be liable for the Misapplication or Nonapplication thereof; and it is hereby declared that any Purchaser under any such Power of Sale as aforesaid in any Mortgage under this Act shall be seised of the Taxes purchased by him for an absolute Estate of Inheritance in Fee Simple, free from any Equity or Power of Redemption whatsoever; and he, his Heirs and Assigns, may recover the same by Distress and Sale, in like Manner as the said Commissioners could have done.

XII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners from Time to Time to borrow at Interest, on the Credit of the 'Paxes hereby or by the said recited Act directed or authorized to be levied by them, or either of the said Taxes, or any Part or Parts thereof respectively, any Sum or Sums which they may think necessary to be raised for the Purpose of paying off any Sum or Sums which may have been previously borrowed under both or either of the Powers herein-before contained; and all the Powers and Provisions herein-before given and contained as or in reference to the Monies which are hereinbefore authorized to be borrowed shall apply to the Monies to be borrowed under this Act, as if the same were here repeated and made applicable to this Act, and to the Monies hereby authorized to be borrowed.

XIII. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners shall in every successive Period of Six Years, to be computed from the Expiration of Three Years after the borrowing of any Principal Monies on Security of the said Taxes authorized to be levied by the said recited Act or this Act, or any Part or Parts thereof respectively, when and so often as any such Principal Monies shall be owing, appropriate and set apart a Sum of not less than Five hundred Pounds out of the bunds and Monies of the said Commissioners, to be applied by them in paying off all or any Part of such Principal Monies, or as a Sinking Fund to be accumulated for that Purpose.

XIV. And be it enacted, That the said Commissioners or any Five or more of them shall and may, if they think necessary, at any Time or Times hereafter, and from Time to Time, sell or cause to be sold all

and

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiv.

and every the Engines and Mills or other Works already erected by virtue of the said former Act, or which shall from Time to Time be erected by virtue thereof or of this Act, within the said District, and also all their Right and Interest in the Site of the said Engines and Mills or other Works, for the best Price that can be gotten for the same, and shall apply the Money arising from every such Sale to and for the Purposes of the said District.

XV. And be it enacted, That the Monies arising from the respective Rates or Assessments made or to be made by virtue of the said recited Act and this Act, so far as relates to the said District, and all Penalties and Monies whatsoever to be received by the said Commissioners by virtue of the said recited Act or this Act, shall be applied and disposed of in defraying the Expenses of obtaining this Act, and in and about making, executing, and maintaining any of the Works, Matters, and Things which by the said recited Act or this Act are authorized to be made, done, or executed by the said Commissioners; and all Costs, Charges and Expenses incident thereto, and to the due Execution of the said recited Act and of this Act, and in Payment of such Sums of Money as shall be due to any Person or Persons on Security of the Taxes of the said District, and the Interest thereof, and to and for no other Use or Purpose whatsoever.

XVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners, at any general, special, or adjourned Meeting to be held by them after the passing of this Act, to resolve and order that the Division heretofore made of the said District into Three Subdivisions for the Purposes of draining shall, from and after a Time to be therein specified, cease and be void, and at the Expiration of such Time the said Subdivisions shall be deemed to be ended and determined to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever.

XVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners and they are hereby authorized and required from Time to Time to make, do, cleanse, widen, cut, build, erect, purchase, repair, amend, reinstate, and execute, or cause to be made, done, cleansed, widened, cut, built, erected, purchased, repaired, amended, reinstated, and executed, all such Banks, Bridges, Pleadings, Cuts, Drains, Outlets, Mills, Engines, and Machinery, and other Works, Matters, and Things, as the said Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District were by the said recited Act authorized and required to make, do, and execute, or cause to be made, done, and executed, for all or any of the Purposes of the said recited Act, and to have and exercise all the Powers and Authorities, and shall be under and subject to all the Clauses, Enactments, and Provisions, mentioned and contained in the said recited Act of and concerning the said Commissioners of the said Lower or Fifth District or Division.

XVIII. And be it enacted, lliat if the Occupier or Occupiers of any Lands lying within the said District to which any Droveway Dike, Outring Dike, or Division Dike doth or shall belong shall neglect or refuse sufficiently to rode, scour, cleanse, open, or repair any such Dike, or to make the same of a sufficient Depth, and of the Width of Nine Feet at the least, after Fourteen Days Notice in Writing given

305

and Works and the Sites thereof.

Application of Monies.

Subdivisions of the District maybe annulled.

Works to be done.

Penalty on Occupiers not cleansing Dikes.

306 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap.wiv.

to him, her, or them, or left at his, her, or their Place of Abode from Time to Time for that Purpose, by the Clerk, Collector, or other Officer of the Commissioners, pursuant to any Order or Bye Law of the Commissioners, every such Occupier shall for every such Neglect or Refusal forfeit and pay the Sum of Sixpence for every Rod of the Dike so neglected to be roded, scoured, cleansed, opened, repaired, deepened, and widened; and it shall be lawful from lime to lime for the said Commissioners to cause such Dikes, at the Charge and Expense of every such Occupier, to be roded, scoured, cleansed, opened, repaired, and deepened, in a sufficient Manner, and made of the \\ idth aforesaid at the least, and where a Way shall have been made over any Dike without a sufficient Tunnel, to cause such Ways to be taken up, and such Dike to be made of a proper Width and Depth, and by Warrant under the Hands of Three or more of the said Commissioners to levy such Penalty, and also such Charges and Expenses, upon such Occupier or Occupiers, by Distress and Sale of his, her, or their Goods and Chattels.

XIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Commissioners from Time to Time to contract with and purchase of and from any Person or Persons interested in any Land within the said District or in the Schedule to this Act annexed, who may be willing to sell the same, a Piece or Pieces of Land, to be used as and for a Site or Sites of an Engine House or Engine Houses, and Residences of the Engine Drivers or other Servant or Servants of the said Commissioners, so that the total Quantity of Land for this Purpose to be held at any One Time by the said Commissioners shall not exceed Two Acres, and to cause the same, by proper Assurances, to be conveyed to the Use of the said Commissioners or any Five or more of them, their Heirs and Assigns, upon and for the Trusts, Intents, and Purposes of the said recited Act as altered and amended by this Act.

XX. And be it enacted, That for the Purposes of the said Contracts Provisions of and Purchases lastly herein-before authorized all the Clauses, Powers, c.*8?incor- an<* Provisions of " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," porated with with respect to the Purchase of Lands by Agreement, and with respect this Act. to the Purchase Money or Compensation coming to Parties having

limited Interests, or prevented from treating, or not making Title, shall and the same are hereby declared to be incorporated with and form Part of this Act.

Annexation

XXI. And be it enacted, That from and immediately after the of Lands in passing of this Act all and every the Fen Lands and Low Grounds du*o. C mentioned and specified in the Schedule to this Act annexed shall

thenceforth be deemed and taken to be within and to form Part of the saitl District; and the same Lands, and also the respective Owners and Occupiers thereof, shall have and be subject and liable to all such and the same Rights, Privileges, Clauses, Enactments, Powers, Provisions, Taxes, Penalties, Remedies, Matters, and Things as the said District, and the Fen Lands and Low Grounds therein, and the respective Owners and Occupiers thereof, had or was or were entitled or subject or liable to under and by virtue of the said recited Act, as altered and amended by this Act, immediately prior to or as if such Annexation had not been made.

Commissioners may purchase a Site for Engine and Buildings.

Certain

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxiv.

XXII. And whereas the said Commissioners have heretofore cut, made, and executed divers Drains and other Works of Drainage in and for the Benefit of the said District, and are now possessed of divers Mills or Engines, and other Property and Effects : Be it enacted, That each and every Owner for the Time being of the said several Lands and Grounds mentioned and specified in the said Schedule to this Act annexed shall, in and for the first Year after the passing of this Act, be taxed and charged with and liable to the Payment of such further and additional gross Sum or Payment, over and above the rateable and proportional Taxes authorized to be assessed and imposed thereon by the said recited Act and this Act, by way of a proportional Payment and Contribution towards the said Cuts, Works, Mills, or Engines, Property and Effects, and the Value thereof, as the said Commissioners and the said Owners respectively shall mutually agree upon, or in case of Diagreement, then as shall be settled by Arbitration, in such and the same Manner as is directed and provided in and by the said " Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," for the .Settlement of disputed Questions of Compensation by Arbitration, which said further and additional gross Sum or Payment shall, in case of Default in Payment thereof within Two Months after the Amount shall have been agreed upon or been ascertained, be recoverable by the Said Commissioners from the said Owners respectively, either by Action at Law, or, if the Amount does not exceed the Sum of Twenty Pounds, in the County Court of Cambridgeshire holden at March, or in the same Manm r as Rates and Taxes imposed and assessed under and by virtue of the said recited Act or this Act are authorized to be recovered, or by such other lawful Ways and Means as the said Commissioners may determine.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend to empower the said Commissioners or any of them, or any Person or Persons whomsoever, to have, use, or exercise any Power or Authority over or to intermeddle with any of the Sewers, Drains, or Works already made by or belonging to, or hereafter to be made by or belonging to, the Governor, Bailiffs, and Commonalty of the Company of Conservators of the Great Level of the Fens called the Bedford Level, or to invalidate, lessen, diminish, alter, or take away any of the Rights, Powers, and Authorities vested in the said Governor, Bailiffs, and Commonalty, or in the Governor, Bailiffs, and Conservators of the said Great Level, but that all Rights, Powers, and Authorities which by virtue of an Act made in the Fifteenth Year of the Reign of King Charles the Second, intituled An Act for settling the Drainage of the Great Level of the Fens called the Bedford Level, or of any other Act or Statute whatsoever or otherwise, are now vested in the said Governor, Bailiffs, and Commonalty, or in the said Governor, Bailiffs, and Conservators, shall for ever hereafter remain and continue and be in the said Governor, Bailiffs, and Commonalty, and in the said Governor, Bailiffs, and Conservators, and every of them, as fully and amply to all Intents and Purposes as if this Act had not been passed.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

VICTORIAE REGINAE

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

n

Cap. xxv.

An Act for amending an Act passed in the Tenth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, for lighting with Gas and supplying with Water the Town of Hartlepool and the Neighbourhood thereof in the County of Durham.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Tenth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty Queen Victoria, intituled An Act for lighting with Gas and supplying with Water 9 & 10 Vict. the Town of Hartlepool and the Neighbourhood thereof in the County c. 115. of Durham, whereby the Company incorporated by the said Act were empowered to raise the Sum of Eighteen thousand Pounds by Shares, and Six thousand Pounds by Mortgage: And whereas the Company have accordingly raised the Sum of Nine thousand Pounds by Shares, and the whole of such Amount has been expended upon the Purposes authorized by the said Act, but no Money has been raised by Mortgage: And whereas the Company incorporated by the said recited Act have proceeded to put the said recited Act into execution, but the whole of the Works authorized thereby are not yet completed: And whereas it is expedient that the said Company-should be empowered to vary, extend, and enlarge their existing Works, and to construct and acquire other Works, and to raise a further Sum of Money for that Purpose: And whereas the Objects [Local.] 41 aforesaid

i

310

Recited Act repealed.

Incorporation of the Hartlepool Gas and Water Company.

Existing Works vest-

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxv.

aforesaid might be more conveniently effected if the said recited Act were repealed, and further Powers and Provisions granted and made instead thereof; but the Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the said recited Act passed in the Tenth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty Queen Victoria shall be and the same is hereby repealed: Provided always, that all Offences which shall have been committed, and all Penalties and Forfeitures which shall have been incurred, previously to the Commencement of this Act shall and may be punishable and recoverable respectively under the said recited Act as if the same had not been repealed, and that all Acts, Matters, and Things made, done, or executed under or by virtue of and in accordance with the Provisions of the said recited Act prior to the Commencement of this Act, shall be good, valid, and effectual to all Intents and Purposes.

II. And be it enacted, That from and immediately after the passing of this Act the several Persons and Bodies Corporate who at the Time of the passing of this Act are Proprietors of Shares in the joint Stock or Fund of the Hartlepool Gas and Water Company, or who may become the Proprietors of any Share or Shares therein under the Provisions of this Act, and the several Persons and Bodies who have already subscribed or who shall hereafter subscribe thereto, and their Executors, Administrators, Successors, and Assigns respectively, shall be and they are hereby united into a Company for the Purpose of manufacturing Gas, and for providing Gasometers, and all Apparatus, Machinery, and Buildings necessary for that Purpose, and for lighting with Gas the several Streets, Roads, Lanes, public Passages, Churches, Chapels, Places, and Buildings, and also the several Shops, Breweries, Taverns, private Houses, Warehouses, and other Buildings, within the Limits of this Act, and also for selling and disposing of Coke, and of every Product, Refuse, or Residuum arising or to be obtained from the Materials used in or necessary for the Manufacture of Gas, in such Manner as the Company may think proper, and also for the Purpose of making, acquiring, and maintaining Waterworks for supplying the Inhabitants and other Persons within the Limits of this Act with Water, with proper Works and Conveniences belonging thereto, according to the Provisions of this Act and the several Acts incorporated herewith, and for other the Purposes herein and in the said incorporated Acts contained; and for the several Purposes aforesaid such Company shall be incorporated by the Name of " The Hartlepool Gas and Water Company," and by that Name shall be a Body Corporate, with perpetual Succession, and shall have Power to purchase and hold Lands, Works, and Premises, and to take Springs and Streams of Water, for the Purposes of the Undertaking, within the Restrictions herein and in the said incorporated Acts contained.

III. And be it enacted, That from and immediate!v after the passing of this Act all Gasworks, Pipes, Engines, Gauges, Tunnels,

Arches,

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap.\xv.

Arches, and other Works, and all Lands, Tenements, Hereditaments, Buildings, Easements, prescriptive and other Rights, Powers, and Privileges whatsoever, of or to which the Company hereby dissolved, or any Person in trust for them, were or are seised, possessed, or entitled at Law or in Equity immediately before the passing of this Act, and all Rates and Monies due or accruing to, and all Securities, Books, Accounts, Documents, Choses in Action, Effects, and Property belonging to the said Company, hereby dissolved at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall be and the same are hereby well and effectually vested in and shall belong to the Hartlepool Gas and Water Company hereby incorporated, for their absolute Use and Benefit, to hold to them and their Successors for the Purposes of this Act, and for such and the same Estates, Terms, and other Interests as under the said recited Act the Company hereby dissolved, or any Persons in trust for them immediately before the passing of this Act, had or would have continued to have had therein if the said recited Act had not been repealed, subject nevertheless to such Charges, Interests, and Liabilities as at the Time of the passing of this Act the same Premises were and are respectively subject to.

IV. And be it enacted, That all Conveyances, Assurances, Leases, Demises, Grants, Mortgages, Bonds, Covenants, Agreements, Contracts, Awards, Securities, and other Instruments made, executed, or entered into by or between any Person or Persons and the Company hereby dissolved, or to, with, in favour of, or by or for any such Person or Persons, and the Company hereby dissolved respectively, shall and the same are hereby declared to be, remain, and continue in full Force and Effect, and the Company hereby incorporated and all such Person and Persons shall respectively be bound by and liable to execute and perform the same; and no Action, Suit, Prosecution, Information, or other Proceeding commenced or pending by, with, or against the Company hereby dissolved shall become invalidated, made void, discharged, abated, discontinued, prejudiced, or affected by the Repeal of the said recited Act, but the same and each of them shall continue and remain in full Force and Effect, and the Company hereby incorporated shall be liable to all Debts and Engagements to which the Company hereby dissolved was or is liable at the Time of the Repeal thereof: Provided always, that the Repeal of the said recited Act shall not affect any Rights or Remedies which could at the Time of the passing of this Act be exercised by any Mortgagee or Creditor against the Company hereby dissolved.

V. And be it enacted, That all Rates, Rents, or Charges made or imposed under or by virtue of the said recited Act, and which at the Time of the passing of this Act shall be due and payable, or if this Act had not passed would have accrued due and payable, shall continue in force and be due and payable to the Company hereby incorporated, and may be collected and recovered by such Means and under such Restrictions and Regulations as any Rates, Rents, or Charges may be collected or recovered under or in pursuance of this Act.

VI. And be it enacted, That all Certificates, Sales, Transfers, and Dispositions before the passing of this Act made or executed of or in respect

311

ed in the Company.

Agreements, Deeds, &c. to remain in force, and Company liable to Debts, Sec.

Rates, &c. imposed under recited Act to continue in force under this Act.

312

main in

force.

Officers under former Act to account.

Present

Officers

continued.

8 & 9 Vict. cc. 16.18. and 10 & 11 Vict. cc. 15.17. incorporated with this Act.

Nothing to authorize Company to take Land, without Consent.

[Short Title.]

Limits of Act.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cup.xxv.

respect of any Share or Shares in the Joint Stock of the said Company under or in pursuance of the said recited Act shall remain in full force and virtue, and shall be and continue available in all respects

whatsoever.

VII. And be it enacted, That all Officers and Persons who at the Time of the passing of this Act shall have in their Possession or under their Control any Money, Books, Documents, Papers, Writings, Securities, Goods, Chattels, or other Effects under or by virtue of any of the Provisions of the said recited Act, shall account for and deliver up all such Money, Books, Documents, Papers, Writings, Securities, Goods, Chattels, and other Effects to the Company hereby incorporated, or to such Person as they shall appoint to receive the same, in the same Manner, and subject to the same Process, Pains, and Penalties for Refusal or Neglect, as if such Officers or Persons had been appointed, and had become possessed of such Money, Books, Documents, Papers, Writings, Securities, Goods, Chattels, or other Effects, under the Provisions of this Act.

VIII. And be it enacted, That all Officers and Persons appointed under the recited Act shall continue in their respective Offices and Employments according to their respective Appointments until removed therefrom according to the Provisions of this Act, and all such Officers and Persons shall have the same Powers, Privileges, and Advantages, and all such Officers and Persons and all Sureties shall be liable to the same Conditions, Penalties, Obligations, Restrictions, and Regulations, as if such Officers and Persons had been appointed and such Sureties had become bound under this Act.

IX. And be it enacted, That the several Acts of Parliament following, (that is to say,) " The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," "The Gasworks Clauses Act, 1847," and " The Waterworks Clauses Act, 1847," except where the same shall be inconsistent with or repugnant to any of the Provisions of this Act, shall be incorporated with this Act, and shall be held to apply to the Company hereby incorporated, and to the Gasworks, Waterworks, Lands, Streams,‘Credits, and Effects authorized to be made or acquired by and vested in the Company hereby incorporated.

X. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing in the said " Lands Clauses Consolidation Act" contained shall authorize the Company to take or use any Land for the Purpose of supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Gas, unless with the Consent of and by Agreement with the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers thereof.

XI. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, it shall be sufficient to use " The

Hartlepool Gas and Waterworks Act, 1849."

XII. And be it enacted, That the Limits of this Act shall be deemed and taken to extend to and include the Town of Hartlepool and the Neighbourhood thereof, which shall be taken to mean and to

extend

313

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. x\v.

extend to and include the whole of the Parishes of Hart and Stranton in the said County of Durham.

XIII. And be it enacted, That the Capital of the Company shall Capital, be Thirty-four thousand Pounds, including the Capital of the Company under the said recited Act.

XIV. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shares into which Number and the Capital shall be divided shall be Six thousand eight hundred, and g™°"snt of the Amount of each Share shall be Five Pounds.

XV. And be it enacted, That One Pound per Share shall be the Calls, greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make upon the Shareholders upon any Share, and One Month at least shall be the Interval between successive Calls.

XVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Power to to borrow on Mortgage or Bond any Sum or Sums not exceeding in b°rrow the whole at any one Time the Amount of One Third of the Capital Mortgage, in Shares or Stock of the Company for the Time being, but no Part

of such Sum or Sums shall be borrowed until the whole of the said Capital or Sum of Thirty-four thousand Pounds shall have been subscribed for, or Shares taken for the same, and One Half thereof shall have been actually paid up.

XVII. And in order to provide for the Recovery of the Arrears of Payment of Interest and Costs, or of the Principal and Interest and Costs, of any Arrears of Mortgage or Bond to be made by the Company pursuant to the ^be'enC " Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," at the respective forcedVy" Times at which such Interest, or such Principal and Interest, and Appoint-Costs, become due, be it enacted, That if such Interest, or any Part ment of a thereof, shall for Thirty Days after the same shall have become due, Receiver-and Demand thereof shall have been made in Writing, remain unpaid,

the Mortgagee or Obligee may sue for the Interest so in arrear by Action of Debt in any of the Superior Courts, or the Mortgagee may require the Appointment of a Receiver by an Application to be made as provided in the last-mentioned Act.

XVIII. And with respect to such Principal Money, Interest, and Recovery ot

Costs due to any Mortgagee, be it enacted, That if such Principal Principal, Money and Interest be not paid within Six Months after the same &c-

has become payable, and after Demand thereof in Writing, the °ent °"ey Mortgagee may sue for the same in any of the Superior Courts of Mortgage. Law or Equity, or if his Debt amount to the Sum of One thousand

Pounds he may alone, or if his Debt does not amount to the Sum of One thousand Pounds he may in conjunction with other Mortgagees whose Debts being so in arrear after Demand as aforesaid shall, together with his, amount to the Sum of One thousand Pounds, require the Appointment of a Receiver by an Application to be made as provided in the said " Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845."

XIX. And be it enacted, That the first General Meeting of the Ordinary Shareholders of the Company shall be held in the Month of July next Meetings

to be held y early.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxv.

after the passing of this Act, and a General Meeting shall be held in the Month of July in each succeeding Year, or at such other stated Periods as shall be appointed for that Purpose by an Order of a General Meeting; and all Meetings, whether ordinary or extraordinary, shall be held within the Town of Hartlepool aforesaid.

XX. And be it enacted, That the Quorum of every Meeting of the Company shall be Eight Shareholders holding in the aggregate not less than One thousand Pounds in the Capital of the Company.

XXI. And be it enacted, That the Number of Shareholders on whose Requisition an Extraordinary Meeting may be required to be convened shall be Ten, and such Shareholders shall hold in the aggregate not less than One thousand Pounds in the Capital of the Company.

XXII. And be it enacted, That the Scale according to which Shareholders may vote in respect of their Shares shall be as follows; (that is to say,)

For Two Shares or more, and less than Five Shares, One Vote:

For Five Shares or more, and less than Ten Shares, Two Votes:

For Ten Shares or more, and less than Twenty Shares, Three Votes:

For Twenty Shares or more, an additional Vote for every Ten Shares beyond the first Ten Shares.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That (subject to the Provisions herein contained for increasing or reducing the Number of Directors) the Number of Directors shall be Ten, and the Qualification of a Director shall be the Possession in his own Right of Ten Shares in the Undertaking.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time to increase or reduce the Number of Directors of the Company, but the whole Number of Directors shall never be greater than Twelve nor less than Six.

XXV. And be it enacted, That all Persons who at the Time of passing this Act may be Directors elected or appointed under the Provisions of the said recited Act hereby repealed shall be the first Directors under and for the Purpose of executing this Act.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That the Quorum of a Meeting ot Directors shall be Four.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That the Number of Directors ot which Committees appointed by the Directors shall consist shall not be less than Three nor more than Five, of whom any Two in the Absence of the others shall be competent to act.

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Directors, without the Direction or Sanction of a General Meeting, from Time to Time to declare and pay in the Interval between any Two ordinary annual General Meetings a Half Year’s Dividend out of the

Profits

315

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. xxv.

Profits of the Company to the Shareholders, but the Directors shall not make any Dividend whereby the Capital of the Company will be reduced.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That the Company shall annually elect Appoint, an Auditor for the Purpose of auditing the Accounts of the Company;

and in case the Office of such Auditor shall, before such Accounts have been audited by him, be vacant by Death or from any other Cause, the Company shall from Time to Time appoint an Auditor to supply such Vacancy.

XXX. And be it enacted, That the Remuneration of such Auditor Remunera-for each such yearly Audit shall not exceed the Rate of Two Pounds *jon..°^

Two Shillings per Day, nor the Sum of Four Pounds Four Shillings in u ltor' the whole, and the same shall be paid to him by the Company.

XXXI. And be it enacted, That for the Purposes of keeping Undertaking Accounts, and declaring and making Dividends, the said Undertaking to be <jon-shall be considered as divided into Two Branches, one of which shall divided ?n-include all Matters relating to or connected with the Supply of Water, to Two and the other shall include all Matters relating to or connected with Branches the Supply of Gas, and that the Company shall keep separate and and separate distinct Accounts of all Monies expended and received in respect of ^epCtof0"ts each Branch of the Undertaking, and that One Moiety of the whole each Branch, of the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of establishing the Company,

and of applying for and obtaining this Act, shall be charged against each Branch of the said Undertaking.

XXXII. And be it enacted, That the Scheme to be prepared Scheme to

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That the Newspaper in which Adver- Newspaper

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That all Notices to be served by the Notices on Company on Shareholders shall be so served as to allow the Party Sharehold-served at least Five clear Days for observing or performing the Act, ers Matter, or Thing therein required or mentioned.

XXXV. And be it enacted, That for the Purpose of better enabling Power for the Company to supply the said District with Water and Gas, it shall the Company be lawful for the Company to contract with and purchase or take on Purchase Lease from the Hartlepool West Harbour and Dock Company, and and oas^*''' for the Hartlepool West Harbour and Dock Company to sell or lease works of to the Company, a certain Spring or Stream of Water called the Old t*le Harile-Quarry Spring, and certain Gasworks and Waterworks constructed by P?°*.West the said Hartlepool West Harbour and Dock Company for the Supply ESTcm*

XXXVII. And whereas Plans and Sections showing the Line, make new Situation, and Levels of the intended Works, and also a Book of Works ac- Reference containing the Names of the Owners, Lessees, and Occu-cording to pierS) or reputed Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers of the Lands and plans. Streams in or through which the same are intended to be made or to pass, have been deposited with the Clerk of the Peace of the County of Durham: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, subject to the Provisions and Restrictions in this and the said incorporated Acts contained, to make and maintain the said Works in the Lines or Situation and on the Levels and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans and Sections respectively, and described in the said Book of Reference, and to enter upon, take, and use such of the Lands, Streams, and Waters delineated on the said Plans and described in the said Book of Reference as the said Company shall deem necessary for that Purpose, or to acquire compulsorily or by Agreement any Easement, Liberty, Privilege, Power, or Authority in or over the same, or to agree for a Lease of such Lands, Streams, and Waters, and to take therefrom such Water as the Company may require for the Purposes of this and the said incorporated Acts.

XXXVIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company in making the said Works by this Act authorized, where Limits of Deviation are marked on the Plans, to deviate from the Lines delineated on the said Plans so deposited with the said Clerk of the Peace, provided that no such Deviation shall extend to a greater Distance than the Limits of Deviation delineated upon the said Plans, nor to a greater Extent in passing through a Town, Village, or Lands continuously built upon than Ten Yards, nor elsewhere to a greater Extent than One hundred Yards from the said Lines.

Power to deviate from Plans in certain Cases.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxv- 317

XXXIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, in addition to the Lands authorized to be compulsorily taken by £"rncd for them, to contract with any Party willing to sell or lease the same for additional the Purchase or Lease of any Lands and Streams not exceeding Accommo-Twenty Acres, to be taken and used in such Places as shall be deemed dauonworks eligible, for extraordinary Purposes; (that is to say,) for the Purpose of a erwor making and providing additional Tanks, Aqueducts, and other Buildings and Conveniences, or for making convenient Roads or Ways to the said Works, or for any other Purposes connected with the said Waterworks which the Company may think beneficial to the Undertaking.

XL. And be it enacted, That the several Persons empowered by Owners the said " Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," to convey Lands g"antLease«. shall respectively have full Power to grant any Lease or Leases of any Lands and Streams, or any Easement, Liberty, Privilege, Power, or Authority in, upon, through, or over the same, for the Purposes of this Act, or any of them : Provided always, that in every such Lease to be granted by Persons under any Disability or Incapacity, and not having Power to lease such Lands and Streams except under the Provisions of this Act, there be reserved and made payable during the Continuance thereof the best and most improved yearly Rent or Sum of Money that can, under the Circumstances of the Case, be reasonably had or gotten for the same, without taking any Fine,

Premium, or Foregift for the same.

XLI. And be it enacted, That the Waterworks shall be completed Period with-within Five Years from the passing of this Act, and on the Expiration in which the of such Period the Powers by this or the said incorporated Acts '^becom-granted to the Company for executing such Works, or otherwise pieted. in relation thereto, shall cease to be exercised, except as to so much of the said Waterworks as shall then be completed: Provided always, that nothing in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend so as to restrain the Company from extending their Mains and Pipes from Time to Time whenever it shall be necessary for the Purpose of supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Mater.

XLII. And whereas a Portion of the Works as laid down on the The Works Plans herein-before referred to are proposed to be laid down or 'lie Slake constructed in, under, or along certain Tidal Lands commonly called of ^artle-the Slake near to Hartlepool aforesaid : Be it enacted, That the Com- moV and pany shall not lay down or construct any Portion of such Works as last altered in aforesaid so as the same shall interfere with the Flux and Reflux of the such Man-Tide, nor shall the Company lay down or construct any Portion of the ner asthe Works in, under, or along the said Tidal Lands until 'they shall have ^ai" direct submitted to the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, a Plan and Working Drawing of such Portion of the said intended Works as shall be laid down or constructed in, under, or along such Tidal Lands, and such Plan and Working Drawing shall have been approved of by the said Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, under the Hand of the Secretary to the [Local.] 4 L Admiralty

318

Works below High-water Mark not to be executed without the Consent of the Admiralty.

Local Survey to made, if deemed expedient by the Admiralty, at the Cost of the Company.

If Works across Tidal Waters are abandoned Admiralty may remove them at the Expense of Company.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxv.

Admiralty for the Time being, and such Portion of the said intended Works shall be laid down and constructed only in such Manner as shall have been so approved of; and if at any Time hereafter any Docks, Cuts, Slips, or other Works of a like Nature, shall be made or constructed by the Owners of any of the Lands adjoining the said Tidal Lands, the Company shall from Time to Time, at their own Expense, and without any Claims for Compensation, alter and divert their Pipes and Works in such Manner as and when the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, shall from Time to Time, under the Hand of the Secretary of the Admiralty for the Time being, direct or require.

XLIII. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the Company to construct below High-water Mark, at ordinary Spring Tides, any Work whatever, without the previous Consent of the Lord High Admiral of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral aforesaid, for the Time being, to be signified in Writing under the Hand of the Secretary of the Admiralty, and then only according to such Plan and under such Restrictions and Regulations as the said Lord High Admiral, or the said Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, may approve of, such Approval being signified as last aforesaid; and where any such Work shall have been constructed, it shall not be lawful for the Company at any Time to alter or extend the same without obtaining, previously to making any such Alteration or Extension, the like Consent or Approval; and if any such Work shall be commenced or completed contrary to the Provisions of this Act, it shall be lawful for the said Lord High Admiral, or the said Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, to abate and remove the same, and to restore the Site thereof to its former Condition, at the Cost and Charge of the Company; and the Amount thereof shall be a Debt due to the Crown, and be recoverable accordingly.

XLIV. And be it enacted, That if, after Working Drawings of the Works of the Company hereby authorized shall have been submitted to the Lord High Admiral of the United Kingdom, or to the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, it shall be deemed expedient by him or them to order a local Survey and Examination of such Works, or of the intended Site thereof, the Company shall defray the Costs of such local Survey and Examination, and the Amount thereof shall be a Debt due to Her Majesty from the Company, and if not paid upon Demand may be recovered as a Debt due to the Crown, with the Costs of Suit, or may be recovered with Costs as a Penalty is or may be recoverable from the Company.

XLV. And be it enacted, That if any Work to be constructed by the Company in, under, or across any Tidal Water, or if any Portion of the Work which affects any such Water or Access thereto shall be abandoned or suffered to fall into Disuse or Decay by the Company, it shall be lawful for the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, to abate and remove the same, or such Part or Parts thereof as he or they may at any Time

or

319

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxv.

or Times deem fit and proper, and to restore the Site thereof to its former Condition, at the Cost and Charge of the Company; and the Amount thereof shall be a Debt due from the Company to the Crown, and be recoverable accordingly.

XLVI. And with respect to the Supply of Water in pursuance of the Thirty-fifth Section of the " Waterworks Clauses Act, 1847," be it enacted, That the Water so to be supplied need not be constantly laid on under a Pressure greater than the Height of the Water in the Reservoir by this Act authorized from whence such Supply is obtained will give.

XLVII. And be it enacted, That the Company shall, at the Request of the Owner or Occupier of any Dwelling House or Part of a House in any Street in which any Water Pipe of the Company shall be laid, or of any Person who under the Provisions of this Act or any Act incorporated therewith shall be entitled to demand a Supply of Water for domestic Purposes, furnish to such Owner or Occupier or other Person a sufficient Supply of Water for their domestic Uses at the Rates herein-after specified; (that is to say,) Where the annual Value of such House shall not exceed Twenty Pounds per Annum, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Seven Pounds Ten Shillings:

Where such annual Value shall exceed Twenty Pounds, and not exceed Forty Pounds, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Seven Pounds:

Where such annual Value shall exceed Forty Pounds, and not exceed Sixty Pounds, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Six Pounds Ten Shillings:

Where such annual Value shall exceed Sixty Pounds, and not exceed Eighty Pounds, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Six Pounds:

Where such annual Value shall exceed Eighty Pounds, and not exceed One hundred Pounds, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Five Pounds Ten Shillings:

And where such annual Value shall exceed One hundred Pounds, at a Rate per Centum per Annum not exceeding Five Pounds: Provided always, that a Supply of Water for domestic Purposes shall not include a Supply of Water for Baths, Water-closets, Fountains, ornamental Purposes, Horses or Cattle, or for washing Carriages, or for any Trade or Business whatsoever.

XLVIII. And be it enacted, That the Company shall not charge more in any One Year than the several Rates herein-after specified in respect of Water-closets in or belonging to any private Dwelling House; (that is to say,)

Where the annual Value of any such private Dwelling House shall not exceed Ten Pounds per Annum, the Sum of Eight Shillings for each such Water-closet:

Where such annual Value shall exceed Ten Pounds, and not exceed Twenty-five Pounds, the Sum of Ten Shillings for each such Water-closet:

Constant Pressure to be afforded from Reservoir.

Rates at which Water is to be supplied for domestic Purposes.

What shall be deemed domestic Purposes.

Limiting Amount of Charge for Water-closets.

Where

320

Water for other than domestic Purposes to be supplied by Agreement.

Power to Undertakers to lease the Rates.

Persons using Water to provide Stopcocks.

Penalty for suffering Water to run waste.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxv.

Where such annual Value shall exceed Twenty-five Pounds, and not exceed Fifty Pounds, the Sum of Twelve Shillings for each such Water-closet:

Where such annual Value shall exceed Fifty Pounds, and not exceed One hundred Pounds, the Sum of Fifteen Shillings for each such Water-closet:

And where such annual Value shall exceed One hundred Pounds, the Sum of Twenty Shillings for each such Water-closet.

XLIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to supply any Person with Water for other than domestic Purposes at such Rate and upon such Terms and Conditions as shall be agreed upon between the Company and the Persons desirous of having such Supply of Water.

L. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Undertakers to lease the whole or any of the Water Rates payable by virtue of this Act for any Term not exceeding Three Years, and upon such Terms, Covenants, and Conditions as the Undertakers shall think proper; and every Lessee shall have the same Powers, Rights, and Remedies for recovering and enforcing the Payment of the Water Rates granted by the Lease as are by this and the said incorporated Acts vested in the Company for that Purpose : Provided always, that no such Lease shall defeat or abridge the Power by the said Waterworks Clauses Act given to the Court of Quarter Sessions of directing the Reduction of the Rates, and the Company shall reduce the Rates in the same Manner as they would have done in case no Lease had been granted.

LI. And be it enacted, That every Person supplied with Water under the Provisions of this Act shall, when required by the Company, provide and affix such proper Tap, Stopcock, or other Apparatus to the Pipe conducting the Water from the Works of the Company as the Company shall direct, and shall keep such Tap, Stopcock, or other Apparatus in good Repair, so as effectually to prevent the Water from running to waste; and in case any such Person shall neglect to provide, when required by the Company, such Tap, Stopcock, or other Apparatus, or to keep the same in good Repair, it shall be lawful for the Company, or for any Person acting under their Authority, to cut off the Pipe or turn off the Water from the Premises of such Person until such Tap, Stopcock, or other Apparatus shall be provided or repaired, as the Case may require.

LII. And be it enacted, That if any Person supplied with Water by the Company shall wilfully or negligently do or suffer any Act, or permit or suffer any Pipe or Apparatus to be out of Repair, so that the Water supplied to him by the Company shall be wasted, or the Supply thereof improperly increased, he shall forfeit for every such Offence a Sum not exceeding Five Pounds, together with the Value of the Water so wasted or improperly increased.

Company

LIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company wJtJrTincs, to rcPair any Place for Water> Pipe or Cock, that shall be out of

LIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Power to to agree with the Owners of any Lands, Works, or Premises which they°may think requisite or proper for the Purposes of supplying Gas f^stehe within the Limits of this Act, for the absolute Purchase, for a Con- works, sideration in Money, or for a Lease on such Terms as may be agreed on, of any such Lands, Works, or Premises, or such Part thereof as they shall think proper, so that the Area of such Lands or Premises shall not exceed Ten Acres in the whole.

LV. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this Company and the said incorporated Acts contained, it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time to construct and maintain such Gas- Gas;vorksL works and Apparatus, and such Buildings with Approaches thereto, upon the Lands belonging to the Company or hereby authorized to be purchased by them, and to do all such other Acts as they shall think necessary for supplying the Inhabitants within the Limits of this Act with Gas, and to supply such Gas upon such Terms as shall be agreed upon between the Company and the Persons supplied therewith, and to sell and dispose of the Coke and other Residuum arising from the Materials used in the Manufacture of Gas, in such Manner as the Company may think proper.

LVI. And be it enacted, That from and after the Expiration of Regulating any existing Contract for the Supply of Gas to any public Lamps Supply of within the Limits of this Act, the Company shall afford such Supply from any Main situate within Twenty-five Yards of any such Lamp, public ° at a Price equal to the lowest Price charged for the Time being by Lamps, the Company to any private Consumer.

LVII. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this Power to and the incorporated Acts contained, it shall be lawful for the Com- Undertakers pany to lay any Pipe, Branch, or other Apparatus from any Main or ‘olay PiPes Branch Pipes into, through, or against any Building for the Purpose Building5 of lighting the same, and to provide and set up any Apparatus necessary for securing to any Buildings a proper and complete Supply of Gas, and for measuring and ascertaining the Extent of such Supply.

LVIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing in this Act Saving or the said incorporated Acts contained shall extend or be construed RiShts of to extend to prejudice, interfere with, or derogate from the Rights, (j0,nmis-Privileges, or Advantages of the Commissioners for improving the KeT&c.of* Pier and Port of Hartlepool. LX. And be it enacted, That nothing contained in this Act, or in the Acts herein recited or referred to, shall extend to authorize the Company to purchase, take, or use any Land or Soil, or any Rights in respect thereof, belonging to Her Majesty in right of Her Crown, without the Consent in Writing of the Commissioners for the Time being of Her Majesty's Woods, Forests, Land Revenues, Works, and Buildings, or any Two of them, first had and obtained for that Purpose, and which such Commissioners or any Two of them are hereby authorized and empowered to give, or to prejudice, diminish, alter, or take away any of the Rights, Privileges, Powers, or Authorities vested in or enjoyed by Her Majesty, Her Heirs or Successors.

LXI. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Company from the Provisions of "The Public Health Act, 1848," or of any general Act relating thereto, or to the Subject Matter thereof, which may pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament.

LXII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. xx vi.

An Act for better supplying with Water the Borough of Macclesfield in the County of Chester, and for other Purposes connected with the said Borough.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Eleventh Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act for better supplying the In/iabitants of the Borough 11 G. 4. of Macclesfield in the County of Chester with Water, and to establish l'V.t. c. the Rates payable fur the same, whereby, after reciting that the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the said Borough were the Owners or reputed Owners of divers Springs of Water situate within the same Borough, and had for a considerable Number of Years then last past, and at much Expense, supplied the Inhabitants thereof with Water, to their great Accommodation and Benefit, Powers are given for extending the Works of the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, and which have accordingly been extended, so as to afford an additional Supply of Water as therein mentioned : And whereas at the Time of the passing of the said recited Act the Borough of Macclesfield was coextensive with the Township of Macclesfield only, but under the Provisions of the Act passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Fifth and Sixth Years of the Reign of King William the Fourth, intituled An Act to provide for the Regulation of Municipal Corpo- 5 & ^ rations in England and Wales, certain Parts of the adjoining Town- c. 76. [Local.] 4 N ships

124.

326 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxvi.

ships of Sutton and Hurdsfield were for Municipal Purposes added to and now form Part of the Borough of Macclesfield: And whereas it is expedient that the said recited Act of the Eleventh \ ear of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth should be repealed, and that the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the said Borough should be enabled to construct additional and more extensive Works for better supplying the said Borough with Water, and that Powers should be given for regulating the Markets and Fairs now held in the said Borough, and for establishing other Markets and Fairs therein, and for other Purposes relating to the Government of the said Borough, but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and Recited Act by the Authority of the same, That the said recited Act passed in repealed. the Eleventh Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth shall be and the same is hereby repealed from and after the Twenty-ninth Day of September One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine, but without Prejudice to any Acts or Proceedings previously had, done, or transacted under or pursuant to the said Act.

Commence-

II. And be it enacted, That this Act shall commence and take meat of Act. effect from and after the Twenty-ninth Day of September One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine.

Interpretation of Terms.

III. And be it enacted, That the following Words and Expressions in this Act and any Act or Part of any Act incorporated therewith shall have the Meanings hereby assigned to them, unless there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Construction;

(that is to say,)

Words importing the Singular Number shall include the Plural Number, and Words importing the Plural Number shall include the Singular Number:

Words importing the Masculine Gender shall include Females : The Word " Person " shall include a Corporation, whether aggregate or sole:

The Word "Lands" shall include Messuages, Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments of any Tenure:

The Word " Street" shall extend to and include any Road, Square, Court, Alley, and Thoroughfare within the Limits of this Act: The W'ord " Month " shall mean Calendar Month:

The Expression " Superior Courts " shall mean Her Majesty's Superior Courts of Record at Westminster:

1 he Word "Oath" shall include Affirmation in the Case of Quakers, and any' Declaration lawfully substituted for an Oath in the Case of any other Person allowed by Law to make a Declaration instead of taking an Oath:

The Word "Justice" of the Peace shall mean Justice of the Peace acting for the Place where the Matter requiring the Cognizance of any such Justice arises; and where any Matter is authorized or required to be done by Two Justices, the Expression "Two

6 Justices"

327

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. xsxi.

Justices" shall be understood to mean Two or more Justices met and acting together:

The Expression "Quarter Sessions" shall mean the General Quarter Sessions of the Peace for the County of Chester:

The Word'" Cattle " shall include Horses, Asses, Mules, Sheep,

Goats, and Swine.

IV. And be it enacted, That all Officers appointed or acting under Officers the said Act passed in the Eleventh Year of the Reign of King actmj; under George the Fourth, and who on the Day of the Commencement of c.i24.t’ocon-this Act shall hold Office thereunder, shall thenceforth continue

tinue until

to hold Office until they shall be removed under the Power herein- removed, after contained.

And be it enacted, That all the Clauses and Provisions of Provision* of the Commissioners Clauses Act, 1847> with respect to the Accounta- 11 bility of Officers and the Remedies against them in case of their Accounta-" failing to account shall be incorporated with this Act, and shall apply bility of

to all Officers who on the Day of the Commencement of this Act existing Offi-shall hold Office under the said Act of the Eleventh Year of the Reign ®ers’f° "PP^ of King George the Fourth.

VII. And be it enacted, That notwithstanding the repealing by Power to this Act of the said recited Act passed in the Eleventh Year of the recover Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth it shall be lawful j^L’ars of for the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses from and after the 1 ates-Commencement of this Act to demand, recover, and receive ail Rates

and Rents, and Arrears of Rates and Rents, Penalties, and Sums of Money now due or owing to the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses under or by virtue of the said first-recited Act, as fully and effectually and by the same Ways and Means as the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, or the Committee appointed under the said recited Act, might have demanded, recovered, and received such Rates, Rents,

Penalties, or Sums of Money and Arrears in case this Act had not been passed.

for that Purpose, contracted Debts on Mortgages and otherwise, CorPoration-and it is expedient to provide for the Payment of the said Debts: Be it therefore enacted, That after the Commencement of this Act all Mortgages, Bonds, Debts, and Sums of Money which before the Commencement of this Act were given, contracted, and were payable by the said Waterworks Committee, and Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses respectively in relation to the said first-recited Act or otherwise according to Law, shall, together with all Interest due or to

accrue due thereon, be paid by the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the said Borough, out of the Rents or Rates and other Property hereby or otherwise respectively made applicable for that Purpose, and shall have the same Priority as nearly as Circumstances will admit as they had previously to the Commencement of this Act, and shall be recovered in like Manner as the same could have been recovered from the said Waterworks Committee, and Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses respectively, previously to the Commencement of this Act.

IX. And he lt enacted, That from and after the Commencement of Contracts, this Act all Contracts, Assurances, and Proceedings made, commenced, &-c. to bind 0r entered into with, against, or by the said Waterworks Committee, dermen 'and aru* Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, and all Penalties, Forfeitures, largesses!'11 and Obligations incurred by them respectively in relation to the Execution of the said Act of the Eleventh Year of the Reign of King George the Fourth, shall and may be carried on and enforced with, against, and by the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses in the same Manner and as fully and effectually as if this Act had not been passed.

Actions, &c. X. And be it enacted, That no Action, Suit, Prosecution, or other not to abate. Proceeding whatsoever, commenced by or against the said Waterworks Committee, or the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, previously to the Commencement of this Act, shall thereupon abate or be discontinued or prejudicially affected by this Act, but on the contrary shall continue and take effect in favour of or against the same Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses as the same would have continued and taken effect against or in favour of the respective Parties if this Act had not been passed.

XI. XIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing in this Lands by Act or in the said Lands Clauses Consolidation Act contained shall except'for"' aut'l01‘ze t,lc saitl Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses to purchase, take, Waterworks. or use any Lands or other Hereditaments, except for the Purpose of the Waterworks and the Works connected therewith, herein-after described and compulsorily authorized, unless with the Consent of and by Agreement with the Owners, Lessees, or Occupiers thereof.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxvi. 3U

XIV. And be it enacted, That this Act and the several Acts and ^‘trfuction Parts of Acts incorporated therewith shall be read and construed as if

the Words " Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the Borough ol Macclesfield acting by the Council of the said Borough" were inserted therein, instead of the Words " Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses,

" Undertakers," "Commissioners," "Company," or other Designation, as the Case may be, wherever the same respectively occurs; and such Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses by such Council shall have, exercise, and execute the Powers, Authorities, and Duties hereby conferred, authorized, or required according to the Laws for the Time being in force with respect to Municipal Corporations in England and Wales.

[Short Title.]

XV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in Deeds, Instruments, and legal and other Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Macclesfield Borough Waterworks Act, 1849-"

XVI. And be it enacted, That the Limits of this Act shall com- Limits of prise and include the whole of the Borough of Macclesfield, as defined

for Municipal Purposes by the said Act passed in the Session of ■^n<jc*!l'| L Parliament held in the Fifth and Sixth Years of the Reign of King Borough. William the Fourth.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Mayor, Aldermen, and Bur- Powers of gesses of the said Borough shall and may, subject to the Provisions the Mayor, of this Act and the Acts and Parts of Acts incorporated therewith, c‘ maintain the said existing Waterworks and Works connected therewith, and construct the additional Waterworks and Works connected therewith herein-after referred to, and supply the said Borough and the Inhabitants thereof with Water, and may, within the said Borough of Macclesfield, exercise all the Powers vested in them by this Act and the Acts and Parts of Acts incorporated therewith.

XVIII. And whereas Plans and Sections showing the Lines and Power to Levels of the intended new Waterworks, and also a Book of Reference make Water-containing the Names of the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers or wor,k.s ac‘ reputed Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers of the Lands and Streams in depoJifert° or through which the same are intended to be made or to pass, have Plans, been deposited with the Clerk of the Peace for the County of Chester:

Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, subject to the Provisions and Restrictions in this Act and the said Acts incorporated therewith contained, to make and maintain the said Waterworks, together with Reservoirs, Conduits,

Pipes, and other Works in the Line and on the Levels and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans and described in the said Book of Reference, and to purchase, enter upon, take, and use such of the Lands, Streams, and Waters mentioned in the said Plan and Book of Reference as shall be necessary for that Purpose, and to agree for a Lease or User of all or any of such Lands, Streams, and Waters, and to take therefrom such Water as the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses may require for the Purposes of this Act.

Deviations.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxvl

XIX. And be it enacted, That the Persons empowered by the said Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, to convey Lands shall have full Power to make Leases or Grants of any Lands, Streams, and Waters, and the User thereof, and any Easement, Power, or Authority in or over such Lands, Streams, or Waters, for the Purposes of this Act: Provided always, that in all such Leases or Grants, when made by any Individual who shall be entitled to any other Estate than a Fee Simple for his own Use, or by any Corporation, there be reserved the best Rent or Remuneration that can reasonably be gotten for the Premises thereby demised or granted, payable half-yearly or oftener, and that no Premium, Fine, Grassum, or Foregift be taken for making the same.

XX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses from Time to Time to take and store up in the said Reservoirs and Works constructed or so to be constructed as aforesaid the Waters of any Springs, Brooks, Rivulets, Streams, and Drains which may be intercepted or collected by any of the intended Works, and from Time to Time to draw off and use the Waters so stored up for the Purposes of this Act, and for the Purposes aforesaid to alter and divert the Course of the said Springs, Brooks, Rivulets, Streams, and Drains and their Tributaries to the Extent and in manner shown on the said Plans: Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall extend to authorize the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses to divert or intercept any Springs, Brooks, Rivulets, or Streams which at present directly or indirectly supply with Water the Macclesfield Canal or the Navigation from the Trent to the Mersey.

XXI. And be it enacted, That in constructing the said Waterworks the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall not deviate from the Line of the Works laid down on the said Plans more than Eleven Yards : Provided always, that no such Deviation shall extend to a greater Distance than the Limits of Deviation delineated on the said Plans, and that the Works by means of such Deviation be not made to extend into the Lands of any Person not mentioned in the said Books of Reference without his previous Consent in Writing, unless the Name of such Person shall have been omitted by Mistake, and the Fact that such Omission happened from Mistake shall have been certified in manner provided by the " Waterworks Clauses Act, 1847," herein referred to.

XXII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, if they shall think fit, to purchase by Agreement, or take upon Lease, or rent or hire, upon such Terms and for such Considerations as shall he agreed upon, the whole or any Part of any Waterworks, Reservoirs, Canals, Rivers, Cuts, Sluices, Aqueducts, Conduits, Brooks, Streams of Water, Ponds, Springs, Wells, Rivulets, Watercourses, Lands, and Hereditaments not mentioned in the said Plans and Books of Reference, or of any Rights therein respectively, for the Purpose of supplying the said Borough or any Part thereof with Water, and for making and providing Reservoirs, Banks, Aqueducts, Conduits, Buildings, Dams, Conveniences,

331

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxvi.

veniences, and other Works for storing, protecting, conveying, and making available the same.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That the Quantity of Lands to be taken by the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses for additional or extraordinary Purposes for the Waterworks and Works connected therewith hereby compulsorily authorized to be made shall not exceed in the whole Thirty Acres.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That the Powers of the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses for the compulsory Purchase or taking of Lands and Hereditaments for the Purposes of the said Waterworks and Works connected therewith shall not be exercised after the Expiration of Three Years from the Commencement of this Act.

XXV. And be it enacted, That the Waterworks hereby compulsorily authorized shall be completed within Five Years from the Time of the Commencement of this Act, and on the Expiration of such Period the Powers by this or the said incorporated Acts granted to the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses for executing such Works, or otherwise in relation thereto, shall cease to be exercised, except as to so much of the said Waterworks as shall then be completed.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall be entitled to receive from every Person supplied with Water by them, under the Provisions of this Act and other Acts or Parts of Acts incorporated herewith, or any of them, such Rent or Sum of Money according to the annual Value of the Tenements supplied with Water as shall be agreed upon between the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses and such Person, according to the Scale following; (that is to say,)

Where the annual Value of such Tenement shall not exceed Twenty Pounds per Annum, the Water Rent shall not exceed per Annum One Shilling and Three-pence in the Pound upon such Value:

Where such Value shall exceed Twenty Pounds and shall not exceed Forty Pounds per Annum, the Water Rent shall not exceed per Annum One Shilling and Four-pence Three Farthings in the Pound upon such Value:

Where such Value shall exceed Forty Pounds and shall not exceed Sixty Pounds per Annum, the Water Rent shall not exceed per Annum One Shilling and Three-pence Halfpenny in the Pound upon such Value:

Where such Value shall exceed Sixty Pounds per Annum and shall not exceed Eighty Pounds per Annum, the Water Rent shall not exceed per Annum One Shilling and Two-pence Farthing in the Pound upon such Value:

Where such Value shall exceed Eighty Pounds per Annum and shall not exceed One hundred Pounds per Annum, the Water Rent shall not exceed One Shilling and a Penny in the Pound upon such Value:

Limiting Quantity of Lands to be taken.

Period for compulsory Purchase of Lands limited.

Period within which Works are to be completed.

Power to Mayor, &c. to receive Rents for Water.

And

3.32

Supply of Water for manufacturing Purposes.

Rates how to be recovered.

Definition of domestic Purposes.

Application of Water Rates.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxvi.

And where such Value shall exceed One hundred Pounds per Annum, the Water Rent shall not exceed One Shilling in the Pound upon such Value:

Provided nevertheless, that the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall not be entitled to receive from any Person in respect of a Supply of Water to any Dwelling House or Part of a Dwelling House more than the Sum of Ten Pounds in any One Year, and that they shall not be obliged to furnish a Supply of Water to any Person for any less Sum than Five Shillings per Annum.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That in case of Manufacturers or other Persons requiring a Supply of Water for the Purposes of any Trade or Business whatsoever, or for any Purpose other than domestic Purposes, such Supply shall be furnished at such Rent or Rate, and upon such Terms and Conditions, as may be agreed upon between the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses and such Persons respectively,

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That all Arrears of Rates or Rents may, when the same do not exceed the Sum of Five Pounds, be recovered, with Costs, either by Distress or Sale of the Goods and Chattels of the Persons respectively liable to pay the same, wdierever such Goods and Chattels may be found, in like Manner as Rent reserved on common Demises or under the Provisions of the Waterworks Clauses Act, 1847, subject to such Appeal to the Quarter Sessions as is thereby provided; and when such Arrears shall exceed the Sum of Five Pounds, the same may be recovered in the Manner provided by the said Waterworks Clauses Act, 1847,

XXIX. And be it enacted, That a Supply of Water for domestic Purposes shall not include a Supply of Water for Horses, Cattle, or for washing Carriages, or for any Trade or Business whatsoever.

XXX. And be it enacted, That all Monies arising from the said Water Rates or Rents, and from Arrears of Water Rates or Rents, and Penalties and Debts connected therewith, due to the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, shall, subject to the Mortgages for the Time being affecting the same, be applied as follows:

Firstly, in paying the Interest due on any Mortgages or other Securities now owing on the said existing Waterworks and Water Rates or Rents, or any of them:

Secondly, in paying the Interest of any future Mortgages or Securities on the said present and any future Waterworks and Water Rates or Rents, or any of them, and the Expenses of maintaining, conducting, carrying on, and regulating such Waterworks, and other the Works and Matters hereby authorized:

1 hirdly, the Residue of such Monies shall be paid over to the Treasurer of the said Borough, to be carried to the Account of " The Borough Fund," and shall be applied and disposed of as Part of such Fund, according to the Provisions of the said Act passed in the Session of Parliament holden in the Fifth and Sixth Years of the Reign of His Majesty King William the Fourth.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxvi. 333

XXXI. And be it enacted, That all Pipes and other Conduits to Gas Pipes be laid or used for the Conveyance of Gas in, under, through, along, "a"*|t"it|fin across, or round any Street or other Place within the Limits of this T|iree Feet Act shall be laid at the greatest practicable Distance, and, if the Width of Water of such Street or other Place will allow thereof, at the Distance of Pipes-Three Feet at least from the nearest Part of any Pipe or Conduit already laid down or hereafter to be laid down for the Conveyance of Water in, under, through, along, across, or round any of the said Streets or other Places, except in Cases where it shall be unavoidably necessary to lay any Gas Pipe across any Water Pipe or Conduit for the Conveyance of Water, in which Cases such Gas Pipe shall be laid above such Water Pipe at the greatest practicable Distance therefrom, and shall form therewith a Right Angle, or as nearly so as may be, and every such Gas Pipe so crossing any Water Pipe or Conduit for Water shall be of such Length that no Joint thereof shall be nearer to any such Water Pipe or Conduit for Water than Three Feet at least, and that in laying down such Gas Pipes the Undertakers or other Persons or Corporation supplying Gas shall in no case join Two or more Gas Pipes together previous to their being laid in the Trench, but shall lay each Pipe as near as may be in its Place in the Trench, and shall in such Trench properly form the joining with the other Pipes to be added thereto with proper and sufficient Materials, and shall also make and keep all such Pipes, and all Pipes communicating therewith, and all the Screws and Joints thereof respectively Air-tight, so as to prevent the Gas from escaping therefrom.

XXXII. And be it enacted, That as Compensation to the Owners Compensa-and Occupiers for the Time being of the Mills and Works of tion to -V'11' Messieurs Isaac Smith, Samuel Smith, and William Pritchard, or any Co's^a/0' of them, and of Messieurs Charles Wood and Richard Wood, situate Water, in Sutton aforesaid, and which may be affected by the Waterworks hereby compulsorily authorized, the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall and they are hereby required to discharge from and out of the intended Reservoir, to be called the Bottoms Reservoir, on each and every working Day, for the Supply of the said Mills and Works, a Quantity of Water equal at least to Three Cubic Feet per Second for Twelve Hours of every working Day.

XXXIV. Penalty for Failure to supply the stipulated Quantity of Water.

Application of Monies arising from Sale of superfluous Lands.

XXXV. And be it enacted, That in case of any Neglect or Default by or in consequence of which the Quantity of Compensation Water required as aforesaid to be discharged from the said Bottoms Reservoir shall not be sq discharged therefrom, the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall, for every Day on which such Neglect or Default shall occur, forfeit and pay, by way of Penalty, to the Occupiers of the said Mills and Works who may sue for the same in any of Her Majesty's Superior Courts, the Sum of Twenty-five Pounds, but such Penalty shall not be incurred if the Want of such Discharge of Water shall arise from unavoidable Cause or Accident or necessary Repairs; and the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall make good, repair, and restore the Works with all convenient Speed.

XXXVI. And be it enacted, That all Monies which shall come to the Hands of the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses in consequence of the Sale of any superfluous Lands and Hereditaments under the Provisions of this Act and of the Acts incorporated therewith, or any of them, shall he applicable to all or any of the Purposes herein authorized, and, subject thereto, shall be paid over to the Treasurer of the said Borough, to he carried to the Account of "The Borough Fund," and shall be applied and disposed of as Part of such Fund according to the Provisions of the said Act passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Fifth and Sixth Years of the Reign of His Majesty King William the Fourth.

XXXVIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, when and as they shall think
