XXXIX. And be it enacted, That when sufficient new Market Places and Places for holding Fairs shall have been provided as aforesaid it shall be lawful for the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses either to discontinue the Use of the present Market Places and Places for holding Fairs as such, and to sell and dispose of the same, or to use and convert the same for any other Purpose whatsoever, or to continue the same as such Market Places and Places for holding Fairs as aforesaid, notwithstanding the setting up, making, erecting, building, and establishing of such other Market Places and Places tor holding Fairs as aforesaid.

XL. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, if they shall think fit, to purchase by Agreement, or to take upon Lease, or rent, or hire, and upon such Terms and for such Considerations as shall be agreed upon, any Lands or Hereditaments which they may think proper for the Purpose of improving the said existing Places for holding Markets and Fairs, and of making such new Places for holding Markets and Fairs as aforesaid, and for making proper Approaches thereto, and for providing Slaughter-houses and other Conveniences connected therewith.

XLI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses from Time to Time to demand and take from any Person occupying or using any Ground, Building, Stall, Stand, Shamble, Pen, or Place in any existing or future Place for holding any Market or Fair, or bringing into any such Market or Pair any Cattle or Animals, or other marketable Commodities, Articles, Matters, or Things specified in the Schedule to this Act annexed! such Stallages, Rents, Payments, and Tolls as the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall from Time to Time appoint, not exceeding the Stallages, Rents, Payments, and Tolls specified in the said Schedule.

XLVII. And whereas the estimated Expense of making the new p°*er to Waterworks for better supplying the said Borough with Water is borrow Fourteen thousand Pounds, and other Monies will be required for Mortgage, carrying the other Purposes of this Act into execution: Be it enacted,

That it shall be lawful for the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses from Time to Time to borrow, at Interest, upon the Security of the Borough Rate of the said Borough and of any Property vested in or belonging to the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, or which may be acquired by them under or by virtue of this Act, or otherwise howsoever, or on any One or more of such Securities, (but subject to the Mortgages and other Debts already charged thereon,) any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Forty-nine thousand Pounds, and in the event of all or any Part of such Monies being paid off by the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, to re-borrow the same toties quoties, and for securing the Repayment of the Monies so to be borrowed, with Interest, the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses may make and execute any Mortgage, Bond, or other Security.

XLVIII. And be it enacted, That every such Mortgage or Security Form of shall be by Deed duly stamped, in which the Consideration shall be Mortgage, truly stated, and every such Deed shall be under the Common Seal of the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses.

XLIX. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained Council not shall extend to enable the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses to take, to sel1 or appropriate, use, sell, demise, mortgage, or alienate for the Purposes of ™ortsa§e this Act, without the Approbation of the Lords Commissioners of Her without Con Majesty's Treasury, or any Three of them, any Lands, Tenements, sent of the or Hereditaments which they could not have taken, appropriated, Treasury, used, sold, demised, mortgaged, or alienated without such Approbation before the passing of this Act, anything in this Act to the contrary notwithstanding. Mortgages to be without Preference.

Register of Mortgages to be kept, and to be open to Inspection.

Transfer or Assignments of Mortgages.

Register of Transfers to be kept.

Interest on Mortgages to be paid half-yearly.

Power to borrow Money at a less Rate to pay off Securities bearing a higher Rate of Interest.

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. xxvi.

L. And be it enacted, That all Persons to whom such Mortgages or Securities shall hereafter be made, or who shall be entitled to the Monies thereby secured, shall, in proportion to the Sums therein respectively mentioned, be Creditors on the Property and Funds which may he included in such Mortgages or Securities equally one with another without any Preference in respect of the Priority of advancing such Monies, or the Dates of any such Mortgages or Securities respectively, and the Principal Monies and Interests secured by such Mortgages or Securities, and all Expenses incident thereto, shall he provided for and paid by the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, and in the same Manner, in all respects as other Debts and Expenses incurred by Municipal Corporations are by Law directed to be levied, raised, and paid.

LI. And be it enacted, That a Register of such Mortgages and Securities shall be kept by the Town Clerk of the said Borough, and within Fourteen Days after the Date of any such Mortgage or Security an Entry or Memorial of the Number and Date thereof, and of the Names of the Parties thereto, with their proper Additions, shall be made in such Register, and such Register may be perused at all reasonable Times by any Person interested therein without Fee or Reward.

LII. And be it enacted, That from Time to Time any Party entitled to any such Mortgage or Security may transfer his Right and Interest therein to any other Person by a Deed duly stamped, wherein the Consideration shall be truly stated.

LIII. And be it enacted, That within Thirty Days after the Date of every such Transfer it shall be produced to the Town Clerk of the said Borough, who thereupon shall cause an Entry or Memorial thereof to be made in the same Manner as in the Case of the original Mortgage or Security, and for such Entry the Town Clerk may demand a Sum not exceeding Five Shillings, and after such Entry every such Transfer shall entitle the Transferee, his Heirs, Executors, Administrators, or Assigns, to the full Benefit of the original Mortgage or Security in all respects, and no Party having made such Transfer shall have Power to make void, release, or discharge the Mortgage or Security so transferred or any Money thereby secured.

LIV. And be it enacted, That, unless otherwise provided by any Mortgage or Security, the Interest of the Money borrowed upon every such Mortgage or Security shall be paid half-yearly to the several Persons entitled thereto.

LV. And be it enacted, That if the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses can at any Time borrow or take up any Sums of Money for any of the Purposes of this Act at a lower Rate of Interest than any Mortgages or Securities given by them, and which shall be then in force, shall bear, then it shall be lawful for them from Time to Time to borrow such Sums of Money as they shall think proper, at such lower Rate as aforesaid, in order to pay off and discharge any Mortgages or Securities bearing such higher Rate of Interest, and in such Manner and on such Security, and subject to such Regulations, as are i herein

339

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. x\vi.

herein contained with respect to Monies borrowed on Mortgage or Security.

LVI. And be it enacted, That when and as often as the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall, under the Provisions of this Act, be enabled and think it expedient to pay off One or more out of the Number of such Mortgages or Securities upon which the same Rate of Interest shall be payable, or a Part of the Money secured on any such Mortgage or Security, if the Person holding such Mortgage or Security shall consent to accept such Part, the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall cause a Notice, signed by the Town Clerk of the said Borough, to be given to the Person entitled to the Money to be paid off, and such Notice shall express the Principal Sum proposed to be paid off, and that the same will be paid, together with the Interest due thereon, at a Place to be specified in such Notice, at the Expiration of Six Calendar Months from the Date of giving such Notice, and at the Expiration of such Period the Interest of the Principal Money to be paid off shall cease, unless such Principal Money and Interest be not paid on Demand pursuant to such Notice, but such Principal Money and the Interest thereof to the End of the said Six Months shall nevertheless be payable on Demand.

LVII. And be it enacted, That for the Purpose of providing a Fund for paying off' the Principal Monies for the Time being owing by virtue of any Mortgage or Security made in pursuance of this Act, the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall once in every Year, out of the said Borough Fund and other their Property and Income, or some or one of them, or some Part thereof, set aside such Sum of Money as they shall think proper, not being more than Five Pounds per Centum on the Amount of such Principal Monies, and the Sum so from Time to Time to be set aside, and also all other Monies which shall be applied by the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses in augmentation of the said Fund, shall be applied in the Manner herein directed in payment, so far as the same will extend, of such Principal Monies, or the same shall be invested in the Public Funds, or on Government or Real Security, in the Names of the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, and the Dividends and Interest of the Monies so invested, when and as the same shall become due, shall be received and invested in like Manner, in order that the said Monies so set aside and invested may accumulate at Compound Interest, and when the accumulated Fund shall amount to a Sum which in the Opinion of the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses can be conveniently applied for that Purpose, the Stocks, Funds, or Securities whereon the same shall be invested shall be sold or otherwise be converted into Money, and the Monies arising from any such Sale and Conversion shall be applied in the Manner by this Act directed in payment, so far as the same will extend, of the said Principal Monies, and so from Time to Time until the whole of the said Principal Monies shall have been discharged.

LVIII. And be it enacted, That if any Party have committed any Irregularity, Trespass, or other wrongful Proceeding in the Execution of this Act or any Act incorporated therewith, or by virtue of any

Power or Authority thereby given, and if before Action brought in respect thereof such Party make Tender of sufficient Amends to the Party injured, such last-mentioned Party shall not recover in any such Action; and if no such Tender have been made, it shall be lawful for the Defendant by Leave of the Court where such Action is pending, at any Time before Issue joined, to pay into Court such Sum of Money as he thinks fit, and thereupon such Proceedings shall be had as in other Cases where Defendants are allowed to pay Money into Court.

LIX. And be it enacted, That the Clauses of the " Railways Penalties. Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," with respect to the Recovery of Damages not specially provided for, and Penalties, and to the Determinations of any other Matter referred to Justices, shall be incorporated in this Act for all or any of the Purposes thereof.

Water Rates, LX 11. And be it enacted, That all Water Rates or Rents due to Amount not sa*c* Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, and all Damages, Costs, disputed, and Expenses, the Amount whereof shall not be disputed, may be may be recovered in the same Manner as is by this Act, or by any Act or recovered as Part of any Act incorporated herewith, provided where the Amount by other thereof shall be ascertained and determined by Two Justices.

LXIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for any Justice who shall issue any Warrant of Distress for the Recovery of any Sum of Money payable under this Act, or any Act or Part of any Act incorporated therewith, to order that the Costs of the Proceedings for the Recovery of such Sum of Money shall be paid by the Person liable to pay such Sum of Money, and such Costs shall be ascertained by such Justice, and shall be included in the Warrant of Distress for the Recovery of such Sum of Money.

LXV. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall Saving extend or be construed to extend to take away, defeat, lessen, alter, yxeee™et'^ns-or affect in anywise howsoever any of the Rights, Privileges, and Exemptions from the Payment of Rates, Tolls, and Duties now enjoyed by the Freemen of the Borough of Macclesfield.

LXVI. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall Saving the take away, diminish, alter, prejudice, or affect any of the Properties, Winchester? Rights, Privileges, Powers, Franchises, or Authorities of or belonging Midfield, and to or vested in the Manchester, Sheffield, and Lincolnshire Railway Lincolnshire Company, in relation to the Macclesfield Canal or otherwise how- Railway

LXVII. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act, or in the Saving the Acts incorporated therewith contained shall extend to prejudice, diminish, alter, or take away any of the Rights, Powers, Privileges, or Staffordshire Authorities vested in the North Staffordshire Railway Company, but Railway all their Rights, Powers, Privileges, and Authorities, under their Company, several Acts of Parliaments are hereby expressly reserved.

LXVIII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall Undertaking be deemed or construed to exempt the said Mayor, Aldermen, and J!ot c*empt Burgesses from the Provisions of the "Public Health Act, 1848," v'°ions™t: or of any general Act relating thereto, or to the Subject Matter n&i2 Vict. thereof, which may pass during the present or any future Session of c. 63. Parliament.

LXIX. And be it enacted, That the Costs, Charges, and Expenses Expenses incurred or to be incurred by the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, of Act-for the Purpose of obtaining and passing this Act, and connected therewith, shall be paid out of the Borough Fund and Borough Rate of the said Borough.

[Public Act.]

LXX. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGINAE.

An Act for enabling the Leeds and Thirsk Railway Company to raise a further Sum of Money for the Completion of their Railways, to guarantee Interest on certain Shares, and for other Pur-

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Eighth and Ninth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, called " The Leeds and Thirsk Railway Act, 1845 And whereas Three several Acts were passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her said present Majesty, called respectively "The Leeds and Hartlepool Railway Act, 1846," " The Leeds and Thirsk (St. Helen's Branch Deviation) Railway Act, 1846," and " The Leeds and Thirsk Railway (Knaresborough Extension) Act, 1846 :" And whereas an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Tenth and Eleventh Years of the Reign of Her said present Majesty, called " The Leeds and Thirsk Railway (Crimple Deviation and Carlton Junction) Act, 1847:" And whereas Four several Acts were passed in the last Session of Parliament, called respectively " The Leeds and Thirsk Railway (Alteration of Levels of Leeds and Hartlepool Railway, &c.) Act, 1848," " Th & Leeds and Thirsk Railway (Harrogate and Puteley Brandi, and East and West Yorkshire Junction Railv * lalgamation) Act, 1848," "The Leeds and Thirsk

Cap. xxvii.

poses.

[26th June 1849.]

4 T

Railway

350

Provisions of recited Acts extended to this Act

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxvii.

Railway (Melmerby and Northallerton Junction) Act, 1848," and "The Leeds Central Railway Station Act, 1848:" And whereas under the Provisions of the said Leeds and Thirsk Railway Act,

1845, the Leeds and Hartlepool Railway Act, 184G, the Leeds and Thirsk Railway (Knaresborough Extension) Act, 1846, and the Leeds and Thirsk (Saint Helen’s Branch Deviation) Railway Act,

1846, the Company was empowered to raise for the Construction of the Railways and Works thereby authorized various Sums amounting in the whole to the Sum of One million three hundred and seventy-one thousand Pounds by Shares, and Four hundred and fifty-five thousand nine hundred and thirty-three Pounds by Loans, exclusive of the Sum of Eighty thousand Pounds which by the said Leeds Central Railway Station Act, 1848, the Leeds and Thirsk Railway Company was authorized to raise as its Contribution towards the Expense of the Works by such last-mentioned Act authorized, and exclusive also of the Sum of Four hundred and nine thousand three hundred and thirty-three Pounds which by the said Leeds and Thirsk Railway' (Melmerby and Northallerton Junction) Act, 1848, and the said Leeds and Thirsk Railway (Harrogate and Pateley Branch and East and West Yorkshire Junction Railway Amalgamation) Act, 1848, the said Company was authorized to raise for the special Purposes of executing the Works in the said Two last-named Acts mentioned, and none of which Works have been yet executed, r.or has any Money been called up under the Powers of the said Two last-mentioned Acts or either of them : And whereas the said Company has raised the Sum of One million two hundred and fifteen thousand two hundred and twenty-two Pounds, or thereabouts, by Shares, and the Sum of Four hundred and twenty-one thousand nine hundred and thirty-three Pounds, or thereabouts, by Loans, and the whole of such Amounts has been expended upon the Works or for the Purposes by such Four first-recited Acts authorized: And whereas it is expedient that the said Leeds and Thirsk Railway Company should be empowered to raise a further Sum of Money for the Completion of the Railways authorized by the said Acts or some of them: And whereas the original Line of the Leeds and Thirsk Railway authorized by the said first-mentioned Act, with such Deviations or Alterations therein as have been sanctioned by subsequent Acts of Parliament relating to the said Company, will shortly be completed and opened for Traffic; and it is expedient that from and after such Completion so much of the Three last-mentioned Acts as enacts that it shall not be lawful for the Company to guarantee Interest or give any Preference in the Receipt of Dividends upon or in respect of the Shares to be created under the Authority thereof should be repealed : And whereas it is also expedient that some of the Powers and Provisions of the said recited Acts should be explained, amended, and enlarged : But the Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions contained in the said recited Acts, so far as the same are or may be applicable and now in force, and except such

4 of

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxvii. 351

of them as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, shall extend to this Act, and to the several Purposes thereof, and to the several Matters and Things hereby authorized to be done, as fully and effectually as if the said Provisions were re-enacted in this Act in reference to such Purposes, Matters, and Things; and the said recited Acts and this Act shall be construed and read together as forming One Act.

II. And be it enacted, That for the Purpose of enabling the said Power to Company to complete the Railways and Works by the said recited Acts authorized it shall be lawful for them to raise the bum ot Pour by Creatioil hundred and fifty thousand Pounds, or any Part thereof, by the ofnew Creation of new Shares or Stock, in addition to the Sums of Money Share?, which they are authorized to raise by their former Acts and the said "Leeds Central Railway Station Act, 1848;" and the new Shares or Stock to be created by virtue of this Act shall be considered Part of the general Capital of the Company, and the Shares so to be created shall be of such Amount, and shall be issued at such Times, in such Manner, and to such Persons, and with such Priority in the Payment of Dividends in preference to the Holders of other Shares in the Company (except as herein-after mentioned), not exceeding after the Rate of Seven Pounds per Centum per Annum upon the nominal Amount thereof, and with such other Rights and Privileges, as any General Meeting of the Company specially convened for the Purpose may determine: Provided always, that all and every Part of such Sum of Money so to be raised shall be applicable only to the Objects and Purposes by this Act authorized.

III. Provided always, and be it enacted, That any Priority in the Saving Payment of Dividends which may be assigned to any Shares to be Riga's of created by virtue of this Act shall not prejudice or affect any Priority Holders of in the Payment of Dividends which may have been assigned to any Preference other Shares in the Company by or in pursuance of any Act passed Shares, prior to the passing of this Act, but the Holders of such last-mentioned Shares shall be entitled to receive Dividends upon or in respect of such Shares to the Extent to which the same may have been guaranteed, in preference to the Holders of any other Shares in the said Company.

IV. Provided also, and be it enacted, That Five Pounds per Calls.

Share shall be the greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make on the Shareholders in respect of the Money by this Act authorized to be raised, and Three Months at the least shall be the Interval between successive Calls.

V. And be it enacted, That after Shares for the whole of the Power to Capital in Shares by this and the said recited Acts limited or autho- borrow rized to be raised by the said Leeds and Thirsk Railway Company *Ioney on shall have been taken, and One Half of such Capital shall have been paid up, it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond such Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be authorized to be borrowed by Order of a General Meeting of the Company, not exceeding in the whole, in addition to the Sums authorized to be

borrowed

352

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxii.

borrowed by the said Company by the said recited Acts, the Sum of One hundred and fifty thousand Pounds, and to secure the Repayment of the Sum so to be borrowed, with Interest, by Mortgage or Bond of the Undertaking, as by the " Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," provided, and subject to the several Provisions therein contained with respect to the borrowing of Money on Mortgage or Bond : Provided always, that all and every Part of such Sum of Money so to be borrowed shall be applicable only to the Objects and Purposes by this Act authorized.

VI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages or Bonds granted by the Company before the passing of this Act, and which shall be in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall during the Continuance thereof have Priority over any Mortgages or Bonds to be created by virtue of this Act.

VII. And be it enacted, That every Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, and every Transfer of any Share, Stock, Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, to be granted or made by virtue of the said recited Acts or this Act, shall be by Deed duly stamped, wherein the Consideration for the same shall be truly stated, anything herein or in the said recited Acts contained to the contrary notwithstanding.

Restriction

VIII. And be it enacted, That when and so soon as the original m certain of Ljne of the Leeds and Thirsk Railway authorized by the said first-'" mentioned Act, with such Alterations or Deviations therein or there-

from as shall have been sanctioned by any subsequent Act relating to the said Company, shall have been completed and opened for Traffic, so much of each of the said Acts passed in the last Session of Parliament, called respectively " The Leeds and Thirsk Railway (Harrogate and Pateley Branch and East and West Yorkshire Junction Railway Amalgamation) Act, 1848," and "TheZeecfc and Thirsk Railway (Melmerby and Northallerton Junction) Act, 1848," and " The Leeds Central Railway Station Act, 1848," as enacts and declares that in the Creation of the new Shares or Stock by such Acts respectively authorized to be created by the Leeds and Thirsk Railway Company it shall not be lawful for the Company to guarantee Interest or give any Preference in the Receipt of Dividend upon or in respect of such new Shares or Stock, shall be and the same is hereby declared to be thenceforth repealed.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxvii.

Shares or any of them, in preference to the Holders of all other Shares in the Company (except any Shares to which any Priority in the Payment of Dividends may have been assigned by or in pursuance of any Act passed prior to the passing of this Act), not exceeding after the Rate of Six Pounds per Centum per Annum on the nominal Amount of such Shares or any of them, and to such other Rights or Privileges in respect thereof, as a General Meeting of the Company may have directed or may hereafter direct.

X. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Com- Interest not pany, out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the said Railway Company authorized to be raised by Calls in respect of |)aiJ up Shares, or by the Exercise of any Power of borrowing, to pay Interest or Dividend to any Shareholder on the Amount of the Calls made in respect of the Shares held by him in the Capital by this Act authorized to be raised: Provided always, that nothing herein-before contained shall be deemed to prevent the said Company from paying to any Shareholder such Interest on Money advanced by him beyond the Amount of the Calls actually made as shall be in conformity with the Provisions in the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, in that Behalf contained.

XL. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Deposits for

Company, out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating future Hills

to the said Railway Company authorized to be raised for the Purposes n°it(it"ubteot of such Act or Acts, to pay or deposit any Sum of Money which by t|‘,e any Standing Order of either House of Parliament, now in force or pany'* hereafter to be in force, may be required to be deposited in respect Capital, of any Application to Parliament for the Purpose of obtaining an Act authorizing the said Company to construct any other Railway or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

XII. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of Railway the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to proride for Company to the Conveyance of the Mails by Railways; and another Act was besabjectt<l

passed in the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, on & 2

intituled An Act for regulating Railways; and another Act was c. 98.," passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled 3& + V|ct. An Act for the better Regulation of Railways, and for the Conveyance -'I^V of Troops; and another Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the c. 55 'Ct' Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Con- 7 & 8 Vict. ditions to the Construction of future Railways authorized or to be c-85- an(l authorized by any Act of the present or succeeding Sessions of Par- 9 &4° Vi.ct-liament, and for other Purposes in relation to Railways; and CC'°" another Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways; and another Act was passed in the same Session, intituled An Act for constituting Commissioners of Railways; Be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall be held to exempt the said Railways or the said Company from the Provisions of the said several Acts respectively, but that such Provisions shall be in force in respect of the said Railways and Company so far as the same are applicable.

354

Railways to be subject to Provisions of future general Acts.

Expenses of Act.

Short Title of Act.

[Public Act.]

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cup.xxvii.

XIII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Railways by the said recited Acts authorized to be made, or the Company, from the Provisions of any general Act relating to such Acts, or of any general Act relating to Railways, or to the better and more impartial Audit of the Accounts of Railway Companies, now in force or which may hereafter pass during this or any future Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision and Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament, of the maximum Rates of Fares and Charges authorized by the said recited Acts.

XIV. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of and attending the passing of this Act or incidental thereto shall be paid by the said Company out of the first Monies that shall come to their Hands, and in preference to any other Payment whatsoever.

XV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments and other Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to refer to and describe it by the Title of " The Leeds and Thirsk Railway Act, 1849."

XVI. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA RKGIN/E.

Cap. xxviii.

An Act for making a short Railway to connect the lane of the Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway with the Line of the London and Southwestern Railway; and for other Purposes.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, called " The Reading, Guildford, and 9 & 10 Vict. Reigate Railway Act, 1840," whereby " The Reading, Guildford, c. 171. and Reigate Railway Company" svere incorporated and authorized to make the Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway from near the Line of the Great Western Railway and Berks and Hants Railway at Reading through Guildford to Reigate, and crossing the Line of the London and South-western Railway at or near Farnborough in the County of Southampton : And whereas an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Tenth and Eleventh Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, called " The Reading, Guildford, 10& 11 Vict. and Reigate Railway Amendment Act, 1847:" And whereas it is c. 241. expedient that a Railway should he made to connect the Line of the said Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway with the Line of the London and South-western Railway, and that further Power [Local.] 4 X should

358 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxviii.

should be given for facilitating the Construction of the Line of the said Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway, but the same cannot be done without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, Provisions of That all the Provisions in the said recited Acts contained, so far as the recited Acts same are applicable and now unrepealed and in force, and are not extended to jnconsistent with or altered by the Provisions of this Act, or of the "Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," or of the "Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," as extended to this Act, shall extend to this Act, and to the several Objects and Purposes thereof, as fully and effectually as if the same Provisions were re-enacted in this Act with reference to such Objects and Purposes.

8 & 9 Vict.

II. And be it enacted, That the Provisions of " The Lands Clauses cc. 18. & Consolidation Act, 1845," and of the " Railways Clauses Consolidation Crated with ^ct> 1845," in so far as the same may be applicable and are not incon-fliis' Act. 1 * sistent with the Provisions herein-after contained, shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act.

[Short Title.]

III. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament and in legal Instruments it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway (Connexion with London and South-western Railway) Act, 1849."

Power to

IV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Reading, make branch Guildford, and Reigate Railway Company, with and out of any Monies Railway. which they are authorized to raise by the said recited Acts or either of them, and which will not be required for the Purposes of such Acts or either of them, to make the Railway herein-after mentioned, with all proper Works and Conveniences connected therewith; (that is to say,)

A Railway commencing by a Junction with the Line of the said Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway as at present authorized to be made in the Parish of Farnborough and County of Southampton, and terminating in the Chapelry of Frimley in the Parish of Ash in the County of Surrey by a Junction with the Line of the London and South-western Railway.

Railway to V. Lessees, or reputed Owners, Lessees, and of the Occupiers of the Lands which may be required to be taken for the Purpose thereof, have been deposited with the respective Clerks of the Peace for the Counties of Surrey and Southampton : Be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions and Powers of Deviation contained in this and the said " Railways Clauses Consolidation Act," the said Railway shall be made in the Line or Course and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans, and described in the said Books of Reference, and according to the Levels defined on the said Sections, and it shall be lawful

XI. And be it enacted, That every Passenger travelling upon the Passengers said Railway may take with him his ordinary Luggage, not exceeding Luggage. One hundred Pounds in Weight for each First-class Passenger, Sixty Pounds in Weight for each Second-class Passenger, and Sixty Pounds

in Weight for each Third-class Passenger, without any Charge being made for the Carriage thereof.

XIII. And be it enacted, That notwithstanding anything in this Act contained it shall not be lawful for the Company, without tile Consent of the London and South-western Railway Company under their Common Seal first had and obtained, to acquire any Right or Property in any of the Lands of the same Company, but only the Right, subject to the Provisions of this Act, of forming and maintaining upon the Lands of the same Company such Works as shall be necessary and proper tor effecting a Junction by means of the Railway hereby authorized to be made with the Line of the said London and South-western Railway; and all such Works shall be formed and from Time to Time repaired and maintained, and all such Openings in the Ledges and Flanches of the same Railway as may be convenient for effecting such Junction shall be made at the Expense of the said Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway Company, under the Superintendence and Direction and to the Satisfaction of the principal Engineer for the Time being of the said London and South-western Railway Company.

XIV. And be it enacted, That, save as herein is expressly enacted, nothing in this Act contained shall extend to prejudice, alter, or take away any Rights, Powers, Privileges, or Authorities vested in the said London and South-western Railway Company.

XV. And whereas in the Construction of the Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway it has been found expedient to carry the said Railway across the several Highways numbered on the Plans referred to in the Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway Act, 181-6, as follows; that is to say, 46 in the Parish of Buckland, 37 in the Parish of Betchworth, 87 and 113 in the Parish of Dorking, 39 in the Parish of Abinger, 40, 65, 66, and 68 in the Parish of Shiere, 28 and 57 in the Parish of Albury, 21 in the Parish of Saint Martha, 1, 9, 30, 31, and 47 in the Parish of Shall'ord, 38, 68, and 100 in the Parish of Ash, all in the County of Surrey, on the Level with such Highways: Be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions contained in the said Railways Clauses Consolidation Act in reference to the crossing of Roads on the Level, it shall be lawful for the Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Railway Company to carry the Railway by the first-recited Act authorized to be made across and on the Level of the said Highways respectively.

XVI. And be it enacted, That for the greater Convenience and Security of the Public the Company shall erect and permanently maintain either a Station or Lodge at the Points where the said Railway crosses the before-mentioned Roads on the Level, and the said Company shall be subject to and shall abide by all such Rules and Regulations with regard to the crossing of such Roads on the Level, or with regard to the Speed at which Trains shall pass such Roads, as may from lime to Time be made by the Commissioners of Railways; and if the said Company shall fail to erect or at all Times maintain any such Station or Lodge, or appoint a proper Person to watch or superintend the crossing at any such Point or Station, or to observe or abide by any such Rule or Regulation as aforesaid, they shall for every such Offence be liable to a Penalty of Twenty Pounds, and also to a daily Penalty of Ten Pounds for every Day such Offence shall

continue

361

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. xxviii.

continue after such Penalty of Twenty Pounds shall have been incurred.

XVII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners of Railways, if it shall appear to them to be necessary for the public Safety, at any Time, either before or after the Railway hereby authorized to be carried across the said Roads on the Level shall have been completed and opened for public Traffic, to require the Company within such Time as the said Commissioners shall direct, and at the Expense of the Company, to carry any or either of the herein-before mentioned Roads either under or over the Railway by means of a Bridge or Arch in lieu of crossing the same on the Level, or to execute such other Works as under the Circumstances of the Case shall appear to the said Commissioners best adapted for removing or diminishing the Danger arising from any such level Crossing.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company permanently to stop up the several Roads numbered on the Plans referred to in the said " Reading, Guildford, and Reigate Act, 1846," as follows; that is to say, SI in the Parish of Albury in the County of Surrey, and 15, 20, and 26 in the Parish of Sandhurst in the County of Berks.

XIX. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide for the Conveyance of the Mails by Railway; and another Act was passed in the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating Railways; and another Act was passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for the better Regulation of Railways, and for the Conveyance of Troops; and another Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Conditions to the Construction offuture Railways authorized by any Act of the present or succeeding Sessions of Parliament, and for other Purposes in relation to Railways; and Two other Acts were passed in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled respectively An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways, and An Act for constituting Commissioners of Railways; and another Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Eleventh and Twelfth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to give further Time for making certain Railways: Be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall be held to exempt the Railway by this and the said recited Acts authorized to be made, or the said Company, from the Provisions of the said several Acts respectively, but that such Provisions shall be in force in respect of the said Railway and Company so far as the same shall be applicable thereto.

XX. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Railways by this or the said recited Acts authorized to be made from the Provisions of any general Act relating to Railways now in force, or which may hereafter pass

during this or any future Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision and Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament, of the maximum Rates of Fares and Charges authorized by this Act.

Expenses of

XXI. And be it enacted, That the Costs, Charges, and Expenses

Act. of and attending the passing of this Act or incidental thereto shall be paid by the said Company, pari passu with the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of every other Act of Parliament passed in the present Session to which they may be liable, out of the first Monies which shall come to their Hands, and in preference to every other Payment whatsoever.

[Public Act.]

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGIKE.

Cap. xxix.

An Act to vest the Stainforth and Keadby Canal in the Company of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River Dun.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Thirty-third Year of the Reign of King George the Third, intituled An Act for making and maintaining a navigable Canal from the River Dunn Navigation Cut at or near Stainforth in the West Riding of the County of York to join and communicate with the River Trent at or near Keadby in the County of Lincoln, and also a collateral Cut from the said Canal to join the said River Dunn in the Parish of Thorne in the said Riding, and by the said Act " The Company of Proprietors of the Stainforth and Keadby Canal Navigation " were incorporated: And whereas the Provisions of such Act have been amended and enlarged by Two other Acts passed respectively in the Thirty-eighth and Forty-ninth Years of the same Reign: And whereas an Act was passed in the Twelfth Year of the Reign of King George the First, intituled An Act for making the River Dun in the West Riding of the County of York navigable from Holmstile in Doncaster up to the utmost Extent of Tinsley Westward, a 1'ownship within Two Miles of Sheffield, and another Act was passed in the Thirteenth Year of the same Reign, intituled An Act for improving the Navigation of the River Dunn from a Place called Holmes-[ Local.] 4 Z stile

33G.3-c.ll7.

12G.1. c. 38.

13G.1.C. 80.

366 12° & 13° VICTOR IJE, Cap. xxix.

stile in the Township of Doncaster in the County of York to Wilsick House in the Parish, of Barmby Dunn in the said County.- And whereas the Provisions of such Acts have been amended and enlarged by certain Acts of Parliament passed respectively in the Sixth and Thirteenth Years of the Reign of King George the Second, and in the Sessions of Parliament held in the First and Second Years and in the Seventh Year of the Reign of King George the Fourth : And whereas by the said Act passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of King George the Second a Company was incorporated under the Style of " The Company of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River DunAnd whereas the Stainforth and Keadby Canal and the Navigation of the River Dun form, with the Aid of the Sheffield Canal, whereof the last-named Company of Proprietors are Lessees, a continuous Water Communication between the Trent and Humber on the one hand, and Sheffield and the manufacturing District of the West Riding of Yorkshire on the other, and it is expedient that the first-named Canal should be vested in the Company of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River Dun, so that the said Canal and Navigation may be placed under one uniform System of Management: And whereas it is expedient that the Tolls now levied upon the said Canal should be diminished, and that certain of the Provisions in the said recited Acts should be amended : And whereas it hath been agreed between the said Canal and Navigation Companies that the said Navigation Company should enter into possession of the said Canal on the First Day of January last, and also that the said Canal and its Appurtenances shall be absolutely vested in the said Navigation Company, provided that the Authority of Parliament can be obtained for that Purpose : May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, Stainforth and by the Authority of the same, That from and after the passing and Keadby of this Act the said Company of Proprietors of the Stainforth and ^Ehln*N*e<* Keadby Canal Navigation shall be and the same is hereby dissolved, v'igation ant* the aforesaid Stainforth and Keadby Canal, and all Cuts, Reser-Company. voirs, Aqueducts, Feeders, Water Tanks, Basins, Pens, Dams, Embankments, Weirs, Locks, Sluices, Culverts, Drains, Soughs, Tunnels, Arches, Sewers, Bridges, Fences, Gates, Ways, Roads, Railroads, Towing Paths, Landing Places, Docks, Quays, Wharfs, Houses, Toll Houses, and other Buildings, Cranes, Weighing Machines, Engines, and other Works, to the same Canal, Cuts, Branches, and Communications respectively belonging, and all and every other the Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments, Easements and Appurtenances whatsoever, of or to which the said Canal Company by virtue of their said recited Acts or by any other Means whatsoever was seised, possessed, or entitled, at Law or in Equity, on the First Day of January last, shall belong to and the same are hereby vested in the said Company of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River Dun; subject nevertheless to the existing Debts, Rents, Annuities, Covenants, Liabilities, Engagements, Contracts, Obligations, and Incumbrances respectively affecting the same, or to which the said Canal Company was subject or liable, on the said First Day of January.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxix.

shall perform and conform and be liable to, all Covenants, Conditions, Liabilities Agreements, Directions, Duties, Liabilities, Debts, Charges, and of Canal Restrictions to which the said Canal Company was at the Time of ComPau"yto the passing of this Act or but for this Act would have been or become p,[evpassing subject or liable, and shall indemnify the several Proprietors of Shares of this Act. in the said Canal, and the several Annuitants under this Act, their respective Heirs, Executors, Administrators, Successors, and Assigns,

Estates and Effects, from and against all such Covenants, Conditions,

Agreements, Directions, Duties, Liabilities, Debts, Charges, and Restrictions, and all Costs, Charges, and Expenses to be occasioned or incurred by reason thereof, or of the Nonperformance or undue Performance of the same or any of them.

III. And be it enacted, That from and immediately after the Chattels and passing of this Act all the Goods, Chattels, Boats, Barges, Trucks, Choses in Machines, Ropes, live and dead Stock, Bonds, Deeds, Securities, p"].t'°"®|an Choses in Action, Books, Writings, Maps, Plans, and other Personal Estate of the Estate, Chattels, and Effects of which the said Canal Company was Canal Com-possessed, or to which it was entitled, at Law or in Equity, on the Pa"y yesteti same First Day of January, so far as the same are capable of being 1"^av^ation transferred at the passing of this Act, shall be vested in and belong to P ' the said Navigation Company, for their absolute Benefit, subject as herein-after mentioned; and all Persons and Corporations who immediately before the passing of this Act owed any Sum of Money to the said Canal Company, or to any Person on their Behalf, shall pay the same, together with all Interest (if any) due or to accrue due thereon, to the said Na\igation Company; and all Debts and Monies which immediately before the passing of this Act were due and owing by or recoverable from the said Canal Company, for the Payment of which they were or but for the passing of this Act would have been liable, shall be paid, with all Interest (if any) due or to accrue due thereon, by or be recoverable from the said Navigation Company; and all Conveyances, Leases, Contracts, Agreements, Mortgages, Bonds,

Covenants, Securities, Debts, and Liabilities made, entered into, or incurred before the passing of this Act, to, with, in favour of, or by or for the said Canal Company, or any Person on their Behalf, shall be and remain as good, valid, and effectual in favour of, against, and with reference to the said Navigation Company, and may be proceeded on and enforced in the same Manner, to all Intents and Purposes, as if the said last-named Company had been the Party to and had executed the same, or had been named or referred to therein, instead of the said Canal Company or Person.

IV. And be it enacted, That on the passing of this Act all the t’owersgiven Rights, Privileges, Powers, and Authorities by the said Canal Art* by the Canal

Certain Provisions of Canal Acts extended.

Actions, &c. not to abate, and Pcnalties to be recoverable.

Officers to account.

I

As to Monies paid into the

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxix.

shall be used, when necessary, in reference thereto, in like Manner as though the said Navigation Company had been originally named in the said Canal Acts instead of the said Canal Company.

V. And be it enacted, That all the Provisions, Enactments, Matters, and Things which by the Three first-recited Acts are to be obeyed, done, and performed by the said Canal Company, the Committee of Management, or the Clerk or other Officers or Servants thereof, and which are not repealed or rendered unnecessary by this Act or otherwise, shall from and after the passing of this Act be applicable to, and shall be obeyed, done, and performed by the said Navigation Company, and the Committee, Law Clerk or other Officers, and the Servants thereof, as though the same Provisions, Enactments, Matters, and Things had been originally prescribed and enacted concerning the last-named Company, instead of the Canal Company; and the Seal of the said Navigation Company may be used in all Matters requiring the same, in like Manner as the Seal of the said Canal Company was by the said Canal Acts authorized to be used.

VI. And be it enacted, That no Action, Suit, Prosecution, or other Proceedings whatsoever, commenced either by or against the said Canal Company previously to the passing of this Act, shall abate or be discontinued or prejudicially affected by this Act, but, on the contrary, the same shall continue and take effect, both in favour of and against the said Navigation Company, in the same Manner in all respects as the same would have continued and taken effect in relation to the said Canal Company if this Act had not been passed; and all Penalties incurred for any Offence against the Provisions of the said Canal Acts or of any or either of such Acts previously to the passing of this Act shall and may be sued for, and all Offences which may have been committed before the passing of this Act against the Provisions of the said Acts, or any or either of them, shall and may be prosecuted, by and against the said Navigation Company, in such and the like Manner to all Intents and Purposes as the same might have been sued for and prosecuted by and against the said Canal Company if this Act had not been passed, the said Navigation Company being in reference to the Matters aforesaid in all respects substituted in the Place of the said Canal Company.

VII. And be it enacted, That all Officers and Persons who after the passing of this Act shall have in their Possession or under their Control any Books, Documents, Papers, Writings, or Effects belonging to the said Canal Company, or to which the said Canal Company may be entitled, shall be liable to account for and deliver up the same to the said Navigation Company, or to such Person or Persons as they may appoint to receive the same, in the same Manner, and subject to the same Process, Pains, and Penalties for Refusal or Neglect, as though such Officers and Persons had been appointed by and become possessed of such Books, Documents, Papers, Writings, or other Effects for the said Navigation Company.

VIII. And be it enacted, That in all Cases in which, under the Provisions of the said Canal Acts, any Sum of Money has already

been

l

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxix.

been paid by the said Canal Company into the Bank of England, or to any Trustee or Trustees, on account of the Purchase of any Land or any Interest therein, or for any Compensation or Satisfaction, or on any other Account, such Sum, or the Stocks, Funds, or Securities in or upon which the same shall have been invested, by the Order of the Court of Exchequer or the Court of Chancery, or otherwise howsoever, and the Interest and Dividends thereon and the annual Produce thereof, shall be applied and disposed of pursuant to the said Canal Acts, and all the Clauses, Provisions, and Authorities contained in such Acts in relation to such Monies, Stocks, Funds, and Securities, and the Interest and Dividends thereon and the annual Produce thereof, shall for the Purposes of this Act be construed and taken as if the said Navigation Company were named in such Canal Acts instead of the said Canal Company.

IX. And be it enacted, That all the Powers and Provisions contained in any Act of Parliament for the Benefit or Protection of the said Canal Company shall be of the like Force, Operation, and Effect, and shall appertain and attach to and be exercised and enforced by the said Navigation Company in as full and effectual a Manner, to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever, as the same Powers and Provisions would have appertained and attached to or might or could have been exercised and enforced by the said Canal Company in case this Act had not been passed.

X. And whereas the Undertaking of the Stainforth and Keadby Canal Navigation is divided into Two hundred and twenty-nine Shares: Be it enacted, That in consideration of the said Canal and Works, Property and Effects thereof, or of the Company of Proprietors thereof, and the Powers and Privileges appertaining thereto, being vested in the said Navigation Company, upon the Terms and in Manner in this Act mentioned, the said Navigation Company, their Successors and Assigns, shall yearly and every Year for the Term of Seven Years, unless in the meanwhile the Principal Sum herein-after mentioned has been paid, according to the Powers herein-after contained, well and truly pay or cause to be paid unto every Person who at the Time of the passing of this Act was the Proprietor of or entitled to any One or more of the said Two hundred and twenty-nine Shares, their respective Executors, Administrators, Successors, and Assigns, a fixed Payment or yearly Sum of Seven Pounds for and in respect of each such Share held by them respectively, and that such Pavment shall be computed and reckoned as from the First Day of January One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine (from which Time the said Navigation Company shall have and be entitled to the Gains, Profits, and Proceeds of the said Canal, and the Works, Property' Effects, Powers, Privileges, and other the Matters and Things appertaining thereto), and shall from Time to Time be paid to the Persons for the Time being entitled thereto in net Monies, free and clear of all Deductions and Abatements whatsoever (except any Income or Property Tax, or other Tax in the Nature thereof, legally chargeable thereon,) in manner following; (that is to say,) by equal half-yearly Payments on the First Day of January and the First Day of July in each Year, the first of such half-yearly Payments to be due, or considered,

36£

Bank of England.

Provisions in other Company’s Acts in favour of Canal Company to remain in force.

Annual Payments to the Canal Proprietors until Principal Sum paid.

deemed, or taken to be due, on the First Day of July One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine; and any Receipt or Receipts for the said first half-yearly Payment shall be a good Discharge for the same, or for so much thereof as shall be therein expressed to be received, notwithstanding that this Act may not at that lime have passed into a Law.

XI. And be it enacted, That in case Default shall be made in Payment of the said annual Payment or any Part thereof at the respective Times and in the Manner herein-before directed in that Behalf, and in case the same shall not be paid within Twenty-one Days next after Demand thereof in Writing shall have been delivered to the said Navigation Company, or to their Solicitor or Agent for the Time being, it shall be lawful for any Two or more Justices of the Peace for the West Riding of the County of York (not being interested in the Matter in question), on Application to them from Time to Time made by or on behalf of any One or more Person or Persons who shall then be entitled, together or alone, to an aggregate Amount of Arrears not being less than One hundred Pounds, whose annual Payment shall be so in arrear, by an Order under the Hands of such Justices to appoint some fit and proper Person to receive the Tolls, Rates, and Duties leviable and recoverable at any Office of the Navigation Company, until such annual Payment, together with the Costs of obtaining such Order, and of recovering and receiving such Tolls, Rates, and Duties, shall be fully paid (subject and without Prejudice nevertheless to the Claims and Demands of Mortgagees whose Securities bear Date prior to the passing of this Act for Recovery of the Principal Monies and Interest due to them respectively), and the Money so to be received by such Person so appointed as aforesaid is hereby declared to be so much Money received by or to the Use of the Party or Parties to whom such annual Payment shall then be due and in arrear as aforesaid, and after such annual Payment and Costs shall have been so satisfied the Power of such Receiver shall cease.

XII. And be it enacted, That on the Second Day of January which will be in the Year One thousand eight hundred and fifty-six the said Navigation Company, their Successors or Assigns, shall well and truly payor cause to be paid unto every Person holding or entitled to hold on that Day the Certificate herein-after mentioned, the Principal Sum of One hundred and fifty Pounds, for which Sum of Money every Person receiving the same shall sign a Receipt, which may be in the Form set forth in the Appendix to this Act marked (A.), or to the like Effect, which Receipt shall be duly stamped, and shall be prepared and the Stamp thereof provided by the said Navigation Company.

XIII. And be it enacted, That in case Default shall be made in Payment by the said Navigation Company of the said Sum of One hundred and fifty Pounds for and in respect of all and every or any of the Two hundred and twenty-nine Shares in the said Canal on or before the Second Day of January One thousand eight hundred and fifty-six, and in case the same shall not be paid within Three Months after Demand thereof in Writing shall have been delivered to the said Navigation Company, or their Solicitor or Agent for the Time being,

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxix. 371

being, (such Demand to be made at any Time on or subsequent to the First Day of October One thousand eight hundred and fifty-five,) it shall be lawful for the Person or Persons having made such Demand who shall be entitled, together or alone, to an aggregate Amount of One thousand Pounds in respect of Certificates given or granted under the Provisions of this Act, to recover the same by levying upon or receiving the Tolls, Rates, and Duties leviable and recoverable upon the said Canal and Navigation, under the like Powers or Authorities, and in like Manner in all respects, as herein-before is provided with respect to the recovery and enforcing the Payment of the annual Interest herein-before provided to be paid : Nevertheless it is hereby enacted, That this Power, and the said Power herein-before given for the Recovery of the said annual Interest when in arrear, shall not be held or taken in any way to supersede or lessen any Remedies to which the Persons entitled to such Principal Money or annual Interest would have been entitled, either at Law or in Equity, in case this present Power, and the said Power for the Recovery of the said annual Interest, had not been hereby given.

XIV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall be lawful Powertopay for the said Navigation Company (having given Three Months offCertifi-previous Notice of such their Intention) to pay to any Person holding

or entitled to hold a Certificate given or granted under the Provisions herein-after contained the Sum of One hundred and fifty Pounds, in discharge thereof, at any Time before the said Second Day of January One thousand eight hundred and fifty-six; and that upon Payment or Tender of the Sum of One hundred and fifty Pounds to such Person, together with a proportionate Part of the said annual Payment or Sum calculated from the last half-yearly Day of Payment up to the Day of Payment or Tender of the said Sum of One hundred and fifty Pounds, such Person shall sign a Receipt for the same according to Schedule (A.) to this Act annexed, or to the like Effect; and that after such Payment or Tender as aforesaid the said annual Payment of Seven Pounds shall absolutely cease.

XV. And be it enacted, That, on Demand by any Person holding Certificate or entitled to hold on the Day of the passing of this Act a Share in of Canal the said Stainforth and Keadby Canal Navigation, the said Company Securities-of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River Dun shall cause a Certificate in respect of each Share according to the Form set forth

in Schedule (B.) to this Act annexed, or to the like Effect, to be delivered, free of Expense, to such Person; and such Certificate shall have the Common Seal of the said Navigation Company affixed thereto, and shall specify the Number by which every such Certificate shall be known in the Books kept by the said Navigation Company.

And be it enacted, That every Person who under the Pro- Canal Ceni-visions of this Act shall become the Proprietor of such Certificate flcates to be shall stand and be possessed thereof upon the same Trusts and for heId °" ,he the same Purposes, and with and under the same Powers and Pro- asThe ShT* visions respectively (subject nevertheless to the Provisions of this in respect™' Act), as the Share in the said Canal represented by such Certificate wl,ich they was at the passing of this Act held upon and subject or liable to, are Sramed-and so as to give Effect to and not revoke any Will or other testamentary

Canal Certificates Personal Estate, and chargeable on Dun Navigation Company and their Property.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the said Certificates shall be deemed to be Personal Estate, and not of the Nature of Ileal Estate; and that, notwithstanding the Dissolution of the said Canal Company, or any Clause, Matter, or Thing in this Act contained, the several Persons for the Time being holding or entitled to hold the said Certificates shall have and be deemed to have a Lien and Charge upon the said Company of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River Dun, their Successors and Assigns, and the Works, Undertakings, Property, and Effects for the Time being of the said Navigation Company, and upon the Tolls, Gains, and Profits thereof, reserving always to the existing Mortgagees a Priority over the Persons entitled to such Lien or Charge.

Certificate to

XVIII. And be it enacted, That the said Certificates shall be

be Evidence, admitted in all Courts as primd facie Evidence of the Title of the Party to whom the same shall be granted, his or their Executors, Administrators, Successors, or Assigns, to the Monies therein specified, nevertheless the Want of such Certificate shall not prevent the Party for the Time being entitled to such Monies from disposing thereof.

Transfer of

XIX. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Regulations herein Canal Certi- contained, every Person entitled to such Certificate may sell and ficate lobe transfer the same, and the Monies thereby secured; and every such stamped *' Transfer shall be by Deed duly stamped, in which the Consideration shall be duly stated; and such Deed may be according to the Form in the Schedule (C.) to this Act annexed, or to the like Effect.

Transfer of

XX. Old Transfer

XXI. And be it enacted, That the said Navigation Company shall Books and preserve and keep at the Office or Place of Business of the said Papers re- Navigation Company all Register and Transfer Books, Dividend share/in Lists> and other ^ooks> Papers, and Documents showing the Trans-Canal to be mission of Shares in the said Canal, and the Proprietors thereof or kept, and the Titles thereto; and that every Annuitant under this Act, and, if Access given suc|, Annuitant be a Corporation, the Clerk or Agent of such Cor-thereto. poration, may at ail convenient Times peruse and examine all such Books, Lists, and other Papers and Documents gratis, and may require a Copy of the same or any of them, or of any Part thereof respectively, and for every One hundred Words so required to be copied the said Navigation Company may demand a Sum not exceeding Sixpence.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap.wis. 373

XXII. And be it enacted, That the said Navigation Company shall not be bound to see to the Execution of any Trust, whether express, boun'clsee implied, or constructive, to which any of the said Canal Certificates to t|ie Exe-may be subject; and the Receipt of the Party in whose Name any cution of such Certificate shall stand in the Books of the said Navigation Com- Trusts, pany, or, if it stands in the Name of more Parties than One, the Receipt of One of the Parties named in such Books, shall from Time to Time be a sufficient Discharge to the said Navigation Company for any Sum of Money payable in respect thereof; notwithstanding any Trusts to which the same may then be subject, and whether or not the said Navigation Company have had Notice of such Trusts; and the said Navigation Company shall not be bound to see to the Application of the Money paid upon such Receipt.

XXIII. And in order to enable the said Navigation Company to Power to pay off and discharge the Monies mentioned in and secured by the ^Mortgage said Certificates, be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said for paying" Navigation Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond any Sum or off the Canal Sums not exceeding in the whole Thirty-four thousand three hundred Certificates, and fifty Pounds, and to secure the Payment thereof, with Interest, in

the same Manner as any Sum or Sums which the said Navigation Company may have been authorized to raise on Mortgage or Bond:

Provided always, that the Mortgages or Bonds executed by the Navigation Company, or in existence at the Time when the same Company shall borrow the said Sum of Thirty-four thousand three hundred and fifty Pounds or any Part thereof, shall have Precedence of and be deemed prior Charges to the Bonds or Mortgages executed for securing the said Sum.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That the said Navigation Company shall Stamp Duty within Six Months after the passing of this Act pay to the Receiver to be paid. General of Inland Revenue, for the Use of Her Majesty, for and in on Purc,iase-respect of the Purchase and Transfer by this Act effected, the Sum of

Three hundred and fifty Pounds, being the Amount of the ad valorem Stamp Duty which would have been payable if the same Sale and Transfer had been made by Deed duly stamped for denoting the proper Stamp Duty payable thereon by Law.

XXV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Books and Books to be other Documents by the Three first-recited Acts or either of them Evidence, authorized or directed to be kept, and which would have been Evidence

if this Act had not been passed, shall still be admitted as Evidence in all Courts of Law and Equity and elsewhere.

XXVI. And whereas by a certain Section or Clause of the said first- As to Rates recited Act the said Canal Company were empowered to ask, demand, <>" the Canal, take, receive, and recover the several Rates therein mentioned for the Tonnage of the several Kinds of Goods, Wares, Merchandize, Commodities, and other Things which should be navigated, carried, oi conveyed in, upon, or along the said Canal: And whereas it is expedient to make such Provisions in respect of the said Rates as are heiein-after contained : Be it therefore enacted, That the said Navigation Company, their Successors and Assigns, shall and they are [Local.] 5 B hereby

XXX. And whereas it is by the said firstly-recited Act enacted, vision in that no Action, Suit, or Information shall be brought or commenced -t-r11 a8ainst any Person or Persons for anything done in pursuance of that Limitation Act until Pwenty Days Notice of the Cause of such Action in Writing of Actions be given to the Clerk or Clerks to the said Company of Proprietors repealed. of the said Canal, or to One or more of their Committee, or after sufficient Satisfaction or Tender of the same hath been made to the Party or Parties aggrieved, or after Six Calendar Months next after the Fact committed, or in case there shall be a Continuation of Damage then within Six Calendar Months next after the doing or committing 3 such

375

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxix.

such Damage shall cease, and not afterwards; and every such Action, Suit, or Information shall be brought and laid in the County of York or Lincoln, as the Case may be or require, and not elsewhere; and the Defendant or Defendants in such Action, Suit, or Information shall and may plead the General Issue, and give that Act and the special Matter in Evidence, at any Trial to be had thereupon, and that the same was done in pursuance and by the Authority of that Act; and if it shall appear to have been so done, or that such Action, Suit, or Information was brought or laid before Twenty Days Notice in Writing as aforesaid, or after a sufficient Satisfaction made or tendered as aforesaid, or after the Time limited for bringing the same as aforesaid, or shall be brought in any other County or Place than as aforesaid, then and in either of the said Cases the Jury shall find for the Defendant or Defendants; and thereupon, or if the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs shall become Nonsuit, or suffer a Discontinuance of his, her, or their Action, Suit, or Information after the Defendant or Defendants shall have appeared, or if a Verdict shall pass against the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs, or if upon Demurrer or otherwise Judgment shall be given against the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs, the Defendant or Defendants shall have Double Costs, and have such Remedy for the same as any Defendant hath for Costs of Suit in any other Case of Law : And whereas it is expedient that the said Enactment should be repealed, and that other Provision should be made instead thereof: Be it therefore enacted, That the same Enactment shall be and it is hereby repealed, and all the Provisions and Enactments touching the Matters aforesaid made in a certain Act passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to amend the Law relating to Double Costs, Notices of Action, Limitations of Actions, and Pleas of the General Issue, under certain Acts of Parliament, shall apply to all such Actions, Suits, or Informations, and Causes of Action, Suit, or Information.

XXXI. And whereas it is enacted by the said recited Acts passed in the Twelfth and in the Thirteenth Years of the Reign of King George the First, that if any Action, Suit, or Information shall be commenced or prosecuted against any Person or Persons for anything that he, she, or they shall do or cause to be done in pursuance of those Acts, or for executing any of the Powers or Authorities, or any of the Orders or Directions, made, given, or directed by or under those Acts, every Person so sued or prosecuted in any Court whatsoever shall and may plead the General Issue, and give those Acts and the special Matter in Evidence; and if in any such Suit the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs, Prosecutor or Prosecutors, shall become Nonsuit, or forbear Prosecution, or discontinue his, her, or their Suit, or if Judgment shall pass against him, her, or them upon any Verdict, or upon Demurrer, or by Default, then and in every or any of the said Cases the Defendant or Defendants shall recover his, her, or their Costs, for which he, she, or they shall have the like Remedy as where Costs are by Law awarded; and it is also enacted by the said recited Act passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of King George the Second, that no Deed creating any Proxy shall be filed or entered in the Book of the said Navigation Company until Affidavit of the due Execution thereof by all the Parties who shall make such Proxy shall be

Certain Provisions of I2G.1.C. 38, and 13 G. 1. c. 20. as to pleading General Issue repealed.

Provision of 6 G. 2. c 9. as to making Affidavit of due Execution of Pros v Deeds repealed.

37() 12’ & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxix.

be made by One of the subscribing Witnesses thereto, before some Master in Chancery, Ordinary or Extraordinary, or Justice of the Peace, and shall be delivered to the Committee of the said Company, or their Treasurer or Agent, to be tiled and kept together with the Instrument in Writing creating such Proxy; and that if any Action, Suit, or Information shall be brought or commenced against any Person or Persons for anything done or to be done in pursuance of the Acts therein recited or of that Act, or in the Execution of the Powers or Authorities or any of the Orders and Directions in such Acts mentioned, every such Action, Suit, or Information shall be commenced and brought within Three Months next after the Fact committed, and not afterwards, and shall be laid and brought in the County wherein the Cause of Action shall arise, and not elsewhere; and the Person or Persons so sued or prosecuted shall or may plead the General Issue, and give that Act and the special Matter in Evidence, at any Trial to be had thereupon, and that the same was done in pursuance of the said Acts; and if it shall appear so to be done, or that such Action, Suit, or Information shall be brought after the Time before limited for bringing the same, or shall be brought in any other County than wherein such Cause of Action shall arise, that then the Jury shall find for the Defendant or Defendants, or if the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs shall be nonsuited, or discontinue his, her, or their Action or Actions after the Defendant or Defendants shall have appeared, or if a Verdict shall pass against him or them, or if upon Demurrer Judgment shall be given against the Plaintiff or Plaintiffs, the Defendant or Defendants shall and may recover Treble Costs, and have the like Remedy for the same as any Defendant or Defendants hath or have for Costs of Suit in any other Cases by Law : And whereas similar Provisions to that which is lastly recited, having Reference to the Limitations of Actions, are inserted in certain other of the said recited Acts; viz, that passed in the Thirteenth Year of the Reign of King George the Second, and those passed in the Sessions of Parliament held in the First and Second Years and in the Seventh Year of the Reign of King George the Fourth: And whereas it is expedient that such several Provisions should be repealed, and that other Provisions should be made in the Stead thereof: Be it therefore enacted, That the same Enactments be and they are hereby repealed, and that all the Provisions and Enactments touching the Matters aforesaid contained in a certain Act passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to amend the Law relating to Double Costs, Notices of Action, Limitations of Actions, and Pleas of General Issue, under certain Acts of Parliament, shall apply to all such Actions, Suits, and Informations, and Causes of Action, Suit, and Information.

Expenses of

XXXII. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and

Act. Expenses of obtaining this Act shall be paid by the said Navigation

Company.

[Short Title.]

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in all legal Instruments and other Documents and Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to describe it as " The Stainforth and Keadby Canal Purchase Act, 1849."

12° & 13" VICTORIA, Cap. xxix. 377

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That in this Act the following Words Definition of and Expressions shall have the several Meanings hereby assigned to erras' them, unless there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant

to such Constructions; (that is to say,)

Words importing the Singular Number shall include the Plural, and Words importing the Plural Number shall include the Singular:

Words importing the Masculine Gender shall include Females:

The Word " Person " shall include Corporation:

The Word " Lands " shall extend to Messuages, Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments of any Tenure:

The Expression " the Canal," or " the said Canal," shall mean the Stainforth and Keadby Canal Navigation, and Works connected therewith:

The Expression " the Canal Company " shall mean the Company of Proprietors of the Stainforth and Keadby Canal Navigation:

The Words " Canal Acts " shall mean the recited Acts relating to the said Stainforth and Keadby Canal:

The Words " the Navigation Company," or " the said Navigation Company," shall mean the Company of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River Dun.

[Public Act.]

XXXV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

Stainfortli and Keadby Canal Certificate, No. [or Nos.

This is to certify, That [state the Name and Addition of the Person or of each of several joint Persons, as the Case may be,'] is [or are], under the Provisions of " The Stainforth and Keadby Canal Purchase Act, 1849," entitled to receive from the Company of Proprietors of the Navigation of the River Dun the Sum of One hundred and fifty Pounds, payable on the Second Day of January in the Year of our Lord One thousand eight hundred and fifty-six, and in the meantime the annual Payment or Sum of Seven Pounds, payable by half-yearly Payments of Three Pounds Ten Shillings on the First Day of January and the First Day of July in each Year, subject to the Provisions of the said " Stainforth and Keadby Canal Purchase Act, 1849."

of our Lord One thousand eight hundred and fifty-six, and the annual Sum of Seven Pounds in the meantime [if more than One add each], numbered created by " The Stainforth and Keadby

SCHEDULE (D.)

For Coal, Culm, Charcoal, Road Materials, Manure, Lime, and Limestone, One Halfpenny per Ton per Mile:

For Iron, Slate, Stone, Bricks, Tiles, and Clay, One Penny per Ton per Mile:

For Grain, Timber, General Merchandize, and all other Articles not before enumerated, One Penny Halfpenny per Ton per Mile.
