ANNO DUODECIMO & DEC1MO TERTIO

VICTORIA IUXtIN E.

Cap. xxx.

An Act for enlarging, improving-, and maintaining-the Harbour of Kirkcaldy in the County of Fife, for regulating- the Petty Customs of the Burgh of Kirkcaldy, and for other Purposes relating- to the said Harbour and Burgh.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Tenth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act for the Improvement, Maintenance, and Regulation ioG.t. c. 9D. of the Harbour of Kirkcaldy in the County of Fife : And whereas the said Act is about to expire, and it is expedient that further Provision should be made for the Management, Improvement, and Regulation of the said Harbour, and of the Ferry, if any, between Kirkcaldy and Leith and Newhaven on the opposite Side of the Firth of Forth, and for making and maintaining new and additional Piers, Quays, Docks,

Tidal Basins, and other Works and Accommodations at the said Harbour : And whereas it is expedient that the Rates and Duties or Petty Customs levied by the Magistrates and Town Council of the Burgh of Kirkcaldy under the Provisions of the said recited Act should be continued and equalized, or that in lieu thereof new Rates and Duties should be levied; but as these Purposes cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament, may it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most [Local.] 5 D Excellent

382

Recited Act repealed, and this Act to take effect.

8 & 9 Vict, c. 19. and 10 & 11 Vict, cc. 16. & 27. incorporated with this Act.

[Short Title.]

Appointment of Commissioners.

Incorporation of Commissioners.

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. xxx.

Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That from and after the passing of this Act the said recited Act shall be and the same is hereby repealed, and this Act shall commence and take effect: Provided always, that notwithstanding the Repeal of the said recited Act it shall be lawful for the Commissioners appointed in virtue thereof, and their Officers and Servants, who shall be in Office and acting at the Time of the passing of this Act, and they are hereby authorized and required to put this Act into execution in so far as relates to the Harbour until the First General Meeting of the Commissioners appointed by this Act shall be held as herein-after provided.

II. And be it enacted, That in so far as not inconsistent with or not otherwise provided or not altered and varied by this Act " The Lands Clauses Consolidation (Scotland) Act, 1845," " The Commissioners Clauses Act, 1847," and " The Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act, 1847," shall be incorporated with and form Part of this Act: Provided always, that nothing in this Act or in the said Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend to compel the Commissioners to erect and keep any Watch-house, Boat-house, Hut, or Weighing Materials for the Use of the Officers of Revenue, or provide or keep a Life Boat, Mortar, or Rockets, or a Tide or Weather Gauge and Barometer, until they shall be required so to do by the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, in Writing under the Hand of the Secretary of the Admiralty, and upon such Requisition being made the Clauses relating thereto contained in the said Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act shall as regards this Act be in full Force.

III. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, Deeds, and Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Kirkcaldy Harbour and Petty Customs Act, 1849."

IV. And be it enacted, That the Provost and the Two Bailies of the Burgh of Kirkcaldy for the Time being, and Six other Inhabitants resident within the Burgh, qualified and to be elected as hereinafter provided, and Two Commissioners of Supply for the County of Fife nominated as herein-after provided, shall be and they are hereby appointed Commissioners for executing and carrying into effect the Purposes of this Act in so far as the same relate to the Harbour; and the Commissioners and their Successors in Office are hereby united and incorporated as a Body Politic and Corporate by the Name and Style of " The Commissioners of Kirkcaldy Harbour," and shall by that Name have perpetual Succession and a Common Seal, with Power to change, break, and make new the same, and by that Name may sue and be sued, and acquire, hold, and dispose of Lands and Property, heritable and moveable, real and personal; and the Provost of the Burgh for the Time being shall ex officio be Chairman of the Commissioners.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

V. And be it enacted, That on the First Tuesday of September after the passing of this Act the Persons qualified for the Time being to vote in the Election of Councillors for the Burgh, under the Provisions of an Act passed in the Third and Fourth Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King William the Fourth, intituled An Act to alter and amend the Laws for the Election of the Magistrates and Councils of the Royal Burghs in Scotland, and who are duly entered in the Roll of Voters of the Burgh by the said Act appointed to be kept, shall meet in the Town House or Council Chamber of the Burgh at Twelve o’Clock Noon, of which Meeting, and the Time and Place for holding the same, Intimation shall be given by Advertisement signed by the Provost or acting Chief Magistrate of the Burgh, and printed and circulated in the Burgh at least Eight Days previous to the Day appointed for holding such Meeting, and then and there shall proceed to elect, by the Majority of the Votes of the Electors present at such Meeting, Six Persons, qualified as aforesaid, to be Commissioners for executing the Purposes of this Act relating to the Harbour.

VI. And be it enacted, That the Provost or acting Chief Magistrate shall, within Twenty-four Hours after any Meeting for the Election of Commissioners, give or cause to be given Notice in Writing of such Election to the several Persons elected, and call upon them severally to declare within Four Days after such Notice whether they accept or decline to accept the Office of Commissioner; and if any Person so elected shall not intimate his Acceptance of the said Office within Four Days after the Date of such Notice he shall be held as having declined to accept, and the Provost or acting Chief Magistrate shall immediately appoint a new Election of a Commissioner in place of the Person so declining at the Distance of not more than Four nor less than Two Days, and shall give Notice of the Day so appointed by Advertisement signed by him and printed and circulated as aforesaid; and such Elections shall be proceeded with in all respects in the same Manner in which the first Election of Commissioners is hereby directed to proceed until the Number of Commissioners herein appointed to be elected shall be completed.

VII. And be it enacted, That on the First Tuesday of December in the Year One thousand eight hundred and fifty, and on the First Tuesday of December in every succeeding Year, One Third of the Commissioners so elected shall go out of Office by Rotation; and the One Third who shall go out of Office in the Year One thousand eight hundred and fifty shall consist of the Two Commissioners whose Names stand lowest on the Rotation List made out in the Manner prescribed by the said Commissioners Clauses Act; and in the succeeding Year One thousand eight hundred and fifty-one the One Third of the Commissioners who shall go out by Rotation shall consist of the Two Commissioners whose Names stand next lowest on the said Rotation List (the Majority of the Commissioners always determining, in case of Dispute, who shall be the Commissioners to go out of Office); and thereafter the One Third of the Commissioners annually going out of Office by Rotation shall consist of the Two Commissioners who have been longest in Office: Provided always, that it shall be no Objection to any Person being elected or acting as a Commissioner under this Act that he shall be a Member of the

Town

Town Council of the Burgh at the Period of his Election, or shall become a Member of the said Town Council while in Office as a Commissioner : Provided also, that if any elected Commissioner who may be or become a Member of the said Town Council shall be chosen Provost or one of the Bailies of the Burgh, and so become ex officio a Commissioner under this Act, he shall thereupon go out ot Office as an elected Commissioner, and the Commissioners shall supply the Vacancy so created by electing in his Boom another Commissioner, qualified as aforesaid, within the Time, in the Manner, and to the Effect provided by the said Commissioners Clauses Act as to supplying occasional Vacancies.

VIII. And be it enacted, That on the First Tuesday of December Commission- j n the Year One thousand eight hundred and fifty, and on the First ceeiUng1 C" Tuesday of December in every succeeding Year, the Persons for the

Years.0 Time being qualified and enrolled as Electors as aforesaid shall meet

and elect in the Manner herein prescribed in relation to the First Election of Commissioners under this Act Two Persons, qualified as aforesaid, to be Commissioners in the Place of the Two Commissioners who shall go annually out of Office by Rotation; and the Provost or acting Chief Magistrate of the Burgh shall preside and be the Returning Officer at the first and all other Meetings for the Election of Commissioners under this Act, and in Cases of Equality of Votes shall have a casting Vote besides his Vote as a Member of the Meeting: Provided always, that no Person (except the said Provost or acting Chief Magistrate in the Case above mentioned) shall have more than One Vote in the Election of any One Commissioner, or upon any other Question which may be put to the Vote at any Meeting for the Election of Commissioners to be held as aforesaid.

IX. And be it enacted, That Onesiphorus Tyndal Bruce'of Falkland, Commis- an<^ James Townsend Oswald of DunniMer, Two of the Commissioners.

sioners of Supply for the County of Fife, shall be the County Commissioners under this Act for the Period from the First Tuesday of September after the passing of this Act until the Thirtieth Day of April in the Tear One thousand eight hundred and fifty-one, and thereafter the Commissioners of Supply for the said County shall annually at their General Meeting held in the Month of April nominate and appoint Two of their Number to be the County Commissioners under this Act as herein-before provided; and the Two County Commissioners so nominated shall hold the said Office for One Year from the Day of their Nomination until the Day of the annual General Meeting of the said Commissioners of Supply in the Month of April in the Year following: Provided always, that no Person entitled ex officio to be a Commissioner shall be eligible or be nominated as a County Commissioner under this Act.

N. And be it enacted, That the Commissioners shall hold their First General Meeting in the Town Hall of Kirkcaldy on the Fourth Tuesday of September after the passing of this Act, or as soon thereafter as conveniently may be, and proceed to put this Act into execution in so far as relates to the Harbour; and the Commissioners shall hold an annual General Meeting in the said Town Hall on the Second Tuesday

of September in every Year thereafter, and shall also hold monthly Meetings for the Transaction of general Business at the said lown Ilall on the Second Tuesday of every Month, or at such other convenient Time and Place as the Commissioners shall from Time to lime appoint; and at all Meetings of the Commissioners the Chairman, or, in his Absence, the eldest Bailie of the Burgh if both Bailies shall be present, or either of the Bailies if only One shall be present, shall be Preses, and in the Absence of the Chairman and of both Bailies the Commissioners present at such Meeting shall elect their Preses for the Time.

XI. And be it enacted, That it shall be in the Power of any Three Special or more of the Commissioners, by a Requisition in Writing under their Hands, to require the Clerk to call a Special Meeting of the Com- canej_ missioners at any Time, and the Clerk shall thereupon be obliged to

call such Meeting, and to give at least Two clear Days Notice of the Time and Place appointed for holding the same.

XII. And whereas the Magistrates and Council of Kirkcaldy have Vesting

by Iloyal Charter the exclusive Right to the Piers, Port, and Harbour Property of of Kirkcaldy, and have been in use to levy Harbour Dues and other Rates and Duties within the Precincts thereof under the Provisions pe"ry in t],e of the said recited Act: And whereas the Magistrates and Council Commis-claim an exclusive Right of Ferry betwixt the said Harbour of sioners. Kirkcaldy and Leith or Newhaven on the opposite Side of the Firth of Forth, and to license Boats to ply at the same, and to take a fixed Rent for such Licence in commutation of the Shore and Anchorage Dues: Be it enacted, That the Right and Property of and in the said Harbour of Kirkcaldy, and the Piers, Jetties, Docks, Quays, Wharves,

Ways, Warehouses, embanked Ground, and all other Works and Buildings, Materials, Implements, Matters, and Things, connected with the said Harbour, (except the embanked Ground along the Back of the East Pier containing about One thousand five hundred Square Yards, to which the Magistrates and Council have acquired Right under Agreement with the Edinburgh and Northern Railway Company,) and of and in all and every Right of Ferry which may belong to the Magistrates and Council, and all Right, Title, or Interest in the said Harbour and Ferry, and Property and Works connected therewith, which may belong to the Magistrates and Council as representing the Community of the Burgh, shall be and the same are hereby transferred from the Magistrates and Council, and their Successors in Office, and all others claiming in their Right or in the Right of the Burgh, or of the Burgesses or Community thereof, to and vested in the Commissioners, and in like Manner the whole Docks, Piers, Quays, Yards, Warehouses, and other Buildings and Works to be constructed or made under the Provisions of this Act shall be vested in and belong to the Commissioners, who shall have full Power and Authority from Time to Time to sell and dispose of all or any of the said Materials or other Articles and Things, or any Part of the same respectively, and also to sell or feu in perpetuity or let on Lease such Part of the Ground or other Heritable Property so vested in them as it may not be necessary to retain for the proper Purposes of the Harbour by public Sale at [Local.] 5 E ' such

386‘ 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

such Time and Place, and at such upset Prices, Feu Duties, or annual Rents, as the Commissioners shall fix and determine, the Day of such public Sale being previously advertised by Handbills circulated in the Burgh, and in any One Newspaper printed and circulated in the County of Fife at the Time, if there be any, Two several Times Ten Days at least before such public Sale: Provided always, that in case no Person shall offer for the Property exposed to Sale, or for any Part or Portion thereof, the Commissioners may adjourn from Time to Time the Sale as to the whole or as to the Part or Portion not disposed of for such Period not less than Ten Days as they may deem proper, and such Adjournment shall be advertised by Handbills, and twice in such Newspaper as aforesaid, at least Ten Days before the adjourned Day of Sale; and the whole Sums to be received by the Commissioners for the Property so sold, whether heritable or moveable, shall be applied towards the Purposes of this Act relating to the Harbour, and to no other Use or Purpose whatsoever.

Providing

XIII. And whereas the Rates and Duties levied at the Harbour Wh'-Debts have heretofore formed Part of the general Revenue of the Burgh, and affecting the have been applied indiscriminately to the Purposes thereof, and the Harbour. said Revenue has been relied on by Creditors and others who have treated and transacted with the Magistrates and Town Council of the Burgh for the Time being : And whereas the Magistrates and Council have, with the Sanction of the Commissioners appointed under the said recited Act, from Time to Time borrowed, on the Security of the said general Revenue of the Burgh, various Sums of Money which have been expended in the Extension of the East Pier and otherwise improving the Harbour, and which Sums, as specified in the Schedule (A.) hereunto annexed, amount to Eleven thousand and eighty-six Pounds Thirteen Shillings and Ten-pence, and are still due and owing by the Burgh: And whereas it is just and reasonable that the Commissioners should relieve the Burgh of the said Debt, and that the same should be preferably secured upon the Harbour and the Rates to be levied thereat, and also that Compensation should be made to the Magistrates and Council for their Rights and Interests in the said Piers, Port, and Harbour hereby transferred to and vested in the Commissioners: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners and they are hereby authorized and required to free and relieve the Magistrates and Council and the Burgh of the several Sums of Money specified in the Schedule (A.) hereunto annexed; and the said several Sums, with the Interest due or to become due thereon, shall be and the same are hereby declared to be secured upon the Property of the Harbour and Works connected therewith, and upon the several Rates to be levied by the Commissioners, and all the Property vested in or belonging to them under the Provisions of this Act, and shall be preferable to the annual Payment to the Magistrates and Council herein-after mentioned, and to any Sum or Sums of Money to be borrowed under the Authority of this Act; and it shall be lawful for the Commissioners and they are hereby authorized and required to make Payment to the Commercial Bank of Scotland of the Sum of Five hundred Pounds in each Year towards the Liquidation of the Principal Sum due to the said Bank as specified in the said Schedule, and that over and above the yearly Interest of the said Principal

Sum:

387

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

Sum: Provided always, that the Commissioners may, if they think fit, pay off the Principal Sums due to the Creditors named in the said Schedule, or any Part thereof, from and out of the Monies to be borrowed by them under the Provisions of this Act: Provided also, that nothing herein contained shall prejudice the Securities granted to the said Creditors, or any of them, for their respective Debts, or prevent them from having the same Recourse ns they now have against the Magistrates and Council, and the Property and Funds of the Burgh, for Payment of their said Debts.

XIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commis- Al,m,a^"y' sioners and they are hereby authorized and required to make Payment *" t£e to the Magistrates and Council of the Sum of Three hundred Pounds Magistrates per Annum by equal half-yearly Payments on the Thirtieth Day of ar.rt Council. March and the Thirtieth Day of September in each Year, beginning the first Payment on the Thirtieth Day of March One thousand eight hundred and fifty for the Half Year preceding, and so on thereafter, with Interest from the Date of Payment, until paid, and which annual Payments and Interest thereon shall be and the same are hereby declared to be secured upon the Property of the Harbour and Works connected therewith, and upon the several Rates to be levied by the Commissioners, and all the Property vested in or belonging to them under the Provisions of this Act, and shall be preferable to any Sum or Sums of Money to be borrowed under the Authority of this Act:

Provided always, that it shall be lawful for the Commissioners, if required, to make and grant to each of the Creditors named in the said Schedule (A.), and to the Magistrates and Council respectively, a Mortgage or Assignation in Security or other valid Deed for securing each of the said Debts, and the said annual Payments, with Interest thereon respectively, upon the said Harbour and Rates and Property, all which Mortgages and Assignations shall be preferable to any Mortgage or Assignation to be granted for Sums to be borrowed under the Authority of this Act.

XV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commis- Power to sioners to borrow on Mortgage any Sums not exceeding in the whole borrow the Sum of Forty-eight thousand Pounds, and to make and grant Money on Mortgages and Assignations of the Property vested in the Com- MortSaSe-missioners, and the several Rates to be levied and taken by them under the Provisions of this Act, in Security of the Payment of the Sums so borrowed, and Interest thereon; and the said Sum of Eleven thousand and eighty-six Pounds Thirteen Shillings and Ten-pence shall be included in and computed as Part of the said Sum of Forty-eight thousand Pounds.

XVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commis- Commissioners to accept and take from any Bank or Banking Company Credit sioners may on a Cash Account to be opened and kept with such Bank or Banking borrow on Company in the Names of the Commissioners, according to the Usao? taken by them as aforesaid, in Security of the Payment of the Amount of such Credit, or of the Sums advanced from Time to Time on such Cash Account, with Interest thereon : Provided always, that the whole Sum due and owing by the Commissioners on such Cash Account, and for Money borrowed by them on Mortgage as aforesaid, including the said Sum of Eleven thousand and eighty-six Pounds Thirteen Shillings and Ten-pence, shall never, when taken all together, exceed the said Sum of Forty-eight thousand Pounds.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Commissioners shall not be held or adjudged to have rendered themselves or any of them personally or individually liable for the Payment of any Sums of Money, Principal or Interest, by reason of their having signed any Mortgage or Assignation in Security made or granted under the Authority of this Act and the Acts incorporated therewith.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That so soon as the Works by this Act authorized to be made are completed, the Commissioners shall every Year appropriate and set apart, out of the Rates to be levied and taken by them, a Sum equal to at least One Pound per Centum of the Sums which shall then be due and owing of the Monies borrowed under the Provisions of this Act as a Sinking Fund to be applied in the Repayment of the Principal Monies so borrowed.

XIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners, by themselves or their Officers and Servants, or others employed by them, to extend, enlarge, and improve the Harbour, to repair, deepen, and cleanse the same, and to make and maintain additional Piers, Quays, and all other Works and Buildings connected therewith which may be necessary for the Reception and Accommodation of Ships and Vessels resorting to the Harbour, and to make, widen, and maintain all necessary Roads and Accesses to the Harbour and Works.

XX. And whereas a Plan and Sections of the Harbour and of the intended Works showing the Situation and Levels thereof respectively, and the Limits within which the same are to be constructed, and also a Book of Reference containing the Names of the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers of the Lands in, upon, or through which the same arc intended to be made, have been deposited with the Sheriff Clerk of the County of Fife: Be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions contained in this Act and in the Acts incorporated therewith, it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to make and maintain the Piers, Quays, Hocks, Yards, and other Works described upon the said Plans in the Situation and upon the Lands delineated thereon and described in the said Book of Reference, and to enter upon, take, and use such of the said Lands as shall be necessary for these Purposes.

XXI. And be it enacted, That if after Working Drawings of the Works hereby authorized shall have been submitted to the Lord High Admiral of the United Kingdom, or to the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, it shall be deemed expedient by him or them to order a local Survey and Examination of such Works or of the intended Site thereof, the Commissioners shall

defray

38.9

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. XXX.

defray the Costs of such local Survey and Examination, and the Amount thereof shall be a Debt due to Her Majesty from the Commissioners, and if not paid upon Demand may be recovered as a Debt due to the Crown, with the Costs of Suit, or may be recovered, with Costs, as a Penalty is or may be recoverable from the Commissioners.

XXII. And be it enacted, That if any Work to be constructed by the Commissioners, or any Portion of such Work, shall be abandoned or suffered to fall into Disuse or Decay by the Commissioners, it shall be lawful for the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, to abate and remove the same, or such Part or Parts thereof as he or they may at any Time or Times deem fit and proper, and to restore the Site thereof to its former Condition, at the Cost and Charge of the Commissioners, and the Amount thereof shall be a Debt due from the Commissioners to the Crown, and be recoverable accordingly, with Costs of Suit.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the proper Officers of Customs to lay down such Moorings within any Part of the Harbour as may be necessary for the mooring thereat any Boats used for the Service of the Customs, and to moor any such Boats at such Moorings, and to make fast such Boats to any Part of the Harbour that they may consider necessary, and to keep and continue such Boats so moored or made fast as long as may be necessary for the Service of the Customs.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That the Powers granted by this Act and the Acts incorporated therewith for the compulsory Purchase of Lands for the Purposes of this Act shall not be exercised after the Expiration of Five Years from the passing of this Act.

XXV. And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to demand and take for every Vessel using or entering the Harbour or Precincts thereof any Sum for every Ton Measurement of such Vessel not exceeding the Rates specified in Schedule (B.) hereunto annexed, and all such Rates shall be payable by the Master of such Vessel; and the Rates on any Vessel entering the Harbour or Precincts thereof light or in Ballast shall be paid within Twenty-four Hours after Arrival, and the Rates on any other Vessel shall be paid upon Arrival or before the Cargo is discharged.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to demand and take for all Goods specified in the Schedule (C.) hereunto annexed which shall be shipped or unshipped, received or delivered, within the Harbour or Precincts thereof, any Sums not exceeding the Rates specified in the said Schedule (C.) with respect to such Goods respectively; and as to all such Goods as arc not specified in the said Schedule the Commissioners may demand and take a Rate equal to the Rate for the Time being payable in respect of Goods of a similar Nature, Package, and Quality; and all such Rates shall be payable by the

Owner of such Goods : Provided always, that all Goods shipped overside or sent direct from one Vessel into another shall pay One Half of the Rates specified in the said Schedule (C.), but no Goods landed or deposited in the Sheds, or remaining on the Quays over Night, shall be entitled to this Exemption.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That all Goods upon which the Rates specified in the said Schedule (C.) have been paid on being unshipped in the Harbour shall be exempted from Payment of Rates on being again shipped, unless such Goods shall have changed Owners or undergone some Process of Manufacture; and all Grain sold in the Stock Market upon which the Rates or Petty Customs specified in the Schedule (E.) hereunto annexed shall have been paid shall, when shipped at the Harbour, be exempted from Payment of the Rates specified in the said Schedule (C.); and all fresh Fish of every Description brought into the Burgh in small Boats for Sale exclusively -within the Burgh, and not sold for the Purpose of being cured, shall be exempted from Payment of the Rates specified in the said Schedule (C.)

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to demand and take for the Use of any of the Sheds, Cranes, Rails, and Weighing Machines which they may provide or erect at the Harbour of and from the Owner of any Goods deposited therein, or loaded, unloaded, or weighed by means thereof, any Sums not exceeding the Rates specified in the Schedule (D.) hereunto annexed.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to appoint and license a sufficient Number of Persons to be Meters and Weighers within the Harbour; and all Meters or Weighers who shall measure or weigh any Goods delivered out of or put on board any Vessel shall, within Six Hours after such Vessel has been discharged or loaded, attend at the Shore Dues Office and give an Account of such Goods; and every Meter or Weigher who shall fail so to give such Account, or shall give a false Account, shall for every such Offence be liable to a Penalty not exceeding Forty Shillings: Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall extend to compel any Officer of Customs to attend and give an Account of any Goods measured or weighed by him as such Officer.

XXX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to license and appoint a sufficient Number of Pilots for the Harbour, and also for conducting Vessels departing from or coming into the Harbour out of and into the Firth of Forth, and to iix the Rate of Pilotage to be paid to such Pilots, and to remove and displace them at pleasure; and such Pilots shall, before being licensed, be examined as to their Fitness and Capacity to be such Pilots by Three competent Persons, being Shipmasters well acquainted with the Coast, and shall be certified by such Persons to be fully qualified; and if any Person shall act as a Pilot within the Harbour or Precincts thereof without having obtained such Certificate, or without being licensed or appointed as aforesaid, every Person so offending shall forfeit and pay for each Offence a Penalty not exceeding Twenty Pounds: Provided always,

391

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

always, that nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Harbour from the Provisions of any general Act relating to Pilots which may pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament.

XXXI. And be it enacted, That all Masters of Vessels Inward bound, of such Tonnage as are by Law required to take Pilots, who shall refuse to take or receive a licensed Pilot, shall be liable to pay the full Pilotage in respect of such Vessels respectively, which shall be recoverable summarily.

XXXII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to lease all or any of the Rates hereby authorized to be levied and taken by them on Goods shipped or unshipped, received or delivered, within the Harbour or Precincts thereof, by public Roup or Sale, for any Period not exceeding Three Years, upon giving Notice of such Roup at least Fourteen Days previous thereto by Advertisement inserted in any One or more of the Newspapers published in the County of Fife or in the Burgh of Kirkcaldy, and to fix the upset Price at which such Rates shall be exposed, and the Conditions of such Roup, as to them shall seem expedient; and in the event of all or any of such Rates being so leased, the Tenants or Lessees thereof shall have the same Powers as to levying, collecting, and recovering the same as are conferred on the Commissioners by this Act and the Acts incorporated therewith.

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners from Time to Time to make such Rules and Regulations for the proper conducting of any Ferry, the Right to which may vest in them under this Act, as to them shall seem fit, and to grant Licence to such Vessels as shall be approved by them to ply at the said Ferry under such Conditions and Restrictions as to the N umber of Passages to be made, and the Number of the Crew to be carried by the Vessels so licensed, and the Hours and Times of sailing, as they shall consider proper; and if any Owner or Master of any Vessel plying at the said Ferry shall commit a Breach of any of the Conditions or Restrictions of such Licence, or shall neglect or refuse to conform to such Rules and Regulations as shall be made by the Commissioners from Time to Time for the Regulation of the' said Ferry, or if it shall appear to the Commissioners that any Vessel licensed by them as aforesaid has become unfit or inefficient for the Purpose of the said Ferry, it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to suspend, withdraw, or revoke such Licence, and to prevent such Vessel, and the Owner and Master thereof, from continuing to ply at the said Ferry: Provided always, that it shall not be lawful for any Person to ply at the said Ferry between the said Places with any Vessel unless and until the same shall have been approved and licensed by the Commissioners as aforesaid: Provided also, that all the Rules and Regulations so to be made as last aforesaid shall be submitted to and approved by the respective Sheriffs of the Counties of Edinburgh and Fife before the same shall become valid and effectual under this Act.

Pilots to pay Pilotage.

Commissioners may lease Rates on Goods.

Commissioners may regulate Ferry, and license Vessels to ply thereat.

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions herein contained as to the said Right of Ferry, it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to let on Lease the exclusive Right and Licence to ply at the said Ferry by public Roup or Sale for any Period not exceeding Five Years, upon giving Notice of such Roup at least Fourteen Days previous thereto by Advertisement inserted in any One or more of the Newspapers published in the County of Fife or in the Burgh of Kirkcaldy, and to agree with the Person or Company to whom such exclusive Right and Licence shall be let for the Payment of a fixed Sum, by the Year or other shorter Period, as a Composition for the Rates payable by or in respect of the Vessels used for the Purposes of the said Ferry, and Goods and Passengers carried thereby; and in case no Bidder shall otter, or in case such exclusive Right or Licence shall not be let, it shall be lawful for the Commissioners by private Contract to let the exclusive Right and Licence to ply at the said Ferry to any Person or Company willing to undertake the same for any Period not exceeding Five Years, and to agree with such Person or Company for the Payment of a fixed Sum, by the Year or other shorter Period, as a Composition for the Rates payable by or in respect of the Vessels used for the Purposes of the said Ferry, and Passengers and Goods carried thereby, and that upon such Conditions and under such Regulations and Restrictions as the Commissioners shall judge expedient.

XXXV. And be it enacted, That all Monies which shall come into the Hands of the Commissioners from the Property vested in them, or the Rates to be levied or Sums to be borrowed by them under the Authority of this Act, shall be applied and disposed of in manner following; (that is to say,) first, in Payment of the Proportion of the Expenses of this Act pa3rable by the Commissioners as herein provided; secondly, in Payment of the Interest due and to come due from Time to Time upon the Debts specified in the Schedule (A.) hereunto annexed; thirdly, in Payment of the Sum of Five hundred Pounds yearly to the Commercial Bank of Scotland as herein-before provided; fourthly, in Payment to the Magistrates and Council of the said annual Sum of Three hundred Pounds as herein-before provided; and fifthly, in defraying the Expenses of maintaining and improving the Harbour, constructing the Works hereby authorized to be made, and otherwise carrying out the several Purposes and Provisions of this Act in relation to the Harbour and Works connected therewith as the Commissioners shall order and determine.

XXXVI. And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act it shall be lawful for the Magistrates and Council, and for such Person as they shall from Time to Time appoint and authorize for that Purpose, (in place of the Rates and Duties commonly called Petty Customs heretofore levied by the Magistrates and Town Council of the Burgh,) to demand and take for all Goods brought within the Limits of the Burgh, otherwise than by Vessels into the Harbour or Precincts thereof, and in the same Manner in which the Rates and Duties or Petty Customs have been in use to be levied in the Burgh, the Rates or Petty Customs specified in the Schedule (E.) hereunto annexed with respect to such Goods as are therein specified; and for

393

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

all such Goods as are not specified in the said Schedule the Magistrates and Council, or other Person authorized as aforesaid, may demand and take such Rates as may be fixed by the Magistrates and Council according to the Weight, Measure, Number, or Quantity of such Goods, as the Case may be; but no such Rate for Goods not specified shall exceed the highest Rate payable for the Time being in respect of Goods of a similar Nature, Package, or Quality specified in the said Schedule; and all such Rates shall be payable by the Owners of such Goods respectively: Provided always, that no such Rates shall be exigible for Goods in transitu on any Part of the Main Line of the Edinburgh and Northern Railway, although Part of such Main Line shall pass within the Territory of the Burgh, but this Exemption shall not extend to any Goods brought within the Limits of the Burgh from any Station of the said Railway: Provided also, that all Goods in transitu which shall be brought within and carried or taken directly out of the Limits of the Burgh without being exposed to Sale, delivered, or warehoused therein shall be exempted from Payment of such Rates.

XXXVII. And be it enacted, That all Goods brought within the Limits of the Burgh which shall be directly exported by Sea at the Harbour without being warehoused or exposed in the Stock Market shall be exempted from Payment of the Rates specified in the said Schedule (E.); and all Goods brought within the said Limits for the Purpose of being shipped, and which shall be warehoused or deposited in Warehouses or Depdts licensed by the Commissioners, and upon which Goods the Rates specified in the said Schedule (C.) shall be paid upon being so warehoused or deposited, shall also be exempted from Payment of the Rates specified in the said Schedule (E.)

XXXVIII. And be it enacted, That the Magistrates and Council may from Time to Time vary the said Rates or any of them in such Manner as they may think expedient, by reducing and again raising the same: Provided always, that such Rates shall not in any Case exceed the Sums respectively hereby authorized to be taken, and that the Rates shall be at all Times charged equally to all Persons and Companies in respect of the same Description of Goods.

XXXIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Magistrates and Council, and for any Person authorized by them as aforesaid, in case of Delay or Refusal to pay any of the said Rates by the Owners of any Goods liable to Payment thereof, to seize, take, and detain such Goods until such Rates are paid; and in case of Delay or Refusal to pay the same for the Space of Three Days after such Seizure and Detention, it shall be lawful for the Magistrates and Council, or any Person authorized by them as aforesaid, to cause the same to be appraised by Two or more properly qualified Persons, and afterwards to sell and dispose of so much and such Part of the Goods taken and appraised as shall be sufficient to satisfy the Rates due and unpaid, together with the Charges and Expenses of such taking detaining, and selling (as the same shall be ascertained by the Sellers Oilth), rendering to the Owner of such Goods the Overplus, if any be, on Demand; and in the event of any Dispute arising between

[Local] 5 G the

Exemptions from Petty Customs.

Power to vary Petty Customs.

For enforcing Payment of Petty Customs.

394

Penalty for Evasion of Petty Customs.

Power to lease or compound Petty Customs.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

the Magistrates and Council, or any Person authorized by them as aforesaid, and the Owners of such Goods, the Amount of the Rates due, and of such Charges and Expenses, shall be determined by the Sheriff upon Application made to him for that Purpose, and the Sheriff shall award such Costs to be paid by either of the Parties to the other as he shall think reasonable, which Costs, if not paid, shall be levied by Poinding and Sale, and the Sheriff shall issue his Warrant accordingly.

XL. And be it enacted, That the Owners of any Goods liable in Payment of the said Rates who shall at any Time wilfully evade the Payment of the same by any Means whatsoever shall for every such Offence forfeit and pay to the Magistrates and Council a Penalty not exceeding Three Pounds over and above Payment of such Rates, to be recovered in the Manner provided by the said Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act with respect to the Recovery of Damages not specially provided for and of Penalties, and to the Determination of any other Matter referred to Justices or the Sheriff: Provided always, that no Person shall for Nonpayment of any such Penalty be imprisoned for any Space exceeding Forty-eight Hours.

XLI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Magistrates and Council to lease the Rates specified in the said Schedule (E.) by public Roup or Auction for any Period not exceeding Five Years, upon giving Notice of such Roup at least Fourteen Days previous thereto by Advertisement inserted in any One or more of the Newspapers published in the County of Fife or in the Burgh of Kirkcaldy; and in case no Person or Company shall offer at such Roup, or in case the said Rates shall not be let by public Roup, it shall be lawful for the Magistrates and Council to agree with any Person or Company for the Payment of a fixed Sum as a Composition for the Rates payable in respect of the Goods which may be carried by such Person or Company, and that for any Period not exceeding Five Years, any Law or Statute to the contrary notwithstanding: Provided always, that in every Case where the said Rates shall be so compounded for it shall be a Condition of such Agreements that the Composition agreed upon shall be paid in advance by quarterly Instalments: Provided also, that in case of all or any of the* said Rates being so let or compounded for, the Tenants or Lessees thereof, or the Persons or Companies so compounding, shall have the same Powers and Privileges as to levying, collecting, and recovering the said Rates as are hereby conferred on the Magistrates and Council.

XLII. And whereas the Sea Weed or Sea Ware cast on the Beach within the Royalty of the Burgh is or is claimed to be Part of the common Good of the Burgh, but the Quantity so cast ashore is uncertain and irregular, and it is expedient that the Magistrates and Council should be empowered to lease the Right vested in the Magistrates and Council of gathering the same by public Roup or private Contract for such Period as they may think fit: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Magistrates and Council to lease the Right of gathering such Sea Weed or Sea Ware by public Roup, or by private Contract or Agreement in case of the same not being let when

exposed

395

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

exposed by public Roup, for any Period not exceeding Five Years, any Law or Statute to the contrary notwithstanding.

XLIII. And be it enacted, That the Complaint and Proceedings before the Sheriff or Justice or Justices before whom any Person shall be complained of or proceeded against for any Offence under the Provisions of this Act or the Acts incorporated therewith, and the Sentence or Conviction thereon, may be in the Form of the Schedule (F.) hereunto annexed, or as near as may be; and, except that such Complaint and the Sentence to be pronounced in relation thereto shall be in Writing, no other Writing or written Record of Evidence or Procedure shall be necessary, unless the Sheriff or Justices at the Hearing of the Complaint shall cause or allow the Procedure or Evidence to be taken down in Writing, or shall themselves tak Ne s of the same.

XLIV. And whereas Persons committing Offences against this Act may be transient Persons unknown to the Officers or Persons appointed and acting under the Authority of this Act: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for such Officers and Persons respectively to seize and detain any such unknown Persons committing any Offence against the Provisions of this Act or the Acts incorporated therewith, and to convey them before the Sheriff or any Justice or Justices without any other Warrant than this Act for so doing; and such Sheriff and Justice or Justices respectively are hereby empowered to proceed with all convenient Dispatch, and without the Necessity of serving a Copy of the Complaint, to the summary hearing and determining of the same.

XLV. And be it enacted, That nothing contained in this Act or in the Acts incorporated therewith shall extend to authorize the Commissioners to purchase, take, or use any Land or Soil, or any Rights in respect thereof, belonging to Her Majesty in right of Her Crown, without the Consent in Writing of the Commissioners for the Time being of Her Majesty's Woods, Forests, Land Revenues, Works, and Buildings, or any Two of them, first had and obtained for that Purpose, and which such Commissioners or any Two of them are hereby authorized and empowered to give, or to prejudice, diminish, alter, or take away any of the Rights, Privileges, Powers, or Authorities vested in or enjoyed by Her Majesty, Her Heirs or Successors.

XL\ I. And be it enacted, That nothing contained in this Act or in the Acts incorporated therewith shall extend to authorize the Commissioners to purchase, take, or use any Lands belonging to the Edinburgh and Northern Railway Company, except in so far as the Magistrates and Council have already acquired Right to any such Lancfs under an Agreement entered into between them and the said Railway Company dated the Twenty-third Day of July One thousand eiffht hundred and forty-six.

XL\

II. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shs prejudice or affect the Rights of Parties in an Action of Declarator ar Damages now depending in the Court of Session in Scotland at tl Instance of Andrew Greig, Peter Greig, and Thomas Barclay, allegir

themselvi

[Public Act.]

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

themselves to be registered Owners of the Steam Ship called " Benledi" of Leith, against the Magistrates and Council of Kirkcaldy.

XLVIII. And be it enacted, That in addition to the Words and Expressions incorporated from the said " Lands Clauses Consolidation (Scotland) Act," " Commissioners Clauses Act," and " Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act," the following Words and Expressions in this Act shall have the several Meanings hereby assigned to them, unless there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Construction; (that is to say,)

The Expression " the Harbour " shall mean the Harbour of Kirkcaldy, and shall include the Docks, Piers, Quays, Yards, and whole Works and Buildings connected with the Harbour:

The Word " Burgh" shall mean the Royal Burgh of Kirkcaldy: The Word " Magistrates " shall mean and include the Provost and Bailies of the Burgh:

The Expression " Magistrates and Council " shall mean the Magistrates and Town Council of the Burgh for the Time being:

The Expression " the Commissioners " shall mean " the Commissioners of Kirkcaldy Harbour " incorporated by this Act:

The Word " Owners " when used in relation to Goods shall be understood to include any Consignor, Consignee, Shipper, or Agent for Sale or Custody of such Goods, as well as the Owner thereof.

XLIX. And be it enacted, That the Expenses of obtaining and passing this Act and incidental thereto shall be paid by the Magistrates and Council and the Commissioners in the following Proportions; videlicet, One Third of such Expenses by the Magistrates and Council out of the ordinary Funds and Revenue of the Burgh, and Two Thirds thereof by the Commissioners out of the first Monies which shall come into their Hands from the Rates to be levied or Sums to be received or borrowed by them under the Authority of this Act.

L. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

In charging the Rates on Goods the gross Weight or Measurement of all Goods to be taken; and for any less Weights, Measures, and Quantities than those above specified, a Proportion of the respective Rates shall be charged.

Five Cubic Feet, not exceeding Two and a Half Cwt., to be rated as a Barrel Bulk; but when the Weight of Five Cubic Feet is greater than Two and a Half Cwt., then Two and a Half Cwt. to be rated as a Barrel Bulk.

3d, Railway Dues.

For the Use of the Rails on the Quays of the Harbour, One Halfpenny per Ton.

4th, Shed Dues.

For each Ton of Eight Barrels Bulk, or for each Ton of Twenty Cwt., which shall remain in the Sheds or on the Quays of the Harbour for a longer Time than Forty-eight Hours, the Sum of Two-pence; and the Sum of One Penny per Ton for each Day during which the said Goods shall remain after the first Forty-eight Hours.

In charging the Petty Customs the gross Weight or Measurement of all Goods to be taken 5 and for any less Weights, Measures, and Quantities than those above specified, a Proportion of the respective Rates shall be charged.

Five Cubic Feet, not exceeding Two and a Half Cwt., to be rated as a Barrel Bulk; but when the Rate of Five Cubic F eet is greater than Two and a Half Cwt-, then Two and a Half Cwt. to be rated as a Barrel Bulk.

SCHEDULE (F.)

Form of Complaint.

Unto the Honourable the Sheriff of [or, Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace for] the County of Fife.

The Complaint and Information of A. B.

Humbly sheweth,

That C.D. has been guilty of a Contravention of " The Kirkcaldy Harbour and Petty Customs Act, 1849," and of " The Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act, 1847," incorporated therewith, or one or other of the said Acts, in so far as [here describe the Offence generally, and state the Time and Place when and where the same was committed], whereby the said C.D. has incurred the Forfeiture [or Penalty] of provided by the

Section of the said " Kirkcaldy Harbour and Petty Customs Acts" [or of the said " Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act"].

May it therefore please your to grant Warrant

to summon the said ( . D. to appear before to answer to this Complaint, and to be dealt with in Terms of the said Acts, or one or other of them.

According to Justice, §c.

[Signed by Complainer or Informer.]

Form

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

411

Form of Warrant.

[Place and Fate.] Having considered the foregoing Complaint, grants Warrant to summon the said C.D. complained of to appear before [Magistrate, and Place and Time], and that by serving the said C.D. with a Copy of the foregoing. Complaint and of this Deliverance, and also grants Warrant for citing Witnesses at the Instance of both Parties to attend at the same Place and Time.

[Signed by Sheriff or Justice of Peace.]

Form of Sentence.

[Place and Date.] The [Magistrate], in respect of the Evidence adduced [or, of the judicial Confession of the said C.D., as the Case may be], convicts the said C.D. of the Offence charged, and therefore decerns and adjudges him to forfeit and pay to the Complainer the Sum of of Penalty, with the Sum of of Expenses, one Half of the said Penalty to be retained by the Complainer, and the other Half thereof [or as the Case may be] to be paid and accounted for by him to the Kirk Session or Collector of the Punds for the Poor of the Parish of Kirkcaldy; and failing Payment by the said C.D. forthwith* grants Warrant for Recovery of the said Penalty and Expenses by Poinding of his Goods and Effects, and summary Sale thereof on the Expiration of not less than Forty-eight Hours after such Poinding; appoints a Return or Execution of such Poinding and Sale to be reported within Eight Days from this Date, and in the meantime grants Warrant for detaining the said C.D. in the Prison of until such Return be reported.

* [If it shall appear at the Trial that no sufficient Poinding can be made within the Jurisdiction of the Magistrate, say here — " and in respect it appears that no sufficient Poinding and Sale can be had whereon to levy the said Penalty and Expenses, grants Warrant to imprison the said C.D. in Prison of for the Space of from this

Date, unless the said Penalty and Expenses be sooner paid, and decerns."]

Warrant of Imprisonment to be granted in case of a Return being made that no sufficient Goods and Effects could be found.

[Place and Date.] The [Magistrate], in respect of the Return made that no sufficient Effects can be found whereon to levy the said Penalty and Expenses, grants Warrant to imprison the said C.D. in the Prison of for the Space of from this Date, unless the said

Penalty and Expenses be sooner paid, and decerns.

Warrant

412

12°& 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxx.

Warrant of Liberation.

[Place and Date.] The f Magistrate], in respect of the Return of a sufficient Poinding and Sale of the Effects of the said C.D. [or, in respect of Payment having been made of the said Penalty and Expenses, as the Case may be,] grants Warrant to the Keeper of the Prison of for the immediate Liberation of the said C.D., and decerns.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

Cap. xxxi.

An Act to amend " The Sunderland Dock Act,

1846," and for other Purposes.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS the Sunderland Dock Act, 1846, being an Act passed in the Ninth Year of the lteign of Her Majesty Queen Victoria, intituled An Act for constructing a Wet loVict. Dock and other Works on the South Side of the River Wear, at c, 13. Sunderland near the Sea, in the County Palatine of Durham, incorporated the Sunderland Dock Company, with a Capital of Three hundred thousand Pounds, and authorized such Company to make and maintain the Dock and other Works therein mentioned or referred to, and gave to them various Powers: And whereas the said Dock and Works have not yet been completed : And whereas it is expedient that the Provisions of the said Act, and the Powers of the Company, should be altered, amended, and enlarged as herein-after expressed:

May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in Provisions of the recited Act, so far as the same are not inconsistent with or are not recited Act altered or repealed by the Provisions of this Act, shall extend to this [^itgeJ[ded to Act, and to the several Purposes thereof, as fully and effectually as if ' 16 ct' the same Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act in reference to such Purposes.

414

[Short Title.]

Acts of Directors appointed under recited Act declared valid, notwithstanding Informality in their Election,

&c.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cajj.xxxi.

II. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, Parliamentary Notices, and other Documents, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression "The Sunderland, Dock Amendment Act, 1849."

III. And whereas by the recited Act the Persons therein named were appointed the First Directors of the Company; and it was enacted, that they should continue in Office until the First Ordinary Meeting to be held after the passing of that Act, and at such Meeting the Shareholders present, personally or by Proxy, might either continue in Office the Directors appointed by that Act, or any Number of them, or might elect a new Number of Directors, or Directors to supply the Places of those not continued in Office, the Directors appointed by that Act being eligible as Directors of such new Body; and it was enacted, that at the First Ordinary Meeting to be held in the Year next after the Year in which such last-mentioned Directors should have been appointed or elected, the Shareholders present, either personally or by Proxy, should elect Persons to supply the Place of the Directors then retiring from Office agreeably to the Provisions in the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act contained; and the several Persons elected at any such Meeting, being neither removed nor disqualified, nor having resigned, should continue to be Directors until others were elected in their Stead : And whereas by the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act it was enacted, that the Directors appointed by the special Act and continued in Office, or the Directors elected to supply the Places of those retiring, should retire from Office at the Times and in the Proportions mentioned in the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act; viz., at the End of the First Year after the First Election of Directors the Number therein mentioned, at the End of the Second Year the Number therein mentioned, and at the End of the Third Year the Number therein mentioned: And whereas inasmuch as the Provisions of the last-mentioned Act, and of the Sunderland Dock Act, with respect to the Retirement of the Directors named in such Act, and the Appointment of others, are inconsistent with each other, be it enacted, That the Thirteen Persons herein-after named, viz. George Hudson, Christopher Brain-well, David Jonassohn, Thomas Brown, Richard Spoor, William Ord, Thomas Reed, Robert Davies, James Richardson, and Nicholas Wood, being Ten of the Persons named as Directors in the Sunderland Dock Act, and John Clap, who has been appointed a Director in the Place of Andrew White another of the Directors named in the same Act, John Scott, who has been appointed a Director in the Place of Thomas Wood another of the Directors named in the same Act, and Thomas Hunter, who has been appointed a Director in the Place of James Hartley the other Director named in the same Act, and which Thirteen Persons have from Time to Time been continued or re-elected and now act as the Directors of the Company, are hereby declared to have been duly elected, and the Appointments of them respectively as Directors are hereby confirmed, and that notwithstanding the Informality (if any) in the Continuation in Office, Election, or Re-election of them, any or either of them, and notwithstanding any Act, Matter, or Thing relating thereto, all Acts done by any Meeting of them as Directors, and all Acts done by any

Meeting

415

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxi.

Meeting of the first-named Ten Directors, and of the said Andrew White, Thomas Wood, and James Hartley, or either or any of them, shall be and are hereby declared to be valid.

IV. And be it enacted, That the Ordinary Meetings of the Com- lr°el£*ec. pany, which shall be held in the Month of August in each Year, shall }"0"gre0f t>;_* be the Meetings at wdiich, pursuant to the Companies Clauses Con- rectors. solidation Act, Directors retiring from Office by Rotation shall so

retire, and at which their Places shall be supplied; and that in the Construction of that Act, as applied to the Sunderland Dock Act, the Ordinary Meeting which shall be held in the Month of August One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine shall be deemed the End of the First Year, the Ordinary Meeting which shall be held in the Year One thousand eight hundred and fifty the End of the Second Year, and the Ordinary Meeting which shall be held in the Year One thousand eight hundred and fifty-one the End of the Third Year, respectively named in the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act with reference to the Rotation of Directors; and at the first of the above-mentioned Ordinary Meetings the Shareholders present, either personally or by Proxy, shall elect Persons to supply the Places of the Directors then retiring from Office agreeably to the Provisions of the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act; and the several Persons elected at such Meeting, being neither removed nor disqualified, nor having resigned, shall continue to be Directors until others are elected in their Stead in Manner provided by the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, and thenceforth the Provisions of that Act with respect to the Rotation of Directors shall be observed.

V. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to Power to raise the additional Sum of One hundred thousand Pounds which by raise Money the recited Act they are authorized to borrow on Mortgage or Bond, ^nC^ation or any Part thereof, by creating new Shares in the Company instead Shares in-of borrowing the same, or, having borrowed the same, to continue at stead of Interest only a Part of such additional Sum, and to raise Part thereof borrowing, by creating new Shares; and the new Shares so to be created shall be

of such nominal Amount, and the Proprietors thereof shall be entitled to such Privileges, and such Preferences or Priorities as to Dividend or otherwise, and such Guarantee, as the Company may determine, and shall in the first instance be offered to the Proprietors of original Shares in the Undertaking of the Company in fair Proportion to the Number of such original Shares as they shall respectively hold therein : Provided always, that no such Augmentation of Capital shall take place without the previous Authority of a General Meeting of the Company.

VI. And be it enacted, That the Capital so to be raised by the Capital Creation of new Shares shall be considered as Part of the general ra'sed by Capital of the Company, and shall be subject to the same Provisions Creation of in all respects, whether with reference to the Payment of Calls, or the lob/'ubTect Forfeiture of Shares, or Nonpayment of Calls, or otherwise, as if it to same Pm-had been Part of the original Capital, except as to the Amount of visions as such Shares, and the Times of making Calls thereon, and the Amount 0,ri?!nal

of such Calls, which respectively it shall be lawful for the Directors Cap,taL

of

410

Voting by Proprietors of new Shares.

Extending Period for compulsory Purchase of Lands.

Existing Contracts and Notices to take Lands not to be affected.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxi.

of the Company from Time to Time to fix as they shall think fit, and as to the Guarantee and Privileges as to Preference or Priority, if any, which are to be attached to such Shares, which Privileges it shall be lawful for the Company to fix as they shall think proper.

VII. And be it enacted, That the Proprietors of any new Shares created under the Powers of this Act shall be entitled to such Number of Votes in respect thereof as the nominal Amount represented by such Shares would have entitled them to if such new Shares had been original Shares in the Undertaking of the Company.

VIII. And be it enacted, That, notwithstanding anything contained in the recited Act, the Period after which the Powers thereby granted to the Company for the compulsory Purchase or taking of Lands shall not be exercised shall be and is hereby extended; and it shall be lawful for the Company to avail themselves of and act upon such Powers at any Time, or from Time to Time within the Period of Two Years from the passing of this Act, but the said Powers shall not be exercised after the Expiration of Two Years from the passing hereof.

IX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall in anywise prejudice or affect any Contracts entered into or Notice given by the said Company before the passing of this Act, for purchasing, taking, or using any Lands which under the said Act such Company is entitled to purchase, take, or use, but every such Contract and Notice respectively shall be construed, and shall take effect, and the same Proceedings shall be had thereunder, and all Parties thereto shall be entitled to the same Rights and Remedies in respect thereof, both at Law and in Equity, as if this Act had not been passed.

Parties X. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Justices, Arbi-

aggrieved by trator, Umpires, or Juries respectively, as the Case may be, who, TimTbein of unt*er t*ie Provisions of the said recited Act or this Act, shall award gramedCing or assess the Compensation to be made by the Company to the

may have Owners or Occupiers of or other Persons interested in any of the

Compensa Lands which shall be taken or used for the Purposes of the Dock or

additional ^or*'s by the said recited Act or this Act authorized, or which may

Damage8 be injuriously affected by the Construction thereof, shall, in estimating the Amount of such Compensation, have regard to and make Compensation for the additional Damages (if any) sustained by such Owners, Occupiers, or other Persons by reason of any such Extension of Time having been granted as aforesaid.

Extending

XL. And be it enacted, That, notwithstanding anything contained Period for in the recited Act, the Period after which the Powers thereby granted of’vv'oHtg0'1 to the Company for making and executing the Works thereby autho-or'!" rized, or otherwise relating thereto, are to cease, is hereby extended; and it shall be lawful for the Company to avail themselves of and act upon such Powers at any Time or from Time to Time within the Period of Five Years from the passing of this Act (except as hereinafter

417

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxi.

after next mentioned), but the said Powers shall not be exercised after the Expiration of Five Years from the passing hereof.

XII. And be it enacted, That, notwithstanding anything contained Extending in the said recited Act, the Period after which the Powers thereby Execution granted to the said Company for providing a suitable Site for the ot Ordnance Erection of a new Battery, Fort, Buildings and Conveniences con- Works, nected therewith, and for carrying up a proper Foundation Wall for the Tower of the said new Buildings to the Level of the proposed Dock Wall, are to cease, is hereby extended; and it shall be lawful for the said Company to avail themselves of and act on such Powers from Time to Time within the Period of Two Years from the passing of this Act; and in all other respects the Terms and Conditions in the said recited Act contained, and all the Powers and Authorities thereby given and vested in the Master General and principal Officers of Her Majesty's Board of Ordnance, shall remain in full Force and Effect.

XIII. And be it enacted, That such Parts of the Sunderland Dock Toll*.

Act, 1846, as may or would empower the said Company to demand, receive, or recover from the Master or Owner of every Vessel entering

or using the said Dock the Rate or Duty specified in the Schedule (A.) to that Act, shall be and the same are hereby repealed; and that in place thereof be it enacted, That as soon as the said Dock shall be fit for the Reception of Vessels, it shall be lawful for the Company to demand, receive, and recover from every Master or Owner of every Ship or Vessel entering or leaving the said Dock any Rate or Duty not exceeding the Rate or Duty specified in the Schedule (A.) to this Act, for every Ton Burthen of such Ship or Vessel, for each and every Time she enters or leaves the said Dock, the Amount of such Burthen to be ascertained as in the said recited Act is directed; and every such Ship or Vessel shall pay the Tonnage Rate or Duty on leaving the said Dock, notwithstanding she may have paid or been liable to pay the Tonnage Rate or Duty when she entered the same.

XIV. And be it enacted, That such Part of the Sunderland Dock Certificate Act, 184G, as directs that a Certificate of the Chairman of the of Justices Quarter Sessions of the Peace for the County of Durham shall be sufficient Evidence of the Dock being completed and fit for the Reception of Dockbelnc Vessels, be and the same is hereby repealed; and in lieu thereof be it ready for g enacted, That a Certificate under the Hand of any Chairman of the Reception Quarter Sessions of the Peace for the County Palatine of Durham, of Vessels-or from any Three of Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace acting in and for the Borough of Sunderland in Petty Sessions assembled, 7uch Justices not being in any Manner interested in the said Dock, shall be conclusive Evidence that the Dock is fit for the Reception of Vessels; and any such Chairman or Justices shall sign such Certificate on proper Proof being adduced to him that the Dock is in a State hereinbefore mentioned.

XV.And be it enacted, That such Parts of the Sutiderkmd Dock Tolls on Act, 1846, as authorizes the said Company to demand, receive, and Goods, & [Local. 1 5 N

1 J ° recover

418

Vessels remaining in Dock beyond a certain Period liable to a further Rate.

Power to Commissioners of the River Wear to take certain Rates, &c.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxi.

recover, for all Goods, Merchandize, Articles, or Things mentioned in the Schedule fB.) to that Act, loaded or delivered from or upon the Quays or Wharfs to be constructed under the Authority of that Act, or shipped or unshipped within the said Dock, the several Rates in the said Schedule specified, shall be and the same are hereby repealed; and in the place thereof be it enacted That it shall be lawful for the said Company to demand, receive, and recover, for or in respect of all Goods, Merchandize, Articles, or Things mentioned in the Schedule (B.) to this Act, loaded or delivered from or upon the Quays or Wharfs to be constructed under the Authority of this Act or the said recited Act, or shipped or unshipped within the said Dock, any Sum not exceeding the several Rates in the said Schedule specified.

XVI. And be it enacted, That such Part of the Sunderland, Dock Act, 1846, as directs that for Vessels remaining in the Dock longer than Fourteen Days there should be paid a further Tonnage Rate as therein mentioned, shall be and the same is hereby repealed; and in the place thereof be it enacted, That if any Vessel using the said Dock, except Inward-bound Vessels with Cargoes that shall be delivered in the said Dock, shall remain in the Dock for any longer Space of Time than Fourteen Days, or, in case of such Inward-bound Vessels as aforesaid, for any longer Space than Thirty Days, such Periods to be respectively computed from the Time of going into the Dock, there shall be paid and payable to the Company by the Master or Owner of every such Vessel, according tot he Tonnage or Burthen thereof, over and above all Tonnage Rates or Duties to which the same shall or may be liable on entering and leaving the said Dock by virtue of this Act, a further Rate or Duty not exceeding Two-pence per Ton for every Week, and so in proportion for any Period less than a Week, during which any such Vessel shall remain in the said Dock beyond such respective Periods as aforesaid: Provided always, that such additional Rates shall not be payable for any such Vessel which shall have been prevented from leaving the said Dock by an Embargo.

XVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners acting under an Act passed in the Eleventh Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Fourth, for the Improvement and Preservation of the River Wear and Port and Haven of Sunderland in the County Palatine of Durham, to levy and receive such and the same Tolls, Rates, and Duties in respect of Ships or Vessels entering or using, and all Coals and Cinders shipped or delivered in the said Sunderland Dock, as such Commissioners are or may from Time to Time be entitled to, and shall levy and receive in respect of Ships and Vessels entering or using, and Coals and Cinders shipped or delivered in the River Wear, or the Port or Haven of Sunderland; and the said Commissioners shall and may lawfully have, use, and exercise all such and the same Powers and Remedies for ascertaining the Tonnage of all Ships and Vessels, and the Quantity of Coals and Cinders liable to Duty to them under the Provisions of this Act, and for levying, receiving, and recovering the Tolls, Rates, and Duties by this Act imposed and payable to them in respect of Ships or Vessels entering or using, and Coals and Cinders shipped or delivered in the

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxi. 419

said Dock, or otherwise in relation thereto, as are by the said Act of the Eleventh Year of the Reign of His said Majesty granted in respect of the Tolls, Rates, and Duties thereby imposed, and for such Purpose the said Sunderland Dock shall be deemed and taken to be Part and Parcel of the said River Wear: Provided always, that nothing in this Act contained shall be construed to authorize the said Commissioners to exercise or have any Power or Jurisdiction whatsoever within the said Dock, or the Entrance thereto or the Outlet therefrom, except such as may be necessary for enabling them to ascertain the Amount of Tolls, Rates, and Duties payable to them, and for levying, receiving, and recovering the same.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That such Parts of the Sunderland Certain Pro-Dock Act, 1846, as require that the Sunderland Dock Company shall visions of the receive and pay to the said Commissioners, in respect of all .Ships and dTc^AcT Vessels entering and Coals or Cinders shipped or delivered in the as to such said Dock, the same Rates and Dues as Ships or Vessels entering Rates and and Coals and Cinders shipped or delivered either in the River Wear Duties re-or the Port or Haven of Sunderland are or may be liable to pay to pea e '

the said Commissioners, and to require that the Company shall half-yearly render to the said Commissioners an Account in Writing of the Coals and Cinders shipped and delivered in the said Dock in the preceding Half Year, and as impose a Forfeiture and Payment in case of failing to deliver such Account, or knowingly delivering an incorrect Account, shall be and are hereby repealed.

XIX. And be it enacted, That in addition to the Powers by the Additional recited Act given to the Dock Master and his Assistants, it shall be Power to lawful for the said Dock Master and his Assistants, or any of them, Dock Master in case the said Dock shall at any Time or Times be so full or the^iu'on crowded with Ships or Vessels laying up so as to prevent, impede, of Vessels, or render inconvenient the Export or Import Trade of the said Dock,

or the Ships entering or leaving the same, to remove any of such Ships or Vessels so laying up as aforesaid into any other more convenient Part of the said Dock, or into the River Wear, such Ships or Vessels when brought into the River Weare being under the Directions of the Haven Masters of the Port for the Time being for such Time as he or they may see fit: Provided that such Ships so removed shall not be liable, on such Removal into the said River, or back again into the said Dock, to the Tonnage Duties payable on Ships or Vessels entering or leaving the said Dock.

XX. And be it enacted, That if any Goods which shall be brought Company into the Dock on board of any Vessel shall not be duly entered with may land the Customs, and the Order for landing lodged with the Officer of Goot's not the Customs stationed on board such Vessel, or with the proper Officer df>ly e"ter5a of the Customs within the said Dock, as the Case may be, within piration of Seven Days next after the Vessel importing the said Goods shall have Seve" Days; been reported to the Custom House, then and in every such Case it

shall be lawful for the proper Officer of the said Company appointed for that Purpose, on the next ensuing Day (not being a Sundau C/mstmas Day, or Good Friday, the King’s or Queen’s Birthday or a Day appointed by Her Majesty's Proclamation for the Purposes of a
