VI. And be it enacted, That the Directors, with the Consent of a

Alteration of General Meeting, may from Time to Time exercise, with respect to

Shares. any

Parties aggrieved by Limitation of Time may have Compensation for additional Damage.

4()5

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxiii.

any of the Shares in such aggregate Capital of Seven million four hundred and thirty-four thousand and fifty Pounds, any of the following Powers:

First,—They may, with the Consent of the Holders of any Shares whereon such preferential Dividends are payable, convert the same into Shares bearing rateable Dividends out of the Revenue of the Company:

Second,—They may conveit any Shares for the Time being fully paid up into transferable Stock:

Third,—They may convert any Shares, whether already issued or not, and whether for the Time being fully paid up or not, into new Shares differing from their present nominal Amounts, with a view to the ultimate Conversion of the whole into Shares of the same nominal Amounts:

Fourth,—They may make any Classification of Shares, whether already issued or not, and whether for the Time being fully paid up or not:

Fifth,—They may, with the Consent of the Holders of any Shares whereon such preferential Dividend is payable, convert the same into transferable Stock bearing a like preferential Dividend : Sixth,—They may issue any of the Shares not already issued, and whether or not converted into Shares of different Amounts, and whether or not classified, at such Times, upon such Terms, and to such Persons as they think fit.

VII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Powers by this Act conferred on the Directors shall not enable them to increase such aggregate Capital of Seven million four hundred and thirty-four thousand and fifty Pounds, whether for the Time being consisting partly of transferable Stock and partly of Shares, or wholly of transferable Stock, beyond the present Amount thereof.

VIII. And be it enacted, That such new Shares into which other

Shares shall be converted, or which shall be issued for or in lieu of other Shares, shall be respectively vested in the several Corporations and Persons who were the respective Holders of the Shares converted into such new Shares, or for or in lieu of which such new Shares shall be issued, and their respective Successors, Executors, Administrators, and Assigns, to their proper Use and Benefit, proportionably to the Sums paid on or in respect of the same respectively; and such Shares already created, but not yet issued, or the Shares which shall be issued for or in lieu of the same, shall be respectively vested in the several Corporations and Persons who have subscribed and shall hereafter subscribe for the same respectively, and their respective Successors, Executors, Administrators, and Assigns, to their proper Use and Benefit, proportionably to the Sums by them respectively subscribed and to be subscribed; and all such Corporations and Persons respectively, and their respective Successors, Executors, Administrators, and Assigns, shall accordingly be Owners and Proprietors of Capital Stock in the Company to the same Extent, and as beneficially, to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever, (except as herein-• [Loca/.] 6 B after

Capital not* to be increased.

Rights of Holders of new Shares.

466 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxiii.

after provided,) as Proprietors of the like Number of the Shares by the first-recited Act authorized to be created, and shall, in respect of the Shares and new Shares by this Act authorized to be respectively created and issued, (except as aforesaid,) be entitled and subject to all such Rights, Privileges, Powers, Provisions, Indemnities, Remedies, Penalties, Clauses, Matters, and Things, as are respectively contained or expressed in the recited Acts or any of them, so far as the same respectively are now unrepealed, and are not by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for: Provided always, that any Proprietor of any Share, or new Share hereby authorized to be created or issued, shall not be entitled to any further or greater Dividend thereon than in respect and to the Extent of the Amount which has for the Time being been paid up on such Share, or on the Share or Shares converted into such new Share, or for or in lieu of which such new Share has been issued.

Towers to

IX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Directors shall, make Calls, in respect as well of the existing Shares for the Time being not fully paid up as of the new Shares for the Time being not fully paid up, have all the Powers by the recited Acts or any of them given to the Directors for making and enforcing Calls: Provided also, that the total Amount which the Directors may call up on any such existing Share shall not exceed the Amount which they might have called up thereon if this Act had not been passed : Provided also, that the total Amount which the Directors may call up on any such new Share or new Shares shall not exceed the total Amount

which they might have called up on the Share or Shares converted into such new Share or new Shares, or for and in lieu of which such new Share or new Shares shall be issued.

Provision as X. And whereas by or under or in pursuance of the Provisions to borrowing of the recited Acts the Company are authorized to borrow at Inte-Money. rest;v]oney to the aggregate Amount of Two million two hundred and fifty-two thousand one hundred and forty-six Pounds, and they have exercised such Powers to the Extent of borrowing at Interest the aggregate Principal Sum of One million six hundred and nine thousand three hundred and fifty Pounds : And whereas it is expedient to simplify the Powers of the Company with respect to the borrowing of Money: Be it therefore enacted, That the Company may from Time to Time, with the Consent of a General Meeting, borrow at Interest on Mortgage of their Undertaking and the future Calls on the Shareholders, or on Bond, all or any Part of the said Sum of Two million two hundred and fifty-two thousand one hundred and forty-six Pounds not for the Time being borrowed and continuing due from the Company on Loan, but nevertheless subject and without Prejudice to the Rights and Interests of the present Mortgagees and Bond Creditors of the Company; and for the Purposes of this Act the Provisions of " The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1815," with respect to the borrowing of Money by the Company on Mortgage or Bond, and with respect to the Conversion of the borrowed Money into Capital, are incorporated with

467

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxHi.

this Act: Provided always, that this Act shall not enable the Company to borrow any greater Amount than they might have borrowed if this Act had not been passed.

XI. And whereas it is expedient that the present Scale of voting at Meetings of Proprietors in the Company should be amended : Be it therefore enacted, That at all General Meetings of the Company every Shareholder shall have One Vote for every Sum of Fifty Pounds held by him in the Capital of the Company up to Ten such Sums, and he shall have an additional Vote for every Five such Sums held by him beyond the first Ten such Sums held by him up to One hundred such Sums, and an additional Vote for every Ten such Sums held by him beyond the first One hundred such Sums held by him : Provided always, that no Shareholder shall be entitled to vote at any Meeting while any Call actually due and payable on or in respect of any Share or Stock held by him remains in arrear and unpaid.

XII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That such Voles shall be ascertained as follows, and not otherwise; to wit,

1. In every Case of a Shareholder holding only One Share in

the Share Capital of the Company, and not holding any of the transferable Stock of the Company, if such Share is of a nominal Amount less than Fifty Pounds such Share shall not confer any Right to vote, or if such Share is of the nominal Amount of Fifty Pounds such Share shall be deemed One entire Sum of Fifty Pounds held in the Capital of the Company, or if such Share is of a nominal Amount greater than Fifty Pounds every entire Sum of Fifty Pounds comprised in such nominal Amount shall be deemed One entire Sum of Fifty Pounds held in the Capital of the Company; but any Balance less than Fifty Pounds of such nominal Amount shall not confer any Right to vote:

2. In every Case of a Shareholder holding more Shares than

One in the Share Capital of the Company, and not holding any of the transferable Stock of the Company, if such Shares together are of an aggregate nominal Amount less than Fifty Pounds such Shares or any of them shall not confer any Right to vote, or if such Shares together are of the aggregate nominal Amount of Fifty Pounds such Shares together shall be deemed One entire Sum of Fifty Pounds held in the Capital of the Company, or if such Shares together are of an aggregate Amount greater than Fifty Pounds every entire Sum of Fifty Pounds comprised in such aggregate nominal Amount shall be deemed One entire Sum of Fifty Pounds held in the Capital of the Company; but any Balance less than Fifty Pounds of such aggregate nominal Amount shall not confer any Right to vote:

3. In every Case of a Shareholder holding any of the trans-

ferable Stock of the Company, and not holding any Share in the Share Capital of the Company, if such Stock is of a nominal Amount less than Fifty Pounds such Stock shall not confer any

Right

Scale of Votes for Shareholders.

Mode of ascertaining such Votes.

408

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Coj).xxxiii.

Right to vote, or if such Stock is of the nominal Amount of Fifty Pounds such Stock shall be deemed One entire Sum of Fifty Pounds held in the Capital of the Company, or if such Stock is of a nominal Amount greater than Fifty Pounds, every entire Sum of Fifty Pounds comprised in such nominal Amount shall be deemed One entire Sum of Fifty Pounds held in the Capital of the Company; but any Balance less than Fifty Pounds of such nominal Amount shall not confer any Right to vote:

4. In every Case of a Shareholder holding any Share or Shares in the Share Capital of the Company, and also holding any of the transferable Stock of the Company, if such Share or Shares and Stock together are of an aggregate nominal Amount less than Fifty Pounds such Share or Shares and Stock, or any of them, shall not confer any Right to vote, or if such Share or Shares and Stock together are of the aggregate nominal Amount of Fifty Pounds such Share or Shares and Stock together shall be deemed One entire Sum of Fifty Pounds held in the Capital of the Company, or if such Share or Shares and Stock together are of an aggregate nominal Amount greater than Fifty Pounds every entire Sum of Fifty Pounds comprised in such aggregate nominal Amount shall be deemed One entire Sum of Fifty Pounds held in the Capital of the Company; but any Balance less than Fifty Pounds of such aggregate nominal Amount shall not confer any Right to vote.

Scale of voting to be that prescribed by this Act. Meetings to be held and Accounts to be made up half-yearly.

Saving Powers of Company,

&c.~

XIII. And be it enacted, That the Scale of voting prescribed by this Act shall be substituted for any and every Scale of voting prescribed by the recited Acts or any of them.

XIV. And be it enacted, That a Special General Meeting of the Company may from Time to Time, by a Resolution passed on the previous Recommendation of the Directors, appoint that the half-yearly General Meetings of the Company shall be held in such Two half-yearly Months in every Year other than the half-yearly Months of February and August as are thought most for the Advantage for the Time being of the Company, and also to appoint that the Accounts of the Company shall be made up half-yearly on such Two half-yearly Days in every Year other than the Thirtieth Day of June and the Thirty-first Day of December as, having regard to such appointed half-yearly Months, are thought most for the Advantage of the Company, and so long as any such Resolution remains in force the half-yearly General Meetings of the Company shall be held in the half-yearly Months thereby appointed, and the Accounts of the Company shall be made up on the half-yearly Days thereby appointed : Provided always, that the Interval between any such appointed half-yearly Day and the First Day of the appointed half-yearly Month then next following shall not be less than Twenty-seven Days nor more than Thirty-two Days.

XV. Provided also, and be it enacted, That this Act or anything therein contained shall not take away, lessen, or prejudicially affect

any

469

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cffyj.xxxiii.

any of' the Powers or Authorities by the recited Acts or any of them granted to the Company or conferred on the Directors.

XVI. And be it enacted, That the Company shall not out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the Company authorized to be raised by Calls in respect of Shares, or by the Exercise of any Power of borrowing, pay Interest or Dividend to any Shareholder on the Amount of Calls made in respect of the Shares held by him in the Capital of the Company : Provided always, that the Company may pay to any Shareholder such Interest on Money advanced by him beyond the Amount of the Calls actually made as shall be in conformity with the Provisions in the " Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," in that Behalf contained.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Company shall not out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the Company authorized to be raised for the Purposes of such Act or Acts pay or deposit any Sum of Money which by any Standing Order of either House of Parliament for the Time being in force may be required to be deposited in respect of any Application to Parliament for the Purpose of obtaining an Act authorizing the Company to construct any Railway or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

XVIII. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide for the Conveyance of the Mails by Railway; and another Act was passed in the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating Railways; and another Act was passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of Her Majesty, intituled An Act for the better Regulation of Railways, and for the Conveyance of Troops; and another Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the Reign of Her Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Conditions to the Construction of future Railways authorized or to be authorized by any Act of the present or succeeding Sessions of Parliament, and for other Purposes in relation to Railways; and Two other Acts passed in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways, and An Act for constituting Commissioners of Railways: Be it enacted, That anything in this Act contained shall not be held to exempt the Railway or the Company from the Provisions of such several Acts respectively, but such Provisions shall be in force in respect to the Railway and the Company, so far as the same are applicable thereto.

XIX. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Railway by this or the said recited Acts authorized to be made from the Provisions of any general Act relating to such Acts, or of any general Act relating to Railways, now in force, or which may hereafter pass during this or any future Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision and Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament, of the maximum Rates of Fares and Charges authorized by this or the recited Acts.

Interest not to be paid on Calls paid up.

Deposits for future Bills not to be made out of Company’s Capital.

XX. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TE11TIO

VICTORIA REGTN/E.

Cap. xxx iv.

An Act for enabling the Windsor, Staines, and Southwestern (Richmond to Windsor) Railway Company to make an Extension of their Railway to the Town of New Windsor; and for other Purposes.

[2(ith June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Tenth and Eleventh Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, called " The Windsor, Staines, and South- 10& 11 Vict western Railway Act (No. 1.), 184-7," whereby the Windsor, Staines, c. 58. and South-western ( Richmond to Windsor) Railway Company were authorized to make a Railway from Richmond to Windsor, with a Loop Line through Brentford and Hounslow, and the London and South-western Railway Company were empowered to subscribe towards and to accept a Lease or Transfer thereof: And whereas an Act was passed in the last Session of Parliament, called " The Windsor and Southwestern Railway Deviations Act, 1848," whereby the said Windsor,

Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway Company were authorized to make certain Deviations in the Line of the said Railway from Richmond to Windsor: And whereas it would be of public Advantage that the said Company should be enabled to make an Extension of the said Windsor, Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway from the authorized Terminus thereof in the Parish of Datchet in the County of Buckingham into the Town of [_Local.~\ 0 D tfew

11 & 12 Vict.

474

Provisions of recited Acts to extend to this Act.

[Short Title.]

Construction of Terms.

Capital.

Shares may be issued.

Number and Amount of Shares.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxiv.

New Windsor in the County of Berks : And whereas it is expedient that the said London and South-western Railway Company should be authorized to subscribe towards the said Extension to Windsor : And whereas the said Windsor, Staines, and South-western ( Richmond to Windsor) Railway Company are willing to carry the above-mentioned Objects into execution, but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in the said herein-before recited Acts and the Acts incorporated therewith, or any of them, so far as the same are now unrepealed, and except such of them or such Parts thereof as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, shall extend to the several Purposes and Things hereby authorized to be done, and to the Capital hereby authorized to be created, as fully and effectually as if the same several Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act with reference to such Purposes and Things.

II. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, Notices, and other Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The South-western Windsor Extension Act, 1849."

III. And be it enacted, That in construing this Act the Expression "the Company" shall mean "The Windsor, Staines, and Southwestern (Richmond to Windsor) Railway Company."

IV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to raise by the Issue of new Shares in the Undertaking of the Company the further Sum of Eighty thousand Pounds : Provided always, that all and every Part of such Sum shall be applicable only to the Objects and Purposes by this Act authorized.

V. And be it enacted, That, unless at a Special General Meeting of the Company, and with the Consent of the Holders for the Time being of such new Capital, it shall be otherwise ordered and directed, the Holders of such new Capital shall be entitled to the same Rights and Privileges, and be subject to the same Provisions and Liabilities, in all respects as if such new Capital had been Part of the original Capital of the Company, except that no Dividend shall be paid in respect of such new Capital until the said Extension Railway hereby authorized, or some Part thereof, shall have been completed anti opened for Traffic, or until the Company shall be in receipt of income or Rent in respect of the same Extension Railway, or some Part thereof.

VI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Number and nominal Amount of such Shares, and the Times of making Calls for such new Capital, and the Amount of such Calls respectively, shall be such as the Directors of the Company shall fix and determine, so

nevertheless

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxiv. 475

nevertheless that the nominal Amount of any such Share shall not exceed Sixteen Pounds, and so nevertheless that Two Pounds Ten Shillings per Share shall be the greatest Amount of any One Call which the said Company may make on the Shareholders, and Fifteen Pounds of the Amount of a Share shall be the utmost aggregate Amount of Calls that may be made in any One Year on any Share, and One Month at the least shall be the Interval between successive Calls.

VII. Provided also, and be it enacted, That no Proprietor of any As to voting new Shares, the total nominal Amount whereof shall be fixed at less in aspect of than Sixteen Pounds, shall be entitled to vote in respect of the ne'v Slu,re!" Number of such Shares held by him, but for the Purpose of voting

the Amount of Capital in the Company represented by all such new Shares held by him shall be considered as divided into as many Sixteen Pound Shares as such Amount of Capital will admit of, and the Right of voting of such Proprietor in respect of such new Shares of less nominal Amount than Sixteen Pounds each shall be determined by the Number of Sixteen Pound Shares into which the Amount of Capital represented by such new Shares held by him shall be capable of being divided.

VIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Power to at any Special General Meeting thereof to order and direct, with grant pre-the Consent of the Holders thereof at the Time of making such terential Order and Direction, that the Capital which shall be raised under the sitareJ!' ' " Provisions of this or of the said recited Acts for the Purposes of the Extension Railway hereby authorized shall, in lieu and stead of the

Rights and Privileges herein-before mentioned, be created, issued, and held on such Terms as to entitle the Proprietors thereof to be paid out of the general Revenue of the Company, and in priority of the general Dividends made by the Company, a Rate of Dividend to be fixed at such Special General Meeting of the Company not exceeding Six Pounds per Centum per Annum upon the Amount paid up upon such new Shares; and such fixed Dividends shall be payable half-yearly at the same Times as the ordinary Dividends of the Company.

IX. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the Company Interest not or for the London and South-western Railway Company, out of any to be paid on Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the said Railway Calls l,ai<l Companies respectively authorized to be raised by Calls in respect of up'

Shares, or by the Exercise of any Power of borrowing, to pay Interest

or Dividend to any Shareholder on the Amount of the Calls made in respect of the Shares held by him in the Capital by this Act authorized to be raised : Provided always, that nothing herein-before contained shall be deemed to prevent the same Companies respectively from paying to any Shareholder such Interest on Money advanced by him beyond the Amount of the Calls actually made as shall be in conformity with the Provisions in the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, in that Behalf contained.

Deposits for future Bills not to be paid out of Company’s Capital.

Provisions of recited Acts relative to the borrowing of Money to be applicable to the Sum to be borrowed under this Act.

Mortgagees under recited Act to have Priority.

X. And be it enacted, That it shall not he lawful for the Company or for the London and South-western Railway Company, out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the same Companies respectively authorized to be raised for the Purposes of such Act or Acts, to pay or deposit any Sum of Money which, by any Standing Order of either House of Parliament now in force or hereafter to be in force, may he required to he deposited in respect of any Application to Parliament for the Purpose of obtaining an Act authorizing the same Companies respectively to construct any other Railway or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

XI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, when and as soon as the whole of the Capital of the Company authorized by the said recited Act and this Act to he raised by Subscription shall have been actually subscribed or taken up, and One Half thereof paid up, by an Order of any General or Special General Meeting of the Company, from Time to Time to borrow and take up at Interest any further or additional Sum of Money, not exceeding the Sum of Twenty-six thousand six hundred and sixty-six Pounds, on the Credit of the said H'indsor, Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway, including the Loop and Extensions thereof, as to them shall seem proper, and thereupon to secure Repayment thereof, with Interest, to such Persons as shall be found willing to lend the same, by such Mortgages, Assignments, or Ronds as are authorized by the said Act or the Acts incorporated therewith, or some of them, in respect of the Sum by the said recited Act authorized to be borrowed: Provided always, that all and every Part of such Sum of Money so to be borrowed shall be applicable only to the Objects and Purposes by this Act authorized.

XII. And be it enacted, That all the Powers, Authorities, and Provisions, Directions, Remedies, Regulations, Matters, and Things, in the said Act or the Acts incorporated therewith, or some of them, contained, relating to or in anywise affecting the borrowing of Money, and the Augmentation of Capital Stock instead of borrowing, or by the Conversion of Money borrowed into Capital Stock, and relating to or in anywise affecting Mortgages and Assignments, and Transfers of Mortgages and Assignments, and Mortgagees and Assignees and Transferees of Mortgagees and Assignees, shall extend and be applicable to the said additional Sum of Twenty-six thousand six hundred and sixty-six Pounds hereby authorized to be raised as aforesaid, in the same Manner as the same extend and are applicable by the said recited Act and the Acts incorporated therewith, or any of them, to the Sum by the said recited Act authorized to be borrowed as aforesaid.

XIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That Mortgages already granted under the Powers of the said recited Act shall during the Continuance thereof have Priority over any Mortgages to be granted under the Powers of this Act.

XIV. And whereas Plans and Sections of the intended Extension Line of Railway showing the Line and Levels thereof, and also Rooks

of

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxiv. 477

of Reference thereto containing the Names of the Owners, Lessees, *"ite(1 and Occupiers, or reputed Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers, of the pjj^f1 L' Lands through which the same is intended to pass, or which may be required to be taken for the Purposes of the Undertaking, have been deposited with the Clerks of the Peace for the Counties of Buckingham and Berks: Be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this and said recited Acts and the Acts incorporated therewith contained, it shall be lawful for the Company to make and maintain the said Extension Railway and the Works herein-after more particularly described in the Line and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans and described in the said Books of Reference, and upon the Levels defined on the said Sections, and to enter upon, take, and use such of the said Lands as shall be necessary for such Purposes.

XV. And be it enacted, That the said Extension Line of Railway, Description herein-after called "The Windsor Extension Line," shall commence of Line of in the Parish of Datchet in the said County of Buckingham in a Field 31 "a)' numbered G2, in the same Parish, on the deposited Plans of the said Windsor, Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway, and shall terminate in the Parish and Town of New Windsor in

the said County of Berks near a certain Lane there called " Farm Yard"

XVI. And be it enacted, That the said Extension Line of Railway Extension shall be and become Part of the Undertaking of the Windsor, Staines, Lino to and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway Company, and shall as such be subject to the several Provisions of the said recited Act relating thereto as extended to this Act. taking.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the further Quantity of Land to Land for ex-

be taken by the Company for extraordinary Purposes shall not exceed traordinary Twenty Acres. Purposes.

XVIII. And whereas it is proposed by the said Company to erect As to Bridge a Bridge for the Purpose of carrying the said Extension Line of Rail- over the way over the River Thames: Be it enacted, That the Piers of such -plumes Bridge shall be founded sufficiently deep to admit of providing and maintaining at the said Bridge a Depth of Ten Feet of Water below

the ordinary Summer Surface of the River, and also that the said Company shall and will dredge or deepen the said River at the Site of the said Bridge, and for a Quarter of a Mile above and below the same, it and as and when the said Company are so required to do by the Lord High Admiral of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, by Writing under the Hand of the Secretary of the Admiralty.

XIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Com- As to cro s-pany to carry the said Extension Line of Railway across and on the >ng of a Level ot a certain Highw-ay or Towing Path numbered on the Plans certa‘n Road, deposited as aforesaid 2, in the said Parish of New Windsor.

Confirming Agreement between the Crown and the Company.

Power to enter into further Agreements with the Crown.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cup.xxxiv.

XX. And whereas an Agreement in Writing bearing Date on or about the Fourteenth Day of February One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine has been entered into between the Commissioners of Her Majesty's Woods, Forests, Land Revenues, Works, and Buildings, on behalf of Her Majesty, of the First Part, William James Chaplin, Henry Charles Lacy, and George Alexander Reid, therein described as Three of the Directors of the Windsor, Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway Company, of the Second Part, the said Company of the Third Part, and the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty of the Fourth Part, which Agreement contains certain Conditions and Stipulations as to the Terms on and the Manner in which the said Windsor, Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway Company should construct and maintain the said Extension of their present Railway from Datchet to Windsor, and as to the Communications, Culverts, and Fences to be made and maintained by the said Company, and as to the Position of the Terminus of the said Railway at Windsor, and as to the Place or Places at which the said Company might construct Stations, and the Mode in which the said Company might use such Stations when constructed, and as to the Mode of fixing the Price at which the Commissioners should sell and convey to the Company such Portions of the Crown Property not situate within the Home Park as might be necessary for the Extension of the Railway, and also containing numerous other Stipulations and Provisions having reference to the said proposed Extension : And whereas it is expedient that such Agreement should be ratified and confirmed by Parliament: Be it enacted, That the said Agreement of the Fourteenth Day of February One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine shall be and the same is hereby authorized, ratified, and confirmed, and the Parties to the said Agreement shall be and they are hereby declared to be bound to abide by, fulfil, perform, and execute every Clause, Matter, and Thing in the said Agreement contained purporting to be obligatory on such Parties respectively as fully and effectually to all Intents and Purposes as if every Clause, Matter, and Thing in the said Agreement had been hereby fully and at length repeated and expressly enacted: Provided always, that nothing in this Clause contained shall prevent the said recited Agreement from being altered or modified by any new Agreement which, consistently with the Provision for that Purpose hereinafter contained, may be hereafter entered into between the Commissioners of Woods for the Time being on behalf of Her Majesty and the said Company.

XXI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners of Woods for the Time being, with the Consent and Approbation of the Lord High Treasurer, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Treasurer, of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland, or any Three or more of them, and for the said Company, to enter into any further Agreements or Agreement having reference to the said proposed Extension, and that any such Agreements or Agreement, when duly executed by the said Commissioners for the Time being on behalf of Her Majesty, with such Consent as aforesaid, and by the said Company, under the Authority of this Act, shall be binding and obligatory on lire Parties thereto for the Purpose

479

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxiv.

and Purposes, and to the Extent and in the Manner in which the same may purport to bind them, but nevertheless that any such Agreement may be altered or modified by any subsequent Agreement executed according to the Provisions of this Act: Provided always, that no Agreement or Agreements modifying, varying, or altering, or purporting to modify, vary, or alter, the said Agreement by this Act confirmed, shall be of any Force, Validity, or Effect, either at Law or in Equity, or otherwise howsoever, unless and until such further Agreement or Agreements shall have been expressly approved of, ratified, and confirmed by Her Majesty, Her Heirs or Successors, and such Approval, Ratification, and Confirmation shall have been previously signified by some Instrument or Instruments in V riting under the ltoyal Sign Manual of Her Majesty, Her Heirs or Successors.

XXII. And be it enacted, That no Depot, Station, Yard, Wharf, Waiting, Watering, Loading or Unloading Place, Building, or Erection of any Kind whatsoever shall be made or constructed by the said Company, and that the said Company shall not permit or allow any Trains, Engines, or Carriages of any Description to stop, or take up or set down any Person or Persons, Passenger or Passengers, or load or unload any Train, Engine, or Carriage whatsoever, on any Part of the said extended Line of Railway, or any Land adjoining the same, between the Fields marked 71 and 72 in the Parish of Datchet on the deposited Plans of the said Windsor, Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway and the said proposed Terminus of the said Extension Line of Railway near Windsor Bridge, without the Consent of the Provost and College of Eton, to be signified by some Writing under their Corporate Seal.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That the Provost of Eton College, Head Master or Under Master of Eton College School, or any Person appointed by them or either of them, shall at all seasonable Times have free Access to any Depot or Station for the Reception of Passengers proceeding by the Trains upon the said Extension Line of Railway, and to every Part thereof, and to every Booking Office, Ticket Office, or other Office or Place for Passengers upon the said Extension Railway, and shall then and there be "entitled to demand and take and have, without any unreasonable Delay, from the proper Officer or Servant of the Company, such Information as it may be in the Power of any Officer or Servant of the Company to give with reference to any Passenger or Person having passed or applying to pass on the said Extension Railway, or otherwise coming to or being in or upon the said Depot or Station, who shall be a Scholar of Eton College, either on the Foundation or otherwise; and in case the said Company or their Officers or Servants, or any of them, shall not permit such free Access to the said Depots or Stations as aforesaid, or shall not furnish such Information as herein-before mentioned, the said Company or Officer or Servant of the said Company shall for each Default forfeit and pay a Sum not exceeding Five Pounds.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That the Powers of the Company for compulsory Purchase of Lands for the Purposes of this Act shall not

be

be exercised after the Expiration of Three Years from the passing of this Act.

XXV. And be it enacted, That after the Expiration of Five Years from the passing of this Act all the Powers hereby granted to the Company tor making the Railways hereby authorized, or otherwise in relation thereto, shall cease to be exercised, except as to so much of the same as shall then be completed.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That the Company may, subject to the Provisions contained in the said recited Acts, lawfully demand and receive in respect of the Railways and Works hereby authorized to be made, for the Tonnage of all Articles, Matters, and Things conveyed upon the same or any Part thereof respectively, and in respect of Passengers, Beasts, Cattle, and Animals conveyed in Carriages, and for Carriages conveyed on the same or any Part thereof respectively, and for and in respect of locomotive Engines or other Power for drawing or propelling supplied by the Company, and for the Conveyance upon the same Railways or any Part thereof respectively, in Waggons or Carriages belonging to the Company, of any Passengers, Cattle or other Animals, Goods, Wares, Merchandize, Articles, Matters, and Things, and for Wharfage, Warehousing, and Craneage, such Amount of Tolls and other Charges as by the said recited Acts the Company are authorized to demand and receive in respect of the same several Matters and Things, Privileges and Advantages respectively, on or in respect of the said Windsor, Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway, or the Works connected therewith, or any Part thereof.

XXVII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the maximum Charges to be made by the Company in respect of all the Tolls and Charges in respect of the Railways and Works hereby authorized to be made, and of Carriages, Waggons, and Trucks, and for locomotive Power, and every Expense incidental to such Conveyance, shall not exceed the Sums in that Behalf limited by the Windsor, Staines, and South-western Railway Act (No. 1.), 1847: Provided also, that the maximum Charges shall not extend to Articles, Matters, or Things, Passengers, Beasts, Cattle, and Animals, conveyed by or in any Special Train, and that in all Cases where any such Articles, Matters, or Things, Passengers, Beasts, Cattle, and Animals, shall be conveyed on the said Windsor, Staines, and South-western (Richmond to Windsor) Railway, including the Deviations and Extension thereof hereby authorized to be made, for a less Distance than Six Miles, the Company may demand and receive the before-mentioned maximum Charges for Six Miles.

XXVIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be held to prevent the Company from taking any increased Charges, over and above the Charges herein-before limited, for the Conveyance of Goods of any Description by Agreement with the Owners of or Persons in charge of such Goods, either in respect of the Conveyance thereof by Passenger or other Trains, or by reason of any other special Service performed by the Company in relation thereto.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxiv. 481

XXIX. And whereas the London and South-western Railway £a"’"nt0 Company have agreed at a General Meeting of the Proprietors ofan(j South-the said Company to subscribe towards the Undertaking hereby

authorized: Be it therefore enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Railway said London and South-western Railway Company to subscribe to

towards and become Shareholders in the said Undertaking to any su scr‘ e’ Extent not exceeding the Amount herein authorized to be raised in Shares.

XXX. And be it enacted, That for such Purpose it shall be lawful and for that for the said London and, South-western Railway Company to raise Purpose to all or any Part of the Money authorized to be subscribed by them sfteVumts. as aforesaid by the Creation of new Shares in the Undertaking of the said London and South-western Railway, of such Rights and Privileges, and subject to the same Provisions, Conditions, and Liabilities, in all respects as the new Shares authorized to be created in the same Undertaking by the London and South-western Railway Company’s Amendment Act, 1818, for the Purposes of that Act; or it shall be lawful for the London and South-western Railway Company, if they shall think fit, with the Consent of a General Meeting of the Proprietors thereof especially convened for the Purpose, to raise the Sums agreed to be subscribed by them, or any Portion thereof, by Mortgage of their Undertaking in like Manner and under and subject to the same Provisions as the same Company by all or any of the Acts relating to their Undertaking is authorized to raise Money by Mortgage on the Credit thereof: Provided always, that the same Company shall not raise any Money by Mortgage until the whole of their then existing Capital shall have been subscribed for, and One Half thereof paid up, nor shall the same Company by such Means increase the Amount which may be owing at any one Time on Mortgage of their Undertaking beyond the Proportion of One Third of their then existing Capital: Provided also, that no Priority or Guarantee of Dividend or Interest which may he granted in respect of any new Shares created by the London and South-western Railway Company in pursuance of the Powers of this Act shall prejudice or affect the Priority of any Guarantee of Dividend or Interest which may have been granted by the said last-mentioned Company by or under any Act passed before the present Session of Parliament.

XXXI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Subscribing London and South-western Railway Company from Time to Time to Company nominate and appoint some One Person (whether a Shareholder or may aPPomt not in the Company hereby authorized to make the said Extension to'votc er>°" and Deviations) under the Seal of the said London and South-western Railway Company, or under the Hand of the Chairman for the Time being of the Directors of such Company, to vote on their Behalf at any Meeting of the Company in respect of the Shares which they may subscribe for and hold in the Capital by this Act authorized to be created, and such Person so appointed shall have the same Right of voting at such Meeting as the London and South-western Railway Company by whom he is appointed.

Railway

XXXII. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of

Company to t])e Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide for the^Pro- fbe Conveyance of the Mails by Railway; and another Act was visions of passed in the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled l fc 2 Vict. An Act for regulating Railways; and another Act was passed in c;- the Sixth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act

c. <jt. C for Mie better Regulation of Railways, and for the Conveyance of 5 & 6 Vict. Troops; and another Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the c. 55, Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Con-I k '8 'ami' dilions to the Construction of future Railways authorized or to 9 & to Vict, be authorized by any Act of the present or succeeding Sessions of cc. 57.105. Parliament, and for other Purposes in relation to Railway and another Act passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways; and another Act passed in the same Session, intituled An Act for constituting Commissioners of Railways : Be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall be held to exempt the said Railway or the Company from the Provisions of the said several Acts respectively, but that such Provisions shall be in force in respect of the said Railway and the Company so far as the same shall be applicable thereto.

Railways to

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be subject to be deemed or construed to exempt the Railways by this or the said of futureS recited Acts authorized to be made, or the Company, from the Progeneral visions of any general Act relating to such Acts, or of any general

Act. Act relating to Railways, or to the better and more impartial Audit

of the Accounts of Railway Companies, now in force, or which may hereafter pass during this or any future Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision and Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament, of the maximum Rates of Fares and Charges authorized by this or the said recited Acts.

[Public Act.]

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DEC I MO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGINA.

Cap. xxxv.

An Act for the further Improvement of the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Seventh and Eighth Years of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act for 7 & 8 G. 4. lighting, cleansing, watching, and otherwise improving the Town ofc- "• Ashton-under-Lyne in the County Palatine of Lancaster, and for regulating the Police thereof whereby certain Persons qualified as therein mentioned were appointed Commissioners for executing the Purposes contained in the said recited Act: And whereas another Act was passed in the Ninth Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act for altering and amending 9 G. -l. c. 42. an Act passed in the last Session of Parliament, intituled 1 An Act ‘ for lighting, cleansing, watching, and otherwise improving the Town ‘ of Ashton-under-Lyne in the County Palatine of Lancaster, and for 1 regulating the Police thereof,’ and also for regulating the Market, and erecting a Market Place within and for the said Town, whereby the Powers of the Commissioners appointed by the said first-recited Act were amended and enlarged : And whereas the said Commissioners have proceeded to carry into execution the several Powers and Authorities vested in them by the said recited Acts, and have raised and expended considerable Sums of Money in lighting, watching, and [Local.] 6 G • cleansing

486 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

cleansing the different Thoroughfares within the said Town, and also in erecting a Town Hall, Public Offices, and Market Place, and Conveniences thereto belonging: And whereas a Charter of Incorporation, bearing Date the Twenty-ninth Day of September One thousand eight hundred and forty-seven, was by Her present Majesty, by and with the Advice of Her Privy Council, granted to the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne, in pursuance of the Provisions contained in an Act passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Seventh \ ear of the Ileign of His late Majesty King William the Fourth and in the 7W.-t. & First Year of the Ileign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act l Vict. c. 78. to amend an Act for the Regulation of Municipal Corporations in England and Wales, which Charter was confirmed by an Act passed ii& 12 Vict, in the last Session of Parliament, intituled An Act to confirm the c. 93. Incorporation of certain Boroughs: And whereas by an Act passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Fifth and Sixth Years of the 5 & t> w. 4. Reign of His late Majesty King William the Fourth, intituled An Act c. 76. to provide for the Regulation of Municipal Corporations in England

and Wales, it was provided that the Trustees under any Act or Acts of Parliament for paving, lighting, cleansing, watching, regulating, supplying with Water, and improving any Borough or Part of any Borough might (if not beneficially interested), at a Meeting to be called for the Purpose, transfer all the Powers vested in them under any such Act or Acts to the Body Corporate of such Borough, and the said Body Corporate should thenceforth be Trustee for executing by the Council of such Borough the Powers and Provisions of any such Act or Acts of Parliament, and the Members of the said Council should have the same Powers and be subject to the same Duties as if their Names had been originally inserted in such Act or Acts, or as if they had been elected under the Provisions of such Act or Acts as such Trustees respectively : And whereas a Special General Meeting of the Commissioners appointed for carrying into execution the said first and second recited Acts was duly convened and held on the Seventh Day of February One thousand eight hundred and forty-eight, at which it was determined to transfer to the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne (as the Body Corporate thereof) all the Powers and Property vested in the said Commissioners by virtue of the said first and second recited Acts: And whereas by an Indenture or Deed of Transfer, dated the said Seventh Day of February One thousand eight hundred and forty-eight, all the Powers by the said first and second recited Acts or either of them vested in the Commissioners for putting and carrying into execution the same Acts, and all and every the several Plots of Land, Market Place, Town Hall, Buildings, Lands, Messuages, and Hereditaments, and Real and Personal Estate whatsoever, of the said Commissioners, were transferred and assigned unto the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the said Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne, and their Successors, to the Intent that the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, and their Successors, should thenceforth be the Trustee for executing by the Council of the Borough the several Powers and Provisions of such Acts : And whereas Doubts have arisen as to the Validity of the said Transfer of the Powers and Property conferred on and vested in the said Commissioners by the said first and second recited Acts : And whereas it is expedient that such Doubts should

487

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

be removed, and that the Powers and Property vested in the said Commissioners, and in any Committee appointed out of the Body of the said Commissioners, by virtue of the said first and second recited Acts, should be effectually transferred to and vested in the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne : And whereas the Municipal Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne, as referred to and described in the said recited Charter of Incorporation, comprises certain Parts of the Audenshaiv Division of the Parish of Ashton-under-Lyne not originally included within the Provisions of the said first and second recited Acts, and it would be attended with public Advantage if the Powers and Provisions of this Act were extended over the whole of the said Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne, as referred to and described in the said Charter of Incorporation: And whereas the Powers at present possessed for paving, cleansing, lighting, and otherwise improving the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne have been found defective, and the Market Place is insufficient for the Accommodation of the Inhabitants of the said Borough, and the Powers and Provisions of the said recited Acts recjuire in other respects to be amended and enlarged : And whereas for the aforesaid and other Purposes it is expedient that the said first and second recited Acts should be repealed, and that other and further Powers should be granted in lieu thereof; but these Objects cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the said first and second recited Acts shall from and after the passing of this Act be and the same are hereby repealed.

II. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Conveyances, Assurances, Contracts, Mortgages, Bonds, Engagements, Liabilities, Acts, Deeds, Matters, and Things heretofore made, done, executed, entered into, or undertaken by or with the Commissioners acting under and by virtue of the said first and second recited Acts, or by or with the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the said Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne as Trustee or Trustees for executing the said Acts in pursuance of the Deed of Transfer before recited, and ail Hates, Assessments, and Orders for the Payment of any Money made under and by virtue of the said Acts or either of them, shall be in full Force and Effect, and may be enforced, levied, and recovered by or against the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses as the Corporation of the said Borough in the same Manner as if such Conveyances, Assurances, Contracts, Mortgages, Bonds, Engagements, Liabilities, Acts, Deeds, Matters, and Things had been respectively made, done, executed, entered into, incurred, or undertaken, and as if such several Rates, Assessments, and Sums of Money had respectively been made, ordered, and become due, under and by virtue of this Act.

III. And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act all the Messuages, Lands, Buildings, Tenements, and Hereditaments, of whatsoever Tenure or Description, and also all the Monies, Debts, Deeds, Books, Writings, and Personal Estate whatsoever, belonging to

or

First and Second recited Acts repealed.

Existing Contracts and Liabilities under recited Acts reserved.

Vesting Property of Commissioners in Corporation.

0J7 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

or vested in, or which may be held to belong to or to be vested in, the Commissioners appointed by and acting under the said first and second recited Acts, shall be and the same are hereby vested in the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the said Borough; and all Persons who shall then owe or be subject to any Liability, whether immediate or future, to pay any Monies to the said Commissioners, shall pay the same, with all Interest (if any) due or to accrue due thereon, to the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, for the Purposes of this Act.

Limits of

IV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall extend to and include

Act- so much and such Part of the Parish of As/iton-under-Lyne as consists

of and is known by the Name of " The Ashton Town's Division otherwise Ashton Town," being the District comprehended within the Boundary of the Parliamentary Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne (excepting such Part thereof as is comprised within the Limits of an Act passed in the Ninth Year of the lteign of His late Majesty King George the Fourth, for lighting, watching, and otherwise improving the Town of Stalybridge), and also so much and such Part of the Audenshaw Division of the said Parish as lies between the said Parliamentary Borough and the County of Chester, which extended Limits are described in the said Charter of Incorporation, and shall for the Purposes of this Act be deemed and taken to be the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyiie; and all the Powers, Provisions, and Authorities in this Act contained shall extend to and be executed and put in force within such Limits or Boundaries.

Council to V. And be it enacted, That all the Powers, Privileges, and Audio-carry this rities hereby conferred upon the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of Act into t|,e borough shall be held, exercised, and enjoyed by the Council ixetu ion, Bie said Borough for the Time being.

and to ap-

VI. And be it enacted, That for the more conveniently carrying

point Com- this Act into execution it shall be lawful for the Council of the said that Purpose Borough, and they are hereby empowered to appoint out of their Body from Time to Time One or more Committee or Committees, consisting of such Number of Persons as they may think fit, to manage, transact, and carry into effect all or any of the Matters and Purposes which the said Council are hereby directed or authorized to do, execute, or perform; which Committee or Committees shall have such or so many of the Powers and Authorities by this Act given to the said Council as the said Council shall think fit or proper to delegate to such Committee or Committees.

Contracts

VII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mayor, may be en- Aldermen, and Burgesses from Time to Time to contract and agree tcred into, with any Person or Corporation for performing any of the Works by this Act authorized to be made or executed, and all Contracts so to be entered into shall be reduced into Writing, and sealed with the Common Seal of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, and the same shall be signed by the Person or sealed with the Common Seal of the Corporation contracting to perform such Works, and shall specify the several Works to be done, and the Prices to be paid for the same, and

489

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

the Time when such Works shall be done and completed, and the Penalties to be suffered in case of Nonperformance thereof, and a Copy of such Contract shall be entered in a Book to be kept by the Town Clerk for that Purpose; and it shall be lawful for the Mayor,

Aldermen, and Burgesses to take such Bond or other Security from every Contractor for the due Performance of his Contract as they shall think sufficient; and the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses may cause the Works to be done in pursuance of such Contract to be inspected by such Persons as they shall from Time to Time appoint; and in case the same shall not be well and sufficiently performed according to the true Intent and Meaning of such Contract, or shall not be finished and completed at or within the Time to be by any such Contract limited for completing the same, the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses may have and pursue all the Remedies provided by the said Contract, and may cause any Action at Law or Suit in Equity to be brought in their Name against the Party so contracting and neglecting to perform such Contract, and his Sureties (if any), for Fulfilment of such Contract, and for any Injury suffered or sustained by the Want of due Performance thereof; and upon proving the Execution of the Contract, and Security (if any), and the Nonperformance thereof, the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall be entitled to and shall recover such Penalty or Damage as may be awarded, with full Costs of Suit.

VIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for Power to the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses to compound and agree with compound any Person or Corporation who shall have entered into any such Con- Jjf^omracts tract or Security for the Performance thereof in pursuance or under

the Authority of this Act, or against whom any Action or Suit shall be brought for any Penalty contained in such Contract or Security, or for or on account of any Breach or Nonperformance of any such Contract or Security, for such Sums of Money or other Recompence as the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall think proper.

IX. And be it enacted, That, except where a different Mode of Service of Service is provided, any Notice which by this Act may be required Notices, to be given to any Person may lawfully be served by delivering the same to such Person at his Place of Residence or Business, or by affixing or leaving the same on or at his usual or last known Place of Residence or Business.

X. And be it enacted, That in all legal Proceedings under this Release of Act it shall be lawful for the Town Clerk, by the Order of the Witnesses. Council, to execute general or other Releases for the Purpose of qualifying any Person in the Service of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, or of the Council, to give Evidence as a Witness, and every such Release shall be under the Hand of the Town Clerk.

XI. And be it enacted, That the several Provisions of the Com- Certain Pro-rnissioners Clauses Act, 184<7, with respect to the Appointment and visions of Accountability of the Officers of the Commissioners, and with respect ® nAn'0* to the Accounts to be kept by the Commissioners, and with respect to porate^wiVu the making of Bye Laws, and with respect to giving Notices and this Act.
