XIII. And be it enacted, That the Towns Improvement Clauses c. 34. incor- 1847, the Town Police Clauses Act, 1847, and the Markets t'hi^Act"111' an(l Fail's Clauses Act, 1847, shall, except in so far as herein varied or otherwise provided for, be incorporated with and form Part of this Act.

XIV. And be it enacted, That nothing contained herein, or in any of the Acts incorporated herewith, shall authorize the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses to acquire any Lands compulsorily, nor to construct any new Cisterns, Pumps, Conduits, or other Waterworks for the gratuitous Supply of Water to the Inhabitants within the Borough, except in substitution for existing public Cisterns, Pumps, Wells, Conduits, and other Waterworks (if any) so used at the Time of the passing of this Act.

Power to

XV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mayor, erect Lamps. Aldermen, and Burgesses from Time to Time to provide such Lamps, Lamp Irons, and Lamp Posts as they shall judge necessary, and to cause the same to be set up in the Streets and other public Places in the said Borough, or to be affixed upon or against the Walls or Palisadoes of all or any of the several Houses or Buildings, with the Consent of the Owners of such Houses or Buildings, or upon or against any other Walls, or in or upon such other Places within the said Borough, and to be altered or taken down and renewed in such Manner as they shall think fit, and to cause such Lamps or any of them to be kept lighted, either with Gas, Oil, or otherwise, at such Times as to the said Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses shall seem necessary or proper for the well and sufficiently lighting of the said Borough.

Power to

XVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mayor, make Gas. Aldermen, and Burgesses (in case they shall deem it expedient to light the said Borough with Gas without contracting for the same) to set up and establish a Manufactory of Gas, with all necessary Works and Apparatus requisite for the same, and to purchase from any Person or Corporation who shall be willing to sell the same any

Buildings,

Lands not to be taken without Consent.

401

12° & 13° VICTOR IiE, Cop.xxxv.

Buildings, Lands, Tenements, or Hereditaments whatsoever within the said Borough, or within any Part of the said Parish of Ashton-under-Lyne near or contiguous to the said Borough, not exceeding One Statute Acre, for the Purpose of erecting Works and Apparatus for the Manufacture of Gas for the Purpose of lighting the said Borough, but not for manufacturing or preparing Gas for Sale, or with any Power to sell the Gas so manufactured or prepared.

XVII. And be it enacted, That the Provisions of the Gasworks Certain Pro-Clauses Act, 1S47, with respect to the breaking up of Streets for the visions of Purpose of laying Pipes, and with respect to the Provision for c°]&5 Vn'^' guarding against fouling Water or other Nuisance from the Gas, and n'orated with with respect to Waste or Misuse of the Gas, or Injury to the Pipes this Act. and other Works, shall, in so far as such Provisions are applicable to

Cases where Gas is not manufactured for Sale or private Consumption, be incorporated with this Act.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That every Person who shall wilfully Penalty for or maliciously break, throw down, or otherwise damage any Lamp, breaking Lamp Iron, or Lamp Post already put up or that shall be put up fu‘J[nps Wll‘ for the Purpose of lighting any Part of the said Borough, or shall wilfully extinguish the Light of any such Lamp, shall for every such Offence be liable to a Penalty not exceeding Forty Shillings, in addition to the Amount of Damage done.

XIX. And be it enacted, That if any Person shall carelessly or Damages for accidentally break, throw down, or damage any such Lamp, Lamp La,nPs Iron, or Lamp Post, and shall not, upon Demand, make Satisfaction t®|" acci" for the Damage done thereto, such Person shall, upon Conviction

thereof before any Justice of the Peace, pay the Amount of such Damage as the same shall be ascertained by such Justice, and the same may be recovered in the same Manner as any Penalties under this Act.

XX. And be it enacted, That if any Street or Part of a Street, Streets to whether the same be a public Highway or not, and whether the same be sewered, be already or shall at any Time hereafter be laid out and opened to [f^ned ’ and the Public within the saitl Borough, be not or shall not be sufficiently flagged.’ sewered, drained, levelled, flagged, paved, and otherwise completed

to the Satisfaction of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, it shall be lawful for the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses at any Time, and from Time to Time after the passing of this Act, notwithstanding the Provisions of the Towns Improvement Clauses Act, 1847, incorporated herewith, to order that any such Street or Part thereof shall be freed from Obstruction, sewered, drained, levelled, flagged, paved, and otherwise completed according to such Plan, on such Level, in such Manner, of such Materials, and within such Time as they shall direct, and thereupon the respective Owners of the Buildings and Lands lying alongside of or adjoining to such Street or Part of a Street (notwithstanding any Part of such Street may include, pass over, lie opposite, or be adjacent to any Cross or other Street, or any Part thereof,) shall, according to such Plan, on such Level, of such Materials, within such Time, and in such Manner as shall be expressed in such Order, at their respective Charges and Expenses, remove all

Obstructions,

492 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

Obstructions, and well and sufficiently sewer, drain, level, flag, pave, and otherwise complete such Street, so far as the same extends along their respective Buildings or Lands; and in the event of such Owners or any of them making default in the due Execution of such Work within such Time as aforesaid, the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses may cause such Work to he executed, and may recover the Expense incurred by them in respect thereof in the Manner directed by the Provisions of the Towns improvement Clauses Act, 1847, with respect to ensuring the Execution of the Works by that or the special Act required to he done by the Owners or Occupiers of Houses or Lands, so far as such Provisions apply to the Recovery of the Expense of Works required to be done by Owners, and except in so far as such Provisions authorize the Recovery of such Expense by Drainage Rates.

Drainage

XXI. And be it enacted, That the Expense of making, maintaining,

of Houses, repairing, and cleansing the Drains or Pipes authorized by the Towns Improvement Clauses Act, 1847, for the Drainage of Houses and Buildings, and their Areas, Water-closets, Privies, and Offices, shall be defrayed by the Owners of such Houses and Buildings, instead of by Drainage Rates; and in the event of such Owners or any of them making default in the Execution of such Work, the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses may cause such Work to be executed, and may recover the Expense incurred by them in respect thereof in the Manner directed by the Provisions of the Towns Improvement Clauses Act, 1847, with respect to ensuring the Execution of the Works by that or the special Act required to be done by the Owners or Occupiers of Houses or Lands, so far as such Provisions apply to the Recovery of the Expense of W orks required to be done by Owners, and except in so far as such Provisions authorize the Recovery of such Expense by Drainage Rates.

Drains not

XXII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall U) flow into authorize any Drainage into any Canal within the Limits of this Act.

Expenses

XXIII. And be it enacted, That in case the Owner of any unoccu-may be re- pied or unproductive Land or Ground adjoining to any Street which o'cojpfers m 01 an)' *>al t " Itich shall be ordered by the Mayor, Aldermen, and of Houses in Burgesses to be sewered, drained, levelled, flagged, or paved, shall the Hear of also be the Owner of any Houses or Buildings at the Rear of and unoccupied adjoining such unoccupied or unproductive Land or Ground, the l/Jionuiiv' to OccuP'ers of such Houses or Buildings shall be liable to the Payment of all the Charges and Expenses of removing Obstructions, and sewering, draining, levelling, flagging, paving, and otherwise completing the Street or Part thereof comprised in such Order, in the same Manner, to the same Extent, and with the same Right of Relief against such Owner as if such Houses and Buildings adjoined such Street or Part of a Street, and as if such Charges and Expenses had been hereby imposed upon such Owner or the Owner of such Houses and Buildings.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That when and so soon as any Street already made or hereafter to be made within the said Borough shall have been sewered, drained, levelled, flagged, paved, and otherwise completed to the Satisfaction of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses,

then the same Owner.

Streets may he declared Highways.

12" & 13" VICTORIA, 493

then and in each such Case it shall be lawful for the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, and they are hereby required, to certify and declare the same to be a public Highway, and after such Certificate and Declaration the same shall be a public Highway; and the same, together with the Main Sewer under the same, shall be for ever afterwards repaired and repairable as such out of the Highway Rate herein-after provided; and every such Certificate and Declaration shall be recorded in the Books of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses.

XXV. And be it enacted, That for the Purpose of maintaining Providing and repairing the present Highways within the Borough when so for Highway sewered, drained, levelled, flagged, paved, and otherwise completed Jte‘ to the Satisfaction of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses as aforesaid, and such of the present and future Streets as shall from Time to Time be declared public Highways as aforesaid, and the Main Sewers under the same, it shall be lawful for the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, when and so often as they shall think necessary, to order and direct a Rate or Assessment, to be called the " Highway Rate," to be made and levied upon the Occupiers of all Messuages, Houses, Shops,

Workshops, Offices, Counting-houses, Warehouses, Cellars, Vaults, Manufactories, Foundries, Breweries, Mills, Stables, Coach-houses,

Collieries, Canals, Railways, Gasworks, Waterworks, Buildings, Erections, Yards, Gardens, Curtilages, Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments whatsoever already built, erected, or situate, or which shall hereafter be built, erected, or situate, within the said Borough, according to the full net annual Value of the same respectively (excepting as herein-after mentioned), anything contained herein or in any other Act to the contrary notwithstanding j provided that the said Rate hereby authorized to be made as aforesaid, called the Highway Rate, shall not in any One Year exceed the Sum of One Shilling in the Pound upon such annual Value.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That nothing in the Towns Improve- Council ment Clauses Act, 1847, incorporated herewith, contained, shall not to levy authorize the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses to levy any Drainage f)ewer or Rates, special Sewer Rates, general Sewer Rates, or Rates for private Rates/' Improvement Expenses, except in so far as specially granted by this Act, or to recover the Expense of making or maintaining Streets,

Sewers, or House Drains, so far as provided for herein, otherwise than is hereby prescribed.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That the Mayor, Aldermen, and As to Burgesses shall not be bound to make any Compensation on account Removal of of the Removal or Alteration of any Obstructions or Projections 0bstructions which may have been erected or placed against or in front of any t!Tpassin0r House or Building, or in or across any Street, before the passing of of Act. this Act, if the same shall have been so erected or placed since the passing of the said first-recited Act.

XXVIII. And whereas a Market Place within the said Borough Power to has for some Time been completed and used by the Public, and it is extend and expedient that the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses should have Market Power to extend the same, and to erect additional Market Places, Places, a-c. [Local.] 6 I and

494

Power to lease Market Dues.

Penalty on Sale of unsound Meat.

Power to Council to levy Improvement Rates.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

and also to complete and extend the Town Hall and other public Buildings : Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses out of the Monies to be raised by them under the Authority of this Act to complete and, if they think necessary, extend the Town Hall and other public Buildings and Erections connected therewith, as also to extend the present Market Place of the Borough, and, if they think fit, to erect and maintain an additional Market Place or Market Places with all necessary Conveniences in connexion therewith, and from Time to Time to remove, enlarge, and alter the Form, Situation, and Extent of the said Market Places or any of them, and to make Conduits, Reservoirs, and Cisterns within or near the said Market Places, and to lay down all necessary Pipes from the same in and through the Streets for conveying Water for the Supply of the said Market Places, and to levy from all Persons using the said present, extended, or additional Market Places any Stallages, Rents, and Tolls not exceeding those specified in the Schedule hereto annexed: Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall give to the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses the Power of erecting Markets or taking Tolls within any Part of the Audenshaw Division lying within the Borough as aforesaid; and the Right of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses to erect Markets and take Tolls, and all the Clauses contained herein and incorporated herewith relating to Markets, Tolls, and Fairs shall extend to and include only so much of the Parish of Ashton-under-Lyne as consists of and is known by the Name of the Ashton Town's Division otherwise Ashton Town as aforesaid.

XXIX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses to lease the whole or any of the Stalls, Standings, or other Places of Sale in the said Market Places, and the whole or any Part of the Stallages, Rents, and Tolls which may arise or become due from or in respect of the said Markets, Fairs, and Market Places, to any Person who shall be willing to take the same, either by public Auction or private Contract, for such Time not exceeding Three Years at any one Time, at such Rent, upon such Perms and Conditions, and with such Security, as shall be agreed upon between the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses and the Lessee.

XXX. And be it enacted, That the Provisions of the Towns Improvement Clauses Act, 1847, with respect to Slaughter-houses, so far as they relate to the Prevention of the Sale of Meat unfit for the Food of Man, shall extend and apply to all unsound or unwholesome Meat and to all Places where the same may be found, whether in the said Market Places or in other Houses, or in the Possession of Hawkers.

XXXI. And, in order to raise Money for carrying into execution the Purposes of this Act, so far as not otherwise provided for herein or in the Acts incorporated herewith, be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, when and so often as they shall think necessary, to order and direct a Rate or Rates, Assessment or Assessments, to be made and levied upon the Occupiers of all Messuages, Houses, Shops, Workshops, Offices,

495

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

Counting-houses, Warehouses, Cellars, Vaults, Manufactories, Foundries, Breweries, Mills, Stables, Coach-houses, Collieries, Canals, Railways, Gasworks, Waterworks, Buildings, Erections, Yards, Gardens, Curtilages, Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments whatsoever already built, erected, or situate, or which shall hereafter be built, erected, or situate, within the said Borough (except as herein-after mentioned), according to the full net annual Value of the same respectively (except as also herein-after mentioned), anything contained herein or in any other Act to the contrary notwithstanding: Provided always, that such Rates and Assessments shall not exceed in any One Year the Sum of One Shilling in the Pound upon such annual Value, in addition to any other Rates which the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses are or may be authorized to levy by this or any other Act.

XXXII. And be it enacted, That for the Purpose of any Rate to be made or levied under the Provisions of this Act, all Lands covered with Water and used as a Canal and any Towing Path to the same, and all Lands used as a Railway constructed under the Powers of any Act of Parliament for public Conveyance, shall be assessed and liable in the Proportion of One Fourth Part only of the net annual Value of such Lands respectively: Provided nevertheless, that all Lands and Buildings of whatever Description, whether belonging to Railway or Canal Companies or not, shall be assessed and liable to the several Rates leviable under this Act according to the full net annual Value thereof respectively, excepting only Lands forming the Lines of such Railways, Canals, and Towing Paths as aforesaid, and the Sheds covering the same or the Platforms connected therewith; and provided also, that if during the present or any future Session of Parliament any public or general Act shall pass for defining the Mode of assessing and rating Railways or Canals for parochial or local Purposes, the Provisions of which public or general Act shall be at variance with the Provisions relative to the Assessment and rating of Railways and Canals contained in this Act, then and in such Case from and after the passing of such public or general Act all Railways and Canals assessable and rateable according to the Provisions of this Act shall cease to be so assessable and rateable, and shall thenceforth become assessable and rateable in accordance with the Provisions of and on the Principles and in the Proportions specified in such public or general Act.

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That where the yearly Rent of the rateable Property occupied by any Tenant shall not exceed Five Pounds, the Owner of such Property shall be rated to and shall pay the several Rates by this Act authorized instead of the Occupier thereof, and where such yearly Rent shall exceed Five Pounds the Occupier shall be rated to and shall pay the said Rates.

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That where the full net annual Value of the rateable Property occupied by any Tenant shall be less than Ten Pounds, it shall be lawful to the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses from lime to Time to compound with the Owner of such Property for any of the Rates payable in respect thereof at such Sum as they shall

Rating of Railways and Canals.

Owners of Houses under the Value of .5/. to pay Rates instead of Occupiers.

Owners of Houses under the Value of 10/. tnay compound for R ates.

41)(> 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

shall think fit, and the Payment of the Sum so compounded for shall operate in all respects in the same Manner as Payment of the Rates in respect of which such Composition may have been made.

Additional XXXV. And, in addition to the Exemptions from Rates provided Exemption for ag aforesaid, be it enacted, That no Rate or Assessment other from Rates. tj,an t|le Highway Rate shall be made in pursuance of this Act upon any Person or Corporation in respect of his or their being the Occupier or Owner of any Lands, Houses, Buildings, or Hereditaments whatsoever situate at a Distance exceeding Two hundred Yards from any Street or Part of a Street within the Borough, which Street or Part of a Street shall be lighted and watched by the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses.

XXXVI. And be it enacted, That in the event of any of the

quashed. Rates or Assessments hereby authorized being quashed in manner

make nel- herein-before provided for, it shall be lawful to the Mayor, Aldermen,

Kate. and Burgesses forthwith to make and levy a new Rate or Assess-

ment in the same Manner as if the Rate or Assessment so quashed had never been made, and such new Rate or Assessment shall be held to have been made of the same Date as the Rate or Assessment so quashed.

Power to

XXXVII. And whereas the Commissioners appointed by the said borrow first and second recited Acts were thereby empowered to borrow any

Money. Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole at any one Time

the Sum of Ten thousand Pounds : And whereas the said Commissioners for the Execution of the Purposes of the said Acts have been obliged to borrow, in addition to the said Sum of Ten thousand Pounds, a Sum of One thousand six hundred Pounds: And whereas the Expenses of obtaining the said Charter of Incorporation are still unpaid : Be it enacted, That for the Purpose of enabling the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses to defray the Expenses attending the obtaining of this Act, and to pay off and discharge the said Sums of Ten thousand Pounds and One thousand six hundred Pounds, and the Expense of the said Charter, and to carry into effect the several other Purposes of this Act, it shall be lawful for them from Time to Time to borrow and take up at Interest, on the Credit of the whole or such Parts as they may think fit of the several Rates, Assessments, Stallages, Rents, and Tolls by this Act granted (excepting the Highway Rate), and of the Borough Rate and Borough Fund, and of the Market Places, Town Hall, and other Hereditaments, Premises, and Property whatsoever vested in or belonging to the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, any Sum or Sums of Money which they may deem necessary, the Sums so borrowed and owing at any one Time not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Twenty thousand Pounds; and for securing the Repayment of the Monies so to be borrowed, with Interest, the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses may release, mortgage, and assign in security the whole or such Parts as they may think fit of the several Rates, Assessments, Stallages, Rents, and Tolls by this Act granted (excepting as aforesaid), and of the Borough Rate and Borough Fund, and of the Market Places, Town Hall, and other Hereditaments, Premises, and Property whatsoever vested in or

belonging

407

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Gy).xxxv.

belonging to the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, to the Person who shall advance or lend such Money, or his Trustee, as a Security for the Repayment of the Money so borrowed, together with Interest for the same: Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall be held to alter, affect, or diminish any Security or Mortgage granted for Money borrowed under the Authority of the Acts first and second before recited, but that the same, so long as they subsist, shall remain good, valid, and effectual, and shall have Priority and be preferable to any Securities or Mortgages which shall be granted by virtue of this Act.

XXXVIII. And be it enacted, That the Provisions of the Commissioners Clauses Act, 1847, with respect to the Mortgages to be executed by the Commissioners, shall (except in so far as relates to the Appropriation and Investment of a Sinking Fund for paying off Monies borrowed) be incorporated with this Act; and that the Powers therein contained of borrowing Money, and charging the Rates and other Property therewith, in order to pay off and discharge previously existing Securities, may from Time to Time be exercised by the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, whether or not such Money can be borrowed at a lower Rate of Interest than such existing Securities shall bear.

XXXIX. And be it enacted, That all Monies whatsoever which shall be levied, borrowed, or otherwise raised by Order of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses in virtue of this Act shall from Time to Time be paid into the Hands of the Treasurer of the Borough, and no Money shall be disbursed or paid by such Treasurer without an Order in Writing of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, signed by Three or more of the Council, and countersigned by the Town Clerk.

XL. And be it enacted, That all Documents which by this Act, or any of the other Acts partially incorporated herewith, may require Authentication by the Signature of the Commissioners or otherwise, shall be sufficiently authenticated by the Common Seal of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, excepting always Summonses, Demands, Notices, Orders for the Execution of Works, Releases to Witnesses, and other such Documents, which shall be sufficiently authenticated by the Signature of the Town Clerk.

XLI. And be it enacted, That all Rate Books and all Entries therein, and all Registers and Books of Proceedings, and other Books whatsoever, made and kept by Order of the Commissioners appointed by the said first and second recited Acts, or of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses as Trustees for executing the said Acts, or of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses under the Powers or for the Purposes of this Act, shall be admitted as Evidence in all Courts and by all Judges, Justices, and others.

XLII. And be it enacted, That the Proprietors of all Reservoirs within the Borough shall, on Notice from the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, well and sufficiently rail and fence off the same to such [Local.] 6 K Height

Certain Provisions of 10 & 11 Vict, c. 16 relating to Mortgages incorporated with this Act.

Treasurer to receive and pay Money by Order of Council.

Authentication of Documents.

Books to be Evidence.

Reservoirs to be fenced.

498

Expense of extinguishing Fires.

Houses not to be built in close Courts.

Penalty for using Dog Carts.

Penalty on discharging Smoke in Streets.

Penalty on selling Goods, &c. by Auction on Streets, &c.

As to driving Two Carts together.

Application of Damages and Penalties.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cop.xxxv.

Height (not exceeding Six Feet) on all Sides thereof as may be required by the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, and in such Manner as shall be sufficient for the Safety of the Public and the Prevention of Accidents.

XLIII. And be it enacted, That the Provisions contained in the Town Police Clauses Act, 1847, as to the Recovery of the Expenses incurred in sending Firemen, Engines, and Appurtenances to extinguish Fires beyond the Limits of the special Act, and of a reasonable Charge for the Attendance and Use of such Firemen, Engines, and Appurtenances, from the Owners of the Lands or Buildings where such Fires shall have happened, and as to determining the Amount of such Expenses and Charge, shall extend and apply to all Cases of Fire, whether within or without the Limits of this Act.

XLIV. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful to build any House in any Court, which Court shall not be at least Eight Yards wide at all Points, and the Passage or Entrance into which Court shall not be at least Six Feet wide and Eight Feet in Height from the Ground for the whole Length of such Passage or Entrance.

XLV. And be it enacted, That every Person who shall use any Dog for the Purpose of drawing or helping to draw any Cart, Carriage, Truck, or Barrow shall be liable to a Penalty not exceeding Forty Shillings for the First Offence, and not exceeding Five Pounds for the Second or any following Offence.

XLVI. And be it enacted, That if any Person shall discharge any Smoke or Steam from any Building (otherwise than from the Top of the same) into any Street within the said Borough, the Person so offending shall for every such Offence forfeit and pay any Sum not exceeding Forty Shillings.

XLVII. And be it enacted, That if any Person shall sell or assist in selling by Auction any Goods, Wares, Merchandise, or other Effects whatsoever upon any Street or Footway within the Borough, without Authority in Writing from the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, he shall forfeit and pay for every such Offence any Sum not exceeding Forty Shillings.

XLVIII. And be it enacted, That no Person shall be liable to any Penalty, under the said Provisions hereby incorporated with this Act, for driving Two Carts or Waggons without having the Halter of the Horse in the last Cart or Waggon fastened to the Back of the first Cart or Waggon, provided such Person shall have a Chain or Rope, securely fastened and not exceeding Six Feet in Length, from the Shaft of the last Cart or Waggon to the Back of the first Cart or Waggon.

XLIX. And be it enacted, That all Damages, Penalties, Fees, and other Payments of which the Application is not otherwise specially directed in this Act (excepting any Penalties which may be imposed upon the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses themselves, or their Officers,)

499

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

Officers,) shall be paid over to the Treasurer of the Borough on account of the Borough Fund, instead of being applied in the Manner provided by the Towns Improvement Clauses Act, 184-7, or the Act therein referred to.

L. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be held to alter, diminish, or affect any of the Powers, Privileges, and Authorities vested in the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses by or in pursuance of any of the Acts of Parliament now in force, or which may be hereafter enacted in relation to Municipal Corporations, or by or in pursuance of the aforesaid Charter of Incorporation; and, except in so far as herein otherwise provided, the said Powers, Privileges, and Authorities shall extend and apply to the Objects and Purposes of this Act, and may be exercised in the Execution of or otherwise in relation to such Purposes.

LI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses from Time to Time to make such Bye Laws as they may consider necessary for carrying into effect the several Purposes for which by this Act, or any of the Acts wholly or partially incorporated herewith, they are empowered to make Bye Laws; and it shall be sufficient Allowance or Confirmation of any Bye Laws which may be made in virtue hereof, or of any of the Acts incorporated herewith, if the same be approved under the Hand of One of Her Majesty's Principal Secretaries of State; and a written or printed Copy of such Bye Laws, authenticated by the Common Seal of the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, shall be sufficient Evidence of the Existence and due making and Confirmation of such Bye Laws: Provided always, that the Bye Laws now in force within the said Borough shall remain in force until the Bye Laws to be made under this Act be made and approved as aforesaid.

LII. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to prejudice, lessen, or defeat any Right, Interest, Property, Power, Privilege, Franchise, or Authority of the Lord of the Manor of Ashton-under-Lyne for the Time being, but all and every such Rights, Interest, Property, Powers, Privileges, Franchises, and Authorities may be exercised and enjoyed in as full and ample Manner to all Intents and Purposes as the same were exercised and enjoyed before the passing of this Act.

LIII. And be it enacted, That, except as herein or in the said Acts incorporated herewith expressly provided, nothing herein contained shall extend or be construed to prejudice, diminish, alter, or take away any of the Privileges, Rights, Powers, Franchises, Hereditaments, or Authorities of or belonging to or vested in the Manchester, Sheffield, and Lincolnshire Railway Company, or the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company, or the London and North-western Railway Company.

LIV. And be it enacted, That nothing contained herein or in any Act incorporated herewith shall prejudice, affect, diminish, or take away any Rights now vested in the Ashton Millowners Waterworks Company.

Powers

conferred by

Acts.

Reserving Rights of the Lord of the Manor.

Borough not to be exempt from Provisions of

11 & 12 Vict, c. 63.

Interpretation of Terms.

[Short Title.]

Expenses of Act.

[Public Act.]

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxv.

LV. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Borough from the Application thereto of the Provisions of the Public Health Act, 1848, in the Manner therein provided, or of any general Act relating to that Act or to the Subject Matter thereof which may pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament.

LVI. And in addition to the Provisions relating to the Construction of this Act, and of the several Acts partially incorporated herewith, which are contained in the said last-mentioned Acts, be it enacted, That the following Words and Expressions in this Act, and in the said Acts so far as incorporated herewith, shall have the several Meanings hereby assigned to them, unless there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Construction; (that is to say,)

The Word " Borough " shall mean the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne as defined in this Act:

The Expression "the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses" shall mean the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses of the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne incorporated by the foresaid Charter of Incorporation:

The Expression "the Council" shall mean the Council of the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne for the Time being appointed in virtue of the foresaid Charter of Incorporation, or of any Acts relating to Municipal Corporations:

The Expression "the Mayor" shall mean the Mayor for the Time being of the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne .- The Expressions " the Town Clerk" and "Clerk to the Commissioners" shall mean the Town Clerk for the Time being of the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne:

The Expressions " Borough Fund " and " Borough Rate " shall mean respectively the Borough Fund and Borough Rate of the Borough of Ashton-under-Lyne:

The Expression " the Quarter Sessions" shall mean the Quarter Sessions for the County of Lancaster holden at Salford .- The Word " House" shall extend to any Building or Erection of whatever Description:

The Word " Person " shall comprehend the Heirs, Executors, or Assignees of any such Person.

LVII. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments and Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Ashton-under-Lyne Improvement Act, 1849-"

LVIII. And be it enacted, That the Expenses of applying for and obtaining this Act, and in any way incident thereto, shall be defrayed out of the Monies already raised or which shall be hereafter raised by the Mayor, Aldermen, and Burgesses, in preference to any other Payment whatsoever.

LIX. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cup.xxxv.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIAE REGINAE.

Cap. xxxvi.

An Act to extend the Provisions and enlarge the Powers of the Staffordshire Potteries Waterworks Act, 1847.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Tenth and Eleventh Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for supplying with Water certain Parts of the Staffordshire Potteries, and the Town of Newcastle-under-Lyme, and several Townships and Places adjoining or near thereto, whereby a Company was incorporated by the Name of " The Staffordshire Potteries Waterworks Company," and was empowered to supply with Water the District included within the Limits of the said Act: And whereas under and by virtue of the said recited Act the Company were authorized to raise for the Purposes thereof the Sum of Sixty thousand Pounds by the Issue of Shares, and a farther Sum of Twenty thousand Pounds by borrowing on Mortgage or Bond; and the Sum of Forty-five thousand Pounds or thereabouts, Part of such Sum of Sixty thousand Pounds, has been raised and expended by the Company in the Construction of certain Portions of the Works by the said recited Act authorized to be made, but the said Works have not yet been completed: And whereas the several Towns, Hamlets, and Places after mentioned, in or near the Staffordshire Potteries are inadequately supplied with Water; and the Construction of Reservoirs, Aqueducts, and other Works for supplying the same with pure Water would be of [Local.] 6 M great

10 & 11 Vict, c. 204.

506 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Ccip.xxxvi.

great Advantage, Comfort, and Convenience to the Inhabitants thereof: And whereas the Company are willing to carry the said Undertaking into execution; but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Recited Act Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That the incorporated saicj recited Act, and the several Acts incorporated therewith, shall, With this Act. so far ag not inconsistent with or not otherwise provided by this Act, be incorporated with and form Part of this Act.

[Short Title.]

II. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, Deeds, and Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression "The Staffordshire Potteries Waterworks Extension Act, 1849."

Interpreta-

III. And be it enacted, That the Expression " the Company " in this tion- Act shall mean the Staffordshire Potteries Waterworks Company

incorporated by the said recited Act.

Limits of

IV. And be it enacted, That the Limits of this Act shall comprise Act> and include the Towns of Longton and Lane End, and the several

Townships, Hamlets, or Yills of Normacot, Meir, and Blurton, all in the County of Stafford.

Power to raise additional Capital by Creation of new Shares.

V. And whereas the estimated Expense of the Works by this Act authorized, including the Purchase of Lands, is Ten thousand Pounds: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to raise for the Purposes of this Act, in addition to any Sums which they are already authorized to raise, any further Sums of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Ten thousand Pounds, by the Creation of new Shares or Stock of the Company, upon such Terms and in such Manner as may have been or may be agreed upon at any General Meeting of the Company specially called for the Purpose; and the new Shares or Stock created by the Company under the Powers of this Act shall become Part of the general Capital of the Company: Provided always, that in the Creation of such new Shares or Stock, no preference or guaranteed Shares, to have priority over the original Shares, shall be created or issued.

Votes of YI. And be it enacted, That the Proprietors of the new Shares created Proprietors under the Powers of this Act shall be entitled to such Number of Shanr Votes in respect thereof as the Amount of Capital represented by such Shares would entitle them to under the said recited Act.

Calls.

VII. And be it enacted, That One Pound per Share shall be the

greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make on the Holders of Shares created by this Act, and Three Months at least shall be the Interval between successive Calls.

Power to

borrow

Money

VIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond any Sums of Money not exceeding in

the

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxxi.

the whole the Sum of Three thousand three hundred and thirty-three Pounds Six Shillings and Eight-pence; but no Part of such Sum shall be borrowed until the whole of the said Capital of Ten thousand Pounds shall have been subscribed for, and One Half thereof shall have been actually paid up.

IX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages or Bonds made or granted by the Company before the passing of this Act, and which shall be in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall, during the Continuance thereof, have Priority over any Mortgages or Bonds to be made or granted in virtue of this Act.

X. And whereas Plans and Sections describing the Line and Situation of the Reservoir at or near Tunstall in the Parish of Wolstanton, and other intended Works, and the Lands in or through which the same are to be made and maintained, and a Book of Reference containing the Names of the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers of such Lands respectively, have been deposited at the Office of the Clerk of the Peace for the County of Stafford: Be it enacted, That such Plans, Sections, and Book of Reference shall be kept by the said Clerk of the Peace, who shall permit all Persons to inspect the same at all seasonable Times, and shall make out Copies and Extracts therefrom for all Persons requiring the same, on being paid the Sum of One Shilling for every such Inspection, and at the Rate of Sixpence for every One hundred Words copied.

XI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, with the Consent of the Most Noble George Granville Duke and Earl of Sutherland under his Hand and Seal, and subject to the Provisions and Restrictions contained in this and the said recited Act and in the Acts incorporated therewith, from Time to Time to divert and alter the Course of and to take and use the Waters of the several Springs described on the said Plans as intended to be taken for the Purposes of this Act, and situated in or upon Lands belonging to the said Duke and Earl of Sutherland at or near Meir in the Parish of Caverswall, and at or near Nomiacot in the Parish of Stone, and to convey such Waters, by Pipes, Aqueducts, or Conduits, into a Reservoir or Reservoirs constructed or to be constructed at or near Meir and Norniacot aforesaid.

XII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, if they shall think proper so to do, to purchase or take on Lease from the said Duke and Earl of Sutherland all his Estate and Interest of and in a certain Reservoir situated at or near Meir aforesaid, and known by the Name of the Meir Reservoir, and of and in a certain other Reservoir situated at or near Normacot aforesaid, and known by the Name of the Furnace Reservoir, and also of and in the Buildings, Mains, Pipes, and other Works and Property of whatever Kind belonging to or vested in the said Duke and Earl of Sutherland, and now used for the Purpose of supplying with Water the Inhabitants of the said Towns of Longton and Lane End and Places adjoining, and that for such Price and upon such Conditions as shall be mutually

agreed

507

on Mortgage-

Former Mortgages to have Priority.

Plans deposited with the Clerk of the Peace to be open for Inspection.

Company empowered to take certain Springs.

Company may purchase or lease existing Waterworks.

508

Consideration for Purchase or Lease of Waterworks may ha an annual Sum.

Company’ to perforin certain Acts required to be done by North Staffordshire Railway Company.

Power to’ construct Works according to deposited Plans.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxvi.

agreed upon between the said Duke and Earl of Sutherland and the Company.

XIII. And be it enacted, That, if the said Duke and Earl of Sutherland and the Company shall so agree, the Consideration for the Purchase or Lease of the said Springs of Water and the said Reservoirs, Works, and Property may be either solely or in part an annual Sum of Money payable by the Company either in Perpetuity or fora Term of Years; and if the Consideration for the said Springs of Water, Reservoirs, Works, and Property shall be an annual Sum of Money, such annual Sum shall be secured by the Bond of the Company in a sufficient Penalty, and shall constitute a Charge on the Capital of the Company in priority to any Charge to be created on the same Capital under this Act, or under any Act of Parliament relating to the Company which may be hereafter passed; and if at any Time such annual Sums be unpaid for Thirty Days after the Day of Payment thereof, then, in addition to any other Remedy consequent on such Charge, the same shall be recoverable from the Company, with Costs of Suit, by Action of Debt in any of the Superior Courts, or by Distress of the Goods and Chattels of the Company, which Distress may be managed, sold, and disposed of in like Manner, and with the like Powers in relation thereto, as Distresses for Rent reserved on common Demises are or for the Time being may be by Law managed, sold, and disposed of.

XIV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Act, and after the said Duke and Earl of Sutherland shall have been authorized by Parliament to sell or grant a Lease of the Reservoir and Spring of Water referred to in the North Staffordshire Railway Act, 1847, and therein described as being situate in certain Lands of the said Duke and Earl of Sutherland in the Parish of Caverswall, the Company and their Successors and Assigns shall and they are hereby required thenceforth to perform and do all and every the Acts, Matters, and Things directed by the said last-mentionea Act to be performed and done by the North Staffordshire Railway Company with reference to the said Reservoir and Spring of Water; and the Company shall also at all Times and for ever thereafter indemnify the said Railway Company, and their Successors or Assigns, for all Damages, Costs, or Expenses suffered or sustained by them in consequence of the Non-performance of such Acts, Matters, and Things, or any of them.

XV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, subject to the Provisions and Restrictions contained in this and the said recited Act, and in the Acts incorporated therewith, to make and maintain the said Reservoir and other intended Works in the Line and Situation and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans and described in the said Book of Reference, and according to the Levels defined on the said Sections, and to enter upon, take, and use such of the Lands, Streams, and Waters described on the said Plans and in the said Book of Reference as shall be necessary for that Purpose, or to agree for a Lease of such Lands, Streams, and Waters, and to take therefrom such Water as the Company may require for the Purposes of this and the said recited Act.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. x\xvi.

XVI. And be it enacted, That the Works authorized by this Act to be made shall he completed within Five Years from the passing of this Act; and on the Expiration of such Period the Powers granted by this and the said recited Act, and the Acts incorporated therewith, for executing such Works, or otherwise in relation thereto, shall cease to he exercised, except as to so much of the said Works as shall then he completed.

XVII. And be it enacted, That in the event of the Company constructing, under the Authority of this Act, any Works at or near the Meir Tunnel of the said North Staffordshire Railway, such Works shall be constructed under the Superintendence and to the Satisfaction of the Engineer for the Time being of the said North Staffordshire Railway Company; and after such Works shall be completed, all subsequent Alterations and Repairs thereupon shall be made and executed with the Consent, under the Superintendence, and to the Satisfaction of the Engineer of the said Railway Company for the Time being, and all such Works, Alterations, and Repairs shall be made, executed, and completed at the sole Risk of the Company, who shall be liable for all Damages occasioned by such Works, Alterations, and Repairs to any of the Works or Property of the said Railway Company.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That if any Works shall be so constructed by the Company as to impede or interfere with the Traffic upon the said Railway, or if the said Traffic shall be impeded or interfered with in consequence of any Act or Omission of the Company, or any of their Agents, Servants, or Workmen, then the Company shall pay to the said Railway Company, as and by way of ascertained Damages, the Sum of Fifty Pounds for every Hour during which such Impediment or Interruption shall continue; and in default of Payment of the Sum or Sums which may have been ascertained to be due in respect of such Damage, within Seven Days after Demand in Writing made by the Solicitor or Agent of the said Railway Company upon any Clerk or Officer of the Company, the said Railway Company may sue for and recover the same, together with full Costs of Suit, from the Company, by Action of Debt or on the Case in any of Her Majesty's Courts of Record at Westminster.

XIX. And be it enacted, That nothing contained in this Act or in the Acts incorporated therewith shall extend or be deemed or construed to extend to authorize the Company to purchase, take, or use any Land which the said Railway Company have already purchased or are authorized to purchase for the Purposes of their Railway or the Woi’ks connected therewith, without the Consent of the said Railway Company, such Consent to be signified in Writing under the Hand of the Secretary for the Time being of the said Railway Company.

XX. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall extend to prejudice, diminish, alter, or take away any of the Rights, Powers, Privileges, or Authorities vested in the said Railway Company, but all their Rights, Powers, Privileges, and Authorities under their several Acts of Parliament are hereby expressly reserved.

Period for Completion of Works.

Provision as to Works at the Meir Tunnel of the North Staffordshire Railway.

Penalty for impeding Traffic on the Railway.

Lands of Railway Company not to be taken.

Saving Rights of Railway Company.

Same Rates to be taken as in former Act.

within Limits of former Act may be supplied under this Act.

Undertaking not to be exempt from Provisions of 11 & 12 Vict, c. 63.

Expenses of Act.

[Public Act.]

V2° & 13° VI CTO RLE, Cap. xxxvi.

XXI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to demand and receive, for and in respect of any Water supplied under the Provisions of this Act, the same Rates as the Company are by the said recited Act authorized to demand and receive for and in respect of Water supplied under the Provisions of the said recited Act.

XXII. And whereas it may be more convenient and expedient to supply with Water certain Parts of the Districts comprised within the Limits of the said recited Act from the Works authorized by this Act to be constructed: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, if they shall think fit so to do, to supply with Water any of the Places particularly mentioned in or comprised within the Limits of the said recited Act, from and by means of the Works to be constructed under the Authority of this Act, or any Part thereof, and to demand and receive for the Water so supplied the same Rates as they are entitled to demand and receive for any Water to be supplied under the Provisions of this or the said recited Act.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Company from the Provisions of " The Public Health Act, 1848," or of any general Act relating thereto or to the Subject Matter thereof, which may pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That all Costs, Charges, and Expenses incurred preparatory to and in the applying for, obtaining, and passing of this Act shall be paid by the Company out of the first Monies which shall come to their Hands, and in preference to any other Payment whatsoever.

XXV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGINAE.

Cap. xxxvii.

An Act for granting farther Powers to the Conclon Gaslight Company.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Seventh and Eighth Years of the Reign of Her Majesty Queen Victoria, intituled An Act for in- T & 8 Vict. corporating the London Gaslight Company: And whereas by the c-95• said Act the Company were empowered to raise by Loan or Mortgage the Sum of One hundred and fifty thousand Pounds, and the Company have raised such Sum on Loan or Mortgage, and the same is now due and owing: And whereas it is expedient that Power should be granted to the Company to convert the Sum of One hundred and fifty thousand Pounds, borrowed and now due by the Company on Loan or Mortgage, into Capital, by the Creation of Shares bearing a guaranteed Rate of Dividend in preference to the existing Shares in the Company, and that the Money raised by such new Shares be wholly applied in paying off such Amount so due as aforesaid; and that some of the Provisions of the recited Act should be altered and enlarged; but the same cannot be effected without the Aid and Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parlia- Po"'er3 of inent assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the extend d* Powers, Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in the recited this6 Act. l° [Local.'] 6 0 Act,

514

[Short Title.]

Certain Provisions in 8 & 9 Vict, c. 16. extended to this Act.

Power to raise the Money borrowed by Creation of new Shares.

A fixed Dividend to be paid on such new Shares;

but not to exceed 6/. per Cent, per Annum.

Limiting the Amount of Calls in respect of Shares.

Application of Money received for Shares.

1(2° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap.\xxvii.

Act, so far as the same are now in force, and except such of them as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, shall extend to this Act, as fully and effectually as if the same Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act, and the recited Act and this Act shall accordingly be construed and have effect as One Act.

II. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act for any Purpose whatsoever it shall be sufficient to use the Expression, " The London Gaslight Amendment Act, 1849."

III. And be it enacted, That the Clauses and Provisions of the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, with respect to the borrowing of Money by the Company on Mortgage or Bond, and with respect to the Conversion of the borrowed Money into Capital, shall be incorporated with this Act.

IV. And be it enacted, That the Company may raise the whole or any Part of the Sum of One hundred andt fifty thousand Pounds borrowed and now due by the Company by creating new Shares: Provided always, that the Amount which the Company may borrow shall not be by this Act increased.

V. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, with the Authority of a General or Special General Council, to declare that the Holders of such new Shares shall be entitled to a fixed Dividend or Interest of such Amount or at such Rates as shall be determined at such Council, and to be paid in preference to any Dividend to the Holders of any of the then existing preferential or other Shares in the Company, and the Company are hereby authorized to pay such Dividend or Interest accordingly: Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall authorize the Company to fix or pay any larger Amount of Dividend or Interest as aforesaid on such new Shares than after the Rate of Six Pounds per Centum per Annum; provided also, that any such fixed Dividend or Interest shall not be paid in preference to any Dividend on any Class of preferential Shares without the Consent of Three Fifths in Value of the Holders of the Shares of such Class.

VI. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the Company to call up or receive at any One Time or in any One Year upon any such new Shares a larger Sum or Amount than may be required to pay off and discharge the Debts for the Time being of the Company.

VII. And to the end that the whole of the Money so raised and received by the Creation of such new Shares may be duly applied, be it enacted, That the Company shall cause a separate and distinct Account to be kept in the Books of the Company of the Money from Time to Time raised and received in respect of such new Shares, and of the Application of the same, and such Money shall be paid solely in discharge of the Debts for the Time being of the Company, and on such Payment the Power of the Company for borrowing or

reborrowing

12° & 13° VICTORIA Cap. xxxvii.

reborrowing Money shall to the Extent of such Payment absolutely cease and determine.

VIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That if under the Provision herein contained Shares are created of a nominal Amount less than Fifty Pounds, such new Shares shall confer on the respective Holders thereof such Privileges of voting at Councils, and such Qualifications for Governor, Deputy Governor, Director, and Auditor, and such other Privileges as are conferred by now existing Shares in the Capital: Provided always, that for the Purpose of ascertaining such Privileges conferred by so many of such new Shares as are holden by the same Person or Persons the aggregate nominal Amount of such new Shares so holden shall be deemed to consist of so many Shares in the Capital and if such aggregate nominal Amount were the nominal Amount or the aggregate nominal Amount of One or more Share or Shares of Fifty Pounds each so holden; provided also, that if the aggregate nominal Amount of such new Shares so holden be less than Fifty Pounds the same shall not confer any such Privilege: Provided also, that if the aggregate nominal Amount of such new Shares so holden be greater than Fifty Pounds, but be not a Multiple of Fifty Pounds, the Excess of such nominal Amount over the highest Multiple of Fifty Pounds therein shall not confer any such Privilege; provided also, that the Holders of such new Shares respectively shall not be entitled to any Dividends or Interest except upon or in respect of the Amount for the Time being actually paid up thereon.

IX. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time to purchase any Shares of the Company, and the same when so purchased shall be cancelled, to the Intent that all Eight and Interest in the same may merge in the Company.

X. And be it enacted, That so much of the recited Act as enacts that the Governor and Deputy Governor of the Company should respectively hold their Offices for Life, and that whenever the Office of Governor or Deputy Governor should become vacant the Board of Directors should within One Calendar Month cause to be summoned a Special General Council for the Purpose of electing his Successor, and the Shareholders present at such Special General Council, either previously or by Proxy, should elect a Person duly qualified as thereinafter provided to supply his Place, and that no Person should be qualified to be elected Governor or Deputy Governor unless at the Period of Election he should be possessed of One hundred Shares at the least in the Capital of the Company, or of being elected a Director unless he should at the Period of Election be possessed of Fifty Shares at the least in the Capital of the Company, and that if the Governor, Deputy Governor, or any Director of the Company should become a Director or Officer of any other Company manufacturing and supplying Gas within the Bills of Mortality or within Ten Miles thereof, then the Office of such Governor, Deputy Governor, or Director should become vacant, is hereby repealed, and such of the Clauses and Provisions of the recited Act as are repugnant to or inconsistent with or otherwise provided for by this Act are hereby also repealed: Provided always, that the present Goveftior and Deputy

Governor

Expenses of

XIV. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses Act. incident to and attending the obtaining and passing of this Act shall be paid and discharged by the Company in preference to all other Payments whatsoever.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VIC TORI. E REGINA.

Cap. xxxviii.

An Act to enable the Cockermouth and Workington Railway Company to make a Branch Railway to Bridgefoot; and for amending the Act relating to their Railway.

[26th June 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament

hfld in the Eightli and Ninth Years of the Reign of Her 8 4 9 Vict, piesent Majesty Queen Victoria, intituled An Act for c-,20-making a Railway from the Market Town of Cockermouth to the Port and Harbour of Workington in the County of Cumberland:

And whereas it is expedient that the Cockermouth and Workington Railway Company should be authorized to make a Branch Railway from the Cockermouth and Workington Railway in the Township of Greysouthen in the Parish of Brigham in the County of Cumberland to Bridgefoot in the said Township of Greysouthen : And whereas under and by virtue of the said Act the said Company were authorized to raise by the Issue of Shares as therein mentioned the Sum of Eighty thousand Pounds, and were also authorized to borrow on Mortgage or Bond the further Sum of Twenty-six thousand six hundred [Local.] 6 P and

518

Powers of recited Act extended to this Act.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Ca/lxxxviii.

and sixty-six Pounds, for the Purposes of the said Act, and the said Company have accordingly issued Shares to the Amount of Eighty thousand Pounds, and of which the Sum of Seventy-six thousand Pounds has been received, and have also raised on Mortgage or Bond the whole of the said Sum of Twenty-six thousand six hundred and sixty-six Pounds, and the whole of the said Sums of Seventy-six thousand Pounds and Twenty-six thousand six hundred and sixty-six Pounds have been expended and applied upon the Purposes of the said Act: And whereas it is expedient that the said Company should be authorized and empowered to raise an additional Sum of Money to carry into effect the Works authorized by the said recited Act, and that some of the Powers and Provisions of the said recited Act should be amended and enlarged; but the Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in the said recited Act, save so far as they are varied by or are inconsistent with " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," and " The Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," and the said "Lands Clauses Consolidation Act," and "The Railways Clauses Consolidation Act," except such of them as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, shall extend to this Act, and to the several Purposes and Things hereby authorized to be done, so far as the same Provisions, Matters, and Things are applicable thereto, as fully and effectually as if the same were repeated and re-enacted in this Act in reference to such Purposes and Things.

II. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act for any Purposes whatsoever it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Cockermouth and Workington Railway Act, 1849."

Power to

III. And whereas a Plan and Section of the Branch Railway by waklaccord t*1'8 auth0l'ized> showing the Lines and Levels thereof, and also ing^to^depo- a Book of Reference to the said Plan containing the Names of the sited Plans. Owners or reputed Owners and of the Occupiers of the Lands through which the same is intended to pass, have been deposited with the Clerk of the Peace for the County of Cumberland: Be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this Act contained, it shall be lawful for the " Cockermouth and Workington Railway Company " to make and maintain the Branch Railway and Works connected therewith in the Line and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plan and described in the said Book of Reference, and according to the Levels defined on the said Section, and to enter upon, take, and use such of the Lands as shall be necessary for such Purpose.

IV. And be it enacted, That the said Branch Railway shall commence from and out of the " Cockermouth and Workington Railway" at or near to a Place called Marron Foot in the Township of Ghrey-southen in the Parish of Brigham in the County of Cumberland, and shall pass thence from, in, through, or into the" several Parishes and

Townships

Short Title of Act.

Line of Branch Railway.

519

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xxxviii.

Townships of Greysouthen, Brigham, Little Clifton, and Workington in the said County, and shall terminate at or near Bridgefoot in the said Township of Greysouthen and Parish of Brigham near or adjoining the Turnpike Road there at a Place called Nepgill.

V. And be it enacted, That the Powers of the Company for the compulsory Purchase of Lands for the Purposes of this Act shall not be exercised after the Expiration of Two \ears from the passing of this Act.

VI. And be it enacted, That the said Branch Railway shall be completed within Five Years from the passing of this Act, and on the Expiration of such Period the Powers by this Act granted to the Company for executing such Branch Railway, or otherwise in relation thereto, shall cease to be exercised, except as to so much of the same as shall then be completed.

VII. And whereas the estimated Expense of making the said Branch Railway is Two thousand five hundred Pounds: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to raise by creating new Shares, in addition to the Sums of Money which they are authorized to raise under and by virtue of the said recited Act, any further Sum of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Two thousand five hundred Pounds, to be applied only in carrying into execution the Objects and Purposes by this Act authorized.

VIII. And whereas it is expedient that the Company should be authorized to raise an additional Sum of Money for the Purpose of completing the Railway and Works by the said recited Act authorized : Be it therefore enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company to raise by creating new Shares (in addition to the Sums of Money which they are authorized by virtue of the said recited Act and herein-before authorized to raise) any further Sum of Money not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Twenty-five thousand Pounds, to be applied only in carrying into execution the Objects and Purposes of the said recited Act.

IX. And be it enacted, That the said respective Sums so to be raised as aforesaid by the Creation of new Shares shall be divided into Shares of such Amount as will conveniently allow the same to be apportioned according to the Order of any Ordinary or Extraordinary Meeting of the Company, and shall be considered as Part of the general Capital of the Company, and shall be subject to the same Provisions in all respects, whether with reference to the Payment of Calls or the Forfeiture of Shares on Nonpayment of Calls, or otherwise, as if it had been Part of the original Capital of the Company, except as to the Times of making Calls thereon, and the Amount of such Calls, which respectively it shall be lawful for the Directors of the Company from lime to Time to fix as they shall think fit: Provided always, that Ten Pounds per Centum shall be the greatest Amount of any One Call which shall be made in respect of such new Shares, and that Three Months at the least shall be the Interval between successive Calls.

Period for compulsory Purchase of Lands limited.

Period for Completion of Works.

Power to raise additional Capital for Branch Railway by Creation of new Shares.

Power to raise additional Capital for existing Works by Creation of new Shares.

New Shares to be considered same as original Shares.

520

Shares created in respect of the 25,000l. entitled to Preference over all others.

How Dividends on new Shares to be calculated.

As to Votes of Proprietors of new Shares.

Power to borrow Money on Mortgage.

Former Mortgages to have Priority.

Interest not to be paid on Calls paid up.

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. xxxviii.

X. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, with the Consent of Three Fifths of the Proprietors present, personally or by Proxy, at any Extraordinary Meeting of the Company, to declare and agree that the Holders of the Shares created in respect of the aforesaid Sum of Twenty-five thousand Pounds shall be entitled to a Preference in Payment of Dividends over all other Shares created by virtue of this and the said recited Act, not exceeding the Rate of Seven Pounds per Centum per Annum upon the Sums paid in respect thereof.

XI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That in calculating the Dividends upon the Shares to be created under the Powers of this Act reference shall be had to the Difference, if any, for the Time being between the Amount of Calls paid thereon and the Amount of Calls paid upon the original Shares of the Company at the Time of the Declaration of such Dividend.

XII. And be it enacted, That the Proprietors of any new Shares created under the Powers of this Act shall be entitled to such Number of Votes in respect thereof as the nominal Amount represented by such Shares would have entitled them to if they had been possessed of original Shares in the Cockermouth and Workington Railway.

XIII. And be it enacted, That after the whole of the said respective Sums of Two thousand five hundred Pounds and Twenty-five thousand Pounds, by this Act authorized to be raised by Shares, shall have been subscribed for, and One Half thereof shall have been paid up, it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond such Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be authorized to be borrowed by an Order of any Ordinary or Extraordinary Meeting of the Company; provided that such Sums of Money do not exceed in the whole the Sum of Nine thousand one hundred and sixty-six Pounds, in addition to the Sum which they are by the said recited Act authorized to borrow; provided always, that the whole of such Money so to be borrowed shall be applicable only to carrying into execution the Objects and Purposes by the said recited Act authorized, except a Sum of Money not exceeding Eight hundred and thirty-three Pounds, which may be applied to carrying into execution the Objects and Purposes by this Act authorized.

XIV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages or Bonds granted by the Company before the passing of this Act, and which shall be in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall during the Continuance thereof have Priority over any Mortgages or Bonds to be created by virtue of this Act.

XV. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Company, out of any Money by this or the said recited Act authorized to be raised by Calls in respect of Shares, or by the Exercise of any Power of borrowing, to pay any Interest or Dividend to any Shareholder on the Amount of the Calls made in respect of the Shares held by him in the Capital by this Act authorized to be raised; provided always, that nothing

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, CV/p.xxxviii. 521

nothing herein-before contained shall be deemed to prevent the said Company from paying to any Shareholder such Interest on Money advanced by him beyond the Amount of the Calls actually made as shall be in conformity with the Provisions in " The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," in that Behalf contained.

XVI. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Deposits for Company, out of any Money by this Act or the said recited Act future Bills authorized to be raised for the Purposes of such Acts, to pay or

deposit any Sum of Money which by any Standing Order of either {|)e Com-' House of Parliament, now in force or hereafter to be in force, may be pane’s required to be deposited in respect of any Application to Parliament Capita), for the Purpose of obtaining an Act authorizing the said Company to construct any other Railway or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

XVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Same Tolls to demand and receive for and in respect of the Branch Railway the to be ta,icn same Tolls and Charges as they are by the said recited Act authorized ‘VIam to demand and receive for and in respect of the Railway by such Act authorized to be constructed.

XVIII. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of the Railway Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide for the Company to Conveyance of the Mails by Railways; and another Act was passed in tj,uel>Jprcl the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act visions

XX. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of applying for, obtaining, and passing this Act, or preparatory or incident thereto, shall be paid and discharged out of the Funds of l he Company, in preference to all other Payments whatsoever.

XXI. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.
