ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGIKE.

Cap. xliii.

An Act to authorize the Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Railway Company to alter the Alston Branch of their Railway, to make a Branch Railway therefrom, and for other Purposes.

[13th July 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament holden in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to authorize the Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Railway Company to extend their Railway in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, to make a Branch Railway, and for other Purposes connected with their Undertaking, and called " The Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Branch Railway Act, 1846": And whereas the said Company were (among other things) empowered by the said Act to make a certain Branch Railway called " The Alston Branch Railway:" And whereas it is expedient that the said Company should be empowered to alter the Line of the said Alston Branch Railway as authorized by the said " Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Branch Railway Act, 1846," to be constructed, by abandoning certain Portions thereof, and making Deviations therefrom, and also to make another Branch Railway, and also that the said Act should be varied as herein-after expressed; but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that [.Local.] 7 K it

9 & 10 Vict.

c. 39t.

590

Certain Provisions of

8 & 9 Vict, cc. 18 & 20. extended to this Act.

[Short Title.]

Power to make Railways according to deposited Plans.

Lines of Railway to be abandoned and made.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xliii.

it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," and " The Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," shall respectively (except so far as the same respectively are altered by or are inconsistent with this Act) be incorporated with and form Part of this Act, and together with the same shall be construed as One Act.

II. And be it enacted, That in reciting this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression, " The Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle, Alston Branch, Railway Act, 1849."

III. And whereas Plans and Sections of the Deviations intended to be made from the Line of the said Alston Branch Railway as authorized by the said " Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Branch Railway Act, 1846," to be constructed, and of the new Branch Railway to be made by virtue of this Act, showing the Lines and Levels thereof respectively, and also Books of Reference containing the Names of the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers, or reputed Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers of the Lands through which the same are intended to pass, have been deposited with the several Clerks of the Peace of the Counties of Northumberland and Cumberland: Be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this and the said several herein-before mentioned Acts contained, it shall be lawrful for the said Company to make and maintain the several Railways herein-after mentioned on the Lines and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans and described in the said Books of Reference, and to enter upon, take, and use such of the said Lands as shall be necessary for such Purpose.

IV. And be it enacted, That the Portions of the said Line of the said Alston Branch Railway to be abandoned, and the new Lines or Portions of Line to be made in lieu thereof, and the new Branch Railway to be made under the Authority of this Act, with suitable Stations, Works, and Conveniences, shall be as follows; (thatis to say,)

So much of the said Line of the said Alston Branch Railway as extends between the Point of Junction with the Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Railway in the Township of Haltwhistle in the Parish of Haltwhistle in the County of Northumberland at or near the lJalt-whistle Station upon the same Railway, and marked with the Letter (A) on the Plans herein-before referred to, and a Point or Place marked (B) on the same Plans in a Field called Broom-house Meadow, belonging to Cuthbert Ellison Esquire, and occupied by John Waugh, situate in the Township of Bellister in the said Parish of Haltwhistle and County of Northumberland, and passing in, through, or into the Parish of Haltwhistle and the said several Townships of Haltwhistle and Bellister, shall be abandoned, and in lieu thereof there shall be made by the said Company a Line of Railway commencing at the said Point of Junction with the Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Railway marked (A) on the said Plans, and terminating at the Point (B) on the same Plans in the said Field called Broomhouse Meadow, and passing

in,

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xYm. 591

in, through, or into, or to be made Within the several Parishes, Townships, Townlands, and extra-parochial Places following, or some of them, (that is to say,) Haltwhistle, Plenmeller, and Bellister, all in the said County of Northumberland:

So much of the said Line of the said Alston Branch Railway as extends between a Point or Place marked Avith the Letter (C) on the Plans herein-before referred to in a Field belonging to the Honourable James Hope Wallace, situate on the South Side of the Road leading from Rowfoot to Featherstone, and in the Toavii-ship of Featherstone in the said Parish of Haltwhistle, and a Point or Place marked (D) on the same Plans in a Field belonging to Edward Robson, and in the Occupation of Ann Stephenson, situate in the XoAvnship of Knaresdale in the Parish of Knaresdale in the said County of Nothumberland, and passing in, through, or into the several Parishes, Townships, ToAvnlands, and extra-parochial Places folloAving, or some of them, (that is to say,) Haltwhistle, Featherstone, Lambley otherwise Lamley, Asholme, and Knaresdale in the said County of Northumberland, shall be abandoned, and in lieu thereof there shall be made by the said Company a Railway commencing at the said Point or Place marked (C) in the said Field belonging to the said James Hope Wallace, and terminating at the said Point or Place marked (D) in the said Field occupied by the said Ann Stephenson, and extending or passing to, from, in, through, or into, or to be made Within the several Parishes, Townships, Townlands, and extra-parochial Places folioAving, or some of them, (that is to say,) Haltwhistle, Featherstone, Lambley otherwise Lamley, Asholme, and Knaresdale, all in the said County of Northumberland:

So much of the said Line of the said Alston Branch Railway as extends betAveen a Point or Place marked (E) on the Plans herein-before referred to in a Field belonging to the Commissioners and Governors of Greenwich Hospital, and occupied by Rebecca Walton, situate in the ToAvnship and Parish of Alstoti Moor otherwise Alston otherwise Aldstone in the County of Cumberland, and the Western Terminus of the said Alston Branch Railway in the Chapelry of Nent Head in the said Parish of Alston Moor otherwise Alston otherwise Aldstone in the said County of Cumberland, shall be abandoned, and in lieu thereof there shall be made by the said Company a Railway commencing at the said Point or Place marked (E) on the said Plans in the said Field occupied by the said Rebecca 1 Valton, and terminating at the Point or Place marked (F) on the said Plans in a Field occupied by Jane Errington, and situate in the said Township and Parish of Alston Moor otherwise Alston otherwise Aldstone, and near to the Bridge over the River Nent, Avhich last-mentioned Railway will extend or pass from, in, through, or into, or be made Within the said Parish or ToAvnship of Alston Moor otherwise Alston otherwise Aldstone in the said County of Cumberland:

A Branch Railway, Avith all necessary and convenient Stations and Works connected therewith, shall be made by the said Company, to commence at or upon the Line of substituted Rail-Avay secondly above described in a Plantation belonging to and in the Occupation of Thomas Whitfield, situate in the said ToAvnship of Lambley otherwise Lamley, and near to the Place Avhere the

last-

5.92 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xWn.

last-mentioned Railway will be carried across the River Tyne, and to terminate at or upon a Part or Point marked (X) on the said Plans of a Railway belonging to the Earl of Carlisle situate at Haltonlea Gate in the Township of Bartley Bum in the said Parish of Haltichistle, which last-mentioned Branch Railway and Works will be made or pass to, from, through, into, or within the Parishes, Townships, Townfields, or extra-parochial Places of Haltwhistle, Lambley otherwise Lamley, Asholme, Bellister, and Hartley Burn, all in the said County of Northumberland, or some of them.

Compensa- V. Provided always, and be it enacted, That in any Case where tion to be before the passing of this Act any Contract hath been entered into or ContractsrC ^ot*ce g'lven by the Company for purchasing any Lands which the have "been Company were by the said recited Act empowered to purchase, for

entered into the Purpose of constructing the Portions of the said Alston Branch or Notices Railway so authorized to be abandoned as aforesaid, the Company shall

given. make to the Owners or Occupiers of and other Parties interested in

such Lands full Compensation for all Injury or Damage sustained by such Owners, Occupiers, and other Parties by reason of such Purchase not being completed pursuant to such Contract or Notice; and the Amount and Application of such Compensation shall be determined in the Manner provided by the " Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," for determining the Amount and Application of the Compensation to be paid for Lands taken under the Provisions thereof: Provided also, that the Authority hereby given for abandoning the Formation of the aforesaid Portions of the said Alston Branch Railway shall not prejudice or affect the Right of the Owner or Occupier of any Lands •which the Company were so empowered to purchase as aforesaid to receive from the Company Compensation for any Damage that may have been occasioned by the Entry of the Company upon such Lands for the Purpose of surveying and taking Levels, and of probing or boring to ascertain the Nature of the Soil, or of setting out the Line of the Railway, pursuant to the Provisions for that Purpose in the said " Lands Clauses Consolidation Act " contained.

Funds for

VI. And be it enacted, That the Cost and Expense of making and constructing constructing the Railways and Works hereby authorized shall be paid Railways. by the said Company out of the Capital authorized to be raised by the said " Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Branch Railway Act, 1846," and the Monies by the same Act authorized to be borrowed.

Rales ami Tolls.

VII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company to demand and receive, for or in respect of the Use of the Railways hereby authorized to be made, such Tolls, Rates, and Dues as are authorized by the said "Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Branch Railway Act, 1846," to be demanded and received by the said Company; and that, so far as concerns the said Tolls, Rates, and Dues, and all other Matters not herein otherwise specially provided for, the said last-mentioned Act shall after the passing of this Act be read and construed as if the Railways and Works hereby authorized to be made had been comprised therein and thereby authorized to be made, and thenceforth the said Act and this Act shall be read and construed as One Act.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xYm.

VIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company, if they shall see fit, to construct the Bridge by which the said first-mentioned substituted Railway hereby authorized to be made shall cross the River South Tyne near Hcdtwliistle aforesaid in such Manner that there shall be a public Roadway for the Passage of Carriages, Horses and other Cattle, and Foot Passengers.

IX. And be it enacted, That as soon as the said Bridge shall be so constructed as aforesaid it shall be lawful for the said Company, from Time to Time and at all Times thereafter, to demand and receive or take for Pontage as or in the Name of a Toll, before or after any Passage over the said Bridge by the said Roadway shall be permitted, any Sums of Money not exceeding the several Sums following; (that is to say,)

For every Horse or Beast of Draught drawing any Coach, Chariot, Landau, Sociable, Berlin, Chaise, Curricle, Whiskey, Car, Calash, Caravan, Hearse, or Litter, or other such Carriage, the Sum of Four-pence:

For every Horse or Beast of Draught drawing any Waggon, Wain, Van, Cart, Wherry, or other such like Carriage, the Sum of Three-pence:

For every Horse, Mule, or Ass, laden or unladen, and not drawing, the Sum of Two-pence:

For every Score of Oxen or Neat Cattle, the Sum of Ten-pence, and so in proportion for any greater or less Number:

For every Score of Calves, Sheep, Lambs, or Swine, the Sum of Five-pence, and so in proportion for any greater or less Number:

For every Person on Foot, the Sum of One Penny:

And such Tolls shall be paid (if demanded) each Time of passing; and it shall be lawful for the Company to erect such Toll Houses and Toll Gates for the Collection of such last-mentioned Tolls as they may see fit.

X. And be it enacted, That the Powers of the said Company for the compulsory Purchase or taking of Lands for the Purposes of this Act shall not be exercised after the Expiration of Three Years from the passing thereof.

XI. And be it enacted, That the Railways and Works authorized by this Act shall be completed within Three Years from the passing of this Act, and on the Expiration of that Period the Powers by this Act and the said " Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," granted to the said Company for executing the said Railways hereby authorized, or otherwise in relation thereto, shall cease to be exercised, except as to so much of the said Railways as shall then be completed.

XII. And whereas the Railways hereby authorized to be made are intended to be carried across the Turnpike Roads and Highways numbered as follows on the Plans herein-before referred to; (that is to say,) Nos. 1, 4, 14, 31, and 36 in the Township of Lambley and Asholme, Nos. 3, 5, and 6 in the Township of Hartley Burn, all in the County of Northumberland; and it is expedient that the same should be carried across the said Turnpike Roads and Highways on a Level: Be it therefore enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said

[Local.] 7 L Company

593

Power to construct Bridge for Carriages, &c.

Tolls for Bridge.

Powers for compulsory Purchase of Lands limited.

Period for Completion of Works.

Turnpike Roads and Highways that may be crossed on a Level.

594

Company to erect Stations at Points of Crossings, and abide by Rules, &c. of the Commissioners of Railways.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xliii.

Company to make the said Railways respectively across the said Turnpike Roads and Highways on a Level at or near the Points marked on the said Plans for the crossing thereof.

XIII. And be it enacted, That for the greater Convenience and Se* curity of the Public the said Company shall, during such Time as the said herein-before mentioned Turnpike Roads or Highways, or any or either of them, shall be crossed on the Level, erect and maintain either a Station or Lodge at the Points where the said Railways shall cross on the Level of any of the said Turnpike Roads or Highways; and the Company shall be subject to and shall abide by all such Rules and Regulations with regard to the crossing of such Turnpike Roads and Highways on the Level, or with regard to the Speed at which Trains shall pass such Turnpike Roads and Highways, as may from Time to Time be made by the Commissioners of Railways; and if the Company shall during such Period as aforesaid fail to erect or to maintain any such Station or Lodge, or appoint a proper Person to watch or superintend the crossing at any such Point or Station, or to observe or abide by any such Rule or Regulation as aforesaid, they shall for every such Offence be liable to a Penalty of Twenty Pounds, and also to a daily Penalty of Ten Pounds for every Day such Offence shall continue after such Penalty of Twenty Pounds shall have been incurred.

XIV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Commissioners of Railways, if it shall appear to them to be necessary for the public Safety, at any Time, either before or after the Railways hereby authorized to be made shall have been completed and opened for public Traffic, to require the Company, within such Time as the said Commissioners shall direct, and at the Expense of the Company, to carry any or either of the herein-before mentioned Roads either under or over the said Railways by means of a Bridge or Arch in lieu of crossing the same on a Level, or to execute such other Works as under the Circumstances of the Case shall appear to the said Commissioners the best adapted for removing or diminishing the Danger arising from such level Crossing.

XY. And whereas it was in and by the said " Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Branch Railway Act, 1846," enacted, that it should not be lawful for the said Company to open for the Use of the Public any Part or Portion of the said Alston Branch Railway between its Commencement at the Point of Junction with the Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Railway in the Township of Haliwhistle and the Town of Alston until the whole of the Line from the said Commencement of the said Branch Railway to Alston aforesaid should have been completed and opened for the Use of the Public: And whereas the Restriction contained in the said Enactment is found to be unnecessary : Be it therefore enacted, That the same shall be repealed, and the same is hereby repealed accordingly.

XVI. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Railway Company, out of any Money by any Act or Acts relating to the said Company authorized to be raised for the Purposes of such Act or Acts, to pay or deposit any Sum of Money

which

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xliii. 595

which by any Standing Order of either House of Parliament, now in Capital of force or hereafter to be in force, may be required to be deposited in ,he Cotu' respect of any Application to Parliament for the Purpose of obtaining ,Mn' an Act authorizing the said Company to construct any other Railway or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

XVII. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of Railway the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide for the Company Conveyance of the Mails by Railway; and another Act was passed [° the Pro^ in the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An visions of Act for regulating Railways; and another Act was passed in the Sixth l & 2 Vict. Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for the o'^8'’v ,t better Regulation of Railways, and for the Conveyance of Troops; and c 9- lcL another Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the Reign of Her 5 & 6 Vict, said Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Conditions to the Con- c. 55., struction of future Railways authorized or to be authorized by any Act £ of the present or succeeding Sessions of Parliament, and for other Pur- 9’& {q yic, poses in relation to Railways; and another Act was passed in the cc. 57.& 105. Tenth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways; and another Act was passed in the same Session, intituled An Act for constituting Commissioners of Railways : Be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall be held to exempt the said Railways hereby authorized to be made, or the said Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Railway Company, from the Provisions of the said several above-mentioned Acts respectively, but that such Provisions shall be in force in respect to the said Railways and Company, so far as the same may be applicable thereto.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be Railways to deemed or construed to exempt the Railways by this or the said recited p® *10 Acts authorized to be made from the Provisions of any general Act offuture* relating to such Acts, or of any general Act relating to Railways, now general

in force or which may hereafter pass during the present or any future Acts. Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision and Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament, of the maximum Rates of Fares and Charges authorized by this Act or by the said recited Acts.

XIX. And be it enacted, That all Costs, Charges, and Expenses of Expenses and attending the passing of this Act or incidental thereto shall be of Act-paid by the said Newcastle-upon-Tyne and Carlisle Railway Company,

pari passu with the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of any other Act of Parliament passed or to be passed in the present Session of Parliament to which they may be liable, out of the first Monies that shall come to their Hands after the passing thereof, and in preference to any other Payment whatsoever.

[Public Act.]

XX. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIAE REGIN JE.

Cap. xliv.

An Act for consolidating the Trusts of the Truro Turnpike Roads and the Penryn and Redruth Turnpike Roads in the County of Cornwall, and for making a new Turnpike Road from Bosvigo Bridge to the Turnpike Road from Truro to Redruth, and for making the Road or Highway from Ferris Town to Bosvigo Bridge a Turnpike Road, and for maintaining all such Roads; and for other Purposes.

[13th July 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act for more effectually amending and widen- 7 & 8 G. 4. ing the Roads from Penryn to Redruth in the County of Cornwall, c-18-and for building a Bridge over Penryn River: And whereas an Act was passed in the Twelfth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty the Queen, intituled An Act for repealing an Act of the Ninth Year n & 12 Vict. of the Reign of His Majesty Ring George the Fourth, intituled ‘ An c- 51.

‘ Act for making, repairing, and improving certain Roads leading to [Loca/.] 7 M ‘ and

598

Commencement and Continuance of Act.

[Short Title.]

Interpretation of Terms.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xliv.

* and from Truro in the County of Cornwall,’ and for making other Provisions in lieu thereof; for forming, vesting, and improving certain Roads; and for continuing and extending the Truro Turnpike Trust: And whereas the Trustees for executing the first-recited Act have put the same into execution, and have for the Purposes thereof borrowed divers Sums of Money, which still remain on the Security of the Tolls thereby granted : And whereas the Trustees for executing the secondly-recited Act have put the same in execution, and have begun some of the Works thereby authorized, and divers Sums of Money have been borrowed, which are due on the Security of the Tolls thereby granted : And whereas it would be of public Advantage if the Trusts of such several Turnpike Roads were consolidated by committing the Care and Management thereof to One Body of Trustees, and if such Trustees were enabled to complete the Works authorized by the secondly-recited Act, and to make a new Turnpike Road commencing at or near Bosvigo Bridge in the Parish of Kenwyn in the County of Cornwall, and terminating in or near the Turnpike Road leading from Truro to Redruth between the Third and Fourth Mile Stones, and adjoining to certain Houses in the several Occupations of William Pearse, Thomas Seymour, Sampson Webb, John Webb, and Edward Merrifield, situate at or near a Place commonly called Green Bottom in the Parish of Kenwyn, and also if a certain Road or Highway commencing at Ferris Town in the Parish of Kenwyn at or near certain Messuages and Hereditaments in the several Occupations of William Douglas Clinton, Elisabeth Snow, and Elizabeth Linncy and William J/‘ William, and extending therefrom to or near Bosvigo Bridge, were vested in such Trustees and made a Turnpike Road, and they were enabled to alter, widen, and improve such last-mentioned Road or Highway, and if further Provisions were made with reference to such Roads, and the first-recited Act were repealed, and other Provisions made in lieu thereof, and the Provisions of the secondly-recited Act were amended; but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That this Act shall commence and take effect on and from the Expiration of One Calendar Month next after the passing thereof, and shall continue and be in force for Twenty-one Years, and thenceforth to the End of the then next Session of Parliament.

II. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act for any Purpose whatsoever, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Truro and Redruth Turnpike Roads Act, 1819-"

III. And be it enacted, That in the Construction of this Act the following Words and Expressions shall have the Meanings hereby assigned to them, unless such Meanings be repugnant to or inconsistent with the Context; (that is to say,)

Words importing the Singtdar Number shall include the Plural Number: ,

Words

599

12° & 13" VICTORIA, Cap. xliv.

Words importing the Plural Number shall include the Singular Number:

Words importing the Masculine Gender shall include Females:

The Word " Lands" shall include Messuages, Lands, Tenements, and Hereditaments, of whatsoever Tenure:

The Expression " the Trustees " shall mean the Trustees for putting this Act into execution:

The Expression " the Roads " shall mean the several Roads to which this Act relates:

The Expression " Turnpike Gate " shall include Turnpike Gates,

Toll Bars, Side Gates, Side Bars, and Toll Chains.

IV. And be it enacted, That from and after the Commencement of Recited Act this Act the first-recited Act shall be and the same is hereby repealed, 7 & 8 G. 4. but the Repeal thereof shall not revive any of the Acts thereby pe^e'dre‘ repealed.

V. And be it enacted, That from and after the Commencement of Certain this Act the several Sections of the secondly-recited Act numbered respectively S, 4, 6, 55, 62, and 67 in the Copies of that Act c.si.re-"’' printed by Her Majesty's Printers shall be and the same are hereby pealed repealed.

VI. And be it enacted, That the secondly-recited Act, and all U&12 Vict. and every the Powers, Provisions, Exemptions, Penalties, Forfeitures, c. 51. and Remedies, Matters, and Things therein contained or expressed, save UoncA^t and except so much and such Parts thereof as are expressly repealed,

varied, altered, or otherwise provided for by this Act, shall respectively be as good, valid, and effectual with xeference to the Purposes of and for executing this Act as if the same respectively had been repeated and re-enacted in this Act; and the secondly-recited Act so repealed, varied, altered, or otherwise provided for and this Act shall accordingly be and be executed as One Act.

VII. And be it enacted, That all Monies due to, and all Property Monies due and Choses in Action vested in, the several Trustees for executing the and Property recited Acts respectively, or any of them, shall, immediately on the {'^recited Commencement of this Act, be vested in the Trustees, and they may Acts vested use, sue for, and recover the same, and act as effectually in respect in the Trus-thereof, as if the same had been vested in them under the recited te?s Ullder Acts respectively, and they shall be liable to all the Debts and En- ^'isthf' ^ gagements to which the several Trustees for executing the recited Bonds and Acts respectively, or any of them, were liable at the Commencement Contracts to of this Act; and all Bonds, Covenants, Securities, and Contracts made bc 8ood-

or entered into under the Powers and Provisions of the recited Acts respectively, to, by, or with any Persons and the several Trustees for executing the recited Acts respectively, or any of them, shall, until the same be fully satisfied or performed, be and continue available to and in favour of such Persons and the Trustees respectively in all Courts of Law and Equity.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xYxx.

VIII. And be it enacted, That the Tolls by this Act granted shall be and are hereby made liable to the Payment of all Monies borrowed, and which on the Commencement of this Act are due, on the Security of the several Tolls by the recited Acts respectively granted, and of all Interest due and to grow due thereon, as if such Monies had been borrowed and were due on the Security of the Tolls by this Act granted.

IX. And be it enacted, That the Trustees may from Time to Time, if and when they shall think fit, give in lieu of and by way of Substitution for any existing Bonds or other Securities for any such Monies, new Bonds or Securities on the Tolls by this Act granted for the Payment of such Monies, with Interest thereon after such Rate, not exceeding the Rate by such existing Bonds and Securities respectively secured, as may be agreed on between the Trustees and the Holders of such existing Bonds and Securities respectively.

X. And be it enacted, That the several Persons who at the Commencement of this Act shall be Trustees under and by virtue of the recited Acts respectively, and their Successors, being duly qualified to act as Trustees of Turnpike Roads in England, and being duly appointed in that Behalf, shall be Trustees for executing this Act.

XI. And be it enacted, That the Trustees shall, within Three Calendar Months after the Commencement of this Act, hold their First Meeting at the Town Hall in the Borough of Truro in the County of Cornwall, or at some other convenient Place in the Neighbourhood of the Roads, whereat the Trustees may qualify, and shall then and from Time to Time thereafter adjourn to and meet at such Place in the Neighbourhood of the Roads as they shall think proper.

XII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall relate to and be executed for more effectually improving, maintaining, and keeping in repair the several Turnpike Roads, Bridges, and Works by the secondly-recited Act authorized to be respectively made, improved, maintained, and kept in repair, and also the Turnpike Roads leading from New Street and Pig Street in Penryn in the County of Cornwall to Redruth in the same County, and from the Bottom of New Street to and over Sowell’s Quay in the Borough of Penryn in the same County, and also the Bridge built under the Authority of the first-recited Act over and across a Branch of the Penryn River at or near Sowell’s Quay aforesaid to the opposite Side in the Parish of Budock in the same County, and also the several Roads and Works by this Act authorized to be respectively made and improved.

XIII. And whereas Maps or Plans and Sections describing the Lines, Situations, and Levels of such Road, commencing at or near Bosvigo Bridge aforesaid, and terminating at or near the Turnpike Road leading from Truro to Redruth aforesaid, intended to be made as aforesaid, and of such existing Road or Highway commencing at Ferris Town aforesaid, and extending therefrom to or near Bosvigo

Bridge

601

12° & 13" VICTORIA, Cap. xliv.

B ridge aforesaid, intended to be widened and improved as aforesaid, and the Lands proposed to be taken for the Purposes thereof respectively, together with Books of Reference to such Plans, containing the Names of the reputed Owners and Lessees and of the Occupiers of such Lands, have been deposited with the Clerk of the Peace for the County of Cornwall: Be it enacted, That the Trustees may set out, make, and complete such intended Turnpike Road, and widen and improve such existing Road or Highway respectively, in the Lines and through the Lands respectively delineated and described in such Maps or Plans and Books of Reference, and may make such Roads respectively of such Width as they may think proper, not exceeding Sixty Feet, together with such Footpaths, Bridges, Embankments, Ditches, Drains, Fences, and other necessary Works upon or near thereto, as they may think requisite, and for the Purposes aforesaid may take possession of the Lands delineated and described in such Maps or Plans and Books of Reference, making Satisfaction for the same to the Owners thereof, and other Persons interested therein.

XIV. And be it enacted, That such Bridge over such Branch of Bridge over the Penryn River shall for ever be and remain a public Bridge, and Penryn River all Persons, Horses, Cattle, and Carriages shall have free Liberty Payment (upon Payment of the Tolls by this Act granted) to pass over the of Toll, same without any Hindrance or Interruption whatsoever; and the

Road or Way and the Footways and Causeways upon and over such Bridge shall be and the same are hereby declared to be a Turnpike Road to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever; and all Materials of and for the Road or Way, Footways and Causeways, upon or over such Bridge shall be deemed Materials gotten, dug, or gathered for the Repair or Use of the Roads, to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever.

XV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all the Powers by Period for this Act or any other Act granted in relation to the taking of Lands p°nr’^s"ry for the Purposes of Turnpike Roads shall, so far as such Powers relate JfLands to the compulsory taking of Lands by this Act authorized to be taken limited, for the Purposes thereof, cease and be utterly void at the Expiration

of Three Years from the Time of the Commencement of this Act:

Provided also, that the preceding Enactment shall not extend the Period by the secondly-recited Act limited for the compulsory taking of Lands for the Purposes thereof.

XVI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That upon and from the Existing Commencement of this Act, and thenceforth until the Thirty-first To,ls to be Day of December One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine in- 3^"r*eccn 1 elusive, and notwithstanding the Repeal of the first-recited Act, or ber ist9. any of the Provisions of this Act, the Trustees may demand and

XVII. And be it enacted, That upon and after the First Day of take Tolls. January One thousand eight hundred and fifty the Trustees may demand and take at the several Turnpike Gates which are or shall be upon or at the Sides of the Roads such Sums of Money or Tolls for Horses, Mules, Asses, and other Beasts of Burden, Oxen, Cows, and Neat Cattle, Calves, Swine, Sheep, and Lambs, and Carriages of whatsoever Sort, as the Trustees shall at any of their Meetings from Time to Time direct, not exceeding the several Sums of Money or Tolls which by the secondly-recited Act the Trustees for executing the same were thereby empowered to demand and take for such Animals and Carriages respectively;

And also for every Foot Passenger or Person on foot (except the Driver of any Waggon, Wain, Cart, or other Carriage) who shall pass any Turnpike Gate erected upon the Roads within Twenty Yards of such Bridge over such Branch of the Penryn River, any Sum not exceeding One Halfpenny, whether he shall travel or go more or less than Twenty Yards on such Roads, any Law or Statute to the contrary notwithstanding; and a like Sum at such Turnpike Gate for every Person who shall ride in or upon any Waggon, Wain, Cart, or other like Carriage (not being a Cart or Carriage usually employed for the Conveyance of Passengers for Hire), or who shall ride upon any Horse or Beast drawing any such Waggon, Wain, Cart, or other like Carriage, whether such Waggon, Wain, Cart, or Carriage shall travel or go more or less than Twenty Yards on such Roads; and upon Payment of such Toll on any Foot Passenger, the Collector shall deliver gratis to such Foot Passenger a Note or Ticket denoting such Payment.

XX. Provided also, and be it enacted, That when the Toll for any Only One Animal or Carriage shall have been paid at any Turnpike Gate T°" "1 b.<-‘ (exclusive of the Turnpike Gate within Twenty Yards of such j^iles.m ^ Bridge) erected, placed, or continued on the Roads, the Toll shall not be payable for the passing or repassing in any one and the same Day (to be so computed) of the same Animal or Carriage through any Turnpike Gate within Ten Miles (to be computed by Measurement along the Centre of the Roads) of the Turnpike Gate at which such Toll was paid.

XXI. Provided also, and be it enacted, That One full Toll only Full Toll to shall be payable at the Turnpike Gate to be erected within Twenty betaken Yards of such Bridge, for the passing and repassing in any one and forCpa*s^,a/ the same Day (to be so computed) of the same Foot Passenger, the Bridge. Animal, or Carriage through such Turnpike Gate; and, as regards

any such Animal or Carriage, such One full Toll shall be payable, notwithstanding any Toll or Tolls may have been paid for the passing or repassing thereof through any of the other Turnpike Gates erected, placed, or continued upon the Roads, and distant less than Ten Miles from such Turnpike Gate within Twenty Yards of such Bridge.

XXII. And be it enacted, That if any Foot Passenger or Person Penalty on on foot shall fraudulently or forcibly pass through any Turnpike £vf,s‘?n£f Gate erected upon the Roads within Twenty Yards of such Bridge ivscn'ers'1 without paying the Toll hereby imposed, every such Person shall for every such Offence forfeit and pay any Sum not exceeding Five Pounds; and such Penalty shall be levied and recovered (together with the necessary Costs and Charges of levying the same) by the same Ways and Means and in like Manner as any Penalty or Forfeiture for fraudulently or collusively claiming or taking the Benefit of any Exemption from Toll or other Exemption on any Turnpike Road may by Law be levied or recovered, and one Moiety of such Penalty shall be paid to the Informer, and the other Moiety thereof shall be paid to the Treasurer of the Trustees, and applied for the Purposes of this Act: Provided that the Penalty hereby imposed shall not be deemed or construed to abolish or affect any Penalty imposed by or leviable under any Law in force relative to Turnpike Roads in England.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That all the Monies which shall be Application received by the Trustees by virtue of this Act upon or in respect of of Tolls-the Roads shall be applied as follows; (that is to say,)

First, In paying and discharging the Expenses of obtaining and passing this Act or incident thereto:

Secondly, In paying and discharging any Interest which is for the Time being owing in respect of any Money borrowed, and at

the

604

l or paying off the Sum of .500/. yearly as a Composition for certain Securities on the Tolls.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xliv.

the Commencement of this Act owing, on the Security of the several Tolls by the recited Acts respectively granted:

Thirdly, In paying and discharging the Expenses of making, improving, maintaining, and keeping in repair respectively the several Roads, Bridges, and Works respectively by this Act authorized to be made, improved, maintained, and kept in repair respectively:

Fourthly, In paying and discharging any Interest which is for the Time being owing in respect of any Money borrowed after the Commencement of this Act for the Purposes last aforesaid on the Security of the several Tolls by this Act granted:

Fifthly, In reducing, paying off, and discharging according to the Provisions of this Act the several Principal Sums borrowed, and at the Commencement of this Act owing, on the Security of the several Tolls by the recited Acts respectively granted:

Sixthly, In reducing, paying off, and discharging according to the Provisions of this Act the several Principal Sums borrowed after the Commencement of this Act for the Purposes aforesaid on the Security of the several Tolls by this Act granted.

XXIV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Trustees may and they are hereby required to pay yearly out of the Monies and Tolls collected and received by virtue of this Act such Sums of Money as are agreed to be accepted by any Persons being Creditors upon the Tolls as a Composition on and in satisfaction of their Securities, to the Amount of Five hundred Pounds, according to the Stipulation after mentioned; (that is to say,) the Trustees shall Twenty-one Days at least before the General Meeting in each Year cause public Notice to be given in some One or more Newspaper or Newspapers circulated in the County of Cornwall, that a Composition will be paid for Five Mortgages, Bonds, or Debentures for One hundred Pounds each to such Creditors on the Tolls as shall be willing to accept the smallest Composition for their Claims, and requiring such Creditors to transmit Proposals in Writing, sealed up, to the Trustees at such Meetings, specifying therein the lowest Rate per Centum which such Creditors will accept and take for every Mortgage, Bond, or Debenture for One hundred Pounds, not exceeding Five, whiclf they may have due and owing on the Tolls (which Proposals shall, as soon after the Hour of One of the Clock in the Afternoon of the Day of such Meeting as convenient, be publicly opened by the Clerk to the Trustees at such Meeting); and the Creditors whose Proposals shall specify the lowest Rate per Centum which they will accept and take for all or any of such Mortgages, Bonds, or Debentures of One hundred Pounds intended to be paid oft’ shall have the Preference and be paid such Sums of Money as they are willing to accept for the same by the Treasurer to the Trustees at the Expiration of One Calendar Month next after such Meeting, with all Interest then due for the same; and if Two or more of such Creditors shall deliver in Proposals at the same Meeting for accepting a Composition for any such Mortgages, Bonds, or Debentures at an equal Rate per Centum, then and in such Case it shall forthwith be determined by Lot, to be fairly

drawn

605

12° & 13° VICTORIAE, Cap. xliv.

drawn by the Clerk to the Trustees, to which of such Creditors Preference shall be given in Payment of such Composition, and the Creditor having the casting Lot shall be paid his Composition at the Time and in manner herein-before mentioned; but if there shall not be any Proposal delivered in at any such annual Meetings by any Creditor, or, being such, the Proposals shall not be for accepting any such Composition on the full Amount of Five hundred Pounds, then and in any such Case, but not otherwise, the Trustees shall and may, and they are hereby required, in every Year in which such Event shall happen, to set apart out of such Monies and Tolls the full Sum of Five hundred Pounds, or such Part thereof as shall not be required for such Composition, to be applied towards Payment of the other Principal Monies then due and owing on the Tolls, and the Trustees shall then cause the Numbers of the Mortgages, Bonds, or Debentures in respect whereof such Composition has not been accepted, and the several Sums for which they are given, to be separately set down in Writing, and put together into a Box or Wheel, and out of such Box or Wheel immediately afterwards cause to be drawn the Numbers of so many of such Mortgages, Bonds, or Debentures as shall be equal in Value or Amount to the Sum so set apart and intended to be paid off; and in One Calendar Month next after such Numbers shall be respectively drawn, the Treasurer to the Trustees shall pay to the Persons entitled to the Mortgages, Bonds, or Debentures the Numbers of which shall be so drawn, or to the Trustees or Guardians of such of them as are under Age, such Sums of Money as shall be due by virtue thereof, which they are hereby required to accept and take accordingly in discharge of such Mortgages, Bonds, or Debentures, or of such Part of the same as shall be thereby satisfied and paid.

XXV. And whereas some of the several Principal Sums borrowed and now owing on the Security of the several Tolls by the recited Acts respectively granted carry a higher Rate of Interest than others of such Principal Sums, and it would therefore improve the Security for such Principal Sums bearing the lower Rate of Interest if such Principal Sums bearing the higher Rate of Interest were paid off and discharged: Be it enacted, That the Trustees may from Time to Time pay off and discharge at such Times as they shall think fit, but in manner provided by the general Acts for regulating Turnpike Roads in England, all or any of such Principal Sums which shall for the Time being carry a higher Rate of Interest than any others of such Principal Sums, unless the Parties holding Securities bearing the higher Rate of Interest shall consent to accept the lower Rate of Interest on such Securities, anything in this Act and the recited Acts, or any of them, to the contrary thereof in anywise notwithstanding.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed to exempt the Roads comprised in this Act from the Provisions of any general Act relating to the Consolidation or other improved Arrangement of Turnpike Roads which may pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament.

Power to pay off in the first instance the Debts carrying the highest Rate of Interest.

Roads not to be exempt from Provisions of future

general Acts.

(>06 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xliv.

[Public Act.]

XXVII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice as such.

LONDON:

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIAE REGINAE.

An Act for amending an Act passed in the Thirty-fifth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Third for dividing and leasing or letting certain Commons or Waste Grounds within the Borough and Township of Congleton in the County of Chester, and for applying the Profits of Part of the same in aid of the Poor’s Rate or other Taxes or public Expenses within the said Township.

[13th July 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Thirty-fifth Year of the Reign of His Majesty King George the Third, intituled An Act for dividing and leasing or letting certain 35G. 3. C. 56.

Commons or Waste Grounds within the Borough and Township of Congleton in the County of Chester, and for applying the Profits of Part of the same in aid of the Poor's Rate or other Taxes or public Expenses within the said Township, and which Act empowered the Trustees therein mentioned to grant and demise, by public Auction,

Cap. xlv,

[Loca/.j

7 P

Parts

610

Powers of recited Act extended to this Act.

Certain Provisions in recited Act repealed.

Power to Trustees to convey or lease upon Ground Kent.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xlv.

Parts of the said Commons or Waste Lands thereby vested in them, either together or in such Lots as the said Trustees or any Five or more of them should think most beneficial for the Purpose of that Act, for any Term or Number of Years not exceeding Twenty-one Years at any one Time, or to let and set the same, or any Part or Parts thereof, at an annual Rent or Rents from Year to Year as therein mentioned : And whereas it would increase the Value of such Parts of the said Trust Lands, and conduce more effectually to the Purposes of the said Act, and tend to the Advantage of the Township of Congleton, if Power were granted to the said Trustees and other Officers under the said Act to enable them to convey in Fee or let all or any Part of the same on long Leases for building upon, reserving a yearly Ground or Chief Rent; and it is expedient that some of the Provisions of the said Act should be amended and extended, but the same cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Powers, Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in the said recited Act, so far as the same are now in force, and except such of them as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, shall extend to this Act as fully and effectually as if the same Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act; and the recited Act and this Act shall accordingly be construed and have Effect as One Act: Provided always, that whensoever any Notice by Advertisement in a Newspaper is requisite for any of the Purposes of the recited Act or this Act, it shall be sufficient if the same be inserted in some Newspaper published in the County of Chester and usually circulating in Congleton.

II. And be it enacted, That so much of the said recited Act as provides and enacts that nothing therein contained should extend, or be deemed, construed, or taken to extend, to ease or lower the said Charles Watkin John Shakerley, his Heirs and Assigns, in his or their Taxes or Levies of any Sort or Kind, but that he and they should be assessed, bear, and pay the same ad valorem, as well for his present Freehold Estates as for such Parts of the said Commons and Waste Lands as should be allotted to him in right of his said Manor and his other Freehold Estates, and that in as full and ample Manner as if that Act had not been made, anything therein contained to the contrary notwithstanding, shall be and the same is hereby repealed.

III. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, and they are hereby authorized and empowered, by Deed or Writing, Deeds or Writings, under their Hands and Seals, to convey, grant, or demise such Parts of the said Trust Lands as they might for the Time being lease, for Twenty-one Years, or any Part or Parts of the same, to any Person

or

611

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xlv.

or Persons whomsoever, either in Fee, or for any Term or Number of Years not exceeding Nine hundred and ninety-nine Years, for the greatest annual Chief or Ground Rent or Rents that can be reasonably had or gotten for the same, and without Fine, or anything in the Nature thereof, subject nevertheless to the Provisoes, Rules, Orders, and Directions herein-after mentioned.

IV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, may from Time to Time cause the said Lands, or any of them, to be divided into such and so many Lots as they shall think most beneficial and advantageous for the Disposal thereof, and shall and may dispose of the same, either in Fee, or for any such Term or Number of Years not exceeding Nine hundred and ninety-nine Years as aforesaid, by Auction, at some one or more of their Meetings to be held in pursuance of this or of the said recited Act, of which Meeting or Meetings for such Purpose public Notice shall be given by the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, by Writing affixed on the Guildhall or on some other conspicuous Place within the said Borough, and also by Advertisement in a Newspaper published and circulating as aforesaid, Fourteen Days at least before the Day or Days appointed for such Meeting or Meetings; and all such Disposals, Conveyances, Grants, or Demises made and executed by the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, shall be valid and effectual at Law.

V. Provided also, and be it enacted, That no Lot of the said Lands shall be conveyed in Fee, or be granted or demised for any Term or Time exceeding Twenty-one Years, unless for building thereOn, or for Annexation to some Land already built on; and whenever any such Lot shall be so conveyed, granted, or demised to any Person or Persons for building thereon, such Person or Persons shall, at the Time of the making of the Conveyance, Grant, or Demise, enter into proper Covenants with the said Trustees, or some Five or more of them, to build thereon, within Five Years thence next ensuing, a good and substantial Dwelling House or other Building, which, exclusive of Outbuildings, shall be of a yearly Value at least double the yearly Ground Rent reserved in such Conveyance, Grant, or Demise, and to uphold and maintain the same of such yearly Value, and according to such Plan and Form, and under such Covenants and Provisoes, as shall be determined on by the said Trustees or any Five or more of them; and whenever any such Lot shall be so conveyed, granted, or demised to any Person or Persons for Annexation to some Land already built on, such Person or Persons shall, at the Time of the making of the Conveyance, Grant, or Demise, enter into proper Covenants with the said Trustees, or some Five or more of them, to annex the same accordingly, within One Year thence next ensuing, and shall grant or secure to the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, an effectual Power of Distress over Freehold Lands or Tenements of ample Value, for the Recovery of the yearly Ground

Rent

Trustees to divide Land into Lots, and convey in Fee or Lease by Auction.

Terms of Conveyances in Fee and Leases exceeding 21 Years.

612

Trustees to sue and be sued in the Name of their Clerk.

Trustees and Clerk to be reimbursed Expenses of suing and defending.

Trustee or Clerk not to be incompetent Witnesses.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xlr.

Rent reserved in such Conveyance, Grant, or Demise; and in the Conveyance, Grant, or Demise of any such Lot, whether for building thereon, or for such Annexation, there shall be contained a sufficient Proviso for Re-entry by the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, in case the Grantee or Grantees, or Lessee or Lessees, his or their Heirs, Executors, Administrators, or Assigns, do not well and truly perform and observe all and singular the Covenants and Provisoes in such Conveyance, Grant, or Demise contained, and on his or their Part to be respectively performed and observed.

VI. And be it enacted, That the said Trustees shall and may sue and be sued in the Name or Names of any One or more of them, or in the Name of their Clerk for the Time being; and all Actions and Suits which may be necessary or expedient to be brought for the Recovery of any Penalty or Sum or Sums of Money due or payable by virtue of this Act or the said recited Act, or for or in respect of any other Matter or Thing relating to this Act or the said recited Act, may be brought in the Name or Names of any One or more of the said Trustees, or in the Name of their Clerk for the Time being; and no Action or Suit which may be brought, commenced, or prosecuted by or against the said Trustees, or any of them, by virtue or on account of this Act or the said recited Act, or in the Name of their Clerk, shall abate or be discontinued by the Death, Suspension, or Removal of such Trustee or Trustees or Clerk, or by any Act or Default of such Trustee or Trustees or Clerk done or suffered without the Consent or Direction of the said Trustees, but that any One of the said Trustees, or their Clerk for the Time being, shall be always deemed to be the Plaintiff or Defendant in every such Action or Suit (as the Case may be), except in such Action or Suit as shall be prosecuted between the said Trustees and their Clerk for the Time being, in which Action or Suit any One of the said Trustees shall or may be Plaintiff or Defendant (as the Case may be).

VII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That every such Trustee or Clerk in whose Name any Action or Suit shall be commenced, prosecuted, or defended in pursuance of this Act shall always be reimbursed and paid, out of the Monies to arise by virtue of this Act or the said recited Act, all such Damages, Costs, Charges, and Expenses as such Trustee or Clerk shall be put to or become chargeable with by reason of his being so made Plaintiff or Defendant therein; and no such Trustee or Clerk shall be personally answerable or liable for the Payment of the same, or any Part thereof, unless such Action or Suit shall arise in consequence of his own wilful Neglect or Default, or have been brought or commenced without the Order or Direction of the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them.

VIII. And be it enacted, That no Trustee or Clerk acting under the Authority of the said recited Act or of this Act shall be deemed incompetent to give Evidence or shall be disqualified from giving

Evidence

613

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. x\v.

Evidence in any Action or Suit by reason only of such Trustee or Clerk being the nominal Plaintiff or Defendant in such Action or Suit.

IX. And be it enacted, That all Orders of the said Trustees made at any of their Meetings shall be entered by their Clerk in a Book to be kept for that Purpose, and shall be signed by the Chairman for the Time being of such respective Meetings; and such Orders and Proceedings, so entered and signed, shall be deemed and taken to be the original Orders and Proceedings, and shall be allowed to be read in Evidence in all Courts and Places whatsoever.

X. And be it enacted, That, notwithstanding anything contained in the said recited Act, if after any Adjournment of a Meeting it shall at any Time be thought necessary to hold a Meeting of the Trustees on an earlier Day than the Day to which the Meeting shall stand adjourned, or in case no Adjournment shall happen to have been made at the previous Meeting of the said Trustees, then and in either of such Cases it shall be lawful for the said Trustees, or any Five or more of them, by Notice in Writing under their Hands to be affixed on the Door of the Guildhall or on some other conspicuous Place within the said Borough, to convene a Meeting of the said Trustees to be held at such Time as may be mentioned in such Notice (such Time not being less than Seven Days after such Notice being so affixed); and all the Orders and Proceedings of the said Trustees at such Meeting to be convened as aforesaid shall be as valid as they would have been in case the said Trustees had met in pursuance of an Adjournment.

XI. And be it enacted, That, notwithstanding anything contained in the said recited Act, all Orders and Proceedings of any Person or Persons acting as a Trustee or Trustees in the Execution of this or the said recited Act, though not duly qualified, nor having taken or subscribed the Oath as prescribed by the said recited Act, previous to his or their being convicted of the said Offence, shall, notwithstanding such Conviction, be as valid and effectual as if such Person or Persons had been qualified and had taken and subscribed the Oath according to the Directions of the said recited Act.

XII. And be it enacted, That the Costs and Charges of obtaining and passing this Act, and all other Costs, Charges, and Expenses relating to the same, or incidental thereto, shall be paid by the said Trustees out of the first Monies to arise under or by virtue of this or the said recited Act.

XIII. Saving always to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, Her Heirs and Successors, and to all and every other Person and Persons, Bodies Politic or Corporate, his, her, and their Heirs, Successors, Executors, and Administrators, all such Right, Title, Estate, Interest,

[Local.] 7 Q Claim,

Proceedings to be entered.

Meetings on Emergencies.

Acts of Trustees not qualified, to be valid if done before Conviction.

Expenses of Act.

General

Saving.

614 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xlv.

Claim, and Demand, (other than and except such as are expressly barred or intended to be barred or extinguished by this Act,) as they or any of them had and enjoyed before the passing of this Act, or could or ought to have had in case this Act had not been passed.

[Public Act.]

XIV. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Printed by George Edward Eyre and William Spottiswoode, Printers to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty. 1849.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIAE REGINAE.

Cap. xlvi.

An Act to facilitate the Prosecution of Criminal Offences before Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace in the County of Renfrew, and to simplify the Proceedings therein and lessen the Costs thereof.

[13th July 1849.] ,y

WHEREAS it is expedient that the Procedure before the Justices of the Peace for the County of Renfrew in the Prosecution of minor Crimes and Offences should be simplified, so as to facilitate the Trials for Crimes and lessen the Costs of Prosecution : May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by Authority of the same, That in all Prosecutions for Criminal Justices em-Offences at the Instance of the public Prosecutor, or of a private Party Powered to with his Concurrence, now competent before Her Majesty's Justices jT£Sp™‘"o" s of the Peace for the said County, and where the Prosecutor shall charged with crave or conclude for Imprisonment for a Period not exceeding Sixty certain Days, or for a Fine not exceeding Five Pounds, and Imprisonment Crimes, for a Period not exceeding Sixty Days in case of such Fine not being paid, accompanied in either Case, if necessary, with Caution for good [Local.] 7 R Behaviour,

618

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xlvi.

Behaviour, or to keep the Peace, for a Period of Six Months, under a Penalty of not more than Five Pounds, the Procedure shall be in the summary Form herein-af'ter provided : Provided always, that in all such Prosecutions all the Proceedings shall be in open Court, and that a Record shall be preserved of the Charge and of the Judgment, and that a Note of the Evidence shall be taken by the Justice or Justices trying the Case, or by the Clerk of Court, and if by the Clerk of Court such Note shall be certified as accurate, and be subscribed by such Justice or Justices, who shall be responsible for the Accuracy of the same.

Form of

II. And be it enacted, That the Complaint at the Instance of the

Complaint. pUu;c Prosecutor, or private Party with his Concurrence, may be in the Form of the Schedule (A.) hereunto annexed, or as near thereto as Circumstances will permit.

Form of

III. And be it enacted, That upon such Complaint being presented Warrant. to any Justice it shall be lawful for such Justice to grant Warrant to apprehend or cite the Person accused to appear and answer to the Complaint; and such Warrant may be in the Form contained in Schedule (B.) hereunto annexed.

Form of

IV. And be it enacted, That upon such Warrant being granted it

Justices may V. And be it enacted, That upon the Apprehension or Commit-Baif*1 of ment of any Person in virtue of this Act for any Crime it shall be lawful for the Justice or Justices to accept of Bail, and to liberate such Person upon Bail, to an Amount not exceeding Five Pounds being found for his due Appearance on the Day of Trial.

Mode of

VI. And be it enacted, That all Warrants and Notices to appear Citation. may be served on the Persons accused by an Officer of Court in the Form contained in the Schedule (D.) hereunto annexed, and that the Warrant to apprehend or to cite, or the Copies served on the Persons accused, shall be sufficient Authority to any Officer of Court to cite Witnesses for either Party to appear at the Trial, under a Penalty of Ten Pounds Scots each in case of Failure; and the Execution by the Officer, which may be according to the Form contained in the said Schedule (D.), shall be held as sufficient Evidence of the Service of the Complaint on the Accused.

Procedure

VII. And be it enacted, That the Procedure at the Trial may be at Trial.;n the Forms contained in the Schedule (E.) hereunto annexed, or as near thereto as Circumstances will admit.

VIII. And be it enacted, That where an accused Party shall have Persons

IX. And be it enacted, That where a Party has been apprehended Party and brought before One Justice for Examination, as before provided, charged where the Crime or Offence charged shall appear to the Prosecutor to offences^ be of a petty Nature, it shall, on his craving, be competent to such ,iay be tried Justice at once to hear the Complaint, and either on Proof thereof, or by One Jus-upon the judicial Confession of the Person accused, to impose a Fine tice-

not exceeding Twenty Shillings, with Imprisonment, in case of such Fine not being paid, for a Period not exceeding Ten Days, or otherwise to sentence a Person accused to Imprisonment for a Period not exceeding Ten Days, without Prejudice to such Justice, upon Cause shown, adjourning such Trial for any Period not exceeding Forty-eight Hours, the Prisoner being either imprisoned or finding Bail, as herein-before provided, for his due Appearance at such Trial.

X. And be it enacted, That where the Party accused resides or is Warrants at the Time beyond the Bounds of the County of Renfrew, and a p^r't^Lut Warrant has been granted to apprehend or to summon him to appear tj)e bounty, to answer to the Complaint, it shall be competent to the Clerk of may be en-’ the Peace or any Justice for the County within which the Accused dorsed by resides or at the Time may be, and they are hereby required, to ciirk'of the endorse such Warrant; and in virtue of such Endorsation any Officer peace of any of the County where the Offence was committed, or where the Party other County resides or may be, may act upon and execute such Warrant; and in where Party like Manner when a Witness proposed to be adduced resides beyond iesides‘

the Bounds of the said County of Renfrew it shall be lawful for any Officer of that County, or of the County where the Witness resides, to cite such Witness, the Warrant or the Copy served on the Accused being first endorsed by the Clerk of the Peace or a Justice for the County where such Witness resides, which Endorsation they are hereby required to make; and such Endorsation may be according to the Form in the Schedule (B.) hereto appended, or in any other Form to the like Effect.

XI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for any Two or Justices may more Justices of the Peace for the said County of Renfrew, after ord<u' summary Trial as aforesaid, and Conviction, to imprison in the House of Correction or Prison, there to be kept to hard Labour for a Period s°Dejlmpr1' not exceeding Sixty Days, all Vagabonds, public Beggars, and idle and disorderly Persons found within the said County who have not a settled Place of Residence and follow no lawful Employment.

XII. And be it enacted, That no Appeal to the Quarter Sessions No Appeal shall be competent from any Judgment pronounced. Deliverance *° Quarter given, or Proceeding had under this Act in any Trial in the summary essions-Form herein provided, nor shall it be competent to bring any such Judgment, Deliverance, or Proceeding under Review of any Superior

Court by Reduction, Advocation, Suspension, or Appeal: Provided always,

620

Proceedings may be written or printed.

Expenses of Act.

[Short Title.]

Interpretation of Terms.

[Public Act.]

Act may be amended &c.

12° & 13° VICTOUIiE, Cap. xlvi.

always, that in Cases proceeding upon a written Complaint under this Act such and the like Appeal shall be allowed as is provided in the Case of any Criminal Offence tried summarily before the Sheriff.

XIII. And be it enacted, That all Proceedings under this Act may be either in Writing or printed, or partly both.

XIV. And be it enacted, That the Expense incurred in preparing and obtaining this Act shall be defrayed out of the Rogue Money of the said County of Renfrew within Five Years after the passing hereof; and the Commissioners of Supply of the said County are hereby required to impose such additional Assessment or Assessments as may be necessary for this Purpose, which Assessments shall be levied with and form Part of the Rogue Money for said County.

XV. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments and Proceedings, and in other Documents, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Renfrewshire Justice of Peace Courts Act, 181-9. "

XVI. And be it enacted, That in this Act the following Words and Expressions shall have the Meanings hereby assigned to them respectively, unless there be something in the Subject or Context repugnant to such Construction; (that is to say,)

Words importing the Singular Number shall include the Plural, and Words importing the Plural Number shall include the Singular Number:

Words importing the Masculine Gender only shall include Females:

The Word "Month" shall mean Calendar Month:

The Word "Justice" shall mean any of Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace for the County of Renfrew.

XVII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

XVIII. And be it enacted, That this Act may be amended or repealed by any Act or Acts to be passed in this present Session of Parliament.

SCHEDULES referred to in the foregoing Act.

SCHEDULE (A.)

Form of Complaint.

Unto the Honourable Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace for the County of Renfrew,

Complains A.B., Procurator Fiscal of Court [or other Party with his Concurrence],

That C.D. has been guilty of the Crime of Actor or Art and Part, in so far as on the Day of

or about that Time, he did [here state the Particulars of the Offence, specifying particularly the Place where the Offence was committed] :

May it therefore please your Honours to grant Warrant to apprehend the said C.D., and to bring him before you [or to cite him to appear before you] to answer to this Libel, and thereafter to [here specify the Punishment concluded for], and to proceed otherwise further in Terms of Law.

A.B.

SCHEDULE (B.)

Deliverance.

[Place and Date.]

Grants Warrant to apprehend and bring C.D. complained upon [or to cite him to appeal] to answer to this Complaint.

E.F., J.P.

Endorsation.

[Place and Date.] Presented to me, and endorsed in Terms of the Statute.

G.H., J.P. Clerk [or Dep.] for shire.

or I.J., J.P. for shire.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. xWi.

SCHEDULE (C.)

Commitment for Trial.

[Place and Date.] Having considered this Complaint, and examined C.D. complained on, grants Warrant to commit him [her or them] to the Prison of for Trial. Appoints the Trial of the said C.D. to take place on or before the Day of and appoints

a Copy of this Complaint to be served on him at least Twenty-four Hours previous to Trial.

E.F., J.P.

SCHEDULE (D.)

Order of Appearance by Officer.

C.D. take notice, That you are required to appear before any Two or more of Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace for the County of Renfrew within [Place of Appearance] upon the Day of

at o’Clock noon, to answer to the Criminal Libel against you to which this Notice is attached.

This Notice served Day of

K.L., Constable.

Execution of Service of Libel by Constable.

A Copy of a Criminal Libel containing a Charge of Theft [or whatever the Crime may be], consisting of Pages, was on the

Day of served by me upon C.D. by delivering

the same to him personally [or otherwise, as the Case may be], on which Copy was marked a Notice of Appearance before any Two or more of Her Majesty's Justices of the Peace for the County of Renfrew to answer to the said Libel within [Place of Appearance], on the Day of at o’Clock

K.L., Constable.

R. S., Witness.

SCHEDULE (E).

Adjournment.

[Place and Date]. Appeared C.D. complained on, who requires a Copy of the Complaint, and that his Trial shall be adjourned as accords with Law.

M.N., J.P.

Procedure.

At the Day of in Presence

of and Esquires, Two

C.D.

M.N., J.P. O.P., J.P.

M.N., J.P. O.P., J.P.
