the Company for the Purposes thereof, in order to the more effectually draining, lighting, and affording Communication from one Side to the other of the said Lines of Railway or any of them, at such Places, to such Extent, and in such Manner as such Owners, Lessees, or Occupiers cotdd or might have made, altered, or maintained the same if this Act had not passed, but subject to the Provisions herein-after contained.

VIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all such Sewers, Drains, Pipes, Crossings, and Communications shall be made and all such Works executed to the reasonable Satisfaction and under the Superintendence of the Engineer of the Company hereby incorporated, and so as not to occasion any Stoppage of or Obstruction or Injury to the Traffic or Passage along the said Railway, or cause any greater Inconvenience to the Company than is absolutely necessary, nor shall any such Sewers, Drains, Pipes, Roads, or Ways, Crossings or Communications, be made so as to interfere with any of the Stations or injuriously with any of the other Works of or belonging to the said Railway for the Time being; and all Losses, Costs, Charges, Damages, and Expenses which shall be done or occasioned by or by reason of the Construction, Maintenance, Use, or Existence of any such Sewers, Drains, Pipes, Roads, or Ways, Crossings or Communications, as last herein-before provided, whether sustained by the Company or other Party using the Railway, shall from Time to Time, when and as often as the same shall happen or arise, be made good to the Company or other Party by w'hom the same shall have been incurred or sustained, by the said Devisees in Trust, their Heirs or Assigns, in case such Sewers, Drains, Pipes, Roads, or Ways, Crossings or Communications, shall have been made by their or any of their Authority or Direction, or by the said Earl of Ellesmere, his Heirs or Assigns, in case such Sewers, Drains, Pipes, Roads, or Ways, Crossings or Communications, shall have been made by his or their or any of their Direction or Authority, or by other the Owners, Lessees, or Occupiers of the said Lands and Mines or any of them, by whose Authority or Directions such Sewers, Drains, Pipes, Roads, or Ways, Crossings or Communications, shall have been made, unless the same shall have happened or arisen by or through the wilful Neglect or Default of the Company or other Party using the Railway, or their or any of their Servants or Agents.

IX. And be it enacted, That in case any Difference shall arise as to the Manner and Time of making such Sewers, Drains, Pipes, Roads, or Ways, Crossings or Communications, or Alterations therein, or the Maintenance thereof, or the Places at which the same shall be made, such Difference shall, subject to the Provisions of this Act, be determined by 'I wo Justices in the Manner provided by the said Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, in case of Difference as to Accommodation Works.

X. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Devisees in Trust and Earl of Ellesmere respectively, and their respective Heirs and Assigns, or other the Owners, Lessees, or Occupiers for the Time being of the said Lands and Mines respectively, to make, construct,

and

659

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. 1.

and lay down, with the Consent of the Railway Commissioners, and for ever thereafter to maintain, collateral Branch Railways, to communicate with the said Extension and Branch Railways hereby authorized to be made or either of them, in manner and subject to the Restrictions and Conditions provided by the Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, with respect to collateral Branch Railways to communicate with the Railway, except and notwithstanding that such collateral Branch Railways may communicate with the said Lines of Railway on an Inclined Plane, and such Communication shall be made so as not to interfere with the Safety of the Public, or to injure the Main Line of Railway.

XI. And whereas it is intended that the said Extension of the As to Con-Ashton and Stalybridge Branch of the Lancashire and Yorkshire struction of Railway shall be carried over several Streets within the said Town of ^Vg'J''Cg^tail Stalybridge, called Rassbottom Street, Wood Street, and Spring streets in Street, upon and by means of Bridges : Be it therefore enacted, That the Town of all Bridges to be erected by the Company for the Purpose of carrying Stalybridge. such last-mentioned Extension Railway over the said several Streets shall be built in conformity with the following Regulations; (that is to say,)

The Bridges shall all be of Brick, Stone, or Iron, or some of those Materials:

The Piers, Pillars, or Abutments and Foundations of every Bridge shall extend and be made below the Surface of the Street to a Depth sufficient to allow the Commissioners for the Time being acting under an Act of Parliament made and passed in the Ninth Year of the Reign of His late Majesty King George the Fourth, intituled An Act for lighting, watching, and otherwise improving the Town of Stalybridge in the Counties Palatine of Lancaster and Chester, and for regulating the Police thereof, and for establishing and regulating a Market and erecting a Market Place within the said Town, (in citing or referring to which last-mentioned Act in this Act it shall in all Cases be sufficient to use the Expression " The Stalybridge Police and Market Act, 1828,") to make and construct any Sinks, Drains,

Sewers, or Watercourses, and to lay and deposit any Main or other Pipes, which under or by virtue of any Act or Acts of Parliament or otherwise they are authorized to make and construct or lay down and deposit in the Street over which such Bridge shall be made:

The inside Face of the Pier or Abutment of the Bridge over Rassbottom Street shall be lineable with the North-easterly Side of that Street when such Street is made straight on the Northeasterly Side thereof as herein-after mentioned, and the inside Face of the South-westerly Pier or Abutment shall be built parallel with the North-easterly Pier or Abutment at a Distance from the inside Face of such North-easterly Pier of not less than Forty-eight Feet on the Square:

The inside Face of the Piers or Abutments of the Bridges over Wood Street and Spring Street shall be parallel with the Buildings on each Side of the Street, and if there be no Buildings then with the Side of the Street:

The

fi60

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. 1.

The Top of every Bridge shall be made and for ever afterwards maintained drop-dry:

The Bridge over Rassbotlom Street shall be an horizontal Beam Bridge of One Span only, and the clear, open, and uninterrupted Span of such Bridge, exclusive of all Piers, Abutments, and other Encroachments of every Description, shall in no Place be less than Forty-eight Feet wide on the Square; and the said Bridge shall be of such a Height from the present Surface of the Carriage Road beneath as to leave under every Part of such Bridge over such Carriage Road a clear, open, and uninterrupted Space or Headway of not less than Eighteen Feet in Height:

The Bridge over Wood Street shall be an horizontal Beam Bridge of One Span only, and the clear, open, and uninterrupted Span of such Bridge, exclusive of all Piers, Abutments, and other Encroachments of every Description, shall in no Place be less than Twenty-five Feet wide on the Square; and the said Bridge shall be of such a Height from the present Surface of the Carriage Road beneath as to leave under every Part of such Bridge over such Carriage Road a clear, open, ana uninterrupted Space or Headway of not less than Sixteen Feet in Height:

The Bridge over Spring Street shall be an horizontal Beam Bridge of One Span only, and the clear, open, and uninterrupted Span of such Bridge, exclusive of all Piers, Abutments, and other Encroachments of every Description, shall in no Place be less than Thirty Feet wide on the Square; and the said Bridge shall be of such a Height from the present Surface of the Carriage Road beneath as to leave under every Part of such Bridge over such Carriage Road a clear, open, and uninterrupted Space or Headway of not less than Sixteen Feet in Height:

The Company shall erect and for ever maintain on the higher or North-west Side of the said Bridges over Rassbottom Street, Wood Street, and Spring Street respectively, a good, substantial, and close Fence not less than Six Feet high, and shall continue such Fence in a Westerly Direction from Rassbottom Street for the Distance of Thirty Yards.

XV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Company to and they are hereby required, before opening the said Extension of purchase the Ashton and Stalybridge Branch of the Lancashire and Yorkshire Land In Railway to the Public, at their own Expense to purchase so much ®r ew'street Land as shall be necessary for forming a new Street of Ten Yards of Ten Yards wide, commencing at Wood Street aforesaid, and terminating at and wide, communicating with Spring Street aforesaid, parallel with and adjoining to the said intended Extension Railway, and to pull down all

Houses and other Buildings necessary to open and form such Street; provided nevertheless, that if there shall happen to be less Space than Ten Yards in Width at any particular Point between the said Railway and Back Cross Street, the Company shall at that particular Point only be required to purchase and bare the Space lying between the said Railway and Back Cross Street, and when and so soon as the Land necessary for making such intended new Street in manner aforesaid shall have been provided and laid open by the said Company as aforesaid, it shall be lawful for the Commissioners for the Time being acting under the Stalybridge Police and Market Act, 1828, and they are hereby empowered, to make, form, pave, and sewer the same new Street to such Level, with such Materials, and in such Manner and Form in all respects, as they shall think proper; and for effectuating all or any of the Purposes aforesaid, as well as for the Purposes of for ever thereafter keeping the same Street and all Sewers therein in good Repair and Condition, the said Commissioners are hereby fully authorized and empowered to pay and apply for all or any of such Purposes all or any Part of the Funds from Time to Time under their Control, and applicable, under the Provisions of the Stalybridge Police and Market Act, 1828, for the paving, sewering, and draining of public Streets and Highways within the said Town of Stalybridge.

XX. And whereas the Ashton Branch of the Manchester, Sheffield, and Lincolnshire Railway communicates with the Line of the Huddersfield and Manchester Railway at or near the Terminus thereof at Stalybridge, and for a considerable Distance runs parallel with and at a short Distance from the said Ashton and Stalybridge Branch of the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company, and a good and convenient Connexion or Communication could be effected between the said Ashton and Stalybridge Branch and the said Huddersfield and Manchester Railway if a Junction were formed between the said Ashton and Stalybridge Branch and the said Ashton Branch on Land belonging to the said Companies or One of them, and if such Junction Railway, and so much of the last-mentioned Branch as lies between the Point thereof at which such Junction would be effected and the said Huddersfield and Manchester Railway, were open to the Traffic of the said Companies, and all Companies and Persons claiming under or though them; and the Manchester, Sheffield, and Lincolnshire Railway Company are willing to effect such Connexion or Communication, if assisted by the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company: Be it therefore enacted, That if the said Manchester, Sheffield, and Lincolnshire Railway Company shall, on or before the First Day of July One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine, on Lands belonging to them and to the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company, or to one of them, and lying between their said respective Branches at or near the Westward End of their respective Stations at Stalybridge, lay down Rails and construct all necessary and proper Works so as to form a good Railway Junction by a double Line of Rails practicable for Engines and Carriages between the said Ashton and Stalybridge Branch and the said Ashton Branch, all the Powers by this Act'conferred upon the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company for making the said Extension of the said Ashton and Stalybridge Branch to the Huddersfield and Manchester Railway shall cease and determine; and, until Default shall have been made by the said Manchester, Sheffield, and Lincolnshire Railway Company in making the said Junction according to the true Intent and Meaning hereof, it shall not be lawful for the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company to exercise any of the said Powers for making the said Extension, anything herein-before contained to the contrary notwithstanding; and from and after the Construction of the said Junction it shall be lawful for the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company, and all other Companies and Persons claiming under or authorized by them, to use the said Junction, and so much of the said Ashton Branch as lies between the Point thereof at which such Junction shall be effected and the said Huddersfield and Manchester Railway and the Passenger Station, with

12° & 13° VICTORIA, CapA.

Huddersfield, and Sheffield Junction Railway Company and the Huddersfield and Manchester Railway and Canal Company, Provision was made for the Use of a Portion of the Line of Railway of the said last-mentioned Company lying between the Point of Junction at Paddock and the Station at Huddersfield, including the Huddersfield Tunnel, and also of the Station of the said last-mentioned Company at Huddersfield, in common by the said Two Companies, on certain Terms, to be settled by Arbitration in the Manner prescribed by the said last-mentioned Act: And whereas no Award has been made in pursuance of the Provisions of the said Acts and of the said Agreement in that Behalf, but the Terms of such common Use of the said Portion of the said Line and of the said Station by the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company (with which the said Huddersfield and Sheffield Junction Railway Company is now incorporated) and the London and North-western Railway' Company (with which the said Huddersfield and Manchester Railway and Canal Company is now incorporated), and the Proportion of the Costs of Construction of the said Portion of the said Line and of the said Station to be paid by the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company to the said London and North-western Railway Company, have been settled and mutually agreed upon by the said last-mentioned Companies: And whereas the estimated Expense of making the said Branch and Extension Railways and Alteration of Levels hereby authorized is Fifty thousand Pounds, and there will be required for the Purpose of paying such Proportion as aforesaid of the Costs of Construction and otherwise relating to the said Line and Station at Huddersfield a further Capital not exceeding Sixty thousand Pounds: And whereas it is expedient that the Company should be enabled to raise for the Purposes authorized by the several Acts relating to their Undertakings, or some of them, a further Sum of Money not exceeding Four hundred and fifty thousand Pounds : And whereas the aggregate Amount of the said several Sums is Five hundred and sixty thousand Pounds: Be it therefore enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, at any Time or from Time to Time, by an Order of any General or Special General Meeting of the Company, to raise such Sums of Moneyas they shall from Time to Time deem expedient, not exceeding in the whole the Sum of Five hundred and sixty thousand Pounds, in addition to the Monies authorized to be raised by the several Acts relating to their Undertakings, or any of them, or by virtue of any other Act or Acts of Parliament; and all and every Part of such Sum of Money so to be raised shall be applied to the Purposes for which the same is herein-before authorized to be raised, and to no other Purpose whatsoever.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That for the Purpose of raising such Sums of Money the Company may issue such and so many distinct Shares, of such Amount, and to be appropriated and disposed of in such Manner, and to such Person or Persons, and on such Conditions, and with such Preference or Priority of Dividend, not exceeding after tile Rate of Ten Pounds per Centum per Annum, and generally on such Terms as by the Order of any such Meeting of the Company shall be determined; or it shall be lawful for the Company, if they think fit, to raise such Sums of Money or any Part thereof by Mortgage of [Local.] 8 F their

their several Undertakings; and all the Provisions contained in or referred to by the Manchester and Leeds Railway Act, 1841, with regard to the Capital and Monies thereby authorized to be raised by Shares or Mortgage, and to the Proprietors thereof, shall in all respects (subject to the Provisions herein contained, and to the Order of any General or Special General Meeting of the Company) be applicable to the Capital and Monies hereby authorized to be raised by Shares or Mortgage, and to the Proprietors thereof; and all the Provisions contained in the Manchester and Leeds Railway Act,

1844, authorizing the Company to consolidate their existing Shares into a General Capital Stock, shall, subject to the Provisions herein contained, be applicable to the Shares hereby authorized to be created by the Company; provided that until the whole of the Capital for the Time being of the Company shall have been subscribed, and One Half thereof paid up, it shall not be lawful for the Company to raise such Sums or any Portion thereof by Mortgage; and provided also, that the Company shall not by any such Means increase the Amount which may be owing at any One Time on Mortgage of their Undertakings beyond the Proportion of One Third of their then existing Capital in Shares and Stock.

XXV. Provided also, and be it enacted, That the Certificate of a Justice that the whole of the Capital for the Time being of the Company has been subscribed, and One Half thereof paid up (which Certificate such Justice is legally authorized and required to grant, on Application made to him by the Company, and on such Proof of the Facts as he may require), and a Copy of the Order of any General or Special General Meeting of the Company authorizing the borrowing of any Money, certified by One of the Directors or by the Secretary of the Company, shall respectively and for all Purposes whatsoever be conclusive Evidence of the Fact of the Capital required to be subscribed and paid up as aforesaid having been so subscribed and paid up, and of the Fact of the Order for borrowing the Money having been made.

XXVI. Provided further, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages already granted under the Powers of the several Acts relating to the Undertakings of the Company, or any of them, shall, during the Continuance thereof, have Priority over the Mortgages granted under this Act.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That all the Powers, Provisions, Matters, and Things contained in the several Acts relating to the Undertakings of the Company, or any of them, with regard to the Use of the Railways by the said Acts authorized to be made, and to the demanding, levying, and recovering of Tolls in respect thereof (except such of them as by the Lands Clauses Consolidation Act,

1845, or the Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, or by this Act, or any other Act, are repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, or as have expired by Effluxion of Time,) shall extend to this Act, and to the Use and Protection of the Railways and Works hereby authorized to be made, and the demanding, levying, and recovering of Tolls in respect thereof, and generally shall operate and be in force

667

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. I.

in reference thereto as fully and effectually as if the same Provisions, Matters, and Things were repeated and re-enacted in this Act, and had specific Reference thereto, and to the Railways and Works hereby authorized.

XXVIII. And be it enacted, That the Tolls to be taken by the Company for and in respect of the Branch or Extension Railways by this Act authorized shall not exceed the Tolls authorized to be taken by " The West Riding Union Railways Act, 1840."

XXIX. And be it enacted, That the Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, and the Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1S15, save as to such Parts thereof as may be modified by or be inconsistent with the Provisions of this Act, shall be incorporated with this Act.

XXX. And whereas by the Liverpool and Bury Railway Act, 1846, the Company were authorized to make (among other Works) a Branch or Extension Railway, being the Branch or Extension Railway herein-before mentioned, commencing at or near the intended Terminus of the Liverpool and Bury Railway at or near Love Lane in the Township and Parish of Liverpool, and terminating at or near the Junction of Tythe Barn Street and Key Street in the same Parish and Township, and by the same Act it was provided that the Powers of the Company for the compulsory Purchase or taking of Lands for the Purposes of that Act should not be exercised after the Expiration of Three Years from the passing thereof, and it is expedient that the Time so limited, so far as regards the said last-mentioned Branch or Extension Railway, should be extended : Be it enacted, That all the Powers by the said Act, or any Act incorporated therewith, granted for the compulsory Purchase or taking of Lands for the Purposes of the said last-mentioned Branch or extended Railway, shall and may be exercised by the Company at any Time within Two Years from the passing of this Act; provided that such Extension of Time shall not alter or affect the Rights, Powers, Provisions, and Directions contained in the " Liverpool, Ormskirk, and Preston Railway Act, 1846," in relation to the common Ownership of the said last-mentioned Branch and Extension Railway by the Company and the East Lancashire Railway Company (wherewith the Liverpool, Ormskirk, and Preston Railway Company is now incorporated), or as to the Cost of Construction, Management, Maintenance, Repairs, and Conduct thereof by the said Two Companies, but such Powers, Provisions, and Directions shall be and remain in full Force and Effect, anything herein contained notwithstanding.

XXXI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Extension hereby authorized of the Period for the compulsory Purchase or taking of Lands for the Purposes of the said last-mentioned Branch or Extension Railway shall not in anywise prejudice or affect any Contract entered into or Notice given by the said Company before the passing of this Act for purchasing, taking, or using any Lands which, under the said Liverpool and Bury Railway Act, 1846, such Company is

XXXII. Provided also, and be it enacted, That the Justices, Arbitrators, Umpires, or Juries respectively, as the Case may be, who, under the Provisions of the said Liverpool and Bury Railway Act, 1846, shall award or assess the Compensation to be made by the Company to the Owners or Occupiers of or other Persons interested in any of the Lands which shall be taken or used for the Purposes of the said Branch or Extension Railway or Works by the said last-mentioned Acts authorized, or which may be injuriously affected by the Construction thereof, shall, in estimating the Amount of such Compensation, have regard to and make Compensation for the additional Damage (if any) sustained by such Owners, Occupiers, or other Persons by reason of the Extension hereby authorized of the Period aforesaid.

XXXIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company, at any Time, and from Time to Time after the passing of this Act, to exercise all Powers with reference to the raising of Money by Mortgage which may have been granted to the Wakefield, Pontefract, and Goole Railway Company (now amalgamated with the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company) by the Acts relating to such Company, or any of them, and which may be then in force, and for such Purpose to mortgage or assign all the Undertakings, and the Rates, Tolls, or other Property of the Company, including the Railways and Undertakings authorized by the said Acts relating to the Wakefield, Pontefract, and Goole Railway Company; provided that no Mortgage already granted by the Company shall be prejudiced or affected by this Provision, or by any Mortgage thereunder or by virtue thereof.

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That if the Company shall pay off all or any Part of any Money which has been or shall at any Time or Times hereafter be borrowed under the Authority of the several Acts of Parliament relating to the said Wakefield, Pontefract, and Goole Railway Company, or any of such Acts, then and in every such Case it shall be lawful for the Company, and they are hereby authorized and empowered, immediately, or at any Time or Times, and from Time to Time thereafter, again to raise or borrow the whole or any Part of the Amount so paid off on the Credit of the several Undertakings vested in them, and for that Purpose to mortgage and assign the Undertakings, and the Rates, Tolls, or other Property of the Company, or any Part thereof respectively, as a Security for any Sum of Money which shall be so again raised or borrowed, with Interest, to such Person as shall advance the same, and so from Time to Time as often as the same shall happen; provided that no Mortgage already granted by the Company shall be prejudiced or affected by this Provision, or by any Mortgage thereunder or by virtue thereof.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. 1. 669

XXXV. And whereas by the herein-before recited "Lancashire Power and Yorkshire Railway Act, 1848," it was enacted, that, with the Con- Lancashire sent and subject to the Restrictions therein mentioned, it should be aiM| York-lawful for the Company at any Time, and from Time to Time, to shire Kail-convert, divide, and distribute the whole, or any such Part as should way Act, be deemed expedient, of the Share Capital of the Company into such Number of new Shares (either wholly paid up or partly paid up) of pjta| to ex-such nominal Amount as should be deemed expedient; and it is tend to fu-expedient that the Power thereby granted as to the then existing ,ure Capital. Share Capital of the Company should be extended to any future or additional Share Capital which may become Part of the Capital of the Company by reason of the Purchase of or Amalgamation with any Undertaking or Undertakings which the Company is now empowered to purchase or amalgamate with, by virtue or under the Authority of any Act or Acts of Parliament already passed in that Behalf, and also to the Capital by this Act authorized to be raised : Be it therefore enacted, That all the Powers and Provisions granted by and contained in the said " Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Act, 1848," relating to the Conversion, Division, and Distribution of the Share Capital of the Company into new Shares, shall be deemed to apply to such future or additional Capital as aforesaid, and the Company shall have Power, with such Consent, and subject to such Restrictions as in the said last-recited Act are mentioned, to convert, divide, and distribute such future or additional Share Capital in like Manner as by that Act is provided with respect to the then existing Share Capital of the Company.

XXXVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Com- Power to pany, at any Time, and from Time to Time, with the Consent of n!akt‘ Ar~ Three Fifths of the Votes of the Shareholders present in Person or ™§a"ffen_tS by Proxy at any General Meeting of the Company specially convened rent Classei for the Purpose, to make with the Holders of any Class or Classes of of Share-Shares (not being Shares entitled to any perpetual, guaranteed, or l,olllt'rs-preferential Dividends, and to which it is hereby declared that the Provisions in this Behalf of the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway

Act, 1848, do not apply), either in the existing Share Capital of the Company, or in any Share Capital which, under the Authority of any Act or Acts now in force, or of this Act, or of any other Act or Acts to be passed in this Session, shall be or become Part of the Capital of the Company, any Arrangements, or any Alterations in or Variations of existing Arrangements, as to such Shares and the Rights attaching thereto respectively, (whether as to Interest, Dividends, or otherwise,) or for the Assimilation thereof to other Shares of the Company; provided that the nominal Amount of the whole Capital of the Company as then constituted shall not be altered by any such Arrangements as aforesaid, and that no Class of Shareholders shall be affected thereby unless and until a Majority of Four Fifths of the Votes of the Shareholders present in Person or by Proxy at a Meeting of the particular Class of Shareholders liable to be so affected shall have consented to the Arrangements proposed by the Company in respect to such Class of Shareholders; provided also, that this Enactment shall apply to the Shareholders of any Company or Companies which, under and by virtue of any Act or Acts now in force,

shall hereafter be incorporated with and become Part of the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company, and who after such Incorporation will become and be Shareholders of the said Company.

XXXVII. And be it enacted, That the Company may cause Meetings of the respective Classes of Shareholders liable to be affected by any such Arrangements to be specially convened for the Purpose of considering and assenting to such Arrangements; and that the Provisions for calling and regulating Special General Meetings of the Company, and foi- voting at General Meetings of the Company, shall, so far as applicable, be deemed to apply to such Meetings as aforesaid of particular Classes of Shareholders; and that a circular Notice of any such intended Meeting, stating the Object of such Meeting, signed by the Secretary, shall be sent by Post to each registered Shareholder of the Class to be affected, according to the Address in the Register of Shareholders; and that the Decision of Four Fifths of the Votes of the Shareholders of the particular Class present in person or by Proxy at any such Meeting shall be binding on all the Shareholders of that Class, and the Arrangements so made and confirmed shall be valid and binding on all the Shareholders of the Company.

XXXVIII. And be it enacted, That all Rights and Privileges which by virtue of any such Arrangement as aforesaid, or of any Arrangement made under the Authority of " The Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Act, 1848," may be applied or attached to any Class of Shares, may be declared to attach and shall accordingly apply or attach also to any new Shares to be created by the Division of any existing Shares, in like Manner as they might have been applied or attached to such new Shares if such Division as aforesaid had been made previously to the passing of the said " Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Act, 1848."

XXXIX. And whereas by " The Manchester and Leeds Railway Act, 1839," it was (among other things) enacted, that it should he lawful for the said Manchester and Leeds Railway Company, in lieu of the Rates or Tolls authorized to be received by them by the therein first-recited Act, to demand, receive, and recover, to and for the Use and Benefit of the said Company, for the Tonnage and Tollage of all Passengers, Beasts, Cattle, Animals, Carriages, Materials, Goods, Wares, Merchandize, and all other Articles, Matters, and Things which should be conveyed upon or along the therein-mentioned extended Line of Railway, and the Line of Railway connecting the same with the Main Line of Railway, or any Part thereof, (being One Mile and a Quarter from the Victoria Station at Manchester,) any Sum or Sums of Money not exceeding in each Case Double the Amount which by the said therein first-recited Act the said Company were authorized to receive in respect of' such Tonnage or Tollage: And whereas the Right to demand and take such Double Tolls was granted to the said Company in consideration of the great Expense of making, maintaining, and working the Extension Railway thereby authorized, but Doubts have arisen whether the Right to take such Double Tolls now exists, and it is expedient that such Doubts should be removed:

o Be

12° & 13° VI CTO RLE, Cap. 1. <>71

Be It therefore enacted and declared, That it shall be lawful for the Company to demand, receive, and take, in respect of the said extended Line of Railway by the said recited Act authorized, and the Line of Railway before mentioned connecting the same with the Main Line of Railway, or any Part thereof, a Rate of Tollage or Tonnage not exceeding Double the Amount of the maximum Rate of Tonnage or Tollage which the said Company now are or at any Time hereafter may be authorized to take and receive in respect of the Main Line of Railway of which it is such Extension as aforesaid, and that the Right of the Company to demand and take such Double Rate in respect of the said Extension shall not be deemed to have been altered or affected by any Act passed since the passing of the said Manchester and Leeds Railway Act, 183Q.

XL. And be it enacted, That from and after the passing of this Company Act it shall be lawful for the Company, subject to the Provisions and mil3' ,r

Limitations contained in " The West Riding Union Railways Act, vary 01 s' 1846," and this Act, from Time to Time to alter or vary the Tolls by the said recited Acts and this Act authorized to be taken, either upon the whole or upon any particular Portions of their Railways, as they shall think fit; provided that all such Tolls be at all Times charged equally to all Persons, and after the same Rate, whether per Ton per Mile or otherwise, in respect of all Passengers, and of all Goods or Carriages of the same Description, and conveyed or propelled by a like Carriage or Engine, passing only over the same Portion of the Line of Railway under the same Circumstances; and no Reduction or Advance in any such Tolls shall be made, either directly or indirectly, in favour of or against any particular Company or Person travelling upon or using the Railway.

XLI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing in this Saving Act contained shall prejudice, diminish, alter, or take away any of of the Rights, Privileges, Exemptions, Powers, or Authorities vested in caa^irt,u"' the East Lancashire Railway Company by any existing Act of Railway Parliament, or under any Contract or Agreement now subsisting Company, between the last-named Company and the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company, touching the Portion of the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway between the Junction therewith of the East Lancashire Railway at Clifton and Salford and the Portion of the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway between the Junction therewith of the East Lancashire Railway at or near Wallon-on-the-Hill and Liverpool, and the Stations, Warehouses, Buildings, and Conveniences connected therewith respectively, hut the same shall remain and be as good, valid, and effectual to all Intents and Purposes whatsoever as if this Act had not been passed.

XLII. Provided also, and be it enacted, That nothing in this Act For l'rotcc-contained shall or shall be held to repeal, modify, or alter the t

cliester and Leeds Railway Act, No. 3., 1847," and is not altered or modified by the Provision herein-before contained authorizing the Company to take Double Tolls in respect of the Extension Line into Manchester herein-before referred to; and further, that nothing in this Act contained shall or shall be held to repeal, modify, or alter the Thirty-fourth and Thirty-fifth Sections respectively of " The Manchester a?id Leeds Railway Act, No. 3., 1847," the Sixty-seventh Section of " The Manchester and Leeds Railway Act, 1846," and the Fifty-ninth Section of " The Sheffield, Rotherham, Barnsley, Wakefield, Huddersfield, and Goole Railway Act, 1846," respectively, as printed by Her Majesty's Printer, or any or either of them.

XLIII. And be it enacted, That all the Provisions of the "Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," with respect to the Payment of Subscriptions, and the Means of enforcing the Payment of Calls, and the Forfeiture of Shares for the Nonpayment thereof, shall be applied to all Shares in the existing or future Capital of the Company, and shall be substituted tor any Provisions for the like Purposes or in the like Behalf contained in the several existing Acts relating to the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway or any Part thereof; provided that nothing herein contained shall affect any Proceeding which may have been commenced under the Provisions of such existing Acts prior to the passing of this Act.

XLIV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That instead of proceeding to forfeit any Shares it shall be lawful for the Directors, in any Case where in their Opinion any Shares if sold would not produce a sufficient Sum to discharge the Arrears of Calls thereon, to agree with the Proprietor thereof for the Surrender of the same to the Company on such Terms as the Directors shall think fit; and after such Surrender, which may be made by Deed Poll under the Hand and Seal of the Proprietor, the Shares so surrendered shall merge in and form Part of the Capital of the Undertaking.

XLV. Provided also, and be it enacted, That in all Cases where any Share shall be declared forfeited, and such Declaration of Forfeiture shall be confirmed at a General Meeting of the Company in the Manner prescribed by the " Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," and Notice shall be given by the Company in the London Gazette and in Two Newspapers circulating respectively in the Counties of Lancaster and York of such Forfeiture, that in case the Arrears of Calls and Interest due thereon shall not be paid within the Space of One Calendar Month from the Publication of such Notice such Share will become merged in the Capital of the Company, then, in case such Arrears and Interest shall not be paid within such last-mentioned Period, and the Market Price of Shares of the same Class in the Company in the City of London upon which the same Amount shall have been paid shall then, or at any Time during the said Period of One Calendar Month, be less than the Arrears of Calls and Interest due in respect of such Shares, the same Share shall absolutely merge in the Capital of the Company; and a Declaration in Writing, made by some credible Person not interested, before any Justice of the Peace, or before any Master or Master Extraordinary in the High

Court

673

12° & 13° VICTORIA, CapA.

Court of Chancery, stating that a Sum of Money sufficient to pay the Arrears of Calls and the Interest due in respect of such Share could not be obtained for the same according to the Market Price of Shares in the City of London, shall be sufficient Evidence of the Facts therein stated; and the Proprietor of such Share shall from and after the making of such Declaration be precluded from all Right, Title, or Interest therein; but nevertheless such Forfeiture and Merger shall not affect or alter the^ Liability of the last Proprietor of any such Share to pay to the said Company the Arrears of Calls and Interest due in respect of such Share, after deducting therefrom the Market Value of such Share according to the Market Price of Shares in the City of London at the Time of such Merger as aforesaid, or the Powers of the Company to enforce Payment thereof by Action.

XLVI. And be it enacted, That in lieu and instead of any Shares Company which shall be so surrendered or forfeited and merged as aforesaid may issue it shall be lawful for the Company from Time to Time, with the fne^e^h®[.es Approbation of Three Fifths at least of the Votes of the Proprietors shares present in Person or by Proxy at any General Meeting of the Com- merged in pany specially convened for that Purpose, to create and issue such Company, new Shares, of such Amount, and with such Preference or Priority of Dividend, not exceeding after the Rate of Ten Pounds per Centum per Annum, and generally on such Terms as by the Order of any such Meeting shall be determined; provided that the aggregate Amount to be raised by the Issue of any such new Shares shall not exceed the aggregate Amount left unpaid on the old Shares in lieu of which such new Shares shall be issued at the Time of the Surrender, Forfeiture, or Merger as aforesaid of such old Shares.

XLVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for any Share- Shareholders holder, with the Consent of and subject to any Conditions or Lirnita- Pa3'ins Calls tion prescribed by a General Meeting of the Company, to pay up any be entitled Share (of any Class) in full, by anticipation or in advance, and such to parti-Share so paid up shall be convertible into Stock, and the Holder cipate in thereof shall be entitled to receive Dividends thereon as on a Share Dividends, paid up in full, and as if the Amount thereof had been paid up on Calls duly made.

XLVIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That any Priority in Saving the Payment of Dividends which may be assigned to any Shares to be created by virtue of this Act shall not prejudice or affect any Priority existing Prein the Payment of Dividends which may have been assigned to any ference other Shares in the Company created prior to the passing of this Act, Shares, but the Holders of such last-mentioned Shares shall be entitled to receive Dividends upon or in respect of such Shares to the Extent to which the same may have been guaranteed, in preference to the Holders of any other Shares in the said Company.

XLIX. Provided always, and be it enacted, That Five Pounds per Calls.

Share shall be the greatest Amount of any One Call which the Company may make on the Shareholders in respect of the Money by this Act authorized to be raised, and Three Months at the least shall be the Interval between successive Calls.

674

Voting.

Power to enter into Agreements with the London and Northwestern Railway Company.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, CapX

L. And whereas different Scales of voting are prescribed by the several Acts originally incorporating the several Companies now forming the Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company, and it is expedient that One uniform Scale of voting should be prescribed : Be it therefore enacted, That at all General Meetings of the Company, and at all Meetings of any particular Class of Shareholders in the Company, every Shareholder shall have One Vote for each and every entire One hundred Pounds of the aggregate nominal Amount of all Stock and Shares (of any and whatever Class or Classes, or of the particular Class, as the Case may be,) held by him; and in case the whole aggregate nominal Amount of all the Stock and Shares held by any Shareholder shall not be equal to One hundred Pounds of nominal Amount, but shall be equal to Fifty Pounds, then he shall have One Vote in respect of all his Stock and Shares; and in all other respects all and singular the Provisions of the " Companies Clauses Consolidation i\ct, 1845," in relation to voting, shall be applicable and shall apply to all the Shareholders of the Company.

LI. And whereas, not only at Huddersfield aforesaid, but in other Places, the Railways and Works of the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company are connected with those of the said London and North-western Railway Company, and it would be for the Convenience of the Public and of the said Companies if the said Companies were authorized to enter into Agreements from Time to Time with respect to the Construction, Enlargement, Alteration, Maintenance, Use, Apportionment, and Management as well of the said Portion of Line and Station at Huddersfield as of other Portions of their respective Lines and Works so connected as aforesaid, and as to the Receipt and Apportionment of the Tolls and Charges arising therefrom, and generally as to the Conveyance and Interchange of Traffic upon their respective Undertakings : Be it therefore enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Lancashire and Yorkshire Railway Company and the said London and North-western Railway Company from Time to Time to make and enter into such Agreements as they shall deem advisable concerning the Construction, Alteration, Enlargement, Apportionment, Maintenance, Use, Enjoyment, Control, and Management, not only of the said Portion of Railway and Station at Huddersfield aforesaid, but also of any other Portions of their respective Undertakings which for the Time being communicate or are connected with each other, and as to the Receipt and Apportionment of the Tolls and Charges arising or derived therefrom, and generally as to the Conveyance and Interchange of Traffic upon their respective Railways or any Part thereof: Provided always, that no such Agreement shall in any Manner alter, affect, increase, or diminish any of the Tolls which the said respective Companies shall for the Time being be respectively authorized and entitled to demand or receive from any Person or any other Company, but that all other Persons and Companies shall, notwithstanding any such Agreements, be entitled to the Use and Benefit of such respective Railways or Portions of Railways, upon the same Terms and Conditions, and on Payment of the same Tolls, as they would have been in case no such Agreement had been entered into.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap A.

LII. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Company, out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the said Company authorized to be raised by Calls in respect of Shares, or by the Exercise of any Power of borrowing, to pay Interest or Dividend to any Shareholder on the Amount of the Calls made in respect of the Shares held by him in the Capital by this Act authorized to be raised : Provided always, that nothing hereiii-before contained shall be deemed to prevent the said Company from paying to any Shareholder such Interest on Money advanced by him beyond the Amount of the Calls actually made as shall be in conformity with the Provisions in "The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," in that Behalf contained.

LIII. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Company, out of any Money by this Act or an}' other Act relating to the said Company authorized to be raised for the Purposes of such Act or Acts, to pay or deposit any Sum of Money which by any Standing Order of either Plouse of Parliament now in force or hereafter to be in force may be required to be deposited in respect of any Application to Parliament for the Purpose of obtaining an Act authorizing the said Company to construct any other Railway or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

LIV. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide for the Conveyance of the Mails by Railways; and another Act was passed in the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating Railways; and another Act was passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for the better Regulation of Railways, and for the Conveyance of Troops; and another Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Conditions to the Construction of future Railways authorized or to be authorized by any Act of the present or succeeding Sessions of Parliament,' and far other Purposes in relation to Railways; and another Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her said present Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways; and another Act was passed in the same Session, intituled An Act for constituting Commissioners of Railways : Be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall be held to exempt the said Railway or the said Company from the Provisions of the said several Acts respectively, but that such Provisions shall be in force in respect of the said Railway and Company so far as the same are applicable.

LV. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Railways by this or the said recited Acts authorized to be made or the Company from the Provisions of any general Act relating to such Acts, or of any general Act relating to Railways, or to the better and more impartial Audit of the Accounts of Railway Companies, now in force or which may hereafter pass during this or any future Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision and Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament,

LVI. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expetises of and attending the passing of this Act or incidental thereto shall be paid by the said Company pari passu with the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of any other Act of Parliament passed in the present Session of Parliament to which they may be liable, out of the first Monies that shall come to their Hands, and in preference to any other Payments whatsoever.

LVII. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

ANNO DUODECIMO & DECIMO TERTIO

VICTORIA REGIME.

Cap. li.

An Act for improving the Approaches to the Charing Cross Bridge on the Surrey Side thereof, and for amending the Acts relating thereto; for authorizing the raising of a further Sum of Money; and for other Purposes.

[13th July 1819.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Sixth and Seventh Years of the Reign of His late Majesty King William the Fourth, intituled An Act for building a Foot Bridge over the River Thames from Hungerford Market in the Parish of Saint Martin in the Fields in the County of Middlesex to the opposite Shore in the Parish of Lambeth in the County of Surrey, and for making suitable Approaches thereto; and by the said Act certain Persons were incorporated by the Name of " The Hungerford and Lambeth Suspension Foot Bridge Company," for carrying into execution the saiil Undertaking: And whereas an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Sixth and Seventh Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to amend an Act relating to the building of the Hungerford and Lambeth Suspension Foot Bridge, and for granting further Powers to " The Hungerford and Lambeth Suspension Foot Bridge Company [Loca/.] 8 K And

6 & 7 W. i. c. 133.

6 &- 7 Vict, c. 19.

682

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. li.

And whereas the said Bridge was, under the Powers of the said recited Acts, completed and opened for public Use : And whereas an Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Eighth 8 & 9 Vict, and Ninth Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An c-62- Act to amend the Acts relating to the Hungerford and Lambeth Suspension Foot Bridge Company, hereafter to be called " The Charing Cross Bridge Company," by which Act the Hungerford and Lambeth Suspension Foot Bridge Company, incorporated by the said first-recited Act, were directed and required to take and use the Name and Style of " The Charing Cross Bridge Company," and to alter their Common Seal, and do all other Acts consequent upon such Change of Name : And whereas by the said last-recited Act the said Company were authorized to make new Approaches to the said Bridge on the Surrey Side thereof from the Belvidere Road in the Parish of Lambeth otherwise Saint Mary Lambeth into Sutton Street in the said Parish, and from the Belvidere Road into Vine Street and the York Road in the same Parish, and to raise by the Creation of Shares and by Mortgage further Monies for the Formation thereof: And whereas it would improve the Approaches to the said Bridge and facilitate the Access thereto from the Waterloo Station of the London and South-western Railway if the Line of the Approaches authorized by the said Third-recited Act were altered, and a more direct Approach made from the present Approach to the said Bridge in the Belvidere Road into the York Road, between Sutton Street and Vine Street in the said Parish of Lambeth, and the said Company are willing and desirous to make such improved Approach : And whereas it is expedient that the Company should be authorized to raise a further Sum of Money for the Formation of the said proposed Approach, and also for the general Purposes of the Company, and that some of the Powers and Provisions of the said recited Acts should be altered, amended, and enlarged, and that further Powers should be granted to the Company : And whereas the several beneficial Purposes aforesaid cannot be effected without the Aid and Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament Provisions of assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions recited Acts contained in the said recited Acts or either of them, or in the Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, incorporated therewith, (so far as tended *o the same are now unrepealed, and except such of them as are by

this Act. this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, or as are incon-

sistent with the Provisions of this Act) shall extend to this Act and to the several Purposes thereof, and to the several Matters and Things hereby authorized to be done, as fully and effectually to all Intents and Purposes as if the same Provisions were re-enacted in this Act with reference to such Purposes, Matters, and Things; and the said recited Act, and the Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845, incorporated therewith, and this Act, shall, as to all Matters and Things whatsoever, except as aforesaid, be read and construed together as One Act.

[Short Title.]

II. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in any Act of Parliament, in legal Instruments or Proceedings, or in Notices,

Adver-

683

12" & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. li.

Advertisements, or other like Documents, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Charing Cross Bridge Approaches Act, 1849."

III. And whereas under the said first-recited Act the said Company were authorized to raise the Sum of Eighty thousand Pounds by the Creation of Shares, the whole of which said Sum of Eighty thousand Pounds has been paid up, and to borrow on Mortgage of the Undertaking the Sum of Twenty-six thousand Pounds, of which the Sum of Twenty-one thousand Pounds only is now owing on the Credit thereof: And whereas by the said secondly-recited Act the said Company were authorized to raise a further Sum of Fifty thousand Pounds by the Creation of new Shares, no Portion of which has been raised : And whereas by the said thirdly-recited Act the said Company were authorized to raise the further Sum of Ten thousand Pounds by the Creation of new Shares, the whole of which have been subscribed for, and in respect of which the Sum of Three thousand two hundred and fifty Pounds has been paid up, and by the same Act the said Company were authorized to raise by Mortgage the further Sum of Three thousand three hundred and thirty-three Pounds, no Portion of which has yet been raised : And whereas the whole of the Sums so raised under the said first-recited Act, and the Sum of Nine hundred and ninety-two Pounds, Part of the said Sum of Three thousand two hundred and fifty Pounds raised under the said thirdly-recited Act, have been applied for the Purposes of the said Acts : And whereas it is expedient that the said Company should be authorized to raise a further Sum of Thirty-one thousand Pounds: And whereas the said Bridge being completed, and the Works authorized by this Act being of great public Benefit, and the said Company being possessed of a large surplus Revenue, which is likely to increase, and which is at present more than sufficient to secure the whole of the said Sum of Thirty-one thousand Pounds, it is expedient that the said Company should be authorized to raise the same by Mortgage or Bond on the Credit of their said Undertaking: Be it therefore enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to borrow on Mortgage or Bond, for the Purposes of this Act, and for the general Purposes of the Company, such Sum or Sums of Money as shall from Time to Time be authorized to be borrowed by Order of a General Meeting of the Company, not exceeding (in addition to the Sums which under or by virtue of the said first and third recited Acts the Company have borrowed, and are authorized to borrow or reborrow, and the Powers to borrow or reborrow, which it is hereby declared shall not be prejudiced.) the Sum of Thirty-one thousand Pounds, and to secure the Repayment of the Money so borrowed, with Interest, by Mortgage of their Undertaking, and of the Rates, Tolls, Duties, and Revenue arising therefrom, or by Bond in the Manner directed or authorized by the Provisions of " The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," incorporated herewith : Provided always, that the whole and every Part of such Sum when so borrowed shall be applied only to the Purposes and for the Objects of the said recited Acts and this Act.

IV. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be held to affect the Validity of any Mortgages on the said

Power to borrow Money on Mortgage.

Prior Mortgages not to be aft'ected.

684

Provisions of 8 & 9 Vict, c. 16. as to borrowing Money to apply to this Act.

Power to sue for Arrears of Interest on Mortgages, or to apply for a Receiver.

Power to sue for Principal Monies secured by Mortgages, or to apply for a Receiver.

Company to employ existing Funds for the Purposes of this Act.

12° Sc 13° VICTORIA, CapAl

said Undertaking which may be subsisting at the Time of the passing of this Act, but all such Mortgages shall during the Continuance thereof have Priority over the Mortgages or any of them which may be created under the Powers of this Act.

V. And be it enacted, That all the Provisions of " The Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," with respect to the borrowing of Money by the Company on Mortgage or Bond, and with respect to the Conversion of the Money borrowed into Capital, shall be incorporated with this Act, and shall be applicable to the borrowing by the Company of the Monies by this Act authorized to be borrowed by them, and to the Conversion thereof into Capital.

VI. And in order to provide for the Recovery of the Arrears of Interest owing on any Mortgage or Bond to be made or entered into by the Company, be it enacted, That if such Interest or any Part thereof shall for Thirty Days after the same shall have become due, and Demand thereof shall have been made in Writing, remain unpaid, the Mortgagee or Bond Creditor may either sue for the Interest so in arrear by Action of Debt in any of the superior Courts or in any inferior Court of competent Jurisdiction, or he may enforce the Payment thereof by the Appointment of a Receiver in the Manner authorized by the Provisions of the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, incorporated herewith.

VII. And in order to provide for the Recovery of the Principal Money secured by and owing on any Mortgage or Bond to be made or entered into by the Company, be it enacted, That if the Principal Monies owing upon any such Mortgage or Bond be not paid within Six Months after the same has become payable, and after Demand thereof in Writing, the Mortgagee or Bond Creditor may sue for the same, together with all Arrears of Interest, in any of the Superior Courts of Law or Equity; or if his Debt for Principal Money amount to the Sum of Two thousand Pounds he may alone, or if his Debt for Principal Money do not amount to the Sum of Two thousand Pounds, he may, in conjunction with other Mortgagees or Bond Creditors whose Debts for Principal Monies, being so in arrear, after Demand as aforesaid, shall together with his amount to the Sum of Five thousand Pounds, enforce the Payment of such Principal Monies, and of all Arrears of Interest, by the Appointment of a Receiver, in the Manner authorized by the Provisions of the Companies Clauses Consolidation Act incorporated herewith.

VIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to apply for or towards the Purposes of this Act any Sum of Money which they may have raised or may raise under the Powers and which shall not have been applied for the Purposes of their said recited Acts or any of them.

IX. And whereas Plans showing the Line of the said improved Approach, and the Lands and Houses in or through which the same is intended to be made, and also other Lands and Houses required to be purchased by the Company, and also a Section of the said proposed Approach, showing the Levels thereof, and also a Book of

7 Reference

685

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. li.

Reference to the said Plans containing the Names of the Owners or reputed Owners, Lessees or reputed Lessees, and Occupiers of the Lands and Houses through which the said Approach is intended to be made, and of the Lands and Houses so required to be purchased, have been deposited with the Clerk of the Peace for the County of Surrey: Be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions of this Act and of the said recited Acts, and of "The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," incorporated therewith, which have been extended to and made applicable to the Purposes of this Act, it shall be lawful for the Company to vary or alter the Approaches to the said Bridge on the Surrey Side thereof by the said third-recited Act authorized to be made, and in lieu thereof to make a new or improved Approach to the said Bridge, to commence on the South or South-east Side of the Belvidere Road in the said Parish of Lambeth otherwise Saint Mary Lambeth in the said County of Surrey, opposite to the present Surrey Side Approach of or to the said Bridge, on the North or North-west Side of the said Road, at or near the Point marked A. on the said Plans so deposited as aforesaid, and to pass thence to and into Manners Street in the said Parish, and from thence across Manners Street to and into the York Road in the same Parish, and to terminate in the same Road between Vine Street and Sutton Street at or near the Point marked B. on the said Plans, all in the said Parish of Lambeth otherwise Saint Mary Lambeth in the County of Surrey, with all proper Conveniences thereto, in the Line and Situation and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans and described in the said Book of Reference, and for the Purposes of the said Approach, and for other the Purposes of the Company or any of them, to enter upon, take, and use such of the Lands and Houses delineated on the said Plans and described in the said Book of Reference as the Company shall deem it expedient or necessary to purchase and take, anything in the said third-recited Act to the contrary notwithstanding.

X. And be it enacted, That if any Omission, Mis-statement, or erroneous Description shall have been made of any Lands or Houses, or of the Owners, Lessees, or Occupiers of any Lands or Houses, described on the said Plans or in the said Book of Reference, it shall be lawful for the Company, after giving Ten Days Notice to the Owners of the Lands affected by such proposed Correction, to apply to Two Justices for the Correction thereof; and if it shall appear to such Justices that such Omission, Mis-statement, or erroneous Description arose from Mistake, they shall certify the same accordingly, and they shall in such Certificate state the Particulars of any such Omission, and in what respect any such Matter shall have been mis-stated or erroneously described; and such Certificate shall be deposited with the Clerk of the Peace of the County of Surrey, and shall also be deposited with the Parish Clerk of the said Parish of Lambeth otherwise St. Mary Lambeth, and such Certificate shall be kept by such Clerk of the Peace and Parish Clerk respectively along with the other Documents to which they relate, and thereupon such Plan and Book of Reference shall be deemed to be corrected according to such Certificate, and it shall be lawful for the Company to make the Works in accordance with such Certificate.

Errors and Omissions in Plans may be corrected by Justices, who shall certify the same.

XI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company in making the said new or improved Approach to deviate from the Line thereof delineated on the said Plans so deposited as aforesaid; provided that the said Approach, or any Works connected therewith, be not by means of any such Deviation as aforesaid made to extend to a greater Distance than the Limits of Deviation delineated upon the said Plans, or into the Lands or Houses of any Person, whether Owner, Lessee, or Occupier, whose Name is not mentioned in the said Book of Reference, without the previous Consent in Writing of such Person, unless the Name of such Person shall have been omitted by Mistake, and the Fact that such Omission proceeded from Mistake shall have been certified in manner herein provided for in Cases of unintentional Errors in the said Book of Reference.

XII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to execute such Works for the Improvement of the Aproaches to the said Bridge on the Surrey Side thereof, and for facilitating the Access thereto and to the Works of the Company from the Waterloo Station of The London and South-western Railway, and also for improving of the various Works and Conveniences belonging to or connected with the said Bridge on the Surrey Side thereof, and for facilitating the Access to such Bridge and Works as well from the River Thames as from the said Railway Station, and the Streets and Places on the Surrey Side of the said Bridge, as the Company shall from Time to Time think necessary or expedient: Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall authorize the Company to make, maintain, vary, extend, or enlarge any Street, except to such Extent as is shown on the said Plans so deposited as aforesaid : Provided also, that nothing in this Act contained shall prevent the Company from making, maintaining, varying, extending, or enlarging any Street (other than the Streets or Approaches by this Act authorized to be relinquished) which the Company might have made, maintained, varied, extended, or enlarged under the Powers of the said recited Acts or any of them.

XIII. And be it enacted, That the said improved Approach and other Works to be executed by the Company shall, for all the Purposes of the said recited Acts or any of them, be and be deemed and taken to be Part of the Approaches to the said Bridge: Provided always, that nothing in this Act contained shall be deemed to prevent the said Company from dedicating the said improved Approach, in the Manner required by Law, to the Use of the Public, in order that the same may become a public Highway, and be for ever thereafter kept in repair by the Parish.

XIV. And whereas the said deposited Plans also show the Lines of the said Approaches authorized by the said third-recited Act, and what Portions thereof are not included within the Line, or the Limits of Deviation therefrom, of the said proposed new Approach authorized by this Act: Be it enacted, That the Company shall and they are hereby required to abstain from making such Parts of the said Approaches authorized to be made by the said third-recited Act, and of the WTorks connected therewith, as are not included in the Approach and Works by this Act authorized to be made, and

12° & 13° VICTORIA, CapM 687

all the Powers and Authorities vested in the Company by the said Approach, Act for making and maintaining the Parts of the said Approaches be and Works hereby required to be relinquished shall from and after the passing of this Act, cease and determine.

XV. And be it enacted, That the Powers of the Company for the Period for

XVI. And be it enacted, That the Works by this Act authorized Period for shall be completed within Five Years from the passing of this Act, Completion and on the Expiration of such Period the Powers for executing the of Works, said Works, or otherwise in relation thereto, shall cease to be exercised, except as to such of the said Works as shall then be completed.

XVII. And whereas the Company are seised of some Lands pur- Extension of chased under the Powers of the said first-recited Act, which Lands g^e0p°r not having yet been used for the Purposes of the said recited Acts superfluous it is apprehended may be considered as coming within the Descrip- Lands, tion of superfluous Lands: And whereas such Lands will now be required for the Purposes of the said recited Acts in connexion with the Purposes authorized by this Act: Be it therefore enacted, That the Period by the said secondly recited Act limited for the Company to sell, and by Deed under their Common Seal to convey to the Purchasers thereof, any Part of the superfluous Lands of which they may be seised under the Provisions of the said first-recited Act, or any Estate or Interest purchased by the Company in such Lands or any Part thereof, shall be extended and enlarged for the further Term of Three Years, to be computed from the Thirtieth Day of August One thousand eight hundred and forty-nine, and that in the meantime and until the Company shall use such Lands for the Purposes of the Company, or shall think proper to sell the same or any Part thereof, it shall be lawful for the Company to let any such superfluous Lands to any Person willing to become the Tenant, thereof, in such Manner and upon such Terms as the Company shall think proper; and all the Clauses of " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," with respect to Lands acquired by the Promoters of the Undertaking under the Provisions of this or the special Act, or any Act incorporated therewith, but which shall not be required for the Purposes thereof, shall extend and apply to the superfluous Lands now vested in the Company under the said first*recited Act, and also to any Lands which may be purchased by the Company under the Powers of this Act, and which may not be required for the Purposes thereof or for any other Purposes of the Company.

And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Com- p0Hcr to pany, in the Construction of the Approach and Works authorized by execute this Act, to do and execute all necessary Works, Acts, Matters, and ,'orks and Things, and to break up or open the Pavement or Soil of any public streets1 &t-or private Street, Road, or Way shown on the said deposited Plans, for the Purer any Sewer, Drain, or Tunnel in such Street, Road, or Way, and poses of

to arch over any Sewer or Drain in or upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans, they the Company doing as little Damage as may be in the Execution of the said Powers, and making Compensation for any Damage caused thereby in the Manner by " The Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," provided for ascertaining and determining Questions of Compensation with regard to Lands purchased or taken under the Provisions thereof, and subject, as to any Sewer, Drain, or Tunnel, to the Provisions herein contained as to the Control of the Metropolitan Commissioners of Sewers.

XIX. And be it enacted, That before any public Street, Road, or served by Way shall be opened or broken up by the Company they shall give

Company tQ the persons under whose Control or Management such Street,

breaking up Road, or Way may be, Notice in Writing ol their Intention to open

Streets or break up the same, Three Days before the Commencement of such Operation.

Notice to be

XX. And be it enacted, That before any Sewer, Drain, Tunnel, or servedbefore Watercourse shall be opened, broken up, arched over, or interfered wi hewers w'^ by the Company, they shall give to the Metropolitan Commis-&c., and"the’ sioners of Sewers Notice in Writing of their Intention to open, break Company to up, arch over, or interfere with the same, Twenty-one Days before obeyDirec- the Commencement of such Operation, together with a Plan of the m^ssioners'of Works proposed; and the Company shall not, except as herein-after Sewers. ° provided, proceed in the Works until the Commissioners shall have sanctioned the same; and the Company shall and they are hereby required to adhere to and comply with such Orders and Regulations as the Commissioners may make in relation to the proposed arching over or Interference with such Sewer, Drain, Tunnel, or Watercourse; and all such Works to which any Order of the Commissioners shall refer shall be done under the Direction and Control of the Surveyor or other Officer of the Commissioners; and such Works, when completed by the Company, shall thenceforth be subject to the Control of the Commissioners.

If Company disobey Directions of Commissioners of Sewers, the Commissioners may stop Works.

XXI. And be it enacted, That if the Company shall not adhere to and comply with such Orders and Regulations as the Metropolitan Commissioners of Sewers may make in relation to the proposed arching over or Interference with such Sewer, Drain, Tunnel, or Watercourse as aforesaid, or shall not execute any Works which the Commissioners may direct to be done in the Manner in which the same shall have been ordered or directed by the Commissioners to be executed, it shall be lawful for the Commissioners to stop any Operations of the Company, and to construct, do, and perform all such Works and Things as may be requisite or necessary to carry the Orders, Regulations, and Directions of the Commissioners into full and complete Effect, so as to guard against Injury to the Drainage of the District, and the Expenses incurred by them in so doing shall be repaid to them by the Company, on Demand, and in default thereof may be recovered by the Commissioners in the same Way as the Commissioners may by Law levy Charges for Default.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, CapM

XXII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That if the Commissioners shall not, within Fourteen Days from the first Ordinary Court of Sewers which shall be holden next after the Expiration of Seven clear Days after the Receipt of any such Notice as is herein-before directed to be given by the Company to the Commissioners, make any Order with reference to the Works mentioned in such Notice, the Company may, at the Expiration of such Fourteen Days, proceed in their Operations according to their said Notice and Plans, in the same Manner as if the Commissioners had expressly sanctioned the same, but subject nevertheless to the Execution thereof being superintended and controlled by the Metropolitan Commissioners of Sewers or their Surveyor.

XXIII. And be it enacted, That every such Street, Road, or Way shall be opened or broken up under the Superintendence of the Persons having the Control or Management of the same, or their Officer, and according to such Plan as shall be agreed upon between such Persons or their Officer and the Company, or in case of any Difference respecting such Plan, then according to such Plan as shall be determined by Two Justices in Petty Sessions assembled; and such Justices are hereby required, on the Application of the Company, to determine the Plan according to which such Street, Road, or Way shall be opened or broken up; provided that Three Days Notice of the Time and Place at which such Determination is to be made shall be proved to have been served upon the Person having the Control or Management of the Street, Road, or Way proposed to be opened or broken up : Provided always, that if the Person having such Control or Management as aforesaid shall neglect or refuse to superintend the opening of any such Street, Road, or Way, after having had Notice of the Company’s Intention as aforesaid, or shall not propose any Plan for breaking up or opening the same, the Company may perform the Work specified in such Notice, without the Superintendence of such Person.

XXIV. And be it enacted, That when the Company shall open or break up the Road or Pavement of any Street, Road, or Way, or shall open, break up, or arch over any Sewer, Drain, or Tunnel, they shall with all convenient Speed complete the Work for which the same shall be broken up, and fill in the Ground and reinstate and make good the Road or Pavement, or the Sewer, Drain, or Tunnel, so opened, broken up, or arched over, and carry away the Rubbish occasioned thereby, and shall at all Times whilst any such Road or Pavement shall be so opened or broken up cause the same to be fenced and guarded, and shall cause a Light sufficient for the warning of Passengers to be set up and maintained against or neat-such Road or Pavement where the same shall be open or broken up, every Night during which the same shall be continued open or broken up, and shall keep the Road or Pavement which has been so broken up in good Repair for Three Months after replacing and making good the same, and for such further Time, if any, not being more than Twelve Months in the whole, as the Soil so broken up shall continue to subside.

689

If Commissioners neglect to give Directions within Fourteen Days, the Works may be proceeded with.

Streets to be broken up under Superintendence.

Streets, &c. broken up to be reinstated with out Delay.
