12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. liv.

Company and they are hereby authorized and empowered, immediately, or at any Time or Times and from Time to Time thereafter, again to raise or borrow the whole or any Part of the Amount so paid oft on the Credit of their Undertaking, and for that Purpose to mortgage and assign their Undertaking, and the Rates, Tolls, and other Property vested in or belonging to them, or any Part thereof respectively, (the Costs and Charges of assigning the same to be paid out of the Money so to be raised,) as a Security for any Sum of Money which shall be so again raised or borrowed, with Interest, to such Person as shall advance the same, and so from Time to Time as often as the same shall happen, but so nevertheless that the Company shall not under the Authority of this Act in any event borrow or owe on Mortgage at any One Time more than One Third of their Share Capital for the Time being.

XXXVI. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages or Bonds granted under the Authority of the Acts hereby repealed, and which shall be in force at the Time of the passing of this Act, shall during the Continuance thereof have Priority over any Mortgages or Bonds to be created by virtue of this Act.

XXXVII. And be it enacted, That every Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, and every Transfer of any Share, Stock, Mortgage, Bond, or other Security for Money, to be granted or made by virtue of this Act, shall be by Deed duly stamped, wherein the Consideration for the same shall be truly stated, anything herein contained to the contrary notwithstanding.

XXXVIII. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the Company hereby incorporated, out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the said Company authorized to be raised by Calls in respect of Shares, or by the Exercise of any Power of borrowing, to pay Interest or Dividend to any Shareholder on the Amount of the Calls made in respect of the Shares held by him in the Capital by this Act authorized to be raised : Provided always, that nothing herein-before contained, shall be deemed to prevent the said Company from paying to any Shareholder such Interest on Money advanced by him beyond the Amount of the Calls actually made as shall be in conformity with the Provisions in the " Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," in that Behalf contained.

XXXIX. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Company, out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the said Company authorized to be raised for the Purposes of such Act or Acts, to pay or deposit any Sum of Money which by any Standing Order of either House of Parliament, now in force or hereafter to be in force, may be required to be deposited in respect of any Application to Parliament for the Purpose of obtaining an Act authorizing the said Company to construct any other Railway, or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

XL. And with respect to the General Meetings of the Company, be it enacted, That the First General Meeting of the Shareholders of

723

12° & 13° VICTORIA, liv.

the Company shall be held within One Month after the passing of this Act, and a General Meeting of the Company shall be held in the Months of February and August in every subsequent Year, and the Meetings so appointed to be held as aforesaid shall be called " Ordinary Meetingsand all Meetings, whether ordinary or extraordinary, shall be held at Darlington, or at such other Place as the Directors shall appoint.

XLI. And be it enacted, That in order to constitute a Meeting, Quorum, whether ordinary or extraordinary, there shall be present, either personally or by Proxy, Ten or more Shareholders holding in the aggregate Shares or Stock to the Amount of Twenty thousand Pounds.

XLII. And be it enacted, That at all General Meetings of the Voter. Company every Shareholder shall have One Vote for every Share up to Twenty, and an additional Vote for every Five Shares beyond the first Twenty Shares held by him : Provided always, that no Shareholder shall be entitled to vote at any Meeting, unless he shall have paid all the Calls then due upon the Shares held by him.

XLIII. And be it enacted, That the Number of Directors shall Number and be Thirteen, and the Qualification of a Director shall be the Possession Qualification in his own Right of Twenty Shares in the Undertaking. of Directors.

XLIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company Power to to reduce the Number of Directors, provided that the reduced Y?ry *,le Number be not less than Seven, and again from Time to Time to oi^ectcTr increase the Number, provided that such increased Number do not exceed Thirteen.

XLV. And whereas Thomas Meynell the elder, Thomas Meynell First the younger, Joseph Pease, John Pease, Henry Pease, Thomas Rich- directors. ardson, Francis Gibson, Henry Pascoe Smith, John Castell Hopkins,

Henry Stobart, William Kitching, Alfred Kitching, and Isaac Wilson are the present Directors or Managing Committee of the Stockton and Darlington Railway Company: Be it enacted, That the said several Persons shall be the First Directors of the Company hereby incorporated.

XLVI. And be it enacted, That the Directors appointed by this Election of Act shall continue in Office until the first Ordinary Meeting to be future held after the passing of this Act, and at such Meeting the Share- Directors-holders present, personally or by Proxy, may either continue in Office the Directors appointed by this Act or any Number of them, or may elect a new Body of Directors, or Directors to supply the Places of those not continued in Office, the Directors appointed by this Act being eligible as Members of such new Body; and at the first Ordinary Meeting to be held in every Year thereafter the Shareholders present, personally or by Proxy, shall elect Persons to supply the Places of the Directors then retiring from Office agreeably to tjjg Provisions in the * Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, lS4o, contained; and the several Persons elected at any such Meeting,

724

Quorum of Directors.

Committees of Directors.

Remuneration of Directors and Auditors.

Newspapers for Insertion of Advertisements.

Power to take Tolls.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. liv.

being neither removed nor disqualified nor having resigned, shall continue to be Directors until others are elected in their Stead, in manner provided by the said Companies Clauses Consolidation Act.

XLVII. And be it enacted, That the Quorum of a Meeting of Directors shall be Three.

XLVIII. And be it enacted, That the Number of Directors of which Committees appointed by the Directors shall consist shall be not less than Three nor more than Nine, and the Quorum of such Committees shall be Three.

XLIX. And be it enacted, That the Remuneration of the Directors and also of the Auditors to be appointed under the Provisions of the "Companies Clauses Consolidation Act, 1845," shall from Time to Time be fixed by a General Meeting of the Company, and be paid out of the Funds of such Company.

L. And be it enacted, That the Newspapers in which Advertisements relating to the Affairs of the Company are to be inserted shall be some One or more Newspaper or Newspapers published within the County of Durham.

LI. And be it enacted, That the Company hereby incorporated may lawfully demand and receive, in respect of Passengers, and of the several Articles, Goods, Matters, and Things, and of the several Descriptions of Animals, herein-after mentioned, conveyed on the said Railway, whether in Carriages belonging to the said Company or otherwise, any Tolls not exceeding the following; (that is to say,)

For all Dung, Compost, and all Sorts of Manure, Lime and Limestone, and all undressed Materials for the Repair of public Roads and Highways, per Ton per Mile One Penny Halfpenny:

For all Ironstone, Iron Ore, Pig Iron, Bar Iron, Rod Iron, Hoop Iron, Sheet Iron, and all other similar Descriptions of Wrought Iron not manufactured into Utensils or into other Articles of Merchandize, and for Lead Ore, Pitching and Paving Stones and other Kinds of Stone, Bricks, Tiles, Slates, Clay, and Sand, per Ton per Mile Two-pence:

For all Sugar, Grain, Corn, Flour, Hides, Hemp, Dyewoods, Earthenware, Timber, Deals, Metals (except Iron), Nails, Anvils, Vices, and Chains, per Ton per Mile Two-pence Three Farthings:

For all Coals, Coke, Culm, and Cinders (except as herein-after mentioned) which shall be conveyed for Ten Miles, or for a greater Distance than Ten Miles, per Ton per Mile One Penny Three Farthings:

For the like Articles, Goods, and Things (except as herein-after mentioned) which shall be conveyed for a less Distance than Ten Miles, per Ton per Mile Two-pence:

For all Cotton and other Wools, Drugs, manufactured Goods, and all other Wares, Merchandize, Articles, Matters, and Things not before enumerated, per Ton per Mile Three-pence Halfpenny: o For

725

12" & 13" VICTORIA, liv.

For every Carriage, of whatever Description, and not being a Carriage adapted and used for travelling on a Railway, and not weighing more than One Ton, carried or conveyed on a Truck or Platform, and which shall be conveyed for a Distance exceeding Fifteen Miles, per Mile Five-pence:

For every such Carriage which shall be conveyed for only Fifteen Miles, or for a less Distance than Fifteen Miles, for the whole Distance, Seven Shillings and Sixpence:

And, per Mile, for every additional Quarter of a Ton or fractional Part of a Quarter of a Ton which any such Carriage may weigh. Two-pence:

For every Passenger conveyed in a First-class Carriage, per Mile Three-pence:

For every Passenger conveyed in a Second-class Carriage, per Mile Two-pence:

For every Passenger conveyed in a Third-class Carriage (except by the Government Trains), per Mile One Penny Farthing:

For every Horse, Mule, Ass, or other Beast of Draught or Burden conveyed for a Distance exceeding Twelve Miles, per Mile Five-pence:

For every such Animal which shall be conveyed for Twelve Miles or a less Distance, for the whole Distance, Five Shillings:

For every Ox, Cow, Bull, or Neat Cattle, conveyed for a Distance exceeding Twelve Miles, per Head per Mile, if One, Threepence, if more than One, Two-pence:

For every such Animal which shall be conveyed for Twelve Miles, or a less Distance, for the whole Distance, Two Shillings:

For every Calfi Pig, Sheep, Lamb, or other small Animal, conveyed for a Distance exceeding Twelve Miles, per Head per Mile One Penny:

For every such Animal which shall be conveyed for Twelve Miles or a less Distance, for the whole Distance, One Shilling.

LII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That in the said Tolls Toll for shall be included the Toll for the Use of Engines for propelling the ProPe'llI)g Carriages on the said Railway, and that no further Charge than is Fower' herein-before stated shall be made by the Company hereby incorporated for the Use of such Engines; provided also, that nothing herein contained shall be construed to prevent the Company hereby incorporated from charging any reasonable Sum for loading and unloading, and for providing Covers for Minerals, Goods, Articles, or Animals.

LIII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That for Coals, Coke, Tolls for Culm, and Cinders which shall be shipped on board of Vessels for Exportation, whether Foreign or Coastwise, it shall not be lawful for coders for the Company to charge any Tolls, Rates, or Dues exceeding the Exportation, following; (that is to say,) .

For all Coals, Coke, Culm, and Cinders which shall be intended tor Exportation, whether Foreign or Coastwise, per Ton per Mile Three Farthings:

726

Regulations as to Tolls:

Short Distances:

Fractional Part of a Mile:

Fractional Parts of a Ton:

General Weight: Weight of Stone and Timber.

Tolls for small Parcels and Articles of great Weight.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. liv.

For the like Articles, Matters, and Things, if conveyed in Carriages belonging to the Company, but not propelled by Engines or other Power belonging to the Company, per Ton per Mile I hree Farthings and One Eighth of a Penny, in lieu of such last-mentioned Toll:

For the like Articles, Matters, and Things propelled by Engines or other Power belonging to the Company, but not conveyed in Carriages belonging to the Company, per Ton per Mile One Penny and One Eighth of a Penny, in lieu of the said before-mentioned Tolls:

If conveyed by Engines or other Power and Carriages belonging to the Company, per Ton per Mile One Penny Farthing, in lieu of the said before-mentioned Tolls, such 'loll of One Penny Farthing to include the Use of Carriages and Engines for propelling the Carriages on the Railway, and all other incidental Expenses, except a reasonable Charge for loading and unloading, where such Service is performed by the Company.

LIV. And be it enacted, That the following Provisions and Stipulations shall be applicable to the fixing of all the above-mentioned Tolls; (that is to say,)

For Persons or Articles conveyed on the Railway for a less Distance than Six Miles (except such Persons or Articles as shall have been or shall be conveyed either through a certain Tunnel called the Shildon Tunnel, or over the Inclined Planes on the Stockton and Darlington Railway called respectively the Black Bop Incline Plane, the Etherley Incline Plane, and the Brusselton Incline Plane, or any of them,) the Company hereby incorporated may demand the same Tolls as for Six Miles:

For a Fraction of a Mile less than a Mile, or beyond any integral Number of Miles, the said Company may demand Tolls on Goods, Articles, and Merchandize for such Fraction in proportion to the Number of Quarters of a Mile contained therein, and if there be a Fraction of a Quarter of a Mile such Fraction shall be deemed a Quarter of a Mile, and in respect of Passengers every Fraction of a Mile beyond an integral Number of Miles shall be deemed a Mile : For a Fraction of a Ton the Company may demand Tolls according to the Number of Quarters of a Ton in such Fraction, and if there be a Fraction of a Quarter of a Ton such Fraction shall be deemed a Quarter of a Ton:

With respect to all Articles, except Stone and Timber, the Weight shall be determined according to the usual Avoirdupois Weight: With respect to Stone and Timber, Fourteen Cubic Feet of Stone, Forty Cubic Feet of Oak, Mahogany, Teak, Beech, or Ash, and Fifty Cubic Feet of any other Timber, shall be deemed One Ton Weight, and so in proportion for any smaller Quantity.

LV. And with respect to small Packages, and single Articles of great Weight, be it enacted, That, notwithstanding the Rates of Tolls herein-before prescribed, the Company hereby incorporated may lawfully demand and receive the Tolls following; (that is to say,)

For any Parcel not exceeding Fourteen Pounds in Weight, for any Distance, Sixpence:

For

727

12° & 13° VICTORIA, liv.

For any Parcel exceeding Fourteen Pounds but not exceeding Twenty-eight Pounds in Weight, for any Distance, Two Shillings:

For any Parcel exceeding Twenty-eight Pounds but not exceeding Fifty-six Pounds in Weight, for any Distance, Two Shillings and Sixpence:

And for Parcels exceeding Fifty-six Pounds in Weight the Company may demand any Sum which they may think fit:

Provided always, that Parcels sent in large aggregate Quantities, although made up of separate Parcels, such as Bags of Sugar, Coffee, Meal, and the like, shall not be deemed small Parcels, but such Term shall apply only to single Parcels in separate Packages:

For the Carriage of any One Boiler, Cylinder, or single Piece of Machinery, or single Piece of Timber or Stone, or other single Article, the Weight of which, including the Truck or Carriage, shall exceed Four Tons but shall not exceed Eight Tons, the Company may demand and receive such Sum as they may think fit, not exceeding Sixpence per Ton per Mile:

For the Carriage of any single Piece of Timber, Stone, Machinery, or other single Article, the Weight of which, with the Carriage, shall exceed Eight Tons, the Company may demand and receive such Sum as they may think fit.

LVI. And be it enacted, That every Passenger travelling upon the said Stockton and Darlington Railway or any Branch thereof may take with him his ordinary Luggage, not exceeding One hundred and fifty Pounds in Weight for First-class Passengers, and One hundred Pounds in Weight for Second and Third Class Passengers, without any extra Charge being made for the Carriage thereof.

LVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to demand and receive, for and in respect of all Articles, Matters, or Things which shall pass over or along both Sides of or which shall be delivered on or discharged at the Summit of any One or more of the Inclined Planes upon the Railway and Branch Railways, or any of them, hereby vested in them, and known respectively as the Black Boy Incline Plane, the Etherley Incline Plane, and the Brusselton Incline Plane, such Sum as the Company shall from Time to Time appoint, not exceeding the Sum of Sixpence per Ton for and in respect of each of the said Inclined Planes, over and above or in addition to the other Tolls or Duties by this Act authorized to be taken : Provided always, that it shall not be lawful for the said Company to charge the said Sum of Sixpence per Ton, or any Part thereof, or any other Toll exceeding the Tolls by this Act authorized for the other Portions of the Railway, in respect of any Articles, Matters, or Things which shall be conveyed along a Portion only of the said Inclined Plane called the Black Boy Incline, and which shall have passed or shall be intended to pass through the said Tunnel called the Shildon Tunnel.

LVIII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to demand and receive, for the Tonnage of all Coals, Culm, Cinders, Stone Lime, and Manure whatsoever which shall be carried or conveyed’upon or over the Passage or Bridge erected under the Authority

Vesting Middlesbrough Dock in Railway Company.

Company to deposit with Clerk of the Peace a Plan and Duplicate of the Middlesbrough Dock, &c.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, CapAW.

of the said fourthly herein-before recited Act across the River Tees, such Sum as the Company shall from Time to Time appoint, not exceeding the Sum of Two-pence per Ton, over and above and in addition "to the other Tolls or Duties by this Act authorized to be taken.

LIX. And be it enacted, That (in consideration of the Sum of One hundred and sixty thousand Pounds so advanced and paid by the said dissolved Company as herein-before mentioned, and upon the Execution of a Deed or Conveyance, duly stamped for denoting the Payment of the full and proper Stamp Duty by Law payable in respect of the said Purchase or Consideration Money,) the aforesaid Dock at Middlesbrough in the North Riding of the County of York known as the Middlesbrough Dock, with all Tidal Basins, Entrances, Approaches, Ways, Railways, Lands, Wharfs, Staiths, Quays, Stations, Warehouses, and other Works and Conveniences, Easements, Rights, and Appurtenances, Engines, Machines, and Utensils whatsoever belonging thereto or connected therewith, and all the Estate, Right, Title, and Interest, Powers, Privileges, and Authorities in relation thereto, of the Persons who at the Time of the passing of this Act shall be the Owners of the said Dock, shall be vested in and belong to the Company hereby incorporated, for their absolute Use and.Benefit, but subject nevertheless to the existing Debts, Liabilities, Engagements, Contracts, Obligations, and Incumbrances affecting the same.

LX. And be it enacted, That the said Stockton and Darlington Railway Company shall and they are hereby required, within Two Calendar Months after the passing of this Act, to deposit with the Clerk of the Peace for the North Riding of the County of York, who is hereby required to receive and keep the same in his Custody, a Plan, authenticated by the Signature of the Right Honourable the Speaker of the House of Commons, on which shall be delineated the said Middlesbrough Dock, with all Tidal Basins, Entrances, Approaches, Ways, Railways, Lands, Wharfs, Staiths, Quays, Stations, Warehouses, and other Works and Conveniences whatsoever belonging thereto or connected therewith, and also a Duplicate of such Plan; and all Persons interested shall have Liberty to, and the said Clerk of the Peace is hereby required, at all reasonable Hours of the Day, to permit all such Persons to inspect, during a reasonable Time, and make Extracts from or Copies of the said Plan, on Payment by each Person to such Clerk of the Peace of One Shilling for every such Inspection, and the further Sum of One Shilling for every Hour during which such Inspection shall continue after the first Hour, and after the Rate of Sixpence for every One hundred Words copied therefrom; and it shall not be lawful for the said Stockton and Darlington Railway Company to purchase or take, under the Provision last herein-before contained, any other Lands or Property than such as are delineated upon the said Plan as the Lands and Property proposed to be purchased by or vested in the said Company, nor shall the Land so to be purchased exceed in Extent Sixty-three Acres, nor shall the Powers of this Act with reference to the Purchase of the said Middlesbrough Dock, Land and Property be exercised until such Plan shall have been so deposited.

12" & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. liv. 729

LXI. And be it enacted, That the said Stockton and Darlington Junction Railway Company shall and they are hereby required, at all Times between after the Purchase of the said Middlesbrough Dock shall have been Darlington"' completed, to continue and keep open as Part of their Railway a Railway and good and sufficient Junction or Connexion between the Stockton and Railway Darlington Railway and the Railway proposed to be purchased under Jj^Qock* the Authority of this Act, at or near to the Place at which the June- to be c, tion or Connexion between the said Two Railways at present exists, tinued.

LXII. And be it enacted, That "The Harbours, Docks, and Powers of Piers Clauses Act, 1SP7>" shall, so far as the same is applicable, and H & l2 Vict. is not modified by this Act, or inconsistent with the Provisions thereof, be held to apply to the Company hereby incorporated, and to the \cct° Dock and other Works connected therewith or belonging thereto, by this Act vested in the said Company, and shall have the like Effect as if the said Dock and other Works had been by this Act authorized to be constructed: Provided always, that nothing in this Act, or in the said Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act, contained, shall extend or be construed to extend to compel the Company to provide or keep any Life Boat, Mortar, or Rockets, or any Tide or Weather Gauge, until they shall be required so to do by the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, in Writing under the Hand of the Secretary of the Admiralty; and upon any such Requisition being made the Clauses relating thereto contained in the said Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act shall as regards this Act be in full Force; and that nothing in this Act, or in the said Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act, contained, shall extend to compel the Company to erect or keep any Watch-house, Boat-house, Hut, or weighing Materials for the Use of the Officers of the Revenue, until the Company shall be required so to do by the Commissioners of Her Majesty's Customs in Writing, and upon any such Requisition being made the Clauses relating thereto contained in the said Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act shall as regards this Act be in full Force.

LXIII. And belt enacted, That from and immediately after the Power to said Middlesbrough Dock shall have been purchased by the said l®ke Dock Stockton and Darlington Railway Company it shall be lawful for the ates‘ Company to demand and receive for or in respect of the said Middlesbrough Dock, any Tolls, Rates, or Duties, not exceeding the Tolls,

Rates, or Duties following; (that is to say,)

For any Vessel using or entering the Dock, the Sum of Three Half-pence for every Ton Register Burden of such Vessel:

For all Coals, Lime, Coke, Culm, or Cinders, loaden or unloaden, or shipped or discharged, or landed, at or within the said Dock, the Sum of Two pence Halfpenny per Ton:

For all Lead, Iron, Ironstone, or any other Ores, Timber, Stone,

Bricks, Tiles, or other Goods, Articles, or Things, not exceeding Half a Ton in Weight, loaden or unloaden, or shipped or discharged, or landed, at or within the said Dock, the Sum of Twopence; and where the Weight thereof shall exceed Half a Ton but shall be less than One Ton, the Sum of Three-pence; and wdiere the Weight thereof shall amount to or exceed One Ton, the Sum of Four-pence per Ton.

As soon as Clarence Company have provided a Station, &c-at Sim Pasture, the Stockton and Darlington Railway Company required to deliver at and take from such Station, &c. Waggons, &c.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap.Wv.

LXIV. And be it enacted, That as soon as the Clarence Railway Company shall have provided sufficient and proper Station Room, Sidings, Booking Places, or other Conveniences at or near to the Junction of the Clarence Railway with the Stockton and Darlington Railway at Sim Pasture, to the Satisfaction of the Commissioners of Railways, the Stockton and Darlington Railway Company shall thenceforth, at all seasonable and proper Times, deliver at and take from such Stations, Sidings, or Booking Places, by locomotive Power in the ordinary Course of Railway Traffic, any Waggons, empty, or laden with Coals or other Minerals, or with Merchandize, which may be required by any Person or Persons whomsoever to be left at or taken from such Station, Sidings, or Booking Places, to or from any Station, Siding, or Booking Place on the said Stockton and Darlington Railway : Provided always, that nothing herein contained shall make the said Stockton and Darlington Railway Company liable to take any such Waggons unless the same shall have been before collected for that Purpose at the Station, Siding, or Booking Place from which the same shall be required to be taken, to the Number of not less than Thirty-two at any One Time; provided also, that if any Difference shall at any Time arise between the said Companies relating to the Use or Management of the said Station Room, Siding, or Booking Places so to be provided at or near Sim Pasture, the same may be from Time to Time referred by either of the said Companies to the Commissioners of Railways, whose Order thereon shall be binding and conclusive between the Parties.

LXV. And be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall

Rights of the prejudice, affect, or alter the Rights, Powers, and Privileges which Thirskftail- may now he exercised or enjoyed by the Leeds and Thirsk Railway way Com- Company under or by virtue of the several Acts relating to such pany. Company.

Railway

LXVI. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of

Company to the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide for the Provisions of Conveyance of the Mails by Railway; and another Act was passed in the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating Railways; and another Act was passed in the Sixth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for the better Regulation of Railways, and for the Conveyance of Troops; and another Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Conditiofis to the Construction of future Railways authorized or to be authorized by any Act of the present or succeeding Sessions of Parliament, and for other Purposes in relation to Railways; and another Act was passed in the Session of Parliament held in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her said present Majesty, intituled An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways; and another Act was passed in the same Session of Parliament, intituled An Act for constituting Commissioners of Railways: Be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall be held to exempt the Company hereby incorporated from the Provisions of the said several Acts respectively, but that such Provisions shall be in force in respect of the said Company, so far as the same shall be applicable thereto.

l & 2 Vict, c. 98.,

3 & i Vict, c. 97.,

5 & 6 Vict, c. 55.,

7 & 8 Vict, c. 85., and 9 & 10 Vict, cc. 57. 105.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. liv.

LXVII. And be it enacted, That nothing herein contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Company hereby incorporated from the Provisions of any general Act relating to Railways, or to the better and more effectual Audit of the Accounts of Railway Companies, now in force or which may hereafter pass during this or any future Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision or Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament, of the maximum Rates of Fares and Charges authorized by the said recited Acts or this Act.

LXVIII. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and Expenses of and attending the passing of this Act, or incidental thereto, shall be paid by the Company or the Directors thereof out of the first Monies that shall come to their Hands, and in preference to any other Payment whatsoever.

LXIX. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments and other Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to refer to and describe it by the Title of " The Stockton and Darlington Railway (Consolidation of Acts, Increase of Capital, and Purchase of the Middlesbrough Dock) Act, 1849."

LXX. And be it enacted, That wherever in this Act the Expression " the Railway" shall be used the same shall mean the Railways and Works by this Act vested in or authorized to be made by the Company hereby incorporated.

LXXI. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

LONDON:

Cap. lv.

An Act to authorize the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company to make certain Branches to the River Dee, with Wharfs and other Conveniences connected therewith, to enter into Agreements for a Joint Station at Shrewsbury, and to subscribe towards the Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway.

[13th July 1849.]

WHEREAS an Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for 7 & 8 Vict. making a Railway from the River Dee in the County of c. 99. the City of Chester to Wrexham in the County of Denbigh, to be called " The North Wales Mineral Railway," whereby a Company was incorporated under the Name and Style of " The North Wales Mineral Railway CompanyAnd whereas an Act was passed in the Ninth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to 8 & 9 Vict. authorize the North Wales Mineral Railway Company to extend their c- 115-Line to Ruabon, and to make a Branch Railway from Rhos Robin to Minera, and to raise additional Capital for those Purposes: And whereas another Act was passed in the Tenth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to authorize the North Wales 9 & 10 Vict. c. 250.

Provisions of recited Acts extended to this Act.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, CajjAv.

Mineral Railway Company to make certain Branches, and also to make a Deviation in their present Line of Railway: And whereas another Act was passed in the Ninth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for making a Railway from Shrewsbury in the County of Salop to Ruabon in the County of Denbigh, to be called "T’/te Shrewsbury, Oswestry, and Chester Junction Railway," and by the said Act a Company was incorporated under the Name and Style of "The Shrewsbury, Oswestry, and Chester Junction Railway Company:" And whereas an Act was passed in the Tenth Year of the Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act for the Consolidation of the Shrewsbury, Oswestry, and Chester Junction and the North Wales Mineral Railway Companies, whereby the said Companies were consolidated under the Name of " The Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company And whereas another Act was passed in the Tenth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to authorize the Shrewsbury, Oswestry, and Chester Junction Railway Company to make Railways to Crickheath and Wem, and to raise additional Capital for those Purposes: And whereas another Act was passed in the Tenth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to authorize the Shrewsbury, Oswestry, and Chester Junction Railway Company to make an Extension into Shrewsbury, and certain Alterations and Deviations in their Line of Railway: And whereas another Act was passed in the Eleventh Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act to authorize the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company to make certain Branches, and to provide Station Room and other Conveniences in the City of Chester, and to raise additional Capital for these Purposes, and for amending the former Acts relating to the said Company: And whereas the Railways and Works authorized to be made by the said recited Acts are now being made, and have been for the most Part completed, and opened for the Service of the Public: And whereas it would be of great public Advantage that the Branch Railways, and Piers, Wharfs, Shipping Places, and other Works herein-after described, should be made in connexion with the said Railway, and the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company are willing to carry such Undertaking into execution : And wdiereas it is also expedient that some of the Powers and Provisions of the said recited Acts should be altered, amended, and enlarged, and further Powers granted to the Company; but these several Purposes cannot be effected without the Authority of Parliament: May it therefore please Your Majesty that it may be enacted; and be it enacted by the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, by and with the Advice and Consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the Authority of the same, That all the Provisions contained in the said several recited Acts, so far as the same are or may be applicable and are now in force, and except such of them as are by this Act repealed, altered, or otherwise provided for, or as may be inconsistent with this Act, or with such of the Provisions of the Companies Clauses Consolidation Acts, 184-5, the Lands Clauses Consolidation Act, 1815, or of the Railways Clauses Consolidation Act, 1815, as are incorporated in the said recited Acts or this Act, shall extend to this Act and the several Purposes thereof, and to the several Matters and Things hereby authorized to be done, as fully and effectually as

if the said Provisions were re-enacted in this Act in reference to such Purposes, Matters, and Things; and the said Acts and this Act shall be construed and read together as forming One Act.

[Short Title.]

II. And be it enacted, That in citing this Act in other Acts of Parliament, and in legal Instruments, Parliamentary Notices, and

other Proceedings, it shall be sufficient to use the Expression " The Shrewsbury and Chester Railway (Dee Branches) Act, 1849"

III. And be it enacted, That all the Provisions of the Companies 8 & 9 Vict.

Clauses Consolidation Act, 184-5, of the said Lands Clauses Consoli- £%q6-’s 1 *jjjr dation Act, 1845, and of the said Railways Clauses Consolidation as applicable, Act, 1845, which are applicable to and are not inconsistent with the tobecon-Provisions of this Act, shall be held to apply to the Purposes of this strued with Act, and be read and construed as forming Part of this Act. tllis Act‘

IV. And be it enacted, That the Provisions in the Harbour, Dock, Certain Pro-and Pier Clauses Act, 1847, with respect to the Construction of such jo'^nJs1°vict Act, and to the Construction of the Harbour, Dock, or Pier, the c. 27. incor-" Construction of Warehouses, Wharfs, and other Conveniences, the poratedwith Rates to be taken by the Undertakers, the Collection and Recovery this Act.

of Rates, the Appointment of Harbour Master, Dock Master, and Pier Master, and their Duties, the discharging of Vessels and the Removal of Goods, the Protection of the Harbour, Dock, and Pier, and the Vessels therein, from Fire or other Injury, the Bye Laws to be made by the Undertakers, the Tender of Amends, the Recovery of Damages not specially provided for, and of Penalties, and to the Determination of any other Matter referred to Justices, and Access to the special Act, in so far as the same are applicable to the Piers and Works connected therewith hereby authorized to be made, and are not inconsistent with the Provisions of this Act, shall be and the same are hereby incorporated with this Act.

V. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company Power to

to make and maintain the several Branch Railways, with all proper ™"j^®r"nch Works and Conveniences respectively connected therewith, as after anj mentioned; (that is to say,) Works.

A Branch Railway commencing from and out of the Line of the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway as authorized to be made at or near a certain Field numbered 59 in the Parish of Saint Mary-on-the-Hill in the County of the City of Chester on the Plans of the said Railway deposited in the Year One thousand eight hundred and forty-three with the Clerk of the Peace for saTd County of the City of Chester, and terminating in the said Parish of Saint Mary-on-the-Hill in the said County of the City of Chester at or near to the River Dee in or near to a certain Field or Parcel of Marsh Land belonging to the Company of Proprietors of the Undertaking for recovering and preserving the Navigation of the River "Dee, and in the Occupation of William Roberts, which said intended Branch Railway will pass in or through or be situate within the said Parish of Saint Mary-on-the-Hill in the said County of the City of Chester:

736 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. Iv.

Also another Branch Railway, commencing by a Junction with the said proposed Branch first herein-before described at a Point One hundred Yards or thereabouts to the Eastward of the Low-water Wharf of the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company on the River Dee in the Parish of Saint M ary-on-the-Hill in the County of the City of Chester, and terminating on, in, or near to the River Dee at or near to a certain Gutter or Brook called Hallow Pool Gutter or Stoopbridge Gutter in the Township of SaUney and Parish of Hawarden in the County of Flint, which said last-mentioned Branch will pass in or through or be situated within the several Parishes, Townships, extra-parochial and other Places following; (that is to say,) Saint Mary-on-the-Hill in the County of the City of Chester, and Saltney and Hawarden in the County of Flint:

And also to make and maintain, in connexion with the said Branch Railways, all necessary and proper Sidings, Stations, Bridges, River Walls, Embankments, Piers, Quays, Wharfs, Jetties, Landing and Shipping Places, Sheds, Warehouses, Depots, Approaches, Communications, and other Works within the Limits of Deviation defined upon the Plans herein-after mentioned.

VI. And whereas the estimated Expense of making the Branch constructed Railways and Piers and other Works connected therewith as aforesaid surplus1,Capi- ’s Thirty-five thousand Pounds: And whereas the said Shrewsbury tal of the 1 and Chester Railway have created and issued, under the Authority Company. of the said recited Acts or some of them, Shares to the Amount of One million two hundred and twenty-one thousand Pounds, upon which the Sum of Nine hundred and fourteen thousand eight hundred and fifty Pounds have been actually paid up or called : And whereas the said Company are authorized by their said recited Acts to borrow the Sum of Three hundred and eighty-three thousand five hundred and thirty-two Pounds, but have only borrowed the Sum of Two hundred and sixty-nine thousand nine hundred and sixty Pounds, so that a further Sum of One hundred and thirteen thousand five hundred and seventy-two Pounds may still be borrowed by them on Bond or Mortgage : And whereas, in order to complete the whole other Works of the said Company already authorized to be made, and not yet completed, there will only be required the further Sum of Two hundred and forty-four thousand nine hundred and fifteen Pounds: Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company either to raise the said Sum of Thirty-five thousand Pounds by Mortgage or Bond, so as nevertheless that the Money due and owing by the Company at any One Time on Mortgage or Bond, under the Provisions of this or the said recited Acts, shall not exceed in Amount One Third Part of the Capital of the Company in Shares for the Time being, or otherwise to raise the same by Calls upon the said surplus Capital subscribed for and authorized to be raised by them as aforesaid, or any Portion or Portions thereof, and to apply the same in the Construction and Maintenance of the said Railway and Works.

VII. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said to be paid on comp;iny> Out of the Money by this Act or any other Act relating to a span up. tj)c sajj Railway Company authorized to be raised by Calls in respect of

VIII. And be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Deposits for Company, out of any Money by this Act or any other Act relating to the said Railway Company authorized to be raised for the Purposes pajd out of of such Act or Acts, to pay or deposit any Sum of Money which by the Com-any Standing Order of either House of Parliament, now in force or pany’sCa-hereafter to be in force, may be required to be deposited in respect of pita1, any Application to Parliament for the Purpose of obtaining an Act authorizing said Company to construct any other Railway or execute any other Work or Undertaking.

IX. And be it enacted, That all the Powers and Provisions in the said recited Acts contained in regard to the borrowing and reborrowing of Money, the Creation of new Shares, and Augmentation of Capital instead of borrowing, or relating to or in anywise affecting Mortgages and Bonds, and Assignments and Transfers thereof, or the several Mortgagees and Bond Creditors or Transferees, shall extend and be applicable to the said Sum of Thirty-five thousand Pounds hereby authorized to be raised, and the Branch Railways and Works hereby authorized, in the same Manner and to the same Extent as the same are applicable to the Sums authorized to be raised by the said recited Acts and the Works thereby authorized, or as if the said Sum of Thirty-five thousand Pounds had been raised for and applied to the Purposes of the said recited Acts.

Provisions of recited Acts in regard to borrowing to extend to Capital and Works hereby authorized.

X. Provided always, and be it enacted, That all Mortgages and Mortgages Bonds already granted under the Powers of the said recited Acts or under former any of them shall have Priority over the Mortgages to be granted iViorhV^ under the Powers of this Act.

XI. And whereas Plans and Sections of the said Branch Railways, Branch Piers, and Works connected therewith, showing the Lines and Levels Raj™ayf and Situation thereof respectively, and the Limits within which the be made"10 same are to be constructed, and also a Book of Reference containing according to the Names of the Owners, Lessees, and Occupiers, or reputed Owners deposited and Lessees and Occupiers of Lands or Buildings through which the Plaiis-same are intended to pass, have been deposited with the Clerk of the Peace for the City of Chester and County of the same City: Be it enacted, That, subject to the Provisions in this and the said recited and incorporated Acts contained, it shall be lawful for the said Company to make and maintain the said Branch Railways, Piers, and Works connected with the same respectively in the Lines and Situation and upon the Lands delineated on the said Plans and described in the said Books of Reference, and according to the Levels defined

Works to be constructed according to Plan deposited at the Admiralty.

Company to remove Part of Point of Land opposite the Cheese Warehouse.

In the event of Docks being hereafter constructed, Company to permit Accesses from the River to be made across the Railway'.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. lv.

on the said Sections, and, within the Limits aforesaid, to make and maintain such Piers, Quays, Landing Places, Approaches, Wharfs, and other Works and Conveniences as they may think necessary for more effectually working the Traffic of the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway or otherwise, and to enter upon, take, and use such of the said Lands and Buildings as shall be necessary for the Purposes aforesaid.

XII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That the Wharfs, Piers, Jetties, or other Works to be made and executed under the Powers of this Act shall not extend into the River Dee beyond the Line showing the Top of the proposed River Wall as drawn and described by a Line marked Z Z Z on a Plan deposited at the Admiralty Office, and signed by David Stevenson and Henry Robertson, Civil Engineers, without the Authority and Consent of the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of the Lord High Admiral; and the said Wharfs, Piers, Jetties, or other Works in, upon, or affecting the River Dee shall be constructed according to Plans and Working Drawings, to be in the first instance, and before the Commencement of the said Works, approved of by the said Lord High Admiral or by the said Commissioners, such Approval to be signified in Writing under the Hand of the Secretary of the Admiralty; and in the event of the Company being authorized and permitted by the said Lord High Admiral or by the said Commissioners to construct any Part or Parts of the proposed Wharfs, Piers, or Jetties so as that the same shall extend into the River Dee beyond the said Line, they shall be bound, at any Time when required by the Admiralty so to do, at their own Expense, to remove so much of the said Works as shall extend into the River as aforesaid, if the same shall in the Opinion of the Lord High Admiral or the said Commissioners be found to injure or interfere with the Navigation of the River.

XIII. And be it enacted, That the Company shall cut off and wholly remove so much and such Part of the projecting Point or Angle of Land opposite the Cheese Warehouse as they may find necessary to supply them with Materials for the Earthwork of the Embankment of the Branch Railway adjoining thereto hereby authorized, and they shall do so according to such Line and in such Manner as shall be previously approved of by the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, such Approval to be signified in Writing under the Hand of the Secretary of the Admiralty.

XIV. And be it enacted, That in the event of Docks being at any future Time constructed or authorized to be constructed within the Line of the said Railway, the said Company shall be bound to suffer and permit, and to afford all reasonable Facilities for enabling the Person or Persons, Company or Companies, by whom such Docks shall be promoted and undertaken, to open up, make, and construct all such Entrances, Locks, and Gates through and across the said Railway as shall be determined by the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High

739

12" & 13° VICTORIA, Cfep.lv.

Admiral, to be requisite and sufficient for Access to the said Docks from the River, which Entrances, Locks, and Gates shall not only in the first instance be made and constructed by the Person or Persons, Company or Companies, promoting and undertaking the said Docks, but shall also from Time to Time be altered, amended, repaired, and maintained by them, and at their Expense, to the Satisfaction of the Engineer for the Time being of the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company, and in such Manner and Form and by such Ways and Means as shall not in anywise prejudice, impede, obstruct, or interfere with the free, uninterrupted, and safe Passage along the said Railway; and the Person or Persons, Company or Companies, so promoting and undertaking the said Docks, shall have no Power, either permanently or temporarily, to enter upon, take, or use any of the Land or Property of the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company, or in any Manner to vary, alter, or interfere with the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway, or any of the Works appertaining thereto, save only for the Purpose of making, constructing, and maintaining the said Entrances, Locks, or Gates in the event aforesaid.

XV. And be it enacted, That during the Construction of the said Jetties or either of them, and Works connected therewith, the said Company shall, if required by the Admiralty, cause to be hung out or exhibited every Night from Sunset to Sunrise a Light, to be kept burning by and at the Expense of the Company, for the Navigation and safe Guidance of Vessels, and for ever after the Completion of the said Jetties or either of them the said Company shall cause to be hung out or exhibited upon each of the said Jetties every Night from Sunset to Sunrise a good and sufficient Light, to be kepi burning by and at the Expense of the Company, for the Navigation and safe Guidance of Vessels, and which Light or Lights shall be from Time to Time altered by the said Company in such Manner and be of such Description and be so used as the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, shall by Writing under the Hand of the Secretary of the Admiralty approve of; and in case the said Company shall neglect to exhibit and keep either of such Lights burning as aforesaid they shall forfeit and pay for every such Neglect the Sum of Ten Pounds.

XVI. And be it enacted, That if after Working Drawings of the Works in or affecting the River Dee or the Banks thereof or the Approaches thereto, hereby or by the said recited Acts or any of them authorized, shall have been submitted to the said Lord High Admiral, or the said Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, it shall be deemed expedient by him or them to order a local Survey and Examination of such Works, or of the intended Site thereof the Company shall defray the Costs of such local Survey and Examination, and the Amount thereof shall be a Debt due to Her Majesty from the Company, and, if not paid upon Demand, may be recovered as a Debt due to the Crown, with the Costs of Suit, or may be recovered, with Costs, as a Penalty is or may be recoverable from the Company.

Lights, if required by the Admiralty, to be hung out on the Jetties after Nightfall.

Expenses of local Surveys ordered by the Admiralty to be paid by the Company.

XX. And whereas the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company were by the first herein-before recited Act authorized to make and construct Wharfs upon the River Dee within the Limits specified in the Plans deposited with reference to the said Act, and the said Company intends, in the Exercise of the Powers thereby conferred upon them, to extend the Wharfs and Landing Places already constructed by them, and to erect certain other Wharfs and Landing Places: Be it enacted, That it shall not be lawful for the said Company to construct any Works from and after the passing of this Act beyond the said Line marked Z Z Z on the said Plan deposited at the Admiralty as aforesaid, under the Powers of the said hereinbefore first above-recited Act, without the previous Consent of the Lord High Admiral, or the Commissioners for executing the Office of Lord High Admiral, to be signified in Writing under the Hand of the Secretary of the Admiralty, and then only according to such Plans and under such Conditions as the said Lord High Admiral or the said Commissioners may approve of, such Approval being signified as aforesaid.

bation and in all respects to the Satisfaction of the said Trustees and their Surveyor, and not otherwise, and in such a Manner as not to injure the same Embankments, or weaken or impair the Efficiency thereof for the Purposes for which the same were and are constructed and maintained, and in such a Manner as as not to injure or impair, the Sluices and Floodgates therein, nor any of the Works under the Management or Control of the same Trustees; and that nothing in this Act contained shall interfere with the Purposes of the said Act of the Forty-fourth Year of the Reign of His said late Majesty, or of any Act therein recited or noticed; and further, that the said Company shall make good all Damage to the said Embankments, Sluices,

Rates pay-

XXIV. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company ableonShips. demand, for every Vessel using or loading or unloading at the said Piers or any of them, any Sum for every 'Ion Measurement of such Vessel, not exceeding the Rates mentioned in Schedule (A.) hereunto annexed; and every such Rate shall be payable by the Master of such Vessel.

Rates to be leviable although the whole Works be not completed.

Rates to be paid as specified in Schedule

(B.)

Rates to be charged for the Use of Warehouses, Cranes, and Weighing Machines.

XXV. And be it enacted, That so soon as any of the Piers and other Works hereby authorized shall be certified by a Certificate under the Hand of the Chairman of the Quarter Sessions of the County of Chester, in the Manner provided by the Harbours, Docks, and Piers Clauses Act, 184*7, to be completed and fit for the Reception, loading, or unloading of Vessels, it shall be lawful for the Company to demand the aforesaid Rates for every Vessel using the same, although the whole of the said Piers and other Works hereby authorized shall not then have been completed.

XXVI. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the said Company to demand for all Goods mentioned in the Schedule (B.) to this Act annexed, which shall be shipped or unshipped, received or delivered, at the said Piers or either of them, any Sums not exceeding the several Rates in the said Schedule (B.) specified with respect to such Goods respectively; and as to all such Goods as shall not be specified in the said Schedule, the Company may demand a Rate equal to the Rate for the Time being payable in respect of Goods of a similar Nature, Package, and Quality; and every such Rate shall be payable by the Owner of the Goods.

XXVII. And be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Company to demand, for the Use of any of their Warehouses, Wharfs, Cranes, and Weighing Machines, of and from the Owner or Person having the Charge of any Goods deposited therein, or loaded, unloaded, or weighed by means thereof, such reasonable Rates as the Company shall from Time to Time appoint, not exceeding the several Rates in Schedule (C.) to this Act annexed.

Power to

XXVIII. And with a view to public Convenience, and the more treat and effectual working of the Traffic of the said Shrewsbury and Chester ceruaofCom' ^a^way Company, and the other Companies after mentioned, (that panies as to ‘s to say>) die Shrewsbury and Birmingham Railway Company, in-the Shrews- corporated by the " Shrewsbury and Birmingham Railway Act, bury Station. 184*6," the Shropshire Union Railways and Canal Company, incorporated by the " Shropshire Union Railways and Canal Act, 1846," and the Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway Company, incorporated by the " Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway Act, 1846," be it enacted, That Arrangements and Agreements may be made between the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company and all or any of the same Companies for the Formation, Maintenance, Arrangement, Management, and joint Use of a joint Station at or near Shrewsbury, 7 for

743

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. lv.

for the Accommodation of Passengers (and for other Purposes connected with the respective Traffic of the Companies Parties to any such Arrangement and Agreement); and that it shall be lawful for the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company, and all or any of the said other Companies, to give effect to, and from Time to Time to alter, vary, or renew, such Arrangements and Agreements as may have been or may be made between them for the Purpose of making, constructing, or arranging the said Station, and for the Regulation, Management, and Use thereof, as to the said Companies shall seem meet for the public Accommodation, and to do or concur in all Acts necessary for the Purposes aforesaid; and that it shall also be lawful for any of the said Companies, under the Powers of their Acts, to purchase Lands, and hold them for the joint Use and at the joint Disposal of themselves and the said other Companies, and for the same Companies to raise and pay the Purchase or Consideration Money for the same, and to sell and dispose of superfluous Lands so acquired, and apply the Proceeds of such Sales for the Benefit of the same Companies, in the Proportions in which they respectively contributed to the Purchase thereof; and that it shall be lawful for the same Companies to appoint a joint Committee for the Regulation and Management of the joint Station, and to agree on Regulations as to the Appointment and Duties of such joint Committee, and to depute to such joint Committee Powers to agree, and from Time to Time to vary or rescind Regulations respecting the Management and Use of such joint Station; and that in case any of the said Companies shall have purchased or acquired Land for the said joint Station, such Company shall hold such Land as shall have been so acquired, and as shall be used for the said joint Station, in trust for the joint Use of the same Companies, upon such Terms as have been or may be agreed upon, and the Company who shall not have purchased the same shall contribute and pay to the Company who purchased such Land such Portion of the Purchase or Consideration Money, and other Expenses incurred in acquiring the same, as has been or shall be agreed upon.

XXIX. And whereas by an Act passed in the Ninth and Tenth Power to Years of the Reign of Her present Majesty a Company was incorpo- contribute to rated under the Name and Style of " The Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway Company, for making a Railway from Shrewsbury to Here- Hereford ford:" And whereas the said Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway is Railway, intended to communicate at Shrewsbury with the Line of the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway: And whereas it is expedient that the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company should be authorized to hold Shares in the said Company : Be it enacted, That it shall be lawful for the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company, with the Consent of a Majority of not less than Three Fifths of the Votes of the Proprietors present, personally or by Proxy, at an Extraordinary Meeting convened for the Purpose, to subscribe towards and to purchase and hold Shares in the Capital Stock of the said Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway Company, authorized to be raised under the said recited Act, to an Amount not exceeding the Sum of Seventy-five thousand Pounds; and it shall be lawful for the Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway Company, with the Consent of a like Majority of J ‘ their

744

Company authorized to enter into Arbitration ot' Disputes as to Branch to the Plas Madoc Colliery.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. lv.

their Shareholders at a Meeting convened as aforesaid, to issue Shares to the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company not exceeding the said Amount; and it shall be lawful for the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company to apply any Part of the Monies which they are already authorized to take up by Subscription or borrowing in the Purchase of the said Shares and Payment of the Calls thereon, or otherwise to raise all or any Part of the said Sum of Seventy-five thousand Pounds authorized to be subscribed by them as aforesaid, by the Creation of new Shares or Stock in their Undertaking, for such Amount and according to such Terms and Conditions as may have been determined upon, or as may hereafter be determined upon by such Company at any General Meeting of the Proprietors thereof specially convened for the Purpose; or it shall be lawful for the said Company, if they shall think fit, with the Consent of their Proprietors convened as aforesaid, to raise the Sums agreed to be subscribed by them for the Purpose aforesaid, or any Portion thereof, by Mortgage of their Undertaking, in like Manner and under and subject to the same Provisions in regard to raising Money by Mortgage as the said Company is authorized to raise Money by under all or any of the said recited Acts: Provided always, that the said Sum of Seventy-five thousand Pounds, when paid to the said Shrewsbury and Hereford Railway Company, shall be applied by them solely to and upon the Objects and Purposes authorized by the said Act of the Ninth and Tenth Years of Her present Majesty; and provided further, that the said Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company shall not by such Means increase the Amount which may be owing at any One Time on Mortgage of their Undertaking beyond the Limits authorized by the said recited Acts; and provided also, that in the event of the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company raising all or any Part of the said Sum of Seventy-five thousand Pounds by the Creation of preference or guaranteed Stock, the preference or guaranteed Stock already created and issued by them shall have Priority over such said last-mentioned preference Stock.

XXX. And whereas by certain Articles of Agreement bearing Date the Eighth Day of July One thousand eight hundred and forty-five, and made between the North Wales Mineral Railway Company of the one Part, and George Hammond Whalley of Serjeant's Inn, Fleet Street, in the City of London, Esquire, the Receiver appointed in certain Causes, Youde versus Jones and others, in Her Majesty's High Court of Chancery at. Westminster, of the other Part, it was among other things agreed, for the Considerations and upon the Conditions in the said Articles of Agreement mentioned, that the said Company should make, construct, and keep up a Branch Railway from the Railway across the Plas Madoc Estate to the Mines upon the said Estate : And whereas certain Disputes and Differences have arisen between the Parties to the said Agreement, in regard to the Import and Effect of the same, so far as relates to the making and constructing of the said Branch Railway, and the Direction thereof, and they have agreed to submit and refer such Disputes and Differences to Arbitration : Be it enacted, That the said Disputes and Differences shall from Time to Time be determined by Arbitration in the Manner prescribed by the Railways Clauses Consolidation Act,

1815,

7 45

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. lv.

1845, for the Settlement of Disputes by Arbitration : Provided always, that in case the said Company shall not within Three Months after the Delivery of the Award by the Arbitrator, and after a Request in Writing to that Effect by the said George Hammond Whalley, complete and open for Traffic the said Branch Railway, they shall pay Twenty Pounds to the said George Hammond Whalley for every Week during which such Branch Railway shall, from any Default of the said Company, remain uncompleted.

XXXI. And whereas an Act was passed in the Second Year of the Railways to Reign of Her present Majesty, intituled An Act to provide fur the be subject m Conveyance of the Mails by Railway; and another Act was passed in

the Fourth Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act C. 9H, for regulating Railways; and another Act was passed in the Sixth 3*4 Vict. Year of the Reign of Her said Majesty, intituled An Act for the better c- !)7., Regulation of Railways, and fur the Conveyance of Troops; and 'lct" another Act was passed in the Eighth Year of the Reign of Her said 7 & s’Vict. Majesty, intituled An Act to attach certain Conditions to the Con- c. 85., and struction of future Railways authorized or to be authorized by any 9 & 1° V|ct. Act of the present or succeeding Sessions of Parliament, and for other cc' 10 ,‘ Purposes in relation to Railways; and Two other Acts were passed in the Ninth and Tenth Years of the Reign of Her said present Majesty, the one intituled An Act for regulating the Gauge of Railways, and the other intituled An Act for constituting Commissioners of Railways: Be it enacted, That nothing in this Act contained shall be held to exempt the said Branch Railway, or the Company, from the Provisions of the said several Acts respectively, but that such Provisions shall be in force in respect to the said Branch Railways and Company, so far as the same shall be applicable thereto.

XXXII. Provided always, and be it enacted, That nothing herein Railways to contained shall be deemed or construed to exempt the Railways by be subject t<> this or the said recited Acts authorized to be made from the Provisions of any general Act relating to such Acts, or of any general rai Acts. Act relating to Railways, now in force or which may hereafter pass during the present or any future Session of Parliament, or from any future Revision and Alteration, under the Authority of Parliament, of the maximum Rates of Fares and Charges authorized by this Act or by the said recited Acts.

XXXIII. Provided always, and be it declared and enacted, That Saving the nothing in this Act contained shall extend or be construed to extend Rights of the to alienate, defeat, lessen, prejudice, or derogate from any Estate, ro"n' Right, Title, Interest, Franchise, Prerogative, or Authority of or pertaining to the Queen’s most Excellent Majesty, Her Heirs or Successors, in right of Her Crown or otherwise.

XXXIV. And be it enacted, That in this Act the following Words Interpreta-and Expressions shall have the Meanings hereby assigned, unless ‘I,10,^0cftTern13 there be anything in the Subject or Context repugnant to such In Construction; (that is to say,)

The Words " Person" and " Parties" shall extend to Corporations, whether aggregate or sole:

746 12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. lv.

The Expressions " the Piers," or " the said Piers," shall be understood to mean the Piers authorized to be constructed by this Act, and to include as well the Piers as the Wharfs, Quays, Landing Places, Communications, Entrances, and Outlets connected therewith authorized by this Act:

The Expression "the said recited Acts" shall mean the Acts of Parliament relating to the " North Wales Mineral Railway Company," the " Shrewsbury, Oswestry, and Chester Junction Railway Company," and the " Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company :"

The Expression " the Company " shall mean " the Shrewsbury and Chester Railway Company."

Expenses of

XXXV. And be it enacted, That all the Costs, Charges, and

Act- Expenses of and attending the obtaining and passing of this Act, or

incidental thereto, shall be paid by the Directors of the said Company out of the first Monies that shall come to their Hands, and in preference to any other Payment whatsoever.

[Public Act.]

XXXVI. And be it enacted, That this Act shall be a Public Act, and shall be judicially taken notice of as such.

12° & 13° VICTORIA, Cap. lv.

Small Parcels, each - For every other Article of Goods, Wares, or Merchandize whatsoever, which shall be shipped from or landed or deposited upon the Wharfs or Quays authorized to be constructed by this Act, such reasonable Rates, Rent, or Sum, not exceeding the Rates, Rent, or Sum then usually paid in the Port of Bristol.
